name: parasite
trans: n. 寄生植物（或动物），寄生虫；不劳而获者，依赖他人过活者

sentences.english: Kangaroos harbour a vast range of parasites.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠身上有各种各样的寄生虫。

detailed_translations.english: a plant or animal that lives on or in another plant or animal and gets food from it

name: parasitic
trans: adj. 寄生的（等于 parasitical）

sentences.english: parasitic fungi
sentences.chinese: 寄生真菌

detailed_translations.english: living in or on another plant or animal and getting food from them

name: mimicry
trans: n. 模仿，模拟；（动物等）拟态伪装

name: symbiosis
trans: n. [生态] 共生；合作关系；共栖

sentences.english: ...the link between bacteria, symbiosis, and the evolution of plants and animals.
sentences.chinese: ...细菌、共生和动植物进化间的联系。

detailed_translations.english: the relationship between different living things that depend on each other

name: symbiotic
trans: adj. [生态] 共生的；共栖的

sentences.english: ...fungi that have a symbiotic relationship with the trees of these northwestern forests.
sentences.chinese: ...与这些位于西北部的森林里的树木存在共生关系的真菌。

detailed_translations.english: a symbiotic relationship is one in which the people, organizations, or living things involved depend on each other

name: creature
trans: n. 生物，动物；（具有某种特征的）人；怪物；受支配的人，产物

sentences.english: all the living creatures in the sea
sentences.chinese: 海洋中所有的生物

detailed_translations.english: anything that is living, such as an animal, fish, or insect, but not a plant

name: organism
trans: n. 生物，有机体，（尤指）微生物；有机组织，有机体系

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: strain
trans: n. 焦虑，紧张；负担，紧张；张力，压力；损伤，扭伤；品种，类型；气质，个性特点；旋律，曲调；口吻，语气；（物理）应变，胁变；血缘；困难，负担 v. 拉伤，扭伤；绷紧，用力拉；竭力，使劲；过滤；使不堪忍受，使紧张；用力推（或拉），拉紧

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

name: species
trans: n. （动植物的）种，物种；种类；（具有相同特征的）一类人；（化学，物理）核素；（圣餐中用的）面包和圣酒 adj. 原种的

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: vital
trans: adj. 至关重要的，必不可少的；生机勃勃的，充满活力的；生命的，维持生命所必需的 n. 身体的重要内脏，维持生命的重要器官（vitals）

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: ripe
trans: adj. （水果、谷物等）成熟的；（奶酪）熟的，（酒）芳醇的；（气味）浓烈的，刺鼻的，（香气）馥郁的；时机成熟的，适宜的；充满……的（ripe with）；高龄的，高寿的；（雌性鱼， 昆虫）快要产卵的；<非正式> (言语) 下流的，粗俗的

sentences.english: Those tomatoes aren’t ripe yet.
sentences.chinese: 那些番茄还没熟。

sentences.english: The conditions were ripe for social change.
sentences.chinese: 社会变革的时机已经成熟。

detailed_translations.english: fully grown and ready to be eaten

name: evolve
trans: v. 进化，演化；逐步发展，逐渐演变

sentences.english: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。

sentences.english: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 各项业务需要快速发展。

detailed_translations.english: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: evolutionary
trans: adj. 进化论的，进化的；演变的，逐步发展的

sentences.english: the evolutionary development of birds
sentences.chinese: 鸟类的进化过程

sentences.english: Some scientists have rejected evolutionary theory.
sentences.chinese: 有些科学家拒绝接受进化论。

sentences.english: He is in favour of gradual, evolutionary social change.
sentences.chinese: 他支持渐进的社会变革。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the way in which plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: Darwinism
trans: n. 达尔文学说；达尔文主义；进化论

name: extinct
trans: adj. 灭绝的；消亡的；（火山）死的；（贵族称号）无合法继承人的；熄灭了的

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: extinction
trans: n. 灭绝，消亡；（债务的）偿清；消光

sentences.english: species in danger of extinction
sentences.chinese: 有灭绝危险的物种

sentences.english: They were hunted almost to extinction.
sentences.chinese: 它们遭受猎杀，几近灭绝。

sentences.english: Conservationists are trying to save the whale from extinction.
sentences.chinese: 生态环境保护工作者正努力挽救鲸类以防止其灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular type of animal or plant stops existing

name: breed
trans: v. 交配繁殖；饲养，培育；养育，培养；引起，酿成；（通过核反应）增殖可裂变物质 n. 品种；（人的）类型，种类

sentences.english: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬是我最喜欢的犬种。

sentences.english: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
sentences.chinese: 鹰在一年中较凉爽的季节交配繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
if animals breed, they  mate in order to have babies

name: reproduction
trans: n. 生殖，繁殖；复印，再版；（声音的）复制，录制；复制品，仿制品

sentences.english: Scientists studied the reproduction, diet, and health of the dolphins.
sentences.chinese: 科学家研究了海豚的繁殖情况、进食规律和健康状况。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["sexual reproduction"]}
sentences.chinese: 有性繁殖

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of producing babies, young animals, or plants

name: proliferate
trans: v. <正式>（在数或量上）激增，猛增；使（细胞、组织、结构等）增生，速生

sentences.english: Computer courses continue to proliferate.
sentences.chinese: 计算机课程层出不穷。

detailed_translations.english: if something proliferates, it increases quickly and spreads to many different places

name: propagate
trans: v. 散播，宣传（观点、信仰等）；传播（运动、光线、声音等）；（动植物等）繁殖，使繁殖

sentences.english: The group launched a website to propagate its ideas.
sentences.chinese: 这个团体建了一个网站来宣扬他们的主张。

sentences.english: The plant can be propagated from seed.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物可由种子繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: to spread an idea, belief etc to many people

name: subsist
trans: vi. 存在；维持生活 vt. 供养

sentences.english: The prisoners subsisted on one mug of the worst quality porridge three times a day.
sentences.chinese: 犯人一天三次靠一杯最差的粥维持生活。

detailed_translations.english: to stay alive when you only have small amounts of food or money

name: exist
trans: v. 存在，实际上有；持续存在，生存

sentences.english: The custom of arranged marriages still exists in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家仍存在包办婚姻的习俗。

sentences.english: Opportunities exist for students to gain sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 学生有机会获得资助。

sentences.english: Stop pretending that the problem doesn’t exist.
sentences.chinese: 别再假装这个问题不存在了。

sentences.english: We existed on a diet of rice.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃大米过活。

detailed_translations.english: to be present in a place or situation

name: posterity
trans: n. 子孙，后裔；后代

sentences.english: A photographer recorded the scene on video for posterity.
sentences.chinese: 一位摄影师为子孙后代摄下了这个场面。

detailed_translations.english: all the people in the future who will be alive after you are dead

name: fermentation
trans: n. 发酵

sentences.english: But thrumming underneath it is a deep layer of culinary funkreminiscent of fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 但敲打底部是深一层的使人想起的厨房的恐怖的发酵。

sentences.english: At that time, any fish caught had to be preserved. The only method possible was by fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 在那个年代，所有捕来的鱼都要被贮存起来，唯一可能的贮存方法就是发酵。

sentences.english: They baited others with CO2 produced by fermentation when yeast is mixed with a sugar solution.
sentences.chinese: 他们用酵母与糖溶液混合后发酵产生的CO2作为另一些陷阱的饵。

name: respiration
trans: n. 呼吸；（医）一次呼吸

sentences.english: His respiration grew fainter throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 一天当中，他的呼吸越来越微弱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 呼吸作用；一次呼吸；植物光合作用
detailed_translations.english: the process of breathing

name: stodgy
trans: adj. （食物）难消化的，易饱的；高糖分的；古板的，枯燥的；（外表）庞大的，笨重的

sentences.english: The company hasn't been able to shake off its image as stodgy and old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 该公司一直未能摆脱其古板守旧的形象。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something is stodgy, they are dull, unimaginative, and commonplace

name: secrete
trans: v. （动植物或其细胞）分泌；隐藏，藏匿（小物件）

sentences.english: The toad’s skin secretes a deadly poison.
sentences.chinese: 蟾蜍的皮肤会分泌一种致命毒素。

detailed_translations.english: if a part of an animal or plant secretes a liquid substance, it produces it

name: secretion
trans: n. 分泌；分泌物；藏匿；隐藏

sentences.english: These secretions are used by the caterpillar as a defence.
sentences.chinese: 这些分泌物被毛虫用作自卫武器。

detailed_translations.english: a substance, usually liquid, produced by part of a plant or animal

name: assimilate
trans: v. 融入，（使）同化；吸收，理解；使相似，成为相似

sentences.english: It will take time to assimilate all these facts.
sentences.chinese: 充分掌握所有这些情况需要时间。

detailed_translations.english: to completely understand and begin to use new ideas, information etc
if people assimilate, or are assimilated into a country or group, they become part of that group and are accepted by the people in that group

name: immune
trans: adj. 免疫的；不受影响的；免除的，豁免的 n. 免疫者，免除者

sentences.english: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 免疫的， 有免疫力的， 不受影响的； 免除的， 豁免的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it

name: immunity
trans: n. 免疫力；免除，豁免

sentences.english: To protect you against small pox or diphtheria, you are vaccinated with a small amount of the toxin, and then your body develops immunity against that toxin.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免你长小脓包或得白喉病，所以会给你的身体接种小量毒素，然后你的身体会针对这些毒素产生免疫力。

sentences.english: Very few people will have any immunity to this particular combination, which is what gives the concern that this will be a pandemic rather than just a normal seasonal flu outbreak.
sentences.chinese: 因为很少有人具备对这种特别的混合病毒的免疫力。 人们因此担心，这将不仅仅是正常的季节性流感疫情，而是一次传染病的大流行。

sentences.english: But a new study shows that people with true expertise in a subject have some immunity to the siren song of corporate sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的研究发现，在某一方面有真才实学的人们对广告赞助商的“糖衣炮弹”有一定的免疫力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being immune to a disease

name: metabolism
trans: n. 新陈代谢

sentences.english: This drug speeds up your metabolism.
sentences.chinese: 这种药物会加快你的新陈代谢。

detailed_translations.english: the chemical processes by which food is changed into energy in your body

name: morphology
trans: n. （生物）形态学；（语言学中的）词法，形态学；结构，形态

sentences.english: The rash morphology progresses from papules to pustules and finally to crusting lesions.
sentences.chinese: 皮疹的形态从最初的丘疹发展至脓疱，最终局部脱屑。

sentences.english: In fact, a major theme in research here is how the morphology of the bird influences its behavior.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，探寻鸟类形态如何影响它的行为是该实验室的主要研究课题。

sentences.english: In fact, a major theme in research here is how the morphology of the bird influences its behavior.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，该实验室研究的一个主要方向是鸟儿的形态是如何影响它们的动作的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形态学(尤指动植物形态学或词语形态学)
detailed_translations.english: the study of the  morpheme s  of a language and of the way in which they are joined together to make words

name: microscope
trans: n. 显微镜

sentences.english: The slightest movement will defocus the microscope.
sentences.chinese: 最轻微的运动都会使显微镜散焦。

sentences.english: The microscope magnified the object two hundred times.
sentences.chinese: 这架显微镜把实物放大了200倍。

sentences.english: The microscope capacitates small objects to be observed.
sentences.chinese: 显微镜可以观察到微小的物体。

detailed_translations.english: a scientific instrument that makes extremely small things look larger

name: calorie
trans: n. 卡（路里）（热量单位）；小卡（现一般定为4.1868焦耳）；大卡，千卡

sentences.english: A potato has about 90 calories.
sentences.chinese: 一个马铃薯大约有90卡路里的热量。

sentences.english: a calorie-controlled diet
sentences.chinese: 控制热量的日常饮食

sentences.english: I need to burn off a few calories (= lose some weight by exercising ) .
sentences.chinese: 我要消耗掉一些卡路里。

sentences.english: My wife convinced me to finally start counting calories (= control my weight by being careful about what I eat ) .
sentences.chinese: 我妻子终于说服我开始计算卡路里、控制体重。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the amount of  energy  that food will produce

name: carbohydrate
trans: n. 碳水化合物，糖类；含碳水化合物的食物，糖类食物；含碳水化合物的食物，糖类食物

sentences.english: Around one third of our meals should be based on carbohydrate, with roughly one half of these grains being whole.
sentences.chinese: 我们每餐食物应当差不多有三分之一是碳水化合物，大概有一半谷物食品为全麦的。

sentences.english: There have been no studies of the effects of a low carbohydrate diet on pregnancy, so its effect on the fetus, if any, are unknown.
sentences.chinese: 目前为止还没有关于怀孕时低碳水化合物饮食影响的研究，因此如果对胎儿有什么影响也是不知道的。

sentences.english: The reason for this is that carbohydrate consumption stimulates insulin production, which aids the production of muscle glycogen.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为是碳水化合物的消耗刺激了胰岛素的分泌，后者对于肌肉糖原产生有帮助。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is in foods such as sugar, bread, and potatoes, which provides your body with heat and energy and which consists of oxygen,  hydrogen  , and  carbon

name: glucose
trans: n. 葡萄糖；葡糖（等于 dextrose）

sentences.english: Now, if the insulin "key" cannot open up the cell to glucose, there is something interfering with it.
sentences.chinese: 现在，如果胰岛素这把“钥匙”无法打开细胞让葡萄糖进入，一定是有东西干扰。

sentences.english: Identifying the presence of brown fat is one thing, but activating it to burn more glucose is another.
sentences.chinese: 确定棕色脂肪的存在是一回事，但激活它让它燃烧更多葡萄糖是另一回事。

sentences.english: But refined carbohydrates, such as white bread and white rice, can be very quickly broken down to glucose, the primary fuel for the body.
sentences.chinese: 但是精制的碳水化合物，例如白面包或白米，可以十分迅速地分解为葡萄糖，提供身体最根本的燃料；

detailed_translations.english: a natural form of sugar that exists in fruit

name: protein
trans: n. 蛋白质，朊 adj. 蛋白质的

sentences.english: Where do you get your protein?
sentences.chinese: 你从哪里获得蛋白质？

sentences.english: Dairy source of protein and calcium.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛的蛋白质来源和钙。

sentences.english: So, what happens, this is another view of a sodium channel, so this is actually looking a little bit more at the protein structure .
sentences.chinese: 那么，这里发生了什么，这是钠离子通道的另一张图片，在这种蛋白质结构中，它看起来更复杂一点。

detailed_translations.english: one of several natural substances that exist in food such as meat, eggs, and beans, and which your body needs in order to grow and remain strong and healthy

name: organ
trans: n. （人体或动植物的）器官；阴茎，阳物；风琴，管风琴；<正式>  （官方的）机构，机关；<正式>机关报刊，宣传工具

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

name: vaccine
trans: n. 疫苗；（计算机）杀毒软件 adj. 疫苗的，菌苗的

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

name: fungus
trans: n. 真菌，真菌类植物；霉菌；（尤指鱼的）真菌感染；迅速出现的令人讨厌的东西

sentences.english: The roses have fungus.
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花长了真菌。

sentences.english: So how do you kill a fungus without harming its host?
sentences.chinese: 问题在于，我们如何才能做到不伤害宿主只杀死真菌呢?。

sentences.english: Monokaryons of this fungus will grow readily as saprophytes in plate or liquid culture .
sentences.chinese: 这种真菌的单核体在平板或液体培养时能像腐生菌那样容易生长。

detailed_translations.english: a simple type of plant that has no leaves or flowers and that grows on plants or other surfaces.  mushrooms  and  mould  are both fungi.

name: membrane
trans: n. （动植物的）膜；（可起防水、防风等作用的）膜状物

sentences.english: Loud noise can damage the delicate membrane in the ear.
sentences.chinese: 很响的噪声会损伤脆弱的耳膜。

detailed_translations.english: a very thin piece of skin that covers or connects parts of your body

name: viability
trans: n. 生存能力，发育能力；可行性

sentences.english: It evaluates the basic viability of the project.
sentences.chinese: 它估计了项目的基本生存能力。

sentences.english: At this first, or highest level of change, you seek to establish the opportunity and agree to the viability of the approach.
sentences.chinese: 在变化的第一层或是最高层，您寻找机会去创建世纪，对方法的生存能力达成一致看法。

name: picturesque
trans: adj. （地方）古雅的，风景如画的；（语言）生动的，独特的；（服饰和外貌）引人注意的，奇特的

sentences.english: a quiet fishing village with a picturesque harbour
sentences.chinese: 拥有一座美丽港口的宁静渔村

detailed_translations.english: a picturesque place is pretty and interesting in an old-fashioned way

name: vivid
trans: adj. 生动的，逼真的；（颜色）鲜艳的，明亮的；（人的想像）丰富的

sentences.english: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

name: sculpture
trans: n. 雕像，雕塑作品；雕刻艺术，雕塑艺术；（动，植）（贝壳、花粉粒、角质层或其他生物体表面凸起或凹陷的）雕饰，雕纹 v. 雕刻，雕塑；从事雕刻

sentences.english: a sculpture of an elephant
sentences.chinese: 一尊大象雕塑

sentences.english: the techniques of sculpture in stone
sentences.chinese: 石雕技艺

detailed_translations.english: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

name: statue
trans: n. （石或金属做的动物或人的）雕像

sentences.english: Churchill’s statue stands outside the parliament building.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔的塑像矗立在议会大厦外。

sentences.english: A bronze statue was erected in his honour.
sentences.chinese: 人们立了一座铜像纪念他。

detailed_translations.english: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large

name: draw
trans: v. 画，绘画；吸引，引起（兴趣、注意）；作（比较），进行（对比）；（尤指乘车辆）移动，行进；引起，激起（反应）；抽（签、牌），抽取；拔出，抽出（尤指武器）；获取，推断出；抽出，吸出；抽（烟），吸（气）；（游戏）以平局告终，战平；取（款），领取(薪水等)；慢慢走，溜达；拉，拖；拉（窗帘、帘子）；使透露消息，使说出意见；草拟，制定（法律文件等）；（滚木球）使（球）朝预定的目标作弧线运动；（船）吃（水）；（帆）吃饱风；使（尤指血液）流出，使渗出；获得，得到；利用，动用；给（浴缸）放满水；拉制（铁丝），轧制；（茶）被泡开，被泡出味来；（用铅笔、钢笔等）画，绘画；吸（烟），吸入（空气）；取（款），领取（薪水等）；拉（窗帘、百叶窗等） n. 和局，不分胜负；抽彩，抽签；由抽签决定对手的比赛，由抽签决定对手的系列比赛；有吸引力的人(或事物)；吸烟；抽签，抓阄；〈非正式〉大麻制品；拔枪；抽彩，抽奖；有吸引力的人（或事物）

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: gallery
trans: n. 美术馆，画廊；（大厅的）楼座，楼上旁听席；（剧场中的）顶层楼座；阳台，露台；一群（相似的人或物）；长廊，走廊；（矿井下的）巷道；观众

sentences.english: The bright modern painting stares out at you in the otherwise conservative gallery.
sentences.chinese: 有些古典派画廊也会陈列出明亮色彩的现代派绘画。

sentences.english: Statement and portrait together form a single image of a thinker. (See the interactive gallery, “Why Philosophy?
sentences.chinese: 陈述和肖像一起构成了一位思想家的独有影像。 （参见互动画廊，“何为哲学？”）

sentences.english: Whether you just want to browse our huge image gallery or want to share your personal photos with others, this is the site for you!
sentences.chinese: 无论你是想要浏览我们众多的画廊图片还是想要和其他人分享你的个人照片,这个网站绝对对你的味口。

detailed_translations.english: a small privately owned shop or studio where you can see and buy pieces of art

name: portrait
trans: n. （尤指只刻画脸、头和肩部的）肖像，照片，雕像；描绘，描述；（文件的）纵向打印格式 adj. （纸张、页面、照片等）竖式的，纵向的

sentences.english: a family portrait
sentences.chinese: 全家福

sentences.english: She’s been commissioned to paint Jackson’s portrait .
sentences.chinese: 她已受托为杰克逊画肖像。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, drawing, or photograph of a person

name: impressionism
trans: n. 印象派，印象主义

detailed_translations.english: a style of painting used especially in France in the 19th century which uses colour instead of details of form to produce effects of light or feeling

name: portray
trans: v. 描绘，描写；（在艺术或文学作品中）描述，刻画；（在电影、戏剧等中）扮演

sentences.english: Romantic artists portrayed nature as wild and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫主义艺术家描绘的大自然是狂野而强大的。

sentences.english: The President likes to portray himself as a friend of working people.
sentences.chinese: 总统喜欢以工薪阶层的朋友自居。

detailed_translations.english: to describe or show someone or something in a particular way, according to your opinion of them

name: mold
trans: n. 模具；铸模；模制品；类型，个性，风格；框架；体型，模样；霉，霉菌；耕作土壤；松软沃土 v. 浇铸，塑造；用模子制作；对……影响重大；将……塑造成；使）紧贴于，吻合；轮廓相符；使发霉 n. （Mold）（美、英、奥地利）莫尔德（人名）

sentences.english: Because of its flexibility, we can mold software into any form to do almost anything.
sentences.chinese: 由于灵活性，我们可以将软件塑造成任何形式从而处理几乎所有的问题。

sentences.english: The women of a nation mold its morals, its religion, and its politics by the lives they live.
sentences.chinese: 一个国家的妇女通过她们的生活方式塑造了这个国家的道德、宗教和政治。

name: embroider
trans: vt. 刺绣；装饰；镶边 vi. 绣花；刺绣

sentences.english: a richly embroidered jacket
sentences.chinese: 刺绣华美的夹克衫

detailed_translations.english: to decorate cloth by sewing a pattern, picture, or words on it with coloured threads

name: tragedy
trans: n. 悲惨事件，惨剧；悲剧（作品）；不幸，遗憾；令人非常烦乱（或生气）的情形

sentences.english: The tragedy happened as they were returning home from a night out.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧发生在他们夜里外出归来的路上。

sentences.english: Tragedy struck the family when their two-year-old son was killed in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧降临到这个家庭，他们两岁的儿子在一次事故中丧生。

detailed_translations.english: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

name: opera
trans: n. 歌剧演出，歌剧表演；歌剧团，歌剧院；歌剧艺术，歌剧剧本

sentences.english: We go to the opera (= go to a performance of opera ) regularly.
sentences.chinese: 我们常去听歌剧。

sentences.english: an opera singer
sentences.chinese: 歌剧演员

detailed_translations.english: a musical play in which all of the words are sung

name: enact
trans: v. 制定，通过，颁布（法令）；扮演，表演；使发生，付诸实际

sentences.english: a drama enacted on a darkened stage
sentences.chinese: 在灯光暗淡的舞台上演的戏剧

detailed_translations.chinese: 颁布；制定法律；扮演；发生
detailed_translations.english: to act in a play, story etc

name: pose
trans: v. 造成，引起（威胁、危险、问题等）；提出（问题）；（为照相、画像等）摆好姿势；假扮，冒充（pose as）；（举止或穿戴）装腔作势，招摇过市；<古>把……难住，使为难 n. （为拍照、画像等摆的）姿势；故作姿态，装腔作势

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: rehearse
trans: v. 排练，排演；监督（表演者或团体）排演；默诵，默默地练习；<正式>详述，重复

sentences.english: I think we need to rehearse the first scene again.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们需要把第一场再排练一次。

detailed_translations.english: to practise or make people practise something such as a play or concert in order to prepare for a public performance

name: prelude
trans: n. 前奏，序幕；前奏曲，序曲；（诗歌等文学作品）引子，序诗 v. 成为……的前奏，作为……的序幕

sentences.english: Living together as a prelude to marriage is now considered acceptable in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 婚前同居如今在许多国家都已被接受。

detailed_translations.english: if an event is a prelude to a more important event, it happens just before it and makes people expect it

detailed_translations.chinese: 成为…的序幕；演奏…作为前奏曲

name: character
trans: n. 性格，品质；特色，特征；人物，角色；勇气，毅力；某种人，古怪有趣的人；（书写或印刷）符号，文字，字体；名誉，名声 v. <古>刻，写；描述；使具有特征

sentences.english: He has a cheerful but quiet character.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格乐观文静。

sentences.english: Everyone recognizes Disney’s cartoon characters.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼的卡通人物尽人皆知。

sentences.english: The whole character of the school has changed.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的特色已经完全变了。

detailed_translations.english: the particular combination of qualities that makes someone a particular type of person

name: role
trans: n. （演员的）角色；作用，职责

sentences.english: She has just landed the lead role in their latest production.
sentences.chinese: 她刚在他们最新的作品中取得了主角。

detailed_translations.english: the character played by an actor in a play or film

name: design
trans: n. 设计，布局，安排；设计艺术，构思；设计图，图纸；图案，花纹；计划，意图 v. 设计，制图，构思；筹划，制订；预定，指定

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

detailed_translations.english: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
detailed_translations.english: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

name: profile
trans: n. （人头部的）侧面（像），侧影；（某物的）外形，轮廓；（人、团体或组织的）简介，概况；（人或组织的）形象，姿态；纵断面，剖面；（地球表面纵断面的）轮廓（如河流走向）；（舞台的）平面布景；（以数量形式记录事物特点的）曲线图，数据图表；（记载个人心理或行为特点、喜好等的）档案 v. 概述，扼要介绍；给……画侧面像，显出……侧面轮廓；显出……的轮廓（be profiled）；（尤指用模板）铣出轮廓，使……成形

sentences.english: Dani has a lovely profile.
sentences.chinese: 达尼的侧面轮廓很好看。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侧面；人物简介；轮廓，形象；姿态，引人注目的状态
detailed_translations.english: a side view of someone’s head
to write or give a short description of someone or something

name: renaissance
trans: n. 复兴，再生；文艺复兴（时期）（the Renaissance）；文艺复兴文化，文艺复兴风格（Renaissance）

sentences.english: ...the Renaissance masterpieces in London's galleries.
sentences.chinese: …伦敦美术馆里文艺复兴时期的杰作。

detailed_translations.english: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period

name: conjure
trans: v. 变魔术，使……变戏法般地出现（或消失）；想象出，设想出；使浮现于脑海，使想起；念咒召唤出（鬼魂等）；<古>恳求，祈求

sentences.english: The magician conjured a rabbit out of his hat.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师从帽子里变出一只兔子来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变魔术， 变戏法； 召唤
detailed_translations.english: to perform clever tricks in which you seem to make things appear, disappear, or change by magic

name: aesthetic
trans: adj. 审美的，美学的；美的，艺术的 n. 美感，审美观；美学（aesthetics）；美术理论

sentences.english: From an esthetic point of view, it’s a nice design.
sentences.chinese: 从美学角度看，这是个不错的设计。

sentences.english: a work of great aesthetic appeal
sentences.chinese: 极富美之神韵的作品

detailed_translations.english: connected with beauty and the study of beauty

name: romantic
trans: adj. （人）浪漫的，有情调的；（事物）富有浪漫色彩的，充满浪漫气息的；爱情的，情爱的；不切实际的，空想的；（文学、艺术和音乐）浪漫主义的（Romantic） n. 浪漫的人；爱幻想的人，空想者； 浪漫主义作家（或音乐家、艺术家）（Romantic）

sentences.english: ‘Tom always sends me red roses on my birthday.’ ‘How romantic!’
sentences.chinese: “我过生日时汤姆总是给我送红玫瑰。”“多浪漫啊！”

detailed_translations.english: showing strong feelings of love

name: mythology
trans: n. 神话，神话故事；错误的信念，谬误；神话学

sentences.english: characters from classical mythology
sentences.chinese: 古典神话中的人物

detailed_translations.english: set of ancient myths

name: arcade
trans: n. 拱廊；(上有顶盖的）拱廊式街道；室内购物商场；（有投币游戏机的）游乐中心，电子游戏厅

sentences.english: The short, squat man in the Dallas Cowboys windbreaker staggers out from the arcade, propping himself against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 身穿达拉斯牛仔风衣的矮胖男人蹒跚的从拱廊走出来，支撑着自己靠在墙上。

sentences.english: No matter how much you think you know about the varied and nuanced spectrum of human sexuality, you realize you don’t know squat until you work in a porn store with a vibrant and active arcade.
sentences.chinese: 无论你认为自己是多么了解人类性行为的多样性和各种细微差别，如果没在色情商店工作过，没见识过店中那条活力四射的拱廊，就不知道半蹲是什么含义。

detailed_translations.english: a covered passage at the side of a row of buildings with  pillar s  and  arch es  supporting it on one side

name: pottery
trans: n. 陶器；陶土，黏土；制陶，陶艺；陶瓷厂；陶瓷之都（斯塔福德郡特伦特河畔斯托克市周边地区，为英国陶瓷工业基地）（the Potteries）

sentences.english: Native American pottery
sentences.chinese: 美洲印第安人的陶器

detailed_translations.english: objects made out of baked clay

name: virtuoso
trans: n. （尤指演奏乐器的）能手，大家 adj. 熟练的

sentences.english: violin virtuoso Vanessa Mae
sentences.chinese: 小提琴大师陈美

detailed_translations.chinese: 艺术品鉴赏家；古董收藏家；艺术大师
detailed_translations.english: someone who is a very skilful performer, especially in music

detailed_translations.chinese: 行家里手的；艺术爱好者的

name: fresco
trans: n. 湿壁画 n. （Fresco）（英、意、西、葡）弗雷斯科（人名）

sentences.english: The medium of fresco makes great demands on a painter's techinical skill.
sentences.chinese: 壁画这种绘画形式对画家的技巧有很高要求。

sentences.english: We show this in a scene in the Sistine Chapel [in Rome] where we create a big crack in the fresco of God and Adam.
sentences.chinese: 我们将这个观点放到了发生在罗马西斯廷教堂的一幕里——一幅绘有上帝与亚当的壁画发生严重断裂。

sentences.english: Today, much of it is occupied by government offices and only vestiges of its beauty endure – admittedly including Gozzoli's fresco of the journey of the Magi.
sentences.chinese: 如今政府办公室占据了它很多的建筑，而梅迪奇·里卡尔第宫也仅保留一丝当年的痕迹--这其中包括戈佐利所绘的壁画《三圣贤之旅》。

detailed_translations.english: a painting made on a wall while the  plaster  is still wet

name: baroque
trans: adj. 巴洛克式的；结构复杂的，形式怪样的 n. 巴洛克风格；巴洛克艺术

sentences.english: furnished in a baroque style
sentences.chinese: 以巴洛克风格陈设的

detailed_translations.chinese: 巴洛克式的；结构复杂的，形式怪样的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the very decorated style of art, music, buildings etc, that was common in Europe in the 17th and early 18th centuries

detailed_translations.chinese: 巴洛克风格；巴洛克艺术
detailed_translations.english: used to describe baroque art, music, buildings etc

name: Dadaism
trans: n. 达达派，达达主义（崇尚虚无的艺术派别）

name: gregarious
trans: adj. 爱交际的，合群的；（动物）群居的；（植物）聚生的

sentences.english: She is such a gregarious and outgoing person.
sentences.chinese: 她就是这样一个爱社交而且外向的人。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and preferring to be with other people

name: swarm
trans: n. 一大群（移动中的昆虫）；（移动着的）一大群人；（多指发生在火山附近的）地震群；（天文）一大群小型天体同时在空中出现 v. （昆虫）成群飞行；（人）蜂涌，涌动；挤满，云集；成群地包围；爬（梯子等），攀

sentences.english: Within minutes the area was swarming with officers who began searching a nearby wood.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟之内这个地方挤满了警官，他们开始搜查附近的一片树林。

detailed_translations.english: If a place is swarming with people, it is full of people moving about in a busy way
a large group of insects, especially  bee s  ,moving together

name: flock
trans: n. （鸟或羊等动物）群；一大群人；（某个教堂的）会众，全体教徒；（填充垫子的）絮屑，毛棉填料；（植绒用的）短绒，绒屑 v. 群集，蜂拥

sentences.english: People have been flocking to the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 看展览的人络绎不绝。

detailed_translations.english: to go or gather together somewhere in large numbers

name: herd
trans: n. 兽群，畜群；人群，民众 v. 驱赶（兽群），放牧；使（人）成群移动

sentences.english: Chobe is also renowned for its large herds of elephant and buffalo.
sentences.chinese: 乔贝还以其大群的大象和水牛而闻名。

sentences.english: It was Tom’s duty to herd the cows.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的职责是放牛。

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals of one kind that live and feed together
to make animals move together in a group

name: mammal
trans: n. 哺乳动物

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: carnivore
trans: n. 食肉动物；喜欢吃肉的人，食肉动物（诙谐说法）

sentences.english: This is a delicious vegetarian dish that even carnivores love.
sentences.chinese: 这是一道肉食者们都喜欢的美味素食。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that eats flesh

name: carnivorous
trans: adj. 食肉的；肉食性的

sentences.english: Snakes are carnivorous.
sentences.chinese: 蛇都是食肉动物。

detailed_translations.english: Carnivorous animals eat meat

name: appetite
trans: n. 食欲，胃口；欲望，爱好

sentences.english: Her husband always had a huge appetite.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫向来胃口极大。

sentences.english: Symptoms include tiredness and loss of appetite.
sentences.chinese: 症状包括疲倦和食欲不振。

detailed_translations.english: a desire for food

name: herbivorous
trans: adj. [动] 食草的

sentences.english: " Cornett's attorney, Jack Johnston, said the tooth "looks like it would be from a herbivorous rodent of some type.
sentences.chinese: 科内特的律师杰克·约翰斯顿说，这颗牙“看起来像是某种食草的啮齿类动物的牙。”

sentences.english: 'Chewing is a property which no large herbivorous terrestrial mammal has got rid of, ' said Professor Martin Sander, from Bonn University.
sentences.chinese: “现在，没有大型陆生食草哺乳动物是不需要咀嚼的，”波恩大学的马丁·桑德教授说。

sentences.english: The camel is a herbivorous animal.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼是一种食草动物。

detailed_translations.english: Herbivorous animals only eat plants

name: omnivore
trans: n. [动] 杂食动物；不偏食的人

sentences.english: But I don’t care if you’re an omnivore.
sentences.chinese: 但是我也不会介意你是否是杂食动物。

sentences.english: He's an 18)omnivore, and what a trainer would call food-driven.
sentences.chinese: 他是杂食动物，驯兽师称之为“食物驱动型”。

detailed_translations.chinese: [动] 杂食动物；不偏食的人
detailed_translations.english: an animal that eats both meat and plants

name: omnivorous
trans: adj. 杂食的；什么都读的；无所不吃的

sentences.english: Brown bears are omnivorous, eating anything that they can get their paws on.
sentences.chinese: 棕熊是杂食动物，抓到什么吃什么。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杂食的；什么都读的；无所不吃的
detailed_translations.english: An omnivorous person or animal eats all kinds of food, including both meat and plants

name: predator
trans: n. 捕食性动物； 掠夺者，掠夺成性的人（或组织）

sentences.english: With no natural predators on the island, the herd increased rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 由于岛上没有天然食肉动物，牧群的数量迅速增加。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that kills and eats other animals

name: predatory
trans: adj. （动物）捕食性的，食肉的；掠夺性的，弱肉强食的

sentences.english: predatory pricing
sentences.chinese: 掠夺性定价

detailed_translations.chinese: 掠夺的，掠夺成性的；食肉的；捕食生物的
detailed_translations.english: a predatory animal kills and eats other animals for food

name: prey
trans: n. 猎物，捕获物；受害者，受骗者；<古>掠夺品 v. 捕食；欺凌，坑害（尤指弱者）；不断困扰，折磨

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: poikilotherm
trans: n. 变温动物

sentences.english: Fish are poikilotherm whose body temperature changes as the ambient water temperature changes.
sentences.chinese: 鱼类是变温动物，其体温随环境的水温变化而变化。

name: rodent
trans: n. 啮齿目动物（如老鼠等） adj. （与）啮齿动物（有关）的

sentences.english: This is an actual monster, some sort of rodent-like creature with a dinosaur beak.
sentences.chinese: 这真的是怪兽，有点像啮齿动物，但长着恐龙一样的嘴巴。

sentences.english: But the new  study found that 70 percent of rodent and primate groups have species with an appendix.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这项新的研究发现，70%的啮齿动物和灵长目动物的物种具有阑尾。

sentences.english: Like Plasmodium, which cycles between mosquitoes and man, Toxoplasma cycles between its rodent and feline hosts, living out different phases of its existence in each.
sentences.chinese: 像疟原虫在蚊子和人之间循环一样，弓形虫的循环界于其啮齿类和猫科宿主之间，在不同宿主体内活出不同的生存阶段。

detailed_translations.chinese: 啮齿类的；咬的，嚼的；侵蚀性的

detailed_translations.english: any small animal of the type that has long sharp front teeth, such as a rat or a rabbit

name: scavenger
trans: n. 食腐动物；清道夫；[助剂] 清除剂；拾荒者

sentences.english: He struck at one with his knife lashed to the end of an oar and watched the scavenger sliding down into deep water.
sentences.chinese: 他用绑在桨的一头的刀子击中了其中的一条，并看着这条食腐动物滑到深海里去了。

name: microbe
trans: n. 细菌，微生物

sentences.english: ...a type of bacteria that include the microbes responsible for tuberculosis and leprosy.
sentences.chinese: …包括引起结核病和麻风病的微生物在内的一类细菌。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a  microscope  . Some microbes can cause diseases.

name: reptile
trans: n. 爬行动物；（非正式）卑鄙的人 adj. 爬行动物的

sentences.english: Bird evolved from reptiles, so the first bird must have come out of an egg--laid by a reptile.
sentences.chinese: 禽类是由爬虫类进化而来，所以，第一只禽鸟肯定是从爬虫类孵化的蛋里出来的。

sentences.english: No matter how dry your skin gets, you will never turn into an alligator or any other type of reptile.
sentences.chinese: 不论皮肤多么干燥，你永远不会变成美洲鳄或任何其他一种皮肤粗糙的爬行动物。

sentences.english: This small reptile, which measures just 10 centimeters long, can swim through the sand dunes at up to 15 centimeters per second.
sentences.chinese: 这种身长只有10厘米小型爬行动物，可以在沙子中以最快每秒15厘米的速度游动。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal, such as a snake or  lizard  , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

name: homotherm
trans: n. 恒温动物

name: primate
trans: n. 灵长目动物（包括人、猴子等）；大主教；首领 adj. 灵长目动物的；大主教的

sentences.english: The woolly spider monkey is the largest primate in the Americas.
sentences.chinese: 绒毛蛛猴是美洲最大的灵长目动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大主教；灵长类的动物；首领
detailed_translations.english: a member of the group of animals that includes humans and monkeys

name: mollusk
trans: n. （美）[无脊椎] 软体动物

sentences.english: Atype of mollusk, the lined chiton has colorful lines on its valves andwhite or yellow spots or bands on its girdle.
sentences.chinese: 条纹石鳖是一种软体动物，瓣膜上有彩色条纹，条带上有白色或黄色斑点或环状物。

sentences.english: "To my eye, it's pretty clearly modified by human hands, though it may originally have originated as a fossil cavity of some ancient mollusk, " Rundkvist wrote.
sentences.chinese: 伦德奎斯特写道，“ 按我的观点，这东西很清楚是用人手修改过的。 尽管它原来可能只是某些古代软体动物化石中空的型腔。”

sentences.english: Measuring more than 16 inches (407 millimeters), this giant mollusk is the biggest ever found in its subclass--Caudofoveata.
sentences.chinese: 超过16英寸（407毫米）的长度，使这种大型的软体动物成为尾腔亚纲中迄今为止发现的最大的物种。

name: coelenterate
trans: adj. 腔肠动物的 n. 腔肠动物

sentences.english: The flat, free-swimming, ciliated larva of a coelenterate.
sentences.chinese: 自由游动的被囊动物；有时作为一个目。

sentences.english: This system found in some animals, and most of the coelenterate porous , they are Camp fixation living or planktonic life, from either side of the body to stimulate feelings or obtain food.
sentences.chinese: 这种体制见于部分多孔动物和多数腔肠动物，它们营固着生活或浮游生活，能够从身体的任何一面感受刺激或取得食物。

detailed_translations.english: any invertebrate of the phylum Cnidaria (formerly Coelenterata), having a saclike body with a single opening (mouth), which occurs in polyp and medusa forms
(loosely) any invertebrate of the phyla Cnidaria or Ctenophora

name: vertebrate
trans: n. 脊椎动物 adj. 脊椎动物（有关）的；有脊椎的

sentences.english: Because these cells are among the largest in the vertebrate brain, they were the first neurons to be identified.
sentences.chinese: 由于这些细胞是脊椎动物大脑中最大的细胞，它们是最早被识别出来的神经元。

sentences.english: Zoonoses are defined by the WHO as “Any disease or infection which is naturally transmissible from vertebrate animals to man".
sentences.chinese: 世界卫生组织将人畜共患病定义为“任何自然地从脊椎动物传播到人类的疾病或传染病”。

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that has a backbone

name: invertebrate
trans: adj. 无脊椎的；无骨气的 n. 无脊椎动物；无骨气的人

sentences.english: Concept artist Terryl Whitlatch wanted the colo claw fish to have an invertebrate look, so her early designs were based on an earwig.
sentences.chinese: 概念画家特丽尔·惠特拉奇希望科洛爪鱼拥有无脊椎动物的外表，所以她的早期设计是以蠼螋为基础的。

sentences.english: There was a hierarchical system in neurobiology, and working in invertebrate animals was not looked upon favorably, except in a very special case: the squid giant axon.
sentences.chinese: 神经生物学中有一个等级系统，无脊椎动物的研究不被看好，除了非常特殊的例子：枪乌贼巨大的轴突。

sentences.english: Smithers, don't you think it's ironic that your irregular night-time activities are in inverse proportion to your reputation as an expert in the area of invertebrate research?
sentences.chinese: 斯密德斯，难道你不认为自己无规律的夜生活与你作为无脊椎动物研究领域的专家的声望成反比是具有讽刺意味的吗？

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that does not have a  backbone

name: finch
trans: n. 雀科鸣鸟；雀类 n. （Finch）人名；（英、俄、西）芬奇

sentences.english: We wake every morning to the sound of a finch singing.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨醒来时还能听到燕雀的歌唱。

sentences.english: One species of finch learned to pick up a cactus needle to poke for insects.
sentences.chinese: 有一种雀科小鸟学会捡起仙人掌针去戳得昆虫猎物。

detailed_translations.english: a small bird with a short beak

sentences.english: wild birds
sentences.chinese: 野鸟

sentences.english: The dawn was filled with the sound of birds.
sentences.chinese: 黎明时分，鸟鸣声不绝于耳。

sentences.english: a flock of birds
sentences.chinese: 一群飞鸟

sentences.english: a wooden bird cage
sentences.chinese: 木制鸟笼

detailed_translations.english: a creature with wings and feathers that can usually fly. Many birds sing and build nests, and female birds lay eggs

name: fowl
trans: n. 家禽；鸟；飞禽 vi. 打鸟；捕野禽

sentences.english: Carve the fowl into 8 pieces.
sentences.chinese: 将这只家禽切成8块。

detailed_translations.english: a bird, such as a chicken, that is kept for its meat and eggs, or the meat of this type of bird

name: monster
trans: n. 怪兽，怪物；残忍的人，恶魔；小恶棍，捣蛋鬼；巨大的东西，庞然大物；难以驾驭的人，难以掌控的事物；畸形动物（或植物） adj. 很受欢迎的；庞大的，巨大的 v. 严厉批评，斥责

sentences.english: the remains of a prehistoric monster
sentences.chinese: 史前怪兽的遗骸

sentences.english: the search for the Loch Ness Monster
sentences.chinese: 对内斯湖水怪的搜寻

detailed_translations.chinese: 怪物；巨人，巨兽；残忍的人
detailed_translations.english: an imaginary or ancient creature that is large, ugly, and frightening
unusually large

name: hordes
trans: n. 游牧部落；一大群（horde 的复数） v. 成群结队（horde 的第三人称单数）

name: insect
trans: n. 昆虫；类似昆虫的小动物（如蜘蛛）；卑鄙的人

sentences.english: an insect bite
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的叮咬

sentences.english: flying insects
sentences.chinese: 飞虫

sentences.english: Don’t forget to bring insect repellant (= a chemical to keep insects away ).
sentences.chinese: 不要忘记带上驱虫剂。

detailed_translations.english: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings

name: worm
trans: n. 蠕虫；（某些昆虫的）幼虫；寄生虫，寄生虫病；小人物，懦夫；蠕虫病毒；蛆虫；螺纹状物，蜗杆，旋管 v. （给动物）驱肠虫；蠕动，曲折行进；（通常为欺骗别人或得到好处）逐渐取得（成功或好感） abbr. 一次写入型光盘，单写多读型光盘（write-once read-many）

sentences.english: ...a new computer worm that disables security software.
sentences.chinese: …一种使安全软件失灵的新型计算机蠕虫病毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 虫，蠕虫；蜗杆；螺纹；小人物
detailed_translations.english: a long thin creature with no bones and no legs that lives in soil

detailed_translations.chinese: 使蠕动；给除虫；使缓慢前进

name: beast
trans: n. 野兽，猛兽，牲畜；凶暴残忍的人，道德败坏的人；（具有某种特性的）东西，货色

sentences.english: ...the threats our ancestors faced from wild beasts.
sentences.chinese: …我们祖辈所面临的来自野兽的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, especially a large or dangerous one

name: aquatic
trans: adj. 水生的，水栖的；与水生动植物有关的；水的，水上的 n. （尤指适于在水塘或水族馆中生活的）水生植物（或动物）；水上运动（aquatics）

sentences.english: an aquatic plant
sentences.chinese: 水生植物

detailed_translations.chinese: 水生的；水栖的；在水中或水面进行的
detailed_translations.english: living or growing in water

detailed_translations.chinese: 水上运动；水生植物或动物

name: amphibian
trans: n. 两栖动物；水陆两用车，水陆两用飞机 adj. 两栖类的；两栖的

sentences.english: At first this amphibian deals with the cooler days by burying itself in the soil.
sentences.chinese: 起初，天气乍凉的时候，这种两栖动物将自己埋在土壤里。

sentences.english: Why does the speaker choose that amphibian as her representative of a public creature?
sentences.chinese: 诗人为何选择这个两栖动物作为公众人物的代表？

sentences.english: "Almost all of them were abandoned somewhere in the city, " said Wu Weichun, the director of the zoo's amphibian department, to the Shanghai Dailynewspaper.
sentences.chinese: “它们中几乎所有都是在城市里被遗弃的，”动物园两栖动物馆主任吴文春对《上海每日新闻报》说。

detailed_translations.english: an animal such as a  frog  that can live both on land and in water

name: migrate
trans: v. （候鸟或动物）迁徙；（尤指为找工作）移居，迁移；转移（从一个部位移到另一部位）；把（程序，硬件）从一系统转移到另一系统；改用操作系统

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: graze
trans: v. 吃草；放牧；擦过；擦伤，擦破；<非正式>经常吃零食而不吃正餐，吃很多零食；<美，非正式>随意地尝试（或体验、浏览） n. 擦伤

sentences.english: fields where they used to graze their sheep
sentences.chinese: 他们过去放羊的田野

detailed_translations.english: if an animal grazes, or if you graze it, it eats grass that is growing
to accidentally break the surface of your skin by rubbing it against something
a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

name: gasp
trans: v. （因惊讶或疼痛）喘气 n. 喘息，倒抽气

sentences.english: ‘My leg!’ he gasped. ‘I think it’s broken!’
sentences.chinese: “我的腿！”他倒抽一口气喊道，“我觉得腿断了！”

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain
when you take in a breath suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain

name: peck
trans: v. 啄，啄食；匆匆轻吻；缓慢而费力地用打字机打；<非正式>（马）向前跌倒 n. 匆匆的轻吻；（鸟的）啄；配克（谷物、水果等的干量单位，等于8夸脱）；啄痕

sentences.english: It was winter and the sparrows were pecking at whatever they could find.
sentences.chinese: 已是冬天了，麻雀们能找到什么就啄食什么。

detailed_translations.english: if a bird pecks something or pecks at something, it makes quick repeated movements with its beak to try to eat part of it, make a hole in it etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 许多；配克（容量单位，等于2加仑）；啄痕；快速轻吻
detailed_translations.english: an action in which a bird pecks someone or something with its beak

name: trot
trans: n. （马等动物的）小跑，慢跑；骑马小跑；人的小步跑；<非正式>腹泻，拉稀（the trots）；<澳，非正式>走运时期，倒霉时期；<澳，非正式>快步马驾车赛（the trots）；（学生用来作弊的）笔记，答案；<英，非正式>（侮辱性用语）左倾分子，托派分子；刚学步的小孩；老太婆 v. （马等四足动物）快步，疾走；步行，走；<非正式>小步快跑，疾行；骑马小跑；<非正式>连珠炮似地说，急匆匆地做

sentences.english: Alan took the reins and the small horse started trotting.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住缰绳，小马开始慢跑起来。

sentences.english: Our horses slowed to a trot.
sentences.chinese: 我们的马减速慢跑。

sentences.english: She broke into a trot (= started running slowly ) and hurried on ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 她突然小跑起来，赶到我们前头。

detailed_translations.english: if a horse trots, it moves fairly quickly with each front leg moving at the same time as the opposite back leg
the movement of a horse at trotting speed

name: dormant
trans: adj. （动物）冬眠的，（似）在深睡的；（植物或芽）休眠的；（火山）暂时不活动的，静止的；（疾病）潜伏期的；（纹章）（动物）卧睡的

sentences.english: a huge dormant volcano
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的
detailed_translations.english: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

name: offspring
trans: n. （人的）后代，子女；（动物的）幼崽，崽兽；结果，产物

sentences.english: a young mother trying to control her offspring
sentences.chinese: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

detailed_translations.english: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

name: spawn
trans: v. （鱼、青蛙、软体动物、甲壳类等）产卵；引发，促生；大量生产；<贬>（人）生（孩子，多指不想要的孩子）；用菌种体栽培 n. （鱼、青蛙、软体动物、甲壳类等的）卵；产卵；<贬>（指人或地方所孕育的）产物，孽种；菌种体

sentences.english: ...her passion for collecting frog spawn.
sentences.chinese: ...她对采蛙卵的热爱。

detailed_translations.english: the eggs of a fish or  frog  laid together in a soft mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 产卵；酿成，造成；大量生产
detailed_translations.english: to make a series of things happen or start to exist

name: pregnant
trans: adj. 怀孕的，妊娠的；意味深长的，意义重大的

sentences.english: care for pregnant women
sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.english: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.english: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant (= make her pregnant ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没想让她怀孕。

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant (= almost ready to give birth ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子即将临产。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has an unborn baby growing inside her body

name: hatch
trans: v. 孵化，孵出；密谋，策划 n. （船甲板或飞机底部装货物的）舱口；（尤指厨房和餐厅之间供传递食物的）两室之间的小窗口；（飞机或宇宙飞船的）舱门；（地面或天花板的）开口

sentences.english: The problems do not end if crocodiles successfully hatch from the eggs.
sentences.chinese: 即使鳄鱼成功地从卵中孵化出来，这些问题也不会终止。

detailed_translations.english: a hole in a ship or aircraft, usually used for loading goods, or the door that covers it
if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out

name: breed
trans: v. 交配繁殖；饲养，培育；养育，培养；引起，酿成；（通过核反应）增殖可裂变物质 n. 品种；（人的）类型，种类

sentences.english: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬是我最喜欢的犬种。

sentences.english: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
sentences.chinese: 鹰在一年中较凉爽的季节交配繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
if animals breed, they  mate in order to have babies

name: domesticate
trans: vt. 驯养；教化；引进 vi. 驯养；使习惯于或喜爱家务和家庭生活

sentences.english: We domesticated the dog to help us with hunting.
sentences.chinese: 我们驯养狗来帮助我们打猎。

detailed_translations.english: to make an animal able to work for people or live with them as a pet

name: fertilize
trans: vt. 使受精；使肥沃

sentences.english: The faeces contain nitrogen which fertilizes the soil.
sentences.chinese: 排泄物含有肥沃土壤的氮。

detailed_translations.english: To fertilize land means to improve its quality in order to make plants grow well on it, by spreading solid animal waste or a chemical mixture on it

name: regeneration
trans: n. [生物][化学][物] 再生，重生；重建

sentences.english: But they can definitely determine how they plan to grow as more people move in, and also how they want to rehabilitate areas that need regeneration.
sentences.chinese: 但它们确实可以决定怎样在更多的人迁移进来的同时计划它们的增长，以及它们希望怎样修复需要重建的区域。

sentences.english: There are three parts to your hair: the hair shaft (the fiber), the hair bulb (the root) and the hair cycle (the period of rest and regeneration).
sentences.chinese: 我们的头发包含三个部分：毛干(纤维)，毛球(根部)和毛发周期(休息和再生的周期)。

sentences.english: And doctors are already experimenting with ways of using tactile cues to improve wound healing and regeneration.
sentences.chinese: 医生已经在试验运用触觉信号来提高伤口愈合及再生的方法。

name: reproduce
trans: v. 复制，翻印；模拟；再制造，再现；繁殖，生殖

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

name: squeak
trans: v. 吱吱叫，嘎吱作响；紧张（或激动）得尖声说；<非正式>勉强通过，侥幸成功；<非正式>告密，告发 n. 吱吱声，短促的尖叫声；只言片语；<非正式>机会

sentences.english: With a third group, she activated the squeak as if by accident.
sentences.chinese: 对于第三组，她则假装吱吱声是偶然发生的。

sentences.english: With a third group, she activated the squeak as if by accident.
sentences.chinese: 对于第三组孩子，她展示发出吱吱声好像意外发出一样。

sentences.english: She interrupted herself after demonstrating the squeak by saying she had to go and write something down, thus suggesting that she might not have finished the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 当演示完吱吱声后，她停了下来，说自己有事得走了，并在纸上写下了些东西，以此暗示也许她还没完成整个过程。

detailed_translations.english: a very short high noise or cry
to make a short high noise or cry that is not loud

name: chirp
trans: v. （鸟）啁啾，（昆虫）唧唧叫； 轻松愉快地说，嘁嘁喳喳地说；抱怨；故意惹怒（某人）而说，奚落 n. 吱吱声，唧唧声

sentences.english: The chirps of the garden birds sounded distant.
sentences.chinese: 花园的鸟鸣听上去那样的遥远。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唧唧声；喳喳声；[通信] 啁啾声
吱喳而鸣；尖声地说；咂嘴打招呼

name: hibernate
trans: v. 冬眠；（人）（长期）蛰居，不活动

sentences.english: Dormice hibernate from October to May.
sentences.chinese: 睡鼠从10月到5月冬眠。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒
detailed_translations.english: if an animal hibernates, it sleeps for the whole winter

name: camouflage
trans: n. （军事上的）伪装，隐蔽；（士兵作伪装用的）迷彩服，伪装色；（动物的）保护色，保护形状；掩饰，欺瞒 v. 掩饰；伪装；掩盖（真相）；（用声音）盖过

sentences.english: soldiers learning camouflage technique
sentences.chinese: 在学习伪装技术的士兵

sentences.english: the camouflage netting over the tanks
sentences.chinese: 坦克上的伪装网

detailed_translations.english: a way of hiding something, especially soldiers and military equipment, by using paint, leaves etc to make it look like the things around it
to hide something, especially by making it look the same as the things around it, or by making it seem like something else

name: extinction
trans: n. 灭绝，消亡；（债务的）偿清；消光

sentences.english: species in danger of extinction
sentences.chinese: 有灭绝危险的物种

sentences.english: They were hunted almost to extinction.
sentences.chinese: 它们遭受猎杀，几近灭绝。

sentences.english: Conservationists are trying to save the whale from extinction.
sentences.chinese: 生态环境保护工作者正努力挽救鲸类以防止其灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular type of animal or plant stops existing

name: monogamous
trans: adj. 一夫一妻的；[动] 单配的

sentences.english: So birds are monogamous but they cheat as well, within limits.
sentences.chinese: 所以鸟类是一夫一妻制，但它们也背叛，有限度地。

sentences.english: Unlike most other fish, they are monogamous and mate for life.
sentences.chinese: 不像其他的鱼类，它们是一夫一妻制并终生厮守。

sentences.english: Many birds are socially monogamous, which is to say that the male and female form an exclusive bond and spend a great deal of their time together.
sentences.chinese: 许多种鸟类都实行社会化的一夫一妻制：雄性与雌性组成独占性的结合，一起度过生命中的大部分时间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一夫一妻的, 单配的

name: polyandrous
trans: adj. 多雄蕊的；一妻多夫的

name: nest
trans: n. 窝，巢，穴；舒适的居所，安乐窝；（套叠的）一套物件，一组物件；藏匿处，秘密窝点 v. （鸟类）筑巢，做窝；（一套物件）逐个套叠；嵌套（信息）；找鸟巢

sentences.english: a bird’s nest
sentences.chinese: 鸟窝

sentences.english: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 雌鸟在5月份筑巢产蛋。

sentences.english: Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
sentences.chinese: 雏鹰仅仅两个月以后就会飞离鸟巢。

detailed_translations.english: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
to build or use a nest

name: niche
trans: n. 合适（称心）的工作（活动）（one's niche）；壁龛；（产品的）商机；生态位（一个生物所占生境的最小单位） v. 把……放在壁龛中 adj. （产品）针对特定小群体的

sentences.english: Amanda soon found her niche at the club.
sentences.chinese: 阿曼达很快就在俱乐部里找到了一份理想的工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁龛；合适的职业；[亦称作 niche market]【商业】有利可图的市场(或形势等)
detailed_translations.english: a hollow place in a wall, often made to hold a statue

name: pest
trans: n. 害虫，有害动物；<非正式>讨厌的人（或物）

sentences.english: a chemical used in pest control
sentences.chinese: 用于防治虫害的一种化学品

detailed_translations.chinese: 害虫；有害之物；讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a small animal or insect that destroys crops or food supplies

name: habitat
trans: n. （动植物的）生活环境，栖息地

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: rhinoceros
trans: n. 犀，犀牛（栖于非洲和亚洲）

sentences.english: In this island is also found the rhinoceros, an animal less than the elephant, but larger than the buffalo.
sentences.chinese: 在这个岛上还能找到犀牛，一种比大象小一点的动物，可是比水牛大。

sentences.english: Contrary to its name, the black rhinoceros is actually grey in color.
sentences.chinese: 有别于它的名字，黑犀牛事实上是灰色的。

detailed_translations.english: a large heavy African or Asian animal with thick skin and either one or two horns on its nose

name: chimpanzee
trans: n. 黑猩猩

sentences.english: So when you go from head to toe, you're seeing a mosaic creature that is neither chimpanzee, nor is it human.
sentences.chinese: 所以从头到脚，让人看到的是一个在黑猩猩和人类之间模棱两可的生物，这就是始祖地人猿。

sentences.english: By hunting or gathering away from the group, both chimpanzee and dolphin moms ensure that what they find goes to their young.
sentences.chinese: 黑猩猩和海豚妈妈们远离群体打猎和收集食物，并保证他们所找到的食物都给孩子们。

sentences.english: It was, if I can give a chimpanzee language, I can empty the contents of his mind. He can tell me what he's thinking, how he sees the world.
sentences.chinese: 他的想法是，如果我能交给黑猩猩一种语言的话，我就可以掏空他的想法，他可以告诉我他在想什么，他是怎样看这个世界的。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent African animal that is like a large monkey without a tail

name: baboon
trans: n. [脊椎] 狒狒

sentences.english: With the baboon you first reward a hop, then a bigger hop, then an even bigger hop.
sentences.chinese: 对狒狒，你先奖励它的小进步，然后是大一点的进步，接着是更大的进步。

sentences.english: We found a very developed foetus from the bat, and the baboon gave birth five days after the event was witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现蝙蝠体内有一个很成熟的胎儿，那只狒狒也在此事过后五天生了幼仔。

detailed_translations.english: a large monkey that lives in Africa and South Asia

name: gorilla
trans: n. 大猩猩

sentences.english: Lose yourself in the play. Be a dinosaur, or a gorilla, or a villain.
sentences.chinese: 放下自己的架子，扮演一只恐龙，或者是大猩猩，甚至是一个坏蛋。

sentences.english: In fact, he found that there was scarcely any information on gorilla cognition at all.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，他发现任何有关大猩猩认知的信息都非常稀少。

sentences.english: The most famous albino animal of all was Snowflake the gorilla, who lived at Barcelona Zoo from 1966 until his death from skin cancer in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 最著名的白化动物是大猩猩雪花。 自1966年以来，他一直生活在巴塞罗纳动物园，直到2003年死于皮肤癌。

detailed_translations.english: a very large African monkey that is the largest of the  apes

name: lizard
trans: n. 蜥蜴；类蜥蜴爬行动物

sentences.english: Neither the lizard nor the glass has any secrets.
sentences.chinese: 无论是蜥蜴还是玻璃，都没有任何秘密。

sentences.english: A lizard will regenerate its tail if it's cut off.
sentences.chinese: 蜥蜴的尾巴如被切掉，它会重新生出一条尾巴。

sentences.english: Meetings are just one symptom of anorganization run by the lizard brain.
sentences.chinese: 会海只是这类靠蜥蜴脑运作的组织的一个症状。

detailed_translations.english: a type of reptile that has four legs and a long tail

name: moth
trans: n. 飞蛾，蛾；<非正式>衣蛾

sentences.english: What do a hummingbird, a moth, and a maple tree have in common?
sentences.chinese: 蜂鸟、蛾子和枫树之间有什么共同之处呢？

sentences.english: Around streetlights in leafy suburbs what often seems like a moth at first glance may in fact be a small bat.
sentences.chinese: 在绿树成荫的郊区，街灯周围经常有乍一看象蛾子的飞行物，而事实上可能是一只微蝠。

sentences.english: Authorities say the mob of 'roos is endangering a species of local lizard and the threatened gold sun moth through overgrazing.
sentences.chinese: 有关部门表示，由于过度放牧，这些袋鼠已经对一种当地蜥蜴和金日蛾的生存构成了威胁。

detailed_translations.english: an insect related to the  butterfly  that flies mainly at night and is attracted to lights. Some moths eat holes in cloth.

name: canary
trans: n. 金丝雀；淡黄色，鲜黄色；加纳利甜酒 n. （Canary）（美、印、英）卡纳里

sentences.english: Tommy: I cleaned the bird cage and the canary disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 汤米：我刚才打扫鸟笼来着，金丝雀不见了。

sentences.english: Your software project might have its own kind of pit canary.
sentences.chinese: 您的软件项目也可以有自己的矿井金丝雀。

sentences.english: Look for some petal earth tones like canary yellow and light natural shades like aqua! There will be soon a dramatic transformation in your wedding that soon forms a fab.
sentences.chinese: 不妨寻找一些如金丝雀黄或如水流动的天然亮色作为裙摆的颜色，这将会使你的婚礼有一个充满戏剧性的出人意料的改变！

detailed_translations.english: a small yellow bird that people often keep as a pet

name: caterpillar
trans: n. 毛虫,蠋（蝴蝶或蛾的幼虫）；（重型车辆的）履带；履带式车辆

sentences.english: A caterpillar transforms into a butterfly.
sentences.chinese: 毛虫变成了蝴蝶。

sentences.english: The caterpillar might well give you nightmares though!
sentences.chinese: 但是，它的毛虫却可能引起你噩梦！

sentences.english: The caterpillars grow.This caterpillar is big and fat.
sentences.chinese: 这毛虫渐渐成长.这个毛虫是大的和肥的。

detailed_translations.english: a small creature like a  worm  with many legs that eats leaves and that develops into a  butterfly  or other flying insect

name: dinosaur
trans: n. 恐龙；守旧落伍的人，过时落后的东西

sentences.english: How then would this dinosaur have moved?
sentences.chinese: 那么这种恐龙要如何移动呢？

sentences.english: Like shark and dinosaur teeth they would break, but then regenerate.
sentences.chinese: 它们就像鲨鱼和恐龙的牙齿一样会断裂，但也会再生。

sentences.english: From there you can look straight down to the dinosaur fossils displayed on the floor below.
sentences.chinese: 从那儿往向下看，你可以看到陈列在地面上的恐龙化石。

detailed_translations.english: one of a group of  reptile s  that lived millions of years ago

name: chameleon
trans: n. 变色龙，变色蜥蜴；见风使舵的人，善变的人

detailed_translations.chinese: 变色龙， 蜥蜴； 善变之人
detailed_translations.english: a  lizard  that can change its colour to match the colours around it

name: larva
trans: n. [水产] 幼体，[昆] 幼虫 n. （Larva）（芬、捷）拉尔瓦（人名）

sentences.english: The eggs quickly hatch into larvae.
sentences.chinese: 这些卵很快孵化成幼虫。

detailed_translations.english: a young insect with a soft tube-shaped body, which will later become an insect with wings

name: bat
trans: n. 球棒，球拍；蝙蝠 v. 用球板（棒）击球；挥打，击走

sentences.english: A bat echolocates the direction.
sentences.chinese: 蝙蝠凭回声测定方向。

sentences.english: Having been suggested by a bat, people invented sonar.
sentences.chinese: 受到蝙蝠的启发，人们发明了声呐。

sentences.english: It is technically incorrect to talk about bat ‘radar’, since they do not use radio waves.
sentences.chinese: 严密来说，说蝙蝠有“雷达”系统是错误的，因为他们并不使用无线电波。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal like a mouse with wings that flies around at night

name: family
trans: n. 家，家庭；家属，亲属；家族；子女，孩子；（动植物的）科；语族；祖先； 一窝（动物）； 有组织的犯罪团伙；（具有明显共同特征的）一类东西；（在某些方面）像家人一样的一群人；（数）族；派别；氏族 adj. 家庭的；一家所有的；老少咸宜的；全家用的

sentences.english: Do you know the family next door?
sentences.chinese: 你认识隔壁那家人吗？

sentences.english: The Webb family still has its farm over there.
sentences.chinese: 韦伯家依然保留着那里的农场。

sentences.english: The family now live in London.
sentences.chinese: 那家人现居伦敦。

sentences.english: This house isn’t big enough for a family of seven.
sentences.chinese: 这房子住不下七口之家。

sentences.english: My family come from Scotland originally.
sentences.chinese: 我祖籍是苏格兰。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who are related to each other, especially a mother, a father, and their children

name: class
trans: n. 班级；（一节）课，上课时间；（某一科目的）课程；阶级，阶层；等级划分，等级制度；（货物、服务或人的）等级，类别；（飞机、火车等的）舱位等级，车厢等级；品味；同届毕业生；<英>（英国大学的）学位等级；（生物）（植物或动物分类的）纲；（比赛的）组别 v. 把……归类，把……看作；把……编入某一班级；属于……类（或等级），被列为某类（或某级） adj. <非正式>优秀的，出色的

sentences.english: Gary came top of the class in English.
sentences.chinese: 加里的英文是班里顶尖的。

sentences.english: a member of the landed class
sentences.chinese: 地主阶级的一员

sentences.english: He’s not in the same class (= not as good ) as her at tennis.
sentences.chinese: 他的网球水平并不如她。

detailed_translations.english: a group of students who are taught together

name: suborder
trans: n. [生物] 亚目

name: order
trans: n. 命令，指示；顺序，次序；井然有序，整齐；正常工作状况，良好使用状况；秩序，治安；（社会的）制度，结构；社会阶级；<正式>种类，类别；点餐，订购；点的餐，订购的货物；（饮食）分量；法院决议，法官指令；汇票，书面指令；（会议、议会、辩论或法院的）程序，规程；（宗教）仪式，祭礼；宗教团体，（尤指）修道会；兄弟会，会社；（尤指主教、牧师、执事的）品级，神品；圣职，牧师职（orders）；（神学）（九级天使的）级；<史>骑士团；勋位，勋爵士团；勋章；（动植物）目；柱型，装饰样式（多利斯、爱奥尼亚、科林斯、托斯卡那和混合型等五种古典建筑风格之一）；建筑类型，样式；（军）专用装备，专用服装；立正持枪姿势（the order）；（数）阶；方程的阶；群阶；矩阵的阶；<美>（计算机的）任务排序，等待队列 v. 命令，指示；就……下令；订购，订货；（为某人）叫出租车；点（菜），点（饮料）；排列，整理

sentences.english: There seemed to be no logical order to the sections.
sentences.chinese: 这几部分似乎没有逻辑顺序。

sentences.english: Let’s have some order in here.
sentences.chinese: 我们把这里整理一下吧。

sentences.english: The court ordered his release from prison.
sentences.chinese: 法院下令放他出狱。

detailed_translations.english: the way that things or events are arranged in relation to each other, so that one thing is first, another thing is second etc
to tell someone that they must do something, especially using your official power or authority

name: genus
trans: n. 类，种；[生物] 属

sentences.english: ...a genus of plants called Sinningia.
sentences.chinese: …大岩桐属植物。

detailed_translations.english: one of the groups into which scientists divide animals or plants, in which the animals or plants are closely related but cannot produce babies together. A genus includes fewer members than a  family  and more members than a  species  .

name: antenna
trans: n. 触须，触角；<美>天线；感觉，直觉

sentences.english: television antennas
sentences.chinese: 电视机天线

detailed_translations.chinese: [电讯] 天线；[动] 触角，[昆] 触须
detailed_translations.english: one of two long thin parts on an insect’s head, that it uses to feel things

name: tentacle
trans: n. 触手，[动] 触须，[动] 触角

sentences.english: Free speech is being gradually eroded year after year by new tentacles of government control.
sentences.chinese: 言论自由正被政府控制的新触角逐渐侵蚀。

detailed_translations.english: one of the long thin parts of a sea creature such as an  octopus  which it uses for holding things

name: brain
trans: n. 脑；<非正式>智力，智慧；聪明的人，智者；<非正式>电脑；（供食用的）动物脑髓 v. <非正式>猛击……的头部

sentences.english: Messages from the brain are carried by the central nervous system.
sentences.chinese: 大脑发出的信息是通过中枢神经系统传递的。

sentences.english: the chemistry of the brain
sentences.chinese: 大脑的化学性质

sentences.english: the human brain
sentences.chinese: 人脑

sentences.english: She died of a brain tumour.
sentences.chinese: 她死于脑瘤。

sentences.english: The job requires brains.
sentences.chinese: 做这工作需要头脑。

detailed_translations.english: the organ inside your head that controls how you think, feel, and move

name: spleen
trans: n. 脾脏；坏脾气；怒气

sentences.english: Obviously you’re annoyed, but that doesn’t give you the right to vent your spleen on me (= get angry with me ) .
sentences.chinese: 很显然你心里不痛快，但你也不该把怒气发泄在我身上呀。

detailed_translations.english: an organ near your stomach that controls the quality of your blood

name: hide
trans: v. 把……藏起来，隐藏；躲藏，躲避；遮住，遮挡；掩盖，隐瞒 n. （可观察鸟兽行动的）隐匿处，埋伏处；兽皮；<非正式>（困境中的）生命，人身安全

sentences.english: She keeps a bottle of gin hidden behind a stack of books.
sentences.chinese: 她在一堆书的后面藏了一瓶杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found

name: spine
trans: n. 脊髓，脊柱；书脊；（动植物的）刺，刺毛；中心力量，中流砥柱；骨气，勇气；直线型薪酬级别制；（地质）火山栓，熔岩塔

sentences.english: cactus spines
sentences.chinese: 仙人掌的刺

detailed_translations.chinese: 脊柱， 脊椎； 刺， 刺毛； 书脊
detailed_translations.english: the row of bones down the centre of your back that supports your body and protects your  spinal cord

name: spineless
trans: adj. 没有骨气的；无脊椎的；懦弱的

sentences.english: a bunch of spineless politicians
sentences.chinese: 一群怯弱的政客

detailed_translations.chinese: 没有骨气的；无脊椎的；懦弱的
detailed_translations.english: lacking courage and determination – used to show disapproval

name: toe
trans: n. （人的）脚趾，（兽、鸟的）趾；（袜、鞋等的）足尖部；端部，尖部；（高尔夫球的）球棒尖；坡脚，基脚，堤脚；（曲线的）趾区；肉质根部 v. 用脚尖推（或触碰、踢、踩）；足尖朝内（或外）行走；（一对车轮）前束（或反前束，后束）；（高尔夫）用球棒尖击（球）

sentences.english: He stubbed his toe (= hurt it by kicking it against something ) on a rock.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚趾踢到一块石头上受了伤。

detailed_translations.english: one of the five movable parts at the end of your foot

name: bill
trans: n. （商品、服务或餐馆的）账单；议案，法案；纸币，钞票；演出人员名单；广告，传单；票据，汇票；单子，清单；喙 v. 开账单；把……宣传为；宣布（某人）将参加演出

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: beak
trans: n. 鸟嘴，喙；鹰鈎鼻，尖鼻；<旧>法官，男教师

sentences.english: ...a black bird with a yellow beak.
sentences.chinese: …一只有着黄喙的黑鸟。

detailed_translations.english: the hard pointed mouth of a bird

name: fuzzy
trans: adj. （图片、声音等）不清楚的，模糊的；不明确的，含混的；（计算机，逻）模糊的，模糊逻辑的；有绒毛的，毛茸茸的；（人，头脑）迷糊的，稀里糊涂的；（头发）鬈曲的；<非正式>友善的，令人愉快的；带（或可产生）模糊音的（fuzzed 的别名）

sentences.english: Some of the photos were so fuzzy it was hard to tell who was who.
sentences.chinese: 有些照片模糊不清，看不出谁是谁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 模糊的；失真的；有绒毛的
detailed_translations.english: if a sound or picture is fuzzy, it is unclear

name: head
trans: n. 头；头脑，智力；顶部；排头；领导人，负责人；<英>校长，院长；人数，（动物的）头数；（植物的）叶球，头状花序；（人或动物的）一头长,一头高；钉头，锤头；啤酒沫；（河流）源头；上座（桌子旁最重要的座位）；<英>（地名）海边悬崖；脓头；硬币正面（有人像）；（录音机、录像机的）磁头；蒸汽压力；（短语的）中心词，主导词；文章或书页的开头；行动的高潮；桶或鼓的平端；船头；船的桅杆顶；桌子或床的上端；窗框或门框的上水平部分；<英,非正式>（持续的）头痛；一段楼梯或台阶的顶端；在一定高度贮存的水体；体液中两点之间的高度差；一团运动中的水（如离岸流） v. 朝某特定方向行进；领导、主管；在…的前部（或顶部）；位于排行之首；在（页或篇章的）顶端加标题；朝某一事件、结果或结果的特定状态前进，尤指不好的状态；用头顶（球）；挡在前面以阻碍、停止或返回；形成…的头或顶部；砍掉（植物或树的）上部或枝干；（指莴苣或卷心菜）形成头状；发源 adj. 主要的；头部的；位于高处的；从前方来的 adv. 硬币人像面朝上地

sentences.english: He kissed the top of her head.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的头顶。

sentences.english: Alan fell asleep as soon as he put his head on the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦头一挨枕头就睡着了。

sentences.english: They dived head first into the water.
sentences.chinese: 他们一头跳进水中。

sentences.english: She was dressed in black from head to foot (= over all her body ).
sentences.chinese: 她从头到脚穿了一身黑。

sentences.english: He still has a full head of hair (= has all his hair, even though he is getting rather old ).
sentences.chinese: 他依然满头浓发。

sentences.english: Jenny marched proudly at the head of the procession.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮自豪地走在游行队伍的前列。

sentences.english: David was asked to head up the technical team.
sentences.chinese: 戴维被要求领导技术小组。

detailed_translations.english: the top part of your body that has your face at the front and is supported by your neck
to be in charge of a team, government, organization etc

name: hump
trans: n. 小圆丘，岗，隆起；驼峰；（人的）驼背；恼怒，烦恼 v. <英>（费力地）扛，背；<冒犯>与（某人）性交；成隆起；<爱尔兰，非正式>走开（hump off）

sentences.english: the hump of a hill
sentences.chinese: 山冈

detailed_translations.english: a large round shape that rises above the surface of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 隆起；弓起；努力；急速行进

name: scale
trans: n. 天平，磅秤；天平盘；天秤（星）座（the Scales）；等级，级别；刻度，标度；标尺，刻度尺；规模，范围；比例，比例尺；鳞，鳞片；鱼鳞状物；水垢；牙垢；音阶；（加热后金属上形成的）氧化皮；进位制；（摄影）影调范围 v. 改变（文字、图片）的尺寸大小；刮去（鱼鳞）；攀登，翻越；剔除（牙垢）；（尤指皮肤）生成鳞屑；（成片状）脱落，剥落；（数量，财产） 按一定比例调节；称得重量为；<美>估算（树木的）产木材量 adj. （模型或复制品）按比例缩小的

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

name: wing
trans: n. （鸟、昆虫或蝙蝠的）翅膀，翼；（飞机的）机翼；（建筑的）侧翼，耳房，厢房，配楼；（舞台的）侧面，侧翼（the wings）；（组织或政党的）派系，翼；<英>（汽车等的）挡泥板，翼子板；（运动场的）边沿；飞行徽章；禽类翅膀，（尤指供食用的）鸡翅；空军联队；（鸟或昆虫）在飞行中；（蝙蝠或翼手龙的）翼膜；翅膀（指飞翔的能力、手段或快速）；（剖）翼状部，翼状结构，翅状部；（植）翼瓣，翅，气囊；侧翼部队；一群鸻（鸟）；（冰球、足球等运动中的）边锋，侧翼队员 v. 飞，飞行；被迅速送往；擦伤（尤指手臂或翅膀）；用力扔（某物）；射伤（鸟的）翅膀

sentences.english: a butterfly with beautiful markings on its wings
sentences.chinese: 翅膀上有美丽花纹的蝴蝶

sentences.english: The pheasant flapped its wings vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 野鸡猛烈地拍打翅膀。

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts of a bird’s or insect’s body that it uses for flying
to fly somewhere

name: fluffy
trans: adj. 绒毛般的，覆有绒毛的；（食物等）松软的，透气的；轻软状的；<非正式>空洞的，不严肃的

sentences.english: a fluffy little kitten
sentences.chinese: 毛茸茸的小猫

sentences.english: fluffy towels
sentences.chinese: 轻而柔软的毛巾

detailed_translations.english: very light and soft to touch

name: carnal
trans: adj. 肉体的；肉欲的；淫荡的；性欲的 n. （Carnal）人名；（西）卡纳尔

sentences.english: carnal desires
sentences.chinese: 肉欲

detailed_translations.chinese: 肉体的；肉欲的；淫荡的；性欲的
detailed_translations.english: relating to sex or someone’s body

name: nervous
trans: adj. 神经紧张的，担忧的；神经质的，神经过敏的；神经的，神经系统的；（疾病）由精神紧张引起的，由精神压力造成的；易激动的，易兴奋的；强健有力的

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

name: fat
trans: adj. 肥的，肥胖的；厚的，宽的；巨额的；<非正式>极少的，没有的；好打的，易中的 n. 脂肪，肥肉；食用油，烹调用油；多余的部分 v. <旧>（使）长肥

sentences.english: Are you suggesting I’m too fat?
sentences.chinese: 你是不是在说我太胖了？

sentences.english: a short fat man in his early fifties
sentences.chinese: 一个五十岁出头的矮胖男人

sentences.english: You’ll get fat if you eat all that chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把那些巧克力都吃了，就会变胖的。

sentences.english: He looks much fatter than in his photo.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去比相片上胖多了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 肥的，胖的；油腻的；丰满的
detailed_translations.english: weighing too much because you have too much flesh on your body
a substance that is stored under the skin of people and animals, that helps to keep them warm

name: grease
trans: n. 油脂；润滑油 v. 给……加润滑油，为……涂（或抹）油

sentences.english: ...grease-stained hands.
sentences.chinese: …沾满了油渍的手。

sentences.english: I greased front and rear hubs and adjusted the brakes.
sentences.chinese: 我把前后轮轴都加了润滑油并调试了刹车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 动物脂， 油脂； 润滑油
detailed_translations.english: a fatty or oily substance that comes off meat when it is cooked, or off food made using butter or oil
If you grease a part of a car, machine, or device, you put grease on it in order to make it work smoothly

name: greasy
trans: adj. 沾油脂的，油污的；含脂肪的，油腻的；油性的；滑的；圆滑的，虚情假意的

sentences.english: a shampoo for greasy hair
sentences.chinese: 适用于油性发质的洗发液

sentences.english: The food was heavy and greasy.
sentences.chinese: 这食物油腻难消化。

detailed_translations.english: covered in grease or oil

name: turtle
trans: n. 海龟；海龟肉；<美>龟；淡水龟；（计算机）龟标 v. 翻到背面或顶部；（尤指在水中）捕捉海龟

sentences.english: ...a pet turtle.
sentences.chinese: …一只宠物龟。

detailed_translations.english: a  reptile  that lives mainly in water and has a soft body covered by a hard shell

name: beaver
trans: n. 河狸，海狸；海狸毛皮；<史>海狸皮帽；海狸呢（一种似海狸毛皮的厚羊毛布料）；勤劳的人；（Beaver）小童子军（加入童子军协会的约六七岁的男孩）；<英，旧，非正式>大胡子男人；头盔面甲的下部，防护面罩的上部，活动防护罩；<美，俚>（从性繁殖角度看待的）女人；<美，俚>女性生殖器，阴部 v. <非正式>勤奋工作

sentences.english: ...a coat with a huge beaver collar.
sentences.chinese: …一件带有大海狸毛皮领的大衣。

detailed_translations.english: a North American animal that has thick fur and a wide flat tail, and cuts down trees with its teeth

name: jellyfish
trans: n. 水母，海蜇；<非正式>软弱的人

sentences.english: But many marine experts have been saying for several years that we need to start loving jellyfish – because in the not too distant future, they may be the most plentiful marine species around.
sentences.chinese: 但是，多年来，许多海洋专家一直在说，我们需要开始热爱水母——因为在不远的将来，它们也许是我们周围最丰富的海洋物种。

sentences.english: Mr. Loughlin and others at the beach said it took a while for everyone to realize what was happening, because jellyfish stings are so rare at the beach.
sentences.chinese: 洛夫林先生和其他在海滩上的人说，过了好一会儿，大家才意识到发生了什么，因为水母蜇人在这片海滩上实属罕见。

detailed_translations.english: a sea animal that has a round transparent body and can sting you

name: starfish
trans: n. 海星

sentences.english: She lays a kindly hand like a tiny starfish on my knee.
sentences.chinese: 她和善地伸出手，像小海星一样放在我的膝盖上。

sentences.english: In the oceans, you can find starfish and sea horses. They are interesting and beautiful sea animals.
sentences.chinese: 在海洋中，你能看到海星以及海马，它们都是很有趣并且美丽的海洋动物。

sentences.english: One reason is their diet: They eat only starfish (and sometimes sea urchins), and they reportedly prefer to eat them alive.
sentences.chinese: 原因之一是它们的饮食：它们只能吃到海星（有时是海胆），据报道它们喜欢吃活的。

detailed_translations.english: a flat sea animal that has five arms forming the shape of a star

name: whale
trans: n. 鲸；<非正式>巨大的东西 v. <美，非正式>殴打，猛击；捕鲸；使惨败

sentences.english: The receding tide stranded the whale.
sentences.chinese: 退潮把鲸鱼搁浅在海滩上。

sentences.english: So whale come out fish, because they are fish obviously.
sentences.chinese: 所以鲸鱼就是鱼，因为他们显然是鱼。

sentences.english: This sense of revelation is in part due to our changing attitude towards the whale.
sentences.chinese: 与鲸鱼感到关联部分是由于和我们对鲸鱼态度发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: a very large animal that lives in the sea and looks like a fish, but is actually a mammal

name: porpoise
trans: n. 海豚；鼠海豚

sentences.english: The rays are often seen gathering in groups near the surface, “flying” through the water by flapping their pectoral fins and sometimes even leaping porpoise-like into the air.
sentences.chinese: 魟鱼经常会成群的聚集在水面以下，通过拍动胸鳍在水中“飞行”，有时候甚至会像海豚一样跃出海面。

sentences.english: The Baiji Conservation Aquarium has already scored small successes with a similar breeding scheme aimed at averting the extinction of the endangered Yangtze finless porpoise.
sentences.chinese: 为防止这种无鳍海豚的灭绝，白鳍豚保护水族馆采用相同的培育方法已经取得了一些成就。

sentences.english: Still, she cautions that it's possible that the Dall's porpoise hunt in Japan may harm subpopulations of that animal, which numbers more than a million worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他警告在日本的捕猎可能危害白腰鼠海豚的亚种的安全，尽管白腰鼠海豚全种在地球上有一百多万只。

detailed_translations.english: a sea animal that looks similar to a  dolphin  and breathes air

name: dolphin
trans: n. 海豚 n. （Dolphin）人名；（英）多尔芬

sentences.english: By hunting or gathering away from the group, both chimpanzee and dolphin moms ensure that what they find goes to their young.
sentences.chinese: 黑猩猩和海豚妈妈们远离群体打猎和收集食物，并保证他们所找到的食物都给孩子们。

sentences.english: Daniel: Yes, like a dolphin.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔: 嗯，像海豚一样。

detailed_translations.english: a very intelligent sea animal like a fish with a long grey pointed nose

trans: n. 对虾，明虾 v. 捕虾

sentences.english: a prawn sandwich
sentences.chinese: 明虾三明治

sentences.english: prawn cocktail (= a small dish of prawns in a sauce with some salad )
sentences.chinese: 大虾冷盘

detailed_translations.english: a small pink  shellfish  that can be eaten

name: shrimp
trans: n. 虾，小虾；<非正式> 矮子，无足轻重的人 v. 捕虾 adj. 与虾有关的；有虾的，虾制的

sentences.english: I also got a microscope set and watched shrimp grow and things like that.
sentences.chinese: 我还得到过一个显微镜，观察小虾的成长和这些类似的事情。

sentences.english: The host generally pays, and no one needs to hear you gripe about appetizer prices or shrimp count.
sentences.chinese: 主人通常都会支付账单，没人想要听到你抱怨关于开胃菜的价格或者小虾的个数。

sentences.english: In summer midnight snack time, if you come across the Baisha street intersection, a big line of persons sitting by the avenue for taste the spicy shrimp .
sentences.chinese: 夏天里消夜时间你如果经过白沙路口就可以看到这儿林荫道上坐了一大排人，没错，他们就是冲着口味虾来的。

detailed_translations.english: a small sea creature that you can eat, which has ten legs and a soft shell

name: lobster
trans: n. 龙虾；（食用）龙虾肉；<澳，新西兰>小龙虾；龙虾红；<澳新>小龙虾 v. 捕龙虾

sentences.english: She sold me a couple of live lobsters.
sentences.chinese: 她卖给了我几只活龙虾。

name: sponge
trans: n. （擦洗用的天然或人造的）海绵块；（用海绵或布）擦拭，擦洗；海绵蛋糕，松软布丁；依赖他人生活的寄生虫，揩油者；海绵（一种海洋软体动物）；（女用）避孕海绵；海绵填料；金属绵 v. 用海绵擦洗；用湿布（或海绵）擦掉，揩去；白吃，揩油；用海绵抹（漆）

sentences.english: Clean the rug by sponging it gently.
sentences.chinese: 用湿布轻轻擦洗以清洁小地毯。

sentences.chinese: ...它通常赖以为食的浮游生物和其他微生物。

name: oyster
trans: n. 牡蛎，蚝；牡蛎白；（鸡脊骨两边的）蚝状鸡背肉；<非正式>沉默寡言的人 v. 养殖（或采捞、采集）牡蛎

sentences.chinese: 我怎样做才能算是从燃烧的牡蛎中取出珍珠？

name: clam
trans: n. 蛤，蛤蜊；<非正式>可食用的双壳软体动物（如扇贝）；<美，非正式>美元；<非正式>嘴紧的人，沉默寡言的人 v. <美>挖蛤，拾蛤

sentences.english: clam chowder (= a type of soup )

trans: n. 珊瑚；（作珠宝的）珊瑚宝石；珊瑚色，橘红色；珊瑚虫；龙虾卵，扇贝卵 adj. 珊瑚色的，浅橘红色的；珊瑚的，珊瑚制的

sentences.english: It is like the bow of the King of the Persians that is painted with vermilion and is tipped with coral.
sentences.chinese: 你的嘴唇就像是波斯王国的弯弓，那是一张涂上朱砂的弯弓，那是一张头上镶嵌珊瑚的弯弓。

sentences.english: I believe they are doing a good job with that. How about the coral? Is it really as beautiful as they say?
sentences.chinese: 我相信他们是在做好事。对了，珊瑚怎么样？它们真的就像人们说的那么漂亮吗？
