a hard red, white, or pink substance formed from the bones of very small sea creatures, which is often used to make jewellery

name: crab
trans: n. 螃蟹，蟹肉；<美，非正式>脾气乖戾的人，易怒的人；阴虱病；起重机，绞车 v. 横行，作蟹行；捕蟹，抓蟹；<美，非正式>抱怨，烦扰

sentences.english: crab meat
sentences.chinese: 蟹肉

detailed_translations.english: a sea animal with a hard shell, five legs on each side, and two large claws

trans: n. 松鼠；松鼠的毛皮 v. 贮藏（供以后使用）；不停（或不安）地探寻

sentences.chinese: 松鼠贮藏坚果以备过冬。

sentences.chinese: 松鼠已经贮存了许多坚果以备过冬。

sentences.english: It was moving fast like a squirrel, but it was as loud as a bear.
sentences.chinese: 它像松鼠一样快速的移动但那声音却像是熊发出的似的。

sentences.chinese: 保守封闭的社团

trans: n. 岛，岛屿；岛状物，孤立体；脑岛，胰岛 v. 使成岛（状），使孤立

sentences.chinese: 我住在一个岛上。

sentences.english: Then one day, an English ship anchored near the island.
sentences.chinese: 然后有一天，一艘英国船在岛附近抛锚了。

sentences.english: This is because the island is so close to the equator. So you can choose to go whenever you like.
sentences.chinese: 就因为这个岛是如此接近赤道。所以只要你愿意你任何时候都可以去。

trans: n. 小岛

sentences.english: Because of this, researchers have experimented with other techniques, such as this one, to turn adult cells into beta-islet cells.
sentences.chinese: 正因为此，研究者们只能使用其他的技术，例如成人干细胞转化胰岛细胞的方法。

sentences.english: Unlike more lethal forms of pancreatic cancer, patients with islet cell neuroendocrine tumor have a high survival rate if the disease is removed promptly.
sentences.chinese: 与更致命的胰腺癌种类不同，如果肿瘤及时切除，胰岛细胞神经内分泌肿瘤患者的存活率很高。

detailed_translations.english: a very small island

sentences.chinese: 海洋生物学

sentences.chinese: 旧金山几乎失去了所有海运业。

sentences.chinese: 我们小心翼翼地沿着狭窄的岩架爬行。

sentences.english: The immaculately tended gardens are an oasis in the midst of Cairo's urban sprawl.
sentences.chinese: 那些打理得非常整洁的花园是杂乱扩张的开罗市区中的一片绿洲。

trans: n. 潮汐；潮水；潮流，趋势；怒潮，（难以控制的）浪潮；高涨的情绪；潮水般的人流，洪流 v. <古>顺潮水漂浮

sentences.chinese: 现在是退潮还是涨潮？

sentences.chinese: 这个酒店位于城市的郊区,是全城最好的酒店之一。

detailed_translations.english: a part of the city far removed from the center

trans: n. 地区，区域；行政区；<英>（首都以外的）地方（the regions）；身体部位；领域，界

sentences.chinese: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

sentences.chinese: 芝加哥一些地区暴力犯罪成患。

trans: adj. 世界主义的，四海为家的；国际性的，国际化的；见过世面的，见识广的；广布的，遍生的 n. 四海为家的人，周游世界的人

sentences.chinese: 一个充满活力的国际性都市

sentences.english: a lively hotel with a cosmopolitan atmosphere

detailed_translations.chinese: 四海为家者；世界主义者；世界各地都有的东西

name: subterrane

trans: adj. 地下的；秘密的；隐蔽的 n. 地下工作者

sentences.english: subterranean passage
sentences.chinese: 地下通道

detailed_translations.english: beneath the surface of the earth

name: cavern
trans: n. 洞穴；凹处 vt. 挖空；置……于洞穴中

sentences.english: And the Hare said to him, 'The piece of red gold that thou seekest is in the cavern that is behind thee.
sentences.chinese: 小野兔告诉他说：“你所寻找的那块红色的金子就在你身后的大洞穴里。

detailed_translations.english: a large  cave

name: flaw
trans: n. 缺点，缺陷；裂痕，瑕疵 v. 削弱，使失效

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

trans: v. 劈开；分开；迅速穿过；紧挨；坚信；分离（分子）；开（路）；（细胞）分裂；（诗、文）黏着；专心于；依恋（某人）（cleave的过去式及过去分词） n. （尤指岩石、地表的）裂缝；额头（或下巴）中间的竖缝；（身体）V 字形凹陷 adj. （部分）裂成两半的

sentences.english: ...a narrow cleft in the rocks too small for humans to enter.
sentences.chinese: ...石块上一个对于人想钻进来说太小了的裂口。

detailed_translations.english: If someone has a cleft chin, they have a cleft in their chin

name: crevice
trans: n. 裂缝；裂隙

sentences.chinese: 藏在岩石缝里的小生物

detailed_translations.english: a narrow crack in the surface of something, especially in rock

name: gap
trans: n. 缝隙，缺口；（时间上的）间隔；空白，缺漏；隔阂，差距

sentences.english: ...the gap between rich and poor.
sentences.chinese: …贫富差距。

detailed_translations.english: a big difference between two situations, amounts, groups of people etc

name: zone
trans: n. （有某特色或作用的）地区，地带；（允许或禁止某种活动的）范围；（尤指有别于周围的）区域，部份；（规划的）区域，分区；（地球的）气候带；时区；（动植物）环带，带；（尤作体育用语）巅峰状态 v. 将……划为某种用途的区域；将……分成区（或划成带）；<古>用带子围绕，环绕

sentences.english: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山和东京都位于地震带。

sentences.english: The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 政府设立了一个经济特区来推动私营企业的发展。

trans: n. 赤道

sentences.english: The United States is north of the equator.
sentences.chinese: 美国位于赤道以北。

sentences.english: In the hot zone near the equator the sun heats the air continually; hence the air there ascends.
sentences.chinese: 在靠近赤道的热带地区，太阳不断地加热那里的空气，于是那里的热空气就上升。

trans: n. 经度，经线

sentences.chinese: 这个镇位于东经12度。

name: altitude

sentences.english: The aircraft had reached its cruising altitude of about 39,000 feet.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机已经达到了大约三万九千英尺的巡航高度。

trans: n. 纬度；纬度地区；选择的自由，回旋余地；（感光乳剂，相纸）曝光宽容度

sentences.english: The birds breed in northern latitudes.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟在北纬地区繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.

name: meridian

sentences.english: Yes this is the…is the prime meridian if you like.
sentences.chinese: 是的，这就是本初子午线，它把地球分为东半球和西半球。

sentences.english: The prime meridian of longitude is in greenwich south london.
sentences.chinese: 经度的本初子午线在伦敦南部的格林威治。

detailed_translations.english: one of the imaginary lines from the North Pole to the South Pole, drawn on a map of the Earth

name: subsidiary

sentences.english: a subsidiary hypothesis
sentences.chinese: 一个附带假设

detailed_translations.english: connected with, but less important than, something else

name: Antarctic
trans: n. 南极洲，南极地区 adj. 南极的

sentences.english: I like to read his Antarctic adventures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢读他的南极种种的冒险事迹。

sentences.english: 'They would, in fact, feel more connected to home than the early Antarctic explorers, ' they write in their article.
sentences.chinese: “事实上，他们会比早期的南极探险者感受到更多与家庭的联系。”他们在文章中写道。

sentences.english: As the nebula collapsed because of its gravity, it spun faster and flattened into a disk.
sentences.chinese: 随着由于重力引起的星云坍缩，它旋转得越来越快，并变成了盘状。

sentences.english: There is one other possible explanation for what scientists have seen: They could be watching the birth instead of a pulsar wind nebula.
sentences.chinese: 对于科学家的最新观察结果，还有其他解释：他们所看到的或许只是一个“脉冲星风星云”的诞生。

sentences.english: As for the spiral itself, current supposition is that this is the result of a star in a binary star system entering the planetary nebula phase, when its outer atmosphere is ejected.
sentences.chinese: 至于螺旋本身，最近的推测是这是双子星系统中的一个恒星进入行星星云阶段的结果，此时它的外层大气会被喷出。

detailed_translations.english: a mass of gas and dust among the stars, which often appears as a bright cloud in the sky at night

name: quasar
trans: n. [天] 类星体；恒星状球体

sentences.english: This quasar was the only one without a known host galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 这个类星体似乎无依无傍，不在任何一个星系当中。

sentences.english: Within a few million years, both quasar and galaxy will have merged.
sentences.chinese: 在几百万年的时间里，类星体和伴星系将会合并在一起。

sentences.english: But scientists have now found a quasar that's apparently churning out new stars in the absence of a host galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在科学家们发现，一颗没有挂靠主星系的类星体显然在大量地制造出新恒星。

detailed_translations.english: an object in space that is similar to a star and that shines very brightly

name: space
trans: n. 空间，空地；（用于特定目的的）处所，场所，空位；（公共汽车、火车等的）空座；开阔地，空旷处；开阔，空旷；空白，空隙；太空，外层空间；宇宙空间；一段时间；自由，自由支配的时间；（词语、行、段落的）间隔；（打字时的）空格，一个字母的宽度；（文件上的）空白处；（乐）（谱表的）线间空白，线间；版面，篇幅；（报纸的）广告专页，（电视、广播节目间的）广告插播时间；（出租或出售的）商铺；（数）空间；（电信）空号 v. 在……之间留间隔，把……分隔开；（印刷或书写中）在（词语，字母，行）之间加空格；（尤指因无聊或吸毒后）变得昏昏沉沉，瞪着眼发呆

sentences.english: How much space is there on each disk?
sentences.chinese: 每张磁盘有多大容量？

sentences.english: The hedge takes up too much space .
sentences.chinese: 这树篱占了太多的地方。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of an area, room, container etc that is empty or available to be used

name: planeroid
trans: n. 位面

name: intergalactic
trans: adj. 星系间的；银河间的

sentences.english: Intergalactic travel remains just a nice idea.
sentences.chinese: 银河间的旅行仍然只是个美好的愿望。

detailed_translations.chinese: 银河间的, 星际间的
detailed_translations.english: between the large groups of stars in space

name: interplanetary
trans: adj. 太阳系内的；行星间的

sentences.english: interplanetary space missions
sentences.chinese: 星际太空飞行任务

detailed_translations.english: between the planets

name: interstellar
trans: adj. 星际的， 恒星之间的

sentences.english: ...interstellar space.
sentences.chinese: ...星际空间。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing between the stars

name: corona
trans: n. （尤指在日蚀或月蚀期间的）日冕，月华；冠，冠状部位；（物理）电晕（=corona discharge）；（教堂的）环形吊灯；（建筑）挑檐滴水板；（Corona）科罗纳（美国城市名）

name: chromosphere
trans: n. 色球层

sentences.english: After that is the chromosphere, a layer that looks reddish because of all the hydrogen found there.
sentences.chinese: 再之外是色球层，这一层由于存在的氢元素而略呈红色。

sentences.english: The solar atmosphere above that consists of the photosphere, chromosphere, a transition region and the corona.
sentences.chinese: 太阳大气则由光球层、色球层、过渡区和日冕组成。

sentences.english: A star during most of its life is a main-sequence star, which consists of a core, radiative and convective zones, a photosphere, a chromosphere and a corona.
sentences.chinese: 一颗恒星其生命的绝大部分处于主序星阶段，在这一阶段它包含一个核心、辐射区和对流区、光球层、色球层和日冕。

detailed_translations.english: a gaseous layer of the sun's atmosphere extending from the photosphere to the corona and visible during a total eclipse of the sun

name: solar
trans: adj. 太阳的，和太阳有关的；（与）太阳能（有关）的 n. <英>（中世纪房屋的）屋顶室，顶层房间

sentences.english: a solar eclipse
sentences.chinese: 日食

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sun

name: photosphere
trans: n. 光球，光球层

sentences.english: The photosphere is the lowest layer of the sun's atmosphere, and emits the light we see.
sentences.chinese: 光球是太阳大气的最底层，我们看到的光线就是从它发出的。

sentences.english: After those zones comes the part of the star that radiates visible light, the photosphere, which is often referred to as the surface of the star.
sentences.chinese: 在这些区域之外，是恒星辐射可见光的部分，即光球层，一般被当作是恒星的表面。

sentences.english: A star during most of its life is a main-sequence star, which consists of a core, radiative and convective zones, a photosphere, a chromosphere and a corona.
sentences.chinese: 一颗恒星其生命的绝大部分处于主序星阶段，在这一阶段它包含一个核心、辐射区和对流区、光球层、色球层和日冕。

detailed_translations.english: the visible surface of the sun, several hundred kilometres thick

name: pseudoscience
trans: n. 伪科学；假科学

name: astronomy
trans: n. 天文学

sentences.english: The book treats of astronomy.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是讲天文学的。

sentences.english: This was the birth of astronomy.
sentences.chinese: 这就是天文学的起源。

sentences.english: You could study astronomy , or space engineering , and be good at it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以学习天文学，或是空间工程学，可以学的很棒。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the stars and  planet s

name: astronomical
trans: adj. 天文（学）的，天体的；（数量、价格或收费）天文数字的，极其巨大的

sentences.english: Houses in the subdivision are going for astronomical prices.
sentences.chinese: 该小区里的房子在以天价出售。

detailed_translations.english: astronomical prices, costs etc are extremely high

name: astrology
trans: n. 占星术；占星学；星座

sentences.english: Astronomy inherits from astrology.
sentences.chinese: 天文学的前身是占星术。

sentences.english: This should be contrasted with nonscientific programs and the best example of a nonscientific program is astrology.
sentences.chinese: 这点与非科学假说正好相反,非科学假说最好的例子便是占星术了。

sentences.english: It was a great innovator in medicine, astronomy, astrology, mathematics and banking; the Babylonians may even have believed that the world was round.
sentences.chinese: 它在医药，天文学，占星术，数学和银行业方面都堪称一个伟大的改革者。 甚至，古巴比伦人可能已经相信地球是圆的。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the positions and movements of the stars and how they might influence people and events

name: astrophysics
trans: n. 天体物理学

sentences.english: But exactly what cut through the haze has been one of the big questions in astrophysics.
sentences.chinese: 然而，究竟是什么驱散了烟雾？ 这一直是天体物理学上的一个重大问题之一。

sentences.english: So for decades, astronomers have used it as a “standard candle” in the field of high-energy astrophysics.
sentences.chinese: 因此几十年来，天文学家一直将其视为高能天体物理领域的“标准烛光”使用。

sentences.english: Unless your physics specialty is deeply theoretical or has to do with astrophysics, you can usually find an industry job that is related to your work.
sentences.chinese: 除非你的物理学专业极端理论化，或者是天体物理，否则你通常是可以在工业界找到一个相关的职位的。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the chemical structure of the stars and the forces that influence them

name: Jupiter
trans: n. [天] 木星；朱庇特（罗马神话中的宙斯神）

sentences.english: a space probe on its way to Jupiter
sentences.chinese: 飞向木星的一个太空探测器

detailed_translations.english: the planet that is fifth in order from the sun and is the largest in the solar system

name: lunar
trans: adj. 月亮的，月球的；银的；阴历的；似月的，月牙形的

sentences.english: studies of the lunar surface
sentences.chinese: 对月球表面的研究

sentences.english: a lunar eclipse
sentences.chinese: 月食

detailed_translations.english: relating to the Moon or to travel to the Moon

name: Mars
trans: n. 战神；[天] 火星

sentences.english: the enormous volcanoes known to exist on Mars
sentences.chinese: 已知在火星上存在的大量火山

detailed_translations.english: the small red planet that is fourth in order from the Sun and is nearest the Earth

name: mercury
trans: n. 汞，水银 ；水银柱；<史>水银，汞盐；山靛；墨丘利（罗马十二主神之一）（Mercury）；水星（Mercury）；<古>信使

sentences.english: He said that all metals were composed of mercury and sulphur in different proportions .
sentences.chinese: 他说一切金属都是由水银和硫黄按不同比例构成的。

sentences.english: Here they endure long hours at dangerous jobs, wringing flecks of gold from the dirt with mercury.
sentences.chinese: 他们每天在这种危险的环境下工作很长时间，从带有水银的泥沙中淘出金沙。

sentences.english: Because glass mercury thermometers harm both humans and the environment, they have been phased out and are no longer recommended.
sentences.chinese: 因为玻璃水银温度计对于人类和环境都有害处，现在已经逐步被淘汰不再建议使用了。

detailed_translations.english: Mercury is a silver-coloured liquid metal that is used especially in thermometers and barometers

name: Earth
trans: n. 地球，世界；陆地，地面；泥土，土壤；地线，电线；<英，非正式>一大笔钱；尘世；兽穴 v. 把（电线）接地；用土掩盖；追赶入洞穴

name: Uranus
trans: n. 乌拉诺斯（希腊神话中的第一代神王、天空之神）；（天）天王星

name: Venus
trans: n. 金星，太白星；<文>美女；帘蛤；（罗马神话）维纳斯

sentences.english: the high surface temperatures of Venus
sentences.chinese: 金星表面的高温

detailed_translations.chinese: [天] 金星；维纳斯（爱与美的女神）
detailed_translations.english: the planetthat is second in order from the Sun

name: Pluto
trans: n. [天] 冥王星；冥王

name: Neptune
trans: n. [天] 海王星；海神

name: Saturn
trans: n. [天] 土星；农业之神（罗马神话中的一个形象）

sentences.english: Saturn is my surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 土星是我的环境。

sentences.english: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. Those are the gas giants, the four heavyweights of the solar system. But was there once a fifth?
sentences.chinese: 木星，土星，天王星和海王星。这些都是气体行星，太阳系的四个重量级。但曾经存在第五个行星吗？

sentences.english: Remember earlier when we talked about Saturn and how he teaches us about karma, cause and effect, and "tough love" style life lessons.
sentences.chinese: 记得早些时候曾当我们谈到土星，以及他如何讲授业，原因和影响我们，“严厉的爱”式的生活经验。

detailed_translations.english: the  planet  that is sixth in order from the sun and is surrounded by large rings

name: emission
trans: n. 排放物，散发物；（尤指光、热、气等的）散发，排放；射精，遗精；<古>发行

sentences.english: the emission of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 向大气排放二氧化碳

sentences.english: Britain agreed to cut emissions of nitrogen oxide from power stations.
sentences.chinese: 英国同意减少发电站氮氧化物的排放量。

detailed_translations.english: the production or sending out of light, heat, gas, etc.

name: infinite
trans: adj. 无限的，无穷尽的；（数量或程度上）极大的，无穷大的；非限定的 n. （空间或数量的）无穷大（the infinite）；上帝（the infinite）

sentences.english: The universe is infinite.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙是无限的。

detailed_translations.english: without limits in space or time

name: interferometer
trans: n. [光] 干涉仪；干涉计

sentences.english: One possibility, according to Hogan, would be to use a device called an atom interferometer.
sentences.chinese: 霍根说，一种可行方式是使用所谓的“原子干涉仪”设备。

sentences.english: This is achieved by firing a laser down a 600 meter long tube where it is split, reflected and directed into an interferometer.
sentences.chinese: 实现这一功能，需要发射一束激光，穿过600米的隧道后，将激光分裂成两束，经过反射的一束和未反射的一束均进入干涉仪。

sentences.english: Currently under construction in Fermilab, the Holometer (meaning holographic interferometer) will delve deep into this quantum realm at smaller scales than the GEO600 experiment.
sentences.chinese: 目前在费米实验室制造的“全息干涉仪”，将比GEO600探测到更小的尺度，进入到量子尺度。

detailed_translations.english: any acoustic, optical, or microwave instrument that uses interference patterns or fringes to make accurate measurements of wavelength, wave velocity, distance, etc

name: radiation
trans: n. 辐射，放射线；辐射的热（或能量等）；放射疗法；辐射形进化，发散状分化

sentences.english: An accident at the power station could result in large amounts of radiation being released.
sentences.chinese: 发电站事故会造成大量核辐射泄漏。

sentences.english: a lethal dose of radiation
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的辐射

sentences.english: Sun creams work by blocking harmful ultraviolet radiation.
sentences.chinese: 防晒霜可隔离有害的紫外线辐射。

detailed_translations.english: a form of energy that comes especially from nuclear reactions, which in large amounts is very harmful to living things

name: revolve
trans: v. （使）旋转；围绕……旋转（revolve around）；以……为最重要内容，以……为中心（revolve around）；反复思考，反复斟酌；循环出现 n. 旋转舞台

sentences.english: The wheel began to revolve.
sentences.chinese: 轮子开始旋转。

sentences.english: The restaurant slowly revolves, giving excellent views of the city.
sentences.chinese: 餐厅缓缓旋转，城市美景尽收眼底。

sentences.english: Using graphics software, you can revolve the image on the screen.
sentences.chinese: 使用绘图软件可以旋转屏幕上的图像。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋转；循环出现；反复考虑
detailed_translations.english: to move around like a wheel, or to make something move around like a wheel

name: land
trans: n. 陆地，地面；土地（尤指耕地或建筑用地）；地产，地皮；农耕，农村生活；国度，国土；想象（或虚构）的地方；（枪炮）阳膛线 v. 着陆，降落；使（飞机）平稳着陆；登陆，上岸；（从船或飞机上）卸下（货物）；落下，跌落；<非正式>使陷入（困境）；<非正式>（令人不快的事）突然出现；<非正式>（尤指轻而易举或意外地）获得；打中（一拳）

sentences.english: They own a lot of land.
sentences.chinese: 他们拥有许多土地。

sentences.english: He bought a piece of land.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一块地。

sentences.english: After 21 days at sea, we sighted land.
sentences.chinese: 经过21天的海上航行，我们见到了陆地。

detailed_translations.english: an area of ground, especially when used for farming or building

name: spaceship
trans: n. 宇宙飞船

sentences.english: ...an alien spaceship.
sentences.chinese: …一艘外星人的宇宙飞船。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle for carrying people through space

name: spacecraft
trans: n. 宇宙飞船，航天器

sentences.english: the world's largest and most expensive unmanned spacecraft
sentences.chinese: 世界上最大、最贵的无人航天器

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that is able to travel in space

name: telescope
trans: n. 望远镜；射电望远镜，无线电望远镜（radio telescope 的简称） v. 叠套缩短，叠缩；缩短，精简；使（车辆）相撞而嵌进；压缩

sentences.english: The captain was rectifying his telescope.
sentences.chinese: 船长正在调他的望远镜。

sentences.english: The telescope reveals many distant stars to our sight.
sentences.chinese: 望远镜把许多遥远的星球显现在我们的眼前。

sentences.english: With the aid of a telescope a ship could be made out on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 借助望远镜可以看出在地平线上有一只船。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer

name: meteorite
trans: n. 陨石，陨星；流星

sentences.english: I close the meteorite room and try the door across thecorridor.
sentences.chinese: 我关上陨石房间的门，又打开了走廊对面的门。

sentences.english: If the contamination were terrestrial, one could expect equal amounts of the molecules (or less) to be present in the meteorite samples, certainly not more.
sentences.chinese: 如果污染是来自地面的，在陨石样品中有可能会发现等量（或者较少）的分子，但肯定不会多。

sentences.english: The group, based at Imperial College London, found some of the base building blocks for life, nucleobases, in dust from the Murchison meteorite which fell to Earth in 1969.
sentences.chinese: 研究小组由伦敦帝国学院创建，他们在1969年坠入地球的默奇森陨石尘埃中发现了碱基，这是构建生命的基本成分。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of rock or metal from space that has landed on Earth

name: holism
trans: n. 整体论

name: supernova
trans: n. [天] 超新星

sentences.english: At least one supernova occurs per decade in our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 每十年至少有一颗超新星在我们的银河系中出现。

detailed_translations.english: a very large exploding star

name: urban
trans: adj. 城市的，城镇的；黑人音乐的；住在都市的

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

name: rustic
trans: adj. 乡村的；纯朴的；粗野的；手工粗糙的 n. 乡下人；乡巴佬

sentences.english: The village had a certain rustic charm .
sentences.chinese: 这个村庄有一种迷人的田园风情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乡村的；纯朴的；粗野的；手工粗糙的
detailed_translations.english: simple, old-fashioned, and not spoiled by modern developments, in a way that is typical of the countryside
someone from the country, especially a farm worker

name: community
trans: n. 社区，社会；（由同国籍、同宗教等构成的）群体，界；（多个国家的）共同体；归属感；（动植物的）群落

sentences.english: The new arts centre will serve the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 这座新的艺术中心将为整个社区服务。

sentences.english: the Polish community in London
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦的波兰侨民团体

detailed_translations.english: the people who live in the same area, town etc

name: metropolitan
trans: adj. 大都市的；本土的；（与）宗主国（有关）的 n. （东正教和天主教的）大主教；大城市人，都会居民

sentences.english: a metropolitan area of South Australia
sentences.chinese: 南澳大利亚的一个都市区

sentences.english: ...the Ukrainian Catholic representatives, Metropolitan Volodymyr and Bishop Sofron.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰的天主教代表——弗拉基米尔大主教和索夫龙主教

detailed_translations.english: relating or belonging to a very large city
a metropolitan is an important priest in the Orthodox and Catholic Churches. He has authority over other priests and is in charge of a particular area.

name: exotic
trans: adj. 奇异的，异国风情的 n. 外来植物，外来动物

sentences.english: exotic birds
sentences.chinese: 外国的奇异鸟类

sentences.english: exotic places
sentences.chinese: 有异国风情的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
detailed_translations.english: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

name: conventional
trans: adj. 依照惯例的，遵循习俗的；老一套的，习惯的；（武器等）常规的，非核的

sentences.english: Internet connections through conventional phone lines are fairly slow.
sentences.chinese: 通过传统的电话线来连接因特网速度很慢。

sentences.english: Bake for 20 minutes in a conventional oven; 8 in a microwave.
sentences.chinese: 在传统的烤炉中烘烤20分钟，在微波炉里则烤8分钟。

detailed_translations.english: a conventional method, product, practice etc has been used for a long time and is considered the usual type

name: convention
trans: n. 习俗，惯例；大会，集会；公约，协定；（文学、艺术上的）传统手法，传统风格

sentences.english: a teachers’ convention
sentences.chinese: 教师大会

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans
sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests

name: patriarchal
trans: adj. 父权制的，男性主宰统治的；族长的，家长的

sentences.english: a patriarchal society
sentences.chinese: 父权制社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 家长的；族长的；由族长统治的
detailed_translations.english: ruled or controlled only by men

name: institutionalize
trans: vt. 使……制度化

sentences.english: the struggle to institutionalize equality for women
sentences.chinese: 使妇女平等制度化的斗争

detailed_translations.english: to make something a normal, accepted part of a social system or organization

name: clan
trans: n. 宗族，氏族；<非正式>大家庭，大家族；<非正式>集团，帮派

sentences.english: the Campbell clan
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔家族

sentences.english: warring clans
sentences.chinese: 交战的各氏族

detailed_translations.english: a large group of families who often share the same name

name: status
trans: n. 法律地位（或身份）；（尤指在社会中的）地位，身份；高级职位，社会上层地位；重视（或崇尚）程度；状况，情形

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

name: taboo
trans: n. （宗教或社会习俗方面的）禁忌，忌讳；禁忌的事物，禁忌行为（或做法）；塔布 adj. 忌讳的，为社会习俗所不容的，不被人接受的；（因会冒犯人或引起尴尬而）禁忌的，忌讳的；（因太神圣或太邪恶而）禁止接触的，禁止使用的 vt. 把……列为禁忌

sentences.english: The topic of addiction remains something of a taboo in our family.
sentences.chinese: 毒瘾在我们家依然是个有些忌讳的话题。

detailed_translations.english: a custom that says you must avoid a particular activity or subject, either because it is considered offensive or because your religion does not allow it
a taboo subject, word, activity etc is one that people avoid because it is extremely offensive or embarrassing

name: ethics
trans: n. 行为准则，道德原则；伦理学，道德学

sentences.english: Refugee workers said such action was a violation of medical ethics.
sentences.chinese: 难民工作者称这种行为违背了医学道德。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理学；伦理观；道德标准
detailed_translations.english: Ethics are moral beliefs and rules about right and wrong

name: genteel
trans: adj. 有教养的，文雅的；上流社会的

sentences.english: She broke into a genteel run.
sentences.chinese: 她优雅地跑了起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有教养的，文雅的；上流社会的
detailed_translations.english: polite, gentle, or graceful

name: marital
trans: adj. 婚姻的，夫妻关系的

sentences.english: marital problems
sentences.chinese: 婚姻问题

sentences.english: the increase in marital breakdown
sentences.chinese: 婚姻破裂的增多

detailed_translations.english: relating to marriage

name: polygamous
trans: adj. 一夫多妻的；一妻多夫的

sentences.english: Less than 1 percent of the men in any Muslim country are polygamous.
sentences.chinese: 任何一个穆斯林国家都有不到1%的男子是有多位妻子的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一夫多妻的， 一妻多夫的
detailed_translations.english: In a polygamous society, people can be legally married to more than one person at the same time. A polygamous person, especially a man, is married to more than one person.

name: household
trans: n. 家庭，一家人；家务；王室（the Household） adj. 家用的，家务的；全家人的；家喻户晓的；皇家的（Household）

sentences.english: household chores
sentences.chinese: 家务杂活

sentences.english: ...growing up in a male-only household.
sentences.chinese: …在全体成员均为男性的家庭里长大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 家庭的， 家喻户晓的
detailed_translations.english: relating to looking after a house and the people in it
A household is all the people in a family or group who live together in a house

name: archeology
trans: n. 考古学（等于 archaeology）

sentences.english: He has been studying archeology these thirty years.
sentences.chinese: 他这三十年来一直在研究考古学。

sentences.english: He was an expert in agriculture archeology, and medicine.
sentences.chinese: 他是农业考古学的专家， 和药。

sentences.english: She's giving a paper on archeology at the National Museum this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午她将在国家博物馆宣读一篇关于考古学的论文。

name: invaluable
trans: adj. 极有用的，极宝贵的

sentences.english: The internet is an invaluable source of information.
sentences.chinese: 因特网是十分有价值的信息来源。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非常宝贵的， 极为贵重的， 无价的
detailed_translations.english: extremely useful

name: unearth
trans: v. 发掘，使出土；发现，揭露；从洞中赶出（动物，尤指狐狸）

sentences.english: Farmers still sometimes unearth human bones here.
sentences.chinese: 农民们有时仍然能在这里挖到人骨。

sentences.english: In one shop, I unearthed a wonderful collection of 1920s toys.
sentences.chinese: 在一家商店，我发现了一套非常好玩的 20 世纪 20 年代的玩具。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发掘；揭露，发现；从洞中赶出
detailed_translations.english: to find something after searching for it, especially something that has been buried in the ground or lost for a long time

name: scoop
trans: n. 勺，球形勺；铲，铲斗；<非正式>（抢先报道的）独家新闻；<美，非正式>（尤指私人的）最新内幕（the scoop）；一勺，一铲斗（的量）；舀的动作，铲的动作；（唱歌中）夸张的上滑音 v. 用勺舀，用铲子铲；挖出，挖空；（急速地）捡起，抱起；<非正式>抢先报道（新闻）；<非正式>赢得（金钱、奖品或胜利纪念品）；（唱歌）使用夸张的上滑音作为曲调的前奏

sentences.english: ...the sound of a spoon scooping dog food out of a can.
sentences.chinese: …用勺子从罐子里舀狗粮的声音。

detailed_translations.english: If you scoop something from a container, you remove it with something such as a spoon
an important or exciting news story that is printed in one newspaper or shown on one television station before any of the others know about it

name: exhume
trans: vt. 发掘；掘出 n. （Exhume）人名；（法）埃克叙姆

sentences.english: His remains have been exhumed from a cemetery in Queens.
sentences.chinese: 他的遗体已被从昆士郡的一个墓地里挖了出来。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a dead body from the ground, especially in order to check the cause of death

name: excavate
trans: v. 发掘，挖掘（古物）；挖（洞），开凿

sentences.english: Schliemann excavated the ancient city of Troy.
sentences.chinese: 谢里曼发掘出特洛伊古城。

detailed_translations.english: if a scientist or archaeologist excavates an area of land, they dig carefully to find ancient objects, bones etc

name: excavation
trans: n. （对古物的）发掘，挖掘；发掘现场； 挖洞，开凿

sentences.english: A second excavation, in 1985, lasted a year and was cut short for technical reasons.
sentences.chinese: 第二次挖掘是在1985年，因为技术原因持续了一年就突然停止了。

sentences.english: If he thinks I’m particular about excavation records, you should see him taking pictures!
sentences.chinese: 如果他觉得我对挖掘纪录很挑剔，你应该看看他是怎么拍照的。

sentences.english: Blue flags define the excavation perimeter, while yellow ones mark the location of fossils or stone tools.
sentences.chinese: 蓝旗用来显示发掘地的周长，而黄旗用来标明发掘出化石或石制工具的地点。

name: Neolithic
trans: adj. 新石器时代的 n. 新石器时代

sentences.english: a Neolithic burial ground
sentences.chinese: 一块新石器时代的墓地

detailed_translations.english: relating to the last period of the stone age, about 10,000 years ago, when people began to live together in small groups and make stone tools and weapons

name: Mesolithic
trans: adj. 中石器时代的 n. 中石器时代

detailed_translations.english: of or relating to the Mesolithic
the period between the Palaeolithic and the Neolithic, in Europe from about 12 000 to 3000 bc, characterized by the appearance of microliths

sentences.english: Paleolithic man could only make the most basic stone tools.
sentences.chinese: 旧石器时代的人类只能制造最简单的石器。

sentences.english: A group of caverns of northern Spain west-southwest of Santander. The caves contain magnificent specimens of Paleolithic art discovered in 1879.
sentences.chinese: 奥尔塔米拉岩窟：西班牙北部的一组岩窟，位于桑坦德西南偏西，洞穴里有1879年发现的旧石器时期艺术的宏伟的标本。

sentences.english: Hilazon Tachtit was occupied by the Natufians, hunter-gatherers who began to build permanent dwellings during the transition between the prefarming Paleolithic and the agricultural Neolithic periods.
sentences.chinese: 希拉松塔奇提特洞穴一直被纳图夫人所占据，并且在旧石器时代到新石器时代的过度阶段开始在那里建造永久性的住房。

name: origin
trans: n. 起源，起因；出身，血统；（原）产地；肌肉起端；神经（或血管）起端；（数）原点

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

name: chronological
trans: adj. 按发生时间顺序排列的；（年龄）按时间计算的

sentences.english: We arranged the documents in chronological order .
sentences.chinese: 我们把这些文件按时序排列。

detailed_translations.chinese: 按年代顺序排列的；依时间前后排列而记载的
detailed_translations.english: arranged according to when things happened or were made

name: archaic
trans: adj. （词，语言风格）古体的，已不通用的；过时的，陈旧的；古代的，早期的

sentences.english: archaic words
sentences.chinese: 古词

detailed_translations.chinese: 古代的；陈旧的；古体的；古色古香的
detailed_translations.english: old and no longer used

name: ascend
trans: v. 攀登，登上；上升，升高，通往高处；升职，晋升；追溯，溯源

sentences.english: The plane ascended rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 飞机迅速爬升。

detailed_translations.english: to move up through the air
to climb something or move to a higher position

name: originate
trans: v. 起源，产生；创始，开创

sentences.english: The disease originated in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病起源于非洲。

sentences.english: All carbohydrates originate from plants.
sentences.chinese: 所有的碳水化合物均来源于植物。

detailed_translations.english: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创始， 开创
detailed_translations.english: to have the idea for something and start it

name: primitive
trans: adj. 原始的，远古的；（器物等）粗糙的，简陋的；（人、动物或植物发展）早期的；（行为，思想，情感）本能的，自然的；（艺术风格）朴实无华的；原来的，原有的；（语言学）根词的，非派生的；（数）（代数或几何表达式）本原的；（生）原生的 n. <旧>原始人，未开化的土人；原始派艺术家（或其作品）；文艺复兴前的艺术家（或作品），模仿文艺复兴前艺术风格的现代画家；早期风格物品；词根，原（词）素；（数）基本式，初基；（计算机）图元，原语

sentences.english: a primitive society
sentences.chinese: 原始社会

sentences.english: a primitive nomadic tribe
sentences.chinese: 原始的游牧部落

sentences.english: the tools used by primitive man
sentences.chinese: 原始人所用的工具

sentences.english: primitive art
sentences.chinese: 原始艺术

sentences.english: The first station buildings were quite primitive.
sentences.chinese: 最初的车站建筑很简陋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 原始的；简单的；简单的，简陋的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to a simple way of life that existed in the past and does not have modern industries and machines

name: remnant
trans: n. 残余部分，残迹；布头，零头布料；（基督教神学）余剩民 adj. 残余的，剩余的

sentences.english: Beneath the present church were remnants of Roman flooring.
sentences.chinese: 在目前的这座教堂下面还有残余的古罗马地板。

detailed_translations.english: a small part of something that remains after the rest of it has been used, destroyed, or eaten

name: porcelain
trans: n. 瓷；瓷器 adj. 瓷制的

sentences.english: a porcelain vase
sentences.chinese: 瓷花瓶

detailed_translations.english: a hard shiny white substance that is used for making expensive plates, cups etc

name: antique
trans: adj. 古老的，古董的；老式的，过时的；（木器表面罩漆工艺）仿古的，古式的；年久的，破旧的 n. 古物，古董；古式（尤指古希腊、古罗马的雕刻、建筑等）；西文粗体字体 v. 以仿古式样制作；觅购古玩

sentences.english: an antique rosewood desk
sentences.chinese: 古董红木书桌

detailed_translations.chinese: 古老的，年代久远的；过时的，古董的；古风的，古式的
detailed_translations.english: antique furniture, jewellery etc is old and often valuable

detailed_translations.chinese: 古董，古玩；古风，古希腊和古罗马艺术风格
detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture, jewellery etc that was made a very long time ago and is therefore valuable

name: antiquity
trans: n. 古代（尤指古希腊和古罗马时期）；年代久远；文物，古物；古代，古时（尤指古埃及、古希腊、古罗马时期）

sentences.english: a building of great antiquity
sentences.chinese: 非常古老的建筑物

detailed_translations.english: ancient times

name: skull
trans: n. 颅骨，头骨；<非正式>脑袋，头脑 v. <非正式>击中（某人的）头

sentences.english: Her husband was later treated for a fractured skull.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫后来因颅骨碎裂而接受治疗。

detailed_translations.english: the bones of a person’s or animal’s head

name: artifact
trans: n. （尤指有文化价值或历史价值的）人工制品，历史文物；非自然存在物体，假象（=artefact）

sentences.english: In the wrong hands this powerful artifact has the ability to unravel the soul.
sentences.chinese: 在错误手这强有力的人工制品有能力解开灵魂。

name: pharaoh
trans: n. 法老；暴君

sentences.english: They were not quasi-divine overmen like pharaoh or minos or the monarchs of mesopotamia.
sentences.chinese: 他们并不像法老、弥诺斯或美索不达米亚君主那样类似上帝的超人。

name: tunnel
trans: n. 隧道，地道；（动物的）洞穴通道；运动场运动员通道；套管；风洞 v. 开凿隧道，挖地道；（物理）（粒子）穿透势垒，隧（道贯）穿

sentences.english: a railway tunnel
sentences.chinese: 铁路隧道

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel (= between England and France )
sentences.chinese: 〔英吉利〕海峡隧道

detailed_translations.english: a passage that has been dug under the ground for cars, trains etc to go through

detailed_translations.chinese: 挖；在…打开通道；在…挖掘隧道
detailed_translations.english: to dig a long passage under the ground

name: manuscript
trans: n. 手稿，原稿；手抄本，手写本 adj. 手写的

sentences.english: Unfortunately, parts of the original manuscript have been lost.
sentences.chinese: 遗憾的是，部分原始手稿丢失了。

detailed_translations.english: a book or piece of writing before it is printed

name: vein
trans: n. 静脉；（植物的）叶脉，（昆虫的）翅脉；（干酪、石头等的）纹理，纹路；矿脉，矿层，岩脉；（某种特定的）情绪，风格，主题；几分；（普通用语或比喻用法）血管 v. 使成脉络；像脉络般分布于

sentences.english: the pulmonary vein
sentences.chinese: 肺静脉

sentences.english: She felt the blood racing through her veins as they kissed.
sentences.chinese: 他们接吻时她觉得热血沸腾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血管；叶脉；[地质] 岩脉；纹理；翅脉；性情
detailed_translations.english: one of the tubes which carries blood to your heart from other parts of your body

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成脉络；象脉络般分布于

name: pit
trans: n. （地面的）坑，洼；（表面上的）疤痕，凹陷；矿井； <非正式>异常凌乱的地方；（舞台前的）乐池，乐队席；<非正式>非常糟糕的事物（the pits）；<美>（水果或蔬菜的）核；<非正式>腋窝，心窝；（赛车道旁的）检修加油站；深渊，绝境；（交易所内特定股票或商品的）交易场；<史>斗兽场；<英，旧>（剧场）正厅后座；无底洞，巨库；<英，非正式>床 v. 使竞争，使对立；去除……的果核；（使）有疤痕，（使）凹陷；（为加油或维修而将赛车）开入检修加油站；<史>使动物相斗（以取乐）；窖藏

sentences.english: Dad first went down the pit (= worked in a coal mine ) when he was 15 years old.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸第一次下煤矿井时才15岁。

sentences.english: a national strike against pit closures
sentences.chinese: 抗议关闭煤矿井的全国性罢工

detailed_translations.chinese: 矿井；深坑；陷阱；（物体或人体表面上的）凹陷；（英国剧场的）正厅后排；正厅后排的观众
detailed_translations.english: a coal mine

detailed_translations.chinese: 使竞争；窖藏；使凹下；去…之核；使留疤痕
detailed_translations.english: to put small marks or holes in the surface of something

name: borehole
trans: n. 钻孔，井眼；（为探测石油或水）地上凿洞

name: pit
trans: n. （地面的）坑，洼；（表面上的）疤痕，凹陷；矿井； <非正式>异常凌乱的地方；（舞台前的）乐池，乐队席；<非正式>非常糟糕的事物（the pits）；<美>（水果或蔬菜的）核；<非正式>腋窝，心窝；（赛车道旁的）检修加油站；深渊，绝境；（交易所内特定股票或商品的）交易场；<史>斗兽场；<英，旧>（剧场）正厅后座；无底洞，巨库；<英，非正式>床 v. 使竞争，使对立；去除……的果核；（使）有疤痕，（使）凹陷；（为加油或维修而将赛车）开入检修加油站；<史>使动物相斗（以取乐）；窖藏

sentences.english: Dad first went down the pit (= worked in a coal mine ) when he was 15 years old.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸第一次下煤矿井时才15岁。

sentences.english: a national strike against pit closures
sentences.chinese: 抗议关闭煤矿井的全国性罢工

detailed_translations.chinese: 矿井；深坑；陷阱；（物体或人体表面上的）凹陷；（英国剧场的）正厅后排；正厅后排的观众
detailed_translations.english: a coal mine

detailed_translations.chinese: 使竞争；窖藏；使凹下；去…之核；使留疤痕
detailed_translations.english: to put small marks or holes in the surface of something

name: quartz
trans: n. 石英

sentences.english: quartz crystals
sentences.chinese: 石英晶体
