detailed_translations.english: to make a book, list, record etc, using different pieces of information, music etc

name: entitle
trans: v. 给予（某人）权利，给（某人）资格；给......命名，给......题名

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

name: emend
trans: vt. 修订；改进

sentences.english: When they do, rule aficionados will say, “Well, we can emend it and make it more supple by adding to the circumstances it covers.
sentences.chinese: 当发生这种情况的时候，爱好制定规则的人们就会说，“好吧，我们可以修订一下规则，让它能适应更多的环境。

sentences.english: It can avoid repeat manual word account and copy out when we emend teaching plan. It is important to enhance level of teaching management and work efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 该设计可以避免修订教学计划过程中反复人工计算、誊写的麻烦，对提高教学管理水平和工作效率有重要作用。

sentences.english: Firstly, based on the introduction of the developmental theories of real-estate, the dissertation puts forward the new developing styles and tries to make emend for the traditional theories.
sentences.chinese: 首先，本文在对城郊房地产大盘开发的基础理论铺垫介绍的基础上，提出了这种新的开发模式对传统房地产理论的修订；

detailed_translations.english: to remove the mistakes from something that has been written

name: paraphrase
trans: n. 释义，改述 v. 释义，改述

sentences.english: The last two clauses were an exact quote rather than a paraphrase of Mr. Forth's remarks.
sentences.chinese: 最后两个分句是对福思先生言论的准确引用而不是改述。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that expresses in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written
to express in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written

name: adapt
trans: v. 适应；调整，使适合；改编；改造，改装

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: adaptable
trans: adj. 能适应的，适应性强的；可改变（以适应新用途）的

sentences.english: The American Constitution has proved adaptable in changing political conditions.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明美国宪法能适应政治形势的变化。

detailed_translations.english: able to change in order to be successful in new and different situations

name: adaptation
trans: n. 改编本，改写本；适应，改变；适应（性），适应力；适应性变化

sentences.english: Branagh won two awards for his screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.
sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适应；改编；改编本，改写本
detailed_translations.english: a film or television programme that is based on a book or play

name: excerpt
trans: n. 摘录，节选 v. 摘录，节选

sentences.english: ...an excerpt from Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker.
sentences.chinese: …柴可夫斯基的《胡桃夹子》选段。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece taken from a book, poem, piece of music etc

name: abstract
trans: adj. 抽象的，纯概念的；（艺术）抽象派的；理论上的，不切实际的 n. 摘要，梗概；抽象画，抽象派艺术作品；抽象的概念 v. 抽象化，从理论上（或孤立地）考虑；提取，使分离；写……的摘要；偷走，窃取；退出

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: abstraction
trans: n. 抽象；提取；抽象概念；空想；心不在焉

sentences.english: He’s always talking in abstractions.
sentences.chinese: 他老是谈抽象的东西。

detailed_translations.english: a general idea about a type of situation, thing, or person rather than a specific example from real life

name: abridge
trans: vt. 删节；缩短；节略

sentences.english: The time is limited, so he abridge his composition.
sentences.chinese: 时间有限，他缩短了他的作文。

sentences.english: She decided to abridge her stay in campus since she wants to hunt for a job immediately.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到她想要马上找工作，他决定缩短在校园里逗留的时间。

name: coin
trans: n. 硬币，金属货币；塔罗牌中的一种花色（coins） v. 创造新词，首次使用；铸币，造币；<英，非正式>迅速而轻松地发财

sentences.english: Toss a coin to see who goes first.
sentences.chinese: 抛硬币决定谁先来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of metal, usually flat and round, that is used as money
to make pieces of money from metal

name: didactic
trans: adj. 说教的；教诲的

sentences.english: His novel has a didactic tone.
sentences.chinese: 他的小说有一种道德说教的口吻。

detailed_translations.english: speech or writing that is didactic is intended to teach people a moral lesson

name: leading
trans: adj. 主要的，最重要的；在（比赛或行列中）首位的，居前的 n. 行距；领导；（用于屋顶的）铅皮，铅板 v. 领导（lead 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: The army played a leading role in organizing the attempted coup.
sentences.chinese: 军队在策划这场未遂政变的过程中起了最主要的作用。

sentences.english: the leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 主要的工业国

sentences.english: a leading heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 最好的心脏病专家

sentences.english: leading members of the government
sentences.chinese: 政府要员

detailed_translations.english: best, most important, or most successful

name: sermon
trans: n. 布道，讲道；<非正式>冗长的说教，训诫

sentences.english: Cardinal Murphy will deliver the sermon on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 墨菲红衣主教将在周日布道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 布道；训诫；启示；冗长的讲话
detailed_translations.english: a talk given as part of a Christian church service, usually on a religious or moral subject

name: initiate
trans: v. 开始实施，发起；使了解，传授；（尤指在秘密仪式上）使加入，接纳 n. 新加入某组织的人，新入会的人

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

name: instill
trans: vt. 徐徐滴入；逐渐灌输

sentences.english: We must instill a sense of duty in our children.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在我们的孩子当中灌输一种责任感。

sentences.english: I aim to instill in them the pleasure of giving.
sentences.chinese: 我的目的在于灌输给他们给予的乐趣。

name: instruct
trans: v. 指示，吩咐；教授，指导；聘请（律师），托办；通知；（法官向陪审团）建议，作说明

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

name: enlighten
trans: v. 阐明，指导；教导，启迪；<古>照耀，照亮（物体）

sentences.english: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

name: edify
trans: vt. 熏陶；启发；教诲

sentences.english: A sermon, especially one intended to edify a congregation on a practical matter and not intended to be a theological discourse.
sentences.chinese: 布道一次讲道，尤其是旨在于实际问题上启发会众，而不在于成为神学讲演。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the morality, intellect, etc, of, esp by instruction

name: lead
trans: v. 引领，带路；（与……）相连，相通；通向，通往；导致，造成；促使，使得；过（某种生活）；领先，居于首位；领导，指挥；开牌；对（证人）进行诱询；用水砣测深 n. 领先地位；超前量，领先的距离；范例，榜样；线索；主角；<英>（牵狗用的）皮带，链条；铅；子弹；<英>电线，导线；铅笔芯；导语；螺距，牙距；进入磨坊的人工水渠；冰原上的水道；（投球前跑垒员的）离垒；行间距；（报纸或电台的）要闻，头条

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

name: direct
trans: adj. 径直的，笔直的；坦率的；直射的；直接的，亲身的；正好的；直系的 v. 把……对准；管理，指导；给……指路；指引，引导；导演；指示，命令；交予，寄至 adv. 径直地，直达地；亲自，直接

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: conduct
trans: v. 实施，进行；指挥；带领，引导；举止，表现；传导 n. 行为，举止；经营方式，管理方法

sentences.english: The Senator’s conduct is being investigated by the Ethics Committee.
sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导
detailed_translations.english: to stand in front of a group of musicians or singers and direct their playing or singing

name: curriculum
trans: n. 课程

sentences.english: Languages are an essential part of the school curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 语言是学校课程中必不可少的部分。

sentences.english: curriculum planning
sentences.chinese: 课程安排

detailed_translations.english: the subjects that are taught by a school, college etc, or the things that are studied in a particular subject

name: discipline
trans: n. 纪律，风纪；惩罚，处分；训导，管教；训练，锻炼；自制力，自律能力；（尤指大学的）科目，学科 v. 惩罚，处分；训练，管教

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

name: compatible
trans: adj. 兼容的；可共存的；可和睦相处的；与……一致的 n. 兼容性计算机

sentences.english: The new software is IBM compatible (= can be used with IBM computers ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个新软件与IBM的计算机兼容。

detailed_translations.english: if two pieces of computer equipment are compatible, they can be used together, especially when they are made by different companies

name: boundary
trans: n. 分界线，边界；界限，范围；（板球）击球超过边界线得分

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: boundless
trans: adj. 无限的；无边无际的

sentences.english: boundless energy and enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 无限的精力和热情

detailed_translations.english: having no limit or end

name: endless
trans: adj. 无止境的，无穷尽的；永久的，无休止的；两端连接的，环状的

sentences.english: an endless stream of visitors
sentences.chinese: 川流不息的游客

sentences.english: The possibilities are endless.
sentences.chinese: 有无限的可能性。

sentences.english: He’s been in a lot of trouble – drugs, guns, blackmail – the list is endless.
sentences.chinese: 他麻烦太多了——毒品、枪支、敲诈——说都说不完。

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount, size, or number

name: cohesive
trans: adj. 团结的，有凝聚力的；使团结的，使凝聚的

sentences.english: a cohesive community
sentences.chinese: 团结的社区

detailed_translations.english: connected or related in a reasonable way to form a whole

name: horizontal
trans: adj. 水平的；（公司）同一层次的；统一的，一致的；地平线的，在地平线上的 n. 水平位置；水平线，水平面

sentences.english: a horizontal surface
sentences.chinese: 水平面

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平的；地平线的；同一阶层的
detailed_translations.english: flat and level

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平线，水平面；水平位置
detailed_translations.english: a horizontal line or surface

name: bulk
trans: n. 主体，大部分；庞大的身躯，肥硕的体形；（巨大的）容积，体积 adj. 大批的，大宗的 v. 使（产品）数量显得很大；结合（待售的股票或商品）

sentences.english: The bulk of consumers are based in towns.
sentences.chinese: 大多数消费者都是城镇居民。

sentences.english: The dough will rise until it is double in bulk.
sentences.chinese: 面团会发酵到原来的两倍大。

detailed_translations.english: the main or largest part of something

name: brim
trans: n. 帽檐，帽边；（容器的）口，边沿 v. （使）满，盛满；充满

sentences.english: an old straw hat with a broad brim
sentences.chinese: 一顶旧的宽边草帽

detailed_translations.english: the bottom part of a hat that sticks out to protect you from sun and rain
to have a lot of a particular thing, quality, or emotion

name: edge
trans: n. 边，边缘；锋，刃；优势；影响力，奇特的品质；（声音里的）尖锐，怒气；（坏事的）边缘，临界点；棱 v. 缓慢地移动；给……加边；险胜；用球拍边击球；倾斜滑雪；修剪（草地边缘）；使锐利，使尖锐

sentences.english: Put the eggs in the centre of the dish, with the vegetables and herbs around the edge.
sentences.chinese: 把鸡蛋放在盘子中间，盘边一圈放些蔬菜和香草。

sentences.english: He stood at the water’s edge staring across the lake.
sentences.chinese: 他站在水边，凝视着湖对面。

sentences.english: A leaf was on the ground, curling up at the edges.
sentences.chinese: 地上有一片叶子，叶边卷曲着。

sentences.english: a knife with a sharp edge
sentences.chinese: 刀刃锋利的小刀

detailed_translations.english: the part of an object that is furthest from its centre

name: rim
trans: n. （圆形物体的）边沿；（污垢等）一周，一圈；轮辋，轮圈；眼镜框；（篮球的）篮筐，篮圈 ；界，边界 v. 形成......的边沿，给......镶边

sentences.english: She looked at him over the rim of her glass.
sentences.chinese: 她沿玻璃杯口看着他。

detailed_translations.english: the outside edge of something circular
to be around the edge of something

name: brink
trans: n. 边缘

sentences.english: Their economy is teetering on the brink of collapse.
sentences.chinese: 他们的经济正摇摆于崩溃的边缘。

detailed_translations.english: a situation when you are almost in a new situation, usually a bad one

name: constituent
trans: n. 选民；成分，构成要素；委托人 adj. 组成的，构成的；选举的，有任命（或选举）权的；立宪的，有宪法制定（或修改）权的

sentences.english: the EU and its constituent members
sentences.chinese: 欧盟及其成员国

sentences.english: He told his constituents that he would continue to represent them to the best of his ability.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉他的选民们他会继续竭尽所能代表他们。

detailed_translations.english: being one of the parts of something
someone who votes in a particular area

name: dimension
trans: n. 大小，尺寸；（空间的）维度；范围，规模；方面，部分 v. 切削（或制作）成特定尺寸；标出尺寸

sentences.english: You can have a spiritual dimension to your life without being religious.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不信宗教，也可以在生命中拥有精神层面的内容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt标出尺寸
detailed_translations.english: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

name: elasticity
trans: n. 弹性，弹力；灵活性

sentences.english: the skin’s natural elasticity
sentences.chinese: 皮肤天生的弹性

detailed_translations.english: the ability of something to stretch and go back to its usual length or size

name: cohesion
trans: n. 凝聚力，团结；内聚力；（句子、文章等在语法或含义方面的）连贯，衔接

sentences.english: a sense of community and social cohesion
sentences.chinese: 社区意识和社会凝聚力

detailed_translations.chinese: 凝聚；结合；[力] 内聚力
detailed_translations.english: if there is cohesion among a group of people, a set of ideas etc, all the parts or members of it are connected or related in a reasonable way to form a whole

name: mechanics
trans: n. 机械学，力学；机制，运作方式；机械部件，运转部件；结构，构成

sentences.english: He has not studied mechanics or engineering.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学习过力学或者工程学。

detailed_translations.english: the part of physics that deals with the natural forces that act on moving or stationary objects

name: pressure
trans: n. 压力，挤压；（气体或液体形成的）压力，压强；心理压力，紧张；催促，要求；气压 v. 对……施加压力，强迫；使……增压

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力，地心引力；严重性；严肃，庄严；重（量）

sentences.english: the force of gravity
sentences.chinese: 重力

sentences.english: I could not hide from her the gravity of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。

detailed_translations.english: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

name: impetus
trans: n. 动力，促进；动量，冲力

sentences.english: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

detailed_translations.english: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

name: release
trans: v. 释放，放走；使出院；把（动物）放生；解救；放开；拉开，松开（装置）；发射，投（弹）；公布，发布；发行，上映；表达，发泄；释放，排放（物质）； 解除（职务或工作），解雇；放弃，让予；使不紧张；开放，解禁 n. （人或动物的）释放，放出；排放，泄漏；（设备的）松开，拉开；释放装置（如按、拉的装置）；表达，宣泄；解脱，轻松感；放松的机会；新发行的东西；公开，发布；公映；（责任等的）免除，解除；免责书；<法律> 放弃，让予；放弃文书；<美> 传球

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: decelerate
trans: vi. 减速，降低速度 vt. 使减速

sentences.english: ...the sensation of the train decelerating.
sentences.chinese: ... 火车减速的感觉。

detailed_translations.english: to go slower, especially in a vehicle

name: precipitate
trans: v. <正式>使……突然降临，加速（坏事的发生）；使突然陷入（某种状态）（precipitate sb./sth. into）；（使）沉淀，（使）淀析；<正式>使急落直下，使陡然下落；降水（如雨、雪、冰雹） adj. <正式>鲁莽的，仓促的（=precipitous）；（事件，情况）突如其来的，突然的；猛地落下的 n. 沉淀物，析出物

sentences.english: The riot was precipitated when four black men were arrested.
sentences.chinese: 这场骚乱是因为四名黑人男子的被捕而突然引发的。

sentences.english: I don't think we should make precipitate decisions.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们不应该做出仓促的决定。

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance that has been chemically separated from a liquid

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉淀；促成；猛抛；使陷入
detailed_translations.english: to make something serious happen suddenly or more quickly than was expected

detailed_translations.chinese: 突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的
detailed_translations.english: A precipitate action or decision happens or is made more quickly or suddenly than most people think is sensible

name: expedite
trans: v. 加速，促进（行为，过程）

sentences.english: strategies to expedite the decision-making process
sentences.chinese: 加快决策进程的策略

detailed_translations.english: to make a process or action happen more quickly

name: quiver
trans: n. （尤指突然的强烈情感所致的）颤抖，颤音；箭囊，箭袋；一组（长度、形状各异的）冲浪板 v. 颤抖，抖动；使颤抖，使抖动

sentences.english: The child was quivering in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 那孩子在她怀里发抖。

sentences.english: Her mouth quivered slightly as she turned away.
sentences.chinese: 她嘴唇微微哆嗦着，转过头去。

sentences.english: I recognized it instantly and felt a quiver of panic.
sentences.chinese: 我立刻认出它了，感到一阵惊恐的颤抖。

detailed_translations.english: to shake slightly because you are cold, or because you feel very afraid, angry, excited etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 颤抖， 抖动， 颤声
detailed_translations.english: Quiver is also a noun

name: jar
trans: n. 玻璃罐，广口瓶；一瓶，一罐（的量或物）；震动 v. 撞击，震动；刺激，对……产生不好的影响；不和谐，不相配；发出刺耳声

sentences.english: a jam jar
sentences.chinese: 果酱罐

sentences.english: half a jar of peanut butter
sentences.chinese: 半瓶花生酱

sentences.english: The ship jarred a little.
sentences.chinese: 船轻微震了一下。

sentences.english: The sudden movement jarred the box and it fell off the table.
sentences.chinese: 这突然一动震动了那个箱子，然后它从桌上掉了下去。

detailed_translations.english: a glass container with a wide top and a lid, used for storing food such as jam or honey, or the amount it contains

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲突；不一致；震惊；发刺耳声
detailed_translations.english: If an object jars, or if something jars it, the object moves with a fairly hard shaking movement

name: vibration
trans: n. 震动，颤动，抖动；<非正式>（情感）感应，共鸣

sentences.english: the vibrations from the earthquake
sentences.chinese: 地震引起的震动

sentences.english: The microscope must be free from vibration.
sentences.chinese: 显微镜一定要避免震动。

detailed_translations.english: a continuous slight shaking movement

name: discharge
trans: v. 释放，允许……离开；解雇；使退伍；（使）流出，（使）排出；开火，发射；放（电）；履行（职责），清偿（债务）；（法官，法庭）撤销（法院命令）；卸（货），让……下车 n. 允许出院，释放；任务的执行，债务的偿还；解雇；退伍；（法庭命令的）撤销；放电；排出物，分泌物；（物质的）放出，排出；射击，开火；（仪器、雷暴等释放出来的）电

sentences.english: Sewage is discharged directly into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 污水被直接排放到海里。

sentences.english: the discharge of toxic waste into the sea
sentences.chinese: 有毒废物向海里的排放

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, liquid, smoke etc, or to allow it to escape
when gas, liquid, smoke etc is sent out, or the substance that is sent out

name: shrink
trans: v. （使）缩小，减少；（通常指布料、衣服等洗后）缩水，皱缩；退缩，畏缩；畏避，回避（工作、责任等） n. <非正式> 精神病学家，心理学家；收缩；畏缩

sentences.english: I’m worried about washing that shirt in case it shrinks.
sentences.chinese: 我不太敢洗那件衬衫，怕它会缩水。

detailed_translations.chinese: 起皱； 收缩； 退缩， 畏缩
detailed_translations.english: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

name: diffuse
trans: v. 扩散，弥漫；减弱，平息（不良情绪或局面）；传播，散布 adj. 扩散的，弥漫的；难解的，冗长的

sentences.english: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
sentences.chinese: 污染物渗进了土壤。

sentences.english: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

sentences.english: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他写的东西冗长难懂。

detailed_translations.english: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this
using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly

name: emit
trans: v. 排放，散发（尤指气体、辐射物）；发出（声音或噪音）；发行，发表

sentences.english: The kettle emitted a shrill whistle.
sentences.chinese: 水壶发出了刺耳的鸣笛声。

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

name: transpire
trans: vi. 发生；蒸发；泄露 vt. 使蒸发；使排出

sentences.english: It now transpires that he kept all the money for himself.
sentences.chinese: 事实已经清楚，他把所有的钱都据为己有了。

detailed_translations.english: if it transpires that something is true, you discover that it is true

name: constitute
trans: v. 组成，构成；是，被视为；成立，设立；任命

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.english: to be the parts that together form sth

name: eject
trans: v. 驱逐，赶出；喷射，排出；（飞行员从即将坠毁的飞机中）弹出；（磁带或光盘）弹出

sentences.english: The demonstrators were ejected from the hall.
sentences.chinese: 示威者被赶出大厅。

sentences.english: Two engines cut out and the plane started to eject fuel as it lost height.
sentences.chinese: 两个发动机突然熄火，飞机在下降的同时开始喷出燃料。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone leave a place or building by using force

name: radiate
trans: v. （使品质或情感）显出，流露；辐射，发射；自中心辐射出，向周围伸展；（动物或植物群）辐射形进化 adj. <罕>辐射（状）的，光芒四射的

sentences.english: He radiated calm confidence.
sentences.chinese: 他身上散发着沉稳自信的气质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播
detailed_translations.english: if someone radiates a feeling, or if it radiates from them, it is very easy to see that this is how they feel

name: molecule
trans: n. 分子，摩尔；少量，一点儿；微小颗粒，微粒

sentences.english: The molecules of oxygen gas contain just two atoms.
sentences.chinese: 氧分子中只有两个原子。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest unit into which any substance can be divided without losing its own chemical nature, usually consisting of two or more atoms

name: ion
trans: n. 离子 n. (Ion) （罗马尼亚、美）扬（人名）

sentences.english: These vibrations turn the ion into a sort of superfast metronome.
sentences.chinese: 铝离子因为这些振动成为一种超高速节拍器。

sentences.english: The ion channel was the missing circuit element I was looking for, and it already existed in nature.
sentences.chinese: 这种离子通道是我正在寻找的缺失的电路元件，而且它的确在自然界中存在。

detailed_translations.english: an atom which has been given a positive or negative force by adding or taking away an  electron

name: electron
trans: n. 电子

sentences.english: Most things are balanced - with equal numbers of electrons and protons.
sentences.chinese: 大部分物体都是电荷平衡的——含等量的电子和质子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge that moves around the nucleus of an atom

name: neutron
trans: n. 中子

sentences.english: Each atomic cluster is made up of neutrons and protons.
sentences.chinese: 每个原子团簇是由中子和质子组成的。

detailed_translations.english: a part of an atom that has no electrical charge

name: nucleus
trans: n. 原子核；细胞核；核心，中心；神经核；（彗星的）核

sentences.english: Neutrons and protons are bound together in the nucleus of an atom.
sentences.chinese: 在一个原子的核内，中子和质子聚合在一起。

sentences.english: the nucleus of an effective team
sentences.chinese: 高效团队的核心

detailed_translations.english: the central part of an atom, made up of neutrons, protons, and other elementary particles

name: proton
trans: n. [物]质子 n. （Proton）人名；（法）普罗东

sentences.english: So we get at the number of neutrons indirectly because we know the proton number here.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我们可以间接得到中子数,因为我们知道质子数了。

sentences.english: When a neutron inside an atom decays, it produces a proton, an electron, and a neutrino.
sentences.chinese: 原子内的一个中子衰变后会产生一个质子、一个电子和一个中微子。

sentences.english: Hydrogen, the most common molecule in the universe, is just two atoms—each with one proton and one electron.
sentences.chinese: 是宇宙中最普通的分子，仅有两个原子构成，每个原子仅包含一个质子和一个电子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of matter with a positive electrical  charge  that is in the central part of an atom

name: atom
trans: n. 原子；微量，极小量

sentences.english: carbon atoms
sentences.chinese: 碳原子

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of an  element  that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a  molecule

name: nuclear
trans: adj. 核子的，原子核的；核武器的；原子能的，核能的；核心的，中心的；细胞核的，构成细胞核的

sentences.english: France’s reliance on nuclear energy
sentences.chinese: 法国对核能的依赖

sentences.english: a nuclear power station
sentences.chinese: 核电站

sentences.english: a nuclear-powered submarine
sentences.chinese: 核动力潜艇

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the nucleus of an atom, or the energy produced when the nucleus of an atom is either split or joined with the nucleus of another atom

name: physics
trans: n. 物理学；物理特性，物理现象

sentences.english: ...the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: …物理学定律。

detailed_translations.english: the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

name: fusion
trans: n. 融合，结合；核聚变；混合音乐；融合菜肴；熔化；融合物

sentences.english: Her work is a fusion of several different styles.
sentences.chinese: 她的作品是几种不同风格的融合。

sentences.english: the best fusion cuisine in the whole of Vancouver
sentences.chinese: 全温哥华最好的混合料理

detailed_translations.chinese: 融合；熔化；熔接；融合物；[物] 核聚变
detailed_translations.english: a combination of separate qualities or ideas

name: thermometer
trans: n. 温度计，寒暑表，体温计

sentences.english: The thermometer registered over 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 温度计显示高于100摄氏度。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that measures the temperature of the air, of your body etc

name: temperature
trans: n. 温度，气温；体温；发烧；热烈程度，情绪激烈程度

sentences.english: The temperature of the water was just right for swimming.
sentences.chinese: 这水温游泳正好。

sentences.english: Water boils at a temperature of 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 水在100摄氏度沸腾。

sentences.english: The nurse took (= measured ) my temperature .
sentences.chinese: 护士给我量了体温。

detailed_translations.english: a measure of how hot or cold a place or thing is

name: thaw
trans: v. （使）（冰雪）融化；（使）（冷冻食品）解冻；使（身体等）变得暖起来；变得友好，变得缓和 n. 解冻时期，融化季节；（敌对国家之间）关系缓和

sentences.english: The lake thawed in March.
sentences.chinese: 3月里，湖水解冻了。

detailed_translations.english: if ice or snow thaws, or if the sun thaws it, it turns into water
a period of warm weather during which snow and ice melt

name: centigrade
trans: n. 摄氏温度 adj. 摄氏度的

sentences.english: ...daytime temperatures of up to forty degrees centigrade.
sentences.chinese: …高达40摄氏度的日间气温。

sentences.english: The number at the bottom is the recommended water temperature in centigrade.
sentences.chinese: 底部的数字为建议性摄氏度水温。

detailed_translations.english: Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.
Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.

name: clot
trans: n. 凝块，黏团（尤指血块）；（非正式）笨蛋，傻瓜 v. （使）凝结成块；覆以粘性物质 n. （Clot）（法、美）克洛（人名）

sentences.english: The patient's blood refused to clot.
sentences.chinese: 病人的血液无法凝结。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid such as blood or milk clots, or if something clots it, it becomes thicker and more solid
a thick almost solid mass formed when blood or milk dries

name: sublimate
trans: v. 使升华，使高尚；纯化 n. 升华物 adj. 纯净化的；高尚的

sentences.english: He could try to sublimate the problem by writing, in detail, about it.
sentences.chinese: 他可以通过详细记述而尝试使人们正视该问题。

detailed_translations.english: to use the energy that comes from sexual feelings to do something, such as work or art, that is more acceptable to your society

name: distillation
trans: n. 精馏，蒸馏，净化；蒸馏法；精华，蒸馏物

sentences.english: He tried to obtain another material by distillation.
sentences.chinese: 他试图通过蒸馏法获得另一种物质。

sentences.english: Also, in traditional black forest cakes, kirsch, which is a clear colorless fruit brandy which is made from double distillation of morellos is added.
sentences.chinese: 此外，传统的黑森林蛋糕中还会加入樱桃酒，这是一种清澈无色的水果白兰地，由欧洲酸樱桃经两次蒸馏后制成。

sentences.english: When carvone begins to distill, the condensation can be seen inside the thermometer adapter, thus the progress of carvone distillation can be readily monitored.
sentences.chinese: 当香芹酮开始蒸馏时，在温度计转接器内可看到有冷凝，因此能够容易地监察香芹酮的蒸馏过程。

name: chaos
trans: n. 混乱，无秩序状态；混沌

sentences.english: The country was plunged into economic chaos.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家陷入了经济大混乱。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

name: clutter
trans: n. 杂乱的东西；杂乱 v. 乱堆，塞满；使（脑子里）塞满（乱七八糟的事）

sentences.english: Could you get rid of some of that clutter in your bedroom?
sentences.chinese: 你能把你卧室那些杂物清理掉一些吗？

detailed_translations.english: a large number of things that are scattered somewhere in an untidy way
to cover or fill a space or room with too many things, so that it looks very untidy

name: equilibrium
trans: n. 平衡，均衡；（心情的）平静，心理平衡；（经济）（供求的）平衡；（化）平衡；能量均分

sentences.english: The government is anxious not to upset the economic equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 政府急切希望不要打乱经济平衡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 均衡；平静；保持平衡的能力
detailed_translations.english: a balance between different people, groups, or forces that compete with each other, so that none is stronger than the others and a situation is not likely to change suddenly

name: density
trans: n. 稠密，密集；密度

sentences.english: areas of high population density
sentences.chinese: 人口密度高的地区

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which an area is filled with people or things

name: liquid
trans: n. 液体，液态物；流音 adj. 液态的，液化的；（资金等）流动的，易变为现金的；流畅自如的，舒展的；明亮的，清澈的；清脆的，流畅的；（市场）活跃的；液态的，液化的;（资金等）流动的，易变为现金的

sentences.english: Add a little more liquid to the sauce.
sentences.chinese: 在酱汁中再加一点水。

sentences.english: Children take antibiotics in liquid form.
sentences.chinese: 儿童服用液态抗生素。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk
in the form of a liquid instead of a gas or solid

name: dilute
trans: v. 稀释，冲淡；削弱，降低；稀释股权；使（颜色）变淡，褪（色）；以一定比例的非熟练工替代（熟练工） adj. 稀释了的，冲淡了的；减弱了的，淡化了的；（颜色）褪了的

sentences.english: dilute hydrochloric acid
sentences.chinese: 稀盐酸

detailed_translations.english: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid
to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

name: dehydrate
trans: vt. 使……脱水；使极其口渴；使丧失力量和兴趣等 vi. 脱水；去水

sentences.english: The substance is dehydrated and stored as powder.
sentences.chinese: 该物质经脱水处理后以粉末形式储存。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…脱水；使极其口渴；使丧失力量和兴趣等
detailed_translations.english: to remove the liquid from a substance such as food or a chemical

name: declivity
trans: n. 下坡；倾斜

name: foam
trans: n. 泡沫，气泡；泡沫橡胶，海绵橡胶；泡沫剂，泡沫产品；唾液，汗沫 v. 起泡沫，有泡沫

sentences.english: a foam mattress
sentences.chinese: 海绵橡胶床垫

detailed_translations.english: a type of soft rubber with a lot of air in it, used in furniture

detailed_translations.english: to produce foam

name: ventilation
trans: n. 通风，通风系统；（医）（尤指人工）给肺提供空气；（对意见、问题、抱怨等的）公开讨论（或调查）

sentences.english: I see no ventilation to speak of, none from a window or a ventilator at least.
sentences.chinese: 我看不到通风设备，连窗户或至少一个通风扇也没有。

sentences.english: There is not a single pane of glass anywhere around the site, and the only mechanical ventilation installed is in the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 基地内的任何地方都没有单一的玻璃窗格，而且唯一的机械通风设备安装在了画廊中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通风设备； 空气流通

name: evaporate
trans: v. （使）蒸发，挥发；消失，消散

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: evaporation
trans: n. 蒸发

sentences.english: Water enters air via evaporation.
sentences.chinese: 水通过蒸发进入空气。

sentences.english: Because it is located in a very hot and dry region, the Dead Sea loses much water through evaporation, causing its level to fluctuate during the year.
sentences.chinese: 因为它处于一个非常炎热和干燥的地区，死海由于蒸发损失掉大量的水，导致其水平面一年到头不断波动。

sentences.english: There has not been much change in rainfall in those areas but the temperature has risen by over 1 degree Centigrade since 1970, which will have enhanced losses due to evaporation.
sentences.chinese: 那些地区的降雨量没有太大变化，但是自1970年以来上升的气温已经超过了1摄氏度，由于蒸发这将会造成水分的更大流失。

name: thermodynamics
trans: n. 热力学

sentences.english: But we know thermodynamics is all about equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 但我们知道热力学都是关于平衡的。

sentences.english: And we went through that and saw what the thermodynamics worked out to be.
sentences.chinese: 我们算出了他们,并看到了它们的热力学应该是怎样的。

sentences.english: And so we can immediately start in deriving all of the thermodynamics, right?
sentences.chinese: 这样我们可以马上开始,得到所有热力学的量对吧？

detailed_translations.english: the science that deals with the relationship between heat and other forms of energy

name: friction
trans: n. 不和，分歧；摩擦；摩擦力

sentences.english: Check your rope frequently, as friction against the rock can wear it away.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查绳索，因为与岩石摩擦会使它磨损。

detailed_translations.english: when one surface rubs against another

name: attrition
trans: n. 摩擦；磨损；消耗

sentences.english: a war of attrition
sentences.chinese: 消耗战

detailed_translations.english: the process of gradually destroying your enemy or making them weak by attacking them continuously

name: chafe
trans: vt. 擦破；擦热；擦痛；激怒 vi. 擦伤；磨擦；激怒 n. 擦伤；气恼 n. （Chafe）人名；（尼日利）沙费；（英）蔡菲

sentences.english: My shorts were chafing my thighs.
sentences.chinese: 我的短裤蹭得我大腿疼。

detailed_translations.english: to rub part of your body to make it warm

name: resonance
trans: n. （声音的）深沉，洪亮；（情感的）共鸣，反响；（物理）共鸣，共振；（电路或设备）谐振；（天文）共振；（化）中介（现象）；（物理）共振态

sentences.english: a tradition that has little resonance in the 21st century
sentences.chinese: 在21世纪难以引起共鸣的传统

sentences.english: His words will have resonance for many musicians.
sentences.chinese: 他的话将在很多音乐家心里产生共鸣。

detailed_translations.english: the special meaning or importance that something has for you because it relates to your own experiences

name: echo
trans: n. 回声，回音，余音绕梁；重复，附和，共鸣；相似之处，再现；回声插入；（话语结构和内容的）重复；（桥牌）回声信号 v. 回响，发出回声；重复，附和

sentences.english: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

sentences.english: ‘He's gone! ’ Viv echoed.
sentences.chinese: “他去了！”维夫重复道。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
to repeat what someone else has just said

name: ultrasonics
trans: n. 超声波学，超声学

name: sonar
trans: n. 声呐；声波定位仪（等于asdic） n. （Sonar）人名；（土）索纳尔

sentences.english: What good is a ship armed to the teeth if its radar and sonar are substandard?
sentences.chinese: 如果一艘武装到牙齿的舰船其雷达和声纳是不合格的，那能好到哪里？

sentences.english: In his work to develop radar, sonar and ultrasound he performed all the necessary tests and provided all the proofs required.
sentences.chinese: 在雷达、声纳和超声的开发工作中，他进行了所有的必要测试，并提供了所需的一切论证。

sentences.english: However, a spokesman for the Ministry of Defence said: 'The Royal Navy can confirm that they were not in the area using sonar and have not been for some time.
sentences.chinese: 英国国防部的一位发言人表示：“皇家海军能证明他们并没有在这一海域使用声纳，而且他们在这片水域逗留的时间也不长。

detailed_translations.english: equipment on a ship or  submarine  that uses  sound waves  to find out the position of objects under the water

name: band
trans: n. 乐队；一伙，一群；范围，段；带，箍；带状物，条纹；波段，频带；戒指 v. 给……分级，把……分段；用带绑扎；加彩条

sentences.english: The band was playing old Beatles songs.
sentences.chinese: 乐队正在演奏披头士的老歌。

sentences.english: I grew up playing in rock bands.
sentences.chinese: 我是在摇滚乐队里玩音乐长大的。

sentences.english: Smith joined the band in 1989.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯在1989年加入这个乐队。

sentences.english: They formed a band when they were still at school.
sentences.chinese: 他们还在读书的时候就组建了一个乐队。

sentences.english: The entertainment includes a disco and live band .
sentences.chinese: 娱乐活动有跳迪斯科和乐队现场演奏。

sentences.english: interviews with band members

detailed_translations.english: a group of musicians, especially a group that plays popular music

name: charge
trans: v. 充电；使……承担责任，赋予……责任；控告，指控；（公开）指责，责备；进攻，冲锋；把……记在账上；要价，收费（金额）；<旧>给（枪炮）装弹；斟满（杯子） n. 电量，电荷；炸药量；掌管，照管；费用，价钱；控告，指控；（书面或口头的）指责，批评；需要照管的人；命令，指示；（人或动物的）猛攻，冲锋；<美，非正式>快感，刺激；感召力，感染力；负载

sentences.english: Leave the battery on charge all night.
sentences.chinese: 让电池充一晚上的电

sentences.english: Please charge your glasses and drink a toast to the bride and groom!
sentences.chinese: 请各位斟满酒杯向新娘、新郎敬酒！

to fill a glass

name: electricity
trans: n. 电，电流，电力；强烈感情

sentences.english: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

trans: n. 电磁体，[电] 电磁铁；电磁石

sentences.english: Lifting electromagnet is a kind of lifting gear.
sentences.chinese: 起重电磁铁是起重工具的一种。

sentences.english: Is the key to control the hydraulic part, this system is through PLC control electromagnet of solenoid valve, to achieve control of the manipulator's action.
sentences.chinese: 液压部分是控制的关键所在，本系统是通过PLC控制电磁阀的电磁铁，从而实现对机械手各动作的控制。

sentences.english: Metallurgical hoist, electric hoist, chain hoist, chain hoists, trolleys, grab, electric flat car, lifting electromagnet, hand hoist, sling, Jack, hoist, bearing.
sentences.chinese: 电动葫芦，冶金葫芦，环链葫芦，手拉葫芦，单轨小车，抓斗，电动平车，起重电磁铁，手扳葫芦，吊索具，千斤顶，卷扬机，轴承。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of metal that becomes magnetic(= able to attract metal objects ) when an electric current is turned on

name: electromagnetism
trans: n. 电磁；电磁学

name: electronic
trans: adj. 电子的，电子学的

sentences.english: electronic games

trans: n. 电子学；电子设备，电子器件

sentences.chinese: 电子工程师

trans: n. 放大器，扬声器；（电子吉他等乐器）扩音器

sentences.english: We can use them as an amplifier.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以将其当作放大器。

sentences.english: The audio interface must support your amplifier and speaker setup.
sentences.chinese: 音频接口必须支持您的扩音器和扬声器设置。

sentences.english: I was not just one college kid, I was an amplifier for him throughout the whole computer science department.
sentences.chinese: 我不仅是一个大学生，我同时也是那个可以帮他在整个计算机系中发声的扩音器。

sentences.chinese: 你得把顶盖拿掉才能更换电池。

sentences.english: When the red light comes on, you should recharge the battery .
sentences.chinese: 红灯亮起的时候你就应该给电池充电了。

detailed_translations.english: an object that provides a supply of electricity for something such as a radio, car, or toy

trans: n. 炸薯条，炸薯片；芯片；碎块，碎屑；缺口，豁口；筹码；撮球，切球；木条 v. 打破，弄缺；（尤指用工具）削下，凿下；切成细条；撮球，挑球

sentences.english: the age of the silicon chip
sentences.chinese: 芯片时代

sentences.english: chip technology
sentences.chinese: 芯片技术

detailed_translations.chinese: 屑片， 碎片； 炸土豆条； 集成电路片， 集成块； 缺口， 瑕疵
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of  silicon  that has a set of complicated electrical connections on it and is used to store and  process  information in computers

name: conductor
trans: n. （乐队等的）指挥；售票员，检票员；导体；<英>传导教育的引导者

sentences.english: He showed his ticket to the conductor and got on.
sentences.chinese: 他向检票员出示了车票，然后上了车。

sentences.english: The conductor's eyes darted to Wilfred, then fixed on Michael again.
sentences.chinese: 乐队指挥飞快地扫了威尔弗雷德一眼，然后视线又落回到迈克尔身上。

sentences.chinese: 木材是很好的绝缘体。

name: magnet
trans: n. 磁体，磁铁；有吸引力的人（或地方、事物）

sentences.english: It's possible to hang a nail from a magnet and then use that nail to pick up another nail.
sentences.chinese: 把一颗钉子挂在一个磁体上再用这颗钉子去吸起另一颗钉子是可能的。

sentences.english: ...his research in electricity and magnetism.
sentences.chinese: …他在电、磁领域的研究。

sentences.chinese: 他的个人魅力

name: semiconductor
trans: n. 半导体；半导体装置

sentences.english: In semiconductor receivers transistors take the place of vacuum tubes.
sentences.chinese: 在半导体收音机中晶体管代替了真空管。

sentences.english: What was happening was this: in its pure state of repeating units of one titanium and two oxygen atoms, titanium dioxide is a semiconductor.
sentences.chinese: 发生的事是这样的：在纯净的一个钛和两个氧原子组成的重复单位下，二氧化钛是一种半导体。

sentences.english: They can then be printed onto a roll of metal foil that becomes a continuous semiconductor.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们可以把这种墨水印刷在一卷金属箔上，从而制成连续的半导体。

name: transistor
trans: n. 晶体管；晶体管收音机（transistor radio）

sentences.english: Every transistor has at least three electrodes.
sentences.chinese: 每个晶体管至少有三个电极。

sentences.english: The transistor became the basis of a new invention called the "computer" which I suspect those of you reading this may be familiar with.
sentences.chinese: 晶体管后来成为了一项叫做“计算机”的新发明的基础，我想正在阅读本文的你对于这个应该比较熟悉吧。

sentences.english: When you got a transistor radio, you could walk around with it, and today you can put your whole record collection in your pocket.
sentences.chinese: 而当你使用晶体管收音机时，你可以带着它到处走动，时至今日你可以把你收集的唱片装进口袋里。

name: ultraviolet
trans: adj. 紫外的，紫外线的；（设备，技术）产生紫外线的 n. 紫外光，紫外辐射

sentences.english: Ozone in the stratosphere is important because it absorbs some of the Sun’s dangerous ultraviolet radiation.
sentences.chinese: 在平流层的臭氧是重要的，因为它吸收了一些太阳中危险的紫外线辐射。

sentences.english: Birds perceive the world differently tohumans, being able to see light in the ultraviolet range of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 鸟类感知世界的方式和人类不同，他们能够在紫外线光谱范围内看见光线。

sentences.english: But it also says there is no evidence to support disinfecting toothbrushes in the microwave or with ultraviolet devices on the market.
sentences.chinese: 但它也说，没有证据支持在微波炉或市面上销售的紫外线设备中对牙刷消毒。

detailed_translations.english: ultraviolet light cannot be seen by people, but is responsible for making your skin darker when you are in the sun

name: microwave
trans: n. 微波炉；微波 v. 用微波炉烹调（或加热）

sentences.english: Its molecules can be agitated by microwave energy.
sentences.chinese: 微波能量可以使其分子随之运动。

sentences.chinese: 他没有学习过力学或者工程学。

sentences.chinese: 牛顿万有引力定律

detailed_translations.chinese: 重力；万有引力；地心吸力

name: relativity
trans: n. （物理）相对论；相对性

sentences.english: They teach the relativity of all ethical ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他们宣扬一切道德观念的相对性。

sentences.english: Einstein put forward his new theory of relativity.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦提出了相对论的新学说。

sentences.english: Everyone was talking about relativity, not only the scientists, but the philosophers and the writers of columns in the newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都在谈论相对论，不仅仅是科学家，甚至哲学家和报纸的专栏作者也是如此。

sentences.english: the velocity of light
sentences.chinese: 光速

sentences.english: The speedboat reached a velocity of 120 mph.
sentences.chinese: 快艇的时速达到了120英里。

sentences.english: a high velocity bullet
sentences.chinese: 高速子弹

detailed_translations.english: the speed of something that is moving in a particular direction

sentences.english: And our goal is to find out the time, the dynamics of this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目的是找出时间，找出这个问题的动力学。

sentences.english: We know the dynamics of outsourcing.
sentences.chinese: 我们了解外包的动力。

sentences.english: Both are believed to have important roles in sea ice dynamics, but how important they are remains unclear.
sentences.chinese: 认为这两者在海冰动力学方面都有重要的作用，但是他们尚不清楚是多么重要。

detailed_translations.english: the branch of mechanics concerned with the forces that change or produce the motions of bodies

name: force
trans: n. 暴力，武力；力，力量；自然力；（有某目的）一群人；有影响力的人（或事）；影响力；武装部队；警察部门；风力 v. 强迫；用力推；使发生；勉强做出

sentences.english: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.english: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.chinese: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.english: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.chinese: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

detailed_translations.chinese: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
detailed_translations.english: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

name: current
trans: adj. 现行的，当前的；通用的，流行的；最近的 n. 水流，气流；电流；思潮，趋势

sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率的加快

trans: n. 意识形态，思想体系；<古>观念学；<古>空想

sentences.english: the ideologies of fascism and terrorism
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主义和恐怖主义的意识形态

sentences.english: a new ideology based on individualism
sentences.chinese: 基于个人主义的新思想体系

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave

name: parade
trans: n. 游行；列队表演，展示；检阅，阅兵；阅兵场；一系列（人或事）；夸示，炫耀；<英>（用于街道名称中）商业街，公共广场；<英>（常指远离大街的）一小排店铺 v. 游行；（使）列队行进，接受检阅；招摇过市，大摇大摆；把（囚犯）示众；展示，展览；夸示，炫耀（财产、知识等）；（使）冒充，伪装

sentences.english: a victory parade
sentences.chinese: 胜利游行

sentences.english: the St Patrick’s Day parade
sentences.chinese: 圣帕特里克节庆祝游行

sentences.english: a military parade
sentences.chinese: 军事检阅

sentences.english: The marchers paraded peacefully through the capital.
sentences.chinese: 游行队伍有秩序地列队穿过首都。

detailed_translations.english: a public celebration when musical bands, brightly decorated vehicles etc move down the street
to walk or march together to celebrate or protest about something

name: govern
trans: v. 统治，管理；控制，影响；（语法）支配；可用来裁定（某案例）

sentences.english: the leaders who govern the country
sentences.chinese: 治理这个国家的领导人

sentences.english: The party had been governing for seven months.
sentences.chinese: 该党执政已经有七个月了。

sentences.english: The universe is governed by the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙受到物理法则的支配。

detailed_translations.english: to officially and legally control a country and make all the decisions about taxes, laws, public services etc

name: confer
trans: v. 授予，赋予；商讨，交换意见

sentences.english: He conferred with Hill and the others in his office.
sentences.chinese: 他和希尔以及他办公室里的其他人进行了商议。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something with other people, so that everyone can express their opinions and decide on something
to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved

name: entitle
trans: v. 给予（某人）权利，给（某人）资格；给......命名，给......题名

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

name: exploit
trans: v. 剥削，压榨；利用（……为自己谋利）；运用，发挥；开发，开拓 n. 英勇事迹，壮举；大胆的表演，不凡的身手

sentences.english: the urgent need to exploit the resources of the Irish Sea
sentences.chinese: 开发爱尔兰海资源的迫切需要

detailed_translations.english: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

name: maneuver
trans: n. 细致巧妙的移动，机动动作；策略，手段；军事演习；（军队或船只的）调动，部署 v. 巧妙地移动；操纵，使花招；部署（军队、船只等）；演习

sentences.english: The chopper shot upward in a manoeuver matched by the other pilot.
sentences.chinese: 这架直升飞机向上冲去，另一架飞机也以相同的移动方向冲了上去。

sentences.english: The president has tried to manoeuver the campaign away from himself.
sentences.chinese: 总统试图操控该活动，使其远离自身。

sentences.english: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.chinese: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。

detailed_translations.english: a skilful or careful movement that you make, for example in order to avoid something or go through a narrow space
to move or turn skilfully or to move or turn something skilfully, especially something large and heavy

name: reform
trans: v. 改革，革新；改邪归正，改造；（石油炼制）重整 n. 改革，改良 adj. 犹太教改革（仅保留犹太教部分的传统信条和习俗）（Reform）

sentences.english: plans to radically reform the tax system
sentences.chinese: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 改革， 改良， 改造； 改正， 改过自新
detailed_translations.english: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way

name: inspect
trans: v. 检查，审视；检阅，视察；进行检查，进行视察

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

name: emigrate
trans: v. 移居外国，移民；迫使（或帮助）……移居外国

sentences.english: He emigrated to Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 他移民去了比利时。

detailed_translations.english: to leave your own country in order to live in another country

name: immigrate
trans: v. （从外地）移居，移民；使移居入境

sentences.english: His father and mother immigrated when he was two.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母在他两岁时移民到这里。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a country in order to live there permanently

name: exile
trans: n. 流放；被流放者，流亡者 v. 流放；使离开

sentences.english: the exiled former president
sentences.chinese: 流亡国外的前总统

sentences.english: political exiles
sentences.chinese: 政治流亡者

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to leave their country, especially for political reasons
a person who is forced to live away from his or her own country

name: enslave
trans: vt. 束缚；征服；使某人成为奴隶

sentences.english: She seemed enslaved by hatred.
sentences.chinese: 她似乎被仇恨所左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 束缚；征服；使某人成为奴隶
detailed_translations.english: to make someone a slave

name: hustle
trans: v. 推搡，硬挤；拼命干活；急速前进，奔忙；催促（某人）；<非正式>（常指非法地）兜售，取得；<美，非正式>拉客，卖淫 n. 忙碌，熙熙攘攘；<美，非正式>欺诈行为；<美>卖力，努力

sentences.english: The guards hustled Harry out of the car.
sentences.chinese: 卫兵们把哈里从车子里拉了出来。

detailed_translations.english: If you hustle someone, you try to make them go somewhere or do something quickly, for example by pulling or pushing them along
busy and noisy activity

name: impel
trans: v. 推动，驱使

sentences.english: ...the courage and competitiveness which impels him to take risks.
sentences.chinese: ...驱策他冒险的勇气和竞争精神。

detailed_translations.english: if something impels you to do something, it makes you feel very strongly that you must do it

name: oust
trans: vt. 罢免，撤职；淘汰；驱逐；取代；撤销（法院对某事的司法权）；<法律>剥夺

sentences.english: The leaders have been ousted from power by nationalists.
sentences.chinese: 那些领导人已被民族主义者赶下了台。

sentences.english: The Republicans may oust him in November.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人可能在11月罢免他。

detailed_translations.english: If someone is ousted from a position of power, job, or place, they are forced to leave it

name: banish
trans: v. 驱逐，赶走；将……驱逐出境，流放；清除，消除；打消……的念头，驱除（想法）

sentences.english: John was banished from England.
sentences.chinese: 约翰被逐出英国。

detailed_translations.english: to not allow someone or something to stay in a particular place

name: deport
trans: v. 驱逐（非本国居民）出境

sentences.english: ...a government decision earlier this month to deport all illegal immigrants.
sentences.chinese: …本月早些时候政府一项驱逐所有非法移民的决定。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone leave a country and return to the country they came from, especially because they do not have a legal right to stay

name: enable
trans: v. 使能够，使可能；激活，启动；准许，授权

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: reign
trans: n. （君主）在位时期，统治时期；领导期，任期；支配期，极盛期；（运动员或运动队）持有指明荣誉头衔的时期 v. 为王，统治；支配，盛行；成为最佳，成为最重要的

sentences.english: Last night confusion reigned about how the debate, which continues today, would end.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，这场在今天继续进行的辩论将如何结束的问题令人困惑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 当政， 统治； 占主导地位
detailed_translations.english: If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主的统治，君主的统治时期
detailed_translations.english: the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

name: dominate
trans: v. 统治，支配；在……中占首要地位；俯视，高耸于；占绝对优势

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

name: abdicate
trans: v. 退位；放弃（责任），失（职）；放弃

sentences.english: King Alfonso XIII abdicated in favour of his eldest son.
sentences.chinese: 国王阿方索十三世把王位让给了长子。

sentences.english: The king was forced to abdicate the throne .
sentences.chinese: 国王被迫退位。

detailed_translations.english: to give up the position of being king or queen

name: administer
trans: v. 管理，治理；执行，实施；给予（药物或治疗）；给予帮助，关心照顾（某人）；主持（仪式等）；<正式>踢，打；执行遗产管理人的职责

sentences.english: The money will be administered by local charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将由当地慈善机构管理。

sentences.english: Our office administers the affairs of the Society.
sentences.chinese: 我们办公室管理协会的事务。

detailed_translations.english: to manage the work or money of a company or organization

name: administration
trans: n. 管理，行政；管理部门，行政部门；（某一任期的）政府；执行，监管；（药的）服用，配给；遗产管理，（债务人、其他个人或破产公司的）资产管理

sentences.english: We’re looking for someone with experience in administration.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在寻找一个有管理经验的人。

sentences.english: The health service spends too much on administration.
sentences.chinese: 医疗服务部门在行政方面花费太多。

detailed_translations.english: the activities that are involved in managing the work of a company or organization

name: institute
trans: n. 研究所，学院，协会；（尤指与法律相关的）注释，论述 v. 制定（制度、规则等）；提出（诉讼）；任命，授予……职位（尤指圣职）

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: amendment
trans: n. 修正，修订之处；美国宪法修正案（Amendment）；（土壤结构或肥力的）改善；（对文件或计划的）修改

sentences.english: constitutional amendments
sentences.chinese: 宪法修正案

detailed_translations.english: a small change, improvement, or addition that is made to a law or document, or the process of doing this

name: colonize
trans: v. 在……开拓殖民地，移民于殖民地；将（场所，产业）据为己用；移植于，大批繁殖于；<美>从他地非法把选民移入

sentences.english: a dead tree that has been colonized by ants
sentences.chinese: 被蚂蚁占据的一棵死树

detailed_translations.chinese: 将…开拓为殖民地；移于殖民地；从他地非法把选民移入
detailed_translations.english: to establish political control over an area or over another country, and send your citizens there to settle

name: check
trans: v. 检查，核对；查看，查询；克制，抑制；存放，寄放；托运；在……上打钩；将（对方的）军 n. 检查，核对；制止（手段），抑制（手段）；结账单；支票（=cheque）；方格图案；衣帽寄存处；寄存凭证；钩号；（国际象棋）将军

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: monarchy
trans: n. 君主国；君主政体，君主制；皇室，王族

sentences.english: the abolition of the monarchy
sentences.chinese: 君主制的废除

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主政体；君主国；君主政治
detailed_translations.english: the system in which a country is ruled by a king or queen

name: republican
trans: adj. 共和政体的，共和国的；拥护共和政体的，共和主义的；（美国）共和党的，支持共和党的（Republican）；北爱尔兰共和主义者的，支持北爱尔兰共和主义者的（Republican） n. 共和主义者，拥护共和政体者；（美国）共和党人，共和党支持者（Republican）；（主张北爱尔兰应脱离英国成为爱尔兰共和国一部分的）北爱尔兰共和主义者（Republican）

sentences.english: Lower taxes made Republican voters happier with their party.
sentences.chinese: 更低的税率使共和党选民对该党更加满意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 共和国的；共和政体的；共和主义的；拥护共和政体的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or supporting a system of government that is not led by a king or queen
someone who believes in government by elected representatives only, with no king or queen

name: anarchism
trans: n. 无政府主义

name: doctrine
trans: n. 教义，主义，信条；（政府政策的）正式声明

sentences.english: traditional doctrines of divine power
sentences.chinese: 神力的传统教义

sentences.english: Marxist doctrine
sentences.chinese: 马克思主义学说

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs that form an important part of a religion or system of ideas

name: immigrant
trans: n. （外来）移民，侨民 adj. 移民的，迁入的

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

name: municipal
trans: adj. 城市的，市政的；自治城市的，地方自治的；内政的

sentences.english: the municipal waste dump
sentences.chinese: 城市垃圾场

sentences.english: municipal elections
sentences.chinese: 市级选举

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to the government of a town or city

name: strike
trans: v. 打，撞；（用手或武器等）打；（使）碰撞；罢工；突然想到，突然意识到；突然袭击；（疾病、灾难等）侵袭；（闪电）击中；引起（强烈感情）；（时钟）敲响；达成（协议，妥协），达到（平衡）；发现（黄金，矿物，石油）；铸造（硬币、奖牌）；删除；踢球，击球；攻球得分；使处于特定状态；让（某人）觉得；摆出（姿态）；照在……上；把……迷住；弹奏，奏出；划（火柴）, 击出（火星）；直击（要害），与…...起（原则性）冲突；（在争斗、竞争等中）取得先机；触发（电弧）；（电影摄影术）复制；（金融用语）结算，算出；<加>组成（委员会）；拆除（帐篷，戏剧布景）；降（帆，旗）（以示敬意或投降）；把（枝）插进土里生根；（植物，扦插）生根；（小牡蛎）附着；（渔）急拉钓线把鱼钩住；行进；来到；闯出（或开辟）新的（或独立的）事业 n. 罢工，罢市，罢课；（军事）打击；击，踢；（石油等宝贵资源的）发现；（投出的）好球；（棒球中的）击空；（十柱保龄球）一投全倒；不利因素；拒绝，抗拒；（渔）（对已上钩的鱼）急拉钓线；（地层、断层等地质特征的）走向

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

name: scandal
trans: n. 丑行，丑闻；流言蜚语，谣言；（由丑闻引起的）反感，公愤；令人震惊（或反感）的事情

sentences.english: It caused quite a scandal when he left his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他离开妻子成了一大丑闻。

sentences.english: The college has recently been involved in a drugs scandal .
sentences.chinese: 这所大学最近卷入了毒品丑闻。

sentences.english: He has been at the centre of a political scandal .
sentences.chinese: 他成了一桩政治丑闻的焦点。

sentences.english: a major scandal involving the government
sentences.chinese: 涉及政府的一桩重大丑闻

sentences.english: a series of financial scandals
sentences.chinese: 一连串金融丑闻

sentences.english: a sex scandal that ruined his reputation
sentences.chinese: 让他名誉扫地的性丑闻

sentences.english: They had already left the country when the scandal broke .
sentences.chinese: 丑闻爆出时他们已经离开了这个国家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丑事， 丑闻； 流言蜚语； 反感， 愤慨
detailed_translations.english: an event in which someone, especially someone important, behaves in a bad way that shocks people

name: vote
trans: v. 投票选举，投票表决；投票评选；（通过投票）决定给予（资助），同意提供（款项）；表明，公认（某事好或坏）；投票同意；建议，主张 n. 选票，票；投票，表决；（选举中的）选票总数（the vote）；选举权，表决权；投票结果，表决结果；投票者，选民（the vote）；特定投票群体，特定选民

sentences.english: A vote for us is not a wasted vote.
sentences.chinese: 投我们的票是不会白投的。

sentences.english: The proposal was rejected by 19 votes to 7.
sentences.chinese: 那项提议以19票对7票被否决。

sentences.english: policies designed to win votes in the South
sentences.chinese: 旨在赢取南方选票的各项政策

sentences.english: It’s the club secretary that counts the votes.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部干事负责清点选票。

detailed_translations.english: an act of voting in an elec­tion or meeting, or the choice that you make when you vote

sentences.english: Our only concern is the children’s welfare.
sentences.chinese: 我们唯一关心的是孩子们的幸福。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

sentences.chinese: “音乐还不错，”凯西回答，“我觉得小提琴和钢琴演奏出了悦耳的合音。”

name: harsh

name: movement
trans: n. 移动，转移；（具有共同思想或目标的）运动；军队有计划的移动；行踪；乐章；改进，发展；量的变化；（活动）机件；排便；（飞机）抵达，起飞

sentences.chinese: 比分是多少？

sentences.english: The school’s test scores have not improved.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的考试成绩没有提高。

detailed_translations.english: the number of points that each team or player has won in a game or competition

sentences.chinese: 风从东北方向吹来。

sentences.english: The plane crashed, killing two of the crew and four passengers.
sentences.chinese: 飞机坠毁，造成两名机组人员和四名乘客死亡。

name: aviator

sentences.chinese: 事实上，飞行员夹克的历史可以追溯到第一次世界大战时期。

sentences.chinese: 其他一些帽子则是受了历史或时尚的启发，比如标志性的飞行员头盔，或是与旧风尚‘报童帽’相似的司机帽。

name: playwright

sentences.english: The playwright does something remarkable in this scene, but without any impression of straining after an effect.
sentences.chinese: 剧作家在这场中有许多惊人妙笔，但并不给人留下竭力追求表面效果的印象。

sentences.english: His plays have been translated into every major living language and are performed more often than those of any other playwright.
sentences.chinese: 他的剧本被翻译成所有主要使用着的语言，并且表演次数远远超过其他任何剧作家。

sentences.english: His plays have been translated into every major living language and are performed more often than those of any other playwright.
sentences.chinese: 他的剧本被翻译成世界上多种主要语言，并且表演次数远远超过其他任何剧作家。

name: operator

sentences.chinese: 喂，接线员吗？请帮我接31号房间。

sentences.chinese: 因此，他的讲道面向的不只是世俗之人，也面向神职人员。

sentences.chinese: 在大多数的高校，你能够得到神职人员的劝导。有些学校有很多来自不同宗教的代表。

sentences.chinese: 我们可以掌握神秘而不可知的未来，从中创出我们所能想象的任何东西，一如雕刻家可以将未成型的石头刻出雕像一样。

sentences.english: This is what the sculptor must do.
sentences.chinese: 而雕塑家就必须做到这一点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who makes sculptures

name: mathematician
trans: n. 数学家

sentences.english: The risks can be so complex that banks hire mathematicians to assess them.
sentences.chinese: 这类风险可以是如此复杂以至于银行雇佣数学家们去评估它们。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or teaches mathematics, or is a specialist in mathematics

name: astronaut
trans: n. 宇航员，太空人

sentences.english: So why become an astronaut at all?
sentences.chinese: 那么，为什么要成为一名宇航员呢？

sentences.english: Yes, I have wanted to be an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我想过成为一个宇航员。

sentences.english: Many different qualities go towards the making of an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 一名宇航员必须具备许多不同的素质。

detailed_translations.english: someone who travels and works in a spacecraft

name: astronomer
trans: n. 天文学家

sentences.english: My ideal is to be an astronomer.
sentences.chinese: 我的理想是当一个天文学家。

sentences.english: If people know you’re an astronomer, they will soon be asking you all about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人知道你是个天文学家，他们会很快向你询问关于这件事的一切。

sentences.english: Any astronomer, at any university, in any country can write a proposal for what they want to do with the telescope.
sentences.chinese: 任何国家、任何大学的天文学家都可以递交申请，告诉我们他们想要使用这台望远镜做什么。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies the stars and  planet s

name: spaceman
trans: n. 宇航员，太空飞行员；太空人

sentences.english: As a gamer, he cares deeply about the difference between character classes—whether a ninja, merchant, or citizen spaceman.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个游戏玩家，他很关心人物的性格分类——是忍者、商人还是平民宇航员。

detailed_translations.english: a man who travels into space

name: botanist
trans: n. 植物学家

sentences.english: A botanist can differentiate varieties of plants.
sentences.chinese: 植物学家能区分各种不同的植物。

sentences.english: Along with English botanist Joseph Hooker, Lyell was one of a small handful of people Darwin had shown early drafts of his own work on natural selection.
sentences.chinese: 同英国植物学家约瑟夫·胡克一样，莱尔是少数了解达尔文在自然选择学说方面研究的早期草稿的人之一。

sentences.english: Forty-five years on, the French botanist's gardens have grown massive in scale.
sentences.chinese: 四十五年过去，这法国植物学家的花园规模更大。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make scientific studies of wild plants

name: choreographer
trans: n. 编舞者，舞蹈指导

sentences.english: My choreographer keeps chiseling away at me, hoping to shape me into perfection.
sentences.chinese: 我的舞蹈编导总是不断雕琢我，一心将我塑造成完美的舞蹈家。

sentences.english: "A choreographer told me that what professionals are looking for in a good dancer is core body strength, " said Dr Neave.
sentences.chinese: “一个舞蹈编导告诉我专家们寻找优秀舞蹈演员的核心指标就是身体力量，”内尔博士透露。

sentences.english: The old master even invited him over to his house, where Jackson taught the moonwalk to him and his choreographer Hermes Pan.
sentences.chinese: 这位老前辈甚至邀请他到家里来，在这儿杰克逊为阿斯泰尔和他的舞蹈教练展示了太空步。

detailed_translations.english: A choreographer is someone who invents the movements for a ballet or other dance and tells the dancers how to perform them

name: scout
trans: n. 侦察兵，侦察机；侦查（尤指勘察地区）；童子军（the Scouts）；（英国大学里清扫学生房间的）校工；（演员、运动员等的）人才发掘者，星探；侦查蜂；童子军队员 v. （在某个地区）寻找，搜寻；物色（尤指体育或娱乐）人才；<罕> 轻蔑地拒绝（建议，想法）；探查，侦查；跟踪，监视

sentences.english: He sent three scouts ahead to take a look at the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他派出三名侦察兵到前面侦察大桥的情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搜索，侦察；侦察员；侦察机
detailed_translations.english: a soldier, plane etc that is sent to search the area in front of an army and get information about the enemy
to examine a place or area in order to get information about it

name: geographer
trans: n. 地理学者

sentences.english: Another reason, says Peter Hopkins, a geographer at Newcastle University, is that Scotland’s cultural iconography is much more vivid and more popular than England’s.
sentences.chinese: 纽卡斯尔大学地理学者彼得•霍普金斯表示，另一个原因是苏格兰的文化意象相比英格兰更生动，更深入人心。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has studied geography to a high level

name: geologist
trans: n. 地质学家，地质学者

sentences.english: He is also a geologist.
sentences.chinese: 他也是一位地质学家。

sentences.english: A senior Pakistani geologist says, however, that the trend could be due to large-scale irrigation schemes that began in the area at around the same time as the West's Industrial Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 然而，一位资深巴基斯坦地质学家说，这个趋势也可能是因为这个地区与西方工业革命同时开始的大规模的灌溉计划造成的。

sentences.english: Another geologist in the region, Yang Yong, also said he believes geological concerns likely played an important role in the decision.
sentences.chinese: 该地区另一位地质学家杨勇也说，他相信地质方面的考虑可能对推迟蓄水的决定起到了重要作用。

name: educator
trans: n. 教育工作者，教师；教育家

sentences.english: What more could an educator hope for than a student's desire to learn.
sentences.chinese: 除了学生的学习兴趣，教育者们别无所求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 教育家；教育工作者；教师
detailed_translations.english: a teacher or someone involved in the process of educating people

name: faculty
trans: n. 机能；天赋，才能；（高等院校的）系，院；<美> 全体教员；<旧>（某行业，尤指医学行业的）全体从业人员；（尤指来自教会当权者的）特许证，许可证

sentences.english: Both faculty and students oppose the measures.
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生都反对这些措施。

detailed_translations.english: all the teachers in a university

name: treasurer
trans: n. 会计；司库；财务主管；出纳员

sentences.english: Because he is treasurer and manager of the establishment.
sentences.chinese: 因为他是这个学校的司库和管事。

sentences.english: Chairman , secretary and treasurer should be elected annually.
sentences.chinese: 主席、秘书和司库应每年改选一次。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is officially responsible for the money for an organization, club, political party etc

name: archeologist
trans: n. 考古学家

name: paleoanthropologist
trans: n. [人类] 古人类学者

name: pilot
trans: n. 飞行员；领航员；（船只的）领航员；（电视）试播节目；常燃小火；航海手册；<非正式>职业骑师；<古>向导；（火车头前端的）排障器 adj. 试点的；（电信）控制引导信号 v. 驾驶（飞行器）；领航；试验，试行；使（新法律）顺利通过；<文>带领，指引

sentences.english: an airline pilot
sentences.chinese: 航空公司飞行员

sentences.english: a fighter pilot
sentences.chinese: 战斗机驾驶员

sentences.english: The official report into the accident says that it was caused by pilot error (= a mistake by the pilot ) .
sentences.chinese: 那宗事故的官方报告称事故是由飞行员失误造成的。

sentences.english: The plan is to launch a pilot programme next summer.
sentences.chinese: 计划是在明年夏天实施一个试验性方案。

detailed_translations.english: someone who operates the controls of an aircraft or spacecraft
A pilot plan or a pilot project is one that is used to test an idea before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale
to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

name: meteorologist
trans: n. 气象学者

sentences.english: "This is probably one of the worst storms since 1990," a meteorologist in Seattle said.
sentences.chinese: 西雅图气象专家表示，这也许是自1990年以来最严重的暴风雪。

sentences.english: At the time, he noted that "One meteorologist remarked that if the theory were correct, one flap of a seagull's wings could change the course of weather forever".
sentences.chinese: 在文中，他写道：“一位气象学者注意到，如果这个理论是正确的，那就意味着一只海鸥扇动一下翅膀能够永久地改变天气的进程”。

sentences.english: By e-mail and earphone, he confers with Jack Parrish, chief meteorologist, and they order the NOAA technician to slip a dropsonde into the shoot.
sentences.chinese: 通过电子邮件和耳机，他与首席气象学家杰克·帕里什联络，指挥NOAA的技术人员发射下投式探空仪。

name: anthropologist
trans: n. 人类学家

sentences.english: This is something I learned as an anthropologist –people love to tell their stories.
sentences.chinese: 这是我作为一名人类学家所理解的----人们喜欢讲述自己的故事。

sentences.english: Fisher, a biological anthropologist, says she wrote her latest book because she wanted to uncover the science behind “why you love who you love and perhaps even help people find the one”.
sentences.chinese: 费舍尔，生物人类学家，说她的最新著作的出发点是缘于她想揭开“为什么你会爱上你的爱人，这也许会帮助人们找到爱人”背后的科学依据。

sentences.english: A data manager, media coordinator, and medical anthropologist will also be arriving over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 一名数据管理员、媒体协调员和医学人类学家也将于周末抵达。

name: artist
trans: n. 艺术家，美术家；表演艺术家；大师，行家

sentences.english: an exhibition of paintings by local artists
sentences.chinese: 当地画家的画展

detailed_translations.english: someone who produces art, especially paintings or drawings

name: imagist
trans: n. 意象派诗人 adj. 意象派的

sentences.english: Much subsequent poetry in england was influenced by imagist lord and practice .
sentences.chinese: 后来的英国诗歌中有许多诗受到了意象主义的箴言和实践的影响。

name: inventor
trans: n. 发明者，发明家

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell, the inventor of the telephone
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔，电话的发明者

detailed_translations.english: someone who has invented something, or whose job is to invent things

name: mechanic
trans: n. 机械工，机修工；<旧>劳工，工匠；方法，手段 adj. 手工的

sentences.english: a garage mechanic
sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂的技工

detailed_translations.english: someone who is skilled at repairing motor vehicles and machinery

name: biographer
trans: n. 传记作者

sentences.english: ...Picasso's biographer.
sentences.chinese: …毕加索的传记作者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes a biography of someone else

name: censor
trans: n. 检查员，审查官；潜意识抑制力；（古罗马）监察官 v. 审查，删改（书、电影、信件等）

sentences.english: The information given to the press was carefully censored by the Ministry of Defence.
sentences.chinese: 发布给报界的信息经过了国防部的仔细审查。

detailed_translations.english: to examine books, films, letters etc to remove anything that is considered offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 检查员；[心理] 潜意识压抑力；信件检查员
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous

name: physician
trans: n. 医生，（尤指）内科医生；抚慰者

sentences.english: your family physician
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭医生

detailed_translations.english: a doctor

name: hermit
trans: n. （尤指宗教原因的）隐士，隐居者；蜂鸟

sentences.english: I've spent the past ten years living like a hermit.
sentences.chinese: 我过去10年里过着隐士般的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: （尤指宗教原因的）隐士；隐居者
detailed_translations.english: someone who lives alone and has a simple way of life, usually for religious reasons

name: recluse
trans: n. 隐士；隐居者 adj. 隐居的

sentences.english: Stained glass windows, ceramic chimney and floral motifs adorn the house and make it an awe inspiring space for recluse.
sentences.chinese: 彩色玻璃窗户，陶瓷灯罩和花纹图案装饰的房子，让它对隐士来说成为一个令人敬畏的空间。

sentences.english: Nancy: Well, suit yourself. I don't recommend turning down too many invitations or you'll get a reputation for being a recluse.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，随你吧。我不建议你拒绝太多邀请，不然你会被别人当成一个隐居者（孤僻的人）

sentences.english: Terror of the lecher hope of the mad recluse: the sky! Black cover of the great cauldron in which boils vast imperceptible humanity.
sentences.chinese: 纵欲者的恐惧，疯隐士的希望：天空！那口大锅的黑色盖子锅中沸煮着无数渺小的人类。

detailed_translations.english: someone who chooses to live alone, and does not like seeing or talking to other people

name: ecologist
trans: n. 生态学者；生态保护论者

sentences.english: Ecologists argue that the benefits of treating sewage with disinfectants are doubtful.
sentences.chinese: 生态学家们认为用消毒剂处理污水的好处是值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies ecology

name: critic
trans: n. 批评家，评论员；批评者，反对……的人

sentences.english: Mather was a film critic for many years.
sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

name: philanthropist
trans: n. 慈善家，博爱主义者；乐善好施的人

sentences.english: A philanthropist is someone who donates to charity. So Harper was admitting that he views "the environment" as a charity case.
sentences.chinese: 慈善家是一些热衷于慈善事业的人，因此，哈珀算是承认他认为“保护环境”是一项慈善事业。

detailed_translations.english: a rich person who gives a lot of money to help poor people

name: attorney
trans: n. 律师；代理人

sentences.english: ...a prosecuting attorney.
sentences.chinese: …一位公诉律师。

detailed_translations.english: a lawyer

name: congressman
trans: n. 国会议员；众议院议员

detailed_translations.english: a man who is a member of a congress, especially the US House of Representatives

name: connoisseur
trans: n. 鉴赏家；内行

sentences.english: a wine connoisseur
sentences.chinese: 品酒专家

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about something such as art, food, or music

name: entrepreneur
trans: n. 企业家，创业者；主办者，提倡者

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: If any of you end up being entrepreneur, which I hope you will be, what do you have in store for yourself, and what does that journey look like?
sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

sentences.english: How would you define personal growth as an entrepreneur?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何定义,一个企业家的个人成长？

detailed_translations.english: someone who starts a new business or arranges business deals in order to make money, often in a way that involves financial risks

name: principal
trans: adj. 最重要的，首要的；本金的，母金的 n. <美>（美国公立中小学的）校长；<英>（英国的）大学校长，学院院长；（企业或机构的）负责人；（音乐会、戏剧、芭蕾舞剧、歌剧中的）主角演员；（管弦乐队每一乐器组的）首席演奏者；（有利息的）本金，资金；（法律和商业事务中的）当事人，委托人；关键人物；（某些行业）完全合格的开业者；<英>（负责某一部门的）高级公务员；主犯，首犯；<史>决斗者；（支撑檩的）主椽；（管风琴的）主音栓

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

name: staff
trans: n. 全体员工，全体雇员；<美>（大、中、小学的）管理人员，行政人员；（军队的）全体参谋人员；陆军上士；手杖，拐杖；权杖，笏；旗杆；（测绘）标杆，标尺；<英>（钟表的）小轴杆；<英>（铁路的）路签；五线谱 adj. 职员的 v. 为……配备员工；是……的职员

sentences.english: The staff were very good.
sentences.chinese: 员工们都很棒。

sentences.english: 10 staff were allocated to the task.
sentences.chinese: 10名员工被分派做这项任务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体职员，员工；工作人员；参谋
detailed_translations.english: the people who work for an organization

name: commander
trans: n. 指挥官，长官；海军中校；英国高级警官；高级骑士（或爵士）

sentences.english: the American Commander, General Otis
sentences.chinese: 美军指挥官奥蒂斯将军

sentences.english: our platoon commander
sentences.chinese: 我们的排长

detailed_translations.english: an officer of any rank who is in charge of a group of soldiers or a particular military activity

name: commentator
trans: n. 现场解说员，实况播音员；评论员

sentences.english: political commentators
sentences.chinese: 政治评论员

detailed_translations.chinese: 评论员，解说员；实况播音员；时事评论者
detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, and who writes about it or discusses it on the television or radio

name: attendant
trans: n. 服务人员；侍从，随从；护理者；随员，助手 adj. 伴随的，随之产生的；伺候的；陪伴的；到场的

sentences.english: a cloakroom/parking/museum attendant
sentences.chinese: 衣帽间 / 停车服务员；博物馆接待员

sentences.english: The Prince was followed by his attendants.
sentences.chinese: 王子由其侍从陪同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侍者；（要人的）侍从；（病人的）护理人员
detailed_translations.english: a person whose job is to serve or help people in a public place

name: trapper
trans: n. 设陷阱捕兽者；捕捉器；[矿业] 矿井风门开关管理员

detailed_translations.english: someone who traps wild animals, especially for their fur

name: orator
trans: n. 演说者；演讲者；雄辩家

sentences.english: He was a natural politician, a gifted orator who knew how to work a crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是位天生的政治家，是位有天赋且知道如何凝集民众的演说家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演说者；演讲者；雄辩家；原告
detailed_translations.english: someone who is good at making speeches and persuading people

name: idiot
trans: n. 白痴，笨蛋；<古>弱智者，低能儿

sentences.english: ‘You are an idiot, ’ he tells them.
sentences.chinese: ‘你确实是傻瓜，’他对他们说。
