sentences.english: Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的读者，假设你是一个白痴。再假设你是一名国会成员。不过我的话说重复了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is mentally ill or has a very low level of intelligence

name: idiocy
trans: n. 白痴；白痴的行为

name: moron
trans: n. 傻瓜；痴愚者；笨人 n. （Moron）人名；（英）莫伦；（法、意、葡、匈）莫龙

name: illiterate
trans: adj. 不识字的，文盲的；行文拙劣的，不通顺的；（对某个学科）无知的，不了解的 n. 文盲

sentences.english: It was an illiterate letter, full of mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 这封信文笔拙劣，错误连篇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is illiterate has not learned to read or write
someone who has not learned to read or write

name: proxy
trans: n. 代理权，代表权；代理人，代表；（测算用的）代替物，指标；投票委托书

sentences.english: You can vote by proxy.
sentences.chinese: 你可以请人代你投票。

detailed_translations.english: if you do something by proxy, you arrange for someone else to do it for you

name: deputy
trans: n. 代理人，副手，副职；代表，议员；（美国协助地方治安官办案的）警官 adj. 副的；代理的

sentences.english: ...Jack Lang, France's minister for culture, and his deputy, Catherine Tasca.
sentences.chinese: …法国文化部长杰克·朗和他的副手凯瑟琳·塔斯卡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副职， 副手； 代表， 代理人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is directly below another person in rank, and who is officially in charge when that person is not there

name: proprietor
trans: n. 业主；所有者；经营者

sentences.english: I am the proprietor of the company.
sentences.chinese: 我是这个公司的经营者。

sentences.english: Marketing concept is the reflection of the marketing activity in the consciousness of the proprietor.
sentences.chinese: 市场营销观念是市场营销活动在经营者意识中的反映。

name: consumer
trans: n. 消费者，顾客，用户；食用者，使用者，消耗者

sentences.english: Consumers will soon be paying higher airfares.
sentences.chinese: 不久消费者就要支付更高的机票价了。

sentences.english: It will offer a wider choice of goods for the consumer (= consumers in general ).
sentences.chinese: 它将为消费者提供更多的商品选择。

sentences.english: Consumer demand led to higher imports of manufactured goods.
sentences.chinese: 消费者需求促使制造商品的进口量增加了。

sentences.english: Consumer spending was down by 0.1% last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月消费支出下降了0.1%。

sentences.english: sources of consumer advice
sentences.chinese: 给予消费者建议的信息来源

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and uses products and services

name: employer
trans: n. 雇主

sentences.english: The shoe factory is the largest employer in this area.
sentences.chinese: 这家制鞋厂是本地区最大的雇主。

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or organization that employs people

name: employee
trans: n. 雇员

sentences.english: a government employee
sentences.chinese: 政府雇员

detailed_translations.english: someone who is paid to work for someone else

name: debtor
trans: n. 债务人，借方

sentences.english: ...important improvements in the situation of debtor countries.
sentences.chinese: …债务国境况的重大改善。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that owes money

name: arbitrator
trans: n. 公断人，仲裁人（或机构）

sentences.english: If negotiations are deadlocked , an arbitrator must be called in.
sentences.chinese: 如果谈判陷入僵局，就必须请一位仲裁人。

sentences.english: The dispute shall be submitted for arbitration by a mutually nominated arbitrator.
sentences.chinese: 这起纠纷应由一位双方共同指定的仲裁人提交仲裁。

sentences.english: The arbitrator's decision on the dispute is final and binding on the both parlies.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁人对争执所做的裁决为最后裁决，对双方均具有约束力。

name: superintendent
trans: n. 主管，负责人；（英国的）警司，（美国的）警察局局长；<美>（大楼的）管理员

sentences.english: a young park superintendent
sentences.chinese: 年轻的公园负责人

sentences.english: the superintendent of the Methodist Church in Hawaii
sentences.chinese: 夏威夷卫理公会负责人

detailed_translations.english: someone who is officially in charge of a place, job, activity etc

name: apprentice
trans: n. 学徒，徒弟；生手，新手 v. 收……为学徒；当学徒

sentences.english: The apprentice lingered his work.
sentences.chinese: 这个徒弟磨洋工。

sentences.english: His apprentice always leaves the tools about.
sentences.chinese: 他的徒弟老是乱放工具。

sentences.english: That would be good for my apprentice to have, complementary.
sentences.chinese: 补充说一下，那会是成为我徒弟的优势。

name: tenant
trans: n. 房客，租户；<法律>业主 v. （作为租赁者）居住，工作

sentences.english: The desk was left by the previous tenant.
sentences.chinese: 书桌是上一个房客留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a house, room etc and pays rent to the person who owns it

name: miser
trans: n. 守财奴；吝啬鬼；（石油工程上用的）凿井机 n. （Miser）人名；（英）迈泽；（德）米泽；（西）米塞尔

sentences.english: I'm married to a miser.
sentences.chinese: 我嫁了个守财奴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 守财奴；吝啬鬼；（石油工程上用的）凿井机
detailed_translations.english: someone who is not generous and does not like spending money

name: donor
trans: n. 捐献者，捐赠者；（化学）供体；（物理）施主 adj. 捐献的

sentences.english: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries (= countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们急需捐赠国的更多援助。

sentences.english: An anonymous donor (= whose name is unknown ) has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
sentences.chinese: 一位匿名捐赠者向重建基金捐了500英镑。

sentences.english: ...the severe shortage of donor organs.
sentences.chinese: …捐献器官的严重匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 捐献的；经人工授精出生的
detailed_translations.english: Donor organs or parts are organs or parts of the body which people allow doctors to use to help people who are ill

name: personnel
trans: n. （公司、组织或军队中的）全体人员，员工；人事部门 adj. 人员的，有关人事的

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

name: benefactor
trans: n. 捐助人，赞助人

sentences.english: An anonymous benefactor donated $2 million.
sentences.chinese: 一位没留姓名的捐助人捐款二百万美元。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives money for a good purpose

name: mortal
trans: adj. 终有一死的，不能永生的；极其严重的，致命的；至死方休的，不共戴天的；极度的，极其强烈的；死的，临死的；（因罪孽深重而）灵魂无法得救的，不能蒙神恩得宽恕的；<非正式>想像得出的，可能；世间的，凡人的 n. 凡人，普通人；地位（或能力）不如他人者

sentences.english: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的
detailed_translations.english: not able to live for ever
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

name: company
trans: n. 公司；陪伴，同伴；宾客，来宾；在一起的一群人；连队；剧团，歌舞团；女童军大队 v. <古>结交，交往；<古>陪伴

sentences.english: Which company do you work for?
sentences.chinese: 你在哪家公司上班？

sentences.english: I called the phone company about the bill.
sentences.chinese: 我就电话账单的事给电话公司打了电话。

sentences.english: The company was set up just after the war.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是战后不久成立的。

sentences.english: People judge you by the company you keep (= the people you spend time with ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们根据你交往的朋友来判断你的为人。

detailed_translations.english: a business organization that makes or sells goods or services

name: audience
trans: n. 观众，听众；读者；觐见，拜见；拥护者

sentences.english: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.english: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

detailed_translations.english: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work

name: recipient
trans: n. <正式>接受者，领受者；接收器，容器 adj. 接受的，容纳的

sentences.english: ...the largest recipient of U.S. foreign aid.
sentences.chinese: …最大的美国对外援助接受方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who receives something

name: exponent
trans: n. 拥护者，倡导者；代表人物；指数，幂；大师，行家；成分；说明者，说明物 adj. 说明的

sentences.english: The fatigue life increases with decreasing modulus of surface layer in a power function with a negative exponent.
sentences.chinese: 沥青面层的疲劳寿命随着面层材料模量的降低以负指数的幂函数形式增加；

sentences.english: In addition, this paper also suggests that the reason for high burning rate-pressure exponent is deflagration of some components in propellant.
sentences.chinese: 此外，本文还提出，火药中某些组分的爆燃是导致一些火药燃速压力指数较高的原因。

sentences.english: Examining the influence of the sports factors on the step exponent of colleges students with the experiment method, questionnaire survey method and Mathematical Statistics method.
sentences.chinese: 采用实验法、问卷调查法和数理统计法，观察运动因素对大学生台阶指数的影响。

detailed_translations.english: a sign written above and to the right of a number or letter to show how many times that quantity is to be multiplied by itself

name: resident
trans: n. 居民，住户；（旅馆的）住宿者；<美>住院医生；<美> 寄宿制学校学生；<史>（英国政府派驻半独立国家的） 特派代表；驻外特工；留鸟，无迁徙习性的蝴蝶（或其他动物） adj. （在某地）居住的，居留的；常驻的；属于（某个群体）的；（鸟、蝴蝶等）非迁徙性的；（计算机程序、文件等在存储器中）驻留的

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: inhabitant
trans: n. （某地的）居民，栖息动物

sentences.english: a city of six million inhabitants
sentences.chinese: 有600万居民的城市

detailed_translations.english: one of the people who live in a particular place

name: bachelor
trans: n. 未婚男子，单身汉；学士；尚未交配的雄鸟

sentences.english: Gerald was 38, and a confirmed bachelor (=  a man who has decided that he will never marry  ) .
sentences.chinese: 杰拉德38岁，抱定主意独身。

sentences.english: a Bachelor of Arts/Engineering/Science
sentences.chinese: 文学士；工程学士；理学士

detailed_translations.english: a man who has never been married

name: idol
trans: n. 偶像，受到热爱和崇拜的人（或物）；圣像，神像；<美>幻象；<美>谬论

sentences.english: a pop idol
sentences.chinese: 流行乐偶像

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that you love or admire very much

name: novice
trans: n. 初学者，新手；见习修士，见习修女；尚未赢过大赛的赛马

sentences.english: The computer course is ideal for novices.
sentences.chinese: 这门计算机课程非常适合初学者。

sentences.english: This trail is not recommended for novice bikers.
sentences.chinese: 不建议自行车新手走这条小路。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no experience in a skill, subject, or activity

name: believer
trans: n. 信徒；相信……者

sentences.english: I made no secret of the fact that I was not a believer.
sentences.chinese: 我对自己不是一个宗教信徒的事实并不隐瞒。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in a particular god, religion, or system of beliefs

name: cult
trans: n. 异教，异教组织；狂热崇拜，迷信；（特定群体的）偶像，时尚；崇拜者，信徒；宗教信仰，宗教习俗 adj. 受崇拜的，热门的

sentences.english: O’Brien has a cult of devoted readers.
sentences.chinese: 奥布赖恩有一批忠实的读者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 异教， 教派； 狂热的崇拜
detailed_translations.english: an extreme religious group that is not part of an established religion

name: fanatic
trans: n. 狂热入迷者；狂热分子，盲信者 adj. 狂热的；盲信的

sentences.english: fanatics who represent a real danger to democracy
sentences.chinese: 对民主构成很大威胁的狂热分子

sentences.english: a religious fanatic
sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂热入迷者；盲信者；盲信
detailed_translations.english: someone who has extreme political or religious ideas and is often dangerous
Fanatic means the same as

name: adherent
trans: n. （政党、思想的）拥护者 adj. 粘着的；遵守的；（植物）联生的

sentences.english: The Nation of Islam and its most famous adherent, Malcolm X, preached a message of self-reliance and racial separatism.
sentences.chinese: “伊斯兰民族”及其最著名的追随者马尔科姆∙艾克斯（Malcolm X）宣扬自力更生和种族分离。

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports a particular belief, plan, political party etc

name: faithful
trans: adj. 忠实的，忠诚的；如实的，忠于原事（物）的；忠贞的；可信任的，可信赖的 n. 忠实支持者（the faithful）

sentences.english: a faithful friend
sentences.chinese: 忠诚的朋友

sentences.english: years of faithful service to the company
sentences.chinese: 为公司多年忠诚的服务

sentences.english: our faithful family dog, Bogey
sentences.chinese: 我家的忠犬博吉

sentences.english: a faithful member of the church
sentences.chinese: 教会的忠实信徒

sentences.english: a faithful account of what had happened
sentences.chinese: 对所发生之事的如实报道

detailed_translations.english: remaining loyal to a particular person, belief, political party etc and continuing to support them

name: disciple
trans: n. 耶稣的十二门徒之一（=the Disciples）；追随者，门徒

sentences.english: ...a major intellectual figure with disciples throughout Europe.
sentences.chinese: …一位信徒遍布欧洲的重要知识分子。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in the ideas of a great teacher or leader, especially a religious one

name: champion
trans: n. 冠军，第一名；拥护者，斗士 v. 捍卫，拥护，支持 adj. <英，非正式>极好的；冠军的，得一等奖的

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

name: assassin
trans: n. 暗杀者，刺客

sentences.english: Kennedy’s assassin is assumed to have been Lee Harvey Oswald.
sentences.chinese: 暗杀肯尼迪的人据说是李·哈维·奥斯瓦尔德。

detailed_translations.english: someone who murders an important person

name: bandit
trans: n. 强盗，土匪；恶棍；敲诈者

sentences.english: They travelled 30 miles through bandit country.
sentences.chinese: 他们走了30英里，穿过强盗横行的乡间。

detailed_translations.english: someone who robs people, especially one of a group of people who attack travellers

name: burglar
trans: n. 入室行窃者，窃贼

sentences.english: Burglars broke into their home.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼闯进了他们家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who goes into houses, shops etc to steal things

name: barbarian
trans: n. 野蛮人；未开化的人；无教养的人 adj. 野蛮的；未开化的

sentences.english: We need to fight this barbarian attitude to science.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要向这种对待科学的野蛮态度作斗争。

detailed_translations.english: Barbarian is also an adjective
someone from a different tribe or land, who people believe to be wild and not  civilized

name: exile
trans: n. 流放；被流放者，流亡者 v. 流放；使离开

sentences.english: the exiled former president
sentences.chinese: 流亡国外的前总统

sentences.english: political exiles
sentences.chinese: 政治流亡者

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to leave their country, especially for political reasons
a person who is forced to live away from his or her own country

name: rebel
trans: n. 造反者，反抗者；反抗权威者；叛逆者，不守规矩者 v. 反叛，造反；违抗，不服从（权威）；反对，反抗（规定、行为规范等）；（胃、腿、头脑等）不听使唤 adj. 造反的；反抗的

sentences.english: Voters rebelled against high property taxes.
sentences.chinese: 投票者们反对高额财产税。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose or fight against someone in authority or against an idea or situation which you do not agree with
someone who opposes or fights against people in authority

name: addict
trans: n. （尤指毒品）上瘾者，瘾君子；<非正式>对……入迷的人 v. 使上瘾，使沉迷

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Walt's meth-business partner, the addict Jesse, is still recovering from the drug-related death of his girlfriend Jane at the end of last season.
sentences.chinese: 而沃特的制毒搭档——瘾君子杰西还未从女朋友之死的痛苦中恢复过来。 他的女朋友简在上一季结尾时死于毒品。

name: egoist
trans: n. 利己主义者，自我主义者，自高自大者

sentences.english: I never thought of myself as a bastard, an egoist .
sentences.chinese: 我从没想过我自己是个杂种， 利己主义者。

sentences.english: And so a hyper-inflated egoist from hyper-INFERIORITY Complex issue book after book to show cause of its LKYism wiseDOOM!
sentences.chinese: 一堆极度自卑的复杂问题产生了这么一个极度膨胀的利己主义者，显示出了其李光耀主义的智慧。

name: eyewitness
trans: n. 目击者；见证人

sentences.english: One eyewitness said he saw her talking to a man in a blue car.
sentences.chinese: 一名目击者说他看见她在跟一个坐在蓝色汽车里的男子说话。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has seen something such as a crime happen, and is able to describe it afterwards

name: spectator
trans: n. （尤指体育比赛的）观看者，观众；旁观者

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

name: spouse
trans: n. 配偶 v. 和……结婚

sentences.english: Spouses were invited to the company picnic.
sentences.chinese: 配偶受到邀请参加公司的野餐会。

detailed_translations.english: a husband or wife

name: couple
trans: n. 两个，几个；一对夫妇，一对情侣 v. 加上，结合；（把设备等）连接；形成一双，配成一对；<旧>交配，交媾；（用电磁感应，静电荷或光学通信线路）将（电路元件）耦合

sentences.english: a newly married couple
sentences.chinese: 一对新婚夫妇

sentences.english: the couple next door
sentences.chinese: 隔壁的那对夫妇

detailed_translations.english: two people who are married or having a sexual or romantic relationship

name: beneficiary
trans: n. 受益者，受惠人；遗嘱受益人；封臣 adj. 拥有封地的，受圣俸的

sentences.english: One of the main beneficiaries of the early election is thought to be the former president.
sentences.chinese: 前总统被认为是早期选举的主要受益者之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: [金融] 受益人，受惠者；封臣
detailed_translations.english: someone who gets advantages from an action or change

name: inferior
trans: adj. 次的，较差的；低等的，下级的；自卑的；（法庭，特别法庭）下级的；（商品，服务）需求量在衰退期中较之繁荣期更大的，低档的；（位置）下方的，下位的，靠下的；（字母，数字，符号）下标的；低等的 n. 下级，（地位或成就）低于他人者；下标字母，下标数字，下标符号

sentences.english: I felt very inferior among all those academics.
sentences.chinese: 与那些大学教师在一起，我自惭形秽。

sentences.english: wine of inferior quality
sentences.chinese: 劣质葡萄酒

sentences.english: inferior goods
sentences.chinese: 质量低劣的商品

detailed_translations.english: not good, or not as good as someone or something else
someone who has a lower position or rank than you in an organization

name: zealot
trans: n. 狂热者；犹太教狂热信徒

sentences.english: religious zealots
sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂热者；犹太教狂热信徒
detailed_translations.english: someone who has extremely strong beliefs, especially religious or political beliefs, and is too eager to make other people share them

name: precursor
trans: n. （事物）先驱，先兆；（尤指经新陈代谢形成另一种物质的）前体，前质

sentences.english: Error is often the precursor of what is correct.
sentences.chinese: 错误常常是正确的先导。

sentences.english: Viewed as a precursor to a wider open data movement, it could be as important as any we have seen in the web era.
sentences.chinese: 它被视为更宽泛的数据开放运动的先导，它将像我们在互联网时代看到的所有重要的事物一样重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that happened or existed before something else and influenced its development

name: avant-garde
trans: n. （艺术、音乐或文学方面的）前卫派思想；前卫派（艺术家等） adj. 前卫的，激进的

name: alumni
trans: n. 校友，毕业生（alumnus 的复数）

sentences.english: the University alumni association
sentences.chinese: 大学校友会

detailed_translations.chinese: 男校友；男毕业生（alumnus的复数）
detailed_translations.english: the former students of a school, college etc

name: skeptic
trans: n. （对一切都）持怀疑态度的人；怀疑论者，不可知论者；无神论者 adj. 不相信的，持怀疑态度的；怀疑论的，不可知论的

sentences.english: You're a skeptic.
sentences.chinese: 你是个怀疑论者。

sentences.english: And, most importantly to the skeptic, Jesus did all this in history.
sentences.chinese: 而，最能取信于怀疑者的一点是，耶稣确实在历史上做过这些事情。

name: malcontent
trans: n. 不满者 adj. 不满的

name: foe
trans: n. 敌人，对头

sentences.english: Britain’s friends and foes
sentences.chinese: 英国的朋友和敌人

detailed_translations.english: an enemy

name: opponent
trans: n. 对手，竞争者；反对者，阻止者 adj. 对立的，敌对的

sentences.english: She bowled out her opponent.
sentences.chinese: 她打败了她的对手。

sentences.english: The soldier jabbed at his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 那个战士猛击他的对手。

sentences.english: He avowed himself an opponent of all alliances.
sentences.chinese: 他声称他是所有联盟的反对者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who you try to defeat in a competition, game, fight, or argument

name: rival
trans: n. 竞争对手，敌手；可与之匹敌者，可与之相比的人（或物） v. 与......相匹敌，比得上 adj. 竞争的，对抗的

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

name: celebrity
trans: n. 名声，名望；名人，明星

sentences.english: a sporting celebrity
sentences.chinese: 体育明星

sentences.english: He’s a national celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 他是全国有名的人物。

sentences.english: We invited a number of minor celebrities (= people who are not very famous ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请了一些小有名气的人物。

sentences.english: celebrity chef/gardener etc
sentences.chinese: 名厨/名人园艺师等

detailed_translations.english: a famous living person

name: figurehead
trans: n. 破浪神；有名无实的领袖；装饰船头的人像

sentences.english: The Queen is merely a figurehead.
sentences.chinese: 女王只是名义上的元首。

detailed_translations.chinese: 破浪神；有名无实的领袖；装饰船头的人像
detailed_translations.english: a wooden model of a woman that used to be placed on the front of ships

name: veteran
trans: n. 老兵，退伍军人；经验丰富的人，老手 adj. 经验丰富的，老练的；<英>古老的

sentences.english: He is a veteran of the last revolution in medical technology, gene therapy, which, after some hyped expectations in the 1990s, fell into disfavor after some unsuccessful trials.
sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

name: traitor
trans: n. 叛徒，卖国贼

sentences.english: ...rumours that there were traitors among us who were sending messages to the enemy.
sentences.chinese: …谣言说我们中有正给敌人送信的叛徒。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is not loyal to their country, friends, or beliefs

name: advocate
trans: v. 拥护，提倡 n. 拥护者，提倡者；辩护律师；（为某一类人）谋利益者；（一项事业或个组织的）工作者

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: feminist
trans: n. 女权主义者，女权运动者 adj. 女权主义的，支持女权运动的

sentences.english: She’s been an outspoken feminist for over twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 20多年来，她一直是个直言不讳的女权主义者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports the idea that women should have the same rights and opportunities as men
Feminist groups, ideas, and activities are involved in feminism

name: humanitarian
trans: adj. 人道主义的，博爱的；基督凡人论的 n. 人道主义者，博爱者；慈善家；基督凡人论者

sentences.english: And on each of those issues we have said that we would consider that and, in fact, have provided some humanitarian support.
sentences.chinese: 对于每一件这样的事情，我们都说过，我们将会对此进行考虑，事实上，我们向他们提供了人道主义援助。

sentences.english: But part of trying to do what is right for the Burmese people is to provide humanitarian assistance in this time of extreme need.
sentences.chinese: 但是，对缅甸人民来说，正确的行动部分是为他们提供人道主义援助，而在目前这个时刻更是极端的需要”。

sentences.english: But otherwise, it is best left to the humanitarian experts, who will be there after you are gone and therefore need to preserve their independence and their impartiality.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果不能，最好将这些任务留给人道主义专家，这些专家在部队撤退之后仍将留在那，因此需要保持他们的独立和公正。

name: throng
trans: n. 一大群，众多 v. 蜂拥，群集 adj. <苏格兰，北英格兰>拥挤的

sentences.english: She got lost in the throng.
sentences.chinese: 她在人群中迷路了。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people in one place
if people throng a place, they go there in large numbers

name: civilian
trans: n. 平民，百姓（区别于军、警） adj. 平民的，民用的

sentences.english: Many innocent civilians were killed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 许多无辜的平民在战争中丧生。

sentences.english: It was difficult to return to civilian life after ten years in the military.
sentences.chinese: 从军十年后重新过平民生活不容易。

detailed_translations.english: anyone who is not a member of the military forces or the police
used to describe people or things that are not military

name: monarch
trans: n. 君主，女王；黑脉金斑蝶；王鹟

sentences.english: Britain's head of state is a constitutional monarch.
sentences.chinese: 英国的国家元首是君主立宪的国王或女王。

detailed_translations.english: a king or queen

name: conservative
trans: adj. 保守的；保守派的，保守主义的（认为政府应该实行政治保守主义）；（衣着）守旧的，传统的；低估的；保守党的；不愿冒险的，谨慎的 n. 保守者，因循守旧者；保守党党员，保守党支持者

sentences.english: a very conservative attitude to education
sentences.chinese: 对待教育非常守旧的态度

sentences.english: conservative views
sentences.chinese: 保守的观点

sentences.english: an argument between reformers and conservatives in the organization
sentences.chinese: 该组织内部的改革派和保守派之争

detailed_translations.english: not liking changes or new ideas
someone who does not like changes in politics, ideas, or fashion

name: envoy
trans: n. 使者，使节，（谈判等的）代表；公使（级别在大使之下）

sentences.english: The United Nations is sending a special envoy to the area.
sentences.chinese: 联合国将向该地区派遣一位特使。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is sent to another country as an official representative

name: aristocrat
trans: n. 贵族，贵族成员

sentences.english: ...a wealthy southern aristocrat.
sentences.chinese: …一位富有的南方贵族。

detailed_translations.english: someone who belongs to the highest social class

name: gentry
trans: n. <英，旧>上流人士，贵族；<非正式，贬>人们（尤指特定种类） n. （Gentry）金特里（人名）

sentences.english: a member of the landed gentry
sentences.chinese: 地主乡绅中的一员

detailed_translations.chinese: 人们（多用贬义）；贵族们；（英）上流社会人士
detailed_translations.english: people who belong to a high social class

name: autocrat
trans: n. 独裁者，专制君主；独断独行的人

sentences.english: He was an accomplished politician and a crafty autocrat.
sentences.chinese: 他是个有造诣的政治家，也是个狡黠的独裁者。

sentences.english: He was an accomplished politician and a crafty autocrat.
sentences.chinese: 他是个杰出的政治家，也是个狡黠的独裁者。

sentences.english: She wrote a lot of books that exposed the avarice of the authoritarian . the autocracy of the autocrat and the falsity of the autonomy.
sentences.chinese: 她写了许多书，暴露了权力主义者的贪婪，独裁者的独裁政体和自治权的虚伪。

detailed_translations.english: a ruler who has complete power over a country

name: delegate
trans: n. 代表；委员会成员 v. 授权，把……委托给；选派（某人做某事）

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

detailed_translations.chinese: 委派…为代表； 授 ， 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc

name: democrat
trans: n. （美国）民主党党员；民主主义者

sentences.english: Murray has joined other Senate Democrats in blocking the legislation.
sentences.chinese: 默里已经加入其他民主党参议员反对这项立法了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民主党人；民主主义者；民主政体论者
detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in democracy, or works to achieve it

name: independent
trans: adj. 自治的，独立的；自立的，自力更生的；公正的，不受他人影响的；分离的，单独的；私营的；无党派的；有主见的，有独立见解的 n. 独立自主者，独立团体；无党派政治家；公理会教友

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

name: candidate
trans: n. 候选人，申请者；有望体验（得到）……的人（物）；投考者，考生；攻读学位者

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

name: balmy
trans: adj. 芳香的；温和的；止痛的 n. （Balmy）人名；（法）巴尔米

sentences.english: a balmy summer night
sentences.chinese: 一个宜人的夏夜

detailed_translations.english: balmy air, weather etc is warm and pleasant

name: humid
trans: adj. 潮湿的，湿热的

sentences.english: Tokyo is extremely humid in mid-summer.
sentences.chinese: 仲夏的东京十分潮湿。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot

name: humidity
trans: n. 潮湿，湿气；湿度

sentences.english: The room is kept at 72 degrees and 50% relative humidity.
sentences.chinese: 房间的温度保持在72度，相对湿度50%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of water contained in the air

name: damp
trans: adj. 潮湿的 n. 湿气，潮气；沼气；气馁 v. 使潮湿，弄湿；减弱，抑制；把（火）调小；限止（钢琴或其他乐器琴弦）的音；减幅，阻尼

sentences.english: Damp had stained the walls.
sentences.chinese: 墙上留下了潮湿的痕迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使潮湿；使阻尼；使沮丧，抑制
detailed_translations.english: to dampen something
water in walls or in the air that causes things to be slightly wet
slightly wet, often in an unpleasant way

name: dank
trans: adj. 潮湿的；阴湿的；透水的 n. （Dank）人名；（英）丹克；（匈）东克

sentences.english: a dank prison cell
sentences.chinese: 阴冷的牢房

detailed_translations.english: unpleasantly wet and cold

name: moisture
trans: n. 潮气，水分

sentences.english: Plants use their roots to absorb moisture from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物利用根从土壤中吸收水分。

sentences.english: Your skin’s moisture content varies according to weather conditions.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤的水分含量随着天气状况而变化。

detailed_translations.english: small amounts of water that are present in the air, in a substance, or on a surface

name: saturate
trans: v. 使湿透，浸透；使充满，使饱和；充斥（市场），使（市场）供大于求；使（化学溶液）饱和；饱和磁化；饱和充电；饱和轰炸 adj. <文>湿透的；饱和的 n. 饱和脂肪

sentences.english: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 水从洞里流进来，浸湿了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满
detailed_translations.english: to make something very wet

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的

name: drought
trans: n. 长期缺乏，严重短缺；<古>口渴；干旱，旱灾

sentences.english: ...a country where drought and famines have killed up to two million people during the last eighteen years.
sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

name: arid
trans: adj. （土地或气候）干燥的，干旱的；枯燥的，乏味的；不成功的，无结果的

sentences.english: Water from the Great Lakes is pumped to arid regions .
sentences.chinese: 五大湖中的水被输往干旱地区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 干旱的；不毛的，[农] 荒芜的
detailed_translations.english: arid land or an arid  climate  is very dry because it has very little rain

name: chilly
trans: adj. 阴冷的，寒冷的；有寒意的；不友好的，冷淡的

sentences.english: Getting chilly, isn’t it?
sentences.chinese: 天冷了，是不是？

sentences.english: The bathroom’s a bit chilly.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里有点冷。

detailed_translations.english: chilly weather or places are cold enough to make you feel uncomfortable

name: chill
trans: n. 寒冷，寒意；着凉，受寒；害怕，担心；冷漠，敌意；冷模，冷模部件 v. （使）冷却，冰镇；使很冷；惊吓，使恐惧；<非正式>放松；（使）沮丧，（使）扫兴 adj. 冷飕飕的；令人紧张的，令人害怕的

sentences.english: There was a slight chill in the air .
sentences.chinese: 空气中有些微的寒意。

sentences.english: I turned on the heater in the hall to take the chill off the house (= to heat it slightly ) .
sentences.chinese: 我开了厅里的暖气给屋子驱寒。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of coldness
unpleasantly cold

detailed_translations.chinese: 冷冻，冷藏；使寒心；使感到冷
detailed_translations.english: if you chill something such as food or drink, or if it chills, it becomes very cold but does not freeze

name: frigid
trans: adj. 寒冷的，严寒的；冷淡的

sentences.english: The guard looked at us with a frigid stare.
sentences.chinese: 守卫冷冷地盯着我们。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is frigid does not like having sex

name: serene
trans: adj. 平静的，安详的；清澈的，晴朗的 n. <古>晴空，平静的大海；平静

sentences.english: The child’s face was serene and beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子的神情宁静可爱。

sentences.english: a serene mountain lake
sentences.chinese: 静谧的山间湖泊

detailed_translations.chinese: 平静的；安详的；清澈的；晴朗的
detailed_translations.english: very calm or peaceful

name: tepid
trans: adj. 微温的，温热的；不太热烈的；不热情的

sentences.english: a tepid response from the audience
sentences.chinese: 观众冷淡的反应

detailed_translations.chinese: 微温的，温热的；不太热烈的；不热情的
detailed_translations.english: a feeling, reaction etc that is tepid shows a lack of excitement or interest

name: gale
trans: n. 大风，狂风；海上风暴；一阵笑声（或哭声等）

sentences.english: a severe gale
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风

detailed_translations.chinese: [气象] 大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵
detailed_translations.english: a very strong wind

name: hurricane
trans: n. 飓风；爆发

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

name: atmosphere
trans: n. （包围地球或其他行星的）大气，大气层；（房间或其他场所内的）空气；气氛，环境；情调，感染力

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: climate
trans: n. 气候；气候区；氛围，局势

sentences.english: Los Angeles’ warm dry climate
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶温暖干燥的气候

detailed_translations.chinese: 气候； 风土， 地带； 风气， 气氛
detailed_translations.english: the typical weather conditions in a particular area

name: barometer
trans: n. 气压计，晴雨表；变化的标志，指标

sentences.english: The skin is an accurate barometer of emotional and physical health.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤是反映一个人身心健康状况的准确指标。

detailed_translations.chinese: [气象] 气压计；晴雨表；显示变化的事物
detailed_translations.english: an instrument that measures changes in the air pressure and the weather, or that calculates height above sea level

name: breeze
trans: n. 微风，和风；轻而易举的事；煤屑，焦炭渣；<英，非正式>骚动，争吵 v. 轻盈而自信地走；轻松过关，轻易通过；吹微风

sentences.english: flowers waving in the breeze
sentences.chinese: 在微风中摇曳的花儿

detailed_translations.chinese: 微风；轻而易举的事；煤屑；焦炭渣；小风波
detailed_translations.english: a gentle wind

name: blast
trans: n. 爆炸，爆破；冲击波；爆炸声，爆破声；强劲的（气或水）流，疾风；吹奏声，轰鸣；严厉的批评；狂欢，有趣的事；（球队或选手的）猛烈进攻；枪击；<美>（公司、组织等发出的）群发电子邮件 v. 炸毁，爆破；轰开，炸开（通路）；向……射击，枪击；发出刺耳的高音；严厉批评，痛斥；由爆炸引起；用力踢，猛击；喷射（水流、气流等）；使枯萎；<美，非正式>轻易击败；损坏，摧毁；开，炸开（通路） int. <非正式>该死，讨厌

sentences.english: I had the gas fire going full blast .
sentences.chinese: 我把煤气取暖器开到最大。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement of wind or air
to criticize someone or something very strongly – used especially in news reports

name: whirlwind
trans: n. 旋风，旋流；旋风般的突发事件，匆忙的事情；旋风式的人 adj. 旋风般的，快速的，匆忙的

sentences.english: a whirlwind romance
sentences.chinese: 旋风式恋爱

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋风；旋风般的快速行动
detailed_translations.english: an extremely strong wind that moves quickly with a circular movement, causing a lot of damage
a whirlwind situation or event happens very quickly

name: typhoon
trans: n. （印度洋及西太平洋的）台风

sentences.english: They have received notice of a typhoon approaching.
sentences.chinese: 他们已收到台风即将来临的预报。

sentences.english: We both are under stress and standing in the middle of a typhoon .
sentences.chinese: 你我都处在很紧张的环境中，站在台风的中心。

sentences.english: The football match have to stand over next week for the typhoon storm.
sentences.chinese: 由于台风风暴，这场足球赛延期到下个星期举行。

detailed_translations.english: a very violent tropical storm

name: tornado
trans: n. 龙卷风，大旋风；极具破坏力的人（或物），情感火爆的人

sentences.english: The tornado rubbished the whole village.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风毁掉了整个村庄。

sentences.english: The tornado disrupted broadcasting along the entire coast.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风使整个沿海的广播都中断了。

sentences.english: The tornado is coming, so we had better batten down the hatches here and get to the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风即将来临，因此我们最好把这里的舱口封上，到地下室去。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely violent storm consisting of air that spins very quickly and causes a lot of damage

name: meteorology
trans: n. 气象状态，气象学

sentences.english: This is a book about meteorology.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是讲气象的。

sentences.english: It plays an increasingly important part in meteorology for cloud, precipitation, hail and thunderstorm detection as well as the navigation of aircraft and ships.
sentences.chinese: 它在对云层、降水、冰雹和雷暴的气象探测以及在船舰和飞机的导航中，起着日益重要的作用。

sentences.english: All of this depends on certain assumptions and the meteorology, the geology and the hydrology of the area plus the contours of the land around this particular power plant.
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些都是根据某些假设,和气象状态，地质情况，还有，水文请跨国,在加上土地的等高线,在这个特定的核能电站的周围。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of weather conditions

name: troposphere
trans: n. 对流层

sentences.english: The orange layer is known as the troposphere, where all of the weather and clouds are generated and contained.
sentences.chinese: 橘黄色的那一层被称为“对流层”，那里是所有的气候状况和云层形成和演变的地方。

sentences.english: The lowest layer of the atmosphere is known as the troposphere, which is constantly in motion, causing the weather.
sentences.chinese: 地球大气层的最底层是所谓的对流层，这一层的大气不断运动，引起了气象变化。

sentences.english: The reasons are as below, the Pacific jet stream or planetary waves in troposphere can directly affect the Pacific center of action of the AO.
sentences.chinese: 这主要是因为太平洋急流或准定常行星波在对流层中直接影响了位于该区域的北极涛动的活动中心。

detailed_translations.english: the lowest atmospheric layer, about 18 kilometres (11 miles) thick at the equator to about 6 km (4 miles) at the Poles, in which air temperature decreases normally with height at about 6.5°C per km

name: current
trans: adj. 现行的，当前的；通用的，流行的；最近的 n. 水流，气流；电流；思潮，趋势

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: funnel
trans: n. 漏斗；漏斗状物；（船、蒸汽机车上的）烟囱 v. 通过漏斗，穿过狭窄通道；输送，传送（金钱、货物或信息）；（一端逐渐扩大或收缩）形成漏斗状

sentences.english: ...a ship with three masts and two funnels.
sentences.chinese: …一艘有3根桅杆和2个烟囱的轮船。

detailed_translations.english: a thin tube with a wide top that you use for pouring liquid into a container with a narrow opening, such as a bottle

detailed_translations.chinese: 通过漏斗或烟囱等；使成漏斗形

name: smog
trans: n. （通常指城市中汽车、工厂等排出的）烟雾，雾霾

sentences.english: Cars cause pollution, both smog and acid rain.
sentences.chinese: 汽车引起污染，既有烟雾又有酸雨。

detailed_translations.english: dirty air that looks like a mixture of smoke and  fog  , caused by smoke from cars and factories in cities

name: fog
trans: n. 雾；烟雾，尘雾；困惑，迷惘；（底片等的）灰雾，雾翳 v. 使令人困惑，使费解；底片产生灰雾；起雾

sentences.english: It will be a cold night, and there may be fog patches .
sentences.chinese: 今夜天气寒冷，部分地区可能有雾。

sentences.english: A blanket of fog covered the fields.
sentences.chinese: 大雾笼罩了田野。

sentences.english: The fog lifted (= disappeared ) in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午，雾散了。

detailed_translations.english: cloudy air near the ground which is difficult to see through

detailed_translations.chinese: 使模糊；使困惑；以雾笼罩
detailed_translations.english: if something made of glass fogs or becomes fogged, it becomes covered in small drops of water that make it difficult to see through

name: precipitate
trans: v. <正式>使……突然降临，加速（坏事的发生）；使突然陷入（某种状态）（precipitate sb./sth. into）；（使）沉淀，（使）淀析；<正式>使急落直下，使陡然下落；降水（如雨、雪、冰雹） adj. <正式>鲁莽的，仓促的（=precipitous）；（事件，情况）突如其来的，突然的；猛地落下的 n. 沉淀物，析出物

sentences.english: The riot was precipitated when four black men were arrested.
sentences.chinese: 这场骚乱是因为四名黑人男子的被捕而突然引发的。

sentences.english: I don't think we should make precipitate decisions.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们不应该做出仓促的决定。

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance that has been chemically separated from a liquid

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉淀；促成；猛抛；使陷入
detailed_translations.english: to make something serious happen suddenly or more quickly than was expected

detailed_translations.chinese: 突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的
detailed_translations.english: A precipitate action or decision happens or is made more quickly or suddenly than most people think is sensible

name: precipitation
trans: n. 降水（如雨，雪，冰雹）；沉淀，淀析；仓促，鲁莽，轻率；坠落

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；降水；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽
detailed_translations.english: rain, snow etc that falls on the ground, or the amount of rain, snow etc that falls

name: drizzle
trans: v. 下毛毛雨，下蒙蒙细雨； （毛毛雨似的）洒落；（毛毛雨似的）洒落 n. 毛毛细雨，蒙蒙细雨；（烹）（浇在食品上的）液态调料细流

sentences.english: The rain isn’t too bad – it’s only drizzling.
sentences.chinese: 雨下得不大——只是毛毛细雨而已。

detailed_translations.english: if it is drizzling, light rain and mist come out of the sky
weather that is a combination of light rain and mist

name: blizzard
trans: n. 暴风雪；大批侵扰性的事物，大量的负担 v. 下暴风雪

sentences.english: We got stuck in a blizzard.
sentences.chinese: 我们被暴风雪困住了。

detailed_translations.english: a severe snowstorm

name: dew
trans: n. 露水；（似露珠的）小水珠 v. <文>用水珠弄湿

sentences.english: The dew gathered on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 露水在叶片上聚集。

detailed_translations.english: the small drops of water that form on outdoor surfaces during the night

name: downpour
trans: n. 倾盆大雨；注下

sentences.english: ...sheltering from a sudden downpour of rain.
sentences.chinese: …躲避一场突如其来的瓢泼大雨。

detailed_translations.english: a lot of rain that falls in a short time

name: droplet
trans: n. 小滴，微滴

sentences.english: Droplets of sweat were welling up on his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 一颗颗小汗珠从他额头上不断冒出来。

detailed_translations.english: a very small drop of liquid

name: frost
trans: n. 严寒天气，霜冻；霜；冷淡，冷漠；<英，非正式>失败 v. （使）蒙上霜，结霜；<美>在（糕饼）上撒糖霜；<美>将（头发）挑染成淡色；为（玻璃）制毛面；受冻

sentences.english: the risk of frost damage to crops
sentences.chinese: 庄稼遭受霜冻灾害的危险

detailed_translations.english: very cold weather, when water freezes
to cover a cake with a mixture of powdery sugar and liquid

name: vapor
trans: n. 蒸气；水蒸气（等于 vapour）

sentences.english: This system traps the gasoline vapor escaping from the fuel tank and carburetor .
sentences.chinese: 这个系统能收集从燃油箱和化油器泄漏出来的汽油蒸气。

sentences.english: The phenomenon of vapor explosions threatens the safe storage and transportation of liquefied petroleum gas.
sentences.chinese: 液化石油气蒸汽爆炸是对其安全储运构成很大威胁的一种观象。

sentences.english: And so, you make not only water vapor, NOX but you make some nitrous oxides, NOX, or nox as it is known, and this is the precursor to smog.
sentences.chinese: 这样不仅仅得到的水蒸气，但是你会得到一些氮氧化物，或者如大家所知到的nox，这是烟雾的前驱体。

name: tempest
trans: n. 暴风雨；骚动；动乱 vt. 使狂怒；扰乱，使激动 vi. 小题大作；起大风暴 n. （Tempest）人名；（英）坦皮斯特

sentences.english: I hadn't foreseen the tempest my request would cause.
sentences.chinese: 我没有想到我的请求会带来这么大一场风波。

detailed_translations.english: a violent storm

name: shower
trans: n. 淋浴器，花洒；淋浴间，淋浴室；淋浴，洗澡；阵雨，阵雪；（落下的东西）一大批，一阵； 流星雨；<美>（为即将结婚或分娩的女子举行的）送礼聚会；<英，非正式> 一群乌合之众，一群笨蛋 v. 淋浴，洗澡；洒落，（使）纷纷降落；朝......阵雨般地扔（大量小东西）（shower sb. with）；大量给予，慷慨给予

sentences.english: Why does the phone always ring when I’m in the shower?
sentences.chinese: 为什么电话铃总是在我洗澡的时候响？

sentences.english: I’d like to use the shower if that’s all right.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以的话，我想用一下这里的淋浴。

sentences.english: The bathroom has a separate shower cubicle (= a shower in a separate part of the room ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫生间里有一个独立的淋浴间。

sentences.english: I need a shower.
sentences.chinese: 我需要洗个淋浴。

sentences.english: Mike shaved and showered.
sentences.chinese: 迈克刮了脸，冲了个淋浴。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that you stand under to wash your whole body
to wash your whole body while standing under a shower

name: hail
trans: v. 赞扬，欢呼；呼喊，招呼；下冰雹；（大量物体）像雹子般落下（或击打）；<古>表示问候或欢呼欢迎 n. 冰雹；雹子般的一阵；招呼（某人）

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

name: condense
trans: v. 冷凝，凝结；压缩，简缩；浓缩，变浓

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

name: crystal
trans: n. 结晶，晶体；水晶；水晶玻璃；（钟表的）石英玻璃保护面，表蒙子 adj. 晶莹的，清澈透明的

sentences.english: ice/salt crystals
sentences.chinese: 冰 / 盐的结晶体

sentences.english: a pair of crystal earrings
sentences.chinese: 一对水晶耳环

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of a substance with many even sides, that is formed naturally when the substance becomes solid

name: penal
trans: adj. 刑事的；刑罚的

sentences.english: the penal system
sentences.chinese: 刑罚制度

detailed_translations.english: relating to the legal punishment of criminals, especially in prisons

name: illicit
trans: adj. 非法的，社会不容许的

sentences.english: the illicit trade in stolen cattle
sentences.chinese: 非法买卖偷来的牛

detailed_translations.english: not allowed by laws or rules, or strongly disapproved of by society

name: unruly
trans: adj. 不守规矩的；任性的；难驾驭的

sentences.english: unruly children
sentences.chinese: 难管教的孩子

sentences.english: unruly behaviour
sentences.chinese: 粗暴的行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 不守规矩的；任性的；难驾驭的
detailed_translations.english: violent or difficult to control

name: illegitimate
trans: adj. 私生的；非法的；不合理的 vt. 认做私生子；认为违法 n. 非嫡出子；庶子

sentences.english: his illegitimate son
sentences.chinese: 他的私生子

detailed_translations.chinese: 私生的；非法的；不合理的
detailed_translations.english: born to parents who are not married

name: default
trans: n. 不履行，违约；默认，系统设定值；缺席，弃权 v. 违约，不履行义务；默认，预设；弃权，未到场 adj. 默认的

sentences.english: Mortgage defaults have risen in the last year.
sentences.chinese: 按揭借款违约在近一年里呈上升趋势。

sentences.english: to default on a loan/debt
sentences.chinese: 拖欠借款 / 债务

detailed_translations.english: failure to do something that you are supposed to do according to the law or because it is your duty
to not do something that you are supposed to do, especially that you are legally supposed to do

name: violate
trans: v. 违反，违背；侵犯，打扰；亵渎，损毁（神圣之地等）；<文>强奸

sentences.english: 34 protesters were arrested for violating criminal law.
sentences.chinese: 34名抗议者因违反刑法而被逮捕。

sentences.english: regimes that violate human rights
sentences.chinese: 侵犯人权的政权

detailed_translations.english: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc

name: violation
trans: n. （对法律、协议、原则等的）违背，违反；侵权行为，（对人权的）侵犯；（对某物的）损毁，（对圣地的）亵渎；强奸

sentences.english: human rights violations
sentences.chinese: 违反人权

detailed_translations.chinese: 违反；妨碍，侵害；违背；强奸
detailed_translations.english: an action that breaks a law, agreement, principle etc

name: infringe
trans: v. 违反，违背（法律、规则等）；侵犯，侵害（权益）

sentences.english: A backup copy of a computer program does not infringe copyright.
sentences.chinese: 计算机程序的备份不侵犯版权。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that is against a law or someone’s legal rights

name: bound
trans: adj. 必然的，肯定的；受约束的，有义务的；被……所限制的，被……所束缚的；要到……去的，驶往……的；装订好的，有封面的；（与……）紧密相连的，关系密切；准备就绪的；（语法要素）黏附的 v. 跳跃，蹦跳着走；形成……的边界，划界；限制，约束；突然增长，急剧上升；（尤指圆形的物体）弹回，弹开 n. 界限，限制；蹦跳，跳跃 v. 捆绑；使团结；凝结（bind 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.english: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

detailed_translations.english: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

name: compulsory
trans: adj. 必须做的，义务的，强制的 n. （花样滑冰、竞技体操等的）规定动作

sentences.english: the threat of compulsory redundancies
sentences.chinese: 强制性裁员的威胁

sentences.english: Car insurance is compulsory.
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险是强制性的。

detailed_translations.english: that must be done because of a law or a rule

name: oblige
trans: v. 迫使，责成；施恩惠于，帮……的忙；<古>使（某人）遵守誓约（或承诺、约定）

sentences.english: Mr. Oakley has always been ready to oblige journalists with information.
sentences.chinese: 奥克利先生一直乐于提供信息帮助记者们。

sentences.english: We called up three economists to ask how to eliminate the deficit and they obliged with very straightforward answers.
sentences.chinese: 我们致电3位经济学家咨询消除赤字的方法，他们满足了我们的要求，给出了非常直接的答复。

detailed_translations.english: To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 迫使；施恩于，帮…的忙；使感激
detailed_translations.english: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

name: obligatory
trans: adj. 有义务的，强制性的；惯常的，赶时髦的；（规定，裁决）有约束力的

sentences.english: She offered him the obligatory cup of tea.
sentences.chinese: 她照例给他端来一杯茶。

detailed_translations.chinese: (法律或道义上)必须的，应尽的
detailed_translations.english: something that is obligatory must be done because of a law, rule etc

name: responsible
trans: adj. （对某人、某事）负责的；（对事故、错误、罪行等）负有责任的，应承担责任的；（工作或职位）重要的，责任重大的；可靠的，负责任的；作为缘由的，应受归咎的；向......负责的，向......汇报的

sentences.english: We are determined to bring the people responsible to justice.
sentences.chinese: 我们决意要将肇事者绳之以法。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is responsible for an accident, mistake, crime etc, it is their fault or they can be blamed

name: domineering
trans: adj. 跋扈的；专横的；盛气凌人的 v. 实行暴政；高耸；流行（domineer 的 ing 形式）

sentences.english: a domineering mother
sentences.chinese: 专横的母亲

detailed_translations.chinese: 跋扈的；专横的；盛气凌人的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is domineering tries to control other people without considering their feelings or ideas – used to show disapproval

detailed_translations.chinese: 实行暴政；高耸；流行（domineer的ing形式）

name: mandatory
trans: adj. 强制性的，义务的；受（前国际联盟）委任统治的 n. 受托人，代理人（=mandatary）

sentences.english: Murder carries a mandatory life sentence .
sentences.chinese: 谋杀罪依照法律要判无期徒刑。

sentences.english: The Council has made it mandatory for all nurses to attend a refresher course every three years.
sentences.chinese: 理事会规定所有护士必须每三年参加一次进修课程。

detailed_translations.english: if something is mandatory, the law says it must be done

name: licensed
trans: adj. 得到许可的（等于 licenced） v. 许可；批准（license 的过去分词）

name: heirship
trans: n. 继承权，继承人的地位

name: jurisdiction
trans: n. 司法权，审判权；管辖权；管辖区域，管辖范围

sentences.english: The British police have no jurisdiction over foreign bank accounts.
sentences.chinese: 英国警方对外国银行的账户没有司法管辖权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 司法权，审判权，管辖权；权限，权力
detailed_translations.english: the right to use an official power to make legal decisions, or the area where this right exists

name: arbitration
trans: n. 仲裁，公断

sentences.english: The dispute is going to arbitration (=  someone is being asked to arbitrate  ) .
sentences.chinese: 这场争议将提请仲裁。

sentences.english: Both sides in the dispute have agreed to binding arbitration .
sentences.chinese: 纠纷双方都接受了约束性仲裁。

detailed_translations.english: the process of judging officially how an argument should be settled

name: fine
trans: adj. 令人满意的，可以接受的；值得崇敬的；健康的，身体好的；优质的，出色的，美好的；晴朗的；纤细的，细小的；精美的，精巧的；细微的，细密的；<非正式>糟糕的；矫饰的，华而不实的 adv. 很，很好；精致地，精美地；细小地 v. 罚款，处以罚金；使变纯，使澄清；使变细，使变瘦；<非正式>放晴 n. 罚金，罚款；微小颗粒

sentences.english: Many people regard Beethoven’s fifth symphony as his finest work.
sentences.chinese: 很多人认为贝多芬的第五交响曲是他最杰出的作品。

sentences.english: He’s a very fine player.
sentences.chinese: 他是个很优秀的选手。

sentences.english: It’s a fine idea.
sentences.chinese: 这是个很妙的主意。

sentences.english: Hatfield House is a fine example of Jacobean architecture.
sentences.chinese: 哈特菲尔德宅第是英王詹姆斯一世时期建筑的典范。

sentences.english: The restaurant was chosen for its good food and fine wines .
sentences.chinese: 这家餐厅因其美酒佳肴而入选。

detailed_translations.english: very good or of a very high standard

name: confiscate
trans: v. 没收，查抄（某人的财产）；充公，罚没（某物，尤指土地） adj. 被没收的

sentences.english: Miss Williams confiscated all our sweets.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯老师没收了我们所有的糖果。

sentences.english: Many opposition supporters had their goods confiscated.
sentences.chinese: 许多反对党支持者的财产被充公了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially take private property away from someone, usually as a punishment

name: convict
trans: v. 定罪，宣判……有罪 n. 已决犯，服刑囚犯

sentences.english: a convicted murderer
sentences.chinese: 已定罪的谋杀犯

sentences.english: an escaped convict
sentences.chinese: 越狱犯

detailed_translations.english: to prove or officially announce that someone is guilty of a crime after a trial in a law court
someone who has been proved to be guilty of a crime and sent to prison

name: verdict
trans: n. （法庭的）裁定，判决；（权威的）评判，定论；意见，决定

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

name: judgment
trans: n. 判断，看法；判断力，识别力；判决，裁决；报应，天谴

sentences.english: I’ve known him for years and I trust his judgment.
sentences.chinese: 我与他相识多年，相信他的判断力。

sentences.english: a decision based on sound judgment
sentences.chinese: 以良好的判断力为基础的决定

sentences.english: Watch carefully and use your judgment.
sentences.chinese: 仔细观察并运用自己的判断力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 判断；裁判；判决书；辨别力
detailed_translations.english: the ability to make sensible decisions about what to do and when to do it

name: indemnity
trans: n. 补偿，赔偿；保障；赔偿物

sentences.english: insurance providing indemnity against future liabilities
sentences.chinese: 对将来的债务提供保障的保险

detailed_translations.english: protection against loss or damage, especially in the form of a promise to pay for any losses or damage

name: imprisonment
trans: n. 监禁，关押

sentences.english: She was sentenced to seven years' imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: 她被判处7年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: Imprisonment is the state of being imprisoned

name: invalidate
trans: v. （对论点、声明或理论）驳斥，证明是谬误的；使无效，使作废

sentences.english: Failure to disclose all relevant changes may invalidate your policy.
sentences.chinese: 未能披露所有的相关变化会令保单无效。

detailed_translations.english: to make a document, ticket, claim etc no longer legally or officially acceptable

name: imprisonment
trans: n. 监禁，关押

sentences.english: She was sentenced to seven years' imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: 她被判处7年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: Imprisonment is the state of being imprisoned

name: captivity
trans: n. 囚禁；被关

sentences.english: The hostages were released from captivity.
sentences.chinese: 人质被释放了。

detailed_translations.english: when a person or animal is kept in a prison,  cage  etc and not allowed to go where they want

name: trial
trans: n. 审判，审理；试验，试用；（对人的忍耐、自制力的）考验，磨练；烦人的事，惹麻烦的人；预赛，选拔赛；（检验车手技能的）摩托车障碍检验赛；（动物的）比赛，表演 v. 测试，试验；（马、狗等动物）参加比赛 adj. 试验性的

sentences.english: The trial is due to start next week.
sentences.chinese: 审理定于下周开始。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试， 试验； 审判； 讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a legal process in which a judge and often a  jury  in a court of law examine information to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime

name: detain
trans: v. 拘留，扣押；耽搁，阻留

sentences.english: Two suspects have been detained by the police for questioning .
sentences.chinese: 两名嫌疑人被警方拘留审问。

sentences.english: He was detained in Washington on urgent business.
sentences.chinese: 他因紧急事务耽搁在了华盛顿。

detailed_translations.english: to officially prevent someone from leaving a place

name: extenuate
trans: v. 减轻（过错等）的程度，使看起来情有可原；使瘦削

sentences.english: Nothing can extenuate his base conduct.
sentences.chinese: 他的卑鄙行为无可掩饰。

sentences.english: My dear sir, I've no wish to extenuate the Count'stransgressions;
sentences.chinese: 先生，我井不想减轻伯爵的过失；

detailed_translations.english: to represent (an offence, a fault, etc) as being less serious than it appears, as by showing mitigating circumstances

name: saddle
trans: n. 鞍，马鞍；（自行车或摩托车的）车座；（羊、兔或鹿的）脊肉；（哺乳动物或家禽的）后背部，脊；（电缆、电线或管的）托架；（窑里用于支撑陶瓷器的）耐火黏土托架；（役马的）鞍部；（山的）鞍部；鞍点 v. 给（马）装鞍；（驯马师）使（马）参加比赛；使承担（责任、任务），使负重担；跨上马鞍

sentences.english: It is no surprise that she could saddle the horses.
sentences.chinese: 她能给马备鞍并没有什么值得惊讶的。

sentences.english: Thee bike's frame, wheels, handlebars and saddle are all made of cardboard in this way, and then fitted together.
sentences.chinese: 自行车的车架、车轮、车把和车座都用以此方式制造的纸板制成，然后组装在一起。

detailed_translations.english: a leather seat that you sit on when you ride a horse
to put a saddle on a horse

name: court
trans: n. 法院，法庭；球场；王宫，宫廷；朝臣；全体审判人员；庭院，院子；董事（会），理事（会）；（用于大型宅第和公寓街区的名称中）宅第，公寓大楼；（用于大型宅第和公寓街区的名称中）宅第，公寓大楼 v. 奉承，讨好；设法取得，追求；招致，引起（不愉快的事）；谈恋爱，求爱

sentences.english: It could not be proved in a court of law.
sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

sentences.english: The court case lasted six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼持续了六个星期。

sentences.english: Four people will appear in court today, charged with fraud.
sentences.chinese: 今天将有四个人因被指控犯有欺诈罪出庭受审。

sentences.english: The court ruled that no compensation was due.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判决不予赔偿。

sentences.english: She threatened to take the magazine to court (= take legal action against them ) if they didn’t publish an immediate apology.
sentences.chinese: 她威胁说如果这家杂志不立刻刊登道歉声明，她就要把他们告上法庭。

detailed_translations.english: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the jury who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty

name: bar
trans: n. 酒吧；吧台；小吃店；块，棒；栏杆，闩；障碍；小节；功能条；球门横梁；条纹，带；律师职业；（法庭中的）法庭围栏，被告席（the Bar）；沙洲，暗礁；军阶杠；电热棒；巴（气压单位） v. 阻止，禁止；阻挡，拦住；封，堵 prep. 除了……以外

sentences.english: The public bar was crowded.
sentences.chinese: 大众酒吧间里人很多。

sentences.english: a candy bar
sentences.chinese: 一根糖果棒

sentences.english: houses with bars across the windows
sentences.chinese: 窗户上钉有铁条的房屋

detailed_translations.english: one of the rooms inside a pub

name: exclude
trans: vt. （故意）不包括，把……排除在外；认为……不可能，排除……的可能；阻挡；开除（学生）；防止……的发生

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

name: authorize
trans: v. 批准，许可；授权

sentences.english: an authorized biography
sentences.chinese: 授权传记

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for something

name: empower
trans: v. 授权；给予（某人）权力，使自主

sentences.english: The Voting Rights Act was needed to empower minority groups.
sentences.chinese: 《选举权法案》对于赋予少数民族自主权是必不可少的。

detailed_translations.english: to give a person or organization the legal right to do something

name: plea
trans: n. 恳求，请求；（法庭上所作的）有罪（无罪）陈述；借口，托辞

sentences.english: Caldwell made a plea for donations.
sentences.chinese: 考德威尔恳求捐款。

detailed_translations.english: a request that is urgent or full of emotion

name: oath
trans: n. 誓言，誓约；（在法庭上的）誓词；诅咒，咒骂

sentences.english: The president took the oath of office (= made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统宣誓就职。

sentences.english: She could not break her oath .
sentences.chinese: 她不能违背誓言。

detailed_translations.english: a formal and very serious promise

name: pledge
trans: n. 誓言，保证，承诺；捐款承诺；戒酒誓言（the pledge）；信物；质押；（美国大学中）宣誓加入男生（女生）联谊会的人；<古>为健康祝酒 v. 保证，发誓；使保证，使许诺；承诺给予，承诺提供；用……抵押，以……典押；<美>宣誓加入（大学男生联谊会或女生联谊会）；<古>为健康祝酒

sentences.english: The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.
sentences.chinese: 会议以加快该地区6个州之间合作的承诺结束。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise or agree-ment, especially one made publicly or officially
to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something

name: plaintiff
trans: n. <法律>原告，起诉人

sentences.english: The lead plaintiff of the lawsuit is the University of California.
sentences.chinese: 这次诉讼的第一原告是加利福尼亚大学。

detailed_translations.english: someone who brings a legal action against another person in a court of law

name: plead
trans: v. 恳求，乞求；极力主张，极力为……辩护；（在法庭）申辩，认罪；（向法庭）陈述案情；以……为理由，提出……作借口

sentences.english: ‘Don’t go!’ Robert pleaded.
sentences.chinese: “别走！”罗伯特央求道。

sentences.english: He appeared before the committee to plead his case.
sentences.chinese: 他出现在委员会上为他的案子辩护。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，请求；申诉，答辩，辩护
detailed_translations.english: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…辩护， 提出…为理由
detailed_translations.english: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence

name: flee
trans: v. 逃离，逃避，逃跑

sentences.english: His attackers turned and fled.
sentences.chinese: 袭击他的人转身逃走了。

sentences.english: Masaari spent six months in prison before fleeing the country .
sentences.chinese: 正有蹲了六个月监狱，然后逃出了该国。

detailed_translations.english: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

name: defend
trans: v. 保卫，防御；捍卫，维护；（在比赛中）防守，防卫；参加卫冕赛，蝉联；做……的辩护律师，为……辩解

sentences.english: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。

sentences.english: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

detailed_translations.english: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

name: proscribe
trans: vt. 剥夺……的公权；禁止

sentences.english: The Act proscribes discrimination on the grounds of race.
sentences.chinese: 这项法令禁止种族歧视。

detailed_translations.english: to officially say that something is not allowed to exist or be done

name: forbid
trans: v. 禁止；使不可能，妨碍

sentences.english: He was forbidden to leave the house, as a punishment.
sentences.chinese: 作为惩罚，他被禁止离开家。

sentences.english: Lack of space forbids listing the names of all those who contributed.
sentences.chinese: 由于篇幅限制，无法列出所有捐款人的姓名。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed

name: abstinence
trans: n. 节制；节欲；戒酒；禁食

sentences.english: ...six months of abstinence.
sentences.chinese: …6个月的禁欲。

detailed_translations.english: the practice of not having something you enjoy, especially alcohol or sex, usually for reasons of religion or health

name: abstain
trans: v. 弃权，不投票；戒除，抑制；离开，回避

sentences.english: Three countries abstained in the vote.
sentences.chinese: 三个国家在投票中弃权了。

detailed_translations.english: If you abstain during a vote, you do not use your vote

name: ban
trans: n. 禁止，禁令；逐出令；<史>褫夺公民权的判决；<古>诅咒；巴尼（罗马尼亚货币单位，复数bani） v. 禁止，取缔；（官方）把（某人）逐出某地

sentences.english: Smoking is banned in the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼内禁止吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something must not be done, seen, used etc
an official order that prevents something from being used or done

name: veto
trans: n. 否决权；拒绝认可，禁止 v. 否决，禁止；拒不接受，反对

sentences.english: The Senate had a sufficient majority to override the presidential veto (= not accept his refusal ).
sentences.chinese: 参议院有足够的多数票可以推翻总统的否决。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to give official permission for something, or the right to refuse to give such permission
if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed

name: revise
trans: v. 改变，修正；修改，修订（书刊、估算等）；<英>温习，复习 n. 修订，校订；（印刷）改样

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

name: verify
trans: v. 核实，查证；证明，证实

sentences.english: I verified the source from which I had that information.
sentences.chinese: 我核实了我获知那条信息的来源。

sentences.english: His statement was verified by several witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他的说法得到了几位证人的证实。

detailed_translations.english: to discover whether something is correct or true

name: deserve
trans: v. 值得，应受

sentences.english: What have I done to deserve this?
sentences.chinese: 我做了什么事，要得到这样的报应？

sentences.english: I’m sorry for the kids. They deserve better (= deserve to be treated in a better way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我为这些孩子感到难过，他们应该过得更好。

sentences.english: Ledley deserves a place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 莱德利应该在队里占有一席之地。

sentences.english: Paula deserves a special mention for all the help she has given us.
sentences.chinese: 应该特别提一下葆拉，她给了我们许多帮助。

sentences.english: I would never hit anyone, even if they deserved it.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会打人，哪怕他欠揍。

sentences.english: What has he done to deserve this punishment ?
sentences.chinese: 他做了什么，竟会受到这样的惩罚？

sentences.english: People who are sent to prison for drunk-driving get what they deserve .
sentences.chinese: 那些醉酒驾车被送进监狱的人是罪有应得的。

detailed_translations.english: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

name: stipulate
trans: v. 规定，明确要求 adj. （叶子，植物）有托叶的，具托叶的

sentences.english: Laws stipulate the maximum interest rate that banks can charge.
sentences.chinese: 法律对银行可以收取的最高利率作了规定。

detailed_translations.english: if an agreement, law, or rule stipulates something, it must be done

name: testify
trans: v. （通常指在法庭上）作证；证明，证实；<美>（尤指做礼拜时）见证（上帝存在）

sentences.english: Mr Molto has agreed to testify at the trial.
sentences.chinese: 莫尔托先生已经同意出庭作证。

sentences.english: Can you testify that you saw the defendant at the scene of the crime?
sentences.chinese: 你能作证你看到被告在犯罪现场吗？

detailed_translations.english: to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law
to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law

name: testimony
trans: n. （尤指法庭上的）证词，证言；证据，证明；（宗教皈依或经历的）公开表白

sentences.english: Barker’s testimony is crucial to the prosecution’s case.
sentences.chinese: 巴克的证词对控方的指控起到了关键作用。

sentences.english: In his testimony, he denied that the company had ignored safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 他在证词中否认公司忽视了安全程序。

detailed_translations.english: a formal statement saying that something is true, especially one a  witness  makes in a court of law

name: justify
trans: v. 是……的正当理由；对……作出解释，为……辩解；使（文本）对齐；（在上帝的眼中）称义，使有义；证明合法；整理版面

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

name: substantiate
trans: vt. 证实；使实体化

sentences.english: Katzen offered little evidence to substantiate his claims .
sentences.chinese: 卡曾拿不出什么证据来证明他的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to prove the truth of something that someone has said, claimed etc

name: confirm
trans: v. 确定，确认；证实，证明；批准，认可；使坚定，加强；给（某人）施坚信礼

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

name: affirm
trans: v. 断言，证实； 宣称拥护，支持；认可（判决，协议），批准；不宣誓而提供正式证词；给予（某人）情感支持（或鼓励）

sentences.english: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

name: assure
trans: v. 使确信，向……保证；确保，使确定；给……保险

sentences.english: The document is genuine, I can assure you .
sentences.chinese: 我能向你保证，这文件是真的。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

name: evidence
trans: n. 根据，证明；（呈上法庭的）证据，证词；迹象，痕迹 v. 证实，证明

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: follow
trans: v. 跟着，跟随；尾随，跟踪；（时间、空间或顺序）排在……后；遵循，听从；仿效，追随；循着，沿着（道路、标志等）；沿着……伸延，与……平行；理解，明白；可以推断出，由此得出；有浓厚兴趣，密切关注；信奉，信仰；以……为原型，讲述……的故事；沿袭，继承；跟唱，跟读；从事（行业、职业）；（欣赏节目的同时）对照看（脚本或乐谱）

sentences.english: Are those men following us?
sentences.chinese: 那些人在跟着我们吗？

sentences.english: The patrol car followed the BMW for a few miles and then lost it.
sentences.chinese: 巡逻车跟了那辆宝马几英里，后来就跟丢了。

sentences.english: The conclusion that follows from these findings is that inner city schools need more investment, not less.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些调研得出的结论是，旧城区学校的资金投入需要增加，而不是减少。

detailed_translations.english: to go, walk, drive etc behind or after someone else

name: observe
trans: v. 注意到，观察到；注视，监视；（在科学研究中）观测，发现；说话，评论；遵守（规则、法律等）；庆祝（节日），纪念（某人或事件）；静默，默哀；举行，参加

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: observance
trans: n. 惯例；遵守；仪式；庆祝

sentences.english: the Memorial Day observance
sentences.chinese: 纪念日的习俗

detailed_translations.chinese: (法律习俗等)遵守；奉行；礼仪，仪式
detailed_translations.english: when someone obeys a law or does something because it is part of a religion, custom, or ceremony

name: abide
trans: v. 遵守（abide by）；容忍，忍受；<旧>居住，逗留；（感情，记忆）始终不渝，持续

sentences.english: I can't abide people with no sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌和没有幽默感的人打交道。

sentences.english: You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
sentences.chinese: 你必须遵守俱乐部的规定。

detailed_translations.english: bear, stand

name: accuse
trans: v. 控告，指控；指责，谴责，归咎于

sentences.english: The professor stands accused of (=  has been accused of  ) stealing his student’s ideas and publishing them.
sentences.chinese: 那位教授被指控剽窃学生的观点拿去发表。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

name: accusation
trans: n. 控告，指责，谴责；（尚未证实的被控告的）罪名，罪状

sentences.english: The main accusation levelled against him was that he tried to avoid military service.
sentences.chinese: 对他提出的主要指控是他想逃避兵役。

sentences.english: Burton’s enemies had made false accusations against him.
sentences.chinese: 伯顿的敌人对他提出不实的指责。

sentences.english: She’s made all sorts of wild accusations against me in the past.
sentences.chinese: 她过去对我妄加指责，说了种种不是。

sentences.english: They fled the country, amid accusations of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 在一片贪污腐败的指责声中，他们逃离了该国。

detailed_translations.english: a statement saying that someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something wrong

name: complaint
trans: n. 抱怨，投诉；不满的缘由，抱怨的问题；疾病，不适

sentences.english: If you wish to make a complaint, you should see the manager.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which someone complains about something

name: impeach
trans: vt. 弹劾；归咎；怀疑 n. 控告，检举；弹劾；怀疑

sentences.english: The governor was impeached for using state funds improperly.
sentences.chinese: 州长因违规使用州政府资金而受到弹劾。

detailed_translations.english: if a government official is impeached, they are formally charged with a serious crime in a special government court

name: indictment
trans: n. 指控，控告；谴责，不满；（制度、社会等的）衰败迹象，腐败迹象；诉状，公诉书

name: incriminate
trans: vt. 控告；暗示……有罪

sentences.english: He claimed that the drugs had been planted to incriminate him.
sentences.chinese: 他声称那些毒品是有人为了栽赃陷害他而放在那里的。

detailed_translations.english: If something incriminates you, it suggests that you are responsible for something bad, especially a crime

name: prosecute
trans: v. 起诉，控告，检举；（律师在法庭上）指控，公诉；<正式>继续（尤指战争）；<古>继续从事（某职业），追求

sentences.english: Mrs Lynn Smith, prosecuting, said the offence took place on January 27.
sentences.chinese: 控方律师林恩·史密斯夫人称案件发生于1月27日。

detailed_translations.english: if a lawyer prosecutes a case, he or she tries to prove that the person charged with a crime is guilty
to charge someone with a crime and try to show that they are guilty of it in a court of law

name: denounce
trans: v. 谴责，痛斥；检举，告发

sentences.english: The group denounced the failure by the authorities to take action.
sentences.chinese: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

sentences.english: She denounced him to the police.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方告发了他。

detailed_translations.english: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

name: lawsuit
trans: n. 诉讼，诉讼案

sentences.english: The dispute culminated last week in a lawsuit against the government.
sentences.chinese: 这场针对政府诉讼案的争论在上星期达到了高潮。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or organization brings to a court of law to be settled

name: query
trans: n. 疑问，询问；问号 v. 质疑，对……表示疑问；询问，提问

sentences.english: Staff are always available to answer your queries.
sentences.chinese: 员工随时为您解答疑问。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询
detailed_translations.english: a question that you ask to get information, or to check that something is true or correct
to express doubt about whether something is true or correct

name: interrogate
trans: v. 审问，讯问，质问；（在计算机或其他机器上）查询

sentences.english: The police interrogated the suspect for several hours.
sentences.chinese: 警察盘问了这名嫌疑犯好几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time in order to get information, sometimes using threats

name: impunity
trans: n. 不受惩罚；无患；[法] 免罚

sentences.english: It’s astonishing that these criminals are free to walk the streets with impunity.
sentences.chinese: 令人惊讶的是，这些罪犯可以招摇过市却依然逍遥法外。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不受惩罚；无患；[法] 免罚

name: exempt
trans: adj. 被免除……的，获豁免的 v. 免除，豁免 n. 被免除（义务或责任）的人（尤指被免税者）

sentences.english: So we have the current argument over how much of the derivative market will be exempt from regulation.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们就看到了当前有关衍生产品市场到底有多大份额可以得到规则的豁免的辩论。

sentences.english: All the new rules do is exempt the user from legal liability - something Apple does not appear to be pursuing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 新法规做到的仅仅是免除了用户的法律责任 - 看起来苹果本来也不打算追究这种责任。

sentences.english: So empirical approaches to literature, the simple observation of data from which one can generalize -they exempt these from the general charge against literary theory.
sentences.chinese: 文学的经验主义研究方法，对我们所概括的事物的简单数据观察,对文学理论的普遍控诉中,他们免除了这些。

name: condone
trans: vt. 宽恕；赦免

sentences.english: I cannot condone the use of violence under any circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我不能原谅在任何情况下使用暴力。

detailed_translations.english: to accept or forgive behaviour that most people think is morally wrong

name: liberate
trans: v. 解放，解救；使自由，使摆脱约束；偷窃；释放（气体、能量等）

sentences.english: A few days later, our armies liberated the city.
sentences.chinese: 几天以后，我军解放了这座城市。

detailed_translations.english: to free prisoners, a city, a country etc from someone’s control

name: remit
trans: v. <正式>汇款；<法律>将（案件）发回原审判法庭（重审）；免除（债务、处罚等）；将……提交（权力部门处理）；<法律>将（某人）转到另一法院审判（或听证）；<罕>推迟；<古>使恢复原状；<古>减少 n. <英，非正式> 职权范围；提交审议的事项

detailed_translations.chinese: 宽恕；免除；减轻；传送；使恢复原状
detailed_translations.english: to free someone from a debt or punishment

name: release
trans: v. 释放，放走；使出院；把（动物）放生；解救；放开；拉开，松开（装置）；发射，投（弹）；公布，发布；发行，上映；表达，发泄；释放，排放（物质）； 解除（职务或工作），解雇；放弃，让予；使不紧张；开放，解禁 n. （人或动物的）释放，放出；排放，泄漏；（设备的）松开，拉开；释放装置（如按、拉的装置）；表达，宣泄；解脱，轻松感；放松的机会；新发行的东西；公开，发布；公映；（责任等的）免除，解除；免责书；<法律> 放弃，让予；放弃文书；<美> 传球

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: absolve
trans: vt. 免除；赦免；宣告……无罪

sentences.english: A police investigation yesterday absolved the police of all blame in the incident.
sentences.chinese: 警方昨天的调查为其开脱了在这件事故中所有的责任。

detailed_translations.english: to say publicly that someone is not guilty or responsible for something

name: acquit
trans: vt. 无罪释放；表现；脱卸义务和责任；清偿

sentences.english: All the defendants were acquitted.
sentences.chinese: 所有被告都被判无罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无罪释放；表现；脱卸义务和责任；清偿
detailed_translations.english: to do something well, especially something difficult that you do for the first time in front of other people

name: abolish
trans: v. 废除，废止，取消

sentences.english: Slavery was abolished in the US in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 美国于19世纪废除了奴隶制。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

name: term
trans: n. （某人做某事或某事发生的）时期，期限，任期；学期，开庭期；到期，期满；术语，专有名词；措辞，说话的方式（terms）；方面，角度（terms）；（人们之间的）关系（terms）；条件，条款（terms）；付款条件，购买（出售）条件（terms）；（结束战争，解决争端的）条件（terms）；（数学运算中的）项；（逻）（三段论中的）项；（尤指苏格兰的）法定结账日（term day）；<法律> 有限期租用的地产；（建筑）界标 v. 把……称为，把……叫做

sentences.english: Teachers often feel overworked in term time (= during the term ) .
sentences.chinese: 教师在学期内经常觉得工作担子过重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 术语；学期；期限；条款；(代数式等的)项
detailed_translations.english: a word or expression with a particular meaning, especially one that is used for a specific subject or type of language
to use a particular word or expression to name or describe something

name: clause
trans: n. 从句，分句；（法律文件的）条款

sentences.english: A confidentiality clause was added to the contract.
sentences.chinese: 合同中加上了一项保密条款。

detailed_translations.english: a part of a written law or legal document covering a particular subject of the whole law or document

name: bill
trans: n. （商品、服务或餐馆的）账单；议案，法案；纸币，钞票；演出人员名单；广告，传单；票据，汇票；单子，清单；喙 v. 开账单；把……宣传为；宣布（某人）将参加演出

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: constitution
trans: n. 宪法，章程；体质，体格；组成，结构

sentences.english: The right to speak freely is written into the Constitution of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 言论自由的权利被写入美国宪法。

sentences.english: She’s got a strong constitution – she’ll recover in no time.
sentences.chinese: 她体质强壮，很快就会恢复。

sentences.english: What’s the chemical constitution of the dye?
sentences.chinese: 这种染料的化学成分是什么？

detailed_translations.english: a set of basic laws and principles that a country or organization is governed by

name: decree
trans: n. 法令，政令；裁定，判决 v. 裁定，判决，颁布

sentences.english: We assembled here today are issuing a new decree to be heardin every city, in every foreign capital, and in every hall of power.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们聚集于此，是为了颁布新的命令，让它在每座城市、每个国家的首都、每座权力的殿堂回响。

detailed_translations.english: to make an official judgment or give an official order
an official order or decision, especially one made by the ruler of a country

name: legislate
trans: v. 通过立法实施；制定法律，立法

sentences.english: Most member countries have already legislated against excessive overtime.
sentences.chinese: 大部分成员国已经立法禁止过度加班。

detailed_translations.english: to make a law about something

name: legislation
trans: n. 法规，法律；立法，制订法律

sentences.english: This is a very important piece of legislation (= law ).
sentences.chinese: 这是一条非常重要的法规。

detailed_translations.english: a law or set of laws

name: legalize
