trans: v. 使合法化，使得到法律认可

sentences.english: Divorce was legalized in 1981.
sentences.chinese: 离婚在1981年被合法化了。

detailed_translations.english: If something is legalized, a law is passed that makes it legal

name: prescribe
trans: v. 给……开（药），让……采用（疗法）；开处方；规定，命令；制定规定；推荐，推举

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

name: set
trans: v. 放，置；使开始；把故事情节安排在；设置；摆放餐具；镶嵌；安排；树立；布置；凝固；使现出坚定的表情；固定发型；把（断骨）复位；排版；为……谱曲；落（下）；布置（戏剧、电影或电视节目的布景）；（断骨）愈合 n. 一组（类似的东西）；一组（配套使用的东西）；一伙（或一帮、一群）人；电视机；布景 ；舞台；（网球、排球比赛等的）盘；集；一组歌曲（或乐曲）；（在某学科上能力相当的）一批学生 ；（尤指坚定的）姿势；头发的定型；凝固；兽穴；（供移植的）秧苗 adj. 位于（或处于）……的；安排好的；固定的；套（餐）；有可能的；不自然的

sentences.english: The set (x, y) has two members.
sentences.chinese: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers, shapes etc in mathematics

name: credential
trans: n. 资格，证明；文凭，资格证书；（政府为新任大使提供的）国书 v. 给……提供证书

detailed_translations.chinese: 外交使节所递的国书, 信任状

name: standard
trans: n. （品质的）标准，水平，规范；正常的水平，应达到的标准；行为标准，道德水准（standards）；<英，史>（小学）（考试达到的）级别；法定度量衡标准；旗杆；流行曲调（或歌曲）；茎干挺直的树（或灌木）；（植）（蝶形花的）旗瓣；（植）（鸢尾属植物的）直立花瓣；直立水管（或煤气管） adj. 普通的，标准的；（大小、尺寸、式样等）常规的，一般性的；权威的，广泛认可的；（语言）合乎规范的，符合标准的；茎干挺直的树（或灌木）；（整成树形并嫁接于挺直茎干上的）灌木

sentences.english: Students have to reach a certain standard or they won’t pass.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须达到某一标准，否则无法通过。

sentences.english: The airline has rigorous safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家航空公司有严格的安全标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准；水准；旗；度量衡标准
detailed_translations.english: the level that is considered to be acceptable, or the level that someone or something has achieved

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准的；合规格的；公认为优秀的
detailed_translations.english: accepted as normal or usual

name: enact
trans: v. 制定，通过，颁布（法令）；扮演，表演；使发生，付诸实际

sentences.english: a drama enacted on a darkened stage
sentences.chinese: 在灯光暗淡的舞台上演的戏剧

detailed_translations.chinese: 颁布；制定法律；扮演；发生
detailed_translations.english: to act in a play, story etc

name: confidential
trans: adj. 机密的，保密的；（言谈举止）神秘的，隐秘的；受信任的，委以机密的

sentences.english: a confidential government report
sentences.chinese: 一份机密的政府报告

sentences.english: Doctors are required to keep patients’ records completely confidential .
sentences.chinese: 医生必须对病人的病历完全保密。

sentences.english: The information will be regarded as strictly confidential (= completely confidential ) .
sentences.chinese: 这一信息将被视为绝对机密。

detailed_translations.english: spoken or written in secret and intended to be kept secret

name: clandestine
trans: adj. 秘密的，私下的；偷偷摸摸的

sentences.english: a clandestine affair
sentences.chinese: 秘密关系

sentences.english: clandestine meetings
sentences.chinese: 秘密会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘密的，私下的；偷偷摸摸的
detailed_translations.english: done or kept secret

name: cipher
trans: n. 密码，暗号（=cypher）；以密码书写的东西；解码；<旧>零，数字0；<正式>无足轻重的人，不重要的东西；（姓名首字母的）拼合字，花押；（管风琴音管因机械故障发出的）连响 v. 把（消息）写成密码；<古>做算术；（管风琴音管）连响

sentences.english: an expert in ciphers
sentences.chinese: 密码专家

sentences.english: messages written in cipher
sentences.chinese: 用密码写的信息

detailed_translations.english: a system of secret writing

name: dissimulate
trans: vi. 掩饰；假装；装糊涂 vt. 掩饰；假装；装糊涂

sentences.english: This man was too injured to dissimulate well.
sentences.chinese: 这个男人伤得太重，不可能掩盖得住。

sentences.english: He didn't attempt to dissimulate or conceal his true feelings.
sentences.chinese: 他没有尝试着掩饰或隐瞒自己的感受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩盖， 掩饰， 假装
detailed_translations.english: When people dissimulate, they hide their true feelings, intentions, or nature

name: disarm
trans: v. 缴……的械，解除……的武装；拆除（炸弹等的）引信；使友好，消除……的敌意；裁减军备，裁军 n. 解除（某人的）武器

sentences.english: Getting the rebels to disarm will not be easy.
sentences.chinese: 要让叛乱分子解除武装并非易事。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce the size of your army, navy etc, and the number of your weapons

name: disarming
trans: adj. 使解除警戒心的；使人消气的 v. 解除武装；使息怒（disarm 的现在分词）

name: scout
trans: n. 侦察兵，侦察机；侦查（尤指勘察地区）；童子军（the Scouts）；（英国大学里清扫学生房间的）校工；（演员、运动员等的）人才发掘者，星探；侦查蜂；童子军队员 v. （在某个地区）寻找，搜寻；物色（尤指体育或娱乐）人才；<罕> 轻蔑地拒绝（建议，想法）；探查，侦查；跟踪，监视

sentences.english: He sent three scouts ahead to take a look at the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他派出三名侦察兵到前面侦察大桥的情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搜索，侦察；侦察员；侦察机
detailed_translations.english: a soldier, plane etc that is sent to search the area in front of an army and get information about the enemy
to examine a place or area in order to get information about it

name: fort
trans: n. 堡垒，要塞；<美>兵营，军营；<史>边界贸易站

sentences.english: The fort flanked on a swamp.
sentences.chinese: 堡垒侧面靠着沼泽。

detailed_translations.english: a strong building or group of buildings used by soldiers or an army for defending an important place

name: fortress
trans: n. 堡垒；要塞 vt. 筑要塞；以要塞防守

sentences.english: ...a 13th-century fortress.
sentences.chinese: …一座13世纪的城堡。

detailed_translations.english: a large strong building used for defending an important place

name: hatchet
trans: n. 短柄小斧 vt. 用短柄小斧砍伐；扼杀

sentences.english: Would I feel better if I took a hatchet to her, just to end this nightmare?
sentences.chinese: 如果我向她举起一把短柄斧，结束这场噩梦，我会感觉好一些吗？

detailed_translations.english: a small axe with a short handle

name: dagger
trans: n. 匕首，短剑 vt. 用剑刺 n. （Dagger）人名；（俄）达格尔

sentences.english: He was stabbed with a dagger.
sentences.chinese: 他被刺了一匕首。

sentences.english: The murderer dubbed a dagger into his heart.
sentences.chinese: 凶手将匕首刺进他的心脏。

sentences.english: He was heavily armed—an air rifle in one hand, a wooden dagger in the other.
sentences.chinese: 他可是全副武装呢，一只手拿着气枪，另一只手握着一把木制匕首。

detailed_translations.english: a short pointed knife used as a weapon

name: armor
trans: n. 盔甲，甲胄；装甲，防弹钢板；甲壳；装甲部队，装甲车辆；（感情、社交或其他方面的）防御 v. （感情、社交或其他方面的）防御

sentences.english: The leading role in the film is costumed in medieval armor.
sentences.chinese: 影片中的主角穿着中古时代的甲胄。

sentences.english: This Courtly Poetry came out of the idea of chivalry and courtly love that you might associate with knights in shining armor.
sentences.chinese: 这首宫廷诗取材于骑士精神和典雅爱恋，你可能会想到这与身穿闪光的盔甲的骑士有关。

name: corps
trans: n. 特种部队；（从事某工作或活动的）一群人；（美国）海军陆战队；（由两个或两个以上师组成的）军，兵团

sentences.english: My corps ! your corps ! our corps ! maring corps !
sentences.chinese: 我的、你的、大家的海军陆战队！

sentences.english: The corps' corn in the corner is scorned by the stubborn corporation.
sentences.chinese: 军团在角落里的谷物受到了顽固的公司司（社团）的嘲笑。

detailed_translations.english: a trained army unit made of two or more  divisions (= groups of soldiers )

name: armament
trans: n. 军备，武器；武装，战备

sentences.english: nuclear armaments
sentences.chinese: 核武器

detailed_translations.english: the weapons and military equipment used by an army

name: enlist
trans: v. （使）参军，（使）入伍；争取，谋取；赞助，支持

name: recruit
trans: v. 招聘，招收（新成员）；招募（新兵）；说服，动员；（通过招募）组成，组建；<旧> 恢复（数量、力气等） n. 新兵；新成员

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: array
trans: n. 一系列，大量；数组，阵列；盛装 v. 布置，排列；配置（兵力）；穿戴，打扮

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

name: squad
trans: n. （专门处理某类犯罪的）警察分队；运动（代表）队；（军队里的）班，组；（进行某活动的）小组，队 v. 把……编成班，把……编入班

sentences.english: a drill squad
sentences.chinese: 操练小队

detailed_translations.chinese: 班；小队；五人组（篮球队的非正式说法）
detailed_translations.english: a small group of soldiers working together as a unit

name: raid
trans: n. 突袭，袭击；突击检查，突然搜查；抢劫，打劫；（股票）恶意大量买进 v. 突袭，偷袭；突击搜捕，突然搜查；抢劫，劫掠；扫荡（某处的食物）

sentences.english: a bombing raid
sentences.chinese: 轰炸

sentences.english: an air raid warning siren
sentences.chinese: 空袭警报

detailed_translations.chinese: 袭击； 突入查抄， 突入搜捕； 劫掠
detailed_translations.english: a short attack on a place by soldiers, planes, or ships, intended to cause damage but not take control

name: charge
trans: v. 充电；使……承担责任，赋予……责任；控告，指控；（公开）指责，责备；进攻，冲锋；把……记在账上；要价，收费（金额）；<旧>给（枪炮）装弹；斟满（杯子） n. 电量，电荷；炸药量；掌管，照管；费用，价钱；控告，指控；（书面或口头的）指责，批评；需要照管的人；命令，指示；（人或动物的）猛攻，冲锋；<美，非正式>快感，刺激；感召力，感染力；负载

sentences.english: Leave the battery on charge all night.
sentences.chinese: 让电池充一晚上的电

sentences.english: Please charge your glasses and drink a toast to the bride and groom!
sentences.chinese: 请各位斟满酒杯向新娘、新郎敬酒！

detailed_translations.english: electricity that is put into a piece of electrical equipment such as a battery
to fill a glass

name: encroach
trans: v. 逐步侵占（侵犯），蚕食；侵占（土地）

sentences.english: The shrubs encroached ever more on the twisting drive.
sentences.chinese: 灌木丛蚕食了越来越多蜿蜒的车道。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually take more of someone’s time, possessions, rights etc than you should

name: despoil
trans: vt. 掠夺，剥夺；夺取

sentences.english: ...people who despoil the countryside.
sentences.chinese: ...掠夺乡村的人。

detailed_translations.english: to steal from a place or people using force, especially in a war

name: invade
trans: v. 武力入侵，侵略；大量涌入，蜂拥而入；侵扰，干扰；扩散，渗入

sentences.english: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 2,000年前古罗马人入侵了英国。

detailed_translations.english: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

name: assault
trans: n. （军事）袭击，攻击；人身攻击，侵犯人身（罪）；抨击；闯关，冲击（难关） v. 袭击，殴打；使（感官）难受

sentences.english: Two men assaulted him after he left the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他离开酒吧之后遭到两名男子的袭击。

sentences.english: The refugee camp came under assault again last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚难民营再次遭袭。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone in a violent way
a military attack to take control of a place controlled by the enemy

name: exterminate
trans: vt. 消灭；根除

sentences.english: Staff use the poison to exterminate moles and rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 员工用毒药来消灭鼹鼠和野兔。

detailed_translations.english: to kill large numbers of people or animals of a particular type so that they no longer exist

name: extinguish
trans: v. 熄灭；消灭，使破灭；<法律>取消（权利，义务），使无效；偿清；压制

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

name: absorb
trans: v. 吸收；使并入，纳入；同化，汲取；消减，缓冲（外力、震动等）；理解，掌握（信息）；使全神贯注，使专心；承受（变革、影响等），承担（费用等）；花掉（大量金钱），耗费

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

name: onset
trans: n. （尤指某种坏事情的）开始，发作；军事攻击

sentences.english: the onset of winter
sentences.chinese: 冬天的来临

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始，着手；发作；攻击，进攻
detailed_translations.english: the beginning of something, especially something bad

name: repulse
trans: vt. 拒绝；驱逐；憎恶 n. 拒绝；击退

sentences.english: Government troops repulsed an attack by rebel forces.
sentences.chinese: 政府军击退了叛军的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: to fight someone and successfully stop their attack on you

name: expedition
trans: n. 远征，考察；探险队，考察队；动作敏捷，迅速

sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

detailed_translations.english: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey

name: siege
trans: n. （军队或警察对某地的）围困，包围；不断的攻击 v. 围攻，包围

sentences.english: The siege lasted almost four months.
sentences.chinese: 这次封锁历时近四个月。

sentences.english: a three-day police siege at a remote country cottage
sentences.chinese: 警方对一座偏僻村舍历时三天的包围

detailed_translations.chinese: 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

name: envelop
trans: v. 覆盖，包住

sentences.english: the enveloping darkness
sentences.chinese: 笼罩四周的黑暗

detailed_translations.english: to cover or wrap something or someone up completely

name: beset
trans: v. 困扰，烦扰 adj. 充满……的

sentences.english: the injuries which have beset the team all season
sentences.chinese: 困扰球队整个赛季的伤病问题

detailed_translations.english: to make someone experience serious problems or dangers

name: besiege
trans: v. 包围，围困；打扰，纠缠

sentences.english: In April 655, Osman’s palace was besieged by rebels.
sentences.chinese: 公元655年4月，奥斯曼的宫殿遭到叛军围攻。

detailed_translations.english: to surround a city or castle with military force until the people inside let you take control

name: morale
trans: n. 士气，精神面貌

sentences.english: A win is always good for morale.
sentences.chinese: 胜利总是可以鼓舞士气。

sentences.english: The failed coup caused a loss of morale within the army.
sentences.chinese: 政变未遂挫伤了军队的士气。

sentences.english: the Prince’s morale-boosting (= intended to raise morale ) mission to the war﹣torn country
sentences.chinese: 王子去这个饱受战争磨难的国家鼓舞士气的使命

detailed_translations.english: the level of confidence and positive feelings that people have, especially people who work together, who belong to the same team etc

name: mandate
trans: n. 授权，委托；任期；命令，指令；托管权，委任统治权；账户代理书面委托 v. 强制执行，颁布；授权，委任；命令，指示；（领土）（由国际联盟）授权托管

sentences.english: Matters debated in meetings do not become a mandate automatically.
sentences.chinese: 会议上讨论的事宜并不能自动成为一项指令。

detailed_translations.chinese: 授权；命令，指令；委托管理；受命进行的工作
detailed_translations.english: if a government or official has a mandate to make important decisions, they have the authority to make the decisions because they have been elected by the people to do so
to give someone the right or power to do something

name: tactics
trans: n. 战术，兵法；方法，策略，手法（tactic 的复数）

sentences.english: All these questions involve policy and tactics.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题，都涉及政策和策略。

sentences.english: In the next part of this post, I'll show you a few ways you can protect yourself from some of these tactics.
sentences.chinese: 在这篇文章的下一部分中，我将向您展示几个方法可以保护自己免受这些策略。

sentences.english: Be Flexible But Firm Encourage your staff for a frank discussion of goals, tactics and strategies. Do not change your direction without good reason.
sentences.chinese: 灵活而坚定的鼓励你的员工对目标，战术和战略进行坦诚的讨论。没有充分的理由，不要改变你的方向。

detailed_translations.english: the art and science of the detailed direction and control of movement or manoeuvre of forces in battle to achieve an aim or task

name: naval
trans: adj. 海军的，军舰的

sentences.english: a naval officer
sentences.chinese: 海军军官

sentences.english: naval battles
sentences.chinese: 海战

detailed_translations.english: relating to the navy or used by the navy

name: military
trans: adj. 军事的，军队的；陆军的；军人般的，军人作风的 n. 军人，军方

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: contagious
trans: adj. （疾病）接触性传染的；（情感）具有感染力的；患接触传染病的

sentences.english: her contagious enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 她那富有感染力的热情

detailed_translations.english: if a feeling, attitude, or action is contagious, other people are quickly affected by it and begin to have it or do it

name: catching
trans: adj. （非正式）（疾病）传染性的；（情感或情绪）有感染力的 v. 截住（抛掷物等）；接住（掉下的人）；捉住；捕获（试图逃跑的人或动物）；赶上（前面的人）（catch 的现在分词）

sentences.english: Julia’s enthusiasm was catching.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉娅的热情很有感染力。

detailed_translations.english: an illness that is catching is easily passed to other people

name: infect
trans: v. 传染，浸染；污染，败坏；（某种感情或兴趣）影响；感染（计算机病毒）

sentences.english: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.
sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.english: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他们可能用中产阶级思想去影响别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone a disease

name: infectious
trans: adj. 传染的，传染性的；有感染力的，有影响力的

sentences.english: infectious diseases
sentences.chinese: 传染性疾病

detailed_translations.english: an infectious illness can be passed from one person to another, especially through the air you breathe

name: contract
trans: n. 合同，契约；<非正式>暗杀协议；（桥牌）定约墩数；婚约，订婚 v. （使）收缩，缩小；签合同，订立契约；患上，感染；订立婚约（或盟约）；欠负（债）

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: acute
trans: adj. 严重的，危险的；急性的，剧烈的；灵敏的；敏锐的，有洞察力的；锐角的；带尖音符的；（声音）高的，尖的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

name: feverish
trans: adj. 发烧的，发热的；狂热的，极度兴奋的

sentences.english: She lay in bed, too feverish to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她躺在床上，烧得太厉害难以入睡。

sentences.english: There was a feverish blush to his cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 他两颊烧得通红。

detailed_translations.english: suffering from a fever

name: invalid
trans: adj. （法律上）无效的，作废的；（论据、理由等）站不住脚的，错误的；（计算机）不能识别的；残疾的 n. 病弱者，伤残者 vt. 使（因伤或病）退役；使伤残，使病弱

sentences.english: Without the right date stamped on it, your ticket will be invalid.
sentences.chinese: 票上若没有加盖正确日期就是废票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效的，作废的；无可靠根据的，站不住脚的
detailed_translations.english: a contract, ticket, claim etc that is invalid is not legally or officially acceptable
someone who cannot look after themselves because of illness, old age, or injury

name: morbid
trans: adj. 病态的；由病引起的；恐怖的；病变部位的

sentences.english: The trip was made all the worse by Frankie’s morbid fear of flying.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗基对坐飞机有种病态的恐惧，使得旅途变得更加糟糕。

sentences.english: His head was full of morbid thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑袋里全是不健康的思想。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病态的；由病引起的；恐怖的；病变部位的
detailed_translations.english: with a strong and unhealthy interest in unpleasant subjects, especially death

name: numb
trans: adj. 麻木的，失去感觉的；迟钝的，呆滞的 v. 使麻木，使失去知觉；使迟钝，使呆滞；使（某种感觉）减轻，使减弱

sentences.english: The cold had numbed her fingers.
sentences.chinese: 她的手指冻僵了。

sentences.english: the numbing effect of the drug
sentences.chinese: 那种药物的麻醉效果

detailed_translations.chinese: 使麻木；使发愣；使失去感觉
detailed_translations.english: to make someone unable to feel pain or feel things they are touching
a part of your body that is numb is unable to feel anything, for example because you are very cold

name: unconscious
trans: adj. （尤指因头部受伤）昏迷的，不省人事的；（想法或感情）无意识的，潜意识的；没意识到某事物；（行为）下意识的，无意中做出的 n. 无意识（不察觉的心理活动）（the unconscious）

sentences.english: She was found alive but unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 她被找到时还活着，但已不省人事。

detailed_translations.english: unable to see, move, feel etc in the normal way because you are not conscious

name: fragile
trans: adj. 易碎的，易损的；不牢固的，易被摧毁的；纤巧美丽的；虚弱的，体弱的

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: susceptible
trans: adj. 易得病的，易受影响的；（人）易受感动的，易动感情的；可能有······的，容许······的；<正式>（尤指想法或陈述）能被理解（或证明、解释）的

sentences.english: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.chinese: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受影响的； 过敏的； 能经受的， 容许的
detailed_translations.english: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

name: malady
trans: n. 弊病；疾病；腐败 n. （Malady）人名；（英）马拉迪

sentences.english: He was stricken at twenty-one with a crippling malady.
sentences.chinese: 二十一岁时腿瘸疾病让他受到重击。

detailed_translations.english: an illness

name: corpse
trans: n. 尸体 v. <英，非正式>使戏剧演员的演出僵住

sentences.english: The corpse was found by children playing in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 这具尸体是在林子里玩耍的孩子发现的。

detailed_translations.english: the dead body of a person

name: gash
trans: n. 很深的裂缝；砍得很深的伤口 vt. 划开；砍入很深；（使）负深伤 n. （Gash）人名；（英）加什

sentences.english: Blood poured from a deep gash in her forehead.
sentences.chinese: 鲜血从她额头上一道很深的伤口汩汩地流出来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 很深的裂缝；砍得很深的伤口
detailed_translations.english: a large deep cut or hole in something, for example in a person’s skin

detailed_translations.chinese: 划开；砍入很深；（使）负深伤

name: symptom
trans: n. （医） 症状；（大问题的）迹象，征兆，征候

sentences.english: One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.
sentences.chinese: 精神分裂症最常见的症状之一是幻听。

detailed_translations.english: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

name: fracture
trans: n. 破裂，断裂；骨折；（尤指岩层的）裂缝，裂痕；（语音）元音割裂；由单元音割裂成的复合元音 v. 破裂，折断；瓦解，分裂；毁坏，破坏；违反，越出……范围

sentences.english: a stress fracture in his left knee
sentences.chinese: 他左膝上的应力性骨折

sentences.english: a hairline fracture
sentences.chinese: 细小的裂缝

sentences.english: The immense pressure causes the rock to fracture.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的压力造成岩石断裂。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or broken part in a bone or other hard substance
if a bone or other hard substance fractures, or if it is fractured, it breaks or cracks

name: bleed
trans: v. 流血，出血；给……放血；散开，渗开，渗透；榨取（钱财）；（金钱）不断流失，持续损失；抽掉（气体或液体）；印成出血版 n. 流血，出血；泄出（液体，气体）；（染料，颜料）渗色，渗开；出血版

sentences.english: Your nose is bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 你的鼻子流血了。

sentences.english: Tragically, she bled to death .
sentences.chinese: 非常不幸，她失血过多死了。

detailed_translations.english: to lose blood, especially because of an injury

name: tingle
trans: v. 感到刺痛；使激动 n. 刺痛感；激动；（用于支撑窗户玻璃或石板瓦的）S 型金属固定夹片 n. （Tingle）（英、美）廷格尔（人名）

sentences.english: My body tingled all over and I had a terrible headache.
sentences.chinese: 我全身刺痛，头疼欲裂。

detailed_translations.english: if a part of your body tingles, you feel a slight stinging feeling, especially on your skin

name: recur
trans: v. 再发生，反复出现；（思考或讲话时）重新回到，反复提及（recur to）；（小数）循环

sentences.english: There is a danger that the disease may recur.
sentences.chinese: 这种病有复发的危险。

sentences.english: Love is a recurring theme in the book.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是这本书中反复出现的主题。

detailed_translations.chinese: (尤指不好的事)一再发生；重现
detailed_translations.english: if something, especially something bad or unpleasant, recurs, it happens again

name: relapse
trans: v. （病）复发，重新恶化；返回，退回原状，故态复萌 n. 旧病复发，恶化；故态复萌，回复原状

sentences.english: "I wish I did," said Phil Jordan, relapsing into his usual gloom.
sentences.chinese: “我要是做了就好了，”菲尔•乔丹说着，回到平时的忧郁中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故态复萌；旧病复发；再度堕落；再陷邪道
detailed_translations.english: to become ill again after you have seemed to improve

detailed_translations.chinese: 复发，再发；故态复萌；回复原状
detailed_translations.english: when someone becomes ill again after having seemed to improve

name: bruise
trans: n. 青瘀，伤痕；（水果或蔬菜的）碰伤 v. 打击，挫伤；压碎，碾碎；使青肿，使出现伤痕；碰伤（水果）

sentences.english: minor cuts and bruises
sentences.chinese: 轻微的伤口和淤青

detailed_translations.english: a purple or brown mark on your skin that you get because you have fallen, been hit etc
to affect someone badly and make them feel less confident

name: fester
trans: vi. 溃烂；化脓 vt. 使……溃烂；使……痛苦；使……恶化 n. 溃烂；脓疮，脓疱

sentences.english: festering sores
sentences.chinese: 溃烂的疮

detailed_translations.english: if a wound festers, it becomes infected

name: intoxicate
trans: v. （酒或毒品）（使）麻醉；（使）中毒；（使）兴奋 adj. 喝醉的；陶醉的

detailed_translations.english: (of an alcoholic drink) to produce in (a person) a state ranging from euphoria to stupor, usually accompanied by loss of inhibitions and control; make drunk; inebriate

name: survive
trans: v. （经历事故、战争或疾病后）活下来，幸存；比……活得久，比……长寿；挺过，艰难度过；幸免于难，留存；（靠很少的钱）继续维持生活；设法对付（困难或令人不愉快的事）

sentences.english: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
sentences.chinese: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。

sentences.english: She survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 她在袭击中幸免于难。

sentences.english: people who survive cancer
sentences.chinese: 癌症幸存者

detailed_translations.chinese: 活下来，继续存在；幸免于
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 从中挺过来； 从…逃出； 比…活得长
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems

name: diagnose
trans: v. 诊断（病症）；找出原因

sentences.english: How did they diagnose you?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: Evidently this springs from some defect in their nature, but it is one not altogether easy either to diagnose of to cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

detailed_translations.english: to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

name: diagnosis
trans: n. 诊断，判断

sentences.english: An exact diagnosis can only be made by obtaining a blood sample.
sentences.chinese: 只有抽取血样才能作出准确的诊断。

detailed_translations.english: the process of discovering exactly what is wrong with someone or something, by examining them closely

name: inject
trans: v. 注射；（给……）添加，增加（某品质）；投入（金钱或资源）；（往物质、装置中）注入或射入（电流、粒子束等）；将（宇宙飞船等）射入轨道（或弹道）

sentences.english: His son was injected with strong drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子被注射了强效的药。

detailed_translations.english: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

name: heal
trans: v. 痊愈，康复；（感情创伤）愈合，（情感）恢复常态；（使）（裂痕、创伤）弥合，（使）和好；止息（争斗），调停；修复（对土地的破坏）；减轻（痛苦）

sentences.english: a preacher who claims that he can heal the sick
sentences.chinese: 自称可以治病的传道士

sentences.english: The rift between the two younger men never healed.
sentences.chinese: 两个较年轻者之间的裂痕从未得以弥合。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone who is ill become healthy again, especially by using natural powers or prayer

name: remedy
trans: n. 解决方法，纠正方法；法定补偿（办法）；治疗（法），药品；（硬币的）公差 v. 补救，纠正；治疗

sentences.english: The problems in our schools do not have a simple remedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校的问题没有简单的解决办法。

sentences.english: To remedy the situation, the water must be chemically treated.
sentences.chinese: 为了改善这种情况，水必须进行化学处理。

detailed_translations.english: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better
to deal with a problem or improve a bad situation

name: treatment
trans: n. 对待，待遇；处理，讨论；治疗，医治；（净化或防治）处理，加工；护理，护理品；<非正式>极致； 对待，待遇

sentences.english: There have been great advances in the treatment of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 癌症治疗有了很大的进展。

sentences.english: Just lately, Kyra has been giving me the silent treatment (= refusing to speak to me because she is angry with me ) .
sentences.chinese: 就在最近，凯拉一直对我不理不睬。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to cure someone who is injured or ill

name: prescription
trans: n. 处方，药方；处方药；开处方，开药方；<正式>解决方法，诀窍；<法律>取得的时效（根据长期或不确定时期持续使用或以长期习惯为基础确立的要求权）（=positive prescription)） adj. 凭处方方可购买的

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

name: dissect
trans: v. 解剖（人或动物的尸体）；剖析，详细评论（某事物）；把（田地）分成小块

sentences.english: books in which the lives of famous people are dissected
sentences.chinese: 剖析名人生平的书籍

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to understand it

name: sterile
trans: adj. 无生殖能力的，不育的；无菌的，消过毒的；（争论或讨论）毫无新意的，无结果的；（建筑、房间等）呆板的，乏味的；（土地）贫瘠的，不长作物的

sentences.english: The classrooms are sterile, with no artwork on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 这些教室毫无生气，墙上一张画都没有。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不育的；无菌的；贫瘠的；不毛的；枯燥乏味的
detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that is sterile cannot produce babies

name: clinic
trans: n. 诊所，门诊部；门诊时间；临床实习；讲习班；（医院的）科，室；减免费用的专业服务机构；健康讲座

sentences.english: an appointment at an outpatient clinic
sentences.chinese: 门诊预约

detailed_translations.english: a place, often in a hospital, where medical treatment is given to people who do not need to stay in the hospital

name: anatomy
trans: n. 解剖学；（动植物的）组成结构，解剖构造；人体；剖析，详细分析；原因，成因；骨骼

sentences.english: a professor of anatomy
sentences.chinese: 解剖学教授

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the structure of human or animal bodies

name: healthful
trans: adj. 有益于健康的，促进健康的；健全的

sentences.english: healthful mountain air
sentences.chinese: 有利于健康的山区空气

detailed_translations.english: likely to make you healthy

name: condition
trans: n. 状况，状态；条件，环境；疾病；条款；<旧>社会地位 v. 训练，使习惯于；控制，制约；护理，保养；影响；加条件于；使（人，动物）健康；（发酵后，在酵母仍存在时）使（啤酒，黑啤酒）酿熟

sentences.english: Profits increased by £1.5m, despite the difficult economic conditions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管经济形势不佳，利润还是增长了150万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

name: hygiene
trans: n. 卫生；卫生学，保健学

sentences.english: the importance of personal hygiene
sentences.chinese: 个人卫生的重要性

sentences.english: a food hygiene training course
sentences.chinese: 食品卫生培训课程

detailed_translations.english: the practice of keeping yourself and the things around you clean in order to prevent diseases

name: sanitation
trans: n. 公共卫生，环境卫生；下水道设施，卫生设备

sentences.english: Overcrowding and poor sanitation are common problems in prisons.
sentences.chinese: 过度拥挤和卫生状况差是监狱里的普遍问题。

detailed_translations.english: the protection of public health by removing and treating waste, dirty water etc

name: physical
trans: adj. 身体的，肉体的；物质的，有形的；外形的，外在的；物理的，物理学的；根据自然规律的，符合自然法则的；粗暴的，粗野的；性欲的，肉欲的；（人）喜欢动手动脚的；肢体活动的 n. 体格检查；（股票）（与期货相对的）现货股票

sentences.english: She was in constant physical pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一直感到身上疼痛。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
sentences.chinese: 青年人的身心需求

sentences.english: people with severe physical disabilities
sentences.chinese: 身体重度残疾的人

sentences.english: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
sentences.chinese: 他对健身着了迷。

detailed_translations.english: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions

name: sustenance
trans: n. 食物；生计；支持

sentences.english: Without sustenance, the animals will soon die.
sentences.chinese: 没有食物，动物很快就会死亡。

sentences.english: Potatoes were their only means of sustenance.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是他们唯一的食物。

detailed_translations.english: food that people or animals need in order to live

name: malnourished
trans: adj. 营养不良的；营养失调的

sentences.english: malnourished children
sentences.chinese: 营养不良的儿童

detailed_translations.english: someone who is malnourished is ill or weak because they have not had enough good food to eat

name: nutrition

sentences.chinese: 他相当成功，甚至还上了一次电视节目。

sentences.english: She did not even bother to phone us.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。

sentences.english: He never even acknowledged my letter.
sentences.chinese: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying

name: decimal
trans: adj. 十进位的，小数的 n. 小数；十进制

sentences.english: changing to a decimal system
sentences.chinese: 改为十进制

sentences.english: calculations accurate to three decimal places
sentences.chinese: 精确到小数点后三位的计算

detailed_translations.english: a decimal system is based on the number 10
a  fraction (= a number less than 1 )  that is shown as a  full stop  followed by the number of  tenth s  ,  hundredth s  etc. The numbers 0.5, 0.175, and 0.661 are decimals.

name: ratio
trans: n. 比率，比例

sentences.english: Yeah, , now you know how the sex ratio matters!
sentences.chinese: 是的，现在你知道性别比例的问题了吧！ ！

sentences.english: The ratio could reach one in four within a year.
sentences.chinese: 一年之内这个比例可以达到四分之一。

sentences.english: When using profiling it is typical to consider only the ratio (or percentage) of time spent in certain areas.
sentences.chinese: 当使用分析时，它是典型的考虑时间花费在某些领域的比例（或百分比）。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other

name: estimate
trans: v. 估计；判断，评价 n. 估计，估价；估价单；看法，判断

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: calculate
trans: v. 计算，核算；预测，推测

sentences.english: These instruments calculate distances precisely.
sentences.chinese: 这些仪器计算距离非常精确。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算， 推算； 计划， 打算
detailed_translations.english: to find out how much something will cost, how long something will take etc, by using numbers

name: enumerate
trans: vt. 列举；枚举；计算

sentences.english: I enumerate the work that will have to be done.
sentences.chinese: 我将必须要做的工作一一列举出来。

detailed_translations.english: to name a list of things one by one

name: evaluate
trans: v. 评价，评估，估值；求（方程式，公式，函数）的数值

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

name: variant
trans: n. 变种，变形；（单词拼写或读音的）变异，变体 adj. 不同的，变体的，变种的

sentences.english: Note that you must use the same variant of this option for all compiler runs related to the same project.
sentences.chinese: 注意，对于所有运行的与同一个项目相关的编译器，必须使用这个选项的相同变体。

sentences.english: Product variant: This is a product that is based on another product but with some different characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 产品变体：这是一种基于另一种产品但具备一些不同特性的产品。

sentences.english: A locale is said to be a language only variant of another locale if it has only language code and that language code is the same as that for another locale.
sentences.chinese: 如果某个区域设置仅有语言代码，且语言代码与另一个区域设置相同，则将第一个区域设置称为第二个区域设置的语言变体。

detailed_translations.english: something that is slightly different from the usual form of something

name: variable
trans: adj. 易变的，多变的；时好时坏的；可变的，可调节的；（数）（数字）变量的；（植，动）变异的，变型的；（齿轮）变速的 n. 可变性，可变因素；（数学中的）变量，变元；（计算机）变量（元）；（天文）变星的简称；（东北信风带以北或南半球的东南信风带与西风带之间的）变风区

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: abacus
trans: n. 算盘

sentences.english: In English we call it an abacus.
sentences.chinese: 在英语里我们叫它为一个算盘。

sentences.english: I could write on paper and use abacus for statistic.
sentences.chinese: 我可以用纸笔写作，要算统计时就打算盘。

sentences.english: In response to declining math skills among their students, some Japanese schools are bringing back an ancient calculating device - the abacus.
sentences.chinese: 为了改善学生日渐衰退的计算能力，日本的一些学校重新使用起一个古老的计算工具-算盘。

detailed_translations.english: a frame with small balls that can be slid along on thick wires, used for counting and calculating

name: aggregate
trans: n. 总数，合计；骨料，混凝料 adj. 总计的，合计的；（种群）聚生的 v. 集合，聚集；总计达到；合计

sentences.english: Sheila’s earnings from all sources aggregated £100,000.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to be a particular amount when added together
the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together
being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together

name: sum
trans: n. 金额，款项；算术，简单计算；总数，总和；全部，一切（尤指数量不大）；<英>计算失误；<英>计算费用 v. 概括，总结；求……的和，计算……的总数

sentences.english: He owes me a large sum of money .
sentences.chinese: 他欠我一大笔钱。

sentences.english: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.
sentences.chinese: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

sentences.english: I was good at sums at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money

name: calculation
trans: n. 计算，运算；估算，预测；算计，盘算

sentences.english: Cathy did a rough calculation.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜作了一个粗略的计算。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of using numbers to find out an amount

name: calculator
trans: n. 计算器

sentences.english: a pocket calculator
sentences.chinese: 一个袖珍计算器

detailed_translations.english: a small electronic machine that can add, multiply etc

name: calculus
trans: n. 微积分；（数，逻）演算（法），计算（法）；（医）（尤指肾或胆囊的）结石，石

sentences.english: We have to factor that into the calculus.
sentences.chinese: 我们要在微积分学中考虑这些因素。

sentences.english: All this leads up to the most fundamental of theorems of calculus .
sentences.chinese: 综上所述就导出了微积分学中的最基本的定理。

sentences.english: Obstruction with stasis also led to the formation of the yellow-brown calculus (stone).
sentences.chinese: 伴有尿液郁积的阻塞还能导致黄褐色的结石（石头）形成。

detailed_translations.english: the part of mathematics that deals with changing quantities, such as the speed of a falling stone or the slope of a curved line

name: digit
trans: n. （零到九中的任一）数字；手指，脚趾

sentences.english: Her telephone number differs from mine by one digit.
sentences.chinese: 她的电话号码跟我的差一个数字。

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；手指或足趾；一指宽
detailed_translations.english: one of the written signs that represent the numbers 0 to 9

name: function
trans: n. 功能，职责；宴会，典礼；函数，应变量；由其他事情造成的结果；子例行程序，子例程；官能团，功能团 v. 工作，运转；行使职责，发挥功能

sentences.chinese: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。

sentences.english: You know I can’t function (= cannot perform normal activities ) without a coffee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作， 运行； 起作用
detailed_translations.english: to work in the correct or intended way

detailed_translations.chinese: 功能，职务；【数】函数；重大聚会
detailed_translations.english: the purpose that something has, or the job that someone or something does

name: subtract
trans: vt. 减去，删减；减去，扣除

sentences.english: Then the deal is that when you sell the house they subtract -you've got to pay this.
sentences.chinese: 那么当你售出房子后，他们会从中减去，这个余额，这就是你要付给他们的。

sentences.english: That is, if you find that a sensor consistently overestimates by a certain value, you can subtract that value before the final value is reported.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，如果您发现某个传感器总是偏高于某个特定数值，那么就可以减去该数值后再报告最终的数值。

sentences.english: Thus, if you have staff activities in loops and want to run the above request, you need to ensure that you subtract only events which belong together.
sentences.chinese: 因此，如果您在循环中具有人员活动，并且想要运行以上的请求，那么您必须确保您只减去了属于一起的事件。

detailed_translations.english: to take a number or an amount from a larger number or amount

name: addition
trans: n. 增加物，新增人员；增加；加法；（建筑物的）扩建部分

sentences.english: This is a fine book; a worthy addition to the series.
sentences.chinese: 这是一本好书——是对这套丛书有价值的增补。

detailed_translations.chinese: 加， 加法； 附加物
detailed_translations.english: something that is added to something else, often in order to improve it

trans: prep. 减，减去；<非正式>没有，缺少；零下 n. <非正式>缺点，不利条件；减号，负号 adj. 小于零的，负的；不利的，负面的；（指分数或等级）略低于某标准的，稍差的；阴性的，负电的

sentences.english: The payment will be refunded to you minus a small service charge.
sentences.chinese: 这笔款项扣除一小笔服务费后将退还给你。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or quantity is being  subtract ed  from another
something that is a disadvantage because it makes a situation unpleasant
used to talk about a disadvantage of a thing or situation

name: multiply
trans: v. 大大增加，倍增；乘，乘以；繁殖，滋生 adv. 多样地，多方面地 adj. 多层的（multi-ply）

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

trans: n. 乘法；大量增加

sentences.english: There will be simple tests in addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
sentences.chinese: 将会有加减乘除的简单测试。

sentences.english: a multiplication of the number of forms to fill out
sentences.chinese: 需要填写的表格数量的倍增

detailed_translations.english: a method of calculating in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

name: numeral
trans: n. 数字，数量符号；数词 adj. 数的，数字的

sentences.english: ...a flat, square wristwatch with classic Roman numerals.
sentences.chinese: ...一块扁平、有标准罗马数字的正方形手表。

trans: n. 百分比，百分率；部分，比例；利润分成，提成；<非正式>利益，好处

sentences.english: Interest rates fell by six percentage points (= 6% ) .
sentences.chinese: 利息下降了6个百分点。

sentences.english: The numbers are small in percentage terms (= when calculated as a percentage ) .

trans: prep. 加；外加，而且；（温度）零上 adj. （在数字后）多，余；略高于标准的；零上的，正的；有利的；正电的 n. 加号，正号；（数字的）加法；好处 conj. 而且；加上

sentences.english: Three plus six equals nine (3+6=9).
sentences.chinese: 3 加6等于9。

sentences.english: The total cost was $10,000, plus 14% interest.
sentences.chinese: 全部费用是1万美元，外加14%的利息。

sentences.english: Daytime temperatures barely reached plus 5˚.
sentences.chinese: 白天的气温仅零上5度。

more than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures

name: equation
trans: n. 等式，方程（式）；等同（看待）；（必须考虑多种因素的）复杂局面（或问题）

sentences.chinese: 有了孩子以后，婚姻中可能出现新的矛盾。

sentences.english: It’s about a page and a quarter.
sentences.chinese: 大概是一又四分之一页。

sentences.english: Cut the cake into quarters.
sentences.chinese: 把蛋糕切成四等份。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you in a quarter of an hour.
sentences.chinese: 我们一刻钟之后见。

detailed_translations.english: one of four equal parts into which something can be divided

name: fraction
trans: n. 分数，小数；小部分，微量；持不同意见的小集团；分离；（基督教用语）分切圣餐面包

sentences.english: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
sentences.chinese: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of something

name: divide
trans: v. （使）分开，分散；分配，分担；使分离；分隔，隔开；使产生分歧；除，除以；分岔 n. 差异，分歧；（两事物间的）界限；<美>分水岭，分水线

sentences.english: The book is divided into six sections.
sentences.chinese: 本书分为六部分。

sentences.english: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将被平分给各慈善机构。

detailed_translations.english: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

name: nanometer
trans: n. [计量] 纳米（即十亿分之一米）

name: partial
trans: adj. 部分的，不完全的；偏袒的，不公平的；偏爱的 n. （乐）分音，泛音

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

name: overbearing
trans: v. 压倒；击败；控制；专横对待（overbear 的现在分词） adj. 专横的，傲慢的；压倒一切的

sentences.english: a bossy overbearing wife
sentences.chinese: 专横霸道的妻子

detailed_translations.english: always trying to control other people without considering their wishes or feelings

name: arrogant
trans: adj. 傲慢的，自大的

sentences.english: He was unbearably arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 他的傲慢让人无法忍受。

sentences.english: an arrogant attitude
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的态度

detailed_translations.english: behaving in an unpleasant or rude way because you think you are more important than other people

name: haughty
trans: adj. 傲慢的；自大的

sentences.english: a haughty laugh
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的大笑

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a proud unfriendly way

name: insolent
trans: adj. 无礼的；傲慢的；粗野的；无耻的

sentences.english: an insolent tone of voice
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的语气

sentences.english: You insolent child!
sentences.chinese: 你这个没礼貌的孩子！

detailed_translations.chinese: 无礼的；傲慢的；粗野的；无耻的
detailed_translations.english: rude and not showing any respect

name: fussy
trans: adj. 爱挑剔的，难取悦的；过分装饰的，过于繁琐的；紧张不安的；<美>婴儿爱哭的

sentences.english: A lot of small children are fussy eaters (= they dislike many types of food ) .
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子挑食。

sentences.english: ‘Do you want to go out or just rent a movie?’ ‘I’m not fussy’ (= I don’t mind ) .
sentences.chinese: “你想出去还是租影碟来看？”“随便。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱挑剔的，难取悦的；易烦恼的
detailed_translations.english: very concerned about small, usually unimportant details, and difficult to please

name: contemptuous
trans: adj. 轻蔑的，鄙视的

sentences.english: a contemptuous glance
sentences.chinese: 轻蔑的一瞥

detailed_translations.english: showing that you think someone or something deserves no respect

name: domineering
trans: adj. 跋扈的；专横的；盛气凌人的 v. 实行暴政；高耸；流行（domineer 的 ing 形式）

sentences.english: a domineering mother
sentences.chinese: 专横的母亲

detailed_translations.chinese: 跋扈的；专横的；盛气凌人的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is domineering tries to control other people without considering their feelings or ideas – used to show disapproval

detailed_translations.chinese: 实行暴政；高耸；流行（domineer的ing形式）

name: presumptuous
trans: adj. 专横的；放肆的；冒昧的

sentences.english: "Without being presumptuous, "he reports, "it has been my main objective for those twenty years to keep the highest possible level of service on what is, after all, a train.
sentences.chinese: “没有放肆，”他说，“这是我的主要目标是为那些二十年保持最高水准的服务是什么，毕竟，一列火车。”

detailed_translations.english: doing something that you have no right to do and that seems rude

name: arrogance
trans: n. 傲慢，自大

sentences.english: I couldn’t believe the arrogance of the man!
sentences.chinese: 我真不敢相信那个男人那么傲慢！

detailed_translations.english: when someone behaves in a rude way because they think they are very important

name: preference
trans: n. 偏爱，偏好；更喜欢的人（或物）；优待，优先（权）；<法律>（尤指债务偿付）优先偿还权

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: bias
trans: n. 偏见，成见；偏好，天赋；倾向，趋势；斜纹；（统计）偏差，偏倚；偏重心球形；偏压，偏统 v. 使有偏见，使偏心；加偏压（或偏流）于 adj. 偏斜的 adv. 偏斜地

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

name: doleful
trans: adj. 寂寞的；悲哀的；阴沉的；忧郁的

sentences.english: a doleful song about lost love
sentences.chinese: 一首关于逝去的爱情的哀歌

detailed_translations.chinese: 寂寞的；悲哀的；阴沉的；忧郁的
detailed_translations.english: very sad

name: upset
trans: v. 使心烦意乱，使生气；打乱，搅乱；打翻，使倾覆；翻倒；意外击败（强对手）；使（肠胃）不适；制造麻烦，破坏某人的计划；镦锻，镦粗 adj. 不高兴的，心烦意乱的；（肠胃）不适的 n. 烦恼，失望；肠胃不适；爆冷门；混乱，麻烦；翻倒，颠覆

sentences.english: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

detailed_translations.chinese: 心烦的， 苦恼的； 不适的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 使心烦意乱，使苦恼，使不适；搅乱；弄翻，倾覆
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick

name: trying
trans: adj. 令人厌烦的，难对付的 v. 试图，努力；试用，试做，试验；品尝（try 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: That child is very trying.
sentences.chinese: 那个孩子非常难缠。

sentences.english: The beginning of the show is often a trying time because of latecomers.
sentences.chinese: 演出刚开始常常是最难熬的时期，因为总会有人迟到。

sentences.english: They do the best they can in trying circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 他们在艰难的环境下尽自己最大的努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难受的；难堪的；费劲的；令人厌烦的
detailed_translations.english: annoying or difficult in a way that makes you feel worried, tired etc

name: sentimental
trans: adj. 情感的（而非理性的）；多愁善感的，柔情的；（故事、电影、书等）感伤的，故作伤感的

sentences.english: She said a sentimental goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 她依依不舍地道别。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伤感的；多愁善感的；感情用事的；寓有情感的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is sentimental is easily affected by emotions such as love, sympathy, sadness etc, often in a way that seems silly to other people

name: grieve
trans: v. （尤指因某人亡故而）感到悲痛；使伤心 n. <苏格兰>农庄总管

sentences.english: People need time to grieve after the death of a loved one.
sentences.chinese: 人们在所爱之人去世后会有一段悲伤期。

sentences.english: She grieved the loss of her only son.
sentences.chinese: 她因为失去唯一的儿子而悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel extremely sad, especially because someone you love has died
if something grieves you, it makes you feel very unhappy

name: grieved
trans: adj. 伤心的 v. 悲伤（grieve 的过去式）

name: gloom
trans: n. 忧郁，绝望；昏暗，幽暗 v. 外观昏暗；显得萧条（或消沉）

sentences.english: He peered into the gathering (= increasing ) gloom.
sentences.chinese: 他在渐深的暮色中眺望远方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏暗， 阴暗； 忧郁， 沮丧
detailed_translations.english: almost complete darkness

name: torturous
trans: adj. 折磨人的，痛苦的

sentences.english: a torturous five days of fitness testing
sentences.chinese: 五天痛苦的体能测试

detailed_translations.english: very painful or unpleasant to experience

name: misery
trans: n. 痛苦，苦难；穷困，悲惨境遇；<英，非正式>老发牢骚的人

sentences.english: What we are witnessing here is human misery on a vast scale.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这里所目睹的情景是许许多多的人都生活困苦。

sentences.english: the misery of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 失业的痛苦

sentences.english: the miseries of war
sentences.chinese: 战争造成的苦难

detailed_translations.english: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick

name: miserable
trans: adj. 痛苦的，使人难受的；（人）乖戾的，总是抱怨的；少得可怜的，太少的；糟糕的，差劲的

sentences.english: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.english: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

name: distressed
trans: adj. 苦恼的，忧虑的；十分疼痛的；（家具或衣服）刻意做旧的；<旧>贫困的，穷困的；〈非正式，美〉（房地产）（因丧失抵押房产赎回权或因该房产系其价值不足以偿付债务的地产的一个部分而）贱卖的 v. 使苦恼，使悲伤，使忧虑；使（家具，皮革）有仿磨损的痕迹（distress 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: The animal was clearly distressed.
sentences.chinese: 那动物显然很痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 痛苦的；忧虑的；贫困的；受损的
detailed_translations.english: very upset

detailed_translations.chinese: 使痛苦；使紧张；使困苦（distress的过去分词）

name: pensive
trans: adj. 沉思的，忧郁的；悲伤的，哀愁的

sentences.english: Jan looked pensive.
sentences.chinese: 简神情忧伤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉思的，忧郁的；悲伤的，哀愁的
detailed_translations.english: thinking a lot about something, especially because you are worried or sad

name: lament
trans: n. 挽歌，悼文；表达哀伤（或痛惜）之情的言辞；抱怨 v. 对……感到悲痛，对……表示失望；抱怨

sentences.english: The nation lamented the death of its great war leader.
sentences.chinese: 举国上下都在哀悼他们伟大的战时领袖。

detailed_translations.english: to express feelings of great sadness about something
a song, piece of music, or something that you say, that expresses a feeling of sadness

name: torment
trans: n. （肉体、精神上的）折磨，痛苦；使人痛苦的人（物） v. 使痛苦，折磨；骚扰，捉弄

sentences.english: The journey must have been a torment for them.
sentences.chinese: 这次旅途对他们来说一定十分痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: severe mental or physical suffering
to make someone suffer a lot, especially mentally

name: deplore
trans: v. 强烈反对，谴责

sentences.english: The UN deplored the invasion as a ‘violation of international law’.
sentences.chinese: 联合国谴责这次入侵 “违反了国际法” 。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谴责；悲悼；哀叹；对…深感遗憾
detailed_translations.english: to disapprove of something very strongly and criticize it severely, especially publicly

name: inconceivable
trans: adj. 不可思议的；难以置信的；不能想象的；非凡的

sentences.english: A few years ago a car fuelled by solar energy would have been inconceivable.
sentences.chinese: 几年前太阳能汽车还是不可思议的事。

sentences.english: It is inconceivable that a man in such a powerful position could act so unwisely.
sentences.chinese: 真是难以置信，这么大权在握的人行事竟如此愚蠢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可思议的；难以置信的；不能想象的；非凡的
detailed_translations.english: too strange or unusual to be thought real or possible

name: uncanny
trans: adj. 神秘的；离奇的；可怕的

sentences.english: an uncanny coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不可思议的巧合

detailed_translations.english: very strange and difficult to explain

name: marvelous
trans: adj. 了不起的；非凡的；令人惊异的；不平常的

sentences.english: It is all the same God, and that God showed me that the universe in which we live is a beautiful and marvelous mystery that is connected together forever and for always.
sentences.chinese: 他们所谈的是同一个上帝，这位上帝向我展示了我们生活在其中的这个宇宙的美丽和奇妙的神秘，它们关联在一起，永永远远。

name: breathtaking
trans: adj. 激动人心的，令人惊叹的；非常糟糕的，令人震惊的

sentences.english: The view from my bedroom window was absolutely breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 我卧室窗外的景色美得令人窒息。

sentences.english: an act of breathtaking arrogance
sentences.chinese: 令人咋舌的傲慢举动

detailed_translations.chinese: 惊人的；惊险的；令人激动的
detailed_translations.english: very impressive, exciting, or surprising

name: astound
trans: vt. 使惊骇，使震惊

sentences.english: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们所做的都是我们擅长的事情，我们最终将使自己大吃一惊。

sentences.english: “You astound me!” Mrs. Willoughby said, pressing her clasped hands to her lips, a gesture she normally bestowed upon seniors who were making their final appearance in the spring choral concert.
sentences.chinese: “你真是令我大吃一惊啊！” 威洛比太太说道，双手紧紧的按在嘴唇上——这是她通常在毕业班学生参加春季合唱音乐会上最后献唱时才会做出的姿势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使惊骇, 使大吃一惊

name: astonish
trans: v. 使吃惊，使惊讶

sentences.english: Her reply astonished me.
sentences.chinese: 她的回答让我大吃一惊。

sentences.english: It astonished him that she had changed so little.
sentences.chinese: 他很惊讶，她几乎没怎么变。

sentences.english: What astonishes me most is his complete lack of fear.
sentences.chinese: 最令我吃惊的是，他什么都不怕。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

name: astonished
trans: adj. 十分震惊的，非常惊讶的 v. 使吃惊，使惊讶（astonish 的过去式和过去分词形式）

name: incredible
trans: adj. 不可思议的，难以置信的；惊人的，极大的，极多的；了不起的，极好的

sentences.english: It’s incredible that he survived the fall.
sentences.chinese: 他跌下去竟然能够生还，真不可思议。

sentences.english: It’s incredible how much Tom has changed since he met Sally.
sentences.chinese: 自从遇见萨莉后，汤姆的变化之大简直令人难以置信。

sentences.english: I find it almost incredible that no one noticed these errors.
sentences.chinese: 没人发现这些错误，真让我无法相信。

detailed_translations.english: too strange to be believed, or very difficult to believe

name: striking
trans: adj. 惊人的，异常的；妩媚动人的，标致的；罢工的；打击的 n. 撞击，碰撞 v. 打，撞；（用手或武器等）打；罢工（strike 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: a striking contrast between wealth and poverty
sentences.chinese: 显著的贫富差异

sentences.english: The most striking feature of those statistics is the high proportion of suicides.
sentences.chinese: 那些统计数据最显著的特征是高自杀率。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or interesting enough to be easily noticed

name: tremor
trans: n. （身体或声音的）颤抖，战栗；兴奋，害怕；轻微地震，小地震；波动，风波 v. 震颤，颤抖，战栗

sentences.english: News of 160 lay-offs had sent tremors through the community.
sentences.chinese: 裁员160人的消息在社区中引起了波动。

detailed_translations.english: If an event causes a tremor in a group or organization, it threatens to make the group or organization less strong or stable

name: trepidation
trans: n. 恐惧；惊恐；忧虑；颤抖

sentences.english: With some trepidation, I opened the door.
sentences.chinese: 我有些惴惴不安地打开了门。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of anxiety or fear about something that is going to happen

name: petrify
trans: vi. 石化；惊呆 vt. 使……石化；使……惊呆

name: scare
trans: v. 使惊恐，吓唬；害怕，恐惧 n. 惊恐，惊吓；（社会上的）大恐慌

sentences.english: You really gave us a scare !
sentences.chinese: 你真的吓了我们一跳！

detailed_translations.english: a sudden feeling of fear

name: startle
trans: v. 使吓一跳，使惊奇 n. 惊愕，惊恐

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn’t mean to startle you.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我不是故意吓你一跳的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

name: stun
trans: v. 使震惊，使惊讶；使昏迷，（尤指）打昏；给（某人）以深刻印象，使深深感动 n. 昏迷；打昏；惊倒

sentences.english: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使震惊， 使目瞪口呆； 把…打昏， 使昏迷
detailed_translations.english: to surprise or upset someone so much that they do not react immediately

name: dismay
trans: n. 担忧；失望，沮丧；惊愕 v. 使担忧；使失望，使沮丧；使惊恐

sentences.english: The thought of leaving filled him with dismay .
sentences.chinese: 想到要离开，他心里充满了忧伤。

sentences.english: The committee was dismayed by what it had been told.
sentences.chinese: 该委员会被所告知的情况搞得焦虑不安。

detailed_translations.english: the worry, disappoint-ment, or unhappiness you feel when something unpleasant happens
If you are dismayed by something, it makes you feel afraid, worried, or sad

name: impetuous
trans: adj. 冲动的；鲁莽的；猛烈的

sentences.english: He was high-spirited and impetuous.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪高昂，行事鲁莽。

sentences.english: She might live to regret this impetuous decision.
sentences.chinese: 她可能会一辈子为这个鲁莽的决定感到后悔。

detailed_translations.english: tending to do things very quickly, without thinking carefully first, or showing this quality

name: impulse
trans: n. 冲动；脉冲；推动力 adj. 一时兴起的，随兴的 v. 推动

sentences.english: a sudden impulse to laugh
sentences.chinese: 突然想笑的冲动

sentences.english: It is the passions which provide the main impulse of music.
sentences.chinese: 激情是音乐创作的主要动力。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

name: impulsive
trans: adj. 冲动的；脉冲的

sentences.english: Rosa was impulsive and sometimes regretted things she’d done.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎性情鲁莽，有时会为做过的事感到后悔。

sentences.english: In a burst of impulsive generosity, I offered to pay.
sentences.chinese: 因一时慷慨，我主动提出付款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲动的；受感情驱使的；任性的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is impulsive does things without considering the possible dangers or problems first

name: urge
trans: v. 敦促，催促，力劝；竭力主张，强烈要求；驱赶，鞭策；鼓励，激励（~ sb. on） n. 强烈的欲望，冲动；推动力

sentences.english: The charity urged quick action.
sentences.chinese: 慈善机构敦促迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: I got a note from Moira urging me to get in touch.
sentences.chinese: 我收到莫伊拉的一封短信，一定要我保持联系。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly suggest that someone does something

name: incentive
trans: n. 激励，刺激

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

name: motivation
trans: n. 动力，诱因；积极性，干劲；<南非>（支持请求或倡议的）事实与理由

name: objective
trans: n. 目的，目标；出击目标（尤指在军事攻击中)；（望远镜或显微镜中的）物镜；出击目标（尤指在军事攻击中）；宾格 adj. 客观的，不带个人情感的；客观存在的；宾格的；目标的

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: grim
trans: adj. 严肃的，坚定的；令人不快的，令人沮丧的；阴森的，凄凉的；<非正式>生病的；<英，非正式>质量低劣，糟糕；（地方）简陋的

sentences.english: ‘I’ll survive,’ he said with a grim smile.
sentences.chinese: “我死不了。”他阴笑着说。

sentences.english: The police officers were silent and grim-faced.
sentences.chinese: 警察默不作声，神情严肃。

detailed_translations.english: looking or sounding very serious

name: sinister
trans: adj. 邪恶的，不祥的；<古>（纹章）（在）盾形纹章左侧的

sentences.english: There is a sinister side to these events.
sentences.chinese: 这些事件有邪恶的一面。

sentences.english: He was a handsome man, in a sinister sort of way.
sentences.chinese: 他英俊的外貌中带着一点阴险。

sentences.english: a sinister atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 不祥的气氛

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴险的；凶兆的；灾难性的；左边的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that something evil, dangerous, or illegal is happening or will happen

name: cruel
trans: adj. 残酷的，残忍的；引起痛苦的 v. <非正式>弄糟，使没有成功可能

sentences.english: His death was a cruel blow .
sentences.chinese: 他的死是个无情的打击。

sentences.english: Sometimes life seems unbearably cruel.
sentences.chinese: 有时候生活残酷得让人无法承受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的
detailed_translations.english: making someone suffer or feel unhappy

name: malevolent
trans: adj. 恶毒的；有恶意的；坏心肠的

sentences.english: Her stare was malevolent, her mouth a thin line.
sentences.chinese: 她目光狠毒，嘴唇紧闭。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恶毒的；有恶意的；坏心肠的
detailed_translations.english: a malevolent person wants to harm other people

name: malice
trans: n. 恶意，怨恨；（尤指加重某些罪行的）恶谋

sentences.english: James bore her no malice (= did not feel any malice towards her ) .
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯对她并无恶意。

detailed_translations.english: the desire to harm someone because you hate them

name: malicious
trans: adj. 恶意的，恶毒的，怀恨的

sentences.english: a malicious girl
sentences.chinese: 恶毒的女孩

detailed_translations.english: very unkind and cruel, and deliberately behaving in a way that is likely to upset or hurt someone

name: ferocious

to make your muscles tight and stiff, or to become tight and stiff

any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

name: menace
trans: n. 威胁，危险的人或物；烦人的人（或事物），引起麻烦的人（或事物）；危险气氛，威胁；<英，法律>（以）威胁（或恐吓）的手段（索要钱财） v. <正式>威胁，威吓

sentences.chinese: 大象仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

sentences.chinese: “克瑞斯，你那板斧有了新对象了，”他说，“一个纯洁得像白玫瑰的青年，对斯宾塞怀着恋人一样的热情。

sentences.english: Cathy Whitaker: That was the day I stopped believing in the wild ardor of things.
sentences.chinese: 凯西。惠特克：那一天，让我开始不再相信狂野的热情这样的事情。

name: ardent
trans: adj. 热心的，热切的；（爱情）热烈的，炽热的

sentences.english: an ardent supporter of free trade
sentences.chinese: 自由贸易的热心支持者

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情的；热心的；激烈的；燃烧般的
detailed_translations.english: showing strong positive feelings about an activity and determination to succeed at it

name: eager
trans: adj. 热切的，渴望的，渴求的

sentences.english: He’s a bright kid and eager to learn.
sentences.chinese: 他是个聪明的孩子，热爱学习。

sentences.english: She’s a very hard worker and very eager to please.
sentences.chinese: 她工作很卖力，而且很希望别人满意。

sentences.english: A crowd of eager young students were already waiting outside.
sentences.chinese: 一群急不可待的青年学生已经在外面等着。

detailed_translations.english: very keen and excited about something that is going to happen or about something you want to do

name: impassioned
trans: adj. 充满激情的；感激的 v. 使充满激情（impassion 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: She appeared on television to make an impassioned plea for help.
sentences.chinese: 她在电视上恳切地请求人们帮助。

sentences.english: an impassioned speech
sentences.chinese: 激昂的演讲

detailed_translations.english: full of strong feeling and emotion

detailed_translations.chinese: 使充满激情（impassion的过去式和过去分词）

name: avid
trans: adj. 热心的，热衷的；渴望的，渴求的

sentences.english: He misses not having enough books because he's an avid reader.
sentences.chinese: 他遗憾没有足够的书，因为他是一个热爱读书的人。

detailed_translations.english: You use avid to describe someone who is very enthusiastic about something that they do

name: devoted
trans: adj. 挚爱的，忠诚的；热衷的；专用于……的 v. 献身，致力；用于（devote 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: a devoted father
sentences.chinese: 尽职的父亲

sentences.english: Beckham’s devoted fans
sentences.chinese: 贝克汉姆的忠实球迷

detailed_translations.english: giving someone or something a lot of love and attention

name: readily
trans: adv. 轻而易举地，迅速地；乐意地，欣然地

sentences.english: Boats are readily available to visitors.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以很方便地租到船只。

sentences.english: The information is readily accessible on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 这些信息在因特网上一查就能找到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐意地， 欣然地； 容易地； 很快地， 立即
detailed_translations.english: quickly and easily

name: enthusiasm
trans: n. 热情，热忱；热衷的活动，热爱的事物

sentences.english: Gillian and Darren greeted the speakers with great enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。

sentences.english: We went along to the local diving club, full of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 我们兴高采烈地去了当地的潜水俱乐部。

sentences.english: They go about their tasks with little enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 他们执行任务时没多大干劲。

sentences.english: A delay of two hours did not dampen their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 耽误了两小时没有减弱他们的热情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it

name: zeal
trans: n. 热情，热忱

sentences.english: ...his zeal for teaching.
sentences.chinese: …他对教学的热衷。

detailed_translations.english: eagerness to do something, especially to achieve a particular religious or political aim

name: zealous
trans: adj. 热心的，热情的，积极的

sentences.english: a zealous preacher
sentences.chinese: 热心的讲道者

sentences.english: zealous political activists
sentences.chinese: 积极的政治活动家

detailed_translations.english: someone who is zealous does or supports something with great energy

name: zest
trans: n. 风味；热心；强烈的兴趣 vt. 给……调味

sentences.english: The danger of being caught added a certain zest to the affair.
sentences.chinese: 被捉奸的危险为这件风流韵事增添了一些刺激性。

detailed_translations.english: eager interest and enjoyment

name: hail
trans: v. 赞扬，欢呼；呼喊，招呼；下冰雹；（大量物体）像雹子般落下（或击打）；<古>表示问候或欢呼欢迎 n. 冰雹；雹子般的一阵；招呼（某人）

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

name: jealous
trans: adj. 妒忌的，好嫉妒的；珍惜的；猜疑的，留意提防的；（神祇）要求绝对忠实和崇敬的

sentences.english: She got insanely jealous and there was a terrible fight.
sentences.chinese: 她变得过分地猜忌，接着是一场激烈的打斗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妒忌的；猜疑的；唯恐失去的；戒备的
detailed_translations.english: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you wish you had

name: indifferent
trans: adj. 冷淡的，不关心的；中等的，平庸的；一般的，相当差的；中立的；不分化的

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: profane
trans: adj. 亵渎的；世俗的；异教的 vt. 亵渎；玷污

sentences.english: profane language
sentences.chinese: 亵渎的语言

detailed_translations.english: showing a lack of respect for God or holy things
to treat something holy with a lack of respect

name: flatter
trans: v. 奉承，讨好；使高兴，使感到荣幸；使显得更漂亮；使（某物）显得更重要（更好）

sentences.english: Perry would always flatter Mrs. Mitchell by praising her cooking.
sentences.chinese: 佩里常常奉承米切尔太太，称赞她的烹调手艺。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it

name: begrudge
trans: vt. 羡慕，嫉妒；吝惜，舍不得给

sentences.english: I certainly don't begrudge him the Nobel Prize.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定不会妒忌他得了获诺贝尔奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羡慕，嫉妒；吝惜，舍不得给
detailed_translations.english: to feel angry or upset with someone because they have something that you think they do not deserve

name: desperate
trans: adj. 不顾一切的，拼命的；极需要的，渴望的；极严重的，极危险的；绝望的，无望的；绝望的，无望的

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

name: contrite
trans: adj. 悔悟了的；后悔的；悔罪的

sentences.english: a contrite apology
sentences.chinese: 深感悔悟的道歉

detailed_translations.english: feeling guilty and sorry for something bad that you have done

name: forlorn
trans: adj. 被遗弃的；绝望的；孤独的

sentences.english: a forlorn figure sitting all by herself
sentences.chinese: 她独自坐着的孤苦身影

sentences.english: Ana sat with a bowed head and spoke in a forlorn voice.
sentences.chinese: 安娜低头坐着，话音凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: seeming lonely and unhappy

name: dubious
trans: adj. 可疑的，靠不住的；有疑虑的；（荣誉、名声等）不好的，不光彩的；质量不佳的

sentences.english: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
sentences.chinese: 该公司被指控有不诚实的会计行为。

sentences.english: Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
sentences.chinese: 许多批评家认为这一论点靠不住，或者说至少有误导性。

sentences.english: The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious .
sentences.chinese: 一国的经济增长会对全世界有益的假设是很值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的， 犹豫不决的， 无把握的； 有问题的； 靠不住的
detailed_translations.english: probably not honest, true, right etc

name: skeptical
trans: adj. 不相信的，持怀疑态度的；（哲）怀疑论的，不可知论的

sentences.english: So how do we strengthen our skeptical skills?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我们如何加强自身的怀疑技能呢？

sentences.english: Not all theory that we read in this course is skeptical.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这门课中提及的理论不全是怀疑性的。

sentences.english: L.M.:Well, I was skeptical myself in the beginning. But these are facts. The findings are very reproducible and we are waiting for confirmation by other labs.
sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

name: suspicion
trans: n. 不好的预感，猜想；（对某人有罪、不诚实等的）怀疑；不信任，猜疑；少量，一点 v. <方> 怀疑

sentences.english: I can’t say for definite who did it, but I certainly have my suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不能确切说是谁干的，但我肯定有怀疑的对象。

sentences.english: Police suspicions were confirmed when the stolen property was found in his flat.
sentences.chinese: 失窃物品在他公寓里找到，警方的怀疑得到了证实。

sentences.english: I wondered how I could leave early without arousing anyone’s suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道怎么才能早点离开而又不引起别人的怀疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑， 疑心， 猜疑； 一点儿， 少量
detailed_translations.english: a feeling you have that someone is probably guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: suspicious
trans: adj. 感觉可疑的，怀疑的；不信任的，持怀疑态度的；令人怀疑的，引起怀疑的

sentences.english: His reluctance to answer my questions made me suspicious .
sentences.chinese: 他不愿回答我的问题，这引起我的怀疑。

sentences.english: She gave him a suspicious glance.
sentences.chinese: 她向他投去怀疑的一瞥。

sentences.english: You’ve got a very suspicious mind!
sentences.chinese: 你真是疑心太重！

detailed_translations.english: thinking that someone might be guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: fishy
trans: adj. 鱼的；可疑的；似鱼的；呆滞的

name: incredulity
trans: n. 怀疑；不轻信，不易相信

sentences.english: When she told her family she was gay, they reacted with a mixture of shock and incredulity.
sentences.chinese: 当她告诉家人她是同性恋时，他们的反应是既震惊又不相信。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you cannot believe something

name: misgiving
trans: n. 疑虑，担忧，不安 v. 使……疑虑，使担忧，使害怕（misgive 的现在分词）

sentences.english: Opponents of nuclear energy have deep misgivings about its safety.
sentences.chinese: 反核能人士非常担心核能的安全性。

sentences.english: She eyed the distant shoreline with misgiving.
sentences.chinese: 她担忧地望着远方的海岸线。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of doubt or fear about what might happen or about whether something is right

detailed_translations.chinese: 担忧；使…疑虑；害怕（misgive的ing形式）

name: poise
trans: n. 沉着，镇定；（优雅的）体态，姿态；<古>平衡；（物理）泊 v. （使）平衡，（使）悬浮；准备做……（be poised）

sentences.english: What amazed him even more than her appearance was her poise.
sentences.chinese: 比她的长相更让他惊讶的是她的沉着镇定。

detailed_translations.english: If someone has poise, they are calm, dignified, and self-controlled
to put or hold something in a carefully balanced position, especially above something else

name: halt
trans: v. （使）停止行进；阻止，中断；（口令）立定；跛行；（尤指逻辑或诗韵）有缺陷；踌躇，犹豫 n. 停止，中止；<英>乡间小火车站（只有站台）；跛，瘸； 跛，瘸；（口令）立定 adj. 跛的，瘸的

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

name: scruple
trans: n. 微量；顾虑；踌躇 vi. 有顾忌；踌躇 vt. 对……有顾虑

sentences.english: a man with no moral scruples
sentences.chinese: 一个道德上无所顾忌的男人

detailed_translations.english: a belief about what is right and wrong that prevents you from doing bad things

name: flounder
trans: v. 不知所措，支吾；困难重重；（在水、泥等中）挣扎，折腾；心乱如麻 n. 鲆，鲽，比目鱼（同flatfish）；挣扎 n. （Flounder）（美、英、以）弗伦德（人名）

sentences.english: More and more firms are floundering because of the recession.
sentences.chinese: 由于经济衰退，越来越多的公司举步维艰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挣扎，折腾；错乱地做事或说话
detailed_translations.english: to have a lot of problems and be likely to fail completely
a European flatfish, Platichthys flesus having a greyish-brown body covered with prickly scales: family Pleuronectidae: an important food fish

name: demur
trans: vi. 反对；抗辩；提出异议 n. 异议；反对 n. （Demur）人名；（德）德穆尔；（法）德米尔

sentences.english: They demurred politely, but finally agreed to stay.
sentences.chinese: 他们礼貌地推却，但最后还是同意留下。

detailed_translations.english: to express doubt about or opposition to a plan or suggestion
disagreement or disapproval

name: hesitate
trans: v. 犹豫，不愿意

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

name: doubt
trans: v. 怀疑，不确定；不信任 n. 怀疑，不确定

sentences.english: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

sentences.english: Kim never doubted his story.
sentences.chinese: 例句：金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right
to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely

name: suspect
trans: v. 猜想，认为（某事有可能）；怀疑……有罪，认为……有嫌疑；不信任，怀疑……的真实性 n. 嫌疑犯，可疑分子；（某坏事物的）可能导致者 adj. 不可靠的，不可信的；可疑的，可能有危险的；有问题的，运转不好的

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

name: loath
trans: adj. 勉强的；不情愿的（等于 loth）

sentences.english: Sarah was loath to tell her mother what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉不愿意告诉母亲所发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: to be unwilling to do something

name: loathe
trans: vt. 讨厌，厌恶

sentences.english: He loathes their politics.
sentences.chinese: 他讨厌他们那一套政治。

detailed_translations.english: to hate someone or something very much

name: hideous
trans: adj. （外表）极丑的，面目狰狞的；非常可怕的，令人难以忍受的

sentences.english: a hideous dress
sentences.chinese: 一条很难看的连衣裙

sentences.english: hideous crimes
sentences.chinese: 丑恶的罪行

sentences.english: Dinnertime that day was hideous.
sentences.chinese: 那天的晚餐很不愉快。

detailed_translations.english: extremely unpleasant or ugly

name: sick
trans: adj. 生病的，患病的；病人的；恶心的，想吐的；不快的，恼怒的；厌倦的，厌烦的；（情感）强烈得令人不适的；（人）变态的，病态的；（故事、笑话等）令人毛骨悚然的，病态的；不祥的；（喻）（组织，体系，社团）面临严重问题的，不景气的；<非正式> 极好的；渴望的 n. 病人（the sick）；<英，非正式> 呕吐物 v. <英，非正式> 呕吐；放狗咬；<非正式> 派某人去追击（或监视、陪伴）

sentences.english: His mother’s very sick.
sentences.chinese: 他母亲病得很重。

sentences.english: Maria can’t come in today because she’s sick.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚因为生病今天不能来了。

sentences.english: a sick child
sentences.chinese: 生病的孩子

sentences.english: a sick animal
sentences.chinese: 患病的动物

sentences.english: What will happen to the business if you fall sick (= become ill ) or die?
sentences.chinese: 假如你生病或是去世了，公司怎么办？

sentences.english: He took sick (= became ill ) and died a week later.
sentences.chinese: 他病倒后一周就去世了。

sentences.english: Pete’s at home in bed, sick as a dog (= very sick ) .
sentences.chinese: 皮特卧床在家，病得很重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 厌恶的；病态的；不舒服；渴望的；恶心的 ；生病的
detailed_translations.english: suffering from a disease or illness
people who are ill

name: complaint
trans: n. 抱怨，投诉；不满的缘由，抱怨的问题；疾病，不适

sentences.english: If you wish to make a complaint, you should see the manager.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which someone complains about something

name: grievance
trans: n. 不满，不平；委屈，冤情；投诉

sentences.english: anyone who has a legitimate grievance against the company
sentences.chinese: 凡是有正当理由对公司感到不满的人

sentences.english: a means of overcoming genuine grievances
sentences.chinese: 化解委屈的一个办法

sentences.english: There must be an opportunity for both sides to air their grievances .
sentences.chinese: 一定要有一个机会让双方都说出心中的不满。

sentences.english: The teachers’ contract established a grievance procedure .
sentences.chinese: 教师合同建立了一个申诉程序。

sentences.english: the sense of grievance which characterized him as a young man
sentences.chinese: 他年轻时惯有的不满情绪

detailed_translations.english: a belief that you have been treated unfairly, or an unfair situation or event that affects and upsets you

name: aversion
trans: n. 厌恶，憎恶；讨厌的人（或东西）

sentences.english: Many people have a natural and emotional aversion to insects.
sentences.chinese: 很多人对昆虫有一种天生的厌恶之感。

detailed_translations.english: a strong dislike of something or someone

name: hatred
trans: n. 仇恨，憎恨，敌意

sentences.english: A look of pure hatred flashed across her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上闪过十足的仇恨表情。
