sentences.english: the old hatreds and prejudices that simmered below the surface
sentences.chinese: 长久以来憋在心中的仇恨与偏见

detailed_translations.english: an angry feeling of extreme dislike for someone or something

name: disgust
trans: n. 反感，憎恶；厌恶，憎恶 v. 使反感，使憎恶；使感到恶心（作呕）

sentences.english: He reached into the bin with a look of disgust on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把手伸进垃圾箱，脸上带着厌恶的表情。

sentences.english: He disgusted many with his boorish behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他以其粗鲁的行为使许多人感到厌恶。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of dislike, annoyance, or disapproval
To disgust someone means to make them feel a strong sense of dislike and disapproval

name: grudge
trans: n. 怨恨，嫌隙 v. （因不满而）不愿意给（或允许）；嫉恨，妒忌（某人）做成（某事）

sentences.english: Mr Gillis was not normally a man to bear grudges .
sentences.chinese: 吉利斯先生通常不是那种会积怨的人。

sentences.english: I’m not harbouring some secret grudge against you.
sentences.chinese: 我没有对你暗地里怀恨在心。

sentences.english: It could be the work of someone with a grudge against the company.
sentences.chinese: 这事可能是某些对公司怀有怨愤的人干的。

sentences.english: You let nasty little personal grudges creep in.
sentences.chinese: 你就由着怨恨的情绪一点一点滋长。

detailed_translations.chinese: 勉强做； 不情愿地给
detailed_translations.english: to do or give something very unwillingly
a feeling of dislike for someone because you cannot forget that they harmed you in the past

name: detest
trans: v. 憎恨，厌恶

sentences.english: The two men detested each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相厌恶。

detailed_translations.english: to hate something or someone very much

name: resent
trans: v. 怨恨，憎恶

sentences.english: Paul resented the fact that Carol didn’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 保罗非常气愤，因为卡萝尔不信任他。

detailed_translations.english: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

name: abhor
trans: vt. 痛恨，憎恶

sentences.english: I abhor discrimination of any kind.
sentences.chinese: 我厌恶任何一种歧视。

detailed_translations.english: to hate a kind of behaviour or way of thinking, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: abhorrent
trans: adj. 可恶的；厌恶的；格格不入的

sentences.english: Bribe paying is not only abhorrent but is counterproductive in the longer term.
sentences.chinese: 贿赂不仅是可恶的，而且从长远看还会产生相反的结果。

sentences.english: In the face of that inherent dignity, Gombinerconcludes, the human practice of delivering animals to the table in the form offood is abhorrent and inexcusable.
sentences.chinese: 面对这与生俱来的尊严，高姆宾尔断言，人类把动物放到餐桌上作为食物的做法是可恶且不可原谅的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is abhorrent is completely unacceptable because it seems morally wrong

name: benevolent
trans: adj. 仁慈的，乐善好施的；（用于慈善机构名称）慈善的，救济的

sentences.english: A benevolent uncle paid for her to have music lessons.
sentences.chinese: 一位叔叔慷慨解囊，出钱供她上音乐课。

sentences.english: a benevolent smile
sentences.chinese: 慈祥的笑容

detailed_translations.english: kind and generous

name: munificent
trans: adj. 慷慨的；丰厚的；宽宏的

sentences.english: a munificent gift
sentences.chinese: 一份厚礼

detailed_translations.english: very generous

name: charity
trans: n. 慈善组织，慈善机构；慈善事业；仁慈，宽厚；赈济，施舍

sentences.english: Several charities sent aid to the flood victims.
sentences.chinese: 有几家慈善机构已向洪灾灾民送去了救援物资。

detailed_translations.english: an organization that gives money, goods, or help to people who are poor, sick etc

name: charitable
trans: adj. 慈善的；仁慈的，宽容的；慷慨的

sentences.english: charitable groups
sentences.chinese: 慈善团体

sentences.english: a charitable donation
sentences.chinese: 慈善捐赠

detailed_translations.english: relating to giving help to the poor

name: generous
trans: adj. 慷慨的，大方的；大量的，丰富的；宽宏大量的

sentences.english: Dietler is generous with his time and money.
sentences.chinese: 迪特勒在他的时间和金钱方面慷慨大方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is generous is willing to give money, spend time etc, in order to help people or give them pleasure

name: generously
trans: adv. 慷慨地；宽大地；丰盛地

name: obliging
trans: v. 强迫（某人）做（某事）；按（某人的要求）照办；帮忙；遵守誓约（oblige 的现在分词） adj. 乐于助人的，热心相助的

sentences.english: The shop assistant was very obliging.
sentences.chinese: 店员非常热情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐于助人的；有礼貌的；体贴的；亲切的
detailed_translations.english: willing and eager to help

name: sympathetic
trans: adj. 同情的，有同情心的；赞同的，支持的；（电影或小说中的人物）讨人喜欢的，可爱的；合意的，合适的；（结构）和谐的；交感神经的，自主神经系统的；（与）交感性（有关）的，（产生）交感性的 n. 交感神经

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

name: liberal
trans: adj. 思想开明的；自由主义的，支持变革的；（加拿大、英国等国）自由党的；慷慨的，大量给予的；通识（教育）的，文科的；不确切的，不拘泥字面的；自由主义神学的 n. 思想开明的人；自由主义者，支持变革的人；（加拿大、英国等国的）自由党党员，自由党支持者

sentences.english: I had quite liberal parents.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母思想很开明。

sentences.english: a liberal supply of drinks
sentences.chinese: 饮料的充足供应

detailed_translations.english: willing to understand and respect other people’s ideas, opinions, and feelings

name: instrumental
trans: adj. 有帮助的，起作用的；用乐器演奏的；与乐器有关的；与（事物）的工具效用有关的；与仪器或测量器具有关的；（语法）工具格的 n. 器乐曲（通常指非古典音乐）；工具格名词，工具格

sentences.english: ...a CD of vocal and instrumental music.
sentences.chinese: …一张声乐和器乐光盘。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐器的；有帮助的；仪器的，器械的
detailed_translations.english: instrumental music is for instruments, not for voices
a piece of music in which no voices are used, only instruments

name: gainful
trans: adj. 唯利是图的；有利益的；赚钱的

name: benefit
trans: n. 好处，益处；救济金，补助金；额外奖励，保险金；慈善活动 v. 对（某人）有用，使受益；得益于，得利于

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: 利益，恩惠；救济金，保险金，津贴
detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

name: beneficial
trans: adj. 有益的，有利的；<法律>（与）权益（有关）的，有财产使用权的

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

name: prop
trans: n. 支柱，支撑物；（戏剧或电影中的）道具；<旧，非正式> 道具管理员（props）；支持者，后盾；<非正式> 螺旋桨，推进器；（英式橄榄球运动的）前排边锋；（本身没有具体意义但能使句法完整的）结构词；（马快跑时的）骤停 v. 支撑，倚靠；<澳>（尤指马等挺直前腿）骤停；用……撑住（某物）

sentences.english: Anna looks after costumes and props.
sentences.chinese: 安娜管理服装和道具。

detailed_translations.chinese: 支柱，支撑物；支持者；道具；（橄榄球中的）支柱前锋
detailed_translations.english: an object placed under or against something to hold it in a particular position

detailed_translations.chinese: 支撑，支持，维持；使倚靠在某物上
detailed_translations.english: to support something by leaning it against something, or by putting something else under, next to, or behind it

name: redress
trans: v. 纠正；重新放直；重新调整，使恢复（平衡）；赔偿；救济 n. 赔偿；矫正；救济

sentences.english: Little could be done to redress the situation .
sentences.chinese: 局势难以挽回。

sentences.english: Affirmative action was meant to redress the balance (= make the situation fair ) for minorities.
sentences.chinese: 反歧视行动旨在弥补对少数群体的不公平待遇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 救济；赔偿；纠正；重新调整
detailed_translations.english: to correct something that is wrong or unfair
money that someone pays you because they have caused you harm or damaged your property

name: compassion
trans: n. 同情，怜悯

sentences.english: I was shocked by the doctor’s lack of compassion .
sentences.chinese: 我对这个医生如此缺乏同情心感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of sympathy for someone who is suffering, and a desire to help them

name: assist
trans: v. 帮助，协助；<古>参加，出席 n. （球赛中的）助攻；资助，帮助

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

detailed_translations.english: to help someone to do something
If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them

name: extricate
trans: vt. 使解脱；解救；使游离

sentences.english: It represents a last-ditch attempt by the country to extricate itself from its economic crisis.
sentences.chinese: 这是该国摆脱经济危机的最后一搏。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from a difficult or embarrassing situation, or to help someone escape

name: donate
trans: v. 捐赠，赠送；献（血），捐献（器官）

sentences.english: people who volunteer to donate blood
sentences.chinese: 自愿献血者

detailed_translations.english: to give something, especially money, to a person or an organization in order to help them

name: raise
trans: v. 提升，举起；（使）直立，站立；建造，树立（纪念碑等）；增加，提高（数量、水平等）；筹集，筹募；召集，征募（尤指士兵）；提及（某事）；引起，使出现；饲养，种植；抚养，养育； 使积方，使自乘……次；比（对手）多下赌注； 打捞（船只）；使（面包）发酵；使复活；（暂时）终止，解除；（通过无线电或电话）与……取得联系；开具（发货单或其他单据）；把（动物）从窝里赶出；（海上人员）驶近能看见（陆地或其他船只）的地方；（免疫）刺激（抗血清、抗体等的）生成 n. <美>加薪；（扑克牌或勃莱格牌用语）赌注加码；（举重）（持杠铃时的）提，举；上升

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: bestow
trans: vt. 赠予，授予（财产、权力或荣誉）；<古>存放，贮藏；使用

sentences.english: The United States bestowed honorary citizenship upon England's World War II prime minister, Sir Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 美国授予了二战期间的英国首相温斯顿·丘吉尔爵士荣誉公民的称号。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something of great value or importance

name: rescue
trans: v. 营救，援救；拯救，挽救（生意等）；<非正式>防止……丢失（或遭丢弃），取回 n. 营救，救援；营救行动

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

name: champion
trans: n. 冠军，第一名；拥护者，斗士 v. 捍卫，拥护，支持 adj. <英，非正式>极好的；冠军的，得一等奖的

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

name: salvage
trans: n. 抢救，救援；抢救出的物品；<法律>海难救助费，打捞费 v. 打捞，抢救；挽救，挽回（珍贵或重要的事物）

sentences.english: a massive salvage operation
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抢救行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 打捞；海上救助；抢救财货；救难的奖金
detailed_translations.english: when you save things from a situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost
to save something from an accident or bad situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost

name: save
trans: v. 救助，搭救；避免，减少；积攒，储蓄；节省（钱、时间或其他资源）；保存，保留；收集；（为某人）保留；（计算机）保存（数据）；使健康长寿，护佑；（足球等）救球，防止对方进球；（棒球）（替补投手） 保持（其他投手取得的领先地位）；（基督教）拯救（某人），使摆脱罪孽 n. （足球等守门员的）救球；（棒球）（替补投手） 保持（其他投手取得的领先地位）；（计算机）存储数据 prep. <正式> 除……之外

sentences.english: We’ll save a lot of time if we go by car.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是开车去，可以节省很多时间。

sentences.english: Everyone is being encouraged to save energy.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都被鼓励节约能源。

sentences.english: ways to save money on heating bills
sentences.chinese: 节省取暖费的种种办法

detailed_translations.english: to use less money, time, energy etc so that you do not waste any

name: adopt
trans: v. 收养；采取，采纳，接受；正式通过；选定（名字），承袭（风俗）；移居，定居；提名（某人）为候选人；保持（姿势）；<英>（地方当局）承担（道路）维修保养责任

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

name: assert
trans: v. 坚称，断言；维护，坚持（权利或权威）；坚持自己的主张，表现坚定；生效，起作用

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: preserve
trans: v. 保护，维护；保持，维持；腌制，保存（食物）；禁止他人捕猎 n. 果酱，腌菜；（某人或某个团体的）专属领域，独有活动；动物保护区，外人禁入的猎地

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: retain
trans: v. 保持，保留；保存，储存；记住；付定金聘定（尤指律师）；留用（员工）

sentences.english: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.english: The state wants to retain control of food imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

detailed_translations.english: to keep something or continue to have something

name: shield
trans: n. 盾（牌）；防护物，保护人；盾形纹（徽）章；<美>警徽；盾形奖牌；（颁发盾形奖牌的）比赛；背甲，头胸甲，龟甲板；（地质）地盾 v. 保护，保卫；遮挡；给……加防护罩；防止（或减少）辐射；（体育运动中）护住（球）；防御，起保护作用

sentences.english: He clanged his sword three times on his shield.
sentences.chinese: 他用他的剑当当当地敲了3下盾。

sentences.english: He used his left hand as a shield against the reflecting sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 他用左手遮挡反射过来的阳光。

sentences.english: He held up his hands, shielding his eyes from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 他抬手遮住眼睛免受阳光照射。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of metal or leather that soldiers used in the past to protect themselves when fighting
to protect someone or something from being harmed or damaged

name: defend
trans: v. 保卫，防御；捍卫，维护；（在比赛中）防守，防卫；参加卫冕赛，蝉联；做……的辩护律师，为……辩解

sentences.english: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。

sentences.english: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

detailed_translations.english: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

name: escort
trans: n. 护送者，护卫队，护航舰；（通常指异性的）社交聚会陪伴者，伴游；陪护，护送 v. 押送；护送，护卫

sentences.english: The shipment was escorted by guards.
sentences.chinese: 货物的运输由卫兵护送。

sentences.english: a police escort
sentences.chinese: 警察护卫队

detailed_translations.english: to take someone somewhere, especially when you are protecting or guarding them
a person or a group of people or vehicles that go with someone in order to protect or guard them

name: convoy
trans: n. （尤指护卫）舰队，车队 v. 护送，为……护航

sentences.english: a military convoy
sentences.chinese: 军方的护送舰队

detailed_translations.english: a group of vehicles or ships travelling together, sometimes in order to protect one another
to travel with something in order to protect it

name: safeguard
trans: n. 保障条款， 保护措施 v. 保护，护卫

sentences.english: International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.
sentences.chinese: 国际安全条约防止核武器数量增加。

detailed_translations.chinese: [安全] 保护；保卫；保护措施
detailed_translations.english: a rule, agreement etc that is intended to protect someone or something from possible dangers or problems
to protect something from harm or damage

name: behave
trans: v. 行为，表现；起反应，起作用；守规矩，举止得体

sentences.english: She behaved in a very responsible way .
sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我无法相信这些人竟这样行事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现，举止；运转，做出反应
detailed_translations.english: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc
The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say

name: behavior
trans: n. 行为，举止；态度；反应

detailed_translations.chinese: 行为， 举止， 表现

name: conduct
trans: v. 实施，进行；指挥；带领，引导；举止，表现；传导 n. 行为，举止；经营方式，管理方法

sentences.english: The Senator’s conduct is being investigated by the Ethics Committee.
sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导
detailed_translations.english: to stand in front of a group of musicians or singers and direct their playing or singing

name: deport
trans: v. 驱逐（非本国居民）出境

sentences.english: ...a government decision earlier this month to deport all illegal immigrants.
sentences.chinese: …本月早些时候政府一项驱逐所有非法移民的决定。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone leave a country and return to the country they came from, especially because they do not have a legal right to stay

name: abstract
trans: adj. 抽象的，纯概念的；（艺术）抽象派的；理论上的，不切实际的 n. 摘要，梗概；抽象画，抽象派艺术作品；抽象的概念 v. 抽象化，从理论上（或孤立地）考虑；提取，使分离；写……的摘要；偷走，窃取；退出

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: abstraction
trans: n. 抽象；提取；抽象概念；空想；心不在焉

sentences.english: He’s always talking in abstractions.
sentences.chinese: 他老是谈抽象的东西。

detailed_translations.english: a general idea about a type of situation, thing, or person rather than a specific example from real life

name: action
trans: n. 行动；行为；战斗；诉讼；<非正式>令人激动的事；动作；情节；惊险刺激的活动（或事件）；作用；开始（电影导演开拍的指令）；赚钱的机会；性交；运转方式 v. 处理 adj. 动作（片）的，动作片中的

sentences.english: The government must take action (=do something) now to stop the rise in violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在必须采取行动遏止暴力犯罪的上升。

detailed_translations.english: the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing

name: shift
trans: v. （使）移动，（使）转移；（使）转换到（另一个人或另一事物）；（使）改变意见（或信仰等）；<英，非正式>赶快；<美>换（挡）；（计算机）移位；按（计算机键盘上的）Shift 键；<英，非正式>摆脱，消除；<英，非正式>（尤指大量）销售，出售；<英，非正式>狼吞虎咽地吃；<古>含糊其辞，拐弯抹角 n. 改变，转变；轮班工作时间；轮班工作的人；（计算机键盘上的）Shift 键；（计算机）移位；<美>（机动车的）换挡装置；宽松直筒连衣裙（=shift dress）；<史>长而宽松的内衣；（建筑）错位；（美橄）（开赛前）球员位置的变换；（天文）（光谱线的）偏移；语音演变（sound shift 的简称）；<古>计谋，诡计

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

detailed_translations.english: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

name: dissipate
trans: v. （使某事物）消散，消失；挥霍，耗费；放荡

sentences.english: As he thought it over, his anger gradually dissipated.
sentences.chinese: 他想明白后，怒气就渐渐消了。

sentences.english: Little by little, the smoke was dissipated by the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 在微风的吹拂下烟雾渐渐地消散了。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 使消散， 使消失， 驱散； 浪费， 挥霍
detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this

name: deal
trans: n. 大量；交易；坏运气，不公平的对待；发牌；冷衫木；优惠的价格，划算的价格；牌戏的一局；一手牌 v. 应对（难缠的人，困难局面）（deal with）；（以某种方式）对付，对待（deal with）；论及，讨论（deal with）；买卖，交易；给予；贩卖（毒品、艺术品等）；与……有关；发牌

sentences.english: The prime minister promised farmers a new deal (= a new and fairer system ) .
sentences.chinese: 首相向农民保证推行一项新政策。

detailed_translations.english: treatment of a particular type that is given or received

name: dispose
trans: v. 处理，放置，安排；使易于，使倾向于；丢掉

sentences.english: Chinese vases are disposed around the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 中国花瓶摆放在展馆四周。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things or put them in their places

name: bestow
trans: vt. 赠予，授予（财产、权力或荣誉）；<古>存放，贮藏；使用

sentences.english: The United States bestowed honorary citizenship upon England's World War II prime minister, Sir Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 美国授予了二战期间的英国首相温斯顿·丘吉尔爵士荣誉公民的称号。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something of great value or importance

name: exert
trans: v. 运用，施加（影响）；努力，尽力（exert oneself）

sentences.english: They exerted considerable influence within the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: Environmental groups are exerting pressure on the government to tighten pollution laws.
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织在向政府施加压力，要求从严执行环保法律法规。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

name: displace
trans: v. 取代，代替；使（人或动物群体）离开家园；移动，转移

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

name: tackle
trans: v. 应付，解决（难题或局面）；与……交涉；（足球、曲棍球等比赛中）抢断；（橄榄球等比赛中）擒抱并摔倒（对方球员）；擒获；对付，打（尤指罪犯）；质问，责问；反对，反抗 n. （足球等中的）抢断球；（橄榄球或美式足球）擒抱摔倒；（美式足球中的）阻截队员；体育器械，（尤指）渔具；（吊起重物用的）索具，滑轮；<英，俚>男性性器官

sentences.english: There is more than one way to tackle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 解决这个问题不止一个办法。

sentences.english: fishing tackle
sentences.chinese: 渔具

detailed_translations.english: to try to deal with a difficult problem
the equipment used in some sports and activities, especially fishing

name: transact
trans: vi. 交易；谈判 vt. 办理；处理

sentences.english: Most deals are transacted over the phone.
sentences.chinese: 大多数生意都是在电话里成交的。

detailed_translations.english: to do business with someone

name: discard
trans: v. 扔掉，弃置；打出（无用的牌），垫（牌） n. 被抛弃物；（纸牌游戏中）垫出的牌

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

name: utilize
trans: v. 利用，使用

sentences.english: We must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须考虑怎样充分利用现有的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose

name: harness
trans: v. 控制并利用；（把动物）拴在一起（或拴到某物上）；给（马）套上挽具；连接，串联 n. （马的）挽具，马具；系带，吊带；日常工作

sentences.english: We can harness the power of the wind to generate electricity.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以利用风力发电。

detailed_translations.english: to control and use the natural force or power of something

name: arrange
trans: v. 安排，筹备；整理，布置，排列；改编；商定

sentences.english: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请联络当地分部安排预约。

sentences.english: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
sentences.chinese: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

sentences.english: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
sentences.chinese: 马修两点钟依约而至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 准备； 整理
detailed_translations.english: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

name: reject
trans: v. 拒绝，否决（提议、建议或请求）；摈弃，不接受（信仰或政治制度）；不雇用，不录取；（因质量不好而）废弃；冷落，嫌弃；排异，排斥（移植器官）；（投币设备）拒绝接受（硬币） n. 次品，废品；不合格者，被排斥者

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: cancel
trans: v. 取消（计划好的事情）；终止，废除；盖销，注销；（因素，情况）抵消，对消 n. 取消，撤销；邮票注销章，戳记；经修正的版面

sentences.english: Our flight was cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 我们的航班取消了。

sentences.english: I’m afraid I’ll have to cancel our meeting tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我得取消我们明天的会议。

sentences.english: You’ll just have to ring John and cancel.
sentences.chinese: 你只能打电话给约翰取消了。

detailed_translations.english: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen

name: undo
trans: v. 解开，松开；消除……影响或结果，使恢复原状；撤销（先前的计算机指令）；破坏，毁掉 n. （计算机）撤消还原

sentences.english: The screws can be undone by hand.
sentences.chinese: 这些螺丝可以用手拧开。

sentences.english: I undid the package carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我小心地打开包裹。

sentences.english: He undid most of the good work of the previous manager.
sentences.chinese: 他把前任经理的大部分功绩都毁掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to open something that is tied, fastened or wrapped

name: delete
trans: v. 删除 n. 删除键

sentences.english: His name was deleted from the list.
sentences.chinese: 他的名字从名单上删掉了。

sentences.english: I deleted the file by mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我误删了这个文件。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that has been written down or stored in a computer

name: contrive
trans: v. 谋划，策划；设计，发明；设法做到

sentences.english: In 1862, a technique was contrived to take a series of photographs showing stages of movement.
sentences.chinese: 1862年时发明了一种技术，可以拍出一连串展示连续动作的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明; 设计; 设法；造成
detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something in spite of difficulties

name: implement
trans: v. 执行，贯彻；为……提供工具 n. 工具，器具；<苏格兰>履行；手段

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

name: effectuate
trans: vt. 完成；实行；招致

name: glean
trans: vt. 收集（资料）；拾（落穗） vi. 收集；拾落穗

sentences.english: At present we're gleaning information from all sources.
sentences.chinese: 目前我们正从所有渠道慢慢收集信息。

detailed_translations.english: to collect grain that has been left behind after the crops have been cut

name: purge
trans: v. 清洗（组织中的异己分子）；清除，排除（不愉快的情况或感觉）；删除（不需要的东西） ；催泻，通便；<法律>弥补，消除（蔑视法庭罪）；（尤指由于患有贪食症）使吐出吃下的食物，催吐 n. （对异己的）清洗，排除；泻药

sentences.english: Anorexics may overeat before purging themselves or vomiting.
sentences.chinese: 厌食症患者会在暴饮暴食之后服用泻药或者把吃下去的东西呕吐出来。

detailed_translations.english: to take a substance that makes your  bowel s  empty
a substance used to make you empty your  bowel s

name: erase
trans: v. 抹去，擦掉；删除；忘却；消除，消灭；（易）被擦掉，（易）被抹去

sentences.english: The computer crashed, and all our records were erased.
sentences.chinese: 计算机瘫痪了，我们所有的记录都被删除了。

detailed_translations.english: to remove information from a computer memory or recorded sounds from a tape

name: eradicate
trans: v. 根除，消灭

sentences.english: an attempt to eradicate inflation
sentences.chinese: 为消除通货膨胀所作的努力

sentences.english: This problem has now been completely eradicated.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题现已彻底杜绝。

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something such as a disease or a social problem

name: efface
trans: vt. 抹去，抹掉；使自己不受人注意

sentences.english: Nothing can efface the last picture I have of them from my mind.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能抹去他们在我脑海中留下的最后印象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抹去，抹掉；使自己不受人注意
detailed_translations.english: to destroy or remove something

name: despatch
trans: v. 派遣；发送；迅速处理；杀死；匆匆吃下，匆匆离开（等于 dispatch） n. 派遣；发送；急件；报道；杀死（等于 dispatch）

name: forsake
trans: v. 抛弃，离开（尤指不履行责任)；摒弃，离开（尤指喜爱的事物）；离开，告别（某地）

sentences.english: She will never forsake her vegetarian principles.
sentences.chinese: 她绝不会放弃自己的素食主义原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing, using, or having something that you enjoy

name: adopt
trans: v. 收养；采取，采纳，接受；正式通过；选定（名字），承袭（风俗）；移居，定居；提名（某人）为候选人；保持（姿势）；<英>（地方当局）承担（道路）维修保养责任

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

name: process
trans: n. 步骤，程序；（自然或偶然的）变化过程；（为达到某目标的）过程，进程；制作方法，加工方法；<法律>传票；（生，剖）端突，突起 adj. （印刷）三原色的，三色版的； 经过特殊加工的；照相板的 v. （用化学物品或机器）处理，加工；审核，受理（正式文件或请求）；（计算机）处理（数据）；冲洗（照片）；加工（食品）；<正式>列队行进；把（头发）弄成直发

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

name: scrap
trans: n. （纸、布等的）碎片，小块；丝毫，一丁点；废品，废弃材料（=scrap metal）；吃剩的东西，残羹剩饭（scraps）；<非正式>小摩擦，小口角；<英，非正式>极瘦小的人（常指小孩） v. （因不切实际而）放弃，抛弃（计划、体系）；把（旧机器、旧汽车等当）作废料处理，报废；<非正式>打架，吵架；激烈竞争 adj. （金属、纸张）废弃的，报废的；零碎的

sentences.english: He’s always getting into scraps with other dogs.
sentences.chinese: 它老是和别的狗打起来。

sentences.english: There's always tons of scrap paper in Dad's office.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸的办公室里总有大量的废纸。

detailed_translations.english: a short fight or argument
Scrap metal or paper is no longer wanted for its original purpose, but may have some other use

name: abandon
trans: v. 抛弃，遗弃；（因危险）离开，舍弃；中止，不再有；放弃（信念、信仰或看法）；陷入，沉湎于（某种情感） n. 放任，放纵

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

name: jettison
trans: v. （为减轻重量而从行驶的飞机或船上）投弃；摆脱，处理掉；放弃；拒绝接受；把……作为废物抛弃 n. 扔，投；废弃；投弃（船舶遇难时投弃货物以减轻负载）

sentences.english: We're going to jettison the cargo.
sentences.chinese: 我们正准备投弃货物。

detailed_translations.english: to throw things away, especially from a moving plane or ship

name: impulsive
trans: adj. 冲动的；脉冲的

sentences.english: Rosa was impulsive and sometimes regretted things she’d done.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎性情鲁莽，有时会为做过的事感到后悔。

sentences.english: In a burst of impulsive generosity, I offered to pay.
sentences.chinese: 因一时慷慨，我主动提出付款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲动的；受感情驱使的；任性的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is impulsive does things without considering the possible dangers or problems first

name: hasten
trans: v. 促进，使加快；急忙进行，赶紧说（或做）；赶往（某地）

sentences.english: Their departure was hastened by an abnormally cold winter.
sentences.chinese: 那个冬天异常寒冷，所以他们提前走了。

detailed_translations.english: to make something happen faster or sooner

name: urge
trans: v. 敦促，催促，力劝；竭力主张，强烈要求；驱赶，鞭策；鼓励，激励（~ sb. on） n. 强烈的欲望，冲动；推动力

sentences.english: The charity urged quick action.
sentences.chinese: 慈善机构敦促迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: I got a note from Moira urging me to get in touch.
sentences.chinese: 我收到莫伊拉的一封短信，一定要我保持联系。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly suggest that someone does something

name: prod
trans: v. 刺，戳；刺激，督促 n. 戳，捅；刺戳的工具；刺激，提醒；（贬称）新教徒

sentences.english: a cattle prod
sentences.chinese: 赶牛刺棒

detailed_translations.english: a pointed instrument used for pushing animals, to make them move
to quickly push something or someone with your finger or a pointed object

name: stimulate
trans: v. 促进，激发（某事物）；激发，鼓励；使（身体，生物系统）兴奋，刺激；起刺激作用

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.english: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

name: promote
trans: v. 促进，提倡；升职，晋升；促销，推广； 将（运动队）晋级；使（学生）升年级；负责筹办，主办（大型活动，如音乐会或体育比赛）；促使（议会私法议案）通过；使（卒）升格为（尤指后等）；<英>（先打大牌）使（小牌）赢得一墩；使（催化剂）更活泼

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: further
trans: adv. 更远地，再往前地；进一步；此外，而且 adj. 更多的，进一步的；（距离上）更远的，较远的 v. 促进，推进

sentences.english: They walked a little further.
sentences.chinese: 他们又往前走了一点。

sentences.english: His hands moved further down her back.
sentences.chinese: 他的手在她背上继续往下滑。

sentences.english: They’ve never been further south than San Diego.
sentences.chinese: 他们从没有到过比圣迭戈更往南的地方。

detailed_translations.english: a greater distance, or beyond a particular place
more or additional

name: elicit
trans: v. 引出，得到；<古>使（潜在的东西）显现，诱出

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

name: instigate
trans: v. 使（正式）开始，使发生；唆使，煽动（instigate sb. to/to do sth.）

sentences.english: Abettors, who instigate others to commit crimes, are not only the instigators but also the disseminator of criminal intent.
sentences.chinese: 教唆犯作为教唆他人犯罪的人，不仅是犯意的挑起者，也是犯意的传播者。

sentences.english: This paper can be divided into four parts. The first part briefly outlines the previous achievements on"instigate the lawsuits".
sentences.chinese: 本文分为四部分，第一部分对有关“教唆词讼”的先行研究作了一个简要的概述。

name: encourage
trans: v. 鼓励，激励；鼓动，怂恿；刺激，促进

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

name: inspire
trans: v. 激励，鼓舞；赋予灵感，激发（想法）；使产生（感觉或情感）；引起，导致；吸气，吸入

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: evoke
trans: v. 引起，唤起（感情、记忆或形象）；召（魂），唤（神）

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

name: arouse
trans: v. 引起，激起；叫醒，唤醒；激起……的性欲

sentences.english: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.english: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

detailed_translations.english: to make you become interested, expect something etc; to wake someone

name: kindle
trans: v. 点燃，开始燃烧；激起，激发；（感情）激动起来；（兔）产仔；照亮，（使）发亮；着火

sentences.english: We watched as the fire slowly kindled.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着火慢慢地燃烧起来。

detailed_translations.english: to start burning; to make a fire start burning

name: intensify
trans: v. 加剧，增强；增强（底片）的阻光度，增加（底片）的厚度

sentences.english: In Junethe civil war intensified.
sentences.chinese: 6月份内战更加激烈了。

sentences.english: His mother’s death intensified his loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的过世使他感到更加孤单。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in degree or strength, or to make something do this

name: fortify
trans: v. 筑防于，设要塞于；提高（食品）营养价值；使增强体质，使振奋精神；增强（感觉或态度）

sentences.english: Her position was fortified by election successes and economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 她的地位因为选举获胜及经济复苏而得到巩固。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage an attitude or feeling and make it stronger
to build towers, walls etc around an area or city in order to defend it

name: propel
trans: v. 推进，驱动；推搡（某人走向特定方向）； 驱使，促使

sentences.english: a boat propelled by a small motor
sentences.chinese: 由小马达驱动的小船

sentences.english: One of our students was unable to propel her wheelchair up the ramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有名学生无法把她的轮椅推上坡道。

detailed_translations.english: to move, drive, or push something forward

name: foment
trans: vt. 煽动；挑起；热敷

sentences.english: They were accused of fomenting rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动叛乱。

detailed_translations.english: to cause trouble and make people start fighting each other or opposing the government

name: incite
trans: v. 鼓动，煽动（暴力或非法行为）

sentences.english: They were charged with inciting racial hatred.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动种族仇恨。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately encourage people to fight, argue etc

name: impulse
trans: n. 冲动；脉冲；推动力 adj. 一时兴起的，随兴的 v. 推动

sentences.english: a sudden impulse to laugh
sentences.chinese: 突然想笑的冲动

sentences.english: It is the passions which provide the main impulse of music.
sentences.chinese: 激情是音乐创作的主要动力。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

name: spur
trans: n. 一时冲动之下，心血来潮；刺激，激励；山嘴，尖坡；（公路或铁路的）支线，岔线；马刺，靴刺 v. 激励，鼓励；促进，加速，刺激（某事发生）；用马刺策（马）前进；紧贴主干剪短（副梢）

sentences.english: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.chinese: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.english: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.chinese: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.english: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
sentences.chinese: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

detailed_translations.english: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something
to encourage someone or make them want to do something

name: prompt
trans: v. 促使，导致；鼓励，提示（说话者）；（计算机上）提示；（给演员）提词，提白 adj. 迅速的，立刻的；（人）利索的，敏捷的；及时的，准时的；（商品）即期要送的，即期要付的 n. （给演员的）提词；（计算机屏幕上显示准备接受指令的）提示； 鼓励，催促；（付款通知单上的）付款期限 adv. 准时地

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

name: due
trans: adj. 到期的，预期的；应有的，应得的；应付的，应给的；适当的 adv. 正对着 n. 应得，所得；会费

sentences.english: The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
sentences.chinese: 该球队预定下个月飞往意大利。

sentences.english: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
sentences.chinese: 应该支付给你的款项将会以支票邮寄给你。

detailed_translations.english: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

name: attainment
trans: n. 达到，获得；成就，造诣

sentences.english: a low level of educational attainment
sentences.chinese: 教育程度低

detailed_translations.english: success in achieving something or reaching a particular level

name: gain
trans: v. 获得，赢得；受益；增加，增长；（经过努力）到达；（钟表）走快；持球前进，推进（一段距离） n. 增加；好处，改进；收益；将球推进的距离；（常用对数表示的功率或电压的）增益

sentences.english: After gaining independence in 1957, it was renamed ‘Ghana’.
sentences.chinese: 1957年获得独立后，该国改名为“加纳”。

sentences.english: Carrie’s gained a lot of weight recently.
sentences.chinese: 卡丽的体重最近增加了很多。

sentences.english: The Democratic Party needed a net gain of only 20 votes.
sentences.chinese: 民主党只需要增20张选票。

detailed_translations.english: to obtain or achieve something you want or need
an increase in the amount or level of something

name: obtain
trans: v. （尤指通过艰难的过程）得到，获得；<正式>（规则或情况）存在，通用

sentences.english: These conditions no longer obtain.
sentences.chinese: 这些状况已不复存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通用， 流行； 存在
detailed_translations.english: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

name: seize
trans: v. 抓住，捉住；（用武力）夺取，占领；逮捕，捉拿；没收，扣押；把握（机会等）；（感觉、疼痛）侵袭，控制；吸引（注意力），唤起（想象力）；<正式>理解，掌握；意识到，得知（be seized of）；（有活动部件的机器，机器的活动部件）咬住，卡住；<英，法律>依法占有（be seized of）；<史>具有（财产）的终身保有权（be seized of）

sentences.english: Suddenly he seized my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他突然抓住我的手。

sentences.english: The rebels have seized power.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子夺取了政权。

sentences.english: The gunmen were seized at 1 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 这几名持枪歹徒在凌晨1点被抓获。

detailed_translations.english: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

name: redeem
trans: v. 补救，掩饰……之不足；挽回（声誉），弥补（过错）（redeem oneself）；（尤指基督教中）解救，为……赎罪；偿还（欠款）；兑换（优惠券、彩票等）；赎回（股票、债券等）；履行，遵守（诺言）

sentences.english: Olivier’s performance redeemed an otherwise second-rate play.
sentences.chinese: 奥利维尔的表演补救了一出本是二流水平的戏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赎回；挽回；兑换；履行；补偿；恢复
detailed_translations.english: to make something less bad

name: procure
trans: v. <正式>（设法） 获得，取得；为（某人）拉皮条，给（某人）做淫媒；<法律>说服，使（某人）做某事；<古>导致

sentences.english: It remained very difficult to procure food, fuel, and other daily necessities.
sentences.chinese: 当时仍然很难获得食品、燃料和其他日用必需品。

detailed_translations.english: to obtain something, especially something that is difficult to get

name: acquire
trans: v. 获得，得到；学到，习得；患上（疾病）；逐渐具有，开始学会

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: acquisitive
trans: adj. 渴望得到的，贪婪的

sentences.english: We live in an acquisitive society.
sentences.chinese: 我们活在一个贪婪的社会里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 渴望得到的， 贪婪的
detailed_translations.english: wanting to have and keep a lot of possessions

name: elude
trans: v. （尤指机智地，巧妙地）避开，逃避；使达不到，使不能实现；使不记得，使不理解；对（法律，要求，处罚）不服从

sentences.english: He eluded his pursuers by escaping into a river.
sentences.chinese: 他逃到河里，甩掉了追踪他的人。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from someone or something, especially by tricking them

name: elusive
trans: adj. 难以理解的，难以记住的；难以发现的，难以捕获的

sentences.english: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
sentences.chinese: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉，但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
detailed_translations.english: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

name: sly
trans: adj. 狡猾的，狡诈的；诡秘的，心知肚明的；（动作）躲躲闪闪的，偷偷摸摸的；淘气的

sentences.english: He leaned forward with a sly smile.
sentences.chinese: 他俯身向前诡秘地一笑。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is sly cleverly deceives people in order to get what they want

name: evade
trans: v. 规避，逃避；难倒，使困惑；未能（被某人）获得；（尤指违法犯罪后）逃脱，躲开（追捕）

sentences.english: You can’t go on evading your responsibilities in this way.
sentences.chinese: 你不能这样继续逃避责任。

sentences.english: You’re simply trying to evade the problem.
sentences.chinese: 你根本是在设法逃避问题。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or deal with something that you should do

name: evasive
trans: adj. 不坦率的，模棱两可的；逃避的，规避的

sentences.english: an evasive reply
sentences.chinese: 模棱两可的答复

detailed_translations.english: not willing to answer questions directly

name: evasion
trans: n. 逃脱，躲避；逃避手段，逃避方法；遁词，借口

sentences.english: I’m tired of his lies and evasions.
sentences.chinese: 我听腻了他的谎言和托词。

detailed_translations.english: when you deliberately avoid talking about something or answering a question

name: escape
trans: v. 逃跑，逃脱；逃避，摆脱；避开，避免（疾病或受伤等）；泄露，逸出；不自觉地说出；被遗忘，被忽略；去度假；退出 n. 逃跑，逃离；逃避现实，暂时解脱；漏出，逸出；Esc退出键；度假；逃跑工具，逃跑方法；野化的植物（或宠物）

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

name: shun
trans: v. （故意）避开，躲开

sentences.english: a shy woman who shunned publicity
sentences.chinese: 不爱抛头露面的羞怯女子

sentences.english: Victims of the disease found themselves shunned by society.
sentences.chinese: 患这种病的人发现，社会上的人都躲着 他们。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid someone or something

name: eschew
trans: vt. 避免；避开；远避

sentences.english: I had eschewed politics in favour of a life practising law.
sentences.chinese: 我选择从事律师职业，有意避开了政治。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid doing or using something

name: avoid
trans: v. 避免，防止；回避，避开；撤销，使无效

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: dodge
trans: v. 闪开，躲开；巧妙躲避，施计回避；按变换序列鸣钟；（冲洗或放大时）局部遮光 n. 逃避的诡计，骗人的伎俩；躲闪

sentences.english: He ran across the courtyard, dodging a storm of bullets.
sentences.chinese: 他跑过院子，躲避雨点般的子弹。

detailed_translations.english: to move quickly to avoid someone or something
to deliberately avoid discussing something or doing something

detailed_translations.chinese: 托辞， 伎俩； 躲闪， 躲避
detailed_translations.english: something dishonest that is done to avoid a rule or law

name: avert
trans: v. 防止，避免；转移

sentences.english: The tragedy could have been averted if the crew had followed safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 如果乘务人员按照安全规则操作，这场悲剧是可以避免的。

sentences.english: Henry averted his eyes as she undressed.
sentences.chinese: 她脱衣服的时候，亨利把目光转向别处。

detailed_translations.chinese: 防止，避免；转移(目光、注意力等)
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something unpleasant from happening

name: insubordinate
trans: adj. 不听话的；不顺从的

sentences.english: In industry, a worker who is grossly insubordinate is threatened with discharge.
sentences.chinese: 在企业界，拒不服从指令的工人面临被解雇的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is insubordinate, you mean that they do not obey someone of higher rank

name: defiant
trans: adj. 违抗的，反叛的，蔑视的

sentences.english: The players are in a defiant mood as they prepare for tomorrow's game.
sentences.chinese: 在准备明天的比赛时，球员们态度挑衅。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的；目中无人的，蔑视的；挑战的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is defiant, you mean they show aggression or independence by refusing to obey someone

name: opposed
trans: adj. 反对的，敌对的；相反的，对立的 v. 反抗，阻碍；与……竞争，与……角逐（oppose 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: I am utterly opposed to any form of terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 我坚决反对任何形式的恐怖主义。

sentences.english: The principles of capitalism and socialism are diametrically opposed (= completely opposite ).
sentences.chinese: 资本主义的原则与社会主义的原则截然相反。

detailed_translations.english: If you are opposed to something, you disagree with it or disapprove of it.

name: rebellion
trans: n. 叛乱，反抗； （对权威的）反抗，不服从；叛逆，不顺从

sentences.english: an armed rebellion
sentences.chinese: 武装叛乱

detailed_translations.english: an organized attempt to change the government or leader of a country, using violence

name: resist
trans: v. 阻挡，抵制；抵抗，回击；耐得住，抵挡；使不受……的伤害，抗（伤害） n. 保护涂层（防染色、着釉等），防染材料

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: demur
trans: vi. 反对；抗辩；提出异议 n. 异议；反对 n. （Demur）人名；（德）德穆尔；（法）德米尔

sentences.english: They demurred politely, but finally agreed to stay.
sentences.chinese: 他们礼貌地推却，但最后还是同意留下。

detailed_translations.english: to express doubt about or opposition to a plan or suggestion
disagreement or disapproval

name: traverse
trans: v. 横穿，穿过；横越岩石面的攀爬；（滑雪时）横线下（坡）；<喻>整体考虑（问题），全面讨论；来回移动，斜向移动；转动（大炮等带轴设备）；<法律>否认（一项指控），反驳 n. （爬陡坡时的）斜向攀上（下）；越过，穿过；滑雪横切运动；（逆风时轮船所作的）曲线航行，折航；横断物，横档；通廊，楼厢；（大炮等的）横转装置；机器部件的横转，横向运动；（测量用的）导线；（军）（壕沟的）土护墙，屏障 adj. 横贯的

sentences.english: two minutes to traverse the park
sentences.chinese: 两分钟横穿公园

detailed_translations.english: a sideways movement across a very steep slope in mountain-climbing

detailed_translations.chinese: 穿过；反对；详细研究；在…来回移动
detailed_translations.english: to move across, over, or through something, especially an area of land or water

name: defy
trans: v. 违抗，不服从；挑战，激；无法，难以（描述或理解）；经受住，顶住

sentences.english: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次（也是最后一次）胆敢违抗我母亲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藐视；公然反抗；挑衅；使落空
detailed_translations.english: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way

name: outrageous
trans: adj. 骇人的，无法容忍的；反常的，令人惊讶的；极其夸张的，不可能的

sentences.english: By diplomatic standards, this was outrageous behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 按外交标准，这是不可接受的行为。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗暴的；可恶的；令人吃惊的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as outrageous, you are emphasizing that it is unacceptable or very shocking

name: turbulent
trans: adj. 骚乱的，动乱的；（气流）湍流的，（水）湍急的； 骚动的，混乱而难以控制的；（技）（与）紊流（有关）的，（与）湍流（有关）的

sentences.english: the turbulent times of the French Revolution
sentences.chinese: 法国大革命的动荡时期

sentences.english: He has had a turbulent political career.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治生涯动荡不定。

detailed_translations.english: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes

name: riot
trans: n. 暴乱，骚乱；纷呈，丰富多彩；<非正式>非常有趣的人（或事物）；纵情欢闹，狂欢；<喻>骚动；<喻>（感情的）爆发，宣泄 v. （人群）发生骚乱，聚众闹事；<喻>放纵，恣意；<罕>浪费，挥霍

sentences.english: urban riots
sentences.chinese: 城市骚乱

sentences.english: prison riots
sentences.chinese: 监狱暴乱

sentences.english: His murder triggered vicious race riots (= caused by a problem between different races ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的被杀引发了严重的种族骚乱。

sentences.english: police wearing riot gear
sentences.chinese: 配有防暴装备的警察

sentences.english: police in bullet-proof vests and carrying riot shields
sentences.chinese: 穿防弹背心、持防暴盾牌的警察

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a large crowd of people are behaving in a violent and uncontrolled way, especially when they are protesting about something
if a crowd of people riot, they behave in a violent and uncontrolled way, for example by fighting the police and damaging cars or buildings

name: defection
trans: n. 脱离，退出，叛逃

name: uprising
trans: n. 起义，暴动；升起 v. 起床；起义；上升（uprise 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: a popular uprising
sentences.chinese: 平民暴动

sentences.english: an armed uprising
sentences.chinese: 武装起义

detailed_translations.english: an attempt by a group of people to change the government, laws etc in an area or country

name: uproar
trans: n. 吵闹，喧嚣；骚乱，骚动

sentences.english: The announcement caused uproar in the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 公告在人群中引起了一阵骚动。

detailed_translations.english: a lot of noise or angry protest about something

name: turmoil
trans: n. 混乱，骚动 v. 扰乱，使不安

sentences.english: She lived through the turmoil of the French Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 她经历过法国大革命的混乱之后仍旧活着。

detailed_translations.english: a state of confusion, excitement, or anxiety

name: treason
trans: n. 叛国罪，通敌罪；背叛，不忠，背信；（史）轻叛逆罪（杀害原被效忠者，如仆杀主、妻杀夫等的行为）

sentences.english: The defendant was convicted of high treason (= treason of the worst kind ) and sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 被告被判犯有严重叛国罪，并处以死刑。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of being disloyal to your country or its government, especially by helping its enemies or trying to remove the government using violence

name: rebel
trans: n. 造反者，反抗者；反抗权威者；叛逆者，不守规矩者 v. 反叛，造反；违抗，不服从（权威）；反对，反抗（规定、行为规范等）；（胃、腿、头脑等）不听使唤 adj. 造反的；反抗的

sentences.english: Voters rebelled against high property taxes.
sentences.chinese: 投票者们反对高额财产税。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose or fight against someone in authority or against an idea or situation which you do not agree with
someone who opposes or fights against people in authority

name: rebellion
trans: n. 叛乱，反抗； （对权威的）反抗，不服从；叛逆，不顺从

sentences.english: an armed rebellion
sentences.chinese: 武装叛乱

detailed_translations.english: an organized attempt to change the government or leader of a country, using violence

name: betray
trans: v. 背叛，出卖；食言，辜负；违背（信仰、原则等）；泄露（机密，信息）；流露，显露出（情感或特性）；暴露（不易发觉的东西）

sentences.english: He felt that she had betrayed him.
sentences.chinese: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

sentences.english: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
sentences.chinese: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。

sentences.english: I would never betray a confidence (=  tell a secret that someone has trusted me with  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背叛， 出卖； 失信于， 辜负； 泄露； 暴露， 显露
detailed_translations.english: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

name: subvert
trans: v. 颠覆，破坏；腐蚀，使道德败坏

sentences.english: an attempt to subvert the democratic process
sentences.chinese: 颠覆民主进程的企图

detailed_translations.english: to try to destroy the power and influence of a government or the established system

name: plot
trans: n. 阴谋，密谋；情节；（专用的）小块地；（表现两个变量关系的）图表；<美>图表，地图；<美>底层平面图 v. 密谋，暗中策划；（在地图上）画出，标出；构思（情节）；绘制（曲线）；绘制（图表）；在图表上标记，布置；用图表说明；计划，制订

sentences.english: a two-acre plot of land
sentences.chinese: 一块两英亩的土地

sentences.english: a vegetable plot
sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

name: overturn
trans: v. （使）翻倒，（使）倾覆；推翻，撤销（判决等）；颠覆，破坏（政府或体系）；<英>在英国大选中因获得多数席位而获胜 n. <罕>颠覆，革命；（尤指水温分层的湖水每年两次的）湖水对流

sentences.english: Leslie jumped to her feet, overturning her chair.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯莉一跃而起，碰倒了椅子。

sentences.english: His car overturned, trapping him inside.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车发生侧翻，把他困在了里面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倾覆， 翻转， 翻倒
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

detailed_translations.chinese: 使翻转，使倾覆，使倒下；颠覆，推翻
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

name: exclusion
trans: n. 排斥，排除在外；被排除在外的人（或事物）；认为不可能；（合约中的）除外事项；<英>开除学籍

sentences.english: Your essays tend to concentrate on one theme to the exclusion of everything else.
sentences.chinese: 你的文章往往会集中于一个主题而不顾及其他各个方面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 排除；排斥；驱逐；被排除在外的事物
detailed_translations.english: when someone is not allowed to take part in something or enter a place

name: decline
trans: v. 下降，衰退；拒绝，谢绝；变格，词形变化 n. 减少，衰退

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: relinquish
trans: v. <正式>（尤指不情愿地）放弃，交出（权力、职位等）；<正式>（不情愿地）松开

sentences.english: No one wants to relinquish power once they have it.
sentences.chinese: 人一旦有了权就不想放弃。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone else have your position, power, or rights, especially unwillingly

name: renounce
trans: v. 声明放弃，抛弃；<法律>（尤指继承人或受托人）放弃（权利或地位）；拒绝承认，拒绝遵守；宣布与……断绝关系，宣布摒弃

sentences.english: Edward renounced his claim to the French throne.
sentences.chinese: 爱德华宣布放弃对法国王位的继承权。

sentences.english: She renounced her citizenship.
sentences.chinese: 她宣布放弃国籍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣布放弃；与…断绝关系；垫牌
detailed_translations.english: if you renounce an official position, title, right etc, you publicly say that you will not keep it any more

name: gainsay
trans: vt. 反驳；否定 n. 否认；反对

sentences.english: No one dared to gainsay him.
sentences.chinese: 没有人敢反驳他。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or to disagree with someone

name: deny
trans: v. 否认；拒绝承认；拒绝给予

sentences.english: The government denied the existence of poverty among 16- and 17-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

name: disclaim
trans: vt. 否认，拒绝；放弃，弃权；拒绝承认 vi. 否认；放弃；弃权

sentences.english: She disclaims any knowledge of her husband's business.
sentences.chinese: 她声称自己对她丈夫的生意一无所知。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否认，拒绝；放弃，弃权；拒绝承认
detailed_translations.english: to state, especially officially, that you are not responsible for something, that you do not know about it, or that you are not involved with it

name: reject
trans: v. 拒绝，否决（提议、建议或请求）；摈弃，不接受（信仰或政治制度）；不雇用，不录取；（因质量不好而）废弃；冷落，嫌弃；排异，排斥（移植器官）；（投币设备）拒绝接受（硬币） n. 次品，废品；不合格者，被排斥者

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: submit
trans: v. 呈递，提交；屈服，不得已接受；建议，主张；使经受，使受到

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: submissive
trans: adj. 顺从的，服从的，卑躬屈膝的

sentences.english: In those days, women were expected to be quiet and submissive.
sentences.chinese: 那时的妇女都要寡言恭顺。

detailed_translations.english: always willing to obey someone and never disagreeing with them, even if they are unkind to you

name: submission
trans: n. 屈服，投降；提交，呈递；提交的文件，呈递材料；<法律>（向法官提出的）看法，意见；<正式> 意见，建议；<古> 谦恭，温顺；（摔跤）制服

sentences.english: The deadline for the submission of proposals is May 1st.
sentences.chinese: 呈交提案的最后期限是 5 月 1 日。

sentences.english: Plans were drawn up for submission to the housing council.
sentences.chinese: 计划已起草，要提交给住房委员会。

sentences.english: Submissions will not be accepted after May.
sentences.chinese: 过了5月再提交将不予接受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投降；提交（物）；服从；（向法官提出的）意见；谦恭
detailed_translations.english: when you give or show something to someone in authority, for them to consider or approve

name: subjection
trans: n. 隶属；服从；征服

sentences.english: the subjection of women
sentences.chinese: 妇女的从属地位

detailed_translations.english: when a person or a group of people are controlled by a government or by another person

name: obedience
trans: n. 服从，遵从

sentences.english: obedience classes for dogs and their owners
sentences.chinese: 为狗和主人安排的服从训练课

detailed_translations.english: when someone does what they are told to do, or what a law, rule etc says they must do

name: succumb
trans: v. 屈服，屈从；病情加重，死于（某疾病）

sentences.english: Don't succumb to the temptation to have just one cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 不要屈服于只抽一支烟的诱惑。

detailed_translations.english: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control

name: enthrall
trans: vt. 迷住，使着迷

sentences.english: The author enthrall, enthralled the minds of his readers.
sentences.chinese: 那位作者于读者着迷。

sentences.english: Such trends do not enthrall neutrals, many of whom would prefer to see free-scoring Barcelona win tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 这些趋势并没有迷惑住中立者，他们中的很多人更愿意火力十足的巴萨明天赢球。

sentences.english: Even now, having been tortured and imprisoned by Voldemort, the idea of the Dark wizard in possession of this wand seemed to enthrall him as much as it repulsed him.
sentences.chinese: 现在，即使在被伏地魔拷问和关押后，这老头儿对于黑巫师拥有老魔杖的想法，似乎仍是既反感又着迷。

name: defer
trans: v. 延期，推迟；听从，遵从（defer to）

sentences.english: The committee deferred their decision .
sentences.chinese: 委员会延期作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to delay something until a later date

name: lash
trans: v. 猛击，狠打；鞭打，抽打；怒斥，抨击；捆绑，捆扎；煽动，激励；（动物）用力甩动（尾巴） n. 睫毛；鞭打（尤作为惩罚）；突然（猛烈）的一甩；责骂，讽刺；鞭梢

sentences.english: Giant waves lashed the sea wall.
sentences.chinese: 巨浪拍打着海堤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鞭打；冲击；摆动；扎捆；煽动；讽刺
detailed_translations.english: to tie something tightly to something else with a rope

detailed_translations.chinese: 鞭打；睫毛；鞭子；责骂；讽刺
detailed_translations.english: a hit with a whip, especially as a punishment

name: sustain
trans: v. 维持，保持；维持……的生命；遭受，经受；（在体力或精神方面）支持，支撑；承受住……的重量；证实，证明；认可，赞成，确认；（演员）充分表演（角色，人物），扮演 n. （乐）延音

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: pervert
trans: v. 使走样，败坏；腐蚀，使堕落；使性欲反常，使性变态；歪曲，曲解 n. 性变态者，性欲反常者

sentences.english: TV violence perverts the minds of young children.
sentences.chinese: 电视暴力腐蚀了孩子们的心灵。

detailed_translations.english: to influence someone so that they begin to think or behave in an immoral way

detailed_translations.chinese: 堕落者；行为反常者；性欲反常者；变态
detailed_translations.english: someone whose sexual behaviour is considered unnatural and unacceptable

name: coddle
trans: vt. 娇养；溺爱（等于 mollycoddle）；用文火煮

sentences.english: Don’t coddle the child – he’s fine!
sentences.chinese: 别太娇惯那孩子——他没事的！

detailed_translations.chinese: 娇养；溺爱（等于mollycoddle）；用文火煮
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone in a way that is too kind and gentle and that protects them from pain or difficulty

name: entail
trans: v. 使必要，需要；<旧>遗赠（财产），限定继承；使人承担 n. 限定继承，限嗣继承的财产

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

name: inflict
trans: v. 使遭受，使承受

sentences.english: ...the damage being inflicted on industries by the recession.
sentences.chinese: …经济衰退给工业造成的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 造成；使遭受（损伤、痛苦等）；给予（打击等）
detailed_translations.english: To inflict harm or damage on someone or something means to make them suffer it

name: distort
trans: v. 扭曲，使失真；歪曲，曲解

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

name: abuse
trans: v. 虐待；滥用，辜负；辱骂；糟蹋（某物）；性侵犯 n. 虐待，凌辱；滥用，妄用；辱骂；舞弊，腐败；糟蹋；性侵犯；恶习，陋习

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

name: correct
trans: adj. 正确的，无误的；恰当的，合适的；（行为）合乎礼节的，得体的；（行为）被人认可的，赞许的 v. 改正，纠正；批改；指出错误；（医疗）矫正

sentences.english: If my calculations are correct, we’re about ten miles from Exeter.
sentences.chinese: 如果我计算得没错的话，我们离埃克塞特大约十英里。

sentences.english: Score one point for each correct answer .
sentences.chinese: 答对一题得一分。

sentences.english: You are absolutely correct, the Missouri is the longest river in the US.
sentences.chinese: 你说的完全正确，密苏里河是美国最长的河流。

sentences.english: Some eyesight problems are relatively easy to correct.
sentences.chinese: 有些视力问题比较容易矫正。

detailed_translations.english: having no mistakes
to make something right or to make it work the way it should

name: innovation
trans: n. 新事物，新方法；革新，创新

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

name: modify
trans: v. 修改，改进；修饰，限定；缓和，使温和；使改形，使转化；变（音）

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

name: modification
trans: n. 修改的行为（过程）；修改，更改；修饰

sentences.english: They have used the same process for almost 50 years with only minor modifications.
sentences.chinese: 同样的工序他们用了将近50年，期间只做过很小的改动。

detailed_translations.english: a small change made in something such as a design, plan, or system

name: ornament
trans: n. 装饰品，点缀品；<正式>装饰，摆设；<正式>首饰，饰物； 为……增添光彩的人（或事物）（ornament to sth.）；（乐）装饰音（ornaments） ；（基督教）（圣坛、圣餐杯和圣器等）礼拜用品，典礼用品 v. 装饰，点缀

sentences.english: a shelf covered with books and ornaments
sentences.chinese: 摆满书籍和装饰品的架子

sentences.english: a cabinet in which she kept her collection of china ornaments
sentences.chinese: 她放置瓷器摆设收藏品的柜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰品，点缀品；装饰，点缀
detailed_translations.english: a small object that you keep in your house because it is beautiful rather than useful

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰， 点缀， 美化

name: coax
trans: v. 哄，劝诱；连哄带劝地得到；小心地摆弄（机器或装置） n. 同轴电缆 adj. 同轴的，共轴的

sentences.english: ‘Please, Vic, come with us,’ Nancy coaxed.
sentences.chinese: “求你了，维克，跟我们一起去吧。”南希哄劝道。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way

name: gild
trans: vt. 镀金；虚饰；供给钱 n. （Gild）人名；（俄）希尔德

sentences.english: a gilded frame
sentences.chinese: 镀金框

detailed_translations.english: to cover something with a thin layer of gold or with something that looks like gold

name: modulate
trans: vt. 调节；（信号）调制；调整 vi. 调制；转调

sentences.english: He carefully modulated his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他仔细地调节了自己的声音。

detailed_translations.english: to change the sound of your voice

name: mend
trans: v. 缝补，修补；修理；愈合，痊愈；弥合（分歧），解决（争端）；（给火）添燃料 n. 好转，复苏；修理过的地方，补丁

sentences.english: My father used to mend our shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲过去常为我们修补鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a tear or hole in a piece of clothing
to be getting better after an illness or after a difficult period

name: renovate
trans: v. 修复，翻新（尤指建筑物）；使恢复活力

sentences.english: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 酒店已经翻新，并重新装饰。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a building or old furniture so that it is in good condition again

name: substantiate
trans: vt. 证实；使实体化

sentences.english: Katzen offered little evidence to substantiate his claims .
sentences.chinese: 卡曾拿不出什么证据来证明他的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to prove the truth of something that someone has said, claimed etc

name: strengthen
trans: v. 使（情感、决心等）更强烈，使（关系）更加紧密；巩固（地位），加强（实力）；（货币）升值；增强（体质）；为……提供更有力的理由（证据）；（风力或水力）变强；使（法令或处罚）更有效；加强，加固（物体或结构）

sentences.english: Our friendship has steadily strengthened over the years.
sentences.chinese: 我们的友谊逐年加深。

sentences.english: Steve’s opposition only strengthened her resolve to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫的反对反而坚定了她继续下去的决心。

sentences.english: The company plans to strengthen its hand (= make itself more powerful ) in Europe by opening an office in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处，以此增强在欧洲的实力。

detailed_translations.english: to become stronger or make something stronger

name: reinforce
trans: v. 加强，强化（观点、思想或感觉）；加固，使更结实；给……加强力量（或装备），增援；寻求（或得到）增援 n. 加固物

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: garnish
trans: v. 装饰（尤指食物）；（为合法扣押属于债务人或被告的钱财）传讯（第三方） n. （为增加色香味而添加的）配菜，装饰品 n. （Garnish）（美、英）加尼什（人名）

sentences.english: She had finished the vegetables and was garnishing the roast.
sentences.chinese: 她已经做好了蔬菜，正给烤肉配饰菜。

detailed_translations.english: to add something to food in order to decorate it

detailed_translations.chinese: 为增加色香味而添加的配菜；装饰品
detailed_translations.english: a small amount of food such as salad or fruit that you place on food to decorate it

name: embellish
trans: vt. 修饰；装饰；润色 vi. 装饰起来；加以润色

sentences.english: The boat was embellished with carvings in red and blue.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船饰有红、蓝雕刻。

detailed_translations.english: to make something more beautiful by adding decorations to it

name: embroider
trans: vt. 刺绣；装饰；镶边 vi. 绣花；刺绣

sentences.english: a richly embroidered jacket
sentences.chinese: 刺绣华美的夹克衫

detailed_translations.english: to decorate cloth by sewing a pattern, picture, or words on it with coloured threads

name: temper
trans: n. 坏脾气，暴躁脾气；心情，情绪；怒气，火气；<正式>（时代的）气息，特征；（人或动物的）性格，性情；（钢等的）硬度，回火性；沉着，冷静 v. 使缓和，使温和；使（金属）回火，锻造；给（钢琴等）调音，调整（音阶）；回火，调和

sentences.english: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper .
sentences.chinese: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

detailed_translations.english: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 调和， 使缓和； 【冶】使回火
detailed_translations.english: to make something less severe or extreme

name: adjust
trans: v. 调整，调节；整理（衣服）；适应，习惯；（保险理赔时）理算，评估（损失，损害）

sentences.english: They’ll soon settle in – kids are very good at adjusting.
sentences.chinese: 他们很快就会习惯的——小孩子适应能力很强。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become familiar with a new situation
to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose

name: refine
trans: v. 精炼，提纯；改进，改善；使……文雅

sentences.english: Oil is refined to remove naturally occurring impurities.
sentences.chinese: 油经过提炼去除天然生成的杂质。

detailed_translations.english: When a substance is refined, it is made pure by having all other substances removed from it

name: conciliatory
trans: adj. 安抚的；调和的；调停的

sentences.english: Brooks felt in no mood to be conciliatory.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁克斯不想作出和解。

detailed_translations.english: doing something that is intended to make someone stop arguing with you

name: hurdle
trans: n. 障碍，难关；（供人或马在赛跑中跨越的）栏架，跨栏；跨栏赛跑，障碍赛跑；（把背叛者送往刑场的）囚笼 v. （奔跑中）跳越（某物）；参加跨栏赛跑；克服（障碍或困难），渡过难关；用临时围栏隔开（或围住）

sentences.english: Finding enough money for the project was the first hurdle.
sentences.chinese: 第一道难关是为该项目筹措足够的资金。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or difficulty that you must deal with before you can achieve something

name: barrier
trans: n. 障碍，壁垒；障碍物，关卡；分界线，屏障；大关，界限

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: barricade
trans: n. （临时的）路障，街垒；争论之处（barricades） v. 在……设路障；把…隔离，堵住

sentences.english: The fans were kept back behind barricades.
sentences.chinese: 歌迷们被拦在路障后面。

detailed_translations.english: a temporary wall or fence across a road, door etc that prevents people from going through
to build a barricade to prevent someone or something from getting in

name: obstacle
trans: n. 障碍，阻碍；障碍物

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: snag
trans: n. 障碍；意外障碍；突出物 vt. 抓住机会；造成阻碍；清除障碍物 vi. 被绊住；形成障碍

sentences.english: It’s an interesting job. The only snag is that it’s not very well paid.
sentences.chinese: 这是一份有趣的工作，唯一的缺憾是工资不高。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or disadvantage, especially one that is not very serious, which you had not expected

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓住机会；造成阻碍；清除障碍物

name: forestall
trans: vt. 先发制人，预先阻止；垄断，屯积；领先；占先一步

sentences.english: a measure intended to forestall further attacks
sentences.chinese: 意在预先阻止进一步攻击的措施

detailed_translations.chinese: 先发制人，预先阻止；垄断，屯积；领先；占先一步
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from happening or prevent someone from doing something by doing something first

name: intercede
trans: vi. 调解，调停；求情，说项

sentences.english: They asked my father to intercede with the king on their behalf.
sentences.chinese: 他们请我父亲代他们向国王求情。

detailed_translations.english: to speak in support of someone, especially in order to try to prevent them from being punished

name: intercept
trans: v. 拦截，阻截；抄截（对方的传球）；截断，中止（光等电磁辐射）；（线，面）截取，截断（部分面积、线、面） n. 拦截，截获；（数）截点，截距

sentences.english: an attempt to intercept drugs being smuggled over the border
sentences.chinese: 阻截毒品走私入境的努力

sentences.english: His phone calls were intercepted.
sentences.chinese: 他的电话被截听了。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something or someone that is going from one place to another before they get there

detailed_translations.chinese: 拦截；[数] 截距；截获的情报

name: intervene
trans: v. 干预，干涉；插话，打岔；干扰，阻挠；发生于其间，介于中间；调停，斡旋

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: interfere
trans: v. 干涉，干扰；阻碍，妨害；（未经允许）摆弄，（尤指）弄坏；（光或其他电磁波）相互作用，相互干扰；（指马）碰踝，绊脚

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

name: meddle
trans: v. 干涉，管闲事，干预他人之事；瞎搞，乱弄

sentences.english: He accused the US of meddling in China’s internal affairs .
sentences.chinese: 他指责美国干涉中国内政。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately try to influence or change a situation that does not concern you, or that you do not understand

name: tamper
trans: v. 做手脚，破坏 n. 夯工，拍压的人；打夯机

sentences.english: Don't tamper with my business.
sentences.chinese: 别干预我的事。

sentences.english: It should not overwhelm you with raw HTTP traffic dumps, and it goes far beyond simply providing a framework to tamper with the application by hand.
sentences.chinese: 用户不会再被大量原始的HTTP流量数据淹没，而且这个工具远不仅仅是一个人工干预应用程序的框架。

name: mediate
trans: v. 调停，斡旋；影响……的发生，使……可能发生；促成（协议），找到……的解决办法；引起，形成；传递，传达；连接，沟通；处于中间地位 adj. 间接的；居间的，介于中间的

sentences.english: The former president has agreed to mediate the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 前总统同意就和谈进行斡旋。

detailed_translations.english: to try to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc

name: balk
trans: v. 畏缩不前，犹豫；（马在障碍物前）突然止步，拒绝跳跃；（棒球投手在投球时）做假动作，佯投；阻止，妨碍（人或动物）拥有（某物）；错过，拒绝（机会、邀请）（等于baulk） n. 障碍；梁木，粗枋；（台球）台盘限制区；（棒球）违例佯投动作；（畦间隆起的）梗（等于baulk） n. （Balk）（美）鲍克（人名）

sentences.english: Even biology undergraduates may balk at animal experiments.
sentences.chinese: 即使是生物专业的大学生都可能会反对动物实验。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone or something from getting or achieving what they want

name: hinder
trans: v. 阻碍，妨碍 adj. （尤指身体部位）后面的

sentences.english: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.chinese: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.english: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.chinese: 对家庭有害无益的政策

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

name: hamper
trans: v. 阻碍，妨碍 n. （尤指装食物用的）带盖大篮子；（装有各种食品的）礼物篮；<美>脏衣篓；障碍船具

sentences.english: She tried to run, but was hampered by her heavy suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 她想跑，但沉重的旅行箱拖累了她。

sentences.english: An attempt to rescue the men has been hampered by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 对那几名男子的营救行动受到恶劣天气的阻碍。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone to do something
a basket with a lid, which is used for carrying food or sending it to someone as a present

name: handicap
trans: n. （生理或智力上的）残障，残疾；障碍，不利因素；让步赛；让杆数 v. 妨碍，使不利；<美>预测（可能的获胜者）

sentences.english: Not speaking the language is a real handicap.
sentences.chinese: 不会讲这种语言的确是一个障碍。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that makes it difficult for someone to do what they want
to make it difficult for someone to do something that they want or need to do

name: incapacitate
trans: vt. 使无能力；使不能；使不适于

sentences.english: Her mother has been incapacitated by a fall.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲摔了一跤后，失去了正常生活能力。

sentences.english: an incapacitating injury
sentences.chinese: 使人失去活动能力的伤

detailed_translations.chinese: 使无能力；使不能；使不适于
detailed_translations.english: to make you too ill or weak to live and work normally

name: prevent
trans: v. 阻止，阻碍；防止，预防；设置障碍

sentences.english: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.english: We were prevented from entering the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们被阻止进入现场。

sentences.english: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.chinese: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something

name: clog
trans: v. 阻塞，堵塞 n. 木底鞋，木屐；累赘，障碍；管道堵塞物

sentences.english: tourists whose cars clog the roads each summer
sentences.chinese: 每年夏天开着汽车堵塞道路的游客

detailed_translations.english: to block something or become blocked
a shoe made of wood with a leather top that covers the front of your foot but not your heel

name: stunt
trans: n. （尤指电影中的）特技表演；噱头，作秀；逞英雄，做愚蠢（有点危险）的事 v. 阻碍……的成长（发育），妨碍发展；表演绝技

sentences.english: Todd flew over the city in a hot-air balloon as a publicity stunt .
sentences.chinese: 作为一种宣传噱头，托德乘坐热气球飞越城市上空。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to attract people’s attention, especially in advertising or politics
