detailed_translations.chinese: 阻碍…的正常生长或发展
detailed_translations.english: to stop something or someone from growing to their full size or developing properly

name: encumber
trans: vt. 阻塞；妨害；拖累

sentences.english: He died in 1874, heavily encumbered by debt.
sentences.chinese: 他于1874年去世，负债累累。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for you to do something or for something to happen

name: obstruct
trans: v. 堵塞，阻塞（洞口、通道、道路等）；遮住，挡住（视线）；阻碍，妨碍

sentences.english: A small aircraft was obstructing the runway.
sentences.chinese: 一架小型飞机堵住了跑道。

sentences.english: The column obstructed our view of the stage.
sentences.chinese: 柱子挡着，我们看不见舞台。

detailed_translations.english: to block a road, passage etc

name: foil
trans: n. 箔；箔纸；陪衬者，陪衬物；花剑；猎物足迹（或嗅迹）；<古>挫折，失败；水翼 v. 挫败，阻止；（猎物）搞乱，搅乱（嗅迹，足迹）；贴箔于

sentences.english: A massive arms-smuggling plan has been foiled by the CIA.
sentences.chinese: 一项大规模的军火走私计划已被中央情报局挫败。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衬托；阻止，挡开；挫败；贴箔于
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad that someone is planning to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 箔，金属薄片；衬托，烘托；叶形片
detailed_translations.english: metal sheets that are as thin as paper, used for wrapping food

detailed_translations.chinese: 面向文件的翻译语言（file-Oriented interpretive language）

name: block
trans: n. 大块，一块（木料、石头等）；（四面临街的）街段，街区；大楼，大厦；栋，座，幢；障碍物，阻碍；（短时间的）思维停滞，思维中断；一组，一批，一叠；（连续的）一段时间；阻挡，拦截；积木；（古代斩首用的）垫头木；<美>一大片土地；（物体的）平面，纯色色块；滑轮，滑轮组；区块 v. 阻塞，堵塞（道路、管道等）；遮住（视线）；封锁，挡住（去路）；阻挠，阻止；阻截，拦截（对方的球）；对……进行块操作；用模具使（帽等）成形

sentences.english: a wall made of concrete blocks
sentences.chinese: 由混凝土块砌成的墙

detailed_translations.english: a piece of hard material such as wood or stone with straight sides
to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it

detailed_translations.chinese: 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的

name: trace
trans: v. 查出，发现，追踪；追溯，追究；描绘（事物的过程或发展），记述；（尤指用手指、脚趾）画（图，线）；勾画……的轮廓，勾勒；（用透明纸覆盖在地图、绘画等上）复制，描摹；（手指、嘴唇等）沿着……移动 n. 痕迹，遗迹，踪迹；微量，少许；描记图，扫描线；挽绳，缰绳；跟踪，追查；（大脑上的学习或记忆）痕迹，印迹；<西印度，美>小径，小道；交线，迹线；（数）迹

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

detailed_translations.english: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
to find or discover sb/sth by looking carefully for them/it

name: vestige
trans: n. 遗迹；残余；退化的器官

sentences.english: We represent the last vestige of what made this nation great – hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我们代表了曾经使这个国家伟大的仅存的品质–勤奋。

detailed_translations.english: a small part or amount of something that remains when most of it no longer exists

name: stalk
trans: n. （植物的）茎，秆；（动物的）肉柄，肉茎；柄；（车辆）（转向柱上控制指示仪、灯光等的）手柄；悄悄追踪；高视阔步 v. 偷偷接近，潜近；跟踪，盯梢；怒冲冲地走，趾高气扬地走；令人厌恶地穿过，威胁地通过；<文>（不好的气氛）笼罩，蔓延

sentences.english: celery stalks
sentences.chinese: 芹菜茎

detailed_translations.english: to walk in a proud or angry way, with long steps
a long narrow part of a plant that supports leaves, fruits, or flowers
to follow a person or animal quietly in order to catch and attack or kill them

name: entrap
trans: vt. 使陷入；使陷罗网；欺骗

name: stationary
trans: adj. 不动的，静止的；不变的，稳定的；（行星）经度无明显移动的；定居的 n. 不动的人或物

sentences.english: How did you manage to drive into a stationary vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么开车的，竟会撞上一辆停着的车子？

detailed_translations.chinese: 固定的， 静止不动的
detailed_translations.english: standing still instead of moving

name: immobile
trans: adj. 固定的；稳定的；不变的

sentences.english: She could see a figure sitting immobile, facing the sea.
sentences.chinese: 她看到一个人影面朝大海坐着，一动不动。

detailed_translations.english: not moving at all

sentences.english: The interest rate has been fixed at 6.5%.
sentences.chinese: 利率已经定为6.5%。

sentences.english: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
sentences.chinese: 架子应当用螺丝固定在墙上。

detailed_translations.english: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

name: fixed
trans: adj. 固定的；（神情）僵硬的；确定的，不变的；顽固的，固执的；（比赛、选举等）被操纵的；<美，非正式>（经济上）处境……的；不易挥发的，形成化合物的 v. 修理（fix 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: The classes begin and end at fixed times.
sentences.chinese: 上下课的时间都是固定不变的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确定的；固执的；<美口>处境的；准备好的
detailed_translations.english: firmly fastened to a particular position

name: solidly
trans: adv. 坚固地；坚硬地；团结一致地

sentences.english: A man who sat himself solidly in an arm-chair, and looked into the fire, so--A shower of ideas fell perpetually from some very high Heaven down through his mind.
sentences.chinese: 这个人稳稳地坐在扶手椅里，凝视着炉火，就这样——一阵骤雨似的念头源源不断地从某个非常高的天国倾泻而下，进入他的头脑。

name: locate
trans: v. 确定……的位置，探明；设立，建立；迁居，开办公司；位于（be located in）

sentences.english: The business is located right in the center of town.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店就在市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or place

name: bear
trans: v. 手持，携带；（车，船）运输，运送；写有，刻有；以（姓名，头衔）相称；见证，作证；承担，担负（责任）；经得起；承受，容忍；生育（孩子）；（树，植物）结（果实），长出（花）；拐弯 n. 熊；粗暴无礼的人，没教养的人；体格笨重的男人，行动迟缓的男人；（股票）卖空者，做空头者；麻烦事，棘手之事；<非正式>“北极熊”（俄国的外号）

sentences.english: a mother bear and her cubs
sentences.chinese: 母熊和它的熊崽们

detailed_translations.english: a large strong animal with thick fur, that eats flesh, fruit, and insects

name: install
trans: v. 安装，设置；（计算机）安装（新软件）；正式任命，使正式就职；安顿，安置

sentences.english: They’ve installed the new computer network at last.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于安装了新电脑网络。

sentences.english: Security cameras have been installed in the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 在市中心已安装了一些监控摄像机。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used

name: set
trans: v. 放，置；使开始；把故事情节安排在；设置；摆放餐具；镶嵌；安排；树立；布置；凝固；使现出坚定的表情；固定发型；把（断骨）复位；排版；为……谱曲；落（下）；布置（戏剧、电影或电视节目的布景）；（断骨）愈合 n. 一组（类似的东西）；一组（配套使用的东西）；一伙（或一帮、一群）人；电视机；布景 ；舞台；（网球、排球比赛等的）盘；集；一组歌曲（或乐曲）；（在某学科上能力相当的）一批学生 ；（尤指坚定的）姿势；头发的定型；凝固；兽穴；（供移植的）秧苗 adj. 位于（或处于）……的；安排好的；固定的；套（餐）；有可能的；不自然的

sentences.english: The set (x, y) has two members.
sentences.chinese: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers, shapes etc in mathematics

name: sustain
trans: v. 维持，保持；维持……的生命；遭受，经受；（在体力或精神方面）支持，支撑；承受住……的重量；证实，证明；认可，赞成，确认；（演员）充分表演（角色，人物），扮演 n. （乐）延音

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: brace
trans: v. （使）作好准备；支撑，加固；抵住，顶住；（身体或身体某部分）绷紧 n. 支撑物，支架；牙箍，牙齿矫正器；大括弧，大括号；一对（猎获的鸟）；<英>吊裤带，背带；手摇曲柄；（船上的）转帆索

sentences.english: He braced himself for the icy plunge into the black water.
sentences.chinese: 他准备跳入冰冷的黑水。

detailed_translations.english: to mentally or physically prepare yourself or someone else for something unpleasant that is going to happen

detailed_translations.chinese: 使防备，使受锻炼；支住，撑牢，使绷紧
detailed_translations.english: to make something stronger by supporting it
something that is used to strengthen or support something, or to make it stiff

name: perceive
trans: vt. 认为，理解；察觉，注意到；意识到

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

name: perceptive
trans: adj. 感知力强的，有洞察力的，思维敏捷的；视觉的，听觉的，感觉的

sentences.english: He was one of the most perceptive U.S. political commentators.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是美国最具洞察力的政治评论员之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感知的，知觉的；有知觉力的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their remarks or thoughts as perceptive, you think that they are good at noticing or realizing things, especially things that are not obvious

name: detect
trans: v. 查明，察觉；测出，检测，识别

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

name: detectable
trans: adj. 可检测的；可发觉的

sentences.english: Doctors say the disease is probably inherited but not detectable at birth.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说该疾病很可能是遗传的，但在出生时是不可发现的。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is detectable can be noticed or discovered

name: discernible
trans: adj. 看得清的，觉察得出的

sentences.english: Far away the outline of the island is just discernible.
sentences.chinese: 远远的，那岛的轮廓依稀可见。

detailed_translations.english: If something is discernible, you can see it or recognize that it exists

name: inquiry
trans: n. 询问，疑问；调查，审查； 探查，探询

sentences.english: I don’t know who sent the gift, but I’ll make some inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道礼物是谁送的，但我会打听一下。

sentences.english: The police have launched a murder inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 警方已开始对谋杀案展开调查

detailed_translations.english: a question you ask in order to get information

name: observe
trans: v. 注意到，观察到；注视，监视；（在科学研究中）观测，发现；说话，评论；遵守（规则、法律等）；庆祝（节日），纪念（某人或事件）；静默，默哀；举行，参加

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: observation
trans: n. 观察，监视；观察力；观察资料，观察结果；言论，评论；遵守，奉行；测天 adj. 用于观察的

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

name: perspective
trans: n. （观察问题的）视角，观点；透视（画）法；（几何）透视关系，投影比例；洞察力，判断力；景观，远景；角度；（声音）立体效果 adj. 透视的

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: insight
trans: n. 洞悉，了解；洞察力

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

name: investigate
trans: v. 侦察（某事）；调查（某人）；研究

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: pierce
trans: v. （锋利尖锐物体）刺入，刺穿；（在身体某部位）扎眼，穿孔（以佩戴珠宝）；（声或光）穿过，透入；冲过，突破；让某人心如刀割，深深地打动

sentences.english: Steam the corn until it can easily be pierced with a fork.
sentences.chinese: 把玉米蒸到用叉子可以轻易扎透。

sentences.english: Rose underwent emergency surgery after a bullet pierced her lung.
sentences.chinese: 罗丝被子弹射穿肺部，接受了紧急手术。

detailed_translations.english: to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point
to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point

name: survey
trans: n. 民意调查，民意测验；考察，调查；（对课题或情况的）全面考察，概述；测量，勘测；测绘图，勘测记录；测量部门；<英> （尤指为欲购房者所做的）房屋鉴定；查勘报告 v. 做民意测验，做民意调查；（尤指认真地）审视，检查；测量，勘测；<英> （尤指为可能的买家）查勘，检视（建筑物的状况）；全面评述，概述

sentences.english: Of the 100 companies surveyed, 10% had a turnover of £50 m to £99 m.
sentences.chinese: 被调查的 100 家公司中，10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

sentences.english: She turned to survey her daughter’s pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她转过头审视女儿苍白的面容。

sentences.english: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

sentences.english: a geological survey
sentences.chinese: 地质勘察

detailed_translations.english: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

name: scan
trans: vt. 细看，审视；粗略看，浏览；扫描检查（物体或身体部位等）；（机器或计算机程序）扫描，察看；将（文件、照片等）扫描进计算机；（用声呐或雷达）扫描，扫掠；（诗）符合格律，韵节合拍；用（光束）扫描；电视扫描 n. 快速查阅，浏览；（医疗）扫描检查；扫描图；胎儿扫描检查

sentences.english: He scanned the horizon, but there was no sign of the ship.
sentences.chinese: 他朝地平线处仔细眺望，但是找不到那艘船的踪影。

sentences.english: She scanned his face, looking for signs of what he was thinking.
sentences.chinese: 她端详着他的脸，想知道他在想些什么。

sentences.english: Video cameras scanned the car park.
sentences.chinese: 摄像机监视着停车场。

sentences.english: She scanned through the paper.
sentences.chinese: 她浏览了一下报纸。

sentences.english: 英文例句:You scan the text into the computer, then edit it.
sentences.chinese: 把文本扫描进电脑，然后进行编辑。

detailed_translations.english: to examine an area carefully but quickly, often because you are looking for a particular person or thing

name: skim
trans: v. （从液体表面）撇去（浮物）；掠过，擦过（表面）；<英>用（扁石）打水漂；略读，浏览；略微讨论（或处理）（skim over）；<非正式>（尤指一段时间内）挪用（小数额钱）；盗用（信用卡电子信息） n. 液面上的表层物；浏览；脱脂品（尤指脱脂奶） adj. 脱脂的；撇去浮沫的

sentences.english: seagulls skimming the waves
sentences.chinese: 掠过浪尖的海鸥

sentences.english: Julie skimmed the sports page.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉浏览了体育版。

detailed_translations.english: to move along quickly over a surface, never touching it or not touching it often

name: spot
trans: n. 地点，场所；（人体的）部位，地方；有某种特质的部分；点，斑点；污点，污渍；（皮肤上的）丘疹，疱疹；（演出中）某演员的固定节目；排名位置； <英>少量，一点；几滴，少许（液体）；困境，窘境；现货交易，现金交易；聚光灯（spotlight 的简称）；（人格或名誉的）污点，瑕玷；<美>（多米诺牌、纸牌或骰子上的）点；调灰泥板，调石膏板；<美，非正式>（特定面值的）钞票；（英足）点球点 v. 看见，注意到；（对比赛对手）让分，让步；飘了几滴雨，下小雨；发现，挖掘（某人有天赋）；<非正式>借（钱）给；使有斑点，使有污迹；稀疏地点缀（表面，某地）；（举重训练时）现场指导监督；<英>业余观察；（军）（尤指从空中）确定敌人的位置；将（橄榄球）放在适当位置；将（台球）放在置球点上 adj. 现货交易的，立即支付的

sentences.english: a nice quiet spot on the beach
sentences.chinese: 海滩上一个安静的好地方

sentences.english: I chose a spot well away from the road.
sentences.chinese: 我选了一个远离马路的地点。

detailed_translations.english: a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time

detailed_translations.chinese: 认出， 发现； 玷污
detailed_translations.english: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize

name: identify
trans: v. 认出，识别；查明，确认；发现；证明（身份），表明；认同，理解；认为……和……一致；和（某人）打成一片

sentences.english: He was too far away to be able to identify faces.
sentences.chinese: 他离得太远，没法看面孔认出谁是谁。

sentences.english: The police took fingerprints and identified the body.
sentences.chinese: 警方采集了指纹，对尸体作了身份确认。

detailed_translations.english: to recognize and correctly name someone or something

name: realize
trans: v. 了解，意识到；（所担心的事）发生，产生（be realized）；实现（目标、梦想等）；（充分）发挥出自己的潜力； 把（概念等）具体表现出来；用（语言特征）表达；对（记谱不全的乐曲）做完整兑谱改编；获得（金钱，利润）；变现，变卖（资产）

sentences.english: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.english: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

name: scrutinize
trans: v. 仔细查看，细致审查

sentences.english: He scrutinized the document.
sentences.chinese: 他细阅了这份文件。

sentences.english: She scrutinized his face.
sentences.chinese: 她细细端详他的脸。

detailed_translations.english: to examine someone or something very carefully

name: locate
trans: v. 确定……的位置，探明；设立，建立；迁居，开办公司；位于（be located in）

sentences.english: The business is located right in the center of town.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店就在市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or place

name: irreconcilable
trans: adj. 矛盾的；不能和解的；不能协调的

sentences.english: I find your irresponsible behaviour, coupled with your irreverent attitude, quite irreconcilable with your position.
sentences.chinese: 我认为你不负责的行为，加上你不敬的态度与你的地位非常不能协调。

sentences.english: Religious controversies are always productive of more acrimony and irreconcilable hatreds than those which spring from any other cause.
sentences.chinese: 宗教的论争总是比来自其他原因的论争产生更多恶毒和不可协调的仇恨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾的， 不能协调的
detailed_translations.english: irreconcilable positions etc are so strongly opposed to each other that it is not possible for them to reach an agreement

name: indomitable
trans: adj. 不屈不挠的；不服输的；不气馁的

sentences.english: an indomitable old lady
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的老妇人

detailed_translations.chinese: 不屈不挠的；不服输的；不气馁的
detailed_translations.english: having great determination or courage

name: sturdy
trans: adj. 结实的，坚固的；（人或身体）强壮的，健壮的；坚决的，坚定的 n. （绦虫幼虫在脑中形成包囊使绵羊产生的）晕倒病，蹒跚病

sentences.english: That chair doesn’t look very sturdy.
sentences.chinese: 那把椅子看上去不太结实。

sentences.english: They kept up a sturdy opposition to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直坚决反对那项计划。

detailed_translations.english: (of an object) strong and not easily damaged

name: obstinate
trans: adj. 执拗的，固执的；棘手的，难以去除的

sentences.english: He was the most obstinate man I’ve ever met.
sentences.chinese: 他是我遇到过的最固执的人。

sentences.english: Don’t be so obstinate!
sentences.chinese: 别这么固执！

sentences.english: an obstinate refusal to obey
sentences.chinese: 固执地拒绝服从

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽固的；倔强的；难以控制的
detailed_translations.english: determined not to change your ideas, behaviour, opinions etc, even when other people think you are being unreasonable

name: bigoted
trans: adj. 顽固的；心地狭窄的；盲从的

name: persistent
trans: adj. 执意的，坚持不懈的；持续的，反复出现的；（化学品，放射性）作用持久的，挥发慢的；（动植物某部位，如角、叶等）宿存的，不落的

sentences.english: persistent rumours
sentences.chinese: 持续流传的谣言

sentences.english: persistent headaches
sentences.chinese: 持续头疼

sentences.english: a persistent problem
sentences.chinese: 长期问题

sentences.english: persistent rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

name: inflexible
trans: adj. 固守己见的，顽固的；（规则、安排等）不可改变的，不容变更的；（材料）坚硬的，不能弯曲

sentences.english: inflexible attitudes towards change
sentences.chinese: 对变革的顽固态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽固的；不可弯曲的；不屈挠的；不能转变的
detailed_translations.english: unwilling to make even the slightest change in your attitudes, plans etc

name: steadfast
trans: adj. 忠诚的，坚定的

sentences.english: her father’s steadfast love for her
sentences.chinese: 她父亲对她永不改变的爱

detailed_translations.english: being certain that you are right about something and refusing to change your opinion in any way

name: unshaken
trans: adj. 不动摇的；坚决的；泰然自若的

name: durable
trans: adj. 持久的，耐用的；<非正式>（人）有耐力的，坚韧不拔的 n. 耐用品

sentences.english: Wood is a durable material.
sentences.chinese: 木头是耐用材料。

detailed_translations.english: staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot

name: tough
trans: adj. （物质，物体）坚韧的，坚固的；（政策或行动）强硬的，严厉的；吃苦耐劳的，坚韧不拔的；顽固的，固执的；困难的，棘手的；艰难的，困苦的，难熬的；（食物）老的，不易切开的，嚼不动的；（人）粗暴的，粗鲁的；（地区）充满暴力与犯罪的；不幸的，倒霉的，活该（表示不同情） n. 恶棍 v. 坚持，忍受，忍耐 adv. 坚强地，坚定地

sentences.english: It was a tough race.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打得很艰难。

sentences.english: She’s had a tough life.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活十分艰辛。

sentences.english: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.chinese: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.english: Tough decisions will have to be made.
sentences.chinese: 必须作出艰难的决定。

sentences.english: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.chinese: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.english: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.english: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.chinese: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.english: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.chinese: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to do or deal with

name: headstrong
trans: adj. 任性的；顽固的；刚愎的

sentences.english: He's young, very headstrong, but he's a good man underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻、任性，但骨子里是个好人。

detailed_translations.english: very determined to do what you want, even when other people advise you not to do it

name: stubborn
trans: adj. （人）固执的，倔强的；难以去除（对付，使用）的

sentences.english: Why are you so stubborn?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么这么固执？

sentences.english: I’ve got a very stubborn streak (= a tendency to be stubborn ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的个性很固执。

sentences.english: Paul can be as stubborn as a mule (= very stubborn ) .
sentences.chinese: 保尔有时倔得像头驴。

detailed_translations.english: determined not to change your mind, even when people think you are being unreasonable

name: tenacious
trans: adj. 顽强的，坚韧不拔的；稳固的，牢固的；（观点、信念）根深蒂固的，深入人心的；顽强的，坚忍不拔的

sentences.english: a tenacious negotiator
sentences.chinese: 锲而不舍的谈判者

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽强的；坚韧的；固执的；紧握的；黏着力强的
detailed_translations.english: determined to do something and unwilling to stop trying even when the situation becomes difficult

name: resolute
trans: adj. 坚决的，果断的

sentences.english: resolute opposition
sentences.chinese: 坚决的反对

sentences.english: resolute leadership
sentences.chinese: 果断的领导

sentences.english: She remained resolute in her belief that the situation would improve.
sentences.chinese: 她依然坚信情况将会好转。

detailed_translations.english: doing something in a very determined way because you have very strong beliefs, aims etc

name: hardheaded
trans: adj. 脚踏实地的；冷静的；无懈可击的；顽固的

sentences.english: ...a hardheaded and shrewd businesswoman.
sentences.chinese: ...一位务实、精明的女商人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脚踏实地的；冷静的；无懈可击的；顽固的
detailed_translations.english: You use hardheaded to describe someone who is practical and determined to get what they want or need, and who does not allow emotions to affect their actions

name: stoically
trans: adv. 坚忍地；恬淡寡欲地

name: fortitude
trans: n. 刚毅；不屈不挠；勇气

sentences.english: Winnie is a woman of quiet fortitude who has endured a lot of suffering.
sentences.chinese: 温妮是个坚强寡言的女子，她忍受了许多痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: courage shown when you are in great pain or experiencing a lot of trouble

name: resist
trans: v. 阻挡，抵制；抵抗，回击；耐得住，抵挡；使不受……的伤害，抗（伤害） n. 保护涂层（防染色、着釉等），防染材料

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: remain
trans: v. 逗留，留下；剩余，遗留；保持不变，一直是；仍需去做（或处理） n. 剩余（物），遗迹；遗体，残骸

sentences.english: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in the same place without moving away

detailed_translations.chinese: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
detailed_translations.english: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

name: persevere
trans: v. 锲而不舍，坚持不懈；固执己见（在辩论中）

sentences.english: It can be tricky at first, but persevere.
sentences.chinese: 一开始会有些棘手，不过要坚持。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚持；不屈不挠；固执己见（在辩论中）
detailed_translations.english: to continue trying to do something in a very determined way in spite of difficulties – use this to show approval

name: perseverance
trans: n. 毅力，不屈不挠的精神

sentences.english: He's a clever man,but fails in perseverance.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个聪明人，但缺乏毅力。

sentences.english: Their power does not come from rank or title but from intellect and perseverance.
sentences.chinese: 他们的权力并非来自等级或头衔，而是来自他们的智慧和毅力。

name: maintain
trans: v. 保持，维持；维修，保养；断言，主张；赡养，抚养；<旧>支持，维护

sentences.english: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.english: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.english: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.english: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

detailed_translations.english: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before

name: insist
trans: v. 坚决要求，坚持；坚称

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

name: implicit
trans: adj. 含蓄的，未言明的；内含的，固有的；无疑问的，无保留的；（函数）隐式的，隐的

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

name: reflection
trans: n. （光、热或声音的）反射；反射光，反射热，回声；（反射出来的）影像，倒影；深思，反省；（尤指见诸语言的）想法，意见；表现，反映；坏的印象；（数）镜射，反射

sentences.english: Can you see your reflection in the glass?
sentences.chinese: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: ...the reflection of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

sentences.english: Inhibition in adulthood seems to be a reflection of a person's experiences as a child.
sentences.chinese: 成年期的压抑似乎是一个人童年经历的一种反映。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

name: expose
trans: v. 暴露，使显露；使面临，使遭受（危险或不快）；揭露，揭发；接触，体验；露出，显露（感情）；使（胶卷）曝光；当众暴露自己的性器官，露阴（expose oneself）；弃（婴孩）于户外让其死去 n. 揭露，曝光

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: exposure
trans: n. 暴露，接触；曝光，揭发；报道，宣传；单张胶片；曝光时间，曝光量；受冻；朝向

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

name: reveal
trans: v. 揭示，透露；表明，证明；展示，显示；（通过神或超自然手段）启示 n. （电视节目最后的）揭示；门侧，窗侧

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: revelation
trans: n. 被揭示的真相，被揭露的内情；揭露，披露；出乎意料的事物，令人惊喜的发现；（上帝的）启示，默示；《启示录》（《圣经·新约》末卷，讲述上帝对圣约翰有关未来的启示）（Revelation）

sentences.english: ...following the revelation of his affair with a former secretary.
sentences.chinese: …在他和前任秘书的风流韵事被揭露之后。

detailed_translations.english: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known

name: unveil
trans: v. （首次）公开，揭示；为……揭幕，揭去……上的覆盖物；除去面纱，显露

sentences.english: The statue was unveiled by the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 这尊雕塑由女王揭幕。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the cover from something, especially as part of a formal ceremony

name: show
trans: v. 显示，表明；给……看，出示；（通过示范）教，解说；指给某人看，指出；带领，引领；（情感、品质等的）流露，表露；（对某人）表现出，对待；显示出，流露出；容易显出，容易看到；标示，表明（信息、时间、计量）；描绘，表现（为）；放映，播出；展示，展出；<非正式> 证明，表明；如约赶到，露面；替（动物）报名参加比赛；出现（盈利或亏损）；<非正式> （妇女）已显出身孕；（北美）获得第三名（或前三名） n. 演出，歌舞表演；（电视或广播）节目；展览，展览会；（体现内心感受的）动作，行为；装出的样子，虚假的外观；鲜艳悦目的景象；<非正式> 事情，场面；<非正式> 表现；动物比赛；场面，场合；<非正式> 滑稽场面，洋相；（分娩或月经时的）见红，现血，血先露；<非正式> （做某事的）机会，时机

sentences.english: Think positively and show some determination.
sentences.chinese: 要往好的方面想，拿出决心来。

sentences.english: She had learned not to show her emotions .
sentences.chinese: 她早就学会了不流露出自己的感情。

sentences.english: It was the sound a man might make when in pain but trying not to show it.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个人强忍着疼痛不愿表露出来时发出的声音。

sentences.english: Mary showed great interest in the children.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽对这些小孩子表示出极大的兴趣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 显现， 显露， 露面； 演出， 放映
detailed_translations.english: to let your feelings, attitudes, or personal qualities be clearly seen

detailed_translations.chinese: 表演，节目；演出，上映；展览，展览物，展览会；显示，展示；表面，外观
detailed_translations.english: a performance for the public, especially one that includes singing, dancing, or jokes

detailed_translations.chinese: 给看，显示，出示；引领，带领；教，告知，说明；表明，证明
detailed_translations.english: to let someone see something

name: transpire
trans: vi. 发生；蒸发；泄露 vt. 使蒸发；使排出

sentences.english: It now transpires that he kept all the money for himself.
sentences.chinese: 事实已经清楚，他把所有的钱都据为己有了。

detailed_translations.english: if it transpires that something is true, you discover that it is true

name: profess
trans: vt. 自称，（尤指）伪称；公开承认（某种感受或信仰）；信仰，信奉（宗教）；正式准予加入（be professed）；<旧>以教授身份教（某科目），传授

sentences.english: She professed to hate her nickname.
sentences.chinese: 她声称讨厌她的绰号。

sentences.english: Why do organizations profess that they care?
sentences.chinese: 为什么一些组织声称他们关心呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示， 承认； 宣称信仰
detailed_translations.english: If you profess to do or have something, you claim that you do it or have it, often when you do not

name: signify
trans: v. 意味着，象征；<正式> 表达，显示（感情、意愿等）；<正式> 要紧，有重要性；<美，非正式>（作为一种游戏或习俗，美国黑人之间）相互吹牛，相互辱骂

sentences.english: Some tribes use special facial markings to signify status.
sentences.chinese: 有些部落使用特殊的面部标记来表示地位。

sentences.english: The image of the lion signified power and strength.
sentences.chinese: 狮子的形象代表权力和力量。

sentences.english: These figures don’t really signify in the overall results.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字对于总体结果影响不是很大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示,意味；要紧,有重要性
detailed_translations.english: to represent, mean, or be a sign of something

name: bare
trans: adj. 赤裸的；光秃秃的；无遮盖的，无装饰的；仅最基本的 v. 使暴露，使露出 adv. 非常，许多

sentences.english: a ragged child with bare feet
sentences.chinese: 一个衣衫褴褛、光着脚的小孩

sentences.english: She felt the sun warm on her bare arms.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉到阳光照在她裸露双臂上的暖意。

sentences.english: He got 40% – a bare pass.
sentences.chinese: 他得了40分，勉强及格。

detailed_translations.english: not covered by clothes

name: exhibit
trans: v. 表现出；卖弄，炫耀；提出（证据等）；展览，展出 n. 展品；（法庭上出示的）证物；<美>展览，展出

sentences.english: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

detailed_translations.english: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

name: leak
trans: v. 渗入，漏出；漏，渗漏；泄露，透露 n. 漏洞，裂缝；泄漏出的液体（或气体）；泄密；<俚>撒尿

sentences.english: The roof is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶在漏水。

sentences.english: A tanker is leaking oil off the coast of Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰海岸附近有一艘油轮漏油。

sentences.english: 英语例句：The boat had sprung a leak (= a hole had appeared in it ).
sentences.chinese: 小船出现了漏洞。

detailed_translations.english: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through
a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something

name: divulge
trans: vt. 泄露；暴露

sentences.english: Officials refuse to divulge details of the negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 官员们拒绝透露谈判的细节。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone information that should be secret

name: denote
trans: v. 标志，预示；表示，意指

sentences.english: What does the word ‘curriculum’ denote that ‘course’ does not?
sentences.chinese: curriculum一词的哪些含义是course没有的？

detailed_translations.english: to mean something

name: indicate
trans: v. 表明，标示；象征，暗示；间接提及，示意；指示，指出；<英>（用灯光或手臂）打行车转向信号；有必要，被建议

sentences.english: The study indicates a connection between poverty and crime.
sentences.chinese: 研究显示贫穷和犯罪有关联。

detailed_translations.english: to show that a particular situation exists, or that something is likely to be true

name: betray
trans: v. 背叛，出卖；食言，辜负；违背（信仰、原则等）；泄露（机密，信息）；流露，显露出（情感或特性）；暴露（不易发觉的东西）

sentences.english: He felt that she had betrayed him.
sentences.chinese: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

sentences.english: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
sentences.chinese: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。

sentences.english: I would never betray a confidence (=  tell a secret that someone has trusted me with  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背叛， 出卖； 失信于， 辜负； 泄露； 暴露， 显露
detailed_translations.english: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

name: irrepressible
trans: adj. 抑制不住的；压服不了的

sentences.english: Jared's exuberance was irrepressible.
sentences.chinese: 杰拉德的兴奋难以抑制。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑制不住的；压服不了的
detailed_translations.english: An irrepressible person is lively and energetic and never seems to be depressed

name: unruly
trans: adj. 不守规矩的；任性的；难驾驭的

sentences.english: unruly children
sentences.chinese: 难管教的孩子

sentences.english: unruly behaviour
sentences.chinese: 粗暴的行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 不守规矩的；任性的；难驾驭的
detailed_translations.english: violent or difficult to control

name: operate
trans: v. 操纵，操作（机器或设备）；（机器等）运转，运行 ；管理，经营（企业、部门等）；（组织或公司）运营；（使）运行，（使）工作；起作用，发生影响；（以某种方式）行事；开刀，动手术；（士兵或警察在某地区）行动，执行公务

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
to use and control a machine or equipment

name: handle
trans: v. 拿；处理，应付；操纵；触（球）；经营，管理 n. 把手，拉手；柄，提手；（理解、解决问题的）方法，途径；<非正式>（尤指奇怪的）名字，名称；（织物等的）手感；<美，非正式>赌注总额 comb. 有……个柄的，有……柄的

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

name: intelligible
trans: adj. 可理解的，明白易懂的；只能凭智力理解的

sentences.english: His reply was barely intelligible.
sentences.chinese: 他的回复几乎让人听不懂。

detailed_translations.english: if speech, writing, or an idea is intelligible, it can be easily understood

name: evident
trans: adj. 清楚的，显然的

sentences.english: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: easy to see, notice, or understand

name: explicit
trans: adj. 清楚明白的，明确的，详述的；直截了当的，坦率的；赤裸裸表现性爱（或暴力）的，露骨的 n. （手稿、早期印刷品或礼拜仪式上唱诗的）结束语

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

name: elusive
trans: adj. 难以理解的，难以记住的；难以发现的，难以捕获的

sentences.english: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
sentences.chinese: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉，但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
detailed_translations.english: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

name: mysterious
trans: adj. 不可思议的，难以理解的；（人）神秘的，陌生的；保密的，故弄玄虚的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: ignorant
trans: adj. 无知的，（对某事物）不了解的；<非正式>无礼的，粗鲁的；暴躁的，易怒的

sentences.english: an ignorant and uneducated man
sentences.chinese: 不学无术的人

detailed_translations.english: not knowing facts or information that you ought to know

name: ignorance
trans: n. 无知，愚昧

sentences.english: Excuse my ignorance, but how does it actually work?
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我的无知，它究竟是如何运作的？

detailed_translations.english: lack of knowledge or information about something

name: grasp
trans: v. 抓牢，握紧；理解，领会；抓住（机会） n. 紧抓，紧握；理解（力），领会；能力所及，伸手可及的距离；控制，权力

sentences.english: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.english: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

sentences.english: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
sentences.chinese: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

sentences.english: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

name: comprehend
trans: v. 理解，领悟；包括，包含

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

name: comprehensive
trans: adj. 综合性的，全面的；有理解力的 n. 综合中学；专业综合测验

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

name: rapacious
trans: adj. 贪婪的；掠夺的

sentences.english: rapacious landlords
sentences.chinese: 贪婪的房东

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more money, goods etc than you need or have a right to

name: strip
trans: v. 除去，撕掉（外皮或表层）；夺去，剥夺（地位，权力，财产）；脱衣服，脱光……的衣服；表演脱衣舞；为（奶牛）收奶；拆卸，拆开（机器、车辆或引擎 ）；<美>拆散（汽车等）卖零件；使空无一物，搬光（家具、设备等）；（使）（螺丝或齿轮）受损；（为利润）出售（公司资产）；分离（债券的）息票使二者分开出售；（子弹出膛时因膛面磨损而）不旋转 n. （纸、金属、织物等）条，带；带状地带；<英>（比赛时穿的）队服，球衣；商业街；脱衣舞；连环漫画；<英>（定时播出的）广播节目；飞机跑道

sentences.english: Strip the beds and wash the sheets.
sentences.chinese: 把床单撤下来清洗。

sentences.english: a strip of paper
sentences.chinese: 一张纸条

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is covering the surface of something else
a long narrow piece of paper, cloth etc

name: bereave
trans: v. 使丧失亲友；剥夺

sentences.english: Sin can never quite bereave a saint of his jewel his grace; but it may steal away the key of the cabinet his assurance.
sentences.chinese: 罪恶全然无法夺去圣徒的珠宝，就是他所得到恩典；但是罪恶可以偷走珠宝柜的钥匙，那就是确据。

detailed_translations.english: to deprive (of) something or someone valued, esp through death

name: loot
trans: v. （尤指在战争或暴乱中）抢劫，掠夺 n. 战利品，掠夺物；赃物，被盗物；<非正式>钱；<美，非正式>大量赠送（或购买）之物

sentences.english: Shops were looted and burned.
sentences.chinese: 商店遭到抢劫和焚毁。

detailed_translations.english: goods taken by soldiers from a place where they have won a battle
to steal things, especially from shops or homes that have been damaged in a war or  riot

name: harry
trans: v. 不断烦扰，折磨；反复进攻，不断袭击

sentences.english: He is increasingly active in harrying the government in late-night debates.
sentences.chinese: 他愈来愈积极地在午夜辩论节目中不断攻击政府。

detailed_translations.english: to keep asking someone for something in a way that is upsetting or annoying

detailed_translations.chinese: (Harry)人名；(英)哈里，哈丽(女名)(教名Henry、Harriet的昵称)

name: ravage
trans: v. 毁坏，破坏，劫掠 n. 蹂躏，大破坏

sentences.english: a country ravaged by civil war
sentences.chinese: 遭受内战重创的国家

sentences.english: His health was gradually ravaged by drink and drugs.
sentences.chinese: 酗酒和吸毒渐渐毁了他的健康。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something very badly

name: grind
trans: v. 磨碎，碾碎；使锋利；用力挤压；摩擦（发出刺耳声）；<非正式>（跳舞者）扭摆臀部；摇动（碾磨机等机器的）手柄操作；用绞肉机绞（肉）；（机器或车辆伴有噪音地）缓慢运转，费力移动 n. 苦差事；摩擦（声），碾磨（声）；<美，非正式>埋头苦读的学生；磨制级别； <爱尔兰>小型教学班；<非正式>（舞蹈中的）扭臀动作

sentences.english: a stone for grinding knives and scissors
sentences.chinese: 磨刀剪的石头

sentences.english: The lenses are ground to a high standard of precision.
sentences.chinese: 镜片被磨到很高的精确度。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smooth or sharp by rubbing it on a hard surface or by using a machine

a movement in  skateboarding  or  rollerblading  , which involves moving sideways along the edge of something, so that the bar connecting the wheels of the  skateboard  or  rollerblade  presses hard against the edge

name: torment
trans: n. （肉体、精神上的）折磨，痛苦；使人痛苦的人（物） v. 使痛苦，折磨；骚扰，捉弄

sentences.english: The journey must have been a torment for them.
sentences.chinese: 这次旅途对他们来说一定十分痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: severe mental or physical suffering
to make someone suffer a lot, especially mentally

name: equivocal
trans: adj. 模棱两可的；可疑的

sentences.english: His answer was equivocal.
sentences.chinese: 他的回答模棱两可。

sentences.english: She was rather equivocal about her work.
sentences.chinese: 她谈到她的工作时有点含糊其词。

detailed_translations.english: if you are equivocal, you are deliberately unclear in the way that you give information or your opinion

name: enigma
trans: n. 谜，不可思议的东西

sentences.english: Iran remains an enigma for the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗对外部世界而言依然是个谜。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something or someone as an enigma, you mean they are mysterious or difficult to understand

name: enigmatic
trans: adj. 神秘的；高深莫测的；谜一般的

sentences.english: She starred in one of Welles's most enigmatic films.
sentences.chinese: 她主演了威尔斯最神秘的电影当中的一部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的；高深莫测的；谜一般的
detailed_translations.english: Someone or something that is enigmatic is mysterious and difficult to understand

name: maze
trans: n. 迷宫；走迷宫（一种儿童游戏）；错综复杂的事物；纵横交错的小街（或小道等）；迷惑，糊涂 v. 使发昏，使迷惑

sentences.english: We got completely lost in the maze.
sentences.chinese: 我们在迷宫中彻底迷了路。

sentences.english: the famous Hampton Court maze
sentences.chinese: 著名的汉普顿宫迷宫

detailed_translations.english: a specially designed system of paths, often in a park or public garden, which is difficult to find your way through

name: labyrinth
trans: n. 迷宫；[解剖] 迷路；难解的事物

sentences.english: ...the labyrinth of corridors.
sentences.chinese: …迷宫般的走廊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迷宫；[解剖] 迷路；难解的事物
detailed_translations.english: a large network of paths or passages which cross each other, making it very difficult to find your way

name: riddle
trans: n. 谜语；谜一般的人（或事）；（筛分土石的）粗筛 v. 猜（某人）出的（谜），为（某人）解（谜）；<古> 打谜语般地说，出谜；把……打得满是窟窿；（尤指令人不快之事）充斥，布满；用粗筛筛；摇动（炉栅）使灰落下

sentences.english: See if you can solve this riddle .
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能猜出这个谜语。

detailed_translations.english: to solve, explain, or interpret (a riddle or riddles)

detailed_translations.chinese: 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等
detailed_translations.english: a question that is deliberately very confusing and has a humorous or clever answer

name: puzzle
trans: v. 使困惑，使迷惑；（因迷惑而）苦思，冥思苦想；（通过苦苦思索）解决（或弄清楚），理出头绪（puzzle sth. out） n. 测验智力（或知识）的游戏（或玩具，问题）；拼图游戏，拼图玩具；令人费解的人（或事物），难题

sentences.english: The meaning of the poem has always been a puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 那首诗的含义始终是个谜。

sentences.english: He thought he had solved the puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他已经解开了那个谜。

sentences.english: What puzzles me is why his books are so popular.
sentences.chinese: 令我不解的是，他的书为什么如此受欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: something that is difficult to understand or explain
to confuse someone or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand something

name: elude
trans: v. （尤指机智地，巧妙地）避开，逃避；使达不到，使不能实现；使不记得，使不理解；对（法律，要求，处罚）不服从

sentences.english: He eluded his pursuers by escaping into a river.
sentences.chinese: 他逃到河里，甩掉了追踪他的人。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from someone or something, especially by tricking them

name: captivate
trans: v. 迷住，使……着迷

sentences.english: I was captivated by her brilliant mind.
sentences.chinese: 我为她的聪慧所迷。

detailed_translations.english: to attract someone very much, and hold their attention

name: enthrall
trans: vt. 迷住，使着迷

sentences.english: The author enthrall, enthralled the minds of his readers.
sentences.chinese: 那位作者于读者着迷。

sentences.english: Such trends do not enthrall neutrals, many of whom would prefer to see free-scoring Barcelona win tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 这些趋势并没有迷惑住中立者，他们中的很多人更愿意火力十足的巴萨明天赢球。

sentences.english: Even now, having been tortured and imprisoned by Voldemort, the idea of the Dark wizard in possession of this wand seemed to enthrall him as much as it repulsed him.
sentences.chinese: 现在，即使在被伏地魔拷问和关押后，这老头儿对于黑巫师拥有老魔杖的想法，似乎仍是既反感又着迷。

name: bewilder
trans: v. 使迷惑，使糊涂

sentences.english: He was bewildered by his daughter’s reaction.
sentences.chinese: 他被女儿的反应弄糊涂了。

detailed_translations.english: to confuse someone

name: perplex
trans: v. 使困惑，使茫然；使复杂化

sentences.english: Shea’s symptoms perplexed the doctors.
sentences.chinese: 谢伊的症状令医生们困惑。

detailed_translations.english: if something perplexes you, it makes you feel confused and worried because it is difficult to understand

name: tangle
trans: v. （使）纠结，（使）缠结；<非正式> 和……发生冲突，和……发生纠纷；（思想、局势变得）纷乱，混乱 n. （线、毛发等的）缠结的一团，乱团；混乱，纷乱；<非正式>争吵，打架；大型棕色海藻（尤指昆布）

sentences.english: My hair tangles easily.
sentences.chinese: 我的头发很容易打结。

sentences.english: His parachute became tangled in the wheels of the plane.
sentences.chinese: 他的降落伞缠在了飞机的轮子上。

detailed_translations.english: to become twisted together, or make something become twisted together, in an untidy mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 乱糟糟的一堆， 混乱； 复杂的问题； 困惑
detailed_translations.english: a confused state or situation

name: confound
trans: vt. 使困惑惊讶，使惊疑；证明……有错，驳倒；打败，挫败（敌人、计划等）；<旧>讨厌，该死；使混淆

sentences.english: His amazing recovery confounded the medical specialists.
sentences.chinese: 他的神奇康复使医学专家感到惊讶。

name: entangle
trans: vt. 使纠缠；卷入；使混乱

sentences.english: Bureaucracy can entangle applications for months.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主义会使申请耽搁数月之久。

detailed_translations.english: to involve someone in an argument, a relationship, or a situation that is difficult to escape from

name: fascinate
trans: v. <旧>（尤指蛇）以眼神震慑（人，动物），使无法动弹；深深吸引，迷住

sentences.english: Politics fascinated Franklin's father.
sentences.chinese: 政治让富兰克林的父亲着迷。

detailed_translations.english: If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it

name: blur
trans: n. 模糊不清的事物；模糊的记忆，记不清的事情；污迹 v. （使）看不清楚，记不清；（使）难以区分；玷污

sentences.english: The street lights were blurred by the fog.
sentences.chinese: 街灯在迷雾的笼罩下十分昏暗。

sentences.english: Many of the details in the picture are blurred.
sentences.chinese: 照片中的许多细节部分都模糊了。

detailed_translations.english: to become difficult to see, or to make something difficult to see, because the edges are not clear
a shape that you cannot see clearly

name: dazzle
trans: v. （强光）使目眩，使眼花；使惊叹，使眼花缭乱 n. （光的）炫目，耀眼；灿烂，令人赞叹的特质

sentences.english: a deer dazzled by the headlights
sentences.chinese: 被车头灯光照得目眩的鹿

sentences.english: As children, we were dazzled by my uncle’s good looks and charm.
sentences.chinese: 小时候，我叔叔的英俊外表和魅力令我们倾倒。

detailed_translations.english: if a very bright light dazzles you, it stops you from seeing properly for a short time

name: dogmatic
trans: adj. 教条的；武断的

sentences.english: Her staff find her bossy and dogmatic.
sentences.chinese: 她的员工认为她爱指挥别人而且自以为是。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is dogmatic is completely certain of their beliefs and expects other people to accept them without arguing

name: illegible
trans: adj. 难辨认的；字迹模糊的

sentences.english: His handwriting is totally illegible.
sentences.chinese: 他的字迹完全无法辨认。

detailed_translations.english: difficult or impossible to read

name: pending
trans: adj. 待决的，待定的，待处理的；即将发生的，迫近的 prep. 直到……为止，在……之前，在等待……之际 v. 等候判定或决定（pend的现在分词）

sentences.english: Many trade disputes are pending, awaiting the outcome of the talks.
sentences.chinese: 许多贸易争端悬而未决，等待会谈结果。

detailed_translations.english: not yet decided or settled

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…期间；直到…时为止；在等待…之际
detailed_translations.english: while waiting for something, or until something happens

name: resolve
trans: v. 解决（问题或困难）；决定，下定决心；作出决议，表决；分解，转化；（使）（症状、病情）消散，消退；解析，解离；分析；（不协和音）转向协和；（当远处物体看得更清楚时）变成；（光学仪器等）分辨；辨析（图表或光谱峰值） n. <正式>决心，坚定的信念；<美>正式决定，决议；决定要做的事

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: resolved
trans: adj. 下定决心的，坚决的 v. 解决；决定；（立法机构等）表决；分解；使（病症）消退；使（不协和音）转向协和音；（当远处物体看得更清楚时）变成；（光学仪器等）分辨（resolve 的过去式和过去分词）

name: determine
trans: v. 决定，控制；查明，确定；下定决心；判决，裁定；求出，解出；限定；<古>终止

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to determine the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员仍在设法弄清失火的原因。

detailed_translations.english: to find out the facts about something

name: determination
trans: n. 决心，坚定；决定，裁定；测定，确定；<法律>（财产权、利息的）终止

sentences.english: his dogged determination (= very strong determination ) to succeed
sentences.chinese: 他想要成功的坚定决心

detailed_translations.english: the quality of trying to do something even when it is difficult

name: discretion
trans: n. 自行决定权，判断力；谨慎，慎重

sentences.english: British newspapers no longer feel they must treat the royal family with discretion.
sentences.chinese: 英国报界不再觉得他们非得审慎对待王室不可了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自由裁量权；谨慎；判断力；判定；考虑周到
detailed_translations.english: the ability to deal with situations in a way that does not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell any of their secrets

name: decide
trans: v. 影响（或决定）……的结果；断定，判定；使下决心；决定，选定；裁决，判决

sentences.english: Has anything been decided yet?
sentences.chinese: 已经作出什么决定了吗？

sentences.english: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
sentences.chinese: 受训者自行选择课程。

sentences.english: After a long discussion, they decided in favour of (= chose ) the older applicant.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间的讨论，他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。

detailed_translations.english: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

name: deem
trans: v. 认为，相信

sentences.english: French and German were deemed essential.
sentences.chinese: 法语和德语被认为是必需的。

detailed_translations.english: to think of something in a particular way or as having a particular quality

name: vindicate
trans: vt. 维护；证明……无辜；证明……正确

sentences.english: The charges are false, and we are sure we will be vindicated in court.
sentences.chinese: 指控不实，我们确信法庭会证明我们是无辜的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 维护；证明…无辜；证明…正确
detailed_translations.english: to prove that someone who was blamed for something is in fact not guilty

name: discern
trans: v. （艰难地或努力地）看出，觉察出；了解，认识

sentences.english: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一大串数据才能认清这一趋势。

sentences.english: We could just discern a town in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

name: assert
trans: v. 坚称，断言；维护，坚持（权利或权威）；坚持自己的主张，表现坚定；生效，起作用

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: conclude
trans: v. 断定，推断出；结束，终止；达成，做成，完成；<美>决定

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

name: affirm
trans: v. 断言，证实； 宣称拥护，支持；认可（判决，协议），批准；不宣誓而提供正式证词；给予（某人）情感支持（或鼓励）

sentences.english: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

name: breakdown
trans: n. （汽车或机器的）故障，损坏；（关系的）破裂，（系统的）瘫痪；精神崩溃，（健康、体力等的）衰竭；细目，分类；分解；跺脚曳步舞

sentences.english: A sudden rise in oil prices could lead to a breakdown of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 油价暴涨会导致经济崩溃。

sentences.english: The breakdown of the negotiations was not unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 谈判的失败是预料之中的事。

detailed_translations.english: a failure of a relationship, discussion or system

name: collapse
trans: v. 倒塌，塌下；崩溃，瓦解；突然倒下，昏倒；瘫倒；突然贬值，暴跌；萎陷，瘪掉；折叠 n. 倒塌，塌陷；突然失败，崩溃；病倒，垮掉；突然贬值，暴跌

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: breach
trans: n. 违反，破坏；（关系）中断，终止；缺口 v. 违反，破坏；在……上打开缺口

sentences.english: The congressman was accused of a breach of secrecy rules.
sentences.chinese: 这个国会议员被指控违反保密条例。

detailed_translations.english: an action that breaks a law, rule, or agreement
to break a law, rule, or agreement

name: shatter
trans: v. （使）破碎，碎裂；破坏，摧毁（抽象物）；使极为惊愕难过，给予极大打击 n. 碎片；受到极大打击的状态

sentences.english: The explosion shattered the building.
sentences.chinese: 这次爆炸把大楼炸成一片废墟。

sentences.english: A tragic accident shattered her dreams of Olympic glory.
sentences.chinese: 一场不幸的意外事故使她获得奥运奖牌的梦想破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way

name: scrap
trans: n. （纸、布等的）碎片，小块；丝毫，一丁点；废品，废弃材料（=scrap metal）；吃剩的东西，残羹剩饭（scraps）；<非正式>小摩擦，小口角；<英，非正式>极瘦小的人（常指小孩） v. （因不切实际而）放弃，抛弃（计划、体系）；把（旧机器、旧汽车等当）作废料处理，报废；<非正式>打架，吵架；激烈竞争 adj. （金属、纸张）废弃的，报废的；零碎的

sentences.english: He’s always getting into scraps with other dogs.
sentences.chinese: 它老是和别的狗打起来。

sentences.english: There's always tons of scrap paper in Dad's office.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸的办公室里总有大量的废纸。

detailed_translations.english: a short fight or argument
Scrap metal or paper is no longer wanted for its original purpose, but may have some other use

name: fragment
trans: n. 碎片；片段；残存部分 v. （使）破碎，分裂

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

name: fracture
trans: n. 破裂，断裂；骨折；（尤指岩层的）裂缝，裂痕；（语音）元音割裂；由单元音割裂成的复合元音 v. 破裂，折断；瓦解，分裂；毁坏，破坏；违反，越出……范围

sentences.english: a stress fracture in his left knee
sentences.chinese: 他左膝上的应力性骨折

sentences.english: a hairline fracture
sentences.chinese: 细小的裂缝

sentences.english: The immense pressure causes the rock to fracture.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的压力造成岩石断裂。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or broken part in a bone or other hard substance
if a bone or other hard substance fractures, or if it is fractured, it breaks or cracks

name: rupture
trans: n. （体内组织等的）破裂；（管道等的）断裂；疝气；（关系的）决裂 v. （使体内组织等）破裂；使（器官）破裂，形成疝（be ruptured/rupture oneself）；（使容器或管道等）断裂；使（关系）破裂

sentences.english: The pipe will rupture at its weakest point.
sentences.chinese: 管道最薄弱的地方会破裂的。

sentences.english: His liver was ruptured when a brick wall collapsed on him.
sentences.chinese: 一堵砖墙坍塌压住了他，导致他的肝脏破裂。

detailed_translations.english: to break or burst, or to make something break or burst
an occasion when something suddenly breaks apart or bursts

name: crumble
trans: v. 崩裂，坍塌；（使）粉碎，（使）成碎屑；瓦解，崩溃；不再抵抗，无力应付 n. <英>酥皮水果甜点心； <美>碎屑；<英>（经烹调用作水果浇头的）脂质面包屑

sentences.english: The fall leaves crumbled in my fingers.
sentences.chinese: 秋叶在我指间碎裂了。

sentences.english: 1/4 cup crumbled goat’s cheese
sentences.chinese: 四分之一杯山羊奶酪碎

detailed_translations.english: to break apart into lots of little pieces, or make something do this

name: squash
trans: v. 压扁，压碎；（使）挤进，（把……）塞进；打断，制止，去除；控制，抑制（情绪） n. （软式）墙网球，壁球；<英>果汁饮料；南瓜属植物（如南瓜）；拥挤的环境（或处所）；（生）（供显微镜观察用的）软化组织薄片，压片；咯吱声

sentences.english: Her suggestions were always squashed.
sentences.chinese: 她的建 议总是受到压制。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power or authority to stop something

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁球；挤压；咯吱声；南瓜属植物；（英）果汁饮料
detailed_translations.english: a game played by two people who use  rackets  to hit a small rubber ball against the walls of a square court

name: crash
trans: v. 撞车，坠毁；猛撞，发出巨响；破产，倒闭，暴跌；（计算机）瘫痪，死机；（在体育比赛中）惨败；过夜，入睡；心脏停止跳动；不请自来，偷偷混入（派对）；闯红灯 n. 撞车事故，失事；巨响，碰撞声；（计算机）瘫痪，死机；破产，暴跌；（做毛巾、窗帘等用的）粗布 adj. 应急的，速成的 adv. 哗啦一声地

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.english: The plates went crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

sentences.english: A large branch came crashing down .
sentences.chinese: 一根大树枝啪啦一声掉落下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒下，坠落；发出撞击声；垮台，破产
detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone extremely hard while moving, in a way that causes a lot of damage or makes a lot of noise
to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

name: ravage
trans: v. 毁坏，破坏，劫掠 n. 蹂躏，大破坏

sentences.english: a country ravaged by civil war
sentences.chinese: 遭受内战重创的国家

sentences.english: His health was gradually ravaged by drink and drugs.
sentences.chinese: 酗酒和吸毒渐渐毁了他的健康。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something very badly

name: raze
trans: vt. 夷为平地；破坏；消除；拆毁 n. （Raze）人名；（法）拉兹

sentences.english: In 1162 Milan was razed to the ground by imperial troops.
sentences.chinese: 1162年米兰被帝国军队夷为平地。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夷为平地；破坏；消除；拆毁
detailed_translations.english: to completely destroy a town or building

name: demolish
trans: vt. 拆毁，拆除（建筑物）；（意外）毁坏，破坏；推翻，驳倒（观点或理论）；<非正式>轻易击败，完胜；<非正式>狼吞虎咽地吃，很快吃光；伤害（感情），破坏（计划）

sentences.english: The entire east wing of the building was demolished in the fire.
sentences.chinese: 大楼的整个东翼都被大火烧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: to completely destroy a building

name: disfigure
trans: vt. 使变丑；损毁……的外形；使大为减色

sentences.english: His face had been disfigured in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 在一次意外事故中他毁了容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使变丑；损毁…的外形；使大为减色
detailed_translations.english: to spoil the appearance that something naturally has

name: frustrate
trans: v. 使懊恼，使沮丧；挫败，阻挠；受挫 adj. <古>痛苦的，受挫的

sentences.english: Their attempts to speak to him were frustrated by the guards.
sentences.chinese: 他们想跟他说话，但被警卫拦住了。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone’s plans, efforts, or attempts from succeeding

name: smash
trans: v. 打碎，（使）粉碎；（使）猛击，（使）猛撞；（用力）撞开，闯过；击溃，使结束；撞毁，撞坏（交通工具）；（网球等比赛中）扣球，打高压球；（轻松）打破（记录） n. 猛烈撞击声，破碎时的哗啦声；猛击；<英，非正式>撞车，车祸；（网球运动中的）高压球，扣球；<非正式>大获成功的歌曲（或戏剧、电影）（=smash hit）；（由白兰地、果味水和冰混合调制的）斯马喜（混合烈酒）饮料；<非正式，旧>破产，投资失败 adv. 哗啦一声 adj. 非常轰动的，出色的

sentences.english: Vandals had smashed all the windows.
sentences.chinese: 破坏分子打碎了所有的窗子。

sentences.english: Firemen had to smash the lock to get in.
sentences.chinese: 消防员不得不砸锁而入。

sentences.english: Several cups fell to the floor and smashed to pieces .
sentences.chinese: 有几个杯子掉到地上摔得粉碎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粉碎，打烂；狠打，猛击；破灭，失败；猛撞，猛冲
detailed_translations.english: to break into pieces violently or noisily, or to make something do this by dropping, throwing, or hitting it

detailed_translations.chinese: 破碎 ； 猛击， 猛撞； 轰动的演出， 巨大的成功
detailed_translations.english: the loud sound of something breaking

name: devastate
trans: v. 毁坏，破坏；使极度震惊，使伤心欲绝

sentences.english: The city centre was devastated by the bomb.
sentences.chinese: 市中心被这枚炸弹摧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something very badly or completely

name: devastation
trans: n. 毁坏，破坏；荒废

sentences.english: The war brought massive devastation and loss of life to the region.
sentences.chinese: 战争给该地区造成巨大的破坏以及生命的丧失。

detailed_translations.english: Devastation is severe and widespread destruction or damage

name: disrupt
trans: v. 中断，扰乱；彻底改变（某物）的结构，使（某物）的结构破裂；使瓦解，使分裂

sentences.english: Traffic was disrupted by a hoax bomb.
sentences.chinese: 有人虚报有炸弹，造成了交通混乱。

sentences.english: Climate change could disrupt the agricultural economy.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化可能给农业经济带来不良影响。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from continuing in its usual way by causing problems

name: mangle
trans: vt. 乱砍；轧布；损坏 n. 轧布机 n. （Mangle）人名；（英）曼格尔

sentences.english: His body was crushed and mangled beyond recognition.
sentences.chinese: 他的身体被轧得血肉模糊而无法辨认。

detailed_translations.chinese: 毁坏， 毁损； 损坏
detailed_translations.english: If a physical object is mangled, it is crushed or twisted very forcefully, so that it is difficult to see what its original shape was

name: spoil
trans: v. 破坏，糟蹋；溺爱，宠坏；善待，格外关照；（食物）变质，腐败；使（选票）作废；极度渴望，跃跃欲试；<古>抢劫（人，地方），掠夺 n. 赃物，战利品（the spoils）；成功所带来的好处（spoils）；（开掘时挖出的）废土，废泥土

sentences.english: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.chinese: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.english: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.english: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.chinese: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.english: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

detailed_translations.english: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

name: engulf
trans: v. 吞没，淹没；使陷入（某种思绪或情绪）；狼吞虎咽

sentences.english: despair so great it threatened to engulf him
sentences.chinese: 几乎要将他压垮的绝望情绪

detailed_translations.english: if an unpleasant feeling engulfs you, you feel it very strongly

name: devour
trans: v. 狼吞虎咽地吃；如饥似渴地阅读，热切地看；吞噬，毁灭；充满（感情）

sentences.english: Her body had been almost entirely devoured by the disease.
sentences.chinese: 她的身体几乎完全被疾病摧毁。

detailed_translations.english: to destroy someone or something

name: crumple
trans: vt. 弄皱；使一蹶不振 vi. 起皱；倒坍；一蹶不振 n. 皱纹；褶皱

sentences.english: She crumpled the paper in her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她把手中的纸揉成了一团。

sentences.english: She crumpled up her coffee cup.
sentences.chinese: 她挤瘪了咖啡杯。

detailed_translations.english: If you crumple something such as paper or cloth, or if it crumples, it is squashed and becomes full of untidy creases and folds
Crumple up means the same as

name: crush
trans: v. 压坏，挤压变形；捣碎，碾成粉末；把……挤入，将……塞进（狭小的空间内）；（使）变皱，起皱；制服，镇压；使心烦意乱，使消沉 n. 拥挤的人群；（对某人短暂的）热恋，迷恋；迷恋对象；果汁饮料；（牛，羊的）分群栏

sentences.english: His leg was crushed in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 他的腿在事故中被压断。

sentences.english: Two people were crushed to death in the rush to escape.
sentences.chinese: 两个人在逃生过程中被踩死。

detailed_translations.english: to press something so hard that it breaks or is damaged

name: disintegration
trans: n. 分裂，解体；蜕变，衰变

sentences.english: Is it the first signal of relationship disintegration?
sentences.chinese: 这是关系瓦解的第一个讯号吗？

sentences.english: The act or an instance of breaking up, as a division, dispersal, or disintegration.
sentences.chinese: 分散，分离分离的行为或实例，如分裂、分散或分解。

sentences.english: The total collapse of the Iron Curtain and the Berlin Wall came in 1989-1990, but the disintegration externally and internally started during my Administration.
sentences.chinese: 铁幕政策和柏林墙的全线坍塌发生在1989年到1990年，但是我执政期间就已经开始内在和外在的瓦解。

name: rift
trans: n. （人际关系）不和，分歧；裂缝，裂口；地堑，裂谷 v. 开裂，断裂；使断裂，使开裂

sentences.english: The interview reflected a growing rift between the president and Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这次会见反映出总统与国会间日益加深的不和。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or narrow opening in a large mass of rock, cloud etc

name: ruins
trans: n. 遗迹（ruin 的复数形式）；废墟 v. 毁灭（ruin 的三单形式）

name: compulsive
trans: adj. 难以抑制的，不能自拔的；引人入胜的

name: pressure
trans: n. 压力，挤压；（气体或液体形成的）压力，压强；心理压力，紧张；催促，要求；气压 v. 对……施加压力，强迫；使……增压

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: tease
trans: v. 取笑，嘲笑；逗弄（动物）；（尤指性方面）挑逗，撩拨；哄，逗；拨，分离；梳理（羊毛、头发等）；<美>（为了使头发显厚）回梳 n. 爱开玩笑的人，爱戏弄别人的人；玩笑，戏弄；卖弄风骚的人；<非正式>激起兴趣的广告

sentences.english: Don’t get upset. I was only teasing .
sentences.chinese: 别生气，我只是在逗你玩。

sentences.english: He used to tease her mercilessly .
sentences.chinese: 他过去总是无情地取笑她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取笑；戏弄；梳理；欺负；强求；使起毛
detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩
detailed_translations.english: someone who enjoys making jokes at people, and embarrassing them, especially in a friendly way

name: compel
trans: v. 强迫，迫使；使发生，促使；<文>驱赶

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

name: constrain
trans: v. 限制，约束；强迫，迫使

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

name: accelerate
trans: v. （使）加快，促进；（车辆或驾驶者）加速

sentences.english: measures to accelerate the rate of economic growth
sentences.chinese: 加快经济增长速度的措施

detailed_translations.english: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

name: laborious
trans: adj. 耗时费力的，辛苦的；（尤指讲话，写作风格）造作的，不流畅的

sentences.english: the laborious business of drying the crops
sentences.chinese: 把收获的庄稼晒干这一艰苦的工作

detailed_translations.english: taking a lot of time and effort

name: industrious
trans: adj. 勤劳的，勤奋的

sentences.english: She was an industrious and willing worker.
sentences.chinese: 她是个勤劳肯干的工人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is industrious works hard

name: assiduous
trans: adj. 刻苦的，勤勉的

sentences.english: Podulski had been assiduous in learning his adopted language.
sentences.chinese: 珀杜斯基曾经勤奋地学习他所选的外语。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is assiduous works hard or does things very thoroughly

name: diligent
trans: adj. 勤奋的，勤勉的；细致的，潜心的

sentences.english: a diligent student
sentences.chinese: 勤勉的学生

detailed_translations.chinese: 勤勉的；用功的，费尽心血的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is diligent works hard and is careful and thorough

name: serious
trans: adj. 严重的，危急的；认真的，严肃的；重要的，须重视的；（音乐、文学等艺术）严肃的；（人）庄重的，严肃的；<非正式>大量的，极多的；（恋爱中）态度认真的；极感兴趣的，热衷的；<非正式>很好的，质优价高的

sentences.english: the serious problem of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 严重的失业问题

sentences.english: Luckily, the damage was not serious.
sentences.chinese: 还好，损坏不算严重。

sentences.english: Serious crimes have increased dramatically.
sentences.chinese: 重大犯罪案件大幅度增加了。

sentences.english: Oil spills pose a serious threat to marine life.
sentences.chinese: 原油泄漏对海洋生物构成了严重威胁。

sentences.english: The president was in serious trouble .
sentences.chinese: 总统遇到大麻烦了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，严重的；认真的；庄重的；危急的
detailed_translations.english: a serious situation, problem, accident etc is extremely bad or dangerous

name: cordial
trans: adj. 热情友好的；感觉强烈的，由衷的 n. <英>甜果汁饮料；<美>烈性甜酒；镇定药，不太难吃的药

sentences.english: The talks were conducted in a cordial atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 会谈在友好的气氛中进行。

detailed_translations.english: friendly but quite polite and formal

name: deliberate
trans: adj. 故意的，蓄意的；从容的，小心翼翼的；深思熟虑的 v. 仔细考虑，认真商讨

sentences.english: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
sentences.chinese: 对她的故意羞辱

sentences.english: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的
detailed_translations.english: intended or planned
to think about something very carefully

name: attempt
trans: v. 努力，尝试 n. 试图，努力；企图杀害；（运动员创造记录的）尝试，冲击

sentences.english: Weather conditions prevented them from attempting the jump.
sentences.chinese: 天气状况使他们无法尝试跳伞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尝试， 试图， 努力
detailed_translations.english: to try to do something, especially something difficult

name: effort
trans: n. 努力，艰难的尝试；力气，精力；有组织的活动；努力的结果，成就；努力的结果，成就

sentences.english: Lou lifted the box easily, without using much effort.
sentences.chinese: 卢没费多大力气就把箱子搬了起来。

sentences.english: Frank put a lot of effort into the party.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克办这次聚会花了不少精力。

sentences.english: Learning to speak another language takes effort.
sentences.chinese: 学说外语要下功夫。

sentences.english: I'm afraid this essay is a poor effort.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，这篇文章写得不好。

detailed_translations.english: the physical or mental energy that you need to do sth; sth that takes a lot of energy

name: endeavor
trans: n. 努力；尽力（等于 endeavour） vi. 努力；尽力（等于 endeavour） vt. 努力；尽力（等于 endeavour）

sentences.english: We always endeavor to please our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

sentences.english: an outstanding example of human endeavor
sentences.chinese: 人类努力进取的突出例证

detailed_translations.english: to try very hard
an attempt to do something new or difficult

name: strive
trans: v. 努力，力争；斗争，反抗

sentences.english: I was still striving to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在努力争取成功。

sentences.english: We must continue to strive for greater efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须继续为提高效率而努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make a great effort to achieve something

name: reluctant
trans: adj. 勉强的，不情愿的

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

name: tolerate
trans: v. 容许，允许（不同意或不喜欢的事物）；忍受，包容；（对药物、毒品或环境状况）有耐力，耐受；敷衍，应付

sentences.english: We simply will not tolerate vigilante groups on our streets.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不容许有自行惩办犯罪的组织出现在我们的街头。

sentences.english: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为是不能容许的。

detailed_translations.english: to allow people to do, say, or believe something without criticizing or punishing them

name: tolerable
trans: adj. 尚好的，还可以的；可接受的，可忍受的

sentences.english: The heat in this room is barely tolerable.
sentences.chinese: 这房间里热得让人要受不了了。

detailed_translations.english: unpleasant or painful and only just able to be accepted

name: insufferable
trans: adj. 难以忍受的；不可忍受的；令人厌恶的

name: undergo
trans: v. 经历，经受

sentences.english: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: stand
trans: v. 站立，直立；起立，站起来；使直立，竖放；位于（某处或某位置）；高度为，高达；处于（某种状态）；停，停靠；停滞，不流动，放着不动；很可能会；持有（某种态度或看法）；达特定水平（或数量、高度等）；保持有效，维持不变；忍受，容忍；经得起，经受；请（某人吃饭、喝酒）；竞选，当候选人；（建筑物等）没有倒塌，依然矗立；走，迈（一小步）；具有……地位，排在第……位；（不小心）踩到；承担……职责；担任（板球赛）裁判员；（牡马）可作种马；（船）保持特定航向 n. 架，座，台；立场，见解；货摊，售货亭；反抗，抵抗；（体育场的）看台；摊位，展台；证人席；（在一局板球赛中两个击球员的）坚守时间，总计得分；出租车站，公共汽车站；林分；<南非>地块；舞台，讲台，演奏台；通常站立（或坐）的位置；停止，停住；巡回演出停留点；（水位几乎不变时的）高潮，低潮；<罕>一群猎鸟

sentences.english: It looks like we’ll have to stand – there are no seats left.
sentences.chinese: 看来我们只能站着——没有座位了。

sentences.english: She stood in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 她站在门口。

sentences.english: (= do not move ) and listen to me.
sentences.chinese: 站好别动，听我说。

sentences.english: Don’t just stand there (= stand and not do anything ) – help me!
sentences.chinese: 不要光站在那里，帮帮我！

detailed_translations.english: to support yourself on your feet or be in an upright position
used to say that you do not like someone or something at all, or that you think that something is extremely unpleasant
a piece of furniture or equipment used to hold or support something

name: endure
trans: v. 持续存在，持久；忍受，忍耐

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: abide
trans: v. 遵守（abide by）；容忍，忍受；<旧>居住，逗留；（感情，记忆）始终不渝，持续

sentences.english: I can't abide people with no sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌和没有幽默感的人打交道。

sentences.english: You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
sentences.chinese: 你必须遵守俱乐部的规定。

detailed_translations.english: bear, stand

name: permit
trans: v. 批准，许可；（使）成为可能；破例做，放纵 n. 执照，许可证；古氏鲳鲹

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
an official written statement giving you the right to do something

name: permissible
trans: adj. 允许的，许可的

sentences.english: the maximum permissible level of radiation
sentences.chinese: 允许的最大辐射水平

detailed_translations.english: allowed by law or by the rules

name: permissive
trans: adj. 放任的，纵容的；<法律>允许而非强制的，可选择的；（生）允许的，许可的；（道路）公众获准可使用的

sentences.english: parents who are too permissive
sentences.chinese: 太过放任的父母

sentences.english: a permissive society
sentences.chinese: 放纵的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 许可的；自由的；宽容的；（两性关系）放纵的
detailed_translations.english: not strict, and allowing behaviour that many other people would disapprove of

name: tacit
trans: adj. 心照不宣的，不言而喻的，默示的

sentences.english: a tacit agreement between the three big companies
sentences.chinese: 三家大公司之间的默契

detailed_translations.chinese: 缄默的；不言而喻的；心照不宣的；默许的
detailed_translations.english: tacit agreement, approval, support etc is given without anything actually being said

name: reception
trans: n. 接待处，服务台；欢迎会，招待会；欢迎，反响；（收音机或电视信号）接收效果，接收质量；接收，接待；（美橄）接球；<英>（幼儿学校的）小班，学前班

sentences.english: She was unsure of her reception after everything that had happened.
sentences.chinese: 发生了这些事后，她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

sentences.english: The plans received a mixed reception from unions (= some people liked them, others did not ) .
sentences.chinese: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc

name: connive
trans: vi. 共谋；纵容；默许

sentences.english: He accused them of conniving with foreign companies to weaken employment rights.
sentences.chinese: 他指控他们与外国公司共谋来削弱雇用权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 默许； 纵容； 共谋
detailed_translations.english: to not try to stop something wrong from happening

name: connivance
trans: n. 纵容；默许；假装不见

name: concede
trans: v. （通常指不情愿地）承认；认（输），承认（失败）；授予，让与；让对手得分

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: concession
trans: n. 让步，妥协；特许权；<英>优惠价，减价；商铺；小摊卖的东西；认输

sentences.english: The British were not prepared to make any concessions .
sentences.chinese: 英国人没有打算作出让步。

sentences.english: the import/export concessions that had been granted to the island
sentences.chinese: 同意给该岛的进出口特许权

detailed_translations.english: something that you allow someone to have in order to end an argument or a disagreement

name: recognize
trans: v. 认识，辨别出；承认，意识到；（正式或在法律上）认可，承认；赞赏，公认；表扬，表彰；（会议或辩论主席）邀请……发言；（计算机等）自动识别（声音、印刷字体等）

sentences.english: I didn’t recognize you in your uniform.
sentences.chinese: 你穿上制服我认不出你了。

sentences.english: It was malaria, but Dr Lee hadn’t recognized the symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 这是疟疾，但李医生没有认出症状。

sentences.english: One must recognise that homesickness is natural.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须承认思乡是正常的。

detailed_translations.english: to know who someone is or what something is, because you have seen, heard, experienced, or learned about them in the past

name: recognition
trans: n. 承认，接受；表彰，赞誉；认出，识别；（政府对他国的）外交认可

sentences.english: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
sentences.chinese: 他盯着她看，但似乎没认出她来。

detailed_translations.english: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past

name: nod
trans: v. 打盹，打瞌睡；上下晃动；（足球中）顶（球）；一时疏忽；点头，点头示意 n. 点头，点头同意；被选中，得到许可；打盹；摆动

sentences.english: The woman greeted us with a nod of the head.
sentences.chinese: 那个女人向我们点点头打招呼。

sentences.english: I showed the doorman my card and he gave a friendly nod.
sentences.chinese: 我向门卫出示了卡片，他友善地点了点头。

detailed_translations.english: an act of nodding
to move your head up and down, especially in order to show agreement or understanding

name: confess
trans: v. 供认，招供；承认，坦白；忏悔，告解；聆听忏悔

sentences.english: Occasionally people confess to crimes they haven’t committed just to get attention.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔人们会承认自己并未犯过的罪行，那只是为了引人注意。

sentences.english: Torture was used and Fian confessed.
sentences.chinese: 酷刑用过之后菲安就招供了。

detailed_translations.english: to admit, especially to the police, that you have done something wrong or illegal

name: approve
trans: v. 同意，赞成；批准，通过；核准；喜欢，赞赏；<古>证明，显示；使（废品或公共土地）升值

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

name: comply
trans: v. 遵从，服从；（商品）符合特定标准

sentences.english: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说过部队会遵从停火协议。
