sentences.english: Some beaches had failed to comply with environmental regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一些海滩没能遵守环保规定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

name: concur
trans: v. 同意，赞同；（事件）同时发生

sentences.english: And so, a lot of people see this as a sort of … or create a scenario, an Orwellian scenario, a Big Brother type scenario but I don't concur.
sentences.chinese: 所以，大多数人会把这个现象视为一种……或者说创作一幕剧情，一幕奥威尔式或是“老大哥”式的剧情，但是我并不同意这样的看法。

detailed_translations.english: to agree with someone or have the same opinion as them

name: avow
trans: vt. 承认；公开宣称；坦率承认

sentences.english: He avowed his commitment to Marxist ideals.
sentences.chinese: 他宣称对马克思主义理想矢志不渝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；公开宣称；坦率承认
detailed_translations.english: to make a public statement about something you believe in

name: ratify
trans: v. 批准，正式签署

sentences.english: The parliaments of Australia and Indonesia have yet to ratify the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚和印度尼西亚议会还未批准该条约。

detailed_translations.english: to make a written agreement official by signing it

name: guarantee
trans: v. 确保，保证；担保，为……作保；保修，包换 n. 保证，担保；保修单，质量保证书；担保金，抵押品

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: endorse
trans: v. （公开）赞同，认可；（在广告中对某种产品）宣传，吹捧；（尤指在支票背面）签名，背书；(在驾驶执照上)记录违章事项

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

name: corroborate
trans: vt. 证实；使坚固

sentences.english: We now have new evidence to corroborate the defendant’s story.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在有新的证据来证实被告人的说法。

sentences.english: Experiments elsewhere corroborate these results.
sentences.chinese: 其他地方的试验也证实了这些结果。

detailed_translations.english: to provide information that supports or helps to prove someone else’s statement, idea etc

name: grant
trans: v. 授予，给予；承认 n. 补助金，拨款；（政府给予的）土地；<正式>给予，授予；合法转让

sentences.english: Britain could grant Spain’s request .
sentences.chinese: 英国可能会同意西班牙的请求。

sentences.english: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
sentences.chinese: 我很希望能够满足她的愿望。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for

name: admit
trans: v. （勉强）承认；招认，招供；准许进入（某处）；接纳，接收（入学）；收治，接收入院；承认……有效；容许，为……留有余地

sentences.english: ‘Okay, so maybe I was a little bit scared,’ Jenny admitted.
sentences.chinese: “行了，也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

sentences.english: I must admit , I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

sentences.english: Admit it! I’m right, aren’t I?
sentences.chinese: 承认吧！我对了，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

name: acknowledge
trans: v. 承认；认可； 跟……打招呼，理会；告知收到；（公开）感谢

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: affirm
trans: v. 断言，证实； 宣称拥护，支持；认可（判决，协议），批准；不宣誓而提供正式证词；给予（某人）情感支持（或鼓励）

sentences.english: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

name: pardon
trans: n. 赦免；宽恕，原谅；（中世纪欧洲出售的）赎罪券，赦罪符 v. 赦免；宽恕，原谅；免除（债务）；请原谅（表示礼貌，用于所问或所说的话有可能被认为无礼时） int. （用于请求别人重复某事）什么，请再说一遍；对不起，不好意思（发出不雅声音之后的道歉用语）；你说什么？（表示惊讶或者受到冒犯）

sentences.english: He craved the teacher's pardon.
sentences.chinese: 他恳求老师原谅他。

sentences.english: I earnestly pray for your pardon.
sentences.chinese: 我恳切地请求你原谅。

sentences.english: I hope you will pardon me for doing so.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你原谅我这样做。

detailed_translations.english: to forgive someone for behaving badly
used to say ‘sorry’ after you have made an impolite sound such as a  burp

name: innocent
trans: adj. 天真的，幼稚的；清白的，无罪的；无辜受害的；没有恶意的，无冒犯之意的 n. 天真无邪的人，幼稚的人；无辜的受害者（尤指犯罪或战争的受害者）

sentences.english: Nobody would believe that I was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 没人肯相信我是清白的。

sentences.english: The court found him innocent and he was released.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判他无罪，他被释放了。

sentences.english: She had always regarded Greg as a hopeless innocent where women were concerned.
sentences.chinese: 她过去一直认为格雷格在关于女人方面是一个不可救药的无知者。

detailed_translations.english: not guilty of a crime
An innocent is someone who is innocent

name: regardless
trans: adv. 不顾，不加理会；不管怎样，无论如何 adj. 不管的，不注意的

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

name: heedless
trans: adj. 不注意的；不留心的

sentences.english: O’Hara rode on, heedless of danger.
sentences.chinese: 奥哈拉不理会危险，继续骑马前行。

detailed_translations.english: not paying attention to something

name: erroneous
trans: adj. 错误的，不正确的

sentences.english: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

detailed_translations.english: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

name: neglect
trans: v. 疏于照顾，未予看管；不予重视，忽视；漏做 n. 忽略，忽视，未被重视

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: negligent
trans: adj. 疏忽的，玩忽职守的，失职的；<文>放松的，随便的，不拘谨的

sentences.english: Mr Brown was found guilty of negligent driving.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生被判疏忽驾驶罪。

detailed_translations.english: not taking enough care over something that you are responsible for, with the result that serious mistakes are made

name: negligence
trans: n. 疏忽，大意；<法律>玩忽职守

sentences.english: negligence in carrying out safety procedures
sentences.chinese: 执行安全程序时的疏忽

sentences.english: The bridge’s architect was sued for criminal negligence.
sentences.chinese: 那座桥梁的建筑师被控犯有玩忽职守罪。

detailed_translations.english: failure to take enough care over something that you are responsible for

name: ridiculous
trans: adj. 可笑的，荒谬的

sentences.english: That’s a ridiculous idea!
sentences.chinese: 那主意很荒唐！

sentences.english: Don’t be ridiculous!
sentences.chinese: 别傻了！

sentences.english: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
sentences.chinese: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

detailed_translations.english: very silly or unreasonable

name: slovenly
trans: adj. 懒散的；不整洁的；马虎的 adv. 邋遢地；马虎地；不整洁地

sentences.english: slovenly habits
sentences.chinese: 邋里邋遢的习惯

sentences.english: a large slovenly woman
sentences.chinese: 一个身材高大、不修边幅的女人

sentences.english: a slovenly way of speaking
sentences.chinese: 随便的说话方式

detailed_translations.chinese: 懒散的；不整洁的；马虎的
detailed_translations.english: lazy, untidy, and careless

detailed_translations.chinese: 邋遢地；马虎地；不整洁地

name: credulous
trans: adj. 轻信的；因轻信而产生的

sentences.english: Quinn charmed credulous investors out of millions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 奎因花言巧语从轻信的投资者那里骗取了数百万美元。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻信的；因轻信而产生的
detailed_translations.english: always believing what you are told, and therefore easily deceived

name: useless
trans: adj. 无用的，无价值的；差劲的，无能的；无效的，徒劳的；（身体一部分或心智因有病或受到损害而）丧失功能的

sentences.english: The editor killed a few useless lines.
sentences.chinese: 编辑删掉了几行无用的文字。

sentences.english: Please cancel the words which are useless.
sentences.chinese: 请把无用的词划掉。

sentences.english: They wrote his suggestion off as a useless idea.
sentences.chinese: 他们把他的建议看做是无用的想法。

name: futile
trans: adj. 徒劳的，无用的；不重要的；没有出息的

sentences.english: My efforts to go back to sleep proved futile.
sentences.chinese: 我努力想再次入睡，但怎么也睡不着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无用的；无效的；没有出息的；琐细的；不重要的
detailed_translations.english: actions that are futile are useless because they have no chance of being successful

name: offhand
trans: adj. 随便的；即时的；无准备的；即席的 adv. 随便地；即席地；即时地

sentences.english: She said you were a bit offhand with her this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 她说你今天下午对她有点敷衍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 随便的；即时的；无准备的；即席的

name: fallible
trans: adj. 易犯错误的；不可靠的

sentences.english: Humans are fallible.
sentences.chinese: 人孰无过。

sentences.english: These surveys are often a rather fallible guide to public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 这些调查往往会对舆论产生误导。

detailed_translations.english: able to make mistakes or be wrong

name: defect
trans: n. 缺点，缺陷，毛病 v. 背叛，叛变

sentences.english: All the cars are tested for defects before they leave the factory.
sentences.chinese: 所有汽车在出厂前都经过品质检验。

sentences.english: a genetic defect
sentences.chinese: 遗传缺陷

detailed_translations.english: a fault or a lack of something that means that something or someone is not perfect
to leave your own country or group in order to go to or join an opposing one

name: defective
trans: adj. 有问题的，有缺陷的；（词）不完全变化的 n. 有缺陷的人

sentences.english: The disease is caused by a defective gene.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病是由缺陷基因引起的。

sentences.english: defective products
sentences.chinese: 残次品

detailed_translations.english: not made properly, or not working properly

detailed_translations.chinese: 有缺陷的人；不完全变化词

name: drawback
trans: n. 缺点，不利条件；出口退税

sentences.english: It’s a great city – the only drawback is the weather.
sentences.chinese: 这是座很不错的城市，唯一的不足就是天气。

detailed_translations.english: a disadvantage of a situation, plan, product etc

name: flaw
trans: n. 缺点，缺陷；裂痕，瑕疵 v. 削弱，使失效

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

name: oblivion
trans: n. 遗忘；湮没；赦免

sentences.english: The loser’s name has been consigned to oblivion (= completely forgotten ).
sentences.chinese: 失败者的姓名已湮没无闻。

detailed_translations.english: when something is completely forgotten or no longer important

name: blunder
trans: v. 跌跌撞撞地走，摸索；犯愚蠢的错误，出漏子；误入，不小心陷入（困境） n. 愚蠢的错误，疏忽

sentences.english: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
sentences.chinese: 他们犯了大错，让他做这份工作。

sentences.english: to make a terrible blunder
sentences.chinese: 犯大错

detailed_translations.english: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid
a careless or stupid mistake

name: expire
trans: v. 到期，失效；死亡；呼气，吐气；（任期）届满

sentences.english: My passport expires next week.
sentences.chinese: 我的护照下周就到期了。

sentences.english: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

detailed_translations.english: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

name: overlook
trans: v. 忽视，忽略；（工作、职位、提拔等）不考虑（某人）；（对不良现象等）不予理会，视而不见；眺望，俯瞰；<古>监督；<罕>检查；<古>用邪恶的眼睛施魔法于 n. <美> 居高临下的位置，从高处能看到的景色；眺望

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

name: ignore
trans: v. 佯装未见，不理睬；忽视，对……不予理会；<法律>（因证据不足）驳回（诉讼）

sentences.english: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。

sentences.english: Sam rudely ignored the question.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

name: omit
trans: v. 省去，遗漏；不做，未能做

sentences.english: Please don’t omit any details, no matter how trivial they may seem.
sentences.chinese: 请不要忽略任何细节，不管它多细小。

detailed_translations.english: to not include someone or something, either deliberately or because you forget to do it

name: absurd
trans: adj. 愚蠢的，荒谬的；滑稽可笑的；荒诞派的 n. 荒诞，荒诞的事物 （the absurd）

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

name: abortive
trans: adj. 失败的；流产的；堕胎的

sentences.english: an abortive military coup
sentences.chinese: 一场未遂的军事政变

detailed_translations.english: an abortive action is not successful

name: err
trans: v. 犯错，出错；作恶，犯罪

sentences.english: It’s always best to err on the side of caution.
sentences.chinese: 过于谨慎永远比冒风险强。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯错；做错；犯罪；走上歧途
detailed_translations.english: to be more careful or safe than is necessary, in order to make sure that nothing bad happens

name: consider
trans: v. 考虑，斟酌；认为，视为；体贴，顾及；细看，端详；探讨，讨论

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

name: considerate
trans: adj. 体贴的，考虑周到的；<旧>小心的，谨慎的

sentences.english: He was always kind and considerate.
sentences.chinese: 他总是很善良，为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: always thinking of what other people need or want and being careful not to upset them

name: meditative
trans: adj. 冥想的，沉思的；耽于默想的

name: tender
trans: adj. 温柔的，亲切的；（食物）嫩的，软的；年幼的，未成熟的；（身体部位）易痛的，一触即痛的；（植物）纤弱的，娇嫩的；微妙的，棘手的；（航海）易倾斜的，不稳的 v. <正式>提出，提供；投标；付钱，偿还；出价购买（股票等）；使变脆弱；<古>温柔地对待 n. 投标，投标书；<英>（期货交易中的）交割意向通知书；（尤指挂在火车头后的）煤水车；（在大船和口岸之间载运人或货物的）供应船，补给船；（装有特别设备的）辅助救火车；服务车，辅助车辆；照料人，照管人；<美，非正式>（通常裹有面包屑的）炸鸡块

sentences.english: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
sentences.chinese: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嫩的；脆弱的；疼痛的，一触即痛的；温柔的
detailed_translations.english: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
to formally offer or show something to someone
a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

name: conscious
trans: adj. 意识到的；神志清醒的，有知觉的；关注的；刻意的，慎重的

sentences.english: I became conscious of someone watching me.
sentences.chinese: 我察觉到有人在监视我。

sentences.english: a conscious act of cruelty
sentences.chinese: 有意而为的残暴行径

detailed_translations.english: noticing or realizing something

name: recollection
trans: n. 记忆力，回忆；回忆起的事物（或景象），往事

sentences.english: My earliest recollections are of my mother bending over my cot.
sentences.chinese: 我最早的记忆是母亲俯身站在我的小床前。

detailed_translations.english: something from the past that you remember

name: ruminate
trans: vt. 反刍；沉思；反复思考 vi. 沉思，反刍

sentences.english: One is to see whether you have any worry triggers and to distract yourself when you begin to ruminate.
sentences.chinese: 首先看看你自己是否有担忧的动机，如果当你自己出现“沉思”时，尽量分散自己的注意力。

sentences.english: “Some people prone to ruminate have basic problems pushing things out of consciousness once they get there,” she said.
sentences.chinese: 有些人陷入事情中时，倾向于反刍基本问题来把事情驱逐出脑海。

sentences.english: This is in part because real events can affect us in the real world, and in part because we tend to ruminate about the implications of real-world acts.
sentences.chinese: 原因部分是由于真实事件影响着现实世界中的我们，部分是因为我们倾向反复思考现实世界中行为的影响。

detailed_translations.english: to think carefully and deeply about something

name: speculate
trans: v. 猜测，推测；投机

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: ponder
trans: v. 仔细考虑，琢磨，沉思

sentences.english: He continued to ponder the problem as he walked home.
sentences.chinese: 他一边往家走一边继续思考那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

name: embalm
trans: vt. 铭记于心；使不朽；防腐；使充满香气

sentences.english: His body was embalmed.
sentences.chinese: 他的尸体进行了防腐处理。

detailed_translations.chinese: 铭记于心；使不朽；防腐；使充满香气
detailed_translations.english: to treat a dead body with chemicals, oils etc to prevent it from decaying

name: contemplate
trans: v. 沉思，深思熟虑；盘算，打算；凝视，注视；考虑接受（发生某事的可能性）

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

name: elevate
trans: v. 提拔，提升；抬起，提起；提高，增加；使情绪高昂，使兴高采烈

sentences.english: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.chinese: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.english: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.chinese: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

detailed_translations.english: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

name: recall
trans: v. 记起，回想起；使想起，使想到；召回，叫回（某人）；召回（运动员），使归队； 收回（有问题的产品）；检索，调用（计算机储存的数据）；<美> 罢免；使重新集中注意力；<古> 撤销，废止（行动，决定） n. 记忆力，记性；召回；（因产品有问题的）收回；（将运动员的）召回归队；<美>（请愿后经投票对政府官员的）罢免；回索率，检索率；撤销

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

name: haunt
trans: v. （鬼魂）出没；萦绕在……心头；（长期）困扰；常去（某地） n. 常去的地方；栖息地

sentences.english: The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former landlord.
sentences.chinese: 据说这个酒吧里经常有一位前任房主的鬼魂出没。

detailed_translations.chinese: 常出没于；使苦恼，使担忧；萦绕在心头，缠绕
detailed_translations.english: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often
a place that someone likes to go to often

name: venture
trans: n. 风险项目，冒险事业；冒险旅行，冒险行动 v. 敢于去（未知或危险等地方）；冒险；小心地说，谨慎地做；敢说，大胆表示

sentences.english: business/commercial venture
sentences.chinese: 商业风投

sentences.english: When darkness fell, he would venture out.
sentences.chinese: 天黑以后，他就会壮着胆子出去。

detailed_translations.english: a new business activity that involves taking risks
to go somewhere that could be dangerous

name: risk
trans: n. 危险，风险；危险的人（或事物），隐患；（按风险大小评估的）被保险对象，受贷者；（保险业承保的）险；金融风险 v. 使遭受（失去、毁坏或伤害的）危险；冒......的危险，担......的风险；冒险做，（明知结果而）大胆做

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

name: probe
trans: v. 调查，打探，探究；（用手指、细长工具等）探查，查看；搜寻，探索；侦察，侦探（敌情） n. 探究，详尽调查；（医生和科学家用的）探针； 航天探测器，太空探测器（=space probe）；探测仪，传感器，取样器

sentences.english: a fibre-optic probe
sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.english: The surgeon would pick up his instruments, probe, repair, and stitch up again.
sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

name: explore
trans: v. 探讨，探究；考察，探索；（用手或身体其他部位）探查，仔细检查

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

name: seek
trans: v. 寻找；寻求，谋求；请求（帮助），征求（意见）；试图，设法；找出，找到（seek sb./sth. out）；自然地向……移动；<古>去，前往（某地）

sentences.english: new graduates seeking employment
sentences.chinese: 正在求职的刚毕业的大学生

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to seek alternative routes.
sentences.chinese: 驾车者被告知需另寻其他路线。

sentences.english: They quickly sought to distance themselves from the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 他们迅速设法远离抗议者。

detailed_translations.english: to look for someone or something

name: grope
trans: v. 摸索；摸索着走；探索，努力寻求；猥亵，乱摸 n. 摸，猥亵

sentences.english: Ginny groped for her glasses on the bedside table.
sentences.chinese: 金尼在床头柜上摸着找眼镜。

sentences.english: We groped around in the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 我们在黑暗中摸索。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find something that you cannot see by feeling with your hands

name: ferret
trans: n. 雪貂；白鼬；（尤指在封闭或狭小空间中的）搜寻，查找；搜寻者 v. （翻箱倒柜地）搜寻，寻找；搜出，查获某物；用雪貂猎鼠（猎兔）；不断地烦扰、纠缠；担心 n. （Ferret）（法、美、西、英、巴）费里特（人名）

detailed_translations.chinese: 搜出，查获；驱出；用雪貂猎取
detailed_translations.english: to hunt rats and rabbits using a ferret
a small animal with a pointed nose, used to hunt rats and rabbits

name: tardy
trans: adj. 缓慢的，迟缓的；迟到的 n. 迟到 n. （Tardy）人名；（英、法、捷、匈）塔迪

sentences.english: Do please forgive this tardy reply.
sentences.chinese: 迟复为歉，敬请原谅。

sentences.english: He’s been tardy three times this semester.
sentences.chinese: 这学期他已经迟到三次了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迟延， 迟到的； 缓慢的， 迟钝的
detailed_translations.english: arriving or done late

name: perpetuate
trans: v. 使持续，使长久（尤指不好的事物）

sentences.english: an education system that perpetuates the divisions in our society
sentences.chinese: 使我们的社会持续分化的一种教育制度

name: detain
trans: v. 拘留，扣押；耽搁，阻留

sentences.english: Two suspects have been detained by the police for questioning .
sentences.chinese: 两名嫌疑人被警方拘留审问。

sentences.english: He was detained in Washington on urgent business.
sentences.chinese: 他因紧急事务耽搁在了华盛顿。

detailed_translations.english: to officially prevent someone from leaving a place

name: delay
trans: v. 推迟，延期；延误，耽搁；（故意）拖延，磨蹭 n. 延期，推迟；延误，耽搁；延迟器

sentences.english: Don’t delay – send off for the information now.
sentences.chinese: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。

sentences.english: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
sentences.chinese: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上，他推迟作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to wait until a later time to do something

name: prolong
trans: v. 拉长，拖长（感觉或活动）；<罕>延长

sentences.english: I was trying to think of some way to prolong the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我在想方设法拖长这次谈话。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

name: protract
trans: v. 延长；绘制；伸展（身体部位）

sentences.english: Delay always breeds danger; and to protract a great design is often to ruin it.
sentences.chinese: 推迟经常孕育危险；拖延一个伟大的工程常常意味着毁灭它。

sentences.english: To protract the suspense, he paused for a considerable period of time before telling us the result of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 为了延长悬念，他在告诉我们实验结果之前停顿了相当一段时间。

detailed_translations.english: to lengthen or extend (a speech, etc); prolong in time

name: retard
trans: v. <正式>阻碍，减缓；减慢，受到阻滞 n. <非正式>弱智，笨蛋；延迟，阻止

sentences.english: Cold weather retards the growth of many plants.
sentences.chinese: 寒冷的天气使许多植物生长滞缓。

detailed_translations.english: to delay the development of something, or to make something happen more slowly than expected

name: postpone
trans: v. 推迟，延缓；把……放在次要地位；把……放在后面

sentences.english: The match had to be postponed until next week.
sentences.chinese: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

sentences.english: His trial has been postponed indefinitely (= no one knows when it will happen ) .
sentences.chinese: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one

name: defer
trans: v. 延期，推迟；听从，遵从（defer to）

sentences.english: The committee deferred their decision .
sentences.chinese: 委员会延期作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to delay something until a later date

name: adjourn
trans: vi. 休会；延期；换地方 vt. 推迟；使……中止；使……延期

sentences.english: The rest of us adjourned to a nearby pub for some refreshments.
sentences.chinese: 我们其他人转移阵地，去了附近酒吧吃点心。

detailed_translations.english: to finish an activity and go somewhere – often used humorously

name: inclined
trans: adj. 有……意向，倾向于……；对……有兴趣的，有天赋的；倾斜的，有坡度的 v. 点头；（使）倾向于；（使）倾斜（incline 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: Commandos are inclined to shoot first and ask questions later.
sentences.chinese: 突击队员往往会先开枪，然后再问话。

sentences.english: He was inclined to self-pity.
sentences.chinese: 他爱自怜。

detailed_translations.english: to be likely to do something or behave in a particular way

name: prone
trans: adj. 有做……倾向的，易于……的；俯卧的，趴着的；（前臂姿势）手心向下的 v. （尤指面部向下）使俯卧，趴着 n. （Prone）（意、阿根、法、美、巴西）普罗内（人名）

sentences.english: His eyes shifted to the prone body on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他的视线移向了趴在地上的尸体。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易于…的， 很有可能…的； 俯卧的
detailed_translations.english: likely to do something or suffer from something, especially something bad or harmful

name: habitually
trans: adv. 习惯地；日常地

name: bent
trans: adj. 弯曲的，变形的；驼背的；(有权者）不诚实的，不正派的；下定决心的；同性恋的 n. 天赋，爱好；信仰；翦股颖；草茎，草梗；<英>莎草；<英，古>石南丛生的荒野，荒草牧场 v. 弯腰；使弯曲；屈从（bend 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: a bent nail
sentences.chinese: 弯曲的钉子

sentences.english: Stand with your knees slightly bent.
sentences.chinese: 双膝微曲站立。

sentences.english: He breathed in deeply, bent double in pain (=  with the top part of your body leaning forward towards your legs  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他深深地吸着气，痛得直不起腰来。

sentences.english: a bent old man (=  not standing straight  )
sentences.chinese: 一个驼背老汉

detailed_translations.english: special natural skill or interest in a particular area
no longer straight

name: aptitude
trans: n. 天资，天赋；自然的倾向，习性；适宜

sentences.english: He drifted into publishing and discovered an aptitude for working with accounts.
sentences.chinese: 他偶入出版界，发现自己具有管账的天资。

detailed_translations.english: natural ability or skill, especially in learning

name: propensity
trans: n. <正式>倾向，习性

sentences.english: Mr. Bint has a propensity to put off decisions to the last minute.
sentences.chinese: 宾特先生有一种将决定拖到最后一分钟的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way

name: trend
trans: n. 趋势，动态；时尚，风尚；热门话题 v. <美>趋向，倾向；（尤指地理特征的）走向；成为热门话题

sentences.english: The current trend is towards more part-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 当前的趋势是雇用更多的兼职人员。

sentences.english: the general trend towards the centralization of political power
sentences.chinese: 政治权力集中化的普遍趋势

sentences.english: A disturbing trend is that victims of violence are getting younger.
sentences.chinese: 一个令人担心的趋势是，暴力行为的受害者越来越年轻。

sentences.english: The growing trend is for single mothers to bring up children by themselves.
sentences.chinese: 单身母亲独自抚养孩子的趋势在上升。

sentences.english: Even so, the underlying trend is positive.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，基本趋势仍是乐观的。

sentences.english: national and international economic trends
sentences.chinese: 国内和国际的经济趋势

sentences.english: the downward trend in the price of gold
sentences.chinese: 黄金价格的下滑势头

sentences.english: Successive presidents have tried to reverse this trend , but without success.
sentences.chinese: 连续几任总统都试图扭转这一趋势，但均未成功。

detailed_translations.english: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

name: penchant
trans: n. 嗜好；倾向

sentences.english: a penchant for fast cars
sentences.chinese: 对跑车的酷爱

detailed_translations.english: if you have a penchant for something, you like that thing very much and try to do it or have it often

name: custom
trans: n. 风俗，习俗；习惯；光顾，惠顾；<法律>惯例，习惯法；（经常性的）顾客 adj. 定做的，量身设计的

sentences.english: She was stopped at customs and questioned.
sentences.chinese: 她在海关被叫住接受问话。

sentences.english: It took ages to clear customs (= be allowed through customs ) but then we were out of the airport quite quickly.
sentences.chinese: 过海关花了很长时间，不过出机场倒是很快。

sentences.english: You won’t be able to take that through customs.
sentences.chinese: 你带着那东西过不了海关的。

detailed_translations.english: the place where your bags are checked for illegal goods when you go into a country

name: accustomed
trans: adj. 习惯的，适应的；惯常的，通常的；（眼睛对光线变化）习惯了的，适应了的 v. 使习惯于，使适应（accustom 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: The pans were in their accustomed places.
sentences.chinese: 那些锅在老地方。

detailed_translations.english: usual

name: interest
trans: n. 兴趣，关注；吸引力，趣味；爱好；利息；利益，好处；权益，股权；利害关系，重要影响；利益集团，利益相关者 v. 使感兴趣，引起……的关注；劝说（某人）做（或参与）

sentences.english: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.chinese: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.english: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。

sentences.english: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.english: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.chinese: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.english: to promote/protect/safeguard sb's interests
sentences.chinese: 为某人的利益游说；保护 / 维护某人的利益

sentences.english: The money was repaid with interest.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱是带息偿还的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about sb/sth

name: tend
trans: v. 倾向于，往往会；照顾，护理；走向，趋向；<美>招待，照料（商店、酒吧等的顾客）

sentences.english: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照管， 照料， 护理
detailed_translations.english: to look after someone or something
if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again

name: inure
trans: vt. 使……习惯；使……适应 vi. 适用；起作用；有助于

sentences.english: We should inure ourselves to hard life.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该使自己习惯艰苦生活。

detailed_translations.english: to cause to accept or become hardened to; habituate

name: temperance
trans: n. 戒酒；节欲；（气候等的）温和 adj. 温暖的；有节制的

sentences.english: ...a reformed alcoholic extolling the joys of temperance.
sentences.chinese: ...一个已戒掉酒瘾的人对戒酒的好处赞不绝口。

detailed_translations.chinese: 戒酒；节欲；（气候等的）温和
detailed_translations.english: when someone never drinks alcohol because of their moral or religious beliefs

name: bondage
trans: n. 奴役，束缚；施虐性行为

sentences.english: the bondage of early motherhood
sentences.chinese: 刚刚做母亲时所受的束缚

detailed_translations.english: the state of having your freedom limited, or being prevented from doing what you want

name: deterrent
trans: n. 威慑，遏制；威慑武器 adj. 威慑的，遏制的

sentences.english: Their missiles are viewed as a defensive and deterrent force.
sentences.chinese: 他们的导弹被视为一种防卫和威慑力量。

sentences.english: However, this is a new age and those attacks will be stopped by a small nukeand therefore, it is not a deterrent anymore.
sentences.chinese: 然而，如今是新的时代，这样的攻击只要一枚核弹就完了，因此，这种战术已经不再是威慑。

sentences.english: Scientists do not know why this is the case but believe it could be an evolutionary throwback to less sophisticated times when crying acted as a deterrent to amorous males at times of turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们目前尚不明确为什么会这样，但是他们认为这可能是一种进化返祖现象，因为在蛮荒时代，哭泣在骚乱时是对发情男性的一种威慑。

name: neutralize
trans: v. 使失效，抵消；中和，使成为中性；使中立；击毁，摧毁（炸弹或军事目标）

sentences.english: Rising prices neutralize increased wages.
sentences.chinese: 不断上涨的物价会抵消工资的增长。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抵销；使…中和；使…无效；使…中立
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from having any effect

name: check
trans: v. 检查，核对；查看，查询；克制，抑制；存放，寄放；托运；在……上打钩；将（对方的）军 n. 检查，核对；制止（手段），抑制（手段）；结账单；支票（=cheque）；方格图案；衣帽寄存处；寄存凭证；钩号；（国际象棋）将军

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: circumscribe
trans: vt. 约束，限定；在……上画圈；包围；（几何学）外接

sentences.english: The President’s power is circumscribed by Congress and the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 总统的权力受到国会和最高法院的制约。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外切，外接；限制；在…周围画线
detailed_translations.english: to limit power, rights, or abilities

name: shackle
trans: n. 束缚；桎梏；脚镣 vt. 束缚；加枷锁 n. （Shackle）人名；（英）沙克尔

name: fetter
trans: vt. 束缚，限制（某人的自由）；给（囚犯）戴脚镣 n. 束缚，禁锢，羁绊；脚镣（常复数） n. (Fetter) （美）费特（人名）

sentences.english: fettered by family responsibilities
sentences.chinese: 受家庭责任的束缚

detailed_translations.english: to restrict someone’s freedom and prevent them from doing what they want

name: restrict
trans: v. 限制，控制（大小、数量、范围）；限制（活动或行为），妨碍；约束，管束；（以法规）限制；封锁（消息）

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

name: restrain
trans: v. 制止，阻止；克制，抑制；控制（某事物）；剥夺……的行动自由（或人身自由），管押；（安全带）缚住（人或其身体部位）

sentences.english: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.english: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

name: confine
trans: v. 限制，局限；防止……扩散；关押，监禁；使离不开（或受困于床、轮椅等） n. 边界，范围；限制，局限

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: quell
trans: v. 制止，镇压；消除，减轻（恐惧、担忧等）

sentences.english: ‘Jerry?’ she called, trying to quell the panic inside her.
sentences.chinese: “杰里？”她叫道，试图减轻内心的惊慌。

detailed_translations.english: to end a situation in which people are behaving violently or protesting, especially by using force

name: curb
trans: v. 控制，抑制；勒住（马） n. 控制，抑制；<美>路缘，马路牙子；（马的跗关节后部因扭伤韧带引起的）硬瘤

sentences.english: measures to curb the spread of the virus
sentences.chinese: 控制病毒扩散的措施

detailed_translations.english: to control or limit something in order to prevent it from having a harmful effect

detailed_translations.chinese: 控制， 约束； 路缘
detailed_translations.english: an influence which helps to control or limit something

name: bound
trans: adj. 必然的，肯定的；受约束的，有义务的；被……所限制的，被……所束缚的；要到……去的，驶往……的；装订好的，有封面的；（与……）紧密相连的，关系密切；准备就绪的；（语法要素）黏附的 v. 跳跃，蹦跳着走；形成……的边界，划界；限制，约束；突然增长，急剧上升；（尤指圆形的物体）弹回，弹开 n. 界限，限制；蹦跳，跳跃 v. 捆绑；使团结；凝结（bind 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.english: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

detailed_translations.english: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

name: leash
trans: n. 拴狗链，皮带；猎鹰腿带；（喻）约束，限制；<罕>（狩猎）三只一组 v. 拴住，牵住（狗）；（喻）约束

name: literate
trans: adj. 有读写能力的，受过良好教育的；熟练的，通晓的；精通文学的 n. 有文化的人

sentences.english: The drawback of the internet is that you have to be literate to use it.
sentences.chinese: 互联网的缺点就是人们必须得有文化才能使用它。

detailed_translations.english: able to read and write

name: chalk
trans: n. 白垩；粉笔；白垩地层；用粉笔划的记号 v. 用粉笔写（或画）；用粉笔做记号；用白垩粉擦（桌球杆等）；<英>把（酒钱）记于（某人）账上；获（胜），得（分）；变成白垩状

sentences.english: He chalked the message on the blackboard.
sentences.chinese: 他用粉笔把这条消息写在黑板上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 用粉笔写；用白垩粉擦；记录；规划
detailed_translations.english: to write, mark, or draw something with chalk

detailed_translations.chinese: 粉笔；白垩；用粉笔划的记号
detailed_translations.english: soft white or grey rock formed a long time ago from the shells of small sea animals

name: transcript
trans: n. 文字记录，抄本，文字本；<美>成绩单；（生化）转录本，转录物

sentences.english: A transcript of this PBS programme is available through our website, pbs.com.
sentences.chinese: 这个公共广播公司节目的文字本可通过我们的网址查阅。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成绩单；抄本，副本；文字记录
detailed_translations.english: a written or printed copy of a speech, conversation etc

name: scholarship
trans: n. 奖学金；学问，学术

sentences.english: She won a scholarship to Iowa State University.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了艾奥瓦州立大学的奖学金。

sentences.english: Her latest publication is a fine piece of scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 她最新出版的作品是一部优秀的学术著作。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education

name: article
trans: n. 文章，论文；物品；条款，条文；冠词；见习契约，见习期 v. 见习，签约做实习生；进行控告；使……受协议条款的约束

sentences.english: The paper’s leading article (=  the main article  ) described the government as weak.
sentences.chinese: 该报社论称政府软弱。

sentences.english: newspaper articles
sentences.chinese: 报纸上的文章

sentences.english: household articles
sentences.chinese: 家居用品

sentences.english: Article 1 of the constitution guarantees freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 宪法的第一条保障宗教信仰自由。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine

name: ken
trans: n. 视野范围，见地，知识范围

sentences.english: mysteries beyond our ken
sentences.chinese: 我们无法理解的神秘事物

detailed_translations.chinese: 视野范围，见地，知识范围
detailed_translations.english: if something is beyond your ken, you have no knowledge or understanding of it

name: stationery
trans: n. （通常有配套信封的）信纸，信笺；文具

sentences.english: a letter on hotel stationery
sentences.chinese: 用酒店信纸写的信

sentences.english: envelopes and other office stationery
sentences.chinese: 信封及其他办公文具

detailed_translations.english: paper for writing letters, usually with matching envelopes

name: brochure
trans: n. 小册子，资料（或广告）手册

sentences.english: a holiday brochure
sentences.chinese: 度假手册

detailed_translations.english: a thin book giving information or advertising something

name: pamphlet
trans: n. 小册子，活页 v. 向……散发小册子

sentences.english: a political pamphlet
sentences.chinese: 政治宣传册

detailed_translations.english: a very thin book with paper covers, that gives information about something

name: credit
trans: n. 信用，信贷，赊购；赞扬，信誉，声望；存款金额，余额；补助；退税，抵免；学分；带来荣耀的人（或事）；作品（指影片、电视节目、戏剧等）；信任，相信 v. 把（钱）记入总账，把钱存入（账户）；相信，信任；认为是……的功劳，给予承认；认为……有特定品质（或效果）

sentences.english: We found his statement hard to credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得他的说法令人难以信服。

sentences.english: The witness’s story gained credit with the jury.
sentences.chinese: 证人的陈述被陪审团采信了。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true
the belief that something is true or correct

name: semester
trans: n. 学期，半学年

sentences.english: the fall semester
sentences.chinese: 秋季学期

detailed_translations.english: one of the two periods of time that a year at high schools and universities is divided into, especially in the US

name: thesis
trans: n. 论文，毕业（或学位）论文；论题，论点；（文章的）主题；（黑格尔哲学用语）正题；（诗韵）扬音节

sentences.english: Cynthia’s still working on her thesis.
sentences.chinese: 辛西娅还在写论文。

sentences.english: Their main thesis was that the rise in earnings was due to improvements in education.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要论点是收入增加得益于教育状况的改善。

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

name: discourse
trans: n. 演讲，论述；谈话，交流；话语，语篇 v. 高谈阔论，论述；交谈；<古>说出；<古>演奏出

sentences.english: "I do not know. " And thus ended their discourse.
sentences.chinese: “我也不晓得。”就这样，他们的谈话结束了。 。

sentences.english: They listened to his discourse on human relations.
sentences.chinese: 他们听他作关于人际关系的演讲。

sentences.english: In discourse thou must attend to what is said, and in every movement thou must observe what is doing.
sentences.chinese: 在谈话中你必须注意所说的话，在任何活动中你都必须观察在做什么。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演讲， 谈话， 论文
detailed_translations.english: a serious speech or piece of writing on a particular subject

name: margin
trans: n. 页边空白；差额，幅度；盈余，利润；余地，备用的时间（或空间、金钱等）；边缘，非主体部分；保证金，押金；<澳新>额外报酬 v. 给……加上边；预付定金，交押金；<古>页边做注释或总结

sentences.english: Someone had scribbled a note in the margin .
sentences.chinese: 有人在页边写了条批注。

sentences.english: Use double spacing and wide margins to leave room for comments.
sentences.chinese: 采用双倍行距和宽阔的页边空白，以便留出地方写评注。

sentences.english: the western margin of southern Africa
sentences.chinese: 非洲南部的西隅

detailed_translations.english: the empty space at the side of a page

name: term
trans: n. （某人做某事或某事发生的）时期，期限，任期；学期，开庭期；到期，期满；术语，专有名词；措辞，说话的方式（terms）；方面，角度（terms）；（人们之间的）关系（terms）；条件，条款（terms）；付款条件，购买（出售）条件（terms）；（结束战争，解决争端的）条件（terms）；（数学运算中的）项；（逻）（三段论中的）项；（尤指苏格兰的）法定结账日（term day）；<法律> 有限期租用的地产；（建筑）界标 v. 把……称为，把……叫做

sentences.english: Teachers often feel overworked in term time (= during the term ) .
sentences.chinese: 教师在学期内经常觉得工作担子过重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 术语；学期；期限；条款；(代数式等的)项
detailed_translations.english: a word or expression with a particular meaning, especially one that is used for a specific subject or type of language
to use a particular word or expression to name or describe something

name: discipline
trans: n. 纪律，风纪；惩罚，处分；训导，管教；训练，锻炼；自制力，自律能力；（尤指大学的）科目，学科 v. 惩罚，处分；训练，管教

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

name: commence
trans: v. 开始，着手

sentences.english: Work will commence on the new building immediately.
sentences.chinese: 新大楼即将破土动工。

detailed_translations.english: to begin or to start something

name: cram
trans: v. 塞进，挤满；临时死记硬背，填鸭式学习；匆忙戴上；贪婪地吃 n. （应考）突击准备，死记硬背；极度拥挤

sentences.english: She’s been cramming hard all week.
sentences.chinese: 她整个星期都在拼命准备应付考试。

detailed_translations.chinese: 狼吞虎咽地吃东西；死记硬背功课

name: academic
trans: adj. 学业的，学术的；学校的，学院的；学业（成绩）优秀的，善于学习的；不切实际的，空谈的 n. 大学教师，学者；（学校或学院的）课程；大学生

sentences.english: He possessed no academic qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学历。

sentences.english: a program to raise academic standards
sentences.chinese: 旨在提高学术水平的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to education, especially at college or university level

name: heredity
trans: n. 遗传，遗传性；祖先，血统；（头衔、职位或权力的）继承，世袭

sentences.english: Heredity is not a factor in causing the cancer.
sentences.chinese: 遗传并非导致这种癌症的一个因素。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which mental and physical qualities are passed from a parent to a child before the child is born

name: heritage
trans: n. 遗产，传统，世袭财产；<美>（植物种类）纯种的，老品种的；<古>特殊（或个人）的所有物，（该有的）一份；<古>上帝选择的人（以色列人或基督教教会）

sentences.english: the importance of preserving the national heritage
sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权
detailed_translations.english: the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society

name: bequest
trans: n. 遗产；遗赠

sentences.english: a bequest of $5,000
sentences.chinese: 五千美元的遗产

detailed_translations.english: money or property that you arrange to give to someone after your death

name: legacy
trans: n. 遗产，遗赠物；遗留问题，后遗症 adj. （软件或硬件）已过时但因使用范围广而难以替代的

sentences.english: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

name: relic
trans: n. 遗物，遗迹，遗风；圣物，圣骨；（事物存在或发生的）证据，痕记；残留物，废墟（relics）

sentences.english: Roman relics found in a field
sentences.chinese: 在野外发现的古罗马遗迹

detailed_translations.english: an old object or custom that reminds people of the past or that has lived on from a past time

name: remains
trans: n. 剩余物，残留物；遗体，遗骸；古迹，遗迹 v. 仍然是，保持不变；逗留，留下；剩余，余留（remain 的第三人称单数形式）

sentences.english: extensive Roman remains (= of ancient buildings ) at Arles
sentences.chinese: 阿尔勒的一大片古罗马遗迹

detailed_translations.english: the parts of something that are left after the rest has been destroyed or has disappeared

name: stray
trans: v. 走失，迷路；走神，离题；（眼睛，手）悠闲 （或漫不经心）地移动；入歧途，犯错误；有外遇，在别处拈花惹草；<文>游荡，徘徊 adj. （动物）走失的，流浪的；离散的，零落的；（物理量）杂散的 n. 走失（流浪）的动物；离群者，走散者；天电干扰

sentences.english: This will limit the number of stray dogs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这将会减少流浪狗在这一区域的数量。

sentences.english: As for her personal safety, she said she isn't overly worried but does think about what a stray lunatic could do.
sentences.chinese: 至于她个人的安全，她说她并没有过度担心，但是她的确在考虑一个流浪疯子可以做些什么。

sentences.english: Then let's say you get into horrible, disastrous debt and have to go begging to the government, like a sad little stray.
sentences.chinese: 另外，比如说，你陷入了讨厌的、损失惨重的债务，而且必须像一个可怜的小流浪儿一样向政府祈求。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that is lost or has no home

name: roam
trans: v. 漫步，闲逛；（眼睛）扫视，（手）扫过；（思绪，想象力）遨游 n. 漫步

sentences.english: Chickens and geese roam freely in the back yard.
sentences.chinese: 鸡和鹅在后院随意溜达。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t let your children roam the streets .
sentences.chinese: 你不应该让孩子在街上游荡。

detailed_translations.english: to walk or travel, usually for a long time, with no clear purpose or direction

name: stalk
trans: n. （植物的）茎，秆；（动物的）肉柄，肉茎；柄；（车辆）（转向柱上控制指示仪、灯光等的）手柄；悄悄追踪；高视阔步 v. 偷偷接近，潜近；跟踪，盯梢；怒冲冲地走，趾高气扬地走；令人厌恶地穿过，威胁地通过；<文>（不好的气氛）笼罩，蔓延

sentences.english: celery stalks
sentences.chinese: 芹菜茎

detailed_translations.english: to walk in a proud or angry way, with long steps
a long narrow part of a plant that supports leaves, fruits, or flowers
to follow a person or animal quietly in order to catch and attack or kill them

name: rumble
trans: v. 发出隆隆声；轰鸣着缓慢行进；（肚子因饥饿而）咕噜作响；低沉地说；（争论）有节制地持续，低调地持续（rumble on）；<英，非正式>看穿（违法活动或进行违法活动者）；<美，非正式>打群架 n. 持续而低沉的声音，隆隆声；<美，非正式>打群架

sentences.english: The sky, swollen like a black bladder, rumbled and crackled.
sentences.chinese: 天空胀得像个黑色的气囊，发出隆隆声和劈啪声。

detailed_translations.english: If something rumbles, it makes a low, continuous noise
a series of long low sounds

name: scale
trans: n. 天平，磅秤；天平盘；天秤（星）座（the Scales）；等级，级别；刻度，标度；标尺，刻度尺；规模，范围；比例，比例尺；鳞，鳞片；鱼鳞状物；水垢；牙垢；音阶；（加热后金属上形成的）氧化皮；进位制；（摄影）影调范围 v. 改变（文字、图片）的尺寸大小；刮去（鱼鳞）；攀登，翻越；剔除（牙垢）；（尤指皮肤）生成鳞屑；（成片状）脱落，剥落；（数量，财产） 按一定比例调节；称得重量为；<美>估算（树木的）产木材量 adj. （模型或复制品）按比例缩小的

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

name: ascend
trans: v. 攀登，登上；上升，升高，通往高处；升职，晋升；追溯，溯源

sentences.english: The plane ascended rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 飞机迅速爬升。

detailed_translations.english: to move up through the air
to climb something or move to a higher position

name: budge
trans: v. （使）稍微移动；<美，非正式> 给别人挪开一块地方；（使）改变主意，（使）让步 n. 羔羊皮

sentences.english: She leaned on the door, but it wouldn’t budge.
sentences.chinese: 她靠在门上，但是门纹丝不动。

sentences.english: The horse refused to budge an inch .
sentences.chinese: 那匹马寸步都不肯走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挪动；微微移动；改变态度或意见；服从
detailed_translations.english: to move, or to make someone or something move

name: locomote
trans: vt. 移动；行动

sentences.english: Since plants cannot locomote , the sensation of experiencing pain would be superfluous. Thus, plants differ completely physiologically from mammals.
sentences.chinese: 由于植物无法移动，它们不太需要具备感知痛苦的能力，因此，植物与哺乳动物在生理上全然不同。

sentences.english: In simulation, millions of robotic modules assemble to form a large cube robot able to locomote in many types of environments.
sentences.chinese: 在仿真方面，数以千计的机器人模块编译成一个可以在多种环境中移动的机器人。

name: traverse
trans: v. 横穿，穿过；横越岩石面的攀爬；（滑雪时）横线下（坡）；<喻>整体考虑（问题），全面讨论；来回移动，斜向移动；转动（大炮等带轴设备）；<法律>否认（一项指控），反驳 n. （爬陡坡时的）斜向攀上（下）；越过，穿过；滑雪横切运动；（逆风时轮船所作的）曲线航行，折航；横断物，横档；通廊，楼厢；（大炮等的）横转装置；机器部件的横转，横向运动；（测量用的）导线；（军）（壕沟的）土护墙，屏障 adj. 横贯的

sentences.english: two minutes to traverse the park
sentences.chinese: 两分钟横穿公园

detailed_translations.english: a sideways movement across a very steep slope in mountain-climbing

detailed_translations.chinese: 穿过；反对；详细研究；在…来回移动
detailed_translations.english: to move across, over, or through something, especially an area of land or water

name: stroll
trans: v. 散步，闲逛；（体育比赛）轻而易举地获胜 n. 散步，溜达；（竞赛中）轻易的胜利

sentences.english: After dinner, I took a stroll round the city.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭后，我绕着城溜达了一圈。

detailed_translations.english: a slow relaxed walk

name: insinuate
trans: vt. 暗示；使逐渐而巧妙地取得；使迂回地潜入 vi. 暗讽；说含沙射影的话

sentences.english: What are you trying to insinuate?
sentences.chinese: 你想暗示什么？

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗示；使逐渐而巧妙地取得；使迂回地潜入
detailed_translations.english: to say something which seems to mean something unpleasant without saying it openly, especially suggesting that someone is being dishonest

name: zigzag
trans: n. 之字形，锯齿形线条；（之字形路线中的）急转弯；行动、计划或想法突然变来变去 v. 呈之字形移动，曲折行进；突然且彻底地变化，随后又突然变回原样 adj. 之字形的，曲折的 adv. 之字形地，曲折地

sentences.english: Some species weave designs into their webs, creating zigzag patterns that can either attract prey, like bees, in bright sunlight, or camouflage the net in the shade.
sentences.chinese: 一些种类的蜘蛛能设计织网，设计出可以在明媚的阳光下吸引猎物，如蜜蜂，或在阴暗处能掩饰蜘蛛网的之字形图案。

sentences.english: Located at 4210 Silver Hill Road just outside of Washington, D.C., the museum is a massive zigzag-shaped edifice constructed of five interconnected pods—each pod larger than a football field.
sentences.chinese: 这座博物馆位于华盛顿特区郊外的银山路4210号，建得宏伟壮观，五个相互连通的分区组成之字形，每个分区的面积比足球场还大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 曲折的；锯齿形的；之字形的
使成之字形；使曲折行进
detailed_translations.english: to move forward in sharp angles, first to the left and then to the right etc
a pattern that looks like a line of z’s joined together

detailed_translations.chinese: 曲折地；之字形地；Z字形地
detailed_translations.english: to move forward in sharp angles, first to the left and then to the right etc

name: motion
trans: n. 运动，移动；手势，动作；提议，议案；<英>排便，大便；转动的机械装置；（当庭提出裁决或命令的）请求，申请 v. 打手势，示意

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

name: unquenchable
trans: adj. 止不住的；不能遏制的；不能熄灭的

name: lag
trans: v. 掉队，落后于；给（管道等）加防冻保暖层；<非正式>使入狱，逮捕 n. （两件事的）时间间隔；<英，非正式>囚犯，惯犯；相位滞后；绝热层，保温套；桶板 adj. 最后的

sentences.english: In this scenario, due to the lag time required to assimilate new resources, the relationship between required resources and estimated delivery timeframe may even turn negative.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，由于时间已经落后，需要吸收新的人力资源，需要的资源和预计的交付时间的关系甚至更加复杂。

sentences.english: But to many, at least as far as science is concerned, it is the countries that were doing well that are now doing better, whereas those at the bottom continue to lag significantly behind.
sentences.chinese: 但是对于许多人而言，至少在科学方面，正是那些在过去做的很好的国家现在正在做的更好，而那些位于底层的国家的科学继续落后。

sentences.english: One is that some countries still lag behind.
sentences.chinese: 一个原因是一些国家仍很落后。

name: subjection
trans: n. 隶属；服从；征服

sentences.english: the subjection of women
sentences.chinese: 妇女的从属地位

detailed_translations.english: when a person or a group of people are controlled by a government or by another person

name: overcome
trans: v. 克服，解决；征服，战胜；使受不了，使无法行动（或思考）

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

name: surpass
trans: v. 超过，胜过，优于；比（预期的或希望的）更好；超越自我；超出（理解范围）

sentences.english: He had surpassed all our expectations .
sentences.chinese: 他超越了我们所有的预期。

sentences.english: The number of multiple births has surpassed 100,000 for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 多胎产首次突破了 10 万例。

detailed_translations.english: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

name: transcend
trans: v. 超出，超越；胜过（某人），超过（某项成就）

sentences.english: The desire for peace transcended political differences.
sentences.chinese: 对和平的渴望超越了政治分歧。

detailed_translations.english: to go beyond the usual limits of something

name: surmount
trans: v. 克服（问题或困难）；耸立于……之上，在……顶上

sentences.english: He has had to surmount immense physical disabilities.
sentences.chinese: 他不得不克服严重的身体残疾。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in dealing with a problem or difficulty

name: precede
trans: v. 处在……之前，先于；在……之前做（或说）；比……更重要，比……（级别）更高

sentences.english: a type of cloud that precedes rain
sentences.chinese: 下雨前出现的一种云

sentences.english: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

sentences.english: The guard preceded them down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

name: vanquish
trans: vt. 征服；击败；克服；抑制（感情等）

sentences.english: A happy ending is only possible because the hero has first vanquished the dragons.
sentences.chinese: 只有主人公先把那些恶龙制服，快乐的结局才有可能。

detailed_translations.english: to defeat someone or something completely

name: despicable
trans: adj. 卑鄙的，可鄙的

sentences.english: It’s despicable the way he treats those kids.
sentences.chinese: 他那样对待那些孩子，真卑鄙。

sentences.english: a despicable act of terrorism
sentences.chinese: 卑劣的恐怖主义行径

sentences.english: a despicable crime
sentences.chinese: 卑鄙的罪行

detailed_translations.english: extremely bad, immoral, or cruel

name: contemptible
trans: adj. 可鄙的，卑劣的

sentences.english: They were portrayed as contemptible cowards.
sentences.chinese: 他们被刻画成可鄙的胆小鬼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可鄙的；卑劣的；可轻视的
detailed_translations.english: not deserving any respect at all

name: ignominious
trans: adj. 可耻的；下流的

sentences.english: an ignominious end to his career
sentences.chinese: 他职业生涯不光彩的终结

detailed_translations.english: making you feel ashamed or embarrassed

name: menial
trans: adj. 卑微的；仆人的；适合仆人做的 n. 仆人；住家佣工；下贱的人

sentences.english: ...low-paid menial jobs, such as cleaning and domestic work.
sentences.chinese: …工钱少又卑微的工作，诸如打扫清洁或做家务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 卑微的；仆人的；适合仆人做的
detailed_translations.english: Menial work is very boring, and the people who do it have a low status and are usually badly paid

detailed_translations.chinese: 仆人；住家佣工；下贱的人

name: scornful
trans: adj. 轻蔑的，鄙视的

trans: adj. 十分肮脏的，污秽的；淫秽的，下流的；<非正式>气愤的，恼怒的；<英，非正式>（天气）恶劣的，多雨雪的；卑鄙的，不道德的 adv. <非正式>非常

trans: adj. 无礼的；失礼的；不尊敬的

trans: n. 歧视，区别对待；区分，辨别；辨别力，鉴赏力

trans: v. 蔑视；侮辱

trans: vt. 轻视；贬低；使相形见小

trans: n. 鄙视，蔑视 v. 鄙视，蔑视；不屑（做某事）

sentences.english: a look of complete disdain

to have no respect for someone or something, because you think they are not important or good enough

trans: v. 鄙视，厌恶，看不起

sentences.chinese: 她看不起她的邻居。

name: mean
trans: v. 意味着；表示……的意思，作……的解释；打算，意欲；使专门用于；导致，结果是；十分熟识；当真，说到做到；对某人重要 adj. 吝啬的，小气的；不善良的，刻薄的；要发怒的；熟练的，出色的；平均的；简陋的，破旧的；微薄的；<旧>出身卑贱的，社会地位低下的；中庸的，中等的；<美>凶狠的，好斗的 n. 中庸，折衷；平均数，中数；中间点

sentences.english: The red light means ‘Stop’.
sentences.chinese: 红灯表示“停”。

sentences.chinese: 这个灯亮说明汽油不多了。

detailed_translations.english: to have or represent a particular meaning

trans: adj. 令人尴尬的，使人难堪的；难对付的，难处理的；局促不安的；不方便的；笨拙的，不雅观的；不舒适的

sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

trans: adj. 十分愚蠢的，白痴般的

trans: adj. 愚蠢的，愚昧的；错误的；未经认真考虑的

trans: n. 恶作剧，骗局；谎报 v. 欺骗，捉弄

sentences.chinese: 恶作剧报警电话

name: curt
trans: adj. 简短而失礼的，唐突无礼的；简略的，简要的；草率的 n. （Curt）（美）库尔特（人名）

sentences.chinese: 他简慢地点点头就转身坐下了。

(Curt)人名；(法)屈尔；(英)柯特；(德、西、芬、罗、瑞典)库尔特

name: acute

sentences.english: His business acumen helped him to succeed where others had failed.

sentences.chinese: 科学研究表明，婴儿对外界信息是相当敏锐的，接受的速度也相当快。

name: gauche

name: rough

name: rugged

sentences.chinese: 我开始怀疑他是否神志正常。

sentences.english: She wondered if she was losing her sanity .
sentences.chinese: 她怀疑自己是否精神有问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心智健全，神智正常；判断正确
detailed_translations.english: the condition of being mentally healthy

name: sluggish
trans: adj. 缓慢的，迟钝的，懒洋洋的；性能欠佳的

sentences.english: Alex woke late, feeling tired and sluggish.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯醒得很晚，感到很倦怠。

sentences.english: Economic recovery has so far been sluggish.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的速度目前仍然缓慢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 萧条的；迟钝的；行动迟缓的；懒惰的
detailed_translations.english: moving or reacting more slowly than normal

name: indolent
trans: adj. 懒惰的；无痛的

sentences.english: The former investment banker has not been indolent: his department has been a factory for acronyms since the crisis began.
sentences.chinese: 这位前投资银行家并非懒惰，自危机开始以来，他的部门已成为加工厂的代称。

sentences.english: In a 1942 presentation at the New York Academy of Medicine, the scientists reported that after lobotomy, patients did sometimes become “indolent” or “outspoken.
sentences.chinese: 在1942年纽约医学专科学院的一个介绍会中，一些科学家提出，额叶切除术后，病人的确有时变得“懒惰”或“直言”。

detailed_translations.english: lazy

name: inertia
trans: n. 缺乏活力，惰性；无变化；惯性

sentences.english: Inertia carried the plane onto the ground.
sentences.chinese: 飞机靠惯性着陆。

sentences.english: I can't seem to throw off this feeling of inertia.
sentences.chinese: 我好像无法摆脱这种无力的感觉。

detailed_translations.english: the force that keeps an object in the same position or keeps it moving until it is moved or stopped by another force

name: slug
trans: n. 蛞蝓，鼻涕虫；<非正式>子弹，气枪弹；满满一口（尤指烈酒）；<美>（投入机器中的）假硬币，代币；懒汉，懒虫；重击；（整行铸排机印刷时的）一行铅字；（计算机）处理后的标题（用于构建固定链接） v. <非正式>重击（某人）；猛击（球）；痛饮（某物，尤指酒），大喝；决一雌雄（slug it out）

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼻涕虫；动作缓慢的人；金属小块
detailed_translations.english: a small creature with a soft body, that moves very slowly and eats garden plants

name: sloth
trans: n. <正式>懒散，怠惰；树懒；<罕>一群熊（a sloth of bears）

sentences.english: He admitted a lack of motivation and a feeling of sloth.
sentences.chinese: 他承认自己缺乏动力，感觉懒散。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怠惰，懒惰；[脊椎] 树懒
detailed_translations.english: an animal in Central and South America that moves very slowly, has grey fur, and lives in trees

name: slothful
trans: adj. 怠惰的，懒惰的；迟钝的

sentences.english: He was not slothful: he had been busy all night.
sentences.chinese: 他可没偷懒：他忙了整整一夜。

detailed_translations.english: lazy or not active

name: stout
trans: adj. （人）肥胖的，壮实的；厚而结实的；不屈不挠的，顽强的 n. 烈性黑啤酒；特大号衣服；胖子

sentences.english: a stout pair of shoes
sentences.chinese: 一双厚实耐穿的鞋子

detailed_translations.chinese: 结实的；矮胖的；勇敢的；激烈的
detailed_translations.english: strong and thick
strong dark beer

name: firm
trans: n. 公司，商行；（以顾问医师为首的）医务小组；<英，非正式>（敌视敌对球队球迷的）球迷俱乐部，球迷联盟 adj. 结实的，坚硬的；牢固的，稳固的；坚定的，坚决的；强有力的；牢牢掌控的；坚挺的；确切的，可靠的；严厉的，强硬的 v. 使强壮，使坚实；坚挺，稳步上涨；敲定 adv. 坚定地，坚决地

sentences.english: She works for an electronics firm.
sentences.chinese: 她在一家电子公司工作。

detailed_translations.english: a business or company, especially a small one

name: stocky
trans: adj. 矮壮的；健壮结实的

sentences.english: a stocky build
sentences.chinese: 敦实的体格

detailed_translations.english: a stocky person is short and heavy and looks strong

name: robust
trans: adj. 强健的，强壮的；（系统或组织）稳固的，健全的；（物体）结实的，坚固的；（观点等）强烈的，坚定的；（食物或饮料）味浓的，醇厚的；特大的；粗野的，粗鲁的

sentences.english: a robust man of six feet four
sentences.chinese: 一个身高六英尺四英寸的壮汉

detailed_translations.english: a robust person is strong and healthy

name: hardy
trans: adj. 坚强的，吃苦耐劳的；（植物）耐寒的；坚定不移的，非常忠诚的；鲁莽的，蛮横的 n. 方柄凿

sentences.english: hardy mountain goats
sentences.chinese: 能适应恶劣环境的石山羊

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚强的；勇敢的；能吃苦耐劳的；鲁莽的
detailed_translations.english: strong and healthy and able to bear difficult living conditions

detailed_translations.chinese: 强壮的人；耐寒植物；方柄凿
detailed_translations.english: any blacksmith's tool made with a square shank so that it can be lodged in a square hole in an anvil

name: lusty
trans: adj. 精力充沛的；健壮的 n. （Lusty）人名；（英）勒斯蒂

sentences.english: the lusty cry of a new-born baby
sentences.chinese: 新生儿响亮的哭声

detailed_translations.chinese: 流满活力的， 精力充沛的

name: stiff
trans: adj. （肌肉或关节）酸痛的，僵硬的；不易弯曲的，硬的；艰难的，严厉的；无礼的，生硬的；（酒）烈性的；稠的，难搅拌的；难移动的，不顺滑的；昂贵的；（风）强劲的，猛烈的；过于正式的 n. <俚>死尸；<美，非正式>……的人；<非正式>无趣的人，令人讨厌的人；<英>（体育俱乐部的）后备队，候补队 (the stiffs) v. <美，非正式>诈骗，不还钱，（尤指）不给小费；<非正式>（新产品、电影、节目等）不畅销，彻底失败；<美，非正式>冷落，怠慢；<非正式>杀害某人 adv. 非常，彻底地

sentences.english: I never felt stiff after training until I was in my thirties.
sentences.chinese: 三十岁之前，我训练后从不会感到身体发僵。

detailed_translations.chinese: 呆板的；坚硬的；严厉的；拘谨的
detailed_translations.english: a stiff punishment is great or severe

detailed_translations.chinese: 死尸；令人讨厌者；流通票据；劳动者
detailed_translations.english: the body of a dead person

name: prodigal
trans: adj. 挥霍的；十分慷慨的 n. 浪子；挥霍者

sentences.english: a prodigal lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

detailed_translations.english: spending money, wasting time etc in a careless way
someone who spends money carelessly and wastes their time – used humorously

name: improvident
trans: adj. 浪费的；无远见的；无先见之明的

detailed_translations.chinese: 无远见的， 不节俭的
detailed_translations.english: too careless to save any money or to plan for the future

name: lavish
trans: adj. 奢侈的，盛大的；慷慨的，大方的 v. 慷慨（或过度）给予

sentences.english: a royal palace on a lavish scale
sentences.chinese: 庞大的皇宫

detailed_translations.english: very generous
to give someone or something a lot of love, praise, money etc

name: luxurious
trans: adj. 奢侈的，豪华的；心满意足的，舒适的；辞藻华丽的

sentences.english: a luxurious 30-room villa
sentences.chinese: 一栋有30个房间的豪华度假别墅

detailed_translations.english: very expensive, beautiful, and comfortable

name: extravagant
trans: adj. 奢侈的，挥霍的；不切实际的，放肆的；豪华的，精美的

sentences.english: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.chinese: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.english: an extravagant lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

sentences.english: an extravagant display of loyalty
sentences.chinese: 过分表露忠诚

sentences.english: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 不要酗酒。

detailed_translations.english: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

name: squander
trans: v. 浪费，挥霍（金钱、时间等）；失去（机会）；（使）分散 n. 浪费

sentences.english: The home team squandered a number of chances in the first half.
sentences.chinese: 主队在上半场浪费了几次机会。

detailed_translations.english: to carelessly waste money, time, opportunities etc

name: flamboyant
trans: adj. 艳丽的；火焰似的；炫耀的 n. 凤凰木

sentences.english: He lifted his arms in a flamboyant gesture .
sentences.chinese: 他抬起胳膊，做了个炫耀的手势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 艳丽的；火焰似的；炫耀的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a confident or exciting way that makes people notice you

name: deft
trans: adj. 灵巧的；机敏的；敏捷熟练的

sentences.english: He sketched her with quick, deft strokes.
sentences.chinese: 他给她画素描，下笔又快又熟练。

sentences.english: deft footwork
sentences.chinese: 敏捷的步法

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵巧的；机敏的；敏捷熟练的
detailed_translations.english: a deft movement is skilful, and often quick

name: adept
trans: adj. 熟练的，擅长的 n. 能手，内行

sentences.english: I’m afraid she’s also an adept liar.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕她还是一个撒谎专家。

detailed_translations.english: good at something that needs care and skill

name: skillful
trans: adj. 熟练的；巧妙的

sentences.english: With a skillful movement he rounded the small fishing-boat.
sentences.chinese: 他以灵巧的动作使小渔船调过头来。

sentences.english: I like making things by hand because my mother is very skillful, and I liked staying with her when I was young.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢亲手作一些东西，这是因为我母亲的手非常巧，而且我小的时候喜欢同她在一起。

sentences.english: They understand that development is a difficult social activity that can be conquered not by a silver bullet, but rather by dedicated, skillful practitioners who know and leverage proven techniques.
sentences.chinese: 开发是一项有难度的社会活动，不仅不能够通过银弹来征服，而是由理解并实施可靠技术的那些专注且熟练的人们来解决。

name: experienced
trans: adj. 熟练的，有经验的 v. 经历，遭遇；体会到，感受到（experience 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: an experienced pilot
sentences.chinese: 经验丰富的飞行员

sentences.english: an experienced public speaker
sentences.chinese: 老练的公开演讲者

sentences.english: She is experienced and self-assured.
sentences.chinese: 她经验丰富且充满自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 老练的，熟练的；富有经验的
detailed_translations.english: possessing skills or knowledge because you have done something often or for a long time

name: stunt
trans: n. （尤指电影中的）特技表演；噱头，作秀；逞英雄，做愚蠢（有点危险）的事 v. 阻碍……的成长（发育），妨碍发展；表演绝技

sentences.english: Todd flew over the city in a hot-air balloon as a publicity stunt .
sentences.chinese: 作为一种宣传噱头，托德乘坐热气球飞越城市上空。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to attract people’s attention, especially in advertising or politics

detailed_translations.chinese: 阻碍…的正常生长或发展
detailed_translations.english: to stop something or someone from growing to their full size or developing properly

name: craft
trans: n. 工艺，手艺；船，艇，飞行器；诡计，骗术；行业，职业；手工艺品 v. 精心制作

sentences.english: traditional rural crafts
sentences.chinese: 传统的乡村手工艺

sentences.english: arts and crafts
sentences.chinese: 手工艺

detailed_translations.english: a job or activity in which you make things with your hands, and that you usually need skill to do
to make something using a special skill, especially with your hands

name: facility
trans: n. 设施，设备；卫生间；天赋，才能；（机器等的）特别装置，（服务等的）特色；（用作某种用途的）场所

sentences.english: What recreational facilities are now available?
sentences.chinese: 什么娱乐设施现在是可用的？

detailed_translations.english: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

name: familiarize
trans: v. 使了解，使熟悉

sentences.english: Employees must familiarize themselves with the health and safety manual.
sentences.chinese: 雇员必须熟悉健康和安全手册。

detailed_translations.english: to learn about something so that you understand it, or to teach someone else about something so that they understand it

name: accomplished
trans: adj. 熟练的，才华高的；娴于社交的；很成功的，非常优秀的；<英>完成的 v. 完成，实现（accomplish 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: However, we also must look at what was not accomplished.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我们也必须看看有哪些“未完成的事业”。

sentences.english: And how is this accomplished well except by general principles, some about the nature of the universe, and others about the proper constitution of man?
sentences.chinese: 而除非通过一些有关宇宙本性的普遍原则和另一些有关人的恰当结构的普遍原则，怎么能好好完成此事呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 完成了的； 有技巧的

name: aptitude
trans: n. 天资，天赋；自然的倾向，习性；适宜

sentences.english: He drifted into publishing and discovered an aptitude for working with accounts.
sentences.chinese: 他偶入出版界，发现自己具有管账的天资。

detailed_translations.english: natural ability or skill, especially in learning

name: vigor
trans: n. [生物]活力，精力 n. （Vigor）人名；（英、法）维戈尔

sentences.english: If you want to retain youthful vigor,you have to take regular exercise.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想保持青春活力，你就得经常锻炼。

sentences.english: In fact, the huge inheritance does not do him any good, but tends to undermine his vigor and passion for life.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，这么大笔的遗产对他不仅没有什么好处，反而会损害他的活力和对生活的激情。

sentences.english: They would be lying there in the tree like, 'Oh, just let me just die up here, ' because they lacked any kind of vigor.
sentences.chinese: 因为它们一点活力都没有, 他们会整天在树下躺着，一付‘噢，实在活不起了，让我死在这里好了’的样子。

name: caliber
trans: n. 口径；才干；水准；器量（同 calibre）

sentences.english: Perhaps the first thing that students notice about their college is the caliber of their fellow students.
sentences.chinese: 可能学生们对这所大学关注的第一件事就是同学的才干。

sentences.english: One of the criminals immediately shoved a .38 caliber handgun to my head, ordered me to the cooler, pushed me down on the floor, and pumped a bullet into the back of my head - execution style.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个匪徒迅速掏出一把口径为38毫米的手枪用力指著我的头，勒令我走到冷冻机旁，然后把我推倒在地，像执行死刑般从后面朝我头部开了一枪。

sentences.english: Also, the further an executive rises, the more he or she must deal with high-caliber people who know how to get what they want, are difficult, strong-willed and have a sharp appetite for power.
sentences.chinese: 此外，管理者升迁到越高的位置，他/她就必须越多地与更有才干的人打交道，这些人知道如何得到自己想要的，他们往往难以相处，意志坚定，有更强的权力欲。

name: quality
trans: n. 质量，品质；优质，上乘；素质，品德；特征，特质；（语音）音质，音色；<英>（供有品位者阅读的）高质量报纸（=quality newspaper）；（占星）黄道宫运动三大特征之一 adj. 优质的，高质量的；<英>（报纸）内容严肃的，高级的；<英，俚>棒极了

sentences.english: Much of the land was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 很多地的土质很差。

sentences.english: Use only high quality ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 只使用上等的材料。

sentences.english: the drug’s addictive quality
sentences.chinese: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

detailed_translations.english: how good or bad something is

name: temperament
trans: n. 气质，性格；（性情）暴躁，喜怒无常；调（音）律（在平均律中，8度音阶包含有12个均等的半音程）

sentences.english: His impulsive temperament regularly got him into difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他容易冲动的性格经常使他陷入困境。

detailed_translations.english: the emotional part of someone’s character, especially how likely they are to be happy, angry etc

name: stamina
trans: n. 耐力，持久力，毅力；雄蕊（stamen 的复数）

sentences.english: You need stamina to be a long-distance runner.
sentences.chinese: 当长跑运动员需要耐力。

sentences.english: Elaine has the stamina and the determination to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 伊莱恩具有成功所需的毅力和决心。

detailed_translations.english: physical or mental strength that lets you continue doing something for a long time without getting tired

name: talent
trans: n. 天赋，才能；天才，人才；<英，俚>性感的人；（尤指古罗马人和古希腊人使用的重量和货币单位）塔兰特

sentences.english: He has a lot of talent , and his work is fresh and interesting.
sentences.chinese: 他很有天赋，作品新颖有趣。

sentences.english: a persuasive speaker with a natural talent for leadership
sentences.chinese: 有领导天赋、颇有辩才的演说者

sentences.english: His latest book reveals hidden talents.
sentences.chinese: 他最新的一本书展现了他深藏不露的才能。

sentences.english: Sadly, she inherited none of her father’s musical talent.
sentences.chinese: 可惜的是，她一点都没有继承她父亲的音乐天赋。

sentences.english: He is a great talent.
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人才。

sentences.english: Britain’s footballing talent
sentences.chinese: 英国的足球天才

detailed_translations.english: a natural ability to do something well

name: confidence
trans: n. 自信，信心；信任，信赖；把握，肯定；保密，机密；秘密，知心话

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

name: disposition
trans: n. 性情，性格；倾向，癖性；易患某病的倾向；赠与，转让；排列，布置；支配权，处置权；<古>（尤指天意的）决定

sentences.english: The rides are unsuitable for people of a nervous disposition.
sentences.chinese: 这种骑乘不适合紧张型性格的人。

sentences.english: a map showing the disposition of American forces
sentences.chinese: 显示美军部署的地图

sentences.english: Neither side shows the slightest disposition to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 双方都没有表露出丝毫妥协的意思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 性格；排列,部署；倾向,意向
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of character which makes someone likely to behave or react in a certain way

name: mass
trans: n. 团，块；大量，许多；（常指混乱的）一群，一堆；大量的东西；群众，平民百姓；大多数，多数；质量；（尤指罗马天主教的）弥撒；弥撒曲 adj. 民众的，大量的 v. （使）聚集，（使）集结

sentences.english: a mass protest
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抗议

sentences.english: weapons of mass destruction
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the problem of mass unemployment
sentences.chinese: 大批人失业的问题

detailed_translations.english: involving or intended for a very large number of people
to come together, or to make people or things come together, in a large group

detailed_translations.chinese: 众多，大量；团，块，堆；群众；质量
detailed_translations.english: a large crowd

name: ability
trans: n. 能力，能够；才能，技能，本领

sentences.english: the ability to walk
sentences.chinese: 行走的能力

sentences.english: The test measures your mathematical ability.
sentences.chinese: 这种测试考查的是数学能力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being able to do something

name: versatile
trans: adj. 多才多艺的，有多种技能的；多用途的，多功能的

sentences.english: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: having many different uses

name: power
trans: n. 控制力，操控力；权力，职权；统治，政权；有影响力的人（或组织）；军事强国，有影响力的大国；某方面的力量（或影响），实力；力量，体能；能源，（尤指）电力；能力，本领； （某事物或社会集团的）影响力，感染力；指数；幂，乘方；放大率；动力，功率；神灵，神力；（传统基督教天使学）掌权天使（九级天使中的第六级）（powers）；（旨在提升某群体地位的）权力运动 v. 驱动，推动（机器或车辆）；快速前进，迅猛移动；猛力踢（或推、顶）（尤指球） adj. 电力的，电能的；电动的；强大的；有重要人士参与的；（服装）礼服的，显示权势的

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

name: avid
trans: adj. 热心的，热衷的；渴望的，渴求的

sentences.english: He misses not having enough books because he's an avid reader.
sentences.chinese: 他遗憾没有足够的书，因为他是一个热爱读书的人。

detailed_translations.english: You use avid to describe someone who is very enthusiastic about something that they do

name: ravenous
trans: adj. 贪婪的；渴望的；狼吞虎咽的

sentences.english: I’m absolutely ravenous.
sentences.chinese: 我饿极了。

sentences.english: a ravenous appetite
sentences.chinese: 极大的胃口

detailed_translations.english: very hungry

name: rapacious
trans: adj. 贪婪的；掠夺的

sentences.english: rapacious landlords
sentences.chinese: 贪婪的房东

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more money, goods etc than you need or have a right to

name: greedy
trans: adj. 贪婪的，贪心的；贪吃的，嘴馋的；渴望的

sentences.english: a greedy and selfish society
sentences.chinese: 一个贪婪自私的社会

sentences.english: He looked at the gold with greedy eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他贪婪地看着这些金子。

sentences.english: Have you eaten them all, you greedy pig?
sentences.chinese: 你把那些全吃了？你这贪吃的猪！

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

name: covetous
trans: adj. 贪婪的；贪求的；渴望的

name: avarice
trans: n. 贪婪，贪财

sentences.english: He paid a month's rent in advance, just enough to satisfy the landlord's avarice.
sentences.chinese: 他预交了一个月的房租，正好满足了房东的贪心。

detailed_translations.english: a desire to have a lot of money that is considered to be too strong

name: avaricious
trans: adj. 贪婪的；贪得无厌的

sentences.english: He sacrificed his own career so that his avaricious brother could succeed.
sentences.chinese: 他牺牲了自己的事业，其目的是让他贪婪的弟弟成功。

detailed_translations.english: An avaricious person is very greedy for money or possessions

name: acquisitive
trans: adj. 渴望得到的，贪婪的

sentences.english: We live in an acquisitive society.
sentences.chinese: 我们活在一个贪婪的社会里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 渴望得到的， 贪婪的
detailed_translations.english: wanting to have and keep a lot of possessions

name: exacting
trans: adj. 严格的；苛求的；吃力的 v. 逼取；急需（exact 的 ing 形式）

sentences.english: She was an exacting woman to work for.
sentences.chinese: 她是一位对下属要求严格的女性。

detailed_translations.english: demanding a lot of effort, careful work, or skill

name: ascetic
trans: adj. 苦行的；禁欲主义的 n. 苦行者；禁欲者

sentences.english: an ascetic life
sentences.chinese: 清苦的生活

detailed_translations.english: living without any physical pleasures or comforts, especially for religious reasons
An ascetic is someone who is ascetic

name: grim
trans: adj. 严肃的，坚定的；令人不快的，令人沮丧的；阴森的，凄凉的；<非正式>生病的；<英，非正式>质量低劣，糟糕；（地方）简陋的

sentences.english: ‘I’ll survive,’ he said with a grim smile.
sentences.chinese: “我死不了。”他阴笑着说。

sentences.english: The police officers were silent and grim-faced.
sentences.chinese: 警察默不作声，神情严肃。

detailed_translations.english: looking or sounding very serious

name: relentless
trans: adj. 坚韧的，不屈不挠的；残酷无情的，不留情面的；不停的，不间断的

sentences.english: her relentless determination to succeed
sentences.chinese: 她要成功的坚定决心

sentences.english: a regime that was relentless in its persecution of dissidents
sentences.chinese: 无情迫害持不同政见者的政权

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；残酷的；不间断的
detailed_translations.english: strict, cruel, or determined, without ever stopping

name: ruthless
trans: adj. 无情的，冷酷的；（行为等）坚决的，果断的

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator
sentences.chinese: 无情的独裁者

sentences.english: They have shown a ruthless disregard for basic human rights.
sentences.chinese: 他们冷酷地无视基本人权。

detailed_translations.english: so determined to get what you want that you do not care if you have to hurt other people in order to do it

name: rigid
trans: adj. （方法、体制等）严格死板的，僵化的；（人）顽固的，不通融的；刚硬的，不易弯曲的；（因强烈的感情而）僵硬的，僵直的；精确的 n. 未铰接的货车

sentences.english: rigid plastic
sentences.chinese: 硬塑料

detailed_translations.english: stiff and not moving or bending

name: stern
trans: adj. （人或其态度）严厉的，认真的；（工作等）严峻的，棘手的；不屈从的，不动摇的 n. 船尾，艉部

sentences.english: It is placed in the stern of a boat.
sentences.chinese: 它被放在船尾。

detailed_translations.english: the back of a ship
serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of someone’s behaviour

name: stringent
trans: adj. （规定或条件）严格的；紧缩的，银根紧的

sentences.english: stringent anti-noise regulations
sentences.chinese: 严格的防噪音条例

detailed_translations.chinese: 严格的；严厉的；紧缩的；短缺的
detailed_translations.english: a stringent law, rule, standard etc is very strict and must be obeyed

name: scrupulous
trans: adj. 细致的，一丝不苟的；正直的，有道德原则的

sentences.english: scrupulous attention to detail
sentences.chinese: 对细节的一丝不苟

detailed_translations.chinese: 细心的；小心谨慎的；一丝不苟的
detailed_translations.english: doing something very carefully so that nothing is left out

name: drastic
trans: adj. 极端的，激烈的

sentences.english: drastic cuts in government spending
sentences.chinese: 政府开支的急剧削减

sentences.english: Drastic changesare needed if environmental catastrophe is to be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 要想避免环境灾难就需要重大的变革。

detailed_translations.english: extreme and sudden

name: harsh
trans: adj. （环境）恶劣的，艰苦的；严厉的，残酷的；刺耳的，难听的；刺眼的，耀眼的；丑陋的；刺激性强的，太强力的

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

name: rigor
trans: n. （尤指发热之初或高潮时的）寒战；严密，严格（rigour的美式拼法） n. （Rigor）（菲、美）里戈尔（人名）
