sentences.english: We are not so much testing as proposal-thinning, and we can add rigor such as traceability and other documentation as the leading architectural candidates emerge.
sentences.chinese: 我们不像细化提议那样做太多测试，随着最主要的架构候选的出现，我们可以添加严密，如可溯性和其他文档。

sentences.english: The towers, not only ground the buildings with their visual weight, but they also contribute to the rigor of rhythmic play needed in such expansive internal spaces and environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些塔楼不仅利用其视觉上的厚重感将建筑物固定在地面上，还有助于生成这种开阔的内部空间和环境所需的严谨的韵律感。

name: rigorous
trans: adj. （测试、系统或程序）严密的，缜密的；（规则，制度等）严格的，苛刻的；一丝不苟的；严酷的，恶劣的

sentences.english: a rigorous analysis of defence needs
sentences.chinese: 对国防需求的缜密分析

sentences.english: the rigorous standards required by the college
sentences.chinese: 大学规定的严格标准

detailed_translations.english: careful, thorough, and exact

name: serious
trans: adj. 严重的，危急的；认真的，严肃的；重要的，须重视的；（音乐、文学等艺术）严肃的；（人）庄重的，严肃的；<非正式>大量的，极多的；（恋爱中）态度认真的；极感兴趣的，热衷的；<非正式>很好的，质优价高的

sentences.english: the serious problem of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 严重的失业问题

sentences.english: Luckily, the damage was not serious.
sentences.chinese: 还好，损坏不算严重。

sentences.english: Serious crimes have increased dramatically.
sentences.chinese: 重大犯罪案件大幅度增加了。

sentences.english: Oil spills pose a serious threat to marine life.
sentences.chinese: 原油泄漏对海洋生物构成了严重威胁。

sentences.english: The president was in serious trouble .
sentences.chinese: 总统遇到大麻烦了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，严重的；认真的；庄重的；危急的
detailed_translations.english: a serious situation, problem, accident etc is extremely bad or dangerous

name: severe
trans: adj. 十分严重的，极为恶劣的；艰巨的，严峻的；（惩罚、批评）严厉的，重的；严厉的，苛刻的；不加装饰的，朴素的

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: austerity
trans: n. （经济的）紧缩，严格节制消费；艰苦，朴素；苦行，禁欲；（物品的）简朴，无华；严格，严厉

sentences.english: IMF-backed austerity measures
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织支持的经济紧缩措施

detailed_translations.english: when a government has a deliberate policy of trying to reduce the amount of money it spends

name: ordeal
trans: n. 磨难，严峻考验；<史>神明裁判（把被告是否经得起剧痛的考验作为被告是否无辜的神谕）

sentences.english: He was beginning to wonder if he would survive the ordeal.
sentences.chinese: 他开始怀疑自己能否熬过这场磨难。

sentences.english: Teresa had a transplant in 1989 and was just recovering from that ordeal when she suffered a brain hemorrhage.
sentences.chinese: 特雷莎在1989年做了一次移植手术，而正当她刚刚从那可怕的磨难中逐渐恢复时，又患了脑溢血。

sentences.english: Soon the whole terrifying ordeal would be over.
sentences.chinese: 这场恐怖的磨难很快就会过去的。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible or painful experience that continues for a period of time

name: bold
trans: adj. 大胆自信的，敢于冒险的；冒失的，鲁莽的；明显的，轮廓突出的；粗体的，黑体的；<文>陡峭的 n. 黑体，粗体

sentences.english: In a surprisingly bold move , he is threatening court action against the company.
sentences.chinese: 他出人意料地做出一个大胆举动，威胁要起诉这家公司。

sentences.english: My aunt Flo was a bold determined woman.
sentences.chinese: 我姑妈芙洛是一个大胆果断的人。

sentences.english: He had the ability to take bold imaginative decisions.
sentences.chinese: 他能够作出富有创见的大胆决定。

sentences.english: She marched into his office as bold as brass (= very confident and not showing enough respect ).
sentences.chinese: 她放肆地直闯进他的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: not afraid of taking risks and making difficult decisions

name: daring
trans: adj. 勇于冒险的，勇于创新的；大胆的，无畏的 n. 勇气，胆量 v. 敢于，胆敢；激，激将（dare 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: a daring rescue attempt
sentences.chinese: 大胆的营救行动

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of risk or danger, or brave enough to do risky things
courage that makes you willing to take risks

name: undaunted
trans: adj. 勇敢的，无畏的

name: dauntless
trans: adj. 无畏的；勇敢的；不屈不挠的

sentences.english: dauntless optimism
sentences.chinese: 无所畏惧的乐观

detailed_translations.chinese: 无畏的；勇敢的；不屈不挠的
detailed_translations.english: confident and not easily frightened

name: valiant
trans: adj. 英勇的，勇敢的 n. 勇士，勇敢的人

sentences.english: Tarr threw himself in front of a train in a valiant effort to save the child.
sentences.chinese: 塔尔勇敢地冲到火车前去救那个小孩。

detailed_translations.english: very brave, especially in a difficult situation

name: gallant
trans: adj. 英勇的，勇敢的；华丽的；雄伟的 n. （Gallant）人名；（法）加朗；（英）加伦特

sentences.english: a gallant attempt to save lives
sentences.chinese: 救人的勇敢之举

detailed_translations.chinese: 英勇的，勇敢的；华丽的；雄伟的
detailed_translations.english: brave

name: intrepid
trans: adj. 无畏的；勇敢的；勇猛的

sentences.english: intrepid explorers
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的探险家

detailed_translations.english: willing to do dangerous things or go to dangerous places – often used humorously

name: valor
trans: n. 英勇；勇猛（等于 valour） n. （Valor）人名；（西）巴洛尔

sentences.english: The troops showed great valor .
sentences.chinese: 军队表现出极大的英勇。

sentences.english: Fortitude is distinct from valor .
sentences.chinese: 刚毅与勇猛不同。

sentences.english: They owed their lives to the valor of the firemen.
sentences.chinese: 他们将其生命归功于消防员的英勇。 英勇。

name: flighty
trans: adj. 轻浮的；轻狂的；心情浮动的

sentences.english: Isabelle was a frivolous little fool, vain and flighty.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎贝尔曾是一个轻率的小傻瓜，自负而轻浮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻浮的； 反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: a woman who is flighty changes her ideas and opinions often, and only remains interested in people or things for a short time

name: skimpy
trans: adj. 不足的；吝啬的

name: stingy
trans: adj. 吝啬的，小气的；小的，少的；有刺的

sentences.english: She’s too stingy to give money to charity.
sentences.chinese: 她很小气，不愿捐钱行善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的
detailed_translations.english: not generous, especially with money

name: miserly
trans: adj. 吝啬的；贪婪的

sentences.english: He is miserly with both his time and his money.
sentences.chinese: 他对时间和金钱都非常吝啬。

detailed_translations.english: a miserly person is not generous and does not like spending money

name: diverse
trans: adj. 不同的，各式各样的

sentences.english: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
sentences.chinese: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

name: diversify
trans: v. （使）多样化，（使）不同；扩大经营范围，增加……的品种；（投资）多元化；null

sentences.english: We need to diversify the economy.
sentences.chinese: 我们要使经济多元化。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使多样化，使变化；增加产品种类以扩大
detailed_translations.english: if a business, company, country etc diversifies, it increases the range of goods or services it produces

name: fickle
trans: adj. 浮躁的；易变的；变幻无常的

sentences.english: an unpredictable and fickle lover
sentences.chinese: 一个捉摸不透、三心二意的情人

detailed_translations.chinese: 浮躁的；易变的；变幻无常的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fickle is always changing their mind about people or things that they like, so that you cannot depend on them – used to show disapproval

name: manifold
trans: adj. <正式>繁多的，多种多样的 n. 歧管（汽车引擎用以进气和排气）；（内燃机）集管，总管；（数）流形，簇

sentences.english: The reasons for this situation are manifold.
sentences.chinese: 出现这种情况原因是多方面的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复写，复印；增多；使……多样化
多方面的，有许多部分的；各式各样的
detailed_translations.english: many and of different kinds

name: lavish
trans: adj. 奢侈的，盛大的；慷慨的，大方的 v. 慷慨（或过度）给予

sentences.english: a royal palace on a lavish scale
sentences.chinese: 庞大的皇宫

detailed_translations.english: very generous
to give someone or something a lot of love, praise, money etc

name: profuse
trans: adj. 丰富的；很多的；慷慨的；浪费的

sentences.english: He made profuse apologies .
sentences.chinese: 他不住地道歉。

sentences.english: Profuse sweating is one of the symptoms of heat exhaustion.
sentences.chinese: 大量出汗是中暑虚脱的症状之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的；很多的；慷慨的；浪费的
detailed_translations.english: produced or existing in large quantities

name: vary
trans: v. （使）不同，（使）呈现差异；（根据情况而）变化，改变；改变，使……变化；变奏

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

name: various
trans: adj. 各种各样的；迥异的，千差万别的 det. 不止一个的，各别的 pron. 不止一个的，各别的

sentences.english: The jacket is available in various colours.
sentences.chinese: 这种夹克有好多种颜色可选。

sentences.english: There are various ways to answer your question.
sentences.chinese: 有多种方法可以回答你的问题。

sentences.english: He decided to leave school for various reasons.
sentences.chinese: 出于种种原因，他决定辍学。

detailed_translations.chinese: 各种各样的， 不同的
detailed_translations.english: if there are various things, there are several different types of that thing

name: variation
trans: n. 变化，变动；变奏曲；变化，变异；（天文）二均差；（数）变分，变差；磁偏角；（芭蕾）单人舞

sentences.english: Most of his poems are variations on the theme of love.
sentences.chinese: 他的大部分诗作都是有关爱情主题的形式不同的作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变化；[生物] 变异，变种
detailed_translations.english: a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of something

name: variant
trans: n. 变种，变形；（单词拼写或读音的）变异，变体 adj. 不同的，变体的，变种的

sentences.english: Note that you must use the same variant of this option for all compiler runs related to the same project.
sentences.chinese: 注意，对于所有运行的与同一个项目相关的编译器，必须使用这个选项的相同变体。

sentences.english: Product variant: This is a product that is based on another product but with some different characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 产品变体：这是一种基于另一种产品但具备一些不同特性的产品。

sentences.english: A locale is said to be a language only variant of another locale if it has only language code and that language code is the same as that for another locale.
sentences.chinese: 如果某个区域设置仅有语言代码，且语言代码与另一个区域设置相同，则将第一个区域设置称为第二个区域设置的语言变体。

detailed_translations.english: something that is slightly different from the usual form of something

name: mutation
trans: n. （动物或植物的）突变，变异；（基因结构突变产生的）突变体，突变型；（形式的）转变，改变；语流音变，变音

sentences.english: The more people who have the virus, the more virus particles there are for that one, fatal mutation to appear in.
sentences.chinese: 因为如果有越多人感染到病毒，就有越多病毒颗粒可以酝酿出一种致命的突变病毒品种。

sentences.english: Analyzes the factors that influence the stretching changing in the hoisting process and put forward a method that adopting S-curve could reduce the stretching mutation.
sentences.chinese: 分析了提升过程中钢丝绳张力变化的影响因素，提出了采用S曲线速度图是可以减小张力突变的一种方法。

sentences.english: For example, it is hard to say whether an ART baby has died because of the ART technology or because one of its parents had a mutation that mutually contributed to subpar fertility and infant death.
sentences.chinese: 例如，很难说是否一个ART的宝宝会因为ART技术而死亡，或者他父母中的其中一个出现突变，这对于在平均水平以下的受精和婴儿的死亡是互相贡献的。

detailed_translations.english: a change in the  genetic  structure of an animal or plant that makes it different from others of the same kind

name: transition
trans: n. 过渡，转变；（分子生物）转换；（乐）临时转调；（物理）跃迁，转变 v. 转变，过渡

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

name: transform
trans: v. 使改观，使变形，使转化；变换（电流）的电压；（数）变换（数学实体） n. （数，语言学）变换式，转换句；（数，语言学）转换规则

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: enrich
trans: v. 使充实，使丰富；使富裕，使富有；使（土壤）肥沃；浓缩（核燃料中的原子）

sentences.english: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。

sentences.english: Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.chinese: 教育可以大大充实生活。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

name: convert
trans: v. （使）转变，（使）转换；（使）改变信仰，（使）皈依；（达阵后）得附加分；使……迷上，使……热衷于 n. 皈依宗教者，改变信仰者；刚迷上……的人，最近开始热衷于……的人

sentences.english: a 19th-century converted barn
sentences.chinese: 由19世纪谷仓改建的房子

detailed_translations.english: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

name: copious
trans: adj. 丰富的；很多的；多产的

sentences.english: He could drink copious amounts of beer without ill effect.
sentences.chinese: 他可以豪饮啤酒而无不适。

sentences.english: She listened to me and took copious notes .
sentences.chinese: 她边听我说话边记下大量笔记。

detailed_translations.english: existing or being produced in large quantities

name: hostile
trans: adj. 敌对的，怀敌意的；强烈反对的；敌人的，敌方的；艰苦的，不利的；不受（被购公司）欢迎的 n. 敌对分子

sentences.english: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
sentences.chinese: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。

sentences.english: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
sentences.chinese: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。

sentences.english: his hostile attitude
sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

detailed_translations.english: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

name: diverge
trans: v. 相异，出现分歧；岔开，分开；  分化，偏离；使偏离，使分叉；（数）发散

sentences.english: The two species diverged millions of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这两个物种从数百万年前开始朝不同方向演变。

sentences.english: Global growth rates are diverging markedly.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的增长率在发生明显的分化。

detailed_translations.english: if similar things diverge, they develop in different ways and so are no longer similar

name: divergent
trans: adj. 不同的，分歧的；（数）（级数）发散的；（心理）（思维）发散的，求异的

sentences.english: Two people who have divergent views on this question are George Watt and Bob Marr.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上意见相左的两个人是乔治·瓦特和鲍勃·马尔。

detailed_translations.english: Divergent things are different from each other

name: belligerent
trans: adj. 敌对的，好战的；<正式>  参战的，交战的 n. <正式>交战方，交战国

sentences.english: a belligerent attitude
sentences.chinese: 敌对的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 交战的；好战的；交战国的
detailed_translations.english: a belligerent country is fighting a war against another country

detailed_translations.chinese: 交战国；参加斗殴的人或集团

name: repulsive
trans: adj. 排斥的；令人厌恶的；击退的；冷淡的

sentences.english: Many people find slugs repulsive.
sentences.chinese: 很多人觉得鼻涕虫让人恶心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 排斥的；令人厌恶的；击退的；冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: extremely unpleas-ant, in a way that almost makes you feel sick

name: offensive
trans: adj. 无礼的，冒犯的；令人不快（讨厌）的；攻击的，进攻性的； <美>（体育比赛中）进攻的，攻势的 n. （军事）进攻，攻势；  （引人注意的）系列行动，攻势

sentences.english: I found her remarks deeply offensive.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得她的话令人非常恼火。

sentences.english: offensive behaviour
sentences.chinese: 无礼的行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 冒犯的，无礼的；进攻的，攻击性的
detailed_translations.english: very rude or insulting and likely to upset people
a planned military attack involving large forces over a long period

name: strife
trans: n. 冲突，争斗；<澳>麻烦，困难

sentences.english: Money is a major cause of strife in many marriages.
sentences.chinese: 钱在许多婚姻中是导致冲突的一个主要原因。

detailed_translations.english: trouble between two or more people or groups

name: feud
trans: n. 不和；争执；封地;（部落或家族间的）世仇 vi. 长期不和；长期争斗

sentences.english: Insults only served to inflame the feud.
sentences.chinese: 侮辱只是起到了加剧长期不和的作用。

sentences.english: The proclamation may be part of a larger feud within the government, and perhaps in the business world as well, over parceling out regulation of the booming industry.
sentences.chinese: 在这个正在急速壮大的产业中制定规则的宣言可能成为政府内部更大的争执的一部分，商业世界可能也是如此。

sentences.english: They discover that they have some differences, but also that they share many things — including an utter lack of interest in keeping up the feud.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现有了许多不同的地方，同时也有许多相同之处——包括完全没有兴趣继续保持不和。

detailed_translations.english: an angry and often violent quarrel between two people or groups that continues for a long time
to continue quarrelling for a long time, often in a violent way

name: struggle
trans: v. 奋斗，努力；搏斗，扭打，挣扎脱身；争夺，争抢；奋力前进，艰难行进 n. 奋斗，斗争；难事；搏斗，扭打

sentences.english: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 他们不得不同各种困境斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to try extremely hard to achieve something, even though it is very difficult

name: strike
trans: v. 打，撞；（用手或武器等）打；（使）碰撞；罢工；突然想到，突然意识到；突然袭击；（疾病、灾难等）侵袭；（闪电）击中；引起（强烈感情）；（时钟）敲响；达成（协议，妥协），达到（平衡）；发现（黄金，矿物，石油）；铸造（硬币、奖牌）；删除；踢球，击球；攻球得分；使处于特定状态；让（某人）觉得；摆出（姿态）；照在……上；把……迷住；弹奏，奏出；划（火柴）, 击出（火星）；直击（要害），与…...起（原则性）冲突；（在争斗、竞争等中）取得先机；触发（电弧）；（电影摄影术）复制；（金融用语）结算，算出；<加>组成（委员会）；拆除（帐篷，戏剧布景）；降（帆，旗）（以示敬意或投降）；把（枝）插进土里生根；（植物，扦插）生根；（小牡蛎）附着；（渔）急拉钓线把鱼钩住；行进；来到；闯出（或开辟）新的（或独立的）事业 n. 罢工，罢市，罢课；（军事）打击；击，踢；（石油等宝贵资源的）发现；（投出的）好球；（棒球中的）击空；（十柱保龄球）一投全倒；不利因素；拒绝，抗拒；（渔）（对已上钩的鱼）急拉钓线；（地层、断层等地质特征的）走向

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

name: contend
trans: v. 声称，主张；竞争，争夺；处理，对付

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: compete
trans: v. 竞争，对抗；争夺；参加比赛

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: frown
trans: v. 皱眉，蹙额；皱眉对……表示不满；不同意，不许可（frown on/upon） n. 皱眉，蹙额

sentences.english: She frowned as she read the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她看着信皱起了眉头。

detailed_translations.english: to make an angry, unhappy, or confused expression, moving your  eyebrows  together

name: parallel
trans: adj. 平行的；相似的，同时发生的；（计算机）并行的；并联的 n. （人或事物的）相似的手法，共同点；相似的人（或物）；（地球的）纬线，纬圈；（印刷）平行符号 v. 与……相似；与……同时发生；与……并行；与……相当，比得上 adv. 与……平行

sentences.english: Lines AB and CD are parallel. AB
sentences.chinese: 线与CD线平行。

sentences.english: two parallel roads
sentences.chinese: 两条平行的道路

sentences.english: Take the road running parallel to the main road just after the village.
sentences.chinese: 过那个村子后走与主干道平行的路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并列的，平行的；类似的；对应的；并联的
detailed_translations.english: two lines, paths etc that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length

detailed_translations.chinese: 可相比拟的事物，相似处；平行线，平行面；纬线
detailed_translations.english: a relationship or similarity between two things, especially things that exist or happen in different places or at different times

detailed_translations.chinese: 与…相似， 与… 相当， 比得上
detailed_translations.english: if one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and seem to be related

name: tantalize
trans: vt. 逗弄；使干着急 vi. 逗弄人；令人干着急

sentences.english: ...the dreams of democracy that have so tantalized them.
sentences.chinese: …让他们可望而不可及的民主梦想。

detailed_translations.english: to show or promise something that someone really wants, but then not allow them to have it

name: rival
trans: n. 竞争对手，敌手；可与之匹敌者，可与之相比的人（或物） v. 与......相匹敌，比得上 adj. 竞争的，对抗的

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

name: assail
trans: vt. 攻击；质问；着手解决

sentences.english: Protesters assailed the proposed fare increase.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者们抨击了提价的提议。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone or something violently

name: fulminate
trans: vi. 爆炸；电闪；怒喝 vt. 使爆发；以严词谴责 n. 雷酸盐；烈性炸药

sentences.english: The newspapers fulminate against the crime.
sentences.chinese: 报纸严厉谴责这个罪行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 猛烈抨击， 严厉谴责
detailed_translations.english: to criticize someone or something angrily

name: baste
trans: v. 粗缝；（烹调时）浇卤汁于；狠揍；大骂

name: repulse
trans: vt. 拒绝；驱逐；憎恶 n. 拒绝；击退

sentences.english: Government troops repulsed an attack by rebel forces.
sentences.chinese: 政府军击退了叛军的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: to fight someone and successfully stop their attack on you

name: repel
trans: v. 击退，驱逐；抵御，驱除；使厌恶，使反感；抵制，不愿接受；排斥，相斥

sentences.english: The smell repelled him.
sentences.chinese: 这气味让他反感。

detailed_translations.english: if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill

name: emulate
trans: v. 仿效，模仿；仿真；努力赶上 adj. <古>争强好胜的

sentences.english: He hoped to emulate the success of Wilder.
sentences.chinese: 他希望效仿怀尔德的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿真；模仿；尽力赶上；同…竞争
detailed_translations.english: to do something or behave in the same way as someone else, especially because you admire them

name: punch
trans: n. 一拳，一击；<非正式>（出拳打击时所需要的）力量；感染力，活力；打孔器，穿孔机；孔洞；压印器，冲压机；潘趣酒（由果汁和酒制成的甜味饮品）；庞奇（奇形怪状、钩鼻、驼背的小丑，木偶戏《庞奇和朱迪》中的男主角）（Punch）；（矮壮的）萨福克驮马（Suffolk punch）；（矮壮的）萨福克驮马（Suffolk punch） v. 用拳猛击（某人或某物）；按（按钮或键）；（用工具或机器）打孔，扎眼；<美>（用刺棒）赶（牲口）；<美>（用刺棒）赶（牲口）

sentences.english: The guard punched my ticket and I got on.
sentences.chinese: 守卫在我的票上打孔后，我就上去了。

sentences.english: a hole punch
sentences.chinese: 打孔器

detailed_translations.english: to make a hole in something, using a metal tool or other sharp object
a metal tool for cutting holes or for pushing something into a small hole

name: thump
trans: v. 重击，捶击；（心脏）怦怦跳；砰地作响；重步走（或前行），重重（或狠狠）地做；<非正式>彻底击垮；头痛欲裂 n. 重击，捶击；重击声；（尤指恐惧、激动引起的）心脏怦怦跳动声

sentences.english: If you don’t shut up, I’m going to thump you!
sentences.chinese: 你要是不住嘴，我就揍你！

sentences.english: She thumped the table with her fist.
sentences.chinese: 她挥拳砸在桌子上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重击；用拳头打；砰地撞到
detailed_translations.english: to hit someone very hard with your hand closed
the dull sound that is made when something hits a surface

name: adverse
trans: adj. 不利的，有害的；相反的；敌对的

sentences.english: They fear it could have an adverse effect on global financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心这会对全球金融市场产生不利影响。

sentences.english: Miller’s campaign has received a good deal of adverse publicity .
sentences.chinese: 米勒的竞选活动招来许多负面报道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）
detailed_translations.english: not good or favourable

name: impact
trans: n. 撞击，冲击力；巨大影响，强大作用 v. 冲击，撞击；挤入，压紧；（对……）产生影响

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

name: admonish
trans: vt. 告诫；劝告

sentences.english: They admonished me for taking risks with my health.
sentences.chinese: 他们告诫我不要拿自己的健康来冒险。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone severely that they have done something wrong

name: stab
trans: v. （用刀等锐器）刺，戳，捅；（用手指或尖物）戳，捅，刺；（疼痛或痛苦的东西）刺痛；（话语）刺伤，刺痛；突然感到（一阵不愉快或负面的感情）；（迅速地）击（球），踢（球） n. 刺，戳，捅，刺（或戳、捅）的伤口；突然一阵剧痛（或难受的感觉）；<非正式>尝试，企图；（流行音乐）乐节间的断音

sentences.english: He was stabbed to death in a fight.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次打斗中被捅死了。

detailed_translations.english: to push a knife into someone or something
an act of stabbing or trying to stab someone with a knife

name: sheathe
trans: vt. 覆盖；插入鞘；包装

name: insert
trans: v. 插入，嵌入；（在文章中）添加，加插；使参与（活动）；（肌肉或其他器官）附着于（尤指移动部分） n. 插入物；（尤指）插页，附加页；（电影等的）插入镜头

sentences.english: He took a small key from his pocket and slowly inserted it into the lock.
sentences.chinese: 他从衣袋里掏出一把小钥匙，然后缓缓地将其插入锁孔里。

detailed_translations.english: to put something inside or into something else

detailed_translations.chinese: 插入物；管芯；镶块；[机械]刀片
detailed_translations.english: something that is designed to be put inside something else

name: pierce
trans: v. （锋利尖锐物体）刺入，刺穿；（在身体某部位）扎眼，穿孔（以佩戴珠宝）；（声或光）穿过，透入；冲过，突破；让某人心如刀割，深深地打动

sentences.english: Steam the corn until it can easily be pierced with a fork.
sentences.chinese: 把玉米蒸到用叉子可以轻易扎透。

sentences.english: Rose underwent emergency surgery after a bullet pierced her lung.
sentences.chinese: 罗丝被子弹射穿肺部，接受了紧急手术。

detailed_translations.english: to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point
to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point

name: transfix
trans: vt. 钉住；刺穿；使呆住

name: impale
trans: vt. 刺穿；钉住；使绝望

sentences.english: Researchers observed one bird impale a rodent on a cactus.
sentences.chinese: 研究人员观察到，一只鸟把一个啮齿动物钉到了一棵仙人掌上。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is impaled, a sharp pointed object goes through them

name: penetrate
trans: v. 刺入，穿透；打进（某地区或国家的市场）；渗入，打入（组织、团体等）；洞察，了解；被理解，被领悟；透过……看见，看穿；（以阴茎）插入

sentences.english: bullets that penetrate thick armour plating
sentences.chinese: 穿过厚装甲的子弹

sentences.english: Sunlight barely penetrated the dirty windows.
sentences.chinese: 阳光几乎照不进那些肮脏的窗户。

detailed_translations.english: to enter something and pass or spread through it, especially when this is difficult

name: interject
trans: vt. 突然插入；插嘴

sentences.english: ‘That’s absolute rubbish!’ he interjected.
sentences.chinese: “那全是废话！”他突然插话道。

detailed_translations.english: to interrupt what someone else is saying with a sudden remark

name: punch
trans: n. 一拳，一击；<非正式>（出拳打击时所需要的）力量；感染力，活力；打孔器，穿孔机；孔洞；压印器，冲压机；潘趣酒（由果汁和酒制成的甜味饮品）；庞奇（奇形怪状、钩鼻、驼背的小丑，木偶戏《庞奇和朱迪》中的男主角）（Punch）；（矮壮的）萨福克驮马（Suffolk punch）；（矮壮的）萨福克驮马（Suffolk punch） v. 用拳猛击（某人或某物）；按（按钮或键）；（用工具或机器）打孔，扎眼；<美>（用刺棒）赶（牲口）；<美>（用刺棒）赶（牲口）

sentences.english: The guard punched my ticket and I got on.
sentences.chinese: 守卫在我的票上打孔后，我就上去了。

sentences.english: a hole punch
sentences.chinese: 打孔器

detailed_translations.english: to make a hole in something, using a metal tool or other sharp object
a metal tool for cutting holes or for pushing something into a small hole

name: successful
trans: adj. 成功的，如愿以偿的；事业有成的，飞黄腾达的；（公司、影片、产品等）利润丰厚的，非常赚钱的

sentences.english: The operation was successful.
sentences.chinese: 手术成功了。

sentences.english: a highly successful (= very successful ) meeting
sentences.chinese: 十分成功的会议

detailed_translations.english: achieving what you wanted, or having the effect or result you intended

name: incipient
trans: adj. 初期的；初始的；起初的；发端的

sentences.english: a sign of incipient madness
sentences.chinese: 精神失常的早期征兆

detailed_translations.chinese: 初期的；初始的；起初的；发端的
detailed_translations.english: starting to happen or exist

name: initiate
trans: v. 开始实施，发起；使了解，传授；（尤指在秘密仪式上）使加入，接纳 n. 新加入某组织的人，新入会的人

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

name: initial
trans: adj. 开始的，最初的；（字母）位于词首的 n. （姓名的）首字母 v. 用姓名的首字母作标记（或签名）于

sentences.english: an initial investment of £5,000
sentences.chinese: 5,000英镑的初始投资

sentences.english: The initial response has been encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

detailed_translations.english: happening at the beginning
the first letter of someone’s first name

name: foremost
trans: adj. 最前的，最重要的 adv. 首先，第一；最基础地，最重要地

sentences.english: Economic concerns are foremost on many voters’ minds.
sentences.chinese: 经济是许多选民关心的首要问题。

sentences.english: Rostropovich was long considered the world’s foremost cellist.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，罗斯特罗波维奇一直被视为世界上首屈一指的大提琴家。

detailed_translations.english: in a leading position among a group of people or things

name: original
trans: adj. 起初的，原先的；原作的，真迹的；新创作的，未发表的；独创的，新颖的；有独到见解的，有独创性的 n. （艺术作品或文件的）原件，原稿；（文学作品中人物或地点的）原型；原版书，原版唱片；（根据服装展特制图样定做的）真品原板服装；<非正式>（举止、服装等）怪异滑稽的人，独特有趣的人

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

name: originally
trans: adv. 起初，原来；独创地，新颖地

sentences.english: The family originally came from France.
sentences.chinese: 这个家族最初来自法国。

sentences.english: The building was originally used as a prison.
sentences.chinese: 这幢建筑最初用作监狱。

sentences.english: We originally intended to stay for just a few days.
sentences.chinese: 我们原先打算只逗留几天。

sentences.english: Originally, we had planned a tour of Scotland but we didn’t go in the end.
sentences.chinese: 起先我们计划到苏格兰旅游，但最后没有成行。

detailed_translations.english: in the beginning, before other things happened or before other things changed

name: primary
trans: adj. 主要的，首要的；<英>小学教育的，初级教育的；初级的，原发性的；最基本的，最根本的；第一手的，直接的；（有机化合物）连上一个碳原子的；（多指胺）（氨基酸顺序）一级的 n. （选举过程中的党内）初选（=primary election）；原色；初级飞羽；主星；初级线圈，原线圈

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: eventual
trans: adj. 最终的，结局的；<古>有条件的

sentences.english: Sweden were the eventual winners of the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典队是锦标赛的最后赢家。

sentences.english: Both sides were happy with the eventual outcome of the talks.
sentences.chinese: 双方对会谈的最终结果都感到满意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最后的，结果的；可能的；终于的
detailed_translations.english: happening at the end of a long period of time or after a lot of other things have happened

name: ultimate
trans: adj. 最终的，最后的；最根本的，最基础的；极限的，终极的；首要的，决定性的；（太空或时空中）最遥远的；（物理）极限的 n. 最好的事物，最终的事物；最终（或最根本）的事实（或原则）；<美>极限飞盘（Ultimate Frisbee 的简称） v. 结束

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

name: final
trans: adj. 最终的，结束的；(出现次序)最后的，末尾的；决定性的，不可变更的；无比的，极度的 n. 决赛；期末考试，课程终结考试；主调音；当日报纸的末版；（飞机进入着陆跑道的）最终边，第五边

sentences.english: The final episode will be shown tonight.
sentences.chinese: 最后一集将于今晚播出。

sentences.english: students preparing for their final examinations
sentences.chinese: 正在准备期末考试的学生

sentences.english: Stone is filming the final instalment of his Vietnam trilogy.
sentences.chinese: 斯通正在拍摄越战三部曲的最后一部。

sentences.english: the final stages in their relationship
sentences.chinese: 他们之间关系的最后阶段

sentences.english: They scored in the final minutes of the game.
sentences.chinese: 他们在比赛的最后几分钟得分。

sentences.english: We can advise the client, but in the end it is he who has the final say.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以提出建议，但是最终的决定权还是在客户自己手里。

detailed_translations.english: last in a series of actions, events, parts of a story etc

name: progress
trans: n. 进步，进展；前进，行进；（社会的）进步 v. 进步，进展；使（任务，事业）取得持续进展；（时间）推移，流逝；缓慢行进；（占星）计算行星（或星象图各星及坐标）的位置

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

name: triumph
trans: n. 巨大成功，重大胜利；（胜利或成功的）喜悦，狂喜；（成功的）典范，楷模；古罗马凯旋式 v. 获胜，成功；（因胜利或成功而）欣喜，欢跃；（古罗马将军）凯旋而归

sentences.english: All her life, Kelly had stuck with difficult tasks and challenges, and triumphed.
sentences.chinese: 凯利在一生中遭遇了种种艰巨任务与挑战，但成功了。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something triumphs, they gain complete success, control, or victory, often after a long or difficult struggle
an important victory or success after a difficult struggle

name: culmination
trans: n. 终点，高潮；<旧>（天体的）达于中天

sentences.english: This little book represented the culmination of 15 years’ work.
sentences.chinese: 这本小书是15年工作的结晶。

detailed_translations.english: something, especially something important, that happens at the end of a long period of effort or development

name: peak
trans: n. 巅峰，顶点；山顶；有尖峰的山；尖端，尖顶；帽檐，帽舌；极值，峰值；（艏或艉的）尖舱；斜桁外端，（帆的）后上角 v. 达到高峰，达到最大值；<古>消瘦，衰弱，精神萎靡 adj. 巅峰状态的，最高的；高峰时期的

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

name: process
trans: n. 步骤，程序；（自然或偶然的）变化过程；（为达到某目标的）过程，进程；制作方法，加工方法；<法律>传票；（生，剖）端突，突起 adj. （印刷）三原色的，三色版的； 经过特殊加工的；照相板的 v. （用化学物品或机器）处理，加工；审核，受理（正式文件或请求）；（计算机）处理（数据）；冲洗（照片）；加工（食品）；<正式>列队行进；把（头发）弄成直发

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

name: phase
trans: n. （发展或变化的）阶段，时期；做出某种行为的短时期；（动物生活周期或年周期的）阶段，期；（月亮的）位相，盈亏；同步，协调；（化）相；（动）（由遗传或季节引起的）动物颜色变化（期）；（物理）相位，相角；（线圈的）匝，（多相电机或电路的）连接；（语言学）（系统语法用语）相（指链接动词与后续动词的关系）；相结构（含有链接动词和后续动词的结构） v. 分阶段进行；（物理）使相位同步，使定相

sentences.english: a new drug that is in the experimental phase
sentences.chinese: 处于试验阶段的一种新药

sentences.english: It’s just a phase he’s going through.
sentences.chinese: 这只是他要经历的一个阶段。

detailed_translations.english: one of the stages of a process of development or change

name: condition
trans: n. 状况，状态；条件，环境；疾病；条款；<旧>社会地位 v. 训练，使习惯于；控制，制约；护理，保养；影响；加条件于；使（人，动物）健康；（发酵后，在酵母仍存在时）使（啤酒，黑啤酒）酿熟

sentences.english: Profits increased by £1.5m, despite the difficult economic conditions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管经济形势不佳，利润还是增长了150万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

name: status
trans: n. 法律地位（或身份）；（尤指在社会中的）地位，身份；高级职位，社会上层地位；重视（或崇尚）程度；状况，情形

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

name: result
trans: n. 结果，后果；（比赛或选举的）结果；（通过调查、研究、计算而获得的）结果；<英> 考试成绩；成效，成果（results）；经营业绩（results）；<英，非正式>（体育比赛中）胜局，获胜 v. 发生，产生；导致，造成（注明的结局或结果） int. <非正式> 成功了！（Result!）

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

name: headway
trans: n. 前进；进步；航行速度；间隔时间

sentences.english: Stormy weather stopped the ship from making headway.
sentences.chinese: 船在暴风雨天气里不能向前开。

detailed_translations.chinese: 前进；进步；航行速度；间隔时间
detailed_translations.english: to move forwards – used especially when this is slow or difficult

name: onset
trans: n. （尤指某种坏事情的）开始，发作；军事攻击

sentences.english: the onset of winter
sentences.chinese: 冬天的来临

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始，着手；发作；攻击，进攻
detailed_translations.english: the beginning of something, especially something bad

name: halt
trans: v. （使）停止行进；阻止，中断；（口令）立定；跛行；（尤指逻辑或诗韵）有缺陷；踌躇，犹豫 n. 停止，中止；<英>乡间小火车站（只有站台）；跛，瘸； 跛，瘸；（口令）立定 adj. 跛的，瘸的

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

name: develop
trans: v. （使）成长，发育，发展；逐渐形成，逐渐养成；开发，研制；出现，产生；修建，开发土地；提高，加强；患病；阐释，展开；冲洗，使底片显影；（修改旋律、和声或节奏以）展开（音乐主题）；（棋）出子

sentences.english: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。

sentences.english: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

sentences.english: exercises to develop muscle strength
sentences.chinese: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

sentences.english: He had developed a certain affection for me.
sentences.chinese: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.english: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make sth do this

name: resume
trans: v. 恢复（职位），回到（座位）；继续说，接着说；概述；（中断后）重新开始，继续 n. 梗概，摘要（résumé或resumé）；<美>简历，履历（résumé或resumé）

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: exit
trans: n. 出口，通道，太平门；（车辆驶出公路的）出路；离去；退出；<文>去世，死亡 v. 退出（电脑程序）；退场（剧本里的舞台指示）；<文>去世，死亡；摊牌让分；离去

sentences.english: We made for the nearest exit.
sentences.chinese: 我们走向最近的出口。

sentences.english: an exit door
sentences.chinese: 出口门

sentences.english: Two men were blocking her exit.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人挡住了她出去的路。

detailed_translations.english: a door or space through which you can leave a public room, building etc
to leave a place

name: climax
trans: n. 高潮，顶点；性高潮；（植物群落演替达到平衡的）顶极（群落）；层进法 v. 达到性高潮；达到高潮，达到顶点

sentences.english: The festival reaches its climax with the traditional boat-burning ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 传统的烧船仪式将节庆活动推向了高潮。

sentences.english: the climax of his naval career
sentences.chinese: 他海军生涯的巅峰

detailed_translations.english: the most exciting or important part of a story or experience, which usually comes near the end

name: emerge
trans: v. 浮现，出现；显露，知悉；恢复过来，幸存下来；形成，兴起

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: proceed
trans: v. 开始行动，开展；<正式>继续做（或从事、进行）；（完成其他事后）继续做某事；<正式>行进，前往；起诉某人；来自，出自 n. （某个事件或活动的）收入，收益

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

name: commence
trans: v. 开始，着手

sentences.english: Work will commence on the new building immediately.
sentences.chinese: 新大楼即将破土动工。

detailed_translations.english: to begin or to start something

name: vanish
trans: v. 突然不见，消失；不复存在，灭绝；（数学）变为零；使不见，使消失 n. 弱化音

sentences.english: My keys were here a minute ago but now they’ve vanished.
sentences.chinese: 我的钥匙刚刚还在这里，现在却不翼而飞了。

sentences.english: The bird vanished from sight.
sentences.chinese: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。

sentences.english: She seemed to have just vanished into thin air (= suddenly disappeared in a very mysterious way ).
sentences.chinese: 她好像就蒸发了似的。

detailed_translations.english: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

name: launch
trans: v. 发动，发起；上市，发行；使（船或舰）下水；发射（武器或宇宙飞船）；启动（计算机程序）；投出，用力扔出；使投身于（事业等）；起飞，出海 n. （航天器的）发射；（产品的）上市；（事件的）发起；汽艇，游艇；（新产品，出版物）发布会，推介会

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

name: engender
trans: v. 产生，引起（某种感觉或情况）

sentences.english: In such circumstances, governments must do all they can to create and engender trust among its nation’s constituents and institutions.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，政府必须尽其所能在它的国家选民和公共机构之间创造和产生信任。

sentences.english: Retrospectives on the process and working practices regularly capture the lessons learned by the project and engender a culture of continuous process improvement within the project.
sentences.chinese: 对过程和工作实践的回顾有规律地捕捉从项目中得到的经验，并在项目中造成一个持续的过程改进的文化。

name: beget
trans: vt. 产生；招致；引起；当……的父亲

sentences.english: Hunger begets crime.
sentences.chinese: 饥饿滋生犯罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 产生；招致；引起；当…的父亲
detailed_translations.english: to cause something or make it happen

name: generate
trans: v. 产生，引起

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

name: terminate
trans: v. （使）结束，（使）终止；到达终点站；终止妊娠，人工流产；<美>解雇；<美>谋杀（某人）；在……结尾，以……收尾 adj. 结束的

sentences.english: The court ruled that the contract must be terminated.
sentences.chinese: 法庭裁决该合同必须终止。

sentences.english: to terminate a pregnancy (= to perform or have an abortion )
sentences.chinese: 终止妊娠（堕胎）

detailed_translations.english: ito end; to make sth end

name: accomplished
trans: adj. 熟练的，才华高的；娴于社交的；很成功的，非常优秀的；<英>完成的 v. 完成，实现（accomplish 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: However, we also must look at what was not accomplished.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我们也必须看看有哪些“未完成的事业”。

sentences.english: And how is this accomplished well except by general principles, some about the nature of the universe, and others about the proper constitution of man?
sentences.chinese: 而除非通过一些有关宇宙本性的普遍原则和另一些有关人的恰当结构的普遍原则，怎么能好好完成此事呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 完成了的； 有技巧的

name: conclude
trans: v. 断定，推断出；结束，终止；达成，做成，完成；<美>决定

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

name: conclusive
trans: adj. 结论性的，毫无疑问的

sentences.english: Her attorneys claim there is no conclusive evidence that any murders took place.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师们声称没有任何发生过谋杀的确凿证据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的； 最后的； 决定性的
detailed_translations.english: showing that something is definitely true

name: advance
trans: v. （使）前进，（使）向前移动；发展，进步；预付；提前，提早；促进，推动；提出（想法或理论）；上涨，增加；提拔，晋升 n. 前进；进步，进展；改善；预付款；勾引，追求；（价格、价值的）上涨；贷款 adj. 预先的，事先的；先行的，先遣的

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: achieve
trans: v. （经努力）达到，取得，实现；获得成功

sentences.english: Frances achieved very good exam results.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西丝考试取得了优异成绩。

sentences.english: Wilson has achieved considerable success as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊作为一名艺术家成就斐然。

sentences.english: She eventually achieved her goal of becoming a professor.
sentences.chinese: 她终于实现目标，当上了教授。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard

name: detach
trans: v. 拆下，使分离；脱离，摆脱；派遣，分派

sentences.english: Please detach and fill out the application form.
sentences.chinese: 请撕下申请表并填好。

detailed_translations.english: to remove sth from sth larger; to become separated from sth

name: detached
trans: adj. 超然的，不带感情的，客观的；单独的，分离的 v. 拆下，使分离；脱离，摆脱；派遣（detach 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: He tries to remain emotionally detached from the prisoners, but fails.
sentences.chinese: 他想尽力保持对囚犯们不掺杂个人感情，却做不到。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is detached is not personally involved in something or has no emotional interest in it

name: solitude
trans: n. 独居，独处，孤独；偏僻的地方，无人居住的地方

sentences.english: the solitude of her house on the lake
sentences.chinese: 她湖边那所房子的清静

detailed_translations.english: when you are alone, especially when this is what you enjoy

name: sever
trans: v. 切下，（使）断裂，割断；断绝（关系、联系等）

sentences.english: Martin’s hand was severed in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 马丁的一只手在事故中被切断了。

sentences.english: a severed rope
sentences.chinese: 割断的绳子

detailed_translations.english: to cut through something completely, separating it into two parts, or to become cut in this way

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sever)人名；(俄)谢韦尔；(捷、塞、意、西、土、瑞典、罗)塞韦尔；(英)塞弗；(德)泽弗

name: rend
trans: vt. 撕碎；分裂；强夺 vi. 将……撕开；使……分离 n. （Rend）人名；（英、匈）伦德

sentences.english: ...pain that rends the heart.
sentences.chinese: ...撕心裂肺的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to tear or break something violently into pieces

name: segregate
trans: v. （尤指因种族、性别、宗教不同而）使隔离，使分开；实行种族隔离；（使）分开，分离；（成对的等位基因）分离 n. （遗传）分离子；（植物学）集合物种中的一种

sentences.english: A large detachment of police was used to segregate the two rival camps of protesters.
sentences.chinese: 一大队分遣警察被派来隔离两群敌对的抗议者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使隔离；使分离；在…实行种族隔离
detailed_translations.english: to separate one group of people from others, especially because they are of a different race, sex, or religion

name: disunite
trans: vt. 不和；使分离 vi. 分散；分离；变得分离

detailed_translations.english: to separate or become separate; disrupt

name: scatter
trans: v. 撒，播撒；（使）散开，（使）散布在各处；（物理）散射（电磁辐射或粒子）；（棒球）（被击中但没有得分的）有效投（球） n. 零星散布的东西；（统计）（对某一变量作反复测量或观察所得数值的）离差；（物理）（光、其他电磁波或粒子的）散射

sentences.english: The sound of gunfire made the crowd scatter in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 枪声使人群四散奔逃。

detailed_translations.english: if a group of people or animals scatter, or if something scatters them, they move quickly in different directions

name: cushion
trans: n. 垫子，坐垫；减震垫，缓冲垫；起缓解作用的东西；大比分领先，稳操胜券；（台球桌的）弹性衬边 v. 缓冲；减轻……的影响；给…安上垫子，把……安置在垫子上

sentences.english: a velvet cushion
sentences.chinese: 天鹅绒垫子

sentences.english: a cushion cover
sentences.chinese: 垫子套

detailed_translations.chinese: 垫子；起缓解作用之物；（猪等的）臀肉；银行储蓄
detailed_translations.english: a cloth bag filled with soft material that you put on a chair or the floor to make it more comfortable

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…安上垫子；把…安置在垫子上；缓和…的冲击
detailed_translations.english: to make the effect of a fall or hit less painful, for example by having something soft in the way

name: soothe
trans: v. 使平静，安抚；减轻，缓和（疼痛）

sentences.english: Lucy soothed the baby by rocking it in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 露西把宝宝抱在怀里摇晃着，让他安静下来。

sentences.english: She made a cup of tea to soothe her nerves.
sentences.chinese: 她泡了杯茶让自己平静下来。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry

name: relax
trans: v. 休息，（使）放松；放心，镇定；松开，（使）松弛；放宽（规则或法律等）； 减少（关注），分散（注意力）；烫直（头发）

sentences.english: Gentle exercise can relax stiff shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 和缓的运动可以使僵硬的肩部肌肉放松。

detailed_translations.english: if you relax a part of your body or it relaxes, it becomes less stiff or less tight
to rest or do something that is enjoyable, especially after you have been working

name: placate
trans: v. 平息，安抚；怀柔

sentences.english: These changes did little to placate the unions.
sentences.chinese: 这些变革对于工会没有起到多少安抚作用。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone stop feeling angry

name: console
trans: v. 安慰，慰藉 n. 控制台，仪表盘；电视机（或收音机）柜；风琴的操作部分；（带装饰的）支架，支托

sentences.english: No one could console her when Peter died.
sentences.chinese: 彼得去世时没人能够安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel better when they are feeling sad or disappointed
a flat board that contains the controls for a machine, piece of electrical equipment, computer etc

name: assuage
trans: vt. 平息；缓和；减轻

sentences.english: Nothing could assuage his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 什么都不能减轻他的内疚。

detailed_translations.english: to make an unpleasant feeling less painful or severe

name: mollify
trans: v. （使）平静，平息怒气；安抚，抚慰；缓和，减轻

sentences.english: He attempted to mollify her.
sentences.chinese: 他想安抚她。

sentences.english: Nature reserves were set up around new power stations to mollify local conservationists.
sentences.chinese: 新的发电站附近建立了自然保护区，以安抚当地的自然环境保护主义者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平息，缓和；使…平静；使…变软
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less angry and upset about something

name: mitigate
trans: v. <正式>减轻，缓和

sentences.english: Measures need to be taken to mitigate the environmental effects of burning more coal.
sentences.chinese: 需要采取措施来减轻燃煤增加对环境造成的影响。

detailed_translations.english: to make a situation or the effects of something less unpleasant, harmful, or serious

name: slacken
trans: vi. 松劲，懈怠；变松弛；变缓慢 vt. 使缓慢；使松弛

sentences.english: The heavy rain showed no signs of slackening off.
sentences.chinese: 大雨没有减弱的迹象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 松劲，懈怠；变松弛；变缓慢
detailed_translations.english: to gradually become slower, weaker, less active etc, or to make something do this

name: pacify
trans: vt. 使平静；安慰；平定

sentences.english: ‘You’re right,’ Rita said, in order to pacify him.
sentences.chinese: “你是对的。”丽塔安抚他道。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone calm, quiet, and satisfied after they have been angry or upset

name: rally
trans: v. 召集，集合；公开支持（或反对）；重新集合，重整（军队）；恢复，重新振作；动员（全体人员）发愤图强；（价格）回升，升值；参加汽车拉力赛；<古>对……善意打趣，嘲笑 n. 集会，大会；赛车，汽车拉力赛；（网球等比赛中的）相持，拉锯；（球队技艺的）改进，提高；恢复健康，康复；（尤指股价）止跌回升

sentences.english: After a shaky start, he rallied and won the title in style.
sentences.chinese: 虽然开局不顺，但他振作精神，最后漂亮地赢得了冠军。

sentences.english: The Tokyo stock market rallied later in the day.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚些时候东京股市止跌回升。

detailed_translations.chinese: 团结；重整；恢复；（网球等）连续对打
detailed_translations.english: to become stronger again after a period of weakness or defeat
a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc

name: revive
trans: v. （使）复原，（使）复苏；重新唤起，重新记起；重新使用，使复兴；重新上演

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

name: revert
trans: v. 回复，恢复（到原来状态、情况或做法）（revert to）；（财产、权力、金钱等）归还；皈依（伊斯兰教）；返祖遗传 n. 皈依伊斯兰教者

sentences.english: Jackson said her boss became increasingly depressed and reverted to smoking heavily.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊说她的老板变得越来越抑郁，又重新大量吸烟了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回复；重提；返祖遗传；归还
detailed_translations.english: When people or things revert to a previous state, system, or type of behaviour, they go back to it

name: retract
trans: vt. 缩回；缩进；取消 vi. 缩回；缩进；撤消 n. 收缩核

sentences.english: The sea otter can retract the claws on its front feet.
sentences.chinese: 海獭能缩回前掌上的爪子。

detailed_translations.english: if part of a machine or an animal’s body retracts or is retracted, it moves back into the main part

name: retrieve
trans: v. 找回，收回；检索（储存于计算机的信息）；（狗等）衔回（物品、猎物）；挽救，挽回；回忆，追忆；收绕钓鱼线 n. （尤指中枪猎物的）找回；收绕钓鱼线；<古> 恢复的可能性；检索

sentences.english: She bent down to retrieve her earring.
sentences.chinese: 她俯身去捡回耳环。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新得到， 取回， 收回； 挽回， 补救； 检索
detailed_translations.english: to find something and bring it back

name: energize
trans: vt. 激励；使活跃；供给……能量 vi. 活动；用力

sentences.english: He helped energize and mobilize millions of people around the nation.
sentences.chinese: 他参与激励并动员了全国数百万人。

sentences.english: I am completely energized and feeling terrific.
sentences.chinese: 我现在充满了活力，感觉棒极了。

detailed_translations.english: To energize someone means to give them the enthusiasm and determination to do something

name: restore
trans: v. 恢复（某种情况或感受）；使复原，使复位；修复，整修；重新采用，恢复使用；归还

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: rehabilitate
trans: v. （监禁、戒毒或病后通过培训和治疗）使恢复正常生活；恢复……的权利，恢复……的名誉；使（建筑物或地区）恢复原状，修复

sentences.english: a special unit for rehabilitating stroke patients
sentences.chinese: 协助中风患者康复的特殊病房

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复地位；使残疾者恢复正常的生活
detailed_translations.english: to help someone to live a healthy, useful, or active life again after they have been seriously ill or in prison

name: recover
trans: v. 恢复（健康，精神，体力）；康复，复原（be recovered）；（从不愉快的经历中）恢复；（从弱势或困境中）好转，扭转；重新获得，寻回；收回（开支、投资等）；恢复（意识、神志或身体状态）；挽回（地位），弥补（时间损失）；提取（能源或化工品等），回收利用； 给……换上新面 n. （军事操练）枪还原，收枪（the recover）

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: revoke
trans: v. 撤回，撤销；（桥牌、惠斯特等牌戏中）有牌不跟 n. 有牌不跟

sentences.english: Their work permits have been revoked.
sentences.chinese: 他们的工作许可证被吊销了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially state that a law, decision, or agreement is no longer effective

name: refresh
trans: v. 使恢复精神，使消除疲劳；使记起，提醒；翻新，使变新；刷新，更新（网页）；<美> 再斟满（饮料）；把（食物）浸入冷水冷却（或保鲜）；恢复精神；喝饮料，吃点心；补充给养 n. （计算机）刷新

sentences.english: A shower will refresh you.
sentences.chinese: 洗个淋浴你就凉快了。

sentences.english: He refreshed himself with a glass of iced tea.
sentences.chinese: 他喝了杯冰茶提了提神。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less tired or less hot

name: intricate
trans: adj. 错综复杂的；难理解的，难学会的

sentences.english: intricate patterns
sentences.chinese: 繁复的图案

detailed_translations.chinese: 错综复杂的， 复杂精细的
detailed_translations.english: containing many small parts or details that all work or fit together

name: complex
trans: adj. 复杂的，难懂的；组合的，合成的；（句子）复合的；复数的，复的；配合的，络合的 n. 综合大楼，建筑群；复合体，综合体；情结；强烈（或过度）的关心（或忧虑）；配合物，络合物

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: disarray
trans: n. 无秩序；杂乱；衣冠不整 vt. 使混乱；弄乱；使脱去衣服

sentences.english: The nation is in disarray following rioting led by the military.
sentences.chinese: 该国发生由军队发动的暴乱后，陷入一片混乱。

detailed_translations.english: If people or things are in disarray, they are disorganized and confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 使混乱；弄乱；使脱去衣服

name: confuse
trans: v. 使糊涂，使迷惑；混淆，弄错；使复杂化

sentences.english: People might well confuse the two products.
sentences.chinese: 人们很容易混淆这两种产品。

detailed_translations.english: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

name: jumble
trans: n. 混乱；杂乱的一堆东西 vi. 混杂；搀杂 vt. 使混乱；搞乱

sentences.english: The photographs were all jumbled up.
sentences.chinese: 照片乱七八糟地堆在一起。

sentences.english: Ben’s words became jumbled.
sentences.chinese: 本开始语无伦次起来。

detailed_translations.english: to mix things together in an untidy way, without any order
a lot of different things mixed together in an untidy way, without any order

name: shuffle
trans: v. 拖着脚走；（因不适、紧张或尴尬而）坐立不安，把脚动来动去；将（纸张等）变换位置，打乱顺序；洗（牌）；匆忙地整理（或浏览）；笨拙地穿上；随机播放；逃避责任（或义务）；<古>躲闪，支吾，搪塞 n. 拖着脚走；洗牌；曳步舞；慢切分节奏，曳步舞拍；变换位置；搅乱，改组；（CD 机上）非顺序自由播放装置

sentences.english: Is it my turn to shuffle?
sentences.chinese: 轮到我洗牌了吗？

sentences.english: Just shuffle the cards .
sentences.chinese: 请洗牌吧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗牌；推诿，推卸；拖曳，慢吞吞地走；搅乱
detailed_translations.english: to mix  playing card s  into a different order before playing a game with them

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗牌，洗纸牌；混乱，蒙混；拖着脚走
detailed_translations.english: a slow walk in which you do not lift your feet off the ground

name: complicate
trans: v. 使复杂化，使难以理解；引起并发症；使卷入，使陷入

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: If the answer to all of these questions is no, a framework will only complicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

sentences.english: The selection service is one of the more difficult services to implement correctly because it has some valuable features that complicate the implementation.
sentences.chinese: 选择服务是比较难以正确实现的服务之一，因为它具有一些使实现复杂化的有价值的功能。

name: befuddle
trans: v. 使糊涂，使迷惑；使昏沉，使昏迷

sentences.english: ...problems that are befuddling them.
sentences.chinese: ...使他们困惑的问题。

detailed_translations.english: If something befuddles you, it confuses your mind or thoughts

name: muddle
trans: v. 把……弄乱，把……混在一起；混淆，分不清；使困惑；懵懵懂懂地白忙；<美>调制（饮料），调（酒）；使糊涂，使迷惑 n. 糊涂，茫然；（局面）一团糟，混乱；乱七八糟

sentences.english: The twins are so alike that it’s easy to muddle them up.
sentences.chinese: 这对双胞胎看上去太像了，很容易弄混。

sentences.english: Spanish and Italian are very similar and I sometimes get them muddled up .
sentences.chinese: 西班牙语和意大利语很相似，我有时会把它们弄混。

detailed_translations.chinese: 混合；使咬字不清晰；使微醉
detailed_translations.english: to confuse one person or thing with another, and make a mistake
when there is confusion about something, and things are done wrong as a result

name: assemble
trans: v. （使）集合，（使）聚集；装配，组装

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: assembly
trans: n. 议会，代表大会；集会，集会者；装配，组装；（计算机）汇编

sentences.english: Police have imposed conditions on public assemblies.
sentences.chinese: 警方给公共集会设置了条件。

sentences.english: Restrictions on freedom of assembly have gradually been relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 对集会自由的限制渐渐放宽了。

sentences.english: an assembly point
sentences.chinese: 集合地点

sentences.english: instructions for assembly
sentences.chinese: 装配说明（书）

detailed_translations.english: the meeting together of a group of people for a particular purpose

name: party
trans: n. 聚会，派对；政党，党派；<正式>（契约或争论的）当事人，一方；队，组，群；<正式>参加者；<非正式>人 v. <非正式> 尽情欢乐，欢宴 adj. （纹章）分割开的，分成不同颜色部分的

sentences.english: We’re having a small party this evening to celebrate our wedding anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我们今晚有个小聚会，庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

sentences.english: the party spirit
sentences.chinese: 参加社交聚会的乐趣

sentences.english: I have always voted for the Labour Party.
sentences.chinese: 我一直投工党的票。

detailed_translations.english: a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc

name: association
trans: n. 协会，社团，联盟；交往，联合；联系，因果关系；联想

sentences.english: Scotland has all kinds of happy associations for me.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰给我各种各样愉快的联想。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship with a particular person, organization, group etc

name: gather
trans: v. 聚集，召集；收集，采集；认为，推断；增加（速度、力量等）；给……打褶；收紧，拉近

sentences.english: You two know each other, I gather.
sentences.chinese: 我想你们俩认识。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true because of what you have seen or heard

name: attend
trans: v. 随同，陪同；经常去，定期去(学校、教堂等)；伴随……而至，（作为结果）伴随；出席，参加；注意，专心；处理，照料；致力于

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

name: convene
trans: v. 召集，集合，开会；传唤

sentences.english: a report by experts convened by the National Institutes of Health
sentences.chinese: 由全国健康协会召集的专家提出的一份报告

detailed_translations.english: if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting
if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting

name: congregate
trans: v. 集合，聚集 adj. 集合在一起的

sentences.english: Crowds began to congregate to hear the President’s speech.
sentences.chinese: 人群开始聚拢，来聆听总统的演讲。

detailed_translations.english: to come together in a group

name: accompany
trans: v. 陪伴，陪同；伴随，与……一起发生；为……伴奏（或伴唱）；附带，补充

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: sprawl
trans: v. 伸开四肢坐（或躺）；蔓延 n. （城市）杂乱无序拓展的地区；四肢摊开的姿势；随意扩展，蔓延物

sentences.english: He sprawled out on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 他摊开手脚躺在沙发上。

sentences.english: I tripped on a stone and went sprawling on the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 我被一块石头绊了一下，四仰八叉地摔在人行道上。

sentences.english: a blow which sent him sprawling
sentences.chinese: 打得他四脚朝天的一拳

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓延；伸开手足躺；无计划地扩展
detailed_translations.english: to lie or sit with your arms or legs stretched out in a lazy or careless way

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓生；伸开手足躺卧姿势

name: broaden
trans: v. 增长（经验、知识等）；变宽，变阔；（使）扩大影响

sentences.english: Mark’s smile broadened.
sentences.chinese: 马克笑得更加灿烂了。

sentences.english: The council decided to broaden the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 地方议会决定拓宽人行道。

detailed_translations.english: to make something wider, or to become wider

name: swell
trans: v. （身体部位）肿胀，膨胀， 使（某物）膨胀，使肿胀；（使）鼓起，（使）隆起；（使）增长，增加，扩大；（声音）逐渐增强，变响亮；（情绪）高涨，充满；波涛汹涌 n. 海浪的涌动，涌浪；（音量的）增强；感情的高涨；（规模或数量的）增长，增加；（尤指身体部位）凸起的形状，鼓出处，隆起处；<旧> 重要人士，时髦人物；（管风琴、簧风琴的）音量调节器 adj. <美，旧> 第一流的，极好的；<美，非正式，古> 漂亮的，时髦的 adv. <美，非正式，旧> 极好地，非常顺利地

sentences.english: Her ankle was already starting to swell.
sentences.chinese: 她的脚踝已经开始肿起来了。

sentences.english: The window frame was swollen shut.
sentences.chinese: 窗框膨胀变形，关得死死的。

detailed_translations.english: to become larger and rounder than normal – used especially about parts of the body
the roundness or curved shape of something
very good

name: expand
trans: v. 扩大，增加；扩展，发展；细谈，详述；变得更自信（善谈）；（宇宙）膨胀

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

name: dilate
trans: vi. 扩大；膨胀；详述 vt. 使扩大；使膨胀

sentences.english: dilated pupils
sentences.chinese: 扩大的瞳孔

detailed_translations.english: if a hollow part of your body dilates or if something dilates it, it becomes wider

name: augment
trans: v. 增加，增大；加强，补充 n. 增（元）音

sentences.english: Any surplus was sold to augment their income.
sentences.chinese: 所有多余的东西被售卖一空来增加他们的收入。

detailed_translations.english: to increase the value, amount, effectiveness etc of something

name: stick
trans: v. 粘，贴；铭记在心，经久不忘；刺，扎，戳；（随便）摆放，放置；伸出，突出；卡住，钉住；容忍，忍受；（名字）流传下去，被众人采用；被接受，被证明成立；（牌戏中）不再要牌；停顿下来，没有进展；<非正式>（生气地）放弃（和打发）；<非正式>使支付，导致损失；刺伤，刺死 n. 枯枝，枝条；条状物，棍状物；（用于某特定用途的）棍，条，签；球棍，球棒；指挥棒；变速杆，操纵杆；惩戒，惩罚；<英，非正式>批评，责罚；<非正式>偏远乡村，边远地区（the sticks）；四分之一磅装的黄油（或人造黄油）；<非正式>（家具的）件；非常瘦的人（或四肢）；画着短细直线的；一批迅速投下的炸弹（或伞兵）；一队特务兵；<非正式>球门柱，（板球三柱门的）柱（the sticks）；（曲棍球犯规动作）举棍过肩（sticks）；（股票）大宗死股

sentences.english: a pair of drum sticks
sentences.chinese: 一对鼓槌

sentences.english: a measuring stick
sentences.chinese: 量尺

sentences.english: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (= uses a stick to help her walk ) .
sentences.chinese: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

name: sticky
trans: adj. 黏性的，涂有黏性物质的；（皮肤因热而）黏湿的；（天气）湿热的，闷热的；（处境、问题等）难办的，棘手的；（网站）吸引人的，吸引人长时间浏览的；（食物）甜腻的；（价格，利率，薪水）变化缓慢的，对变化反应缓慢的；<英，非正式>持有异议的，抱不合作态度的；持久的；<非正式>感到热得难受的 n. 告事贴；置顶留言

sentences.english: There’s some sticky stuff in your hair.
sentences.chinese: 你的头发上有什么黏糊糊的东西。

sentences.english: a sticky floor
sentences.chinese: 黏糊糊的地板

detailed_translations.english: made of or covered with a substance that sticks to surfaces

name: attachment
trans: n. 附加设备，附属物；（邮件）附件；文件附件；喜欢，依恋；（临时的）隶属，委派；信念，拥护；连接，连接物；扣押

sentences.english: a child’s attachment to its mother
sentences.chinese: 孩子对母亲的依恋

sentences.english: The vacuum cleaner has various attachments.
sentences.chinese: 这台真空吸尘器有各种附件。

sentences.english: the attachments that secure your boots firmly to the skis
sentences.chinese: 把靴子牢牢固定在滑雪板上的扣件

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you like or love someone or something and that you would be unhappy without them

name: cohere
trans: vi. 凝聚；连贯；粘着；一致

sentences.english: All the details are there and are correct but they don’t cohere.
sentences.chinese: 所有的细节都摆在那里，而且都正确，但是它们并不一致。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连贯， 一致； 黏合； 齐心协力， 团结一致
detailed_translations.english: if ideas, arguments, beliefs, statements etc cohere, they are connected in a clear and reasonable way

name: cling
trans: v. 抓住，抱紧；黏附，粘住；依恋，依附；坚持，坚信；紧抓不放，坚守 n. 粘核桃

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

name: adhere
trans: v. 黏附，附着；遵守，遵循（规定或协议）；拥护，持有（观点或信仰）

sentences.english: Small particles adhere to the seed.
sentences.chinese: 微小的粒子紧贴着种子。

sentences.english: We adhere to the principles of equal rights and freedom of expression for all.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚持人人平等和言论自由的原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stick firmly to something

name: adherent
trans: n. （政党、思想的）拥护者 adj. 粘着的；遵守的；（植物）联生的

sentences.english: The Nation of Islam and its most famous adherent, Malcolm X, preached a message of self-reliance and racial separatism.
sentences.chinese: “伊斯兰民族”及其最著名的追随者马尔科姆∙艾克斯（Malcolm X）宣扬自力更生和种族分离。

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports a particular belief, plan, political party etc

name: constant
trans: adj. 持续不断的，经常发生的；恒定的，不变的；忠诚的，忠实的 n. 常数，恒量；不变的事物

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

name: incessant
trans: adj. （令人不快的事物）不停的，连续的

sentences.english: The child’s incessant talking started to irritate her.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子喋喋不休，她开始烦躁起来。

sentences.english: incessant rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing without stopping

name: coherent
trans: adj. 有条理的，连贯的；说话条理清晰的，易于理解的；团结一致的，凝聚的；（波）相干的，相参的；黏着的，黏连的

sentences.english: The three years of the course are planned as a coherent whole.
sentences.chinese: 这三年的课程是作为连贯的整体来安排的。

sentences.english: a coherent account of the incident
sentences.chinese: 对该事件条理分明的陈述

sentences.english: He's so calm when he answers questions in interviews. I wish I could be that coherent.
sentences.chinese: 他如此镇定地回答了访谈中的问题。我希望我也能那样有条不紊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一致的，协调的；(话语等)条理清楚的
detailed_translations.english: if a piece of writing, set of ideas etc is coherent, it is easy to understand because it is clear and reasonable

name: incoherent
trans: adj. 语无伦次的；不连贯的；不合逻辑的

sentences.english: Ben, drunk and incoherent, slumped in a chair.
sentences.chinese: 本醉得语无伦次，一屁股跌坐在一把椅子上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 语无伦次的；不连贯的；不合逻辑的
detailed_translations.english: speaking in a way that cannot be understood, because you are drunk, feeling a strong emotion etc

name: ceaseless
trans: adj. 不断的；不停的

sentences.english: the ceaseless fight against crime
sentences.chinese: 对犯罪的持续打击

detailed_translations.english: happening for a long time without stopping

name: speedy
trans: adj. 迅速发生的；高速的，快速移动的

sentences.english: a speedy recovery from injury
sentences.chinese: 受伤后的迅速康复

detailed_translations.english: happening or done quickly or without delay

name: swift
trans: adj. 迅速的，立刻的；快速移动的，速度非常快的；<美，非正式>机灵的，聪明的 n. 雨燕；蝙蝠蛾；绷架 adv. <文> （在组合形式以外为诗歌或文学用于）迅速

sentences.english: My letter received a swift reply.
sentences.chinese: 我的信很快就得到了回复。

sentences.english: She shot a swift glance at Paul.
sentences.chinese: 她迅速瞥了保罗一眼。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done quickly and immediately

name: successive
trans: adj. 连续的，依次的；接替的，继承的

sentences.english: The team has had five successive victories.
sentences.chinese: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。

sentences.english: Successive governments have tried to deal with this issue.
sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

name: consecutive
trans: adj. 连续的，不间断的

sentences.english: It had rained for four consecutive days.
sentences.chinese: 雨接连下了四天。

sentences.english: Can they win the title for the third consecutive season?
sentences.chinese: 他们能连续第三个赛季赢得冠军称号吗？

detailed_translations.english: consecutive numbers or periods of time follow one after the other without any interruptions

name: prompt
trans: v. 促使，导致；鼓励，提示（说话者）；（计算机上）提示；（给演员）提词，提白 adj. 迅速的，立刻的；（人）利索的，敏捷的；及时的，准时的；（商品）即期要送的，即期要付的 n. （给演员的）提词；（计算机屏幕上显示准备接受指令的）提示； 鼓励，催促；（付款通知单上的）付款期限 adv. 准时地

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

name: fitful
trans: adj. 一阵阵的；断断续续的；不规则的；间歇的

sentences.english: John awoke from a fitful sleep .
sentences.chinese: 约翰从断断续续的睡眠中醒来。

sentences.english: The peace talks only seem to be making fitful progress.
sentences.chinese: 和平会谈似乎时而前进，时而停滞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一阵阵的；断断续续的；不规则的；间歇的
detailed_translations.english: not regular, and starting and stopping often

name: continually
trans: adv. 不断地；频繁地

sentences.english: The desert continually encroaches on the fertile land.
sentences.chinese: 沙漠在不断地侵蚀肥沃土地。

sentences.english: If you continually question why he included this section at all, then you will be frustrated.
sentences.chinese: 如果您不断地询问他究竟为什么要包含此部分，那么您将感到失落。

name: gradually
trans: adv. 逐渐地，逐步地

sentences.english: Jill gradually became aware of an awful smell.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔渐渐地闻到了一股难闻的气味。

sentences.english: Gradually, my ankle got better.
sentences.chinese: 我的脚踝慢慢好了。

detailed_translations.english: slowly, over a long period of time

name: haunt
trans: v. （鬼魂）出没；萦绕在……心头；（长期）困扰；常去（某地） n. 常去的地方；栖息地

sentences.english: The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former landlord.
sentences.chinese: 据说这个酒吧里经常有一位前任房主的鬼魂出没。

detailed_translations.chinese: 常出没于；使苦恼，使担忧；萦绕在心头，缠绕
detailed_translations.english: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often
a place that someone likes to go to often

name: frequency
trans: n. 出现次数；频繁；频率

sentences.english: Businesses come and go with alarming frequency.
sentences.chinese: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

sentences.english: the frequency of serious road accidents
sentences.chinese: 重大道路交通事故的发生率

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something happens a lot

name: insufficient
trans: adj. 不充分的，不够重要的

sentences.english: Insufficient resources have been devoted to the health service.
sentences.chinese: 用于医疗保健服务的资源不足。

detailed_translations.english: not enough, or not great enough

name: scanty
trans: adj. 少量的，不足的；（衣服）暴露的，紧（身）的 n. <非正式>女式小短裤（或衬裤）（scanties）

sentences.english: So far, what scanty evidence we have points to two suspects.
sentences.chinese: 目前，我们指向两名嫌犯的证据太少。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的；吝啬的；仅有的；稀疏的
detailed_translations.english: You describe something as scanty when there is less of it than you think there should be

name: meager
trans: adj. 贫乏的；瘦的；（数量）少的，不足的

sentences.english: His meager wage is not enough to support their five children.
sentences.chinese: 靠他一个人的微薄工资不足以养活他们的五个孩子。

sentences.english: Do you think those savings are meager, or not worth the effort?
sentences.chinese: 你认为这些节省的开支是微薄的，或者是不值得努力获得的吗？

sentences.english: It was medieval European monks who introduced scientific brewing techniques in an effort to produce a nutritious beverage to supplement their meager diets.
sentences.chinese: 正是中世纪欧洲的僧侣们引进科学的啤酒酿造技术，制造有营养的饮料， 从而补充了他们贫乏的饮食。

name: needy
trans: adj. （人）贫困的；（环境）贫穷的；需要关注的，需要情感支持的

sentences.english: a needy family
sentences.chinese: 贫困家庭

sentences.english: There will be efforts to get larger amounts of food to the needy.
sentences.chinese: 将努力把更多的食品送给穷人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 贫困的；贫穷的；生活艰苦的
detailed_translations.english: having very little food or money
The needy are people who are needy

name: stingy
trans: adj. 吝啬的，小气的；小的，少的；有刺的

sentences.english: She’s too stingy to give money to charity.
sentences.chinese: 她很小气，不愿捐钱行善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的
detailed_translations.english: not generous, especially with money

name: devoid
trans: adj. 缺乏，完全没有

sentences.english: We humans appear to be meaning-seeking creatures that have the misfortune to be thrown into a world devoid of intrinsic meaning.
sentences.chinese: 我们人类似乎是寻求意义的生物，而很不幸，我们却进入了一个本质上缺乏意义的世界。

sentences.english: Rice cakes may seem like a good option – after all they're fat-free and low in calories – but they're also devoid of fibre and protein and can make you crave something more satisfying.
sentences.chinese: 大米蛋糕似乎是好的选择-毕竟它们无脂肪，低卡路里-但是它们也缺乏纤维和蛋白质，会使你渴望更令人满意的东西。

name: scarce
trans: adj. 缺乏的，不足的；稀有的，少见的 adv. <文> 几乎不

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: forfeit
trans: v. 丧失，被没收；（尤指为获得他物）主动放弃 n. 罚金，没收物 adj. 被没收的，丧失的

sentences.english: The company’s property may even be forfeit.
sentences.chinese: 公司财产甚至可能被没收。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罚金；没收物；丧失的东西
detailed_translations.english: something that is taken away from you or something that you have to pay, because you have broken a rule or made a mistake

detailed_translations.chinese: 因受罚而丧失的；被没收的
detailed_translations.english: to be legally or officially taken away from you as a punishment

detailed_translations.chinese: （因犯罪、失职、违约等）丧失（权利、名誉、生命等）

name: degenerate
trans: v. 恶化，堕落，退化 adj. 衰退的，堕落的；退化的 n. 堕落的人，颓废的人

sentences.english: Inactivity can make your joints stiff, and the bones may begin to degenerate.
sentences.chinese: 不活动会使关节僵硬，骨骼因此可能会开始退化。

detailed_translations.english: to become worse
