morally unacceptable
someone whose behaviour is considered to be morally unacceptable

name: decadence
trans: n. 堕落，颓废；衰落

sentences.english: But even your dreams will be but a pale shadow of my true decadence.
sentences.chinese: 但你的梦不过是我真实衰落中一个苍白的影子罢了。

sentences.english: America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between.
sentences.chinese: 美国是唯一一个直接从野蛮进入颓废、中间没有经过文明阶段的社会。

sentences.english: America a is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between.
sentences.chinese: 美国是唯一一个直接从野蛮进入颓废、中间没有经过文明阶段的社会。 ?。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that shows that someone has low moral standards and is more concerned with pleasure than serious matters

name: decline
trans: v. 下降，衰退；拒绝，谢绝；变格，词形变化 n. 减少，衰退

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: languish
trans: v. 长期受苦，受煎熬；衰败，未能取得进展 ；变得衰弱；<古>思恋；<古>显示出温柔亲切（或忧伤）的样子

sentences.english: The housing market continues to languish.
sentences.chinese: 住宅市场继续疲软。

sentences.english: The shares are languishing at just 46p after yesterday’s fall.
sentences.chinese: 股价经历了昨天的下跌后，就停滞在46便士上了。

sentences.english: West Ham United are currently languishing at the bottom of the league.
sentences.chinese: 西汉姆联队目前在联赛中一直排名垫底。

detailed_translations.english: ifsomething languishes, it fails to improve and develop or become successful

name: ebb
trans: n. 衰退；退潮 vi. 衰退，衰落；（潮水或海水）退，落

sentences.english: His confidence is at a low ebb.
sentences.chinese: 他的信心很低落。

detailed_translations.english: the flow of the sea away from the shore, when the tide goes out
if the tide ebbs, it flows away from the shore

name: flag
trans: n. 旗帜；国旗；信号旗，标志旗；菖蒲，鸢尾；铺路用的厚石板（多为矩形或正方形）；（在街上慈善捐赠后获得的）小纸徽；（用作标志的）旗状装置（或符号、图画）；出租车空车显示器；特征位；旗舰 v. 给……做标记；示意……停下来，挥手示停；（裁判向场内）丢旗判罚；疲乏，热情衰减；引起对……的注意

sentences.english: Children waving flags greeted the Russian leader.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们挥舞着旗帜，欢迎俄罗斯领导人。

sentences.english: the flag of Kenya
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亚国旗

sentences.english: the Spanish flag
sentences.chinese: 西班牙国旗

detailed_translations.english: a piece of cloth with a coloured pattern or picture on it that represents a country or organization

name: deplete
trans: v. 大量减少，耗尽

sentences.english: ...substances that deplete the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: …消耗臭氧层的物质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚
detailed_translations.english: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

name: degrade
trans: v. 侮辱，贬低；降低，削弱（尤指质量）；降解，分解；使降级，贬黜；使（岩石）陵削；使（能量）衰变

sentences.english: a movie that degrades women
sentences.chinese: 贬损女性的影片

sentences.english: How can you degrade yourself by writing such trash?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能写这种垃圾作品来自贬身份呢？

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone without respect and make them lose respect for themselves

name: enervate
trans: vt. 使衰弱，使失去活力 adj. 衰弱的，无力的

sentences.english: The hot sun enervated her to the point of collapse.
sentences.chinese: 热辣辣的太阳把她晒得快要晕过去了。

detailed_translations.english: to deprive of strength or vitality; weaken physically or mentally; debilitate
deprived of strength or vitality; weakened

name: informal
trans: adj. 轻松友好的，不拘礼节的；（文字或言谈）非正式的，口语体的；（服装）休闲的，家居的；（组织、团体和安排）非官方的，非正规的

sentences.english: The atmosphere at work is fairly informal.
sentences.chinese: 工作气氛相当轻松。

sentences.english: The two groups met for informal talks.
sentences.chinese: 两个团体会面举行非正式会谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非正式的；不拘礼节的；随便的；通俗的；日常使用的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and friendly without being restricted by rules of correct behaviour

name: indefinite
trans: adj. 无限期的，期限不定的；模糊不清的，不明确的；（词，屈折变化，短语）不定的

sentences.english: The next day the union voted to begin an indefinite strike.
sentences.chinese: 第二天工会投票表决决定开始无限期罢工。

sentences.english: The picture has been loaned for an indefinite period to the National Gallery.
sentences.chinese: 那幅画长期出借给国家美术馆。

detailed_translations.english: an indefinite action or period of time has no definite end arranged for it

name: casual
trans: adj. 休闲的，便装的；随便的，非正式的；漫不经心的，随意的；临时的，短期的；碰巧的，偶然的；不认真的，马虎的；不定期的，偶尔的；感情不深的，疏远的 n. 便服，便装（casuals）；临时工；<英>散漫青年；待命士兵

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.english: His eyes were angry, though he sounded casual.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.english: a casual conversation
sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

name: potential
trans: adj. 潜在的，可能的 n. （事物的）潜力，可能性；（人的）潜能，潜力；电势，电位，电压

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

name: contingent
trans: n. （军队的）分遣队；代表团 adj. 附带的，依情况而定的；偶然（发生）的，可能的

sentences.english: Has the Scottish contingent arrived yet?
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰代表团到了没有？

detailed_translations.chinese: 因情况而异的；不一定的；偶然发生的；可能的；依情况而定的；偶然的；[逻]有条件的
detailed_translations.english: depending on something that may happen in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 分遣队；偶然事件；分得部分；代表团
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who all have something in common, such as their nationality, beliefs etc, and who are part of a larger group

name: dispensable
trans: adj. 不必要的，可有可无的；（法律或其他规则）在特定情况下可放宽的，可通融的

sentences.english: Part-time workers are considered dispensable.
sentences.chinese: 兼职工作人员被认为是可有可无的。

detailed_translations.english: not necessary or important and so easy to get rid of

name: occasional
trans: adj. 偶尔的，不经常的；（家具）特定场合才使用的； （文章、演讲或宗教仪式等）在特殊场合所作的，为特殊场合所准备的；非定时的，临时的

sentences.english: He made occasional visits to London.
sentences.chinese: 他有时候会去伦敦。

sentences.english: They had an occasional coffee together after shopping.
sentences.chinese: 他们偶尔会在购物后一起喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: He only has occasional use of a car.
sentences.chinese: 他只是偶尔用一下汽车。

sentences.english: We should have enough money for the occasional trip.
sentences.chinese: 我们的钱应该足够偶尔出去旅行一次的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶尔的， 间或发生的
detailed_translations.english: happening sometimes but not often or regularly

name: fortuitously
trans: adv. 偶然地，意外地

name: haphazard
trans: adj. 无计划的，没有条理的 adv. 杂乱无章地，无计划地 n. 偶然

sentences.english: It was strings of words borrowed from the different languages around them and put together in sort of haphazard ways.
sentences.chinese: 它只不过是从身边的不同语言当中,借用了一些单词串,以随意的方式将它们放在一起

sentences.english: All the master had to do was shake the tree a little and the garden was full of leaves again, spread out in haphazard patterns.
sentences.chinese: 大师什么都没有做，只是摇了摇树。 花园又重新被凋落的树叶覆盖了，整个花园展现出随意的样式。

name: random
trans: adj. 任意的，随机的，胡乱的；（砖石建筑）石头大小不一的；<非正式>奇怪的，不同寻常的 n. 随意，随机；<非正式>不认识的人，陌生人 adv. 随机地，胡乱地

sentences.english: The gang picked their victims at random.
sentences.chinese: 这帮犯罪分子随意选择对象下手。

sentences.english: The company has introduced random drug testing of its employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司已实行对雇员的随机毒品测试。

detailed_translations.english: without any definite plan, aim, or pattern
happening or chosen without any definite plan, aim, or pattern

name: doubtful
trans: adj. 怀疑的，不确定的；未必的，不大可能的；不可靠的

sentences.english: Prospects for a lasting peace remain doubtful.
sentences.chinese: 持久和平的前景难料。

sentences.english: ‘Everything’s going to be all right, you’ll see.’ Jenny looked doubtful .
sentences.chinese: “一切都会顺顺当当的，你等着看好了。” 珍妮看起来不大相信的样子。

detailed_translations.english: probably not true or not likely to happen

name: lottery
trans: n. 抽彩给奖法，博彩；<美>抽签法，随机选择；碰运气的事

sentences.english: a lottery ticket
sentences.chinese: 彩票

sentences.english: Do you really think winning the lottery would make you happy?
sentences.chinese: 你真的认为彩票中奖会带给你幸福吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩票；碰运气的事，难算计的事；抽彩给奖法
detailed_translations.english: a game used to make money for a state or a  charity  in which people buy tickets with a series of numbers on them. If their number is picked by chance, they win money or a prize.

name: accidental
trans: adj. 意外的，偶然的；非主要的，附带的；（亚里士多德思想中的）非本质属性的；临时记号的 n. 临时记号；次要方面，非主要的特性

sentences.english: an accidental discharge of toxic waste
sentences.chinese: 有毒废料的意外排放

sentences.english: Buy an insurance policy that covers accidental damage .
sentences.chinese: 购买一份意外损害保单。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意外的；偶然的；附属的；临时记号的
detailed_translations.english: happening without being planned or intended

detailed_translations.chinese: 次要方面；非主要的特性；临时记号

name: constrict
trans: v. （使）压缩，（使）收缩；限制，约束；（蛇）盘绕以使窒息

sentences.english: Caffeine constricts the blood vessels in your body.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡因会使体内的血管收缩。

sentences.english: Linda’s throat constricted and she started to cry.
sentences.chinese: 琳达喉咙发紧，哭了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to make something narrower or tighter, or to become narrower or tighter

name: dwindle
trans: v. （逐渐）减少，变小；使缩小，使减少

sentences.english: The elephant population is dwindling.
sentences.chinese: 大象的数量在减少。

sentences.english: His money had dwindled away.
sentences.chinese: 他的钱在逐渐变少。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

name: detract
trans: vt. 转移，使分心 vi. 贬低；减去

sentences.english: They feared that the publicity surrounding him would detract from their own election campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心围绕他的宣传会有损他们自已的竞选活动。

detailed_translations.english: If one thing detracts from another, it makes it seem less good or impressive

name: contract
trans: n. 合同，契约；<非正式>暗杀协议；（桥牌）定约墩数；婚约，订婚 v. （使）收缩，缩小；签合同，订立契约；患上，感染；订立婚约（或盟约）；欠负（债）

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: reduce
trans: v. 减少，降低；（烹调中）使变浓稠，收汁；<美>节食减肥；使沦为，使陷入（不好的境地）；迫使，使不得不（做）；（通过破裂、燃烧等）使变成，使化为；归纳，简化；将分数约到（最小项）；（使）进行还原反应；减薄（底片或图片）；（语音）弱化；使（脱臼，断骨）复位；<古>攻克，征服（尤指围攻并占领城镇或要塞）

sentences.english: The governor announced a new plan to reduce crime.
sentences.chinese: 州长宣布了一项降低犯罪率的新计划。

sentences.english: The helmet law should reduce injuries in motorcycle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 头盔法的实施应该能减少摩托车事故的受伤率。

sentences.english: Small businesses will need to reduce costs in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 小企业要想生存必须削减成本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price

name: diminish
trans: v. 减弱，降低，减少；贬低，轻视

sentences.english: The party’s share of the electorate has diminished steadily.
sentences.chinese: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。

sentences.english: These drugs diminish blood flow to the brain.
sentences.chinese: 这些药物会减少流向脑部的血液量。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

detailed_translations.chinese: 减少， 减小， 降低
detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

name: curtail
trans: v. 减缩，限制；剪短；剥夺……特权等

sentences.english: The new law will curtail police powers.
sentences.chinese: 这条新法规将削弱警方的权力。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce or limit something

name: indent
trans: v. 缩进（行、段落、列表等）；使（某物边缘处）凹进，（在某物上）制造凹痕；<英>订货；<史>将（一式两份的文件）以锯齿线裁成两份（以便验证真伪）；按一式两份起草（法律文件） n. <英>订货单，购货单；（行，段落）缩进，缩格；凹口；定期服务合同，师徒契约

detailed_translations.english: an official order for goods or equipment

name: subtraction
trans: n. 减去；（数）减，减法

sentences.english: In other words, we can use the magic of subtraction.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，我们可以借助减法的魔力。

sentences.english: It also lets you perform mathematical operations like addition, subtraction, division, and multiplication on two statistics.
sentences.chinese: 它还允许您对两个统计数据执行诸如加、减、乘、除等数学运算。

sentences.english: Atomicity enables the two operations -- the subtraction from the savings account and the addition to the checking account -- to be treated as a single transaction.
sentences.chinese: 原子性使得这两个操作 —— 从储蓄帐户减钱和向支票帐户加钱 —— 被当作单个事务进行处理。

detailed_translations.english: the process of taking a number or amount from a larger number or amount

name: erratic
trans: adj. 不稳定的，难以预测的 n. 漂泊无定的人，古怪的人；（地质）漂块，漂砾

sentences.english: His breathing was becoming erratic.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸越来越不均匀。

sentences.english: his erratic behaviour
sentences.chinese: 他难以捉摸的行为

detailed_translations.english: something that is erratic does not follow any pattern or plan but happens in a way that is not regular

detailed_translations.chinese: 漂泊无定的人；古怪的人

name: stable
trans: adj. 稳定的，牢固的；稳重的，沉稳的；（化学结构或物理状态）稳定的 n. 马厩；（属同一马主或驯马师的）一群赛马；（在同一地方工作或训练的）一批人，（同一公司生产的）系列产品；赛马训练场 v. 使（马）入厩，把（马）拴在马厩

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

name: unstable
trans: adj. 不稳定的；动荡的；易变的

sentences.english: The political situation is still very unstable.
sentences.chinese: 政局依然非常动荡。

sentences.english: an unstable relationship
sentences.chinese: 不稳定的关系

detailed_translations.english: likely to change sud­denly and become worse

name: steady
trans: adj. 平稳的，稳步的，持续的；稳定的，恒定的；稳固的，牢固的；沉着的，冷静的；（人）稳重的，可靠的 v. 使平稳，稳住；（使）稳定，（使）固定（一段时间）；（使）镇定，（使）冷静 n. <非正式>关系确定的情侣；（支撑大篷车或其他车辆的）支架，撑竿 int. 当心，冷静点 adv. 稳定地，持续地，稳固地

sentences.english: It takes a steady hand to perform surgery.
sentences.chinese: 做手术手要稳。

sentences.english: The plane steadied, and the passengers relaxed
sentences.chinese: 飞机平稳后，乘客们松了一口气。

detailed_translations.english: firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking
to hold someone or something so they become more balanced or controlled, or to become more balanced or controlled

name: steadily
trans: adv. 逐渐地，稳步地；不变地，稳定地；冷静地，镇定地；固定地，牢固地

sentences.english: The bus climbed steadily up the road.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车稳定地沿公路向上爬。

name: poise
trans: n. 沉着，镇定；（优雅的）体态，姿态；<古>平衡；（物理）泊 v. （使）平衡，（使）悬浮；准备做……（be poised）

sentences.english: What amazed him even more than her appearance was her poise.
sentences.chinese: 比她的长相更让他惊讶的是她的沉着镇定。

detailed_translations.english: If someone has poise, they are calm, dignified, and self-controlled
to put or hold something in a carefully balanced position, especially above something else

name: ascent
trans: n. 垂直上升；上坡路；攀登；（地位、职务的）提升，（水平的）提高；（某些宗教中的）升天

sentences.english: the first ascent of Qomolangma
sentences.chinese: 首次攀登珠穆朗玛峰

detailed_translations.english: the act of climbing something or moving upwards

name: descent
trans: n. 下降，降落；斜坡，斜面；出身，血统；堕落，沦落；突然到访，突袭

sentences.english: Passengers must fasten their seat belts prior to descent.
sentences.chinese: 乘客在飞机降落之前必须系好安全带。

sentences.english: young men and women of Asian descent
sentences.chinese: 亚裔男女青年

sentences.english: There is a gradual descent to the sea.
sentences.chinese: 有一片斜坡缓缓伸延到海边。

detailed_translations.english: the process of going down

name: extend
trans: v. 延伸；扩大，延长；持续；包括，波及；提供，表示；伸出；使竭尽全力；对……估价；继承（面向对象语言中的一种概念）

sentences.english: Management have agreed to extend the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 管理层已同意延长最后期限。

detailed_translations.english: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer

name: extension
trans: n. 延伸，扩展；展期，延长期；扩建部分，延伸部分；（电话）分机；扩展名；（为非全日制学生开设的）进修部；牵伸（术）；外延；广延（性）

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

name: hike
trans: n. 徒步旅行，远足；（价格、花费等的）大幅度提高，猛增 v. 远足，徒步旅行；突然增加，突然提高；拉起，提起（尤指衣物）；后传（发球）给四分卫

sentences.english: He wants to hike round the world.
sentences.chinese: 他打算徒步旅行环游世界一周。

sentences.english: You can organize a picnic in the park, a group hike or bike ride, or meet up with friends for one of those free local events.
sentences.chinese: 你可以组织在公园野餐一群徒步旅行或者骑自行车或者和朋友会面为其中的一个免费本地事件。

detailed_translations.english: to take a long walk in the mountains or countryside
a long walk in the mountains or countryside
to increase a price, tax etc by a large amount

name: hoist
trans: v. 吊起，提升；<非正式>投篮 n. 吊升机械，起重机；吊起，升起；旗宽（贴近旗杆的部分）；（一串）信号旗

sentences.english: The crew hurried to hoist the flag.
sentences.chinese: 船员们急忙把旗子升起来。

detailed_translations.english: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes

detailed_translations.chinese: 起重器械； 举起， 升起， 吊起
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for lifting heavy objects with ropes

name: stretch
trans: v. （使）变大，拉长；（布料）可伸缩，有弹性；伸展肢体；伸出，伸长（胳膊或腿）；拉紧，拽紧；（时间上）延续；（空间上）延伸，绵延；使竭尽所能，使施展本领；耗尽，竭尽（财力或物力）；（使）延长使用，节俭地使用；（资金，资源）足够，够用；放宽，放松；夸大，夸张；涉及，囊括 n. （土地或水域的）一片，一段；（时间）连续的一段，持续；（肢体）伸展，伸开；弹性，伸缩性；服刑期；（终点前的）直线跑道；言过其实的话；困难的任务，苛求的任务；<非正式>加长轿车；抢风航行的距离 adj. （织物）有弹性的，有弹力的

sentences.english: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔从床上坐起来，打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒 腰。

sentences.english: Always stretch before exercising.
sentences.chinese: 锻炼之前都要做伸展运动。

detailed_translations.english: to straighten your arms, legs, or body to full length
to reach a long way for something

detailed_translations.chinese: 一段时间； 一段距离；延伸， 连绵； 连绵的一片
detailed_translations.english: a continuous period of time

name: transform
trans: v. 使改观，使变形，使转化；变换（电流）的电压；（数）变换（数学实体） n. （数，语言学）变换式，转换句；（数，语言学）转换规则

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: deform
trans: v. 改变……的外形，损毁……的形状

sentences.english: Wearing badly-fitting shoes can deform your feet.
sentences.chinese: 穿不合脚的鞋会使脚变形。

detailed_translations.english: if you deform something, or if it deforms, its usual shape changes so that its usefulness or appearance is spoiled

name: elevate
trans: v. 提拔，提升；抬起，提起；提高，增加；使情绪高昂，使兴高采烈

sentences.english: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.chinese: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.english: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.chinese: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

detailed_translations.english: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

name: sharpen
trans: v. （使）变锋利（尖锐，清晰）；（使）改善，提高；（使）加剧

sentences.english: Her gaze sharpened, as if she had seen something unusual.
sentences.chinese: 她眼睛一亮，好像看到了不寻常的东西。

sentences.english: He will need to sharpen his diplomatic skills in order to work with Congress.
sentences.chinese: 他将需要增强外交技巧以与国会打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 削尖， 磨快； 使敏锐， 使敏捷
detailed_translations.english: If your senses, understanding, or skills sharpen or are sharpened, you become better at noticing things, thinking, or doing something

name: enhance
trans: v. 增强，提高，改善

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: abate
trans: v. <正式>（使）减轻，减少；<法律>废除；消除（妨碍行为）；（指令状、法律诉讼等）无效

sentences.english: We waited for the storm to abate.
sentences.chinese: 我们等风暴减弱。

detailed_translations.english: to become less strong or decrease

name: accumulate
trans: v. 积累，积攒

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

name: amplify
trans: v. 放大，扩大（声音）；增强，加强；详述，进一步阐明；扩增（基因，DNA序列）

sentences.english: an amplified guitar
sentences.chinese: 带有扩音设备的电吉他

detailed_translations.chinese: 放大， 增强； 扩大； 详述， 进一步阐述
detailed_translations.english: to make sound louder, especially musical sound

name: amplification
trans: n. 扩大，增强；阐述，引申；扩增

sentences.english: Since the Greek language in which John wrote had no exclamation marks, he used an amplification technique that is common in Scriptures.
sentences.chinese: 后来约翰用希腊语写作没有惊叹的标志，他在经文中普片的使用用一种放大的手法。

sentences.english: At this point in the outbreak, an amplification event would be a setback capable of extending the presently intense containment efforts for several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 在暴发的这一时刻，扩大事件将是一次挫折，能将目前紧张的控制努力延续数周。

name: stuffy
trans: adj. （房间或建筑物）闷的，通风不顺畅的；古板的，保守的；（鼻子）不通的，堵塞的

sentences.english: It’s getting stuffy in here – do you mind if I open the window?
sentences.chinese: 这里越来越闷了，我开开窗行吗？

detailed_translations.english: (of a building, room, etc.) warm in an unpleasant way and without enough fresh air

name: tilted
trans: adj. 倾斜的，翘起的 v. 使倾斜（tilt 的过去分词）

name: regularly
trans: adv. 定期地，有规律地；频繁地，经常地；均匀地，匀称地；（语法）变化规律地

sentences.english: We meet regularly, once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们定期见面，每月一次。

detailed_translations.english: at the same time each day, week, month etc

name: coil
trans: n. （绳或线等的）卷，匝；（电路的）线圈；（汽车发动机的）盘管；子宫节育环；蚊香；成卷邮票；<古>混乱，骚动 v. 卷，盘绕

sentences.english: Shake the rope and let the coils unwind.
sentences.chinese: 抖动绳索把绳圈展开。

sentences.english: a coil of wire
sentences.chinese: 一圈金属线

sentences.english: Mist coiled around the tops of the hills.
sentences.chinese: 薄雾盘绕着山巅。

detailed_translations.english: one ring of wire, rope etc in a continuous series
to wind or twist into a series of rings, or to make something do this

name: slope
trans: n. 斜坡，斜面；山坡；滑雪斜坡；斜度，坡度；（电子）斜率；扛枪姿势；<美，非正式> 东方人（尤指越南人） v. 倾斜，成斜坡；歪斜；悄悄地走，溜；<英，非正式> 逛，随意走动

sentences.english: a steep slope
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

sentences.english: a gentle
sentences.chinese: 缓坡

sentences.english: She looked back up the grassy slope.
sentences.chinese: 她回头望了一眼那绿草如茵的坡地。

sentences.english: a pleasant garden that slopes down to the river
sentences.chinese: 一座向河边倾斜的宜人花园

detailed_translations.english: a piece of ground or a surface that slopes
if the ground or a surface slopes, it is higher at one end than the other

name: slant
trans: v. （使）倾斜，（使）歪斜；有偏向性地陈述，带偏向性地报道 n. 倾斜，歪斜；（有倾向性的）观点，态度 adj. 斜的

sentences.english: The article had an anti-union slant .
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章有反工会倾向。

detailed_translations.english: a way of writing about or thinking about a subject that is based on a particular opinion or set of ideas
to slope or make something slope in a particular direction

name: protrude
trans: v. 伸出，突出；（动物）使（身体部位）突出

sentences.english: ...a huge round mass of smooth rock protruding from the water.
sentences.chinese: …从水中突出来的一块光滑的圆形巨石。

detailed_translations.english: to stick out from somewhere

name: rotate
trans: v. （使）旋转，（使）转动；（人员）轮换，轮值；轮种，轮作；定期调换地点（或位置） adj. （植） 辐状的

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 地球每24小时绕地轴自转一周。

sentences.english: Rotate the pan halfway through the baking time.
sentences.chinese: 烘烤到一半时把盘子转一下。

detailed_translations.english: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this
to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this

name: roll
trans: v. （使）翻滚，滚动；（使）翻身，翻转；（使）滚动，开动；（机器）转动，运转；（液体）滚落，滑落；使……成球状（或管状）；使平坦，压平；把（衣服的边）卷起来；掷（骰子）；（船或飞机因为风或浪而）摇晃，摇摆；转动（眼睛），（眼珠）骨碌碌地转 ；摇（车窗），卷（窗帘等）；发出持续而低沉的声音，隆隆作响；摇晃着行进，蹒跚地走；（时间）流逝；（产品）从（流水线，机器）产出；用颤音发出（辅音，尤其是r）；（词语）轻松自如说出，流畅地吐出；<非正式> 盗窃（某人，尤指喝醉或睡着的人）；（波浪，烟，云，雾）翻滚，涌流；（土地）绵延起伏，伸展；（影视节目的摄制人员名单在屏幕上）滚动显示；掷出（骰子数）；（人，动物）在原地打滚；卷（烟）；连获成功；摇动（肩膀）；<美，非正式> 使（车）翻身，使翻车 n. 卷，卷轴；卷状食品，卷饼；（通常指颈部或腰部的）赘皮，赘肉；面包卷，小圆面包；名单，花名册；滚动，翻滚；左右摇晃，振荡；隆隆声，持续的轰隆声；掷骰子；（地形的）延绵起伏；压路机，辊轧机；（名单上的）总人数；公文，案卷；（乐）（鼓的）单击（或双击）快速滚奏；<美> 一卷钞票，钱；（飞机）翻滚

sentences.english: The ball rolled into the street.
sentences.chinese: 球滚到了街上。

sentences.english: There was silence as the cameras started to roll.
sentences.chinese: 摄影机开始转动，大家安静了下来。

detailed_translations.english: if something rolls, especially something round, or if you roll it, it moves along a surface by turning over and over

name: dangle
trans: v. （使）悬垂，（使）悬荡；用（诱惑物）来诱惑（或激励）某人

sentences.english: A gold bracelet dangled from his left wrist.
sentences.chinese: 一只金手镯在他左腕上晃来晃去。

detailed_translations.english: If something dangles from somewhere or if you dangle it somewhere, it hangs or swings loosely

name: project
trans: n. 项目，计划；（学校的）课题，研究项目；<美>廉租房区，公共房屋区 v. 预计，推算；计划，规划；伸出，突出；投掷，喷射；投射，投影；展现，表现；使（声音，尤指嗓音）扩及远处；传播；想像（自己、场景等）在另一地点或时间；（尤指无意地把情感、愿望）投射转移（给别人）；使（某人）迅速成功，让（某人）获得更好的工作；作（曲线）的射影图；把（地球，天空等）投影在平面上

sentences.english: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
sentences.chinese: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。

sentences.english: a three-year research project
sentences.chinese: 一项为期三年的研究计划

sentences.english: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (= a small trial to test if an idea will be successful ) .
sentences.chinese: 试行成功后，该方案现在将得到推广。

sentences.english: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目由威康公司资助。

sentences.english: a project manager
sentences.chinese: 项目经理

sentences.english: a geography project
sentences.chinese: 一个地理课题

detailed_translations.english: a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc

name: encompass
trans: v. 包含，包括；包围，环绕；<古>促成，实现

sentences.english: The study encompasses the social, political, and economic aspects of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究涵盖了这一局势的社会、政治和经济三方面。

detailed_translations.english: to include a wide range of ideas, subjects, etc

name: active
trans: adj. 好动的；积极主动的；定期进行的，起作用的；（思想等）活跃的；切实的；（火山）活的；主动语态的；活性的；（疾病）恶化的；服役的；参战的；（动词）表动作的；（电路系统）在运转中的 n. 主动语态

sentences.english: games for active youngsters
sentences.chinese: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏

sentences.english: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
sentences.chinese: 她80多岁了，但仍旧很活跃。

sentences.english: He became politically active at college.
sentences.chinese: 他上大学时开始积极参与政治活动。

detailed_translations.english: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities

name: hump
trans: n. 小圆丘，岗，隆起；驼峰；（人的）驼背；恼怒，烦恼 v. <英>（费力地）扛，背；<冒犯>与（某人）性交；成隆起；<爱尔兰，非正式>走开（hump off）

sentences.english: the hump of a hill
sentences.chinese: 山冈

detailed_translations.english: a large round shape that rises above the surface of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 隆起；弓起；努力；急速行进

name: tower
trans: n. 塔，塔楼；（发送信号等的）塔台；塔状堆积物；高柜，高架子；高层建筑，办公大楼；立式机箱；伦敦塔（the Tower） v. （比周围的人或物）高出许多，屹立；胜过，超过（其他人或机构）；（尤指猎鹰为捕抓猎物俯冲前）高飞，翱翔

sentences.english: the Eiffel Tower
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔

sentences.english: a castle with tall towers
sentences.chinese: 有高高的塔楼的城堡

sentences.english: He towered over his mother.
sentences.chinese: 他比他的母亲高出很多。

detailed_translations.english: a tall narrow building either built on its own or forming part of a castle, church etc
to be much taller than the people or things around you

name: spin
trans: v. （使）快速旋转；（使）急转身；（头感到）眩晕；纺纱，纺织；飞驰，疾驰；编故事；有倾向性地陈述；（用甩干机或洗衣机）甩干（衣服）；（昆虫）吐（丝），结（网）；（用旋式诱饵）钓鱼；播放（唱片）；抛（硬币）；（球）旋转；（用车床将金属薄板）旋压成形 n. 高速旋转；兜风；带倾向性的解释（或说法）；（政治上的）倾向性报道；（尤指板球、网球、斯诺克球中的）旋转球；（飞机的）旋冲，螺旋下降；晕头转向，焦虑不安；（物理）核素总角动量

sentences.english: The plane’s propellers were spinning.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的螺旋桨在快速旋转。

sentences.english: She sat by the window spinning.
sentences.chinese: 她坐在窗前纺线。

sentences.english: the Earth’s spin
sentences.chinese: 机的螺旋桨在快速旋转。

detailed_translations.english: to turn around and around very quickly, or to make something do this
an act of turning around quickly

name: concave
trans: adj. 凹的，凹面的 n. 凹面 v. 使变凹形

sentences.english: a concave lens
sentences.chinese: 凹透镜

detailed_translations.english: a concave surface is curved inwards in the middle

name: convex
trans: adj. 凸面的，凸出的；凸多边形的 n. 凸面，凸出部分

sentences.english: a convex lens
sentences.chinese: 凸透镜

sentences.english: a convex mirror
sentences.chinese: 凸镜

detailed_translations.english: curved outwards, like the surface of the eye

name: pitch
trans: n. <英>体育场地，球场；（感情或活动的）激烈，强烈；（音符的）高低度，音高；推销用语；（棒球中的）投，掷；沥青，柏油；<英>摊位，（街头艺人的）表演场所；（船或飞机的）颠簸；（尤指屋顶的）倾斜度；（登山）（尤指很陡的）坡段；（鹰扑向猎物前向上攀飞的）高度；（高尔夫）下旋高球（pitch shot）；（板球）弹跳点（pitch of the ball）；<英>露营地；（技）螺距，节距；印刷密度，打印密度 v. 投，掷，扔；（棒球中）投（球）；触地，（使球）定点落地；（使）跌倒（猛然移动）；（船、飞机）上下颠簸；把……定于某水平；使（产品）针对，面向；推销，争取支持（或生意等）；定音高；向下倾斜； 支，搭（帐篷）；击出大曲线球，击高球；（板球）固定球门（准备比赛）；（球）弹起；用石头铺（路）；迫使……进入（新的境地）；（酿酒用语）给（麦芽汁）加酵母；<西印度，古>盖上沥青，涂上沥青

sentences.english: She crumpled up the page and pitched it into the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她把那页纸揉成团，扔进了火里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投掷， 扔； 猛然倒下； (船、 飞机)颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 球场；程度，强度；高度，高音；沥青；顶点
detailed_translations.english: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；投掷，扔；使猛然倒下；表达；把…定于特定程度；定调；架设，搭，营
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

name: glamor
trans: n. 魅力；魔法；迷人的美（等于 glamour） vt. 迷惑；使有魅力（等于 glamour）

sentences.english: But when it comes down to it, we cannot ignore a film franchise that has been successfully thrilling us with action and glamor for over 40 years.
sentences.chinese: 但是说起这类影片的时候，我们就无法忽视一部电影的特殊魅力。 它成功地运用动作特技和魅力吸引了我们40多年。

sentences.english: More important is the use of that '50s-style illustration, which creates a perfect merger of glamor, celebrity and style announcing an issue that covers the magazine's long history.
sentences.chinese: 其次，封面运用了50年代风格，完美揉合了魅力、名人和格调，仿佛说出了这期杂志浓缩的全部历史。

detailed_translations.chinese: 魅力；魔法；迷人的美（等于glamour）

name: glamorous
trans: adj. 迷人的，富有魅力的

sentences.english: She led an exciting and glamorous life.
sentences.chinese: 她生活奢华，充满刺激。

sentences.english: the most glamorous neighborhood in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里最繁华的街区

sentences.english: On television, she looks so glamorous.
sentences.chinese: 她在电视里看上去光彩照人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有魅力的, 迷人的
detailed_translations.english: attractive, exciting, and related to wealth and success

name: catching
trans: adj. （非正式）（疾病）传染性的；（情感或情绪）有感染力的 v. 截住（抛掷物等）；接住（掉下的人）；捉住；捕获（试图逃跑的人或动物）；赶上（前面的人）（catch 的现在分词）

sentences.english: Julia’s enthusiasm was catching.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉娅的热情很有感染力。

detailed_translations.english: an illness that is catching is easily passed to other people

name: engross
trans: vt. 使全神贯注；用大字体书写；正式写成（决议等）；独占；吸引

sentences.english: The scene was stunning, and for a time engrossed all our attention.
sentences.chinese: 景色非常美丽，一时间把我们都完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: if something engrosses you, it interests you so much that you do not notice anything else

name: engrossed
trans: adj. 全神贯注的；专心致志的 v. 全神贯注（engross 的过去分词）

sentences.english: Tony didn't notice because he was too engrossed in his work.
sentences.chinese: 托尼因过于全神贯注于工作而没有注意到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全神贯注的；专心致志的
detailed_translations.english: If you are engrossed in something, it holds your attention completely

name: attractive
trans: adj. 吸引人的，有吸引力的；（人）迷人的，有魅力的；值得考虑的，值得做的；（与）引力（有关）的

sentences.english: an attractive young woman
sentences.chinese: 妩媚动人的年轻女子

sentences.english: Women seem to find him attractive .
sentences.chinese: 女性似乎觉得他很有吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有吸引力的， 引起注意的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is attractive is good looking, especially in a way that makes you sexually interested in them

name: conspicuous
trans: adj. 出色的，引人注目的；显眼的，明显的

sentences.english: The notice must be displayed in a conspicuous place.
sentences.chinese: 通告一定要贴在显眼的地方。

sentences.english: a bird with conspicuous white markings
sentences.chinese: 一种长有醒目白斑的鸟

sentences.english: I felt very conspicuous in my red coat.
sentences.chinese: 我穿着红外套，感觉自己十分显眼。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

name: inviting
trans: adj. 诱人的，吸引人的 v. 邀请（invite 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: The log fire looked warm and inviting.
sentences.chinese: 篝火看上去温暖诱人。

detailed_translations.english: something that is inviting is very attractive and makes you want to be near it, try it, taste it etc

name: bait
trans: n. 用作诱饵的人（或物）；饵，诱饵 v. 放诱饵；激怒，故意惹恼；纵犬袭击（动物）

sentences.english: We used worms as bait.
sentences.chinese: 我们用小虫子作诱饵。

sentences.english: The fish wouldn’t take the bait .
sentences.chinese: 鱼儿不上钩。

sentences.english: He baited his hook with pie.
sentences.chinese: 他把馅饼放在钓钩上作饵。

sentences.english: The boys dug pits and baited them so that they could spear their prey.
sentences.chinese: 男孩子们挖了陷阱，在里面放上诱饵，以便用矛刺杀猎物。

detailed_translations.english: food used to attract fish, animals, or birds so that you can catch them
If you bait a hook or trap, you put bait on it or in it

name: charisma
trans: n. 个人魅力，感召力；神赐的力量，神授的能力；非凡的领导力

sentences.english: He lacks charisma.
sentences.chinese: 他缺乏个人魅力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 魅力；神授的能力；非凡的领导力
detailed_translations.english: a natural ability to attract and interest other people and make them admire you

name: draw
trans: v. 画，绘画；吸引，引起（兴趣、注意）；作（比较），进行（对比）；（尤指乘车辆）移动，行进；引起，激起（反应）；抽（签、牌），抽取；拔出，抽出（尤指武器）；获取，推断出；抽出，吸出；抽（烟），吸（气）；（游戏）以平局告终，战平；取（款），领取(薪水等)；慢慢走，溜达；拉，拖；拉（窗帘、帘子）；使透露消息，使说出意见；草拟，制定（法律文件等）；（滚木球）使（球）朝预定的目标作弧线运动；（船）吃（水）；（帆）吃饱风；使（尤指血液）流出，使渗出；获得，得到；利用，动用；给（浴缸）放满水；拉制（铁丝），轧制；（茶）被泡开，被泡出味来；（用铅笔、钢笔等）画，绘画；吸（烟），吸入（空气）；取（款），领取（薪水等）；拉（窗帘、百叶窗等） n. 和局，不分胜负；抽彩，抽签；由抽签决定对手的比赛，由抽签决定对手的系列比赛；有吸引力的人(或事物)；吸烟；抽签，抓阄；〈非正式〉大麻制品；拔枪；抽彩，抽奖；有吸引力的人（或事物）

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: enrapture
trans: vt. 使狂喜；使着迷

sentences.english: The place at once enraptured me.
sentences.chinese: 这个地方立刻把我迷住了。

sentences.english: The 20,000-strong audience listened, enraptured.
sentences.chinese: 两万多名观众听得入了迷。

sentences.english: ...an enraptured audience.
sentences.chinese: ...一场观众如痴如醉。

detailed_translations.english: If something or someone enraptures you, you think they are wonderful or fascinating

name: induce
trans: v. 引诱，诱使；引起，导致；给（孕妇）引产，（用药物）催生；归纳出

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: intoxicate
trans: v. （酒或毒品）（使）麻醉；（使）中毒；（使）兴奋 adj. 喝醉的；陶醉的

detailed_translations.english: (of an alcoholic drink) to produce in (a person) a state ranging from euphoria to stupor, usually accompanied by loss of inhibitions and control; make drunk; inebriate

name: lure
trans: v. 引诱，诱惑 n. 诱惑（物），诱惑力；鱼饵，诱饵

sentences.english: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.
sentences.chinese: 他把她诱骗到家里，然后用父亲的枪把她打死。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引力， 诱惑物； 诱饵， 鱼饵
detailed_translations.english: something that attracts people, or the quality of being able to do this

name: entice
trans: v. 诱使，引诱

sentences.english: To influence or lead by means of wiles; entice.
sentences.chinese: 引诱，诱骗通过使用诡计来影响或怂恿；诱使。

sentences.english: To entice all the people looking for a loo-break to stay a bit longer, locals bought the antebellum houses and turned them into restaurants and inns.
sentences.chinese: 为了诱使那些原本只想小憩一会的过客待的更久一些，当地人买下内战前的房子，改装成餐馆和旅店。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something or go somewhere, usually by offering them something that they want

name: tempt
trans: v. 引诱，诱惑；怂恿，利诱；冒……的风险

sentences.english: If you leave valuables in your car it will tempt thieves.
sentences.chinese: 如果把贵重物品留在车上，会招来小偷的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not

name: addict
trans: n. （尤指毒品）上瘾者，瘾君子；<非正式>对……入迷的人 v. 使上瘾，使沉迷

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Walt's meth-business partner, the addict Jesse, is still recovering from the drug-related death of his girlfriend Jane at the end of last season.
sentences.chinese: 而沃特的制毒搭档——瘾君子杰西还未从女朋友之死的痛苦中恢复过来。 他的女朋友简在上一季结尾时死于毒品。

name: addicted
trans: adj. （吸毒）成瘾的，上瘾的；入迷的，着迷的 v. 使上瘾，使沉迷（addict 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: Many of the women are addicted to heroin and cocaine.
sentences.chinese: 这些妇女中的很多吸食海洛因和可卡因成瘾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉溺于某种（尤其是不良的）嗜好的；入了迷的，上了瘾的
detailed_translations.english: unable to stop taking a harmful substance, especially a drug

name: absorb
trans: v. 吸收；使并入，纳入；同化，汲取；消减，缓冲（外力、震动等）；理解，掌握（信息）；使全神贯注，使专心；承受（变革、影响等），承担（费用等）；花掉（大量金钱），耗费

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

name: absorbing
trans: adj. 十分有趣的；引人入胜的 v. 吸收；接受（消息等）；（使）并入；掌握；（使）全神贯注；减轻（打击等）作用；耗费，占用；承担（absorb 的现在分词）

name: delicate
trans: adj. 柔和的，清淡的；虚弱的，纤弱的；脆弱的，易碎的；小巧玲珑的，纤细的；微妙的，棘手的；精致的，精巧的；灵巧的，熟练的；（仪器）灵敏的 n. 精美的衣物

sentences.english: his delicate hands
sentences.chinese: 他纤细的手

sentences.english: delicate hand-cut glass
sentences.chinese: 易碎的手工刻花玻璃

sentences.english: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin .
sentences.chinese: 阳光很容易晒伤小孩娇嫩的皮肤。

detailed_translations.english: small and having a beautiful shape or appearance

name: pitiful
trans: adj. 可怜的，令人同情的

sentences.english: The refugees were a pitiful sight .
sentences.chinese: 难民们看上去真可怜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 值得同情的， 可怜的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is pitiful looks or sounds so sad and unfortunate that you feel very sorry for them

name: fragile
trans: adj. 易碎的，易损的；不牢固的，易被摧毁的；纤巧美丽的；虚弱的，体弱的

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: emaciate
trans: v. （使）消瘦；（使）衰弱；消瘦

detailed_translations.english: to become or cause to become abnormally thin

name: emaciated
trans: adj. 瘦弱的；憔悴的 v. 憔悴；消瘦下去（emaciate 的过去分词）

sentences.english: The prisoners were ill and emaciated.
sentences.chinese: 囚犯们疾病缠身，骨瘦如柴。

detailed_translations.english: extremely thin from lack of food or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 憔悴；消瘦下去（emaciate的过去分词）

name: flimsy
trans: adj. 脆弱的；浅薄的；易损坏的；不周密的 n. 薄纸；复写纸；打字纸

sentences.english: a flimsy cotton dress
sentences.chinese: 一件又轻又薄的棉布连衣裙

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的；浅薄的；易损坏的；不周密的
detailed_translations.english: flimsy cloth or clothing is light and thin

name: fragmentary
trans: adj. 支离破碎的，不完整的

sentences.english: a fragmentary account
sentences.chinese: 零星的叙述

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片的；不完全的；断断续续的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different small parts

name: frail
trans: adj. （人）脆弱的，虚弱的；易碎的，易坏的；（性格、道德方面）脆弱的，意志薄弱的 n. （装无花果或葡萄干的）灯心草篮；<美，非正式，旧>女人

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["frail elderly people"]}
sentences.chinese: 年老体衰者

sentences.english: her frail health
sentences.chinese: 她虚弱的身体

detailed_translations.english: someone who is frail is weak and thin because they are old or ill

name: brittle
trans: adj. 易碎的，脆的；（关系或局势）不牢固的，易变的；脆弱的；冷淡的；尖利的，刺耳的；（声音）像要哭的 n. 果仁薄脆糖

sentences.english: In systems such as this we also often find that there are either no tests around this configuration code, or the tests that do exist are brittle and/or not realistic.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的系统中，我们经常会发现对于这些配置代码没有进行测试，或者尽管存在测试，但它很脆弱且/或不切实际。

sentences.english: But while our screens are brittle, theirs is flexible––at what they say is one tenth the price.
sentences.chinese: 但我们的屏幕都很脆弱，他们的却很柔软，而且价钱是我们的十分之一。

name: slender
trans: adj. 苗条的，纤细的；（尤指竿、枝或茎）细长的，狭窄的；微薄的，不足的

sentences.english: She is slender and stylish.
sentences.chinese: 她身材修长，穿着时髦。

sentences.english: The company only has a slender hope of survival.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司维持下去的希望很渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: thin in an attractive or graceful way

name: impotence
trans: n. [泌尿][中医]阳萎；虚弱；无效（等于 impotency）

sentences.english: Impotence affects 10 million men in the U.S. alone.
sentences.chinese: 仅在美国，就有1千万男子患有阳痿。

detailed_translations.chinese: [泌尿][中医] 阳萎；虚弱；无效（等于impotency）
detailed_translations.english: Impotence is a man's sexual problem in which his penis fails to get hard or stay hard

name: limp
trans: v. 瘸着脚走，跛行；进展缓慢，艰难地行进 adj. 柔软的，不直挺的；无力的，无精神的 n. 跛行

sentences.english: a limp handshake
sentences.chinese: 无力的握手

sentences.english: His body suddenly went limp.
sentences.chinese: 他突然身子一软。

detailed_translations.english: not firm or strong

detailed_translations.chinese: 跛行，一拐一拐地走；缓慢费力地前进
detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured
the way someone walks when they are limping

name: cryptic
trans: adj. 神秘的，含义模糊的；[动] 隐藏的

sentences.english: This thrilling story will keep you on the edge of your seat as you explore the house, collect items and unravel cryptic secrets.
sentences.chinese: 这惊心动魄的故事，将让你在你的座位边，为您探索的房子，收集物品和解开神秘的秘密。

sentences.english: It was the cryptic first sign of a cyberespionage and information-warfare campaign devised to disrupt the 2016 presidential election, the first such attempt by a foreign power in American history.
sentences.chinese: 这是一场网络间谍—信息战行动的第一个神秘迹象，该行动旨在干扰2016年的总统大选，在美国的历史上，这还是第一次有外国势力有这样的举动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的； 含义模糊的
detailed_translations.english: having a meaning that is mysterious or not easily understood

name: secluded
trans: adj. 隐蔽的；隐退的，隐居的 v. 隔绝（seclude 的过去式）

sentences.english: He’s 80 years old now and lives a very secluded life.
sentences.chinese: 他现在80岁了，过着远离尘嚣的生活。

detailed_translations.english: very private and quiet

name: seclusion
trans: n. 隐居；与世隔绝的地方

sentences.english: They enjoyed ten days of peace and seclusion.
sentences.chinese: 他们享受了十天与世隔绝的宁静生活。

name: dissemble
trans: vt. 掩饰，掩盖；假装 vi. 隐藏，掩饰（思想、感情等）

sentences.english: Henry was not slow to dissemble when it served his purposes.
sentences.chinese: 形势一对他有利，亨利就马上开始隐瞒。

detailed_translations.english: to hide your true feelings, thoughts etc

name: lurk
trans: vi. 潜伏；潜藏；埋伏 n. 潜伏；埋伏

sentences.english: a dark formless danger, lurking in the shadows
sentences.chinese: 一种潜藏在阴影里的无形危险

detailed_translations.english: to wait somewhere quietly and secretly, usually because you are going to do something wrong

name: sneak
trans: v. 偷偷地走，潜行；偷带，私运；<非正式>偷走（不重要的或小的东西）；偷偷地做（或获得）；<英>（尤作儿童用语）打小报告，告密 n. <英>打小报告的人，告状者（尤指儿童）；<非正式>鬼鬼祟祟的人；四分卫快速带球切入；<美，非正式>旅游鞋，软帮运动鞋；偷偷摸摸的行为 adj. 出其不意的，偷偷摸摸的

sentences.english: I snuck her a note.
sentences.chinese: 我偷偷塞给她一张纸条。

detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere secretly and quietly in order to avoid being seen or heard
to go somewhere secretly and quietly in order to avoid being seen or heard

name: conceal
trans: v. 隐匿，隐藏；隐瞒（真实感情或真相）；遮盖，遮住

sentences.english: The shadows concealed her as she crept up to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她借着阴影蹑手蹑脚地走向房子。

sentences.english: The path was concealed by long grass.
sentences.chinese: 小路隐藏在长长的草里。

sentences.english: a concealed weapon
sentences.chinese: 藏匿的武器

detailed_translations.english: to hide something carefully

name: feign
trans: vt. 假装；装作；捏造；想象 vi. 假装；装作；作假；佯作

sentences.english: Feigning a headache, I went upstairs to my room.
sentences.chinese: 我假装头痛，上楼到自己房间去了。

detailed_translations.english: to pretend to have a particular feeling or to be ill, asleep etc

name: pretend
trans: v. 伪装，假装；（玩游戏时）假扮，装扮；自诩，自称（pretend to） adj. <非正式>假装的，假想的（尤为儿童使用）

sentences.english: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

sentences.english: He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
sentences.chinese: 他并没睡着，不过是装睡而已。

sentences.english: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。

sentences.english: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不可以娶她，装作娶她无妨是不对的。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
imaginary or not real - used especially by children

name: simulate
trans: v. 假装，冒充；模拟，模仿；看上去像；计算机模拟 adj. <古> 虚假的，假装的

sentences.english: a machine that simulates conditions in space
sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

sentences.english: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

detailed_translations.english: to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real

name: hide
trans: v. 把……藏起来，隐藏；躲藏，躲避；遮住，遮挡；掩盖，隐瞒 n. （可观察鸟兽行动的）隐匿处，埋伏处；兽皮；<非正式>（困境中的）生命，人身安全

sentences.english: She keeps a bottle of gin hidden behind a stack of books.
sentences.chinese: 她在一堆书的后面藏了一瓶杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found

name: obscure
trans: adj. 难以说清楚的，模糊的；鲜为人知的，默默无闻的；未被查实的，不确定的；费解的，晦涩的 v. 遮掩，遮蔽；使费解 n. 某种模糊的或不清楚的东西

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

name: screen
trans: n. 屏幕，荧光屏；计算机屏幕显示的数据（或图像）；（电影院）银幕；电影（总称）；（摄）聚焦屏；屏风，隔板；掩蔽物，屏障；掩饰，幌子；（医疗）化验，检查；（拦在圣坛或唱诗班四周的木质或石砌）围屏；（隔离用的）植物丛；纱窗，纱门；（纱门或纱窗的）金属丝，塑料线；（机动车的）挡风玻璃；（篮球、冰球等运动的）掩护；（印刷）网屏，网版；屏蔽器；（电子）帘栅极，屏栅极（=screen grid）；掩护部队，护航舰队；大筛子，滤网 v. 检查，筛查（以确定是否患病）；检测（体内违禁药物）；隐藏，遮蔽；庇护，包庇；（似乎）用屏障把事物隔开（screen sth. off）；防止（或免受）电磁干扰；放映（影片），播放（电视节目）；审查，甄别（看是否可以信任）；分析，评估；对（人、行李）进行安全检查；转接，甄别（来电以决定是否接听）；筛，筛选（谷物，煤等）；检查排除（screen someone/thing out）；加网印刷

sentences.english: a computer with an 18-inch colour screen
sentences.chinese: 带18英寸彩色屏幕的电脑

sentences.english: He went on staring at the TV screen .
sentences.chinese: 他继续盯着电视屏幕看。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a television or computer where the picture or information appears

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩蔽， 遮蔽； 放映， 播放； 审查， 甄别
detailed_translations.english: if something screens something else, it is in front of it and hides it

name: deceit
trans: n. 欺骗，诡计

sentences.english: an atmosphere of hypocrisy and deceit
sentences.chinese: 充满虚伪和欺骗的氛围

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is intended to make someone believe something that is not true

name: deceitful
trans: adj. 欺骗的，撒谎的

sentences.english: His manner was sly and deceitful.
sentences.chinese: 他的态度诡诈而又不老实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗的；欺诈的；谎言的；虚伪的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is deceitful tells lies in order to get what they want

name: deceive
trans: v. 欺骗，蒙骗；使误信，误导；对（丈夫、妻子或伴侣）不忠

sentences.english: He had been deceived by a young man claiming to be the son of a millionaire.
sentences.chinese: 他被一个自称是百万富翁之子的年轻人骗了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true
to make someone believe something that is not true

name: deceptive
trans: adj. 欺骗性的，造成假象的

sentences.english: Some snakes move with deceptive speed (= move faster than you think or expect ) .
sentences.chinese: 有些蛇的爬行速度出乎意料地快。

sentences.english: Gwen’s students may look angelic, but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 格温的学生也许看起来像天使，不过人不可貌相。

detailed_translations.english: something that is deceptive seems to be one thing but is in fact very different

name: gangster
trans: n. 歹徒，匪徒

sentences.english: ...a gangster film.
sentences.chinese: …一部黑帮片。

detailed_translations.english: a member of a violent group of criminals

name: fraud
trans: n. 欺诈，骗局，诡计；骗子；伪劣品，冒牌货

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["electoral fraud"]}
sentences.chinese: 选举欺诈

sentences.english: She was found guilty of fraud.
sentences.chinese: 她被判犯有诈骗罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺诈， 诈骗； 骗子
detailed_translations.english: the crime of deceiving people in order to gain something such as money or goods

name: fraudulent
trans: adj. 欺诈的，诈骗的

sentences.english: a fraudulent insurance claim
sentences.chinese: 欺诈性保险索赔

sentences.english: a fraudulent statement
sentences.chinese: 骗人的声明

detailed_translations.english: intended to deceive people in an illegal way, in order to gain money, power etc

name: homicide
trans: n. <美>杀人；谋杀；<美>（警局中的）重案组；<旧>谋杀者

sentences.english: The police arrived at the scene of the homicide.
sentences.chinese: 警察赶到了杀人现场。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of murder

name: theft
trans: n. 偷窃，盗窃；盗窃罪

sentences.english: There have been a number of thefts in the area.
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗偷窃案。

sentences.english: the theft of £150 from the office
sentences.chinese: 办公室150英镑失窃

detailed_translations.english: an act of stealing something

name: pilferage
trans: n. 偷盗，行窃；赃物

name: counterfeit
trans: adj. 伪造的，假冒的；<古>假装的，虚假的 v. 伪造，仿造；佯作，假装；酷似 n. 伪造物，赝品

sentences.english: They admitted counterfeiting documents.
sentences.chinese: 他们承认伪造了文件。

sentences.english: Levi Strauss says counterfeits of the company's jeans are flooding Europe.
sentences.chinese: 利瓦伊·斯特劳斯说该公司牛仔裤的仿冒品充斥着欧洲市场。

detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly in order to deceive people
Counterfeit is also a noun
made to look exactly like something else, in order to deceive people

name: conspire
trans: v. 密谋，共谋；共同导致

sentences.english: They'd conspired to overthrow the government.
sentences.chinese: 他们曾合谋推翻政府。

detailed_translations.english: to secretly plan with someone else to do something illegal

name: conspiracy
trans: n. 阴谋，密谋；阴谋集团

sentences.english: There were many conspiracy theories (= beliefs that something is the result of a conspiracy ) surrounding Princess Diana’s death.
sentences.chinese: 围绕戴安娜王妃之死有许多阴谋论。

detailed_translations.english: a secret plan made by two or more people to do something that is harmful or illegal

name: sin
trans: n. （违背宗教或道德的）罪，罪恶；过错，过失 v. 犯戒律，犯过失；亵渎，冒犯（上帝，人，原则）（sin against） abbr. 正弦（sine 的缩写）

sentences.english: She needed to confess her sins and ask for forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她需要忏悔罪过，请求宽恕。

sentences.english: He knew that he had committed a terrible sin .
sentences.chinese: 他知道自己犯下了可怕的罪行。

detailed_translations.english: an action that is against religious rules and is considered to be an offence against God
to do something that is against religious rules and is considered to be an offence against God

name: brew
trans: v. 沏（茶），冲（咖啡）；酿（啤酒）；酝酿，即将来临 n. 啤酒；茶，咖啡；交融，混合

sentences.english: Every beer on the menu was brewed locally.
sentences.chinese: 酒单上的所有啤酒都是本地酿造的。

detailed_translations.english: to make beer
to make beer
a drink that is brewed, especially tea

name: beguile
trans: vt. 欺骗；使着迷；轻松地消磨

sentences.english: I was beguiled by the romance and exotic atmosphere of the souks in Marrakech.
sentences.chinese: 我被马拉喀什剧场浪漫的异国情调迷住了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗；使着迷；轻松地消磨
detailed_translations.english: to persuade or trick someone into doing something

name: despoil
trans: vt. 掠夺，剥夺；夺取

sentences.english: ...people who despoil the countryside.
sentences.chinese: ...掠夺乡村的人。

detailed_translations.english: to steal from a place or people using force, especially in a war

name: forge
trans: v. 形成，缔造；伪造，假冒；稳步前进；锻造；伪装，假冒 n. 锻铁炉，锻造车间

sentences.english: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

sentences.english: a forged passport
sentences.chinese: 假护照

detailed_translations.english: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects

name: assassinate
trans: v. 暗杀，行刺

sentences.english: a plot to assassinate the President
sentences.chinese: 刺杀总统的阴谋

detailed_translations.english: to murder an important person

name: kidnap
trans: v. 绑架，劫持 n. 绑架，诱拐

sentences.english: Police appealed for wit­nesses after a woman was kidnapped at gunpoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名妇女遭到持枪绑架，警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them

name: embezzle
trans: vt. 盗用；挪用；贪污

sentences.english: Two managers were charged with embezzling $400,000.
sentences.chinese: 两名经理被控挪用了40万美元。

detailed_translations.english: to steal money from the place where you work

name: extort
trans: vt. 敲诈；侵占；强求；牵强地引出

sentences.english: Corrupt government officials were extorting money from him.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的政府官员那时正向他勒索钱财。

detailed_translations.english: to illegally force someone to give you something, especially money, by threatening them

name: blackmail
trans: n. 勒索，敲诈；胁迫，威胁；勒索金 v. 敲诈，勒索；要挟，胁迫

sentences.english: She had already tried emotional blackmail (=  tried to make him feel guilty  ) to stop him leaving.
sentences.chinese: 她试过以情相迫，不让他离开。

detailed_translations.chinese: 勒索，敲诈；勒索所得之款
detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get money from you or make you do what they want by threatening to tell other people your secrets
to use blackmail against someone

name: delude
trans: v. 欺骗，哄骗；<旧>迷惑；<旧>逃避；<旧>使失望

sentences.english: Neither side should delude itself that it can avoid the harm caused by an increased mutual antagonism;
sentences.chinese: 任何一方都不应迷惑他自己，认为增长的相互对立所带来的伤害是可以避免；

sentences.english: Neither side should delude itself that it can avoid the harm caused by an increased mutual antagonism; both should understand that a crisis in one country can hurt the other.
sentences.chinese: 任何一方都不应迷惑他自己，认为增长的相互对立所带来的伤害是可以避免；双方都应认识到，一国的危机可以伤害到另一国。

name: defraud
trans: vt. 欺骗 vi. 进行诈骗（过去式 defrauded, 过去分词 defrauded, 现在分词 defrauding, 第三人称单数 defrauds, 名词 defraudation）

sentences.english: He faces charges of theft and conspiracy to defraud (= a secret plan to cheat someone, made by two or more people ) .
sentences.chinese: 他面临偷窃和合谋诈骗的指控。

detailed_translations.english: to trick a person or organization in order to get money from them

name: fabricate
trans: v. 制造，生产；捏造，编造；组装，装配

sentences.english: The police were accused of fabricating evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方被控捏造证据。

sentences.english: The discs are expensive to fabricate.
sentences.chinese: 这些磁盘的生产成本很高。

detailed_translations.english: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone

name: purge
trans: v. 清洗（组织中的异己分子）；清除，排除（不愉快的情况或感觉）；删除（不需要的东西） ；催泻，通便；<法律>弥补，消除（蔑视法庭罪）；（尤指由于患有贪食症）使吐出吃下的食物，催吐 n. （对异己的）清洗，排除；泻药

sentences.english: Anorexics may overeat before purging themselves or vomiting.
sentences.chinese: 厌食症患者会在暴饮暴食之后服用泻药或者把吃下去的东西呕吐出来。

detailed_translations.english: to take a substance that makes your  bowel s  empty
a substance used to make you empty your  bowel s

name: belie
trans: vt. 给人以假象，掩饰（感情等）；显示……为虚假，表明……不正确；使落空，辜负（要求、期望等）；给人以……假象，使人对……产生错觉

sentences.english: Her pleasant manner belied her true character.
sentences.chinese: 她讨人喜欢的举止掩饰了她真实的个性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩饰；与…不符；使失望；证明…虚假错误
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a false idea about something

name: trap
trans: n. （捕捉动物的）陷阱，网，夹子；圈套，诡计；伏击；牢笼，困境；<俚>嘴；（尤指旧时使用的）双轮轻便马车；（应该避免的）错误，问题；（赛狗开始时的）放狗隔栏；（高尔夫球场的）沙坑，凹地；容器，存贮装置；（水管）存水弯，U形管；抛靶器（将泥鸽等抛于空中以打靶）；<史>（射球戏用的）抛球器 v. 设陷阱（或夹子、捕捉器）捕捉；使陷入圈套，使中计；诱捕，抓捕；使无力改变，使受限制；把……困在，使陷于（尤指危险之地）；（尤指身体某部位等）被卡住；聚集（空气、气体或能量等）；（英足）停（球）；（棒球）抓住（从地上弹起的球） n. <美>暗色岩

sentences.english: Mr Smith has walked straight into a trap laid by the Tories.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生直接落入了保守党布设的圈套。

sentences.english: He felt he had been trapped into accepting the terms of the contract.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得自己是中了圈套才接受这合同条款的。

sentences.english: Were you just trying to trap her into making some admission?
sentences.chinese: 你仅仅是在试图诱骗她招供吗？

detailed_translations.english: a clever trick that is used to catch someone or to make them do or say something that they did not intend to
to trick sb into sth

name: accomplice
trans: n. 同谋，帮凶

sentences.english: Witnesses said the gunman immediately ran to a motorcycle being ridden by an accomplice.
sentences.chinese: 证人们说该枪手立即向由一名同犯驾驶的摩托车跑去。

detailed_translations.english: a person who helps someone such as a criminal to do something wrong

name: abduct
trans: vt. 绑架；诱拐；使外展

sentences.english: The diplomat was abducted on his way to the airport.
sentences.chinese: 外交官在去机场途中遭绑架。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone away by force

name: convenient
trans: adj. 方便的，便利的；附近的，方便到达的；<旧>适当的

sentences.chinese: 使用邮购目录是一种方便的购物方式。

sentences.english: My secretary will call you to arrange a convenient time to meet.
sentences.chinese: 我的秘书会打电话给你安排一个方便的时间见面。

sentences.english: restaurants convenient for shops and theatres
sentences.chinese: 靠近商店和剧院的餐厅

detailed_translations.english: useful to you because it saves you time, or does not spoil your plans or cause you problems

name: grateful
trans: adj. 感谢的，感激的；（尤用于书信或正式场合提出请求）感激不尽，请；<古>令人获得快意的，受欢迎的

sentences.english: Our grateful thanks go to all who participated.
sentences.chinese: 我们衷心感谢所有参与者。

sentences.english: She gave me a grateful look.
sentences.chinese: 她感激地看了我一眼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to thank someone because of something kind that they have done, or showing this feeling

trans: n. 感激之情，感谢

sentences.english: He smiled at them with gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 他向他们笑了笑表示谢意。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being grateful and wanting to express your thanks

name: auspicious
trans: adj. 有助于成功的，有利的；吉利的，吉兆的；<古> 富裕的

sentences.chinese: 这个新来的男孩在小学校里有幸运的第一天。

sentences.chinese: 倒转的同样碑刻是重复的，此外一排五个纳粹党所用的十字记号如幸运的符号表示安全和好运。

name: cozy
trans: adj. 舒适的，温暖的；友好的，亲密无间的；密切的，互相勾结的；轻易得到的（但不一定是恰当的）；不提出（或不接受）挑战的 n. （茶壶的）保温罩；（角落里的）带蓬双人座 v. （非正式）使感到舒适，使得意

sentences.chinese: 床上有一位老奶奶，一个打着鼾的奶奶睡在舒适的床上，在那打瞌睡的房子里，每个人都在睡觉。

sentences.english: And on that bed there is a granny, a snoring granny on a cozy bed in a napping house, where everyone is sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 那张床上有一位老奶奶，在那打瞌睡的房子里，一个打着鼾奶奶睡在舒适的床上，在那里每个人都在睡觉。

name: fortunate
trans: adj. 幸运的；带来幸运的，吉利的；富足的；侥幸的

name: readily
trans: adv. 轻而易举地，迅速地；乐意地，欣然地

sentences.english: Boats are readily available to visitors.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以很方便地租到船只。

sentences.english: The information is readily accessible on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 这些信息在因特网上一查就能找到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐意地， 欣然地； 容易地； 很快地， 立即
detailed_translations.english: quickly and easily

name: boon
trans: n. 裨益，优势，有用的东西 adj. 愉快的；慷慨的

sentences.english: It is for this reason that television proves such a boon to so many people.
sentences.chinese: 正是这个原因电视机成为这么多人的一大福音。

detailed_translations.english: You can describe something as a boon when it makes life better or easier for someone

name: bonanza
trans: n. 富矿带；带来好运之事；幸运

sentences.english: The expected sales bonanza hadn't materialized.
sentences.chinese: 预期的销售大涨并未成为现实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 富矿带；带来好运之事；幸运
detailed_translations.english: You can refer to a sudden great increase in wealth, success, or luck as a bonanza

name: blessing
trans: n. 幸事，福祉；支持，赞同；上帝的恩宠，祝福；祷告，祈祷 v. 求上帝保佑，祝福；祝圣，使圣洁；赞美上帝（bless 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: The priest gave the blessing.
sentences.chinese: 牧师为大家祝福。

detailed_translations.english: protection and help from God, or words spoken to ask for this

detailed_translations.chinese: 使幸福（bless的ing形式）；使神圣化；为…祈神赐福

name: thrive
trans: v. 茁壮成长，兴旺，繁荣；（尤指在别人觉得困难的时候）以……为乐，可以出色应对

sentences.english: plants that thrive in tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 在热带雨林蓬勃生长的植物

sentences.english: a business which managed to thrive during a recession
sentences.chinese: 在经济萧条时期也能顺利发展的一家企业

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

name: furrow
trans: n. 皱纹；犁沟；车辙 vt. 犁；耕；弄绉 vi. 犁田；开沟；犁出痕迹 n. （Furrow）人名；（英）弗罗

sentences.english: A deep furrow appeared between his brows.
sentences.chinese: 他眉间出现了一道深深的皱纹。

detailed_translations.english: a deep line or fold in the skin of someone’s face, especially on the forehead
to make a wide deep line in the surface of something

name: instrument
trans: n. 器械；乐器；仪器；促成某事的人（或事物），手段；受利用（或控制）的人，工具；文据，正式法律文件 v. 给……装备测量仪器

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

name: implement
trans: v. 执行，贯彻；为……提供工具 n. 工具，器具；<苏格兰>履行；手段

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

name: tool
trans: n. （尤指手用）工具；（完成工作或达到目标的）工具，手段；受人利用的人，工具；<忌，俚>阴茎；容易被利用（或欺骗）的人，蠢人；（计算机）工具；（书籍装订时的）压印图案 v. 驱车兜风，驾车到处跑；（用工具）制作，在（皮革，尤指书籍的皮革封面）上压印图案；（为生产而）配置设备；凿刻（石头）；<英，非正式>（尤指为犯罪活动而）武装

sentences.english: I don’t have the right tools to start fiddling around with the engine.
sentences.chinese: 我没有合适的工具来摆弄发动机。

sentences.english: a shop selling garden tools
sentences.chinese: 出售园艺工具的商店

detailed_translations.chinese: 工具，用具；器械，机床；手段
detailed_translations.english: something that you hold in your hand and use to do a particular job

detailed_translations.chinese: 使用工具；用机床装备工厂

name: shaft
trans: n. 竖井，通风井；（工具或武器的）杆，柄；（机器的）轴；（马车的）辕；箭，矛；柱（尤指柱头和柱基间的主要部分）；（光、闪电等的）一道，一束；机智的话，（尤指）攻击性的话；侮辱，责难（the shaft）；（品质或情感的）突然闪现；<俚>阴茎 v. <非正式>苛待，欺骗；（光成束地）照射；<俚>性交

sentences.english: a drive shaft
sentences.chinese: 驱动轴

detailed_translations.chinese: 拍杆；[机] 轴；箭杆；杆状物
detailed_translations.english: an  arrow

name: pump
trans: n. 抽水机，泵；<英>（跳舞、锻炼、运动等用的）平底轻便鞋；<美>（通常皮制的）女式浅口鞋；抽吸，泵送；（生理）泵（指特定离子逆浓度梯度进行的跨膜主动运输机制） v. （用泵）抽出，注入（液体或气体）；从地下抽出（水、油等），用泵抽运（水、空气等）；（上下或内外）快速反复运动；（心脏）泵送血液；操作泵（唧筒）；（液体）间歇地喷涌出；<非正式> 盘问，套问；<非正式> 让某人使用大量药物；<非正式> 举重；给......洗胃；<非正式> 不断制造，连续播放；大量增加；<非正式> 将（子弹）射向目标；（尤指为了防止打滑而）点踏（刹车板），点拉（操纵杆）；上下（或内外）快速摇动，急速摇晃

sentences.english: water/air/beer etc pump (=for moving water, air etc)
sentences.chinese: 抽水机/抽气机/啤酒泵等

sentences.english: It's not enough to get rid of raw sewage by pumping it out to sea.
sentences.chinese: 仅用水泵将未经处理的污水排入海中是不够的。

sentences.english: The money raised will be used to dig bore holes to pump water into the dried-up lake.
sentences.chinese: 筹到的钱款将用来挖井眼，再将水抽入干涸的湖中。

detailed_translations.english: a machine for forcing liquid or gas into or out of something
to make liquid or gas move in a particular direction, using a pump

name: snap
trans: v. （咔嚓一声）断裂，折断；（使）啪地突然移动；厉声说，怒气冲冲地说；突然崩溃，情绪突然失控；（狗等动物）突然咬，猛咬；拍照，摄影；<美>使……终结；（啪的一声）扣上，打开；发出噼啪声；打响指；<美>（美式橄榄球）后传发球；用子母扣扣（衣服） n. （尤指东西断裂或关上的）喀嚓声，啪嗒声；快照，照片；<美>子母扣，搭扣；呼“同”牌游戏（一种纸牌游戏，玩家抢先看到有两张相同的牌时呼“同”）；打响指，响指声；<美，非正式>容易的事，好办的事；某种短时期的天气；迅速的动作；<美>（美式橄榄球）（裆下后传）发球；（风格或动作）充满活力，热情；不耐烦的语调（或样子）；<北英格兰>食物（尤指带到工作地点在休息时间吃的）；薄脆饼干；突然折断；猛咬 adj. 突然的，仓促的 int. <英，非正式>真巧啊，一模一样（发现两件相同的物品时的惊叹语）；（呼“同”牌游戏中的）“同！”

sentences.english: A twig snapped under my feet.
sentences.chinese: 一根细枝在我脚下嚓一声断开了。

sentences.english: The wind snapped branches and power lines.
sentences.chinese: 大风刮断了树枝和输电线。

detailed_translations.chinese: 咔嚓折断， 啪地绷断； 猛咬； 猛然断裂 <；吧嗒一声；厉声说话， 怒声责骂
detailed_translations.english: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion
to take a photograph
a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing

name: squeeze
trans: v. 挤压，捏；挤出，榨出（液体等）；（使）挤入，塞入；为……挤出时间（squeeze someone/something in）；排挤出（squeeze someone/something out）；敲诈勒索，榨取；严格限制，紧缩（资金）；好不容易取得，勉强成功；紧紧闭上双眼；扣扳机射击，打一整发（子弹）；拍照；（桥牌）逼（对方）放弃一张赢墩牌，逼牌 n. 挤压，捏；拥挤，塞满；挤出来的少量事物；紧缩，拮据；<美，非正式> 男朋友，女朋友；<非正式> 勒索（或敲诈）的钱；拥抱；（桥牌）紧逼打法（逼对手扔掉一张重要的牌）；压模，拓印；（棒球）抢分战术； <旧> 拥挤的社交舞会

sentences.english: She smiled as he squeezed her hand.
sentences.chinese: 他捏了捏她的手，她笑了。

sentences.english: He squeezed the trigger, but nothing happened.
sentences.chinese: 他扣动扳机，但没有反应。

detailed_translations.english: to press something firmly together with your fingers or hand

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤； 握手； 拮据， 紧缺
detailed_translations.english: an act of pressing something firmly with your fingers or hand

name: prune
trans: v. 修剪，修整；删除，削减 n. 李子干，西梅干；<非正式>讨厌的人，乏味的人；（树枝、灌木丛等的）修剪，修整

sentences.english: The company is pruning staff in order to reduce costs.
sentences.chinese: 公司正在裁员以减少开支。

name: glaze
trans: vt. 装以玻璃；上釉于 vi. 变呆滞；变得光滑 n. 釉；光滑面 n. （Glaze）人名；（英）格莱兹

sentences.english: Sometimes his eyes would glaze over for a second or two.
sentences.chinese: 有时候他会两眼发直地愣一两秒钟。

a liquid that is used to cover plates, cups etc made of clay to give them a shiny surface

trans: v. （用力地）拉，拖，拽；（迅速地）穿（衣服）；用拖船拖（船）；努力做 n. 拖船；猛拉，拽；一股强烈的感情；强大的吸引力；（滑翔机的）拖航飞机；（系在马鞍上支承车杠或挽绳的）圆环；苦干；竞争，较量

sentences.english: The woman gently tugged his arm.
sentences.chinese: 那女人轻轻拽了拽他的胳膊。

sentences.chinese: 她猛地一拉，扯下绷带。

detailed_translations.english: to pull with one or more short, quick pulls

sentences.english: The interest rate has been fixed at 6.5%.
sentences.chinese: 利率已经定为6.5%。

sentences.english: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
sentences.chinese: 架子应当用螺丝固定在墙上。

detailed_translations.english: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

trans: v. 保持，维持；维修，保养；断言，主张；赡养，抚养；<旧>支持，维护

sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

detailed_translations.english: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before

trans: n. 选段，引文；提取物，汁 v. 提取，提炼；取出，拔出；摘录；索取，设法得到；开（方），求（根）

name: flush
trans: v. （人的皮肤或脸）发红（尤指因病或激动）；冲洗（抽水马桶），（抽水马桶）被冲洗；（用水或其他液体）冲洗；（用液体）冲走；把（猎鸟，动物）赶出隐藏地，使暴露；（使）发光；使（液体）流过；（植物）绽出新芽；嵌平（接合处） n. 脸红，皮肤发红（因尴尬、发热等原因）；一阵强烈情感；（尤指抽水马桶的）冲洗；（厕所里的）冲水设备，抽水马桶；旺盛期；（突如其来的）大量；急流；（树叶或幼苗等）破土而出的时期，（叶、花或果的）繁茂生长；有暖色之处，光亮之处；同花的一手牌，同花顺；驱赶（猎鸟）；（突如其来的）大批，大量 adj. （两物体表面）完全齐平的；<非正式>（尤指钱）充裕的，大量的；（门）平的，无装饰的；（印刷文字）不缩排的，齐头排的 adv. （与另一平面）齐平地；不偏不倚地，正好地

sentences.english: Susan flushed deeply and looked away.

sentences.english: He flushed angrily .
sentences.chinese: 他气得满脸通红。

name: clinch
trans: v. 确定，敲定，解决；成功赢得；扭打；拥抱；敲弯，钉住；用活结系牢 n. 扭打；拥抱；活结 n. （Clinch）（美、英）克林奇（人名）

sentences.english: a young salesman eager to clinch the deal
sentences.chinese: 一名急于想做成这笔生意的年轻推销员

name: scratch
trans: v. （用指甲）挠，轻抓；（用指甲或利器）抓破，划破；划出，刮出（痕迹）；（用爪子）抓，刨；（鸟、哺乳动物，尤指鸡）用嘴（或爪子）扒地找食物；寻觅（难找的人或物）（scratch for）；艰难生活（scratch along）；勾掉，划去（写下的字）；<非正式> 仓促写下；（用尖利物）刮擦出声音；<非正式> 取消，撤销（想法或计划）；<非正式>（使）退出比赛；（用刮擦技法）播放唱片 n. （某人皮肤上的）划痕，划伤；刮痕，划痕；抓，挠；刮擦声；唱片的嚓嚓声（指唱片纹道与唱针的摩擦噪声）；刮擦（多用于快板乐中，用手制止唱片转动，使其来回移动发出有节奏的嚓嚓声的技巧）；（高尔夫）零让步（表明选手不弱，能在场上达到规定击球的次数）；<非正式> 钱 adj. （球队或一群人等）仓促拼凑的，匆匆组成的；（高尔夫球员）无让杆的，无让步优待的；碰巧的；打草稿用的

sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

sentences.chinese: 理论上，管端切割机器人能完成任意形状的圆管端头的切割。

sentences.chinese: 理论上，小型开孔切割机器人能够在任意曲面上开任意形状的孔，管端切割机器人能完成任意形状的圆管端头的切割。

name: chop
