sentences.chinese: 他正在用耥耙给稻田除去杂草。

sentences.english: Spray-fusing of parts resistance to strong grain-wear and free machining, such as harrow teeth of dredger.
sentences.chinese: 抗强烈磨粒磨损，无需加工场合的喷焊，如挖泥船耙齿。

sentences.english: Combining the working principle of plough and harrow in agriculture that can realize to mix and comminute all kinds of material.
sentences.chinese: 将农业用的犁耙工作原理结合到一起，可同时实现对多种物料的搅拌和粉碎。草耙，灰耙，钉齿耙。

detailed_translations.english: to draw a harrow over (land)
a farming machine with sharp metal blades, used to break up the earth before planting crops

name: pick
trans: v. 采，摘（花、果）；（用手指）弄掉；找茬；捡，抱起；选择；弹，拨（弦）；撬开（锁），扒窃……中的东西；小心走路（~ one's way）；（反复地）拔，拉，撕，扯；没胃口地吃；（高尔夫）拾球（尤指认输的拾球）（~ up）；采，摘（花、果等） n. 精华（the pick of）；选择，选择权；被选中的人（或事物）；鹤嘴锄；（吉他的）拨子；（尖状的）挖撬工具；（篮球）掩护

sentences.english: The Roman Swiss Army knife has a knife, spoon, fork, spike, spatula, and small pick.
sentences.chinese: 这种古罗马瑞士军刀包含了刀，勺，叉，长钉，抹刀和小鹤嘴锄。

detailed_translations.english: a  pickaxe

name: shovel
trans: n. 铲子，铁锹；（推土机、挖土机等的）铲，铲形部分；一铲（的量） v. （用铲子）铲起，铲去；把……大量送入

sentences.english: ...a coal shovel.
sentences.chinese: …一把煤铲。

sentences.english: The workmen shovelled gravel onto the road.
sentences.chinese: 工人们把碎石铲到路面上。

detailed_translations.english: a tool with a rounded blade and a long handle used for moving earth, stones etc
to lift and move earth, stones etc with a shovel

name: sickle
trans: n. 镰刀 adj. 镰刀型的 v. 呈镰刀型 n. （Sickle）（美、加、英）茜克克丽（人名）

sentences.english: He swished the tops off weeds with a sickle.
sentences.chinese: 他挥动镰刀嗖嗖地割掉了杂草的草尖。

sentences.english: Family history. If your family has a history of an inherited anemia, such as sickle cell anemia, you also may be at increased risk of the condition.
sentences.chinese: 家族史如果你有亲人患有遗传性的贫血，比如镰刀细胞性贫血，那么你患有这种贫血的风险也会比一般人高。

sentences.english: The flag flutters everywhere, beside red banners with the hammer and sickle, a reminder that the country is one of the last to uphold Marxist values.
sentences.chinese: 国旗各处飘扬，伴随着印有镰刀斧头的红色横幅，提醒人们，这是最后一个坚持马克思主义价值观的国家。

detailed_translations.english: a tool with a blade in the shape of a hook, used for cutting wheat or long grass

name: spade
trans: n. 锹，铲；（纸牌中的）黑桃（spades）；黑桃牌；<旧>黑人，黑鬼 v. 用锹挖（地），用锹铲（土）；把……弄实抹平

sentences.english: ...a garden spade.
sentences.chinese: …一把花园里使用的锹。

detailed_translations.english: a tool for digging that has a long handle and a broad metal blade that you push into the ground

name: bore
trans: v. 使厌烦，使讨厌；钻（孔），挖（洞）；盯着看 n. 令人讨厌的人；使人厌烦的事；内径，口径；探孔，钻孔；涌潮，激潮

sentences.english: Get the special drill bit to bore the correct size hole for the job.
sentences.chinese: 找个特殊的钻头，钻个尺寸合适的孔。

detailed_translations.english: to make a deep round hole in a hard surface
something that is not interesting to you or that annoys you

name: hectic
trans: adj. 繁忙的，忙乱的；（脸）潮红的；<古>（与）痨病（有关）的，发痨病热的 n. <古>潮热，痨病热

sentences.english: I’ve had a pretty hectic day.
sentences.chinese: 我忙乱了一整天。

sentences.english: a hectic social life
sentences.chinese: 繁忙的社交生活

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴奋的，狂热的；脸上发红；肺病的；忙碌的
detailed_translations.english: very busy or full of activity

name: officially
trans: adv. 官方地，正式地；据公布，据传（但不一定是事实）；依据法规等

sentences.english: The new church was officially opened on July 5th.
sentences.chinese: 新教堂于7月5日正式启用。

sentences.english: Nothing has yet been officially announced.
sentences.chinese: 一切都还没有正式宣布。

sentences.english: The scheme was officially launched in May.
sentences.chinese: 该计划是在5月份正式实施的。

sentences.english: Has the company officially confirmed the appointment?
sentences.chinese: 公司正式证实这项任命了吗？

sentences.english: the number of officially recognized political parties
sentences.chinese: 官方认可的政党数量

detailed_translations.english: publicly or formally

name: entry
trans: n. 进入，加入；出场，莅临；门，入口；进入权，进入许可；参赛；参赛作品，竞赛答题；参赛人数，报名人数；登记，录入；条目，账目，记录

sentences.english: You can leave your umbrella in the entry.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把伞放在入口处。

sentences.english: More keyboarding staff are required for data entry.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的键盘录入人员来录入这些资料。

sentences.english: There was no sign of a forced entry.
sentences.chinese: 没有强行闯入的迹象。

sentences.english: How did the thieves gain entry (= get in )?
sentences.chinese: 窃贼是怎样进入的？

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate or passage where you enter a building; an entrance hall

name: role
trans: n. （演员的）角色；作用，职责

sentences.english: She has just landed the lead role in their latest production.
sentences.chinese: 她刚在他们最新的作品中取得了主角。

detailed_translations.english: the character played by an actor in a play or film

name: log
trans: n. 原木，圆材；正式记录，航海日志；对数；（定期或系统的）观察记录；船舶测速仪 v. 正式记录；行驶，行进（若干距离或时间）；伐木，砍伐；<美>成功获得，取得（成就）

sentences.english: a roaring log fire
sentences.chinese: 原木燃烧的熊熊大火

detailed_translations.english: a thick piece of wood from a tree
to make an official record of events, facts etc

name: draft
trans: n. 草稿，草案；汇票；<美>通风气流，穿堂风（=draught）；征兵；<美>（职业球队的）选拔队员制 v. 起草，草拟；选派，派遣；<美>征召，征召……入伍；<美>挑选，选拔（运动员）；作草图，绘样 adj. （动物）驮重物的，负重的；（啤酒）散装的；草拟的

sentences.english: the rough draft of his new novel
sentences.chinese: 他的新小说的草稿

sentences.english: I read the first draft and thought it was very good.
sentences.chinese: 我读了第一稿，觉得非常好。

sentences.english: All parties eventually approved the final draft (= finished form ) of the peace treaty.
sentences.chinese: 各方最后都同意了和平条约的终稿。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or a plan that is not yet in its finished form
to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form

name: sketch
trans: n. 素描，速写，草图；（任何作品的）粗样，初稿；简述，概述；幽默短剧，滑稽小品；<非正式，旧>滑稽的人（或物） v. （给……）画速写，（给……）画素描；简述，概述；（用手或身体）做（姿势）

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail
a short humorous scene on a television programme, in a theatre etc, that is part of a larger show

name: assumption
trans: n. 假定，假设；取得，承担

sentences.english: You would be making an assumption that's not based on any fact that you could report.
sentences.chinese: 你会做出不以你能报道的任何事实为依据的一种假设。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

name: drudgery
trans: n. 苦工，苦差事

sentences.english: People want to get away from the drudgery of their everyday lives.
sentences.chinese: 人们想摆脱日常生活中的苦差事。

detailed_translations.english: hard boring work

name: chore
trans: n. 家庭杂务，杂活；累活，苦差事

sentences.english: everyday chores like shopping and housework
sentences.chinese: 购物和做家务之类的日常琐事

sentences.english: We share the domestic chores.
sentences.chinese: 我们分担家务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 家庭杂务；日常的零星事务；讨厌的或累人的工作
detailed_translations.english: a small job that you have to do regularly, especially work that you do to keep a house clean

name: undertaking
trans: n. 任务，企业；许诺，保证；丧葬业，殡仪业 v. 承担，从事；承诺，答应；<英>在内侧行驶时赶上并超越（另一辆车）（undertake 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: Starting a new business can be a risky undertaking.
sentences.chinese: 创办新企业有时是一件有风险的事情。

sentences.english: Both organizations gave an undertaking to curb violence among their members.
sentences.chinese: 两个组织都作出承诺要约束其成员的暴力行为。

detailed_translations.english: an important job, piece of work, or activity that you are responsible for

name: task
trans: n. （尤指困难的或必须定期做的）工作，任务；（尤指语言教学中旨在帮助达到某一学习目的的）活动 v. 派给……任务；对（手段，能力）要求极高，考验

sentences.english: Sara had the task of preparing the agenda for meetings.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉的任务是准备会议议程。

sentences.english: I was given the task of building a fire.
sentences.chinese: 我分配到生火的任务。

sentences.english: the skills required to carry out these tasks
sentences.chinese: 执行这些任务所需要的技能

sentences.english: He soon realized the scale of the task he had undertaken .
sentences.chinese: 他很快就意识到他所承担任务的艰巨性了。

sentences.english: Our first task is to gather information.
sentences.chinese: 我们的首要任务是收集信息。

sentences.english: Monkeys can be taught to do simple tasks .
sentences.chinese: 猴子能被教会做一些简单的事。

sentences.english: They have the unenviable task of supervising the most dangerous prison in the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们有个令人头疼的工作，就是管理国家最危险的监狱。

sentences.english: Volunteers had the thankless task of distributing campaign leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 志愿者的任务是分发活动传单，吃力不讨好。

sentences.english: Trying to bring up a small daughter on your own is no easy task .
sentences.chinese: 独自抚养年幼的女儿不是件轻而易举的事。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that must be done, especially one that is difficult or unpleasant or that must be done regularly

name: career
trans: n. 职业，事业；职业生涯；<古>速度，行程 adj. 就业的，职业的；终身从事的 v. 猛冲

sentences.english: a teaching career
sentences.chinese: 教学事业

sentences.english: He realized that his acting career was over.
sentences.chinese: 他意识到自己的演艺事业已走到了尽头。

sentences.english: a physiotherapist who wanted to make a dramatic career change by becoming an author
sentences.chinese: 想彻底改行当作家的理疗师

sentences.english: Nurses want an improved career structure (= better opportunities to move upwards in their jobs ) .
sentences.chinese: 护士希望有更好的职业架构。

detailed_translations.english: the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

name: audition
trans: n. （对演艺人员的）面试，试演；<古>听觉，听能 v. 试镜，试演；对（某人）进行面试，让（某人）试演

sentences.english: ...an audition for a Broadway musical.
sentences.chinese: …一部百老汇歌舞剧的试演。

detailed_translations.english: An audition is a short performance given by an actor, dancer, or musician so that a director or conductor can decide if they are good enough to be in a play, film, or orchestra
to take part in an audition

name: vocation
trans: n. （认为某种职业适合自己的）使命感；（认为特别适合自己的）工作，职业，生活方式；神召，天命，（宗教）使命感

sentences.english: At 17 she found her true vocation as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 17岁时她找到了自己真正的使命——当一名作家。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of work that you feel is right for you

name: charge
trans: v. 充电；使……承担责任，赋予……责任；控告，指控；（公开）指责，责备；进攻，冲锋；把……记在账上；要价，收费（金额）；<旧>给（枪炮）装弹；斟满（杯子） n. 电量，电荷；炸药量；掌管，照管；费用，价钱；控告，指控；（书面或口头的）指责，批评；需要照管的人；命令，指示；（人或动物的）猛攻，冲锋；<美，非正式>快感，刺激；感召力，感染力；负载

sentences.english: Leave the battery on charge all night.
sentences.chinese: 让电池充一晚上的电

sentences.english: Please charge your glasses and drink a toast to the bride and groom!
sentences.chinese: 请各位斟满酒杯向新娘、新郎敬酒！

detailed_translations.english: electricity that is put into a piece of electrical equipment such as a battery
to fill a glass

name: major
trans: adj. 重大的，主要的；严重的；大调的，大音阶的； <旧>（公立学校中置于学生姓氏后，表示两兄弟中）大的，年长的；主修的；大（项）的 n. 主修科目，专业；陆军少校，（美国）空军少校；（某专业的）主修学生；<美，非正式>职业棒球大联盟；大型公司，重要企业；成年人，已达到法定年龄者；（军乐队中主管某一乐器部的）乐器长；大调，大音程； 大项，大前提；主要世界性组织（或公司、比赛） v. （在美国大学）主修，专攻

sentences.english: There are two major political parties in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国有两大政党。

sentences.english: The government’s major concern is with preventing road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 政府关注的大事是预防道路交通事故。

sentences.english: Smoking is one of the major causes of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是引发癌症的元凶之一。

sentences.english: the major developments in computer technology
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术的重大进步

sentences.english: He’s majoring in Political Science.
sentences.chinese: 他主修政治学。

detailed_translations.english: very large or important, when compared to other things or people of a similar kind
to study something as your main subject at college or university

name: resign
trans: v. 辞（职），放弃（工作或职位）；（使）听任，（使）顺从（~ oneself to）；（国际象棋）放弃，投子认输

sentences.english: A hospital administrator has resigned over claims he lied to get the job.
sentences.chinese: 一位医院主管因为有人声称他的职位是骗来的而辞职了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization
to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization

name: solicit
trans: v. 请求，索求，征求（意见）；<美>兜售，推销；拉（客），卖淫

sentences.english: Morgan is accused of illegally soliciting campaign contributions.
sentences.chinese: 摩根被指控非法征募竞选捐款。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone for money, help, or information

name: register
trans: n. 登记表，注册簿；注册员；（人或乐器的）声区，音区；（适合特定场合使用的）语体风格，语域；（印刷，摄影）套准，叠合；<美>现金出纳机；（电子设备的）寄存器；<美>（供暖或制冷设备的）调风口，节气门；（设计图案组成的）条，局部 v. 登记，注册；（正式地或公开地）发表意见，提出主张；流露出，表达出；注意到，受到注意；（仪器上）显出，显示；把……挂号邮寄；取得（结果），得（分）；（印刷，摄影）套准，叠合

sentences.english: Have you signed the hotel register ?
sentences.chinese: 你在酒店登记簿上签名了吗？

sentences.english: Police want a national register of DNA samples.
sentences.chinese: 警方想要一个全国范围的DNA样本登记册。

sentences.english: How many students have registered for English classes?
sentences.chinese: 有多少学生注册选修英语课了？

detailed_translations.english: an official list of names of people, companies etc, or a book that has this list
to put someone’s or something’s name on an official list

name: inaugurate
trans: v. 为……举行就职典礼；为……举行落成仪式；开创，开展

sentences.english: He will be inaugurated (as) President in January.
sentences.chinese: 他将于一月份就任总统。

sentences.english: The moon landing inaugurated a new era in space exploration.
sentences.chinese: 登陆月球开创了太空探索的新纪元。

detailed_translations.english: to introduce a new public official or leader at a special ceremony

name: promote
trans: v. 促进，提倡；升职，晋升；促销，推广； 将（运动队）晋级；使（学生）升年级；负责筹办，主办（大型活动，如音乐会或体育比赛）；促使（议会私法议案）通过；使（卒）升格为（尤指后等）；<英>（先打大牌）使（小牌）赢得一墩；使（催化剂）更活泼

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: provide
trans: v. 提供，供给；配备，准备好；（法律或规章）规定；供养，提供生计；为（可能事件）作充分准备；<史>任命（牧师）担任有俸神职

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

name: provision
trans: n. 提供，供应；准备，预备；（尤指为旅行准备的）食物，必需品（provisions）；条款，规定；赡养，供养；（机构账户上为已知负债，尤指坏账或资产价值缩减，从利润中留出的）准备金；<史>神职委任（尤指教皇对尚未缺额神职的预先委任） v. 为……提供所需物品（尤指食物）；（为已知债务）留出准备金

sentences.english: The agreement includes a provision for each side to check the other side’s weapons.
sentences.chinese: 协议有项规定，允许双方互查武器。

sentences.english: Under the provisions of the Act, employers must supply safety equipment.
sentences.chinese: 该法令规定，雇主必须提供安全设备。

detailed_translations.english: a condition in an agreement or law

name: accommodate
trans: v. 为……提供住宿；容纳，提供空间；考虑到，顾及；顺应，适应；帮助（某人），向……施以援手；迎合，迁就；调解

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: furnish
trans: v. 为（房间或房屋）配备家具；提供，供应

sentences.english: Will these finds furnish more information on prehistoric man?
sentences.chinese: 这些发现是否能提供更多有关史前人类的资料？

sentences.english: Having bought the house, they couldn’t afford to furnish it.
sentences.chinese: 买下房子后，他们没有钱买家具了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 装备，布置 （房间、建筑物）；供应，提供
detailed_translations.english: to put furniture and other things into a house or room

name: render
trans: v. 使成为，使处于某种状态；给予，提供；（以某种方式）表达，表现；粉刷，往（墙上）抹灰；将（脂肪）熬成油，使熔化；正式宣布（判决或决定）；（供审查，考虑）提交，呈报；<文>放弃，献出；演奏，演唱；翻译；绘制（指用色彩和明暗使轮廓图像具立体感）；秘密引渡（外国罪犯、恐怖嫌疑犯）；从（动物身体）提取（蛋白质、脂肪及其他可用部分） n. 底灰，底泥；<史>交纳

sentences.english: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
sentences.chinese: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

sentences.english: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered
sentences.chinese: 一张3,200美元服务费的账单

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

name: incompatible
trans: adj. 不相容的，不能共存的；不能和谐相处的，合不来的；不兼容的，互斥的 n. 互不相容的人或事物

sentences.chinese: 礼貌和实话往往互不相容。

sentences.english: Business interests are incompatible with public office.
sentences.chinese: 商业利益与公职不可兼得。

detailed_translations.english: two things that are incompatible cannot exist or be accepted together

name: congruity
trans: n. 适合，调和；一致；全等

detailed_translations.chinese: 一致性， 适合性； 共同点

name: incongruity
trans: n. 不协调；不一致；不适宜

sentences.english: The incongruity of her situation struck Gina with unpleasant force.
sentences.chinese: 吉娜猛然意识到自己处境尴尬，心里很不舒服。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不调和的, 不适宜的
detailed_translations.english: the fact that something is strange, unusual, or unsuitable in a particular situation

name: incongruous
trans: adj. 不协调的；不一致的；不和谐的

sentences.english: The new theatre looks utterly incongruous in its setting.
sentences.chinese: 这座新剧院和周围的环境格格不入。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不协调的；不一致的；不和谐的
detailed_translations.english: strange, unexpected, or unsuitable in a particular situation

name: respective
trans: adj. 分别的，各自的

sentences.english: We all went back to our respective homes to wait for news.
sentences.chinese: 我们都各自回家等待消息。

sentences.english: the respective roles of teachers and students
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生各自不同的角色

detailed_translations.english: used before a plural noun to refer to the different things that belong to each separate person or thing mentioned

name: close
trans: v. （使）关闭；合上，合拢；（使）暂时性关闭，关门；（永久）停业，停止活动；（使）结束，（使）停止；结清（银行账目，房屋互助协会账目）；关闭（计算机上的文件、文档或程序）；（股票等）收盘；拉近（距离），缩小（差距）；把……牢牢抱住（或抓住、握住）；（使）（伤口）愈合；关闭，封锁（公路、公园等）；完成，做成（交易等）；接通（电路）；盖住，合上（开口）；堵住，封闭；（报价等）停止，中止 adj. （空间或时间上）接近的，靠近的；酷似的，几乎相等的；接近的，快要……的；（数量、数字、水平等）接近的；（通常指危险或不愉快的情况几乎发生）差一点儿，险些；近亲的（如父母、子女、兄弟姐妹等）；亲近的，亲密的；（与某人的工作或活动）紧密相关的，密切的；仔细的，全面的；实力相差无几的，仅以些微之差获胜的；几乎要……的，差不多要……的；闷热的，不通风的；密集的，空间很小的；（头发或胡子）紧贴皮肤的，齐根的；守口如瓶的，掩饰感情的；吝啬的，小气的；严加保护的，严加守卫的；差不多正确的；闭塞音的，闭的（发音时口形相对闭合的） adv. （空间上）靠近地，（时间上）接近地 n. （活动或一段时间的）结束，末尾；大教堂所属的周围场地及建筑物；一端不通的街道，死胡同，死巷道；<英>英国某些传统公学的操场；<苏格兰>（街道和公用楼梯或后院间的）通路，入口；（股市一日的）收盘（the close）；（板球一日比赛的）终赛（the close）；（乐）短句结尾，收束；关闭（尤指关门）

sentences.english: Would you mind if I closed the window?
sentences.chinese: 我把窗户关上你不介意吧？

sentences.chinese: 她拉上了窗帘。

sentences.chinese: 我来修一下车门，它关不紧。

sentences.chinese: 贝丝合上眼睛想睡觉。

sentences.english: She heard the door close behind her.
sentences.chinese: 她听见门在她身后关上了。

sentences.english: I will now close the meeting by asking you to join me in a final toast.
sentences.chinese: 现在我要请大家最后干一杯来结束这次会议。

name: mutual
trans: adj. 相互的，彼此的；共同的，共有的；（保险公司、建筑协会等）互助的 n. 互助公司

sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢德夫，他好像也不喜欢我。

sentences.english: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.

name: concerted
trans: adj. 共同筹划的，一致的；尽力的，竭力的；（音乐）分声部的 v. 共同议定，协调（concert 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.chinese: 各图书馆同心协力吸引年轻人。

trans: adj. 兄弟般的；友好的

trans: adj. 依赖的，依靠的；取决于；有瘾的 n. 受供养者

sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: congenial
trans: adj. 意气相投的；性格相似的；适意的；一致的

sentences.chinese: 堆肥为根部的生长提供了适宜的条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意气相投的；性格相似的；适意的；一致的

name: relevant
trans: adj. 有关的，切题的；正确的，适宜的；有价值的，有意义的

sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

name: bond
trans: n. 纽带，联系；公债，债券；结合，黏合；承诺，契约；枷锁，桎梏 v. （使）建立亲密关系；与……黏合（或连接）

sentences.chinese: 我父亲把他所有的钱都投在上市债券上。

sentences.chinese: 在这里，富人和穷人比邻而居。

sentences.chinese: 乐队正在演奏披头士的老歌。

sentences.english: I grew up playing in rock bands.
sentences.chinese: 我是在摇滚乐队里玩音乐长大的。

sentences.english: Smith joined the band in 1989.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯在1989年加入这个乐队。

sentences.english: They formed a band when they were still at school.

name: collaborate

sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

trans: n. 铰链，合叶；枢纽，关键；铰合部 v. 给（某物）装铰链

sentences.chinese: 安倍深受指控牵连，不得不辞职。

sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

name: supersede

sentences.chinese: 他们的地图从此被摄影地图册取代。

sentences.chinese: 过度肥胖与高血压和中风的发病风险增加密切相关。

detailed_translations.english: if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other
if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

name: grant

sentences.chinese: 英国可能会同意西班牙的请求。

sentences.english: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
sentences.chinese: 我很希望能够满足她的愿望。

name: subsidiary
trans: n. 子公司，附属公司；辅助者 adj. 次要的，附属的；子公司的

sentences.chinese: 晒黑皮肤最早流行于20世纪30年代中期。

trans: adj. 声名狼藉的，臭名昭著的

trans: adj. 著名的，杰出的；辉煌的

detailed_translations.chinese: 可作楷模的， 典范的

name: matchless
trans: adj. 无比的；无敌的

trans: v. 精通，擅长；超过，胜过

sentences.chinese: 你新办的这次展览特别成功。

to do something very well, or much better than most people

trans: adj. 极好的，卓越的 int. 太好了

sentences.chinese: 极好的建议

sentences.chinese: 他的汽车状况极佳。

sentences.chinese: 二手计算机买得好会非常合算。

trans: n. 赞扬，称赞；问候，祝贺 v. 赞美，恭维

sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

trans: adj. 赞美的，表示钦佩的；免费赠送的

sentences.chinese: 酒店客房里有一瓶免费赠送的香槟。

sentences.chinese: 我有几张今晚的免费戏票。

detailed_translations.english: given free to people

trans: adj. 有名望的，著名的 v. 使有声誉（renown 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.chinese: 这个地区以其罗马式教堂闻名。

trans: adj. 值得赞赏的

sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme

name: celebrate
trans: v. 庆祝，庆贺；赞扬，赞美；主持（宗教仪式）

sentences.chinese: 今天是爸爸的生日，我们打算出去吃饭庆祝一下。

sentences.english: My folks are celebrating their 50th anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我父母正在庆祝他们结婚50周年。

sentences.english: poems that celebrate the joys of love
sentences.chinese: 赞美爱之喜悦的诗歌

detailed_translations.english: to show that an event or occasion is important by doing something special or enjoyable

name: celebrated
trans: adj. 著名的，驰名的 v. 庆祝，庆贺；赞扬，赞美；主持（宗教仪式）（celebrate 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.chinese: 著名女演员

sentences.english: a celebrated legal case

detailed_translations.english: famous

detailed_translations.chinese: 庆祝（celebrate的过去式和过去分词）

trans: adj. 显要的，值得注意的；非常成功的，令人尊敬的 n. 显要人物，名流

sentences.chinese: 如果有任何显著的不相符或让人起疑的情况，要想好该如何去解释这个情况。

trans: adj. 著名的，有名的 v. 注意，留意；指出，特别提到；记录（note 的过去式和过去分词）

detailed_translations.english: well known or famous, especially because of some special quality or ability

sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.chinese: 言过其实的自夸——“我们定位于成为XYZ的卓越供应商”——并不能构建其地位。

sentences.chinese: 我们也完全有理由相信，美国将再次赢得美利坚强国的卓越地位。

sentences.chinese: 瑞典制造的轿车在世界上最为有口皆碑的是其超群的安全性能，萨博也不例外。

trans: adj. 重要的，著名的；显眼的，突出的；突起的，高耸的 n. 舟蛾（=prominent moth）

sentences.chinese: 世界杯赛将占据议程表的重要位置。

trans: v. 使有尊严，使高贵；使显得堂皇，抬高……的身价

trans: adj. 庄严的；有尊严的；高贵的 v. 使高贵（dignify 的过去式）

sentences.chinese: 研究员表示，将一个可以散发上千种气味的小型设备安装在电视背后，从而实现电视(根据情景)生成气味是可能的。

sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

name: exalt
trans: v. <正式>提升，提拔；<正式>颂扬，吹捧；使得意

sentences.chinese: 但是，权力也可以激励人、振奋人和提升人，因为它可以帮助人们成就非同寻常的事业。

sentences.chinese: 受到世代尊崇的阿拉伯人勇气的象征

sentences.english: His body was embalmed.
sentences.chinese: 他的尸体进行了防腐处理。

detailed_translations.chinese: 铭记于心；使不朽；防腐；使充满香气

name: tarnish
trans: v. 使失去光泽，使变暗淡；玷污 n. （金属表面的）暗锈；颜色晦暗，无光泽；污点

sentences.english: His regime was tarnished by human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 他的政权因践踏人权而形象受损。

name: extol
trans: vt. 颂扬；赞美；赞颂

sentences.english: Now experts are extolling the virtues of the humble potato.
sentences.chinese: 现在专家们在颂扬粗陋的马铃薯的种种好处。

detailed_translations.english: to praise something very much

name: laud
trans: vt. <正式>赞美，称赞 n. <古>赞美，称赞；颂歌；（lauds）（主要指罗马天主教教堂的）晨祷 n. （Laud）劳德（英国坎特伯雷大主教威廉·劳德 William Laud）

sentences.english: He lauded the work of the UN High Commissioner for Refugees.
sentences.chinese: 他赞扬了联合国难民事务高级专员的工作。

name: revere

name: admirable
trans: adj. 令人钦佩的，极其出色的

sentences.english: an admirable achievement

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人钦佩的；极好的；值得赞扬的

sentences.english: The Coca-Cola bottle is one of the classic designs of the last century.
sentences.chinese: 可口可乐瓶是上个世纪的经典设计之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最优秀的，典型的，标准的；传统式样的，典雅的
detailed_translations.english: having all the features that are typical or expected of a particular thing or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学名著， 经典作品， 杰作； 优秀的典范； 古典文学， 古典语文研究
detailed_translations.english: a book, play, or film that is important and has been admired for a long time

name: respect
trans: n. 尊敬，敬重；重视，尊重；方面，着眼点；问候，敬意（respects） v. 尊敬，敬佩；慎重对待，尊重；遵守；避免破坏（或干扰） int. <非正式> 真了不起（因敬重或赞同而发出的感叹）

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

name: adore
trans: v. 非常喜欢，热爱；爱慕，疼爱；崇拜，崇敬

sentences.english: Betty adores her grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂非常宠爱孙辈。

detailed_translations.english: to love someone very much and feel very proud of them

name: admire
trans: v. 钦佩，仰慕；欣赏，观赏

sentences.english: I really admire the way she brings up those kids all on her own.
sentences.chinese: 我十分佩服她独力把那些孩子抚养大。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and like someone because they have done something that you think is good

name: advocate
trans: v. 拥护，提倡 n. 拥护者，提倡者；辩护律师；（为某一类人）谋利益者；（一项事业或个组织的）工作者

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: hilarious
trans: adj. 很可笑的，很滑稽的；<古>欢闹的，兴高采烈的

sentences.english: The focus is solely on the shirts and the hilarious design.
sentences.chinese: 这些注意力完全放在衣服和欢闹的设计上了。

sentences.english: But I love my awful life so much right now, that I find it hilarious when I am unable to convince anyone else of it.
sentences.chinese: 即时它摧毁了我的家，但现在十分我喜欢我糟糕的生活，当我不能使其他人确信是我发现它是欢闹的。

name: sullen
trans: adj. 愠怒的，不高兴的；（天气）阴沉的；沉闷的

sentences.english: Bill sat in sullen silence and refused to eat his lunch.
sentences.chinese: 比尔一声不响，闷闷不乐地坐着，不肯吃午饭。

sentences.english: a look of sullen resentment
sentences.chinese: 愤懑的眼神

detailed_translations.chinese: 愠怒的，不高兴的；（天气）阴沉的；沉闷的
detailed_translations.english: angry and silent, especially because you feel life has been unfair to you

name: hilarity
trans: n. 欢喜；高兴；欢闹

sentences.english: Eva joined in the hilarity as much as anyone.
sentences.chinese: 伊娃和其他人一样尽情欢笑。

detailed_translations.english: laughter, or a feeling of fun

name: aura
trans: n. 气氛，氛围；（据说由生物体散发出的）光影；（任何看不到的）发散物（尤指气味）；（癫痫或偏头痛发作前的）先兆，预感

sentences.english: She had an aura of authority.
sentences.chinese: 她有一种权威气质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 光环；气氛；（中风等的）预兆；气味
detailed_translations.english: a quality or feeling that seems to surround or come from a person or a place

name: formal
trans: adj. 庄重的，合乎礼仪的；（语言）正式的，规范的；合法的；整齐的，布置井然的；正统的，拘谨的；（教育或培训）正规的；形式上的，表面的；官方的，公开的 n. 正式的社交聚会；（女子的）正式礼服

sentences.english: formal recognition of the reformed church
sentences.chinese: 改革后的教会所获得的官方承认

sentences.english: a formal agreement between the countries
sentences.chinese: 两国间的正式协议

sentences.english: There is no formal structure for negotiating pay increases.
sentences.chinese: 加薪谈判没有正式的框架可循。

detailed_translations.english: made or done officially or publicly

name: session
trans: n. （某项活动的）一段时间，一场；（议会等的）会议，（法庭的）开庭；学年，上课时间；（酒吧中）演奏会（尤指演奏爱尔兰音乐）；（尤指录音师的）灌录音乐时间；<非正式>酗酒期；基督教长老会的管理机构 adj. （音乐家）伴奏的

sentences.english: Board members met in closed session (= with nobody else present ) .
sentences.chinese: 委员会成员举行了闭门会议。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament

name: conference
trans: n. （大型、正式的）会议，研讨会；（小型正式的）商讨，讨论；体育协会（或联合会）

sentences.english: Representatives from over 100 countries attended the International Peace Conference in Geneva.
sentences.chinese: 来自一百多个国家的代表出席了在日内瓦举行的国际和平大会。

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting where a lot of people discuss important matters such as business, politics, or science, especially for several days

name: reception
trans: n. 接待处，服务台；欢迎会，招待会；欢迎，反响；（收音机或电视信号）接收效果，接收质量；接收，接待；（美橄）接球；<英>（幼儿学校的）小班，学前班

sentences.english: She was unsure of her reception after everything that had happened.
sentences.chinese: 发生了这些事后，她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

sentences.english: The plans received a mixed reception from unions (= some people liked them, others did not ) .
sentences.chinese: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc

name: etiquette
trans: n. 礼节，规矩

sentences.english: strict rules of professional etiquette
sentences.chinese: 严格的行规

detailed_translations.english: the formal rules for polite behaviour in society or in a particular group

name: decorum
trans: n. 礼仪；礼貌；端正

sentences.english: I was treated with decorum and respect throughout the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 整个调查当中我受到了礼遇和尊重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼仪；礼貌；端正；恪守礼仪
detailed_translations.english: Decorum is behaviour that people consider to be correct, polite, and respectable

name: banquet
trans: n. 宴会，盛宴；筵席，宴席 v. 宴请；参加宴会

sentences.english: a state banquet (=  one attended by heads of government and other important people  )
sentences.chinese: 国宴

detailed_translations.english: a formal dinner for many people on an important occasion

name: bidding
trans: n. （尤指拍卖中的）出价；（拍卖时买方）报出的价钱；投标；吩咐，要求；叫牌 v. 出价；投标，竞标；努力争取（bid 的现在分词）

name: ceremony
trans: n. 仪式，典礼；礼节，礼仪，客套

sentences.english: a wedding ceremony
sentences.chinese: 婚礼

sentences.english: the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games
sentences.chinese: 奥运会开幕式

sentences.english: The queen was crowned with due ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 女王按照规定的礼仪加冕。

detailed_translations.english: an important social or religious event, when a traditional set of actions is performed in a formal way

name: ceremonial
trans: adj. 仪式的，礼节的；（职务）礼仪性的，象征性的 n. 仪式，典礼，礼节

sentences.english: the Mayor’s ceremonial duties
sentences.chinese: 市长的礼仪职责

sentences.english: Native American ceremonial robes
sentences.chinese: 美洲印第安人的礼袍

detailed_translations.english: used in a ceremony or done as part of a ceremony
a special ceremony, or special formal actions

name: ceremonious
trans: adj. 隆重的；讲究仪式的；正式的

sentences.english: Putting on a hat can be a ceremonious act, an elegant gesture in the ritual of dressing.
sentences.chinese: 戴帽子被看作一种礼节性的举动， 是着装仪式上一个优雅的举动。

sentences.english: When their bodies arrived in Shanghai, all walks of life in Shanghai held ceremonious funeral service for them.
sentences.chinese: 其灵榇抵达上海后，上海社会各界为之举行了隆重的祭奠活动。

sentences.english: The Spring Festival is the most ceremonious traditional festival, we the Chinese nation is the most festive atmosphere all holidays a festival.
sentences.chinese: 春节是我们中华民族最隆重的传统节日，是所有的节日中最有节日氛围的一个节日。

detailed_translations.english: done in a formal serious way, as if you were in a ceremony

name: unveil
trans: v. （首次）公开，揭示；为……揭幕，揭去……上的覆盖物；除去面纱，显露

sentences.english: The statue was unveiled by the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 这尊雕塑由女王揭幕。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the cover from something, especially as part of a formal ceremony

name: celebrate
trans: v. 庆祝，庆贺；赞扬，赞美；主持（宗教仪式）

sentences.english: It’s Dad’s birthday and we’re going out for a meal to celebrate.
sentences.chinese: 今天是爸爸的生日，我们打算出去吃饭庆祝一下。

sentences.english: My folks are celebrating their 50th anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我父母正在庆祝他们结婚50周年。

sentences.english: poems that celebrate the joys of love
sentences.chinese: 赞美爱之喜悦的诗歌

detailed_translations.english: to show that an event or occasion is important by doing something special or enjoyable

name: entertain
trans: v. 使有兴趣，使快乐；心存，怀有（想法、希望、感觉等）；招待，请客

sentences.english: A museum should aim to entertain as well as educate.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆应该致力于成为娱乐和教育功能并重的场所。

sentences.english: Mark usually does the cooking when we entertain.
sentences.chinese: 我们招待客人时通常都是马克下厨。

sentences.english: Do you get an allowance for entertaining clients?
sentences.chinese: 你招待客户有补助吗？

detailed_translations.english: to amuse or interest people in a way that gives them pleasure

name: glaring
trans: adj. 耀眼的；瞪视的；炯炯的

sentences.english: the glaring light of high noon
sentences.chinese: 正午的耀眼阳光

detailed_translations.english: too bright and difficult to look at

name: grip
trans: n. 紧握；掌握，控制；理解；不打滑，走得稳；手柄；紧握（或抓牢）的方式；（拍摄电影时）摄影机和照明设备管理人员；<英>发夹；旅行袋 v. 握紧，夹住；（尤指通过摩擦力）牢牢地附着，紧贴；使感兴趣，吸引住（某人）的注意；对……产生强有力的影响

sentences.english: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.chinese: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.english: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.chinese: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.english: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.english: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 他放开手往后退去。

detailed_translations.english: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

name: posture
trans: n. （坐或立的）姿势；态度，立场；（鸟或其他动物的）体态；情形 v. 故作（姿态），装腔作势；<古>使处于……态度（或姿态）

sentences.english: her upright posture
sentences.chinese: 她笔挺的姿势

detailed_translations.english: the way you position your body when sitting or standing

name: grasp
trans: v. 抓牢，握紧；理解，领会；抓住（机会） n. 紧抓，紧握；理解（力），领会；能力所及，伸手可及的距离；控制，权力

sentences.english: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.english: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

sentences.english: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
sentences.chinese: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

sentences.english: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

name: jerk
trans: n. 急拉，急推；<美，非正式>傻瓜，坏蛋；肌肉抽搐；（举重）挺举；腌制后放在木火上烤的肉；颠簸，震摇 v. 急拉，猛推；（举重）挺举过头；制肉干；（用调料浸泡及用木柴火烤）烹饪（猪肉，鸡肉） adj. 腌泡过的

sentences.english: Wilcox jerked his head to indicate that they should move on.
sentences.chinese: 威尔科克斯扭扭头，示意他们该走了。

sentences.english: ‘Is that the only way out of here?’ he asked, jerking a thumb at the door.
sentences.chinese: “那是这里唯一的出口吗？”他用拇指指了指门口问道。

sentences.english: The sound of the phone jerked me awake.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃声突然把我吵醒了。

detailed_translations.english: to move with a quick sudden movement, or to make part of your body move in this way

detailed_translations.chinese: 急推， 急拉， 急扭

name: chuckle
trans: v. 轻声笑，暗自笑 n. 轻笑，暗笑

sentences.english: The banker chuckled and said, "Of course not."
sentences.chinese: 银行家轻声笑了，说道，“当然不。”

sentences.english: He gave a little chuckle.
sentences.chinese: 他轻声一笑。

detailed_translations.english: When you chuckle, you laugh quietly
Chuckle is also a noun

name: flip
trans: v. （使）快速翻转，迅速翻动；快速翻阅，浏览；<非正式>勃然大怒，心烦意乱；（快速地）调频道，换台；轻抛，轻掷；按（开关）；（话题、活动或意见）突然改变，突然转换；改变，交换（位置）；突然变得热情，突然极感兴趣；为盈利而从速转卖（股份，财产） adj. 轻率的，无礼的 n. 轻抛，轻掷，轻击；空翻；浏览，草草翻阅；<英，非正式>短暂旅行（或游览）；蛋奶酒 int. <非正式>讨厌（表示轻微厌恶）

sentences.english: I was fed up with his flip comments.
sentences.chinese: 我听够了他那些轻率的评论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〈口〉无理的， 轻率的， 轻浮的
detailed_translations.english: not said or meant seriously
to move something with a quick sudden movement so that it is in a different position
an action in which you make a flat object such as a coin go upwards and turn over in the air

name: stagger
trans: v. 摇摇晃晃地走，蹒跚；使震惊，使大吃一惊；使交错，使错开 n. 踉跄，蹒跚；使（物体，物体的组成部分）交错排列；赛跑选手起跑时的梯形排列 adj. 交错的，错开的

sentences.english: He managed to stagger home.
sentences.chinese: 他好不容易才蹒跚着走回家。

sentences.english: She staggered back a step.
sentences.chinese: 她踉跄着后退了一步。

sentences.english: The old man staggered drunkenly to his feet.
sentences.chinese: 老汉醉醺醺地踉跄着站了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to walk or move unsteadily, almost falling over
to make someone feel very surprised or shocked
an unsteady movement of someone who is having difficulty in walking

name: trudge
trans: vi. 跋涉；步履艰难地走 vt. 跋涉 n. 长途跋涉；沉重的步伐

sentences.english: We trudged home through the snow.
sentences.chinese: 我们艰难地穿过雪地走回了家。

sentences.english: We were reluctant to start the long trudge home.
sentences.chinese: 我们不情愿的开始长途跋涉回家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跋涉；步履艰难地走，费力地走
detailed_translations.english: to walk with slow heavy steps, especially because you are tired or it is difficult to walk
Trudge is also a noun

name: fasten
trans: v. 关紧，锁好（门窗）；（使）牢固，（使）固定；握住，咬住；盯住……不放，集中注意力于……；缠着，纠缠；系牢，扣紧

sentences.english: ‘I’m going now,’ she said, fastening her coat.
sentences.chinese: “现在我要走了。”她一边说，一边扣上大衣。

sentences.english: Fasten your seat belt.
sentences.chinese: 请系好安全带。

detailed_translations.english: to join together the two sides of a coat, shirt, bag etc so that it is closed
to firmly close a window, gate etc so that it will not open, or to become firmly closed

name: hurl
trans: v. 猛扔，猛摔；大声说出（辱骂或斥责等）；呕吐 n. <非正式>乘车，搭便车；猛投，投掷

sentences.english: Demonstrators were hurling bricks through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 示威者在向窗里掷砖块。

sentences.english: He hurled a chair across the set, smashing lamps and vases.
sentences.chinese: 他抓起一把椅子扔向片场的那头，把灯和花瓶都砸得粉碎。

detailed_translations.english: to throw something with a lot of force, especially because you are angry

name: face
trans: n. 脸，面部；面部表情，脸色；人；初看，初听；尊严，威信；面貌；（物体的）正面，表面；斜坡，山坡；钟面，表盘；采掘面，工作面；（球拍的）拍面；（尤指足球的）球门 v. 面临，遭遇；正视，面对；与……交往，与……交谈；面向，面朝；迎战，对阵；抹盖，覆盖；接受，容忍

sentences.english: She had a beautiful face.
sentences.chinese: 她面容秀美。

sentences.english: Her face was white with fear.
sentences.chinese: 她吓得脸煞白。

sentences.english: A big smile spread across his face.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸上绽开了灿烂笑容。

sentences.english: I felt like punching him in the face.
sentences.chinese: 我真想给他脸上来一拳。

sentences.english: The birds build their nests in the rock face.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟在岩壁上筑巢。

detailed_translations.english: the front part of your head, where your eyes, nose, and mouth are

name: leap
trans: v. 猛冲，突然而迅速地移动；剧增，猛涨；赶紧抓住（机会）；（心）猛跳；跳，跳跃 n. 跳跃，跳高；骤变，激增；（对新事物的）认真尝试

sentences.english: She leapt over the fence.
sentences.chinese: 她跳过篱笆。

sentences.english: He threw a stick into the river and the dog went after it in a flying leap.
sentences.chinese: 他把一根枝条扔到河里，那条狗一个飞跃就追了过去。

detailed_translations.english: to jump high into the air or to jump in order to land in a different place
a big jump

name: bow
trans: v. 鞠躬，点头；低下（头）；停止对抗，屈从于；（使）弯曲；用弓拉奏（乐曲）；<美>（新影片）首映，（新产品）投放市场 n. 鞠躬，点头；船头；蝴蝶结；弓；琴弓；（用琴弓拉的）一段（音乐）；字母的一弯；（钥匙、剪刀等的）金属环状柄，圆形拎环；<美>眼镜架，眼镜框

sentences.english: She bowed and left the stage.
sentences.chinese: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.english: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.chinese: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.english: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

detailed_translations.english: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience

name: blink
trans: v. 眨（眼）；（灯）闪烁；表示惊讶，显出不安；退让，让步 n. 眨眼；片刻的犹豫，举棋不定；（光的）瞬间闪烁

sentences.english: I blinked as I came out into the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 我走出来，在太阳光下直眨眼睛。

detailed_translations.english: to shut and open your eyes quickly
very quickly

name: erect
trans: v. 搭建，建造；使竖立，竖起；创立，建立；安装，装配；（使）勃起 adj. 竖直的，直立的；竖起的；勃起的，坚挺的

sentences.english: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
sentences.chinese: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅，建于1892年

sentences.english: Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
sentences.chinese: 警察在进城的主要道路上设立了路障。

sentences.english: It took a couple of hours to erect the tent.
sentences.chinese: 搭帐篷花了几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a building or wall

name: trample
trans: v. 踩，践踏；伤害，侵犯；脚步沉重地走 n. <文>践踏，踩踏声

sentences.english: There was a small fence to stop people trampling on the flowers.
sentences.chinese: 有一道小小的围栏，防止人们践踏花草。

detailed_translations.english: to step heavily on something, so that you crush it with your feet
the act of trampling

name: tremble
trans: v. （因害怕、紧张、兴奋等）颤抖，哆嗦；颤动，轻轻摇晃；害怕，紧张；（声音）颤抖 n. 颤抖，战栗； <非正式>震颤病 (the trembles)；乳毒病（同 milk sickness）

sentences.english: His lip started to tremble and then he started to cry.
sentences.chinese: 他的嘴唇开始颤抖，接着就哭了起来。

sentences.english: I will never forget the look on the patient's face, the tremble in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 我将永远不会忘记那病人脸上的表情和他颤抖的手。

detailed_translations.english: to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
Tremble is also a noun

name: glide
trans: v. 滑行，滑动；滑翔；做事顺利；悄悄地走，流逝 n. 滑动，滑行；（滑翔机或无动力飞机的）飞行，滑翔；滑音，延音；（尤指向腿侧的）斜击

sentences.english: Waiters glide between tightly packed tables bearing trays of pasta.
sentences.chinese: 侍者们托着一盘盘的意大利面食在拥挤的餐桌间自如穿行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滑翔；滑行；悄悄地走；消逝
detailed_translations.english: to move smoothly and quietly, as if without effort
a smooth quiet movement that seems to take no effort

name: depart
trans: v. 启程，出发；背离，违背；离职

sentences.english: Flights by Air Europe depart Gatwick on Tuesdays.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲航空公司的航班每逢周二从盖特威克机场起飞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离开；出发，起程；违反；去世
detailed_translations.english: to leave, especially when you are starting a journey

name: slump
trans: v. （价格、价值、数量等）骤降，猛跌；惨败，猛跌；（因无力站立而）倒下，倚，靠；（肩或脑袋）耷拉着 n. （价格、销售额、利润等的）突然下跌；（经济的）不景气，萧条；（运动员或运动队的）低迷期

sentences.english: Sales slumped by 20% last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年销售额骤减 20%。

sentences.english: The council's land is now worth much less than originally hoped because of a slump in property prices.
sentences.chinese: 由于地产价格的暴跌，委员会的土地目前大不如原来所希望的那么值钱了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌
detailed_translations.english: to fall or lean against something because you are not strong enough to stand
Slump is also a noun

name: gaze
trans: v. 凝视，注视 n. 凝视，注视；特定视角，特定角度

sentences.english: Patrick sat gazing into space  (= looking straight in front, not at any particular person or thing ).
sentences.chinese: 帕特里克坐着，茫然地看着前方。

detailed_translations.english: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so
a long steady look

name: creep
trans: v. 爬行，匍匐；蹑手蹑脚地移动；不知不觉地到来，渐渐出现；蔓生，蔓延；谄媚奉承，巴结；（由于恐惧、厌恶等）起鸡皮疙瘩 n. 讨厌的人，献媚者；（树篱或墙壁上供动物通过的）墙洞；给幼畜断奶时吃的固体食物；爬行，缓慢行进；<非正式>毛骨悚然的感觉，战栗

sentences.english: He crept back up the stairs, trying to avoid the ones that creaked.
sentences.chinese: 他蹑手蹑脚地回楼上，尽量避开那些嘎吱作响的梯级。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；蔓延；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩
detailed_translations.english: if something such as an insect, small animal, or car creeps, it moves slowly and quietly

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者

name: limp
trans: v. 瘸着脚走，跛行；进展缓慢，艰难地行进 adj. 柔软的，不直挺的；无力的，无精神的 n. 跛行

sentences.english: a limp handshake
sentences.chinese: 无力的握手

sentences.english: His body suddenly went limp.
sentences.chinese: 他突然身子一软。

detailed_translations.english: not firm or strong

detailed_translations.chinese: 跛行，一拐一拐地走；缓慢费力地前进
detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured
the way someone walks when they are limping

name: sigh
trans: v. 叹气，叹息；（风）呼啸，呜咽；叹息着说；<文> 渴望，思慕 n. 叹气，叹息（声）；（尤指风发出的）叹息般的声音

sentences.english: ‘Well, there’s nothing we can do about it now,’ she sighed.
sentences.chinese: “唉，我们现在对此无能为力。”她叹口气说。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in and out making a long sound, especially because you are bored, disappointed, tired etc
an act or sound of sighing

name: recoil
trans: vi. 畏缩；弹回；报应 n. 畏缩；弹回；反作用

sentences.english: We recoil in horror from the thought of subjecting someone to extreme pain.
sentences.chinese: 想到要让一个人经受极度的痛苦，我们就会恐惧地退缩。

sentences.english: ...his small body jerking in recoil from the volume of his shouting.
sentences.chinese: …他小小身体在他大声的叫喊中畏缩地抽搐着。

detailed_translations.english: to move back suddenly and quickly from something you do not like or are afraid of
Recoil is also a noun

name: uphold
trans: v. 支持，维护（法规、制度或原则）；认可，维持（法院原判）；鼓励；举起

sentences.english: We have a duty to uphold the law.
sentences.chinese: 维护法律是我们的责任。

detailed_translations.english: to defend or support a law, system, or principle so that it continues to exist

name: grab
trans: v. 攫取，抓住；（尤指匆忙地）取，吃，喝；霸占，强夺；利用，抓住（机会）；引人注意，吸引 n. 攫取，赚取；抓具，抓斗；抓取（或截获、采集）的图像

sentences.english: I grabbed my bag and ran off.
sentences.chinese: 我抓起我的包就跑。

sentences.english: Two men grabbed her and pushed her to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 两名男子抓住她，把她推倒在地上。

sentences.english: Kay grabbed hold of my arm to stop herself falling.
sentences.chinese: 凯抓住我的手臂，以免自己摔倒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓取，攫取；赶紧做；抓住；抓，夺
detailed_translations.english: to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement
to suddenly try to take hold of something

name: stride
trans: n. 大步，阔步；步态，步伐；步距，步幅；步速；进展，进步；<非正式>裤子（strides）；钢琴跨越弹奏法 v. 大步走，阔步走；跨越，跨过；<文>跨坐在……上，跨立在……上

sentences.english: He strode toward her.
sentences.chinese: 他大步向她走去。

sentences.english: Paco reached the door in only three strides.
sentences.chinese: 帕科三大步就走到了门口。

detailed_translations.english: to walk quickly with long steps
a long step you make while you are walking

name: thrust
trans: v. 猛推，猛塞；刺，扎；（人）推进，挤过；上伸，伸出；强使接受 n. 要点，要旨；猛推，刺；（飞机、火箭等的）驱动力，推力；强攻，挺进；（拱、椽的）侧向压力；（地质）冲断层，逆断层；苛评

sentences.english: He jumped back to avoid another thrust of the knife.
sentences.chinese: 他往后一闪，躲避再次捅来的一刀。

sentences.english: She thrust her way into the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 她挤进了人群。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement in which you push something forward
If you thrust your way somewhere, you move there, pushing between people or things which are in your way

name: gnaw
trans: vt. 咬；折磨；侵蚀 vi. 咬；折磨；侵蚀

sentences.english: Dexter gnawed his pen thoughtfully.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特若有所思地咬着钢笔。

sentences.english: A rat had gnawed a hole in the box.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠在箱子上咬了一个洞。

detailed_translations.english: to keep biting something hard

name: spew
trans: vt. 喷出；呕吐 vi. 喷涌；呕吐

sentences.english: Factory chimneys spewed fumes out into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 工厂的烟囱向空中喷吐浓烟。

detailed_translations.english: to flow out of something quickly in large quantities, or to make something flow out in this way

name: dab
trans: n. 轻拍；少量；熟手；比目鱼；嘻哈手势 v. 轻拍；涂；轻擦；轻敷 n. （Dab）（法）达布（人名）

sentences.english: She wiped her tears away with a dab of her handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 她用手绢轻轻地擦掉眼泪。

detailed_translations.english: a small amount of something that you put onto a surface

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻拍；涂；轻擦；轻敷（过去式dabbed，过去分词dabbed，现在分词dabbing，第三人称单数dabs）
detailed_translations.english: to touch something lightly several times, usually with something such as a cloth

name: plunge
trans: v. （使）突然向前倒下（跌落）；猛推，猛插；投入（液体中以使淹没）；（价值）猛跌；（剧烈）颠簸，震荡；（马）猛地用后腿直立；陡然向下倾斜；骤然陷入；（鲁莽地）开始；（使）投身，（使）突然开始从事；种下（植物） n. （突然的）坠落；跳水，快速游泳；（价值或数量的）骤然下跌；突然陷入 adj. （女式服装）领口低的（plunging）

sentences.english: The government's political and economic reforms threaten to plunge the country into chaos.
sentences.chinese: 该政府的政治和经济改革有可能使这个国家陷入混乱之中。

sentences.english: Eddy found himself plunged into a world of brutal violence.
sentences.chinese: 埃迪发现自己突然陷入了一个残酷暴力的世界。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth experience sth unpleasant

name: dart
trans: v. 飞奔，猛冲；瞥，急扫（一眼）；（为施药而）用飞镖射（动物） n. 飞镖；飞镖游戏；缝褶；猛冲，突进；（恐惧、愤怒等的）一阵

sentences.english: a poisoned dart
sentences.chinese: 毒镖

sentences.english: She darted a sly sideways glance at Bramwell.
sentences.chinese: 她狡猾地斜瞟了布莱威尔一眼。

detailed_translations.english: a small pointed object that is thrown or shot as a weapon, or one that is thrown in the game of darts
If you dart a look at someone or something, or if your eyes dart to them, you look at them very quickly
to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction

name: shove
trans: v. 猛推，乱挤；连推带挤地走；<非正式> 随便放置，乱放（某物）；<非正式>移动身体，挪动身体（以腾出地方）；<非正式>去他的，让……见鬼 n. 猛推

sentences.english: He shoved her towards the car.
sentences.chinese: 他推着她走向汽车。

sentences.english: Everyone was pushing and shoving to see the prince.
sentences.chinese: 大家都推着挤着要看王子。

detailed_translations.english: to push someone or something in a rough or careless way, using your hands or shoulders
to put something somewhere carelessly or without thinking much
a strong push

name: drag
trans: v. 拖，拽；用鼠标拖动；硬撑着行进，费劲地移动；生拉硬拽，强迫；拖沓；（用网或钩子）搜寻；谈论，讨论（不愉快或复杂的事）；（船）拖锚，走锚；拖地而行，拖着走 n. 累赘，拖累；令人不快的事，无聊的事；一吸，一抽；阻力，抗力；男扮女装；<非正式>街，路；（拉钓线时引起的假蝇的）异动；<古>车轮制动器，刹车；<英，非正式>汽车；（四匹马拉的）高大私人马车；被拖（或拉）之物；重型耙，耢；（拖在猎犬前面代替狐狸用的具有强烈气味的）人工臭迹；<北美，非正式>（对其他人的）影响（力）；每次敲击前用另一只鼓槌先击两个装饰音（基本的击鼓模式之一）

sentences.english: He grabbed her arm and dragged her into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他抓住她的手臂把她拖进房间。

sentences.english: He took a drag on his cigarette, and exhaled the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 他咂了口烟，然后吐出烟雾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖，拉；迫使，硬拉；拖着脚步走
detailed_translations.english: to pull something along the ground, often because it is too heavy to carry

detailed_translations.chinese: 累赘； 一吸， 一抽
detailed_translations.english: If you take a drag on a cigarette or pipe that you are smoking, you take in air through it

name: haul
trans: v. （用力）拖，拉；强迫（某人）去某处；费力前进，艰难地走；<非正式>迫使（某人）出庭受审；（用运载工具）运送，运输；<英>（费力地）升级；（尤指帆船）突然改变航道 n. 拖，拉；大批赃物，大量非法物品；赛季（或赛事）得分总数；旅行的距离；一网的捕鱼量；托运的距离

sentences.english: the steam locomotive which hauled the train
sentences.chinese: 拖动火车的蒸汽机车

sentences.english: I hauled the door shut behind me.
sentences.chinese: 我用力拽上了门。

detailed_translations.english: to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖， 拉， 托运； 一次获得的数量
detailed_translations.english: the amount of fish caught when fishing with a net

name: shake
trans: v. 摇动，抖动；削弱，动摇；发抖，颤抖；握手；使震惊，使难以置信；（通过惊吓或干扰而使心情或态度）改变；摆脱，克服；（因愤怒而）挥动，舞动（拳头、棍子等） ；甩掉，摆脱（跟踪者）；抖掉，抖出；使劲甩动，急剧晃动；（因发怒或为弄醒对方而）晃动，摇醒；摇头（表示拒绝、怀疑或难过）；（使）震颤，（使）震动；（声音因紧张、生气等）颤抖；使摒弃，使改变（态度、信念） n. 摇动，摇晃；<非正式>地震；（摇动容器后的）撒出物；奶昔；<非正式>哆嗦，颤抖；（乐）颤音；<美>（尤用于乡村建筑的）木制盖屋板，木制墙面板

sentences.english: She shook him to wake him up.
sentences.chinese: 她摇摇他，想把他叫醒。

sentences.english: Shake the bottle before you open it.
sentences.chinese: 打开瓶子之前先摇一摇。

sentences.english: The whole house started to shake.
sentences.chinese: 整幢房子摇晃起来。

sentences.english: The car shook as it went over a bump.
sentences.chinese: 汽车驶过一个隆起的地方时颠了一下。

sentences.english: The little boy’s hand was shaking.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩的手在发抖。

sentences.english: Give the bottle a good shake before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前要用力摇晃瓶子

sentences.english: His confidence was badly shaken.
sentences.chinese: 他的自信心受到很大的打击。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly from side to side or up and down, usually with a lot of force, or to make something or someone do this
if you give something a shake, you move it up and down or from side to side

name: jolt
trans: v. （使）震动，（使）颠簸；使受到震惊（而采取行动），使觉醒；使突然活跃（或有效） n. 颠簸，摇晃；震惊，惊讶；一点，少量（提神的东西）；（能源的）猛增

sentences.english: We jolted along rough wet roads through an endless banana plantation.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿崎岖潮湿的公路颠簸着驶过无边无际的香蕉种植园。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and roughly, or to make someone or something move in this way

detailed_translations.chinese: 颠簸；摇晃；震惊；严重挫折
detailed_translations.english: a sudden shock

name: embrace
trans: v. 拥抱；欣然接受，乐意采纳；包括，涉及；围绕，环绕 n. 拥抱；接受，信奉

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

name: heave
trans: v. 用力举起，使劲拖；（用力）扔，抛；起伏；发出（叹息）；恶心，呕吐；人头攒动，挤满（人）；用绳将（船）拉动（或往高处拖动） n. （用力）举，拉；（用力）扔；（剧烈的）起伏；（地质）平错，隆起

sentences.english: Michael’s shoulders heaved with silent laughter.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔憋着不笑出声来，双肩直抖。

sentences.english: The sea heaved up and down beneath the boat.
sentences.chinese: 船的下面大海波涛汹涌。

detailed_translations.english: to move up and down with very strong movements

detailed_translations.chinese: 举起，提起，拉起，拖；扔；发出
detailed_translations.english: to pull or lift something very heavy with one great effort

detailed_translations.chinese: 举起； 起伏， 升降
detailed_translations.english: a strong rising or falling movement

name: slap
trans: v. （用手掌）打，拍；拍打，拍击；（尤指生气地）啪的一声放下，随意扔放；（快速地、随意地或用力地）涂抹（某物）；甩击；侮辱 n. 拍，掌击；掌击声，拍打声；<英，非正式>（厚厚地或随意涂抹的）化妆品；侮辱 adv. <非正式> 直接地，猛然；<非正式> 恰好，正好 adj. 精力不足的，效率不高的；（食物）松软的，过于柔软的

sentences.english: Sarah slapped Aaron across the face.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在阿龙的脸上掴了一巴掌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拍击；侮辱；掌击；掴…的耳光
detailed_translations.english: to hit a surface with a lot of force, making a loud sharp sound
a quick hit with the flat part of your hand

name: clutch
trans: v. 紧握，紧抓；（因害怕或痛苦）突然抓住 n. 离合器踏板；一小群，一小簇；势力范围，控制；紧握，紧抓；一窝（蛋）；<美>女式无带手提包 adj. 关键性的；（尤指体育比赛中）在关键时刻表现良好的

sentences.english: Tony fell into the clutches of an attractive American who introduced him to drugs.
sentences.chinese: 托尼落入一个有魅力的美国人的掌控，那人给他介绍毒品。

sentences.english: I staggered and had to clutch at a chair for support.
sentences.chinese: 我踉跄了几步，不得不抓住一把椅子扶稳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离合器；控制；手；紧急关头
detailed_translations.english: the  pedal  that you press with your foot when driving a vehicle in order to change  gear  , or the part of the vehicle that this controls
If you clutch at something or clutch something, you hold it tightly, usually because you are afraid or anxious

detailed_translations.chinese: 没有手提带或背带的；紧要关头的

name: flush
trans: v. （人的皮肤或脸）发红（尤指因病或激动）；冲洗（抽水马桶），（抽水马桶）被冲洗；（用水或其他液体）冲洗；（用液体）冲走；把（猎鸟，动物）赶出隐藏地，使暴露；（使）发光；使（液体）流过；（植物）绽出新芽；嵌平（接合处） n. 脸红，皮肤发红（因尴尬、发热等原因）；一阵强烈情感；（尤指抽水马桶的）冲洗；（厕所里的）冲水设备，抽水马桶；旺盛期；（突如其来的）大量；急流；（树叶或幼苗等）破土而出的时期，（叶、花或果的）繁茂生长；有暖色之处，光亮之处；同花的一手牌，同花顺；驱赶（猎鸟）；（突如其来的）大批，大量 adj. （两物体表面）完全齐平的；<非正式>（尤指钱）充裕的，大量的；（门）平的，无装饰的；（印刷文字）不缩排的，齐头排的 adv. （与另一平面）齐平地；不偏不倚地，正好地

sentences.english: Susan flushed deeply and looked away.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊脸涨得通红，目光转向别处。

sentences.english: He flushed angrily .
sentences.chinese: 他气得满脸通红。

detailed_translations.english: to become red in the face, for example when you are angry or embarrassed
if two surfaces are flush, they are at exactly the same level, so that the place where they meet is flat

name: sprawl
trans: v. 伸开四肢坐（或躺）；蔓延 n. （城市）杂乱无序拓展的地区；四肢摊开的姿势；随意扩展，蔓延物

sentences.english: He sprawled out on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 他摊开手脚躺在沙发上。

sentences.english: I tripped on a stone and went sprawling on the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 我被一块石头绊了一下，四仰八叉地摔在人行道上。

sentences.english: a blow which sent him sprawling
sentences.chinese: 打得他四脚朝天的一拳

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓延；伸开手足躺；无计划地扩展
detailed_translations.english: to lie or sit with your arms or legs stretched out in a lazy or careless way

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓生；伸开手足躺卧姿势

name: sway
trans: v. 摇摆，摇晃，摆动；影响（某人），使改变看法；<文> 统治，管理；（使）摇摆，摇动 n. 统治，势力，支配，控制，影响；摇摆，摆动；统治，影响

sentences.english: Don’t allow yourself to be swayed by his promises.
sentences.chinese: 你可不要听了他的许诺就改变主意呀。

detailed_translations.english: to influence someone so that they change their opinion

name: spring
trans: n. 春天，春季；泉，泉水；源泉，根源；弹簧，发条；弹性，弹力；跳，跃；活力，朝气；<罕>一群水鸭；朔望潮，大潮（spring tide 的简称）；（船甲板）翘曲，弯曲；（厚木板、圆材的）裂开，裂缝；（航海）倒缆，斜系船缆 adj. 春天的 v. 跳，跃；突然弹开，突然移动；突然出现，涌现；突然启动，突然运转；突然向某人提供（或提出）；<非正式>帮助……逃跑（或越狱），营救；发源于，来自；<美，非正式>付账（尤指请客）；<古>花钱；<澳，非正式>突然发现，撞见（不正当活动或违法者）；惊起（猎鸟），使（猎鸟）从躲藏处飞出；使爆炸；（尤指木料）翘曲，裂开；（船的桅杆或其他部分）翘曲，裂开

sentences.english: He sprang to his feet (= stood up suddenly ) and rushed after her.
sentences.chinese: 他腾地站起身，冲过去追她。

sentences.english: There are several hot springs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这地区有几处温泉。

sentences.english: With a spring, the cat leapt on to the table.
sentences.chinese: 猫一跃跳上桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction, especially by jumping
a place where water comes up naturally from the ground

name: industrial
trans: adj. 工业的，产业的；有很多产业的，工业发达的；工业用的，用于工业的；（与）工业摇滚（有关）的；因勤劳而得到的 n. 从事工业的公司；工业股票；工业工人

sentences.english: By 1900, Britain was a mainly industrial society.
sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to industry or the people working in it

name: practical
trans: adj. 真实的，实际的；（计划、方法等）切实有效的，切实可行的；（人）明智的，务实的；合适的，适用的；心灵手巧的，善于制作（或修补）的；几乎完全的，实际上的 n. <英>（科学、烹饪等的）实践课，实用知识考试

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: instrument
trans: n. 器械；乐器；仪器；促成某事的人（或事物），手段；受利用（或控制）的人，工具；文据，正式法律文件 v. 给……装备测量仪器

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

name: instrumental
trans: adj. 有帮助的，起作用的；用乐器演奏的；与乐器有关的；与（事物）的工具效用有关的；与仪器或测量器具有关的；（语法）工具格的 n. 器乐曲（通常指非古典音乐）；工具格名词，工具格

sentences.english: ...a CD of vocal and instrumental music.
sentences.chinese: …一张声乐和器乐光盘。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐器的；有帮助的；仪器的，器械的
detailed_translations.english: instrumental music is for instruments, not for voices
a piece of music in which no voices are used, only instruments

name: textile
trans: n. 纺织物，织物；纺织业（textiles）；<非正式>着衣者，非自然主义者 adj. 纺织的；<非正式>非自然主义者的，限于着衣者的（裸体主义者用语）

sentences.english: Their main exports are textiles, especially silk and cotton.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要出口商品是纺织品，尤其是丝绸和棉布。

detailed_translations.english: any type of woven cloth that is made in large quantities, used especially by people in the business of making clothes etc

name: outfit
trans: n. （尤指在某一场合穿的）全套服装；全套工具，全套设备；<非正式>（协同工作的）一组人，一队人（尤指乐队、运动队、公司） v. 配备，向……提供装备（或服装）；得到装备

sentences.english: She bought a new outfit for the party.
sentences.chinese: 她为了这次派对买了套新衣服。

sentences.english: a cowboy outfit
sentences.chinese: 一套牛仔服装

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn together, especially for a special occasion

name: mine
trans: pron. 我的；<英，非正式>我的家 n. 矿，矿井；地雷，水雷；宝库，源泉；<史>炸药坑道 v. 采（煤等矿物）；布雷，用雷炸毁（车辆）；寻找（某事物中）蕴含的价值；在（地下）挖洞（或坑道）；挖掘（数据）；挖矿（获取加密货币的勘探方式）

sentences.chinese: 这是格伦的主意，不是我的。

sentences.english: ‘Is that your car?’ ‘No, mine is parked over the road.’
sentences.chinese: “那是你的车吗？”“不是，我的车停在路对面。”

sentences.english: You’ve got good legs – mine are too thin.
sentences.chinese: 你的腿很美——我的腿太细了。

sentences.english: His English is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 他英语比我好。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself

name: gear
trans: n. 排挡，齿轮；（用于特定目的的）装备，服装；（做事的）速度，努力；（特定用途的）器械，装置；<非正式>毒品；<非正式>所有物，财物 v. 使变速，使调挡

sentences.english: His mountain bike had 18 gears.
sentences.chinese: 他的山地自行车有18挡。

sentences.chinese: 安迪挂着三挡小心地行驶。

sentences.english: Does this thing have a reverse gear?
sentences.chinese: 这玩意儿有倒挡吗？

sentences.english: Any cyclist can climb a difficult hill; you just change gear.
sentences.chinese: 谁都能骑上难爬的山坡，只要换挡就行了。

sentences.english: Don’t turn off the engine while you’re still in gear.
sentences.chinese: 还挂着挡的时候不要关发动机。

sentences.english: It’s a good habit to take the car out of gear while you’re at a stoplight.
sentences.chinese: 等红灯时换空挡的习惯很好。

sentences.english: Colleges are not always geared to the needs of mature students.
sentences.chinese: 大学并不总是去适应成年学生的需要。

sentences.english: My training was geared toward winning gold.
sentences.chinese: 我的训练是为赢得金牌去规划的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 齿轮，传动装置，排挡；用具，设备；衣服
detailed_translations.english: the machinery in a vehicle such as a car, truck, or bicycle that you use to go comfortably at different speeds

name: fixture
trans: n. 固定装置，固定家具；既定人选（或事物）；（预定的）体育赛事

sentences.english: light fixtures
sentences.chinese: 照明设备

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that is fixed inside a house or building and is sold as part of the house

name: monitor
trans: n. 显示器，监控器；监视仪，监护仪；监督员，监察员；（学校里的）班长，级长；（电台的）监听员；扬声器；巨蜥；浅水重炮舰 v. 监视；监听（外国广播或电话）；监控（无线电或电视传输信号）

sentences.chinese: 心脏监测仪

detailed_translations.chinese: 班长；监视器，检测器；显示器

name: device
trans: n. 装置，设备；手段，方法；花招，诡计；炸弹，爆炸装置；图画，设计；<古>（某物的）样式，外表

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: equipment
trans: n. 设备，用具；（对某人或某物的）装备过程；（做某事应具备的）素质，才能

sentences.english: a shop selling camping equipment
sentences.chinese: 出售露营装备的商店

sentences.english: some brand new computer equipment
sentences.chinese: 一些全新的计算机设备

sentences.english: a very useful piece of equipment
sentences.chinese: 一件非常有用的设备

sentences.english: A lot of money was spent on the equipment of the new hospital.
sentences.chinese: 新医院的装备花费巨大。

detailed_translations.english: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity

name: cement
trans: n. 水泥；胶合剂，接合剂；（对关系、看法等起巩固作用的）纽带；牙骨质；（黏附颗粒的）沉积岩基质；（填充牙齿龋洞的）黏固粉 v. 用（水泥或胶合剂）黏结，胶合；巩固，加强；决定，确立

sentences.english: a bag of cement
sentences.chinese: 一袋水泥

sentences.english: Most artificial joints are cemented into place.
sentences.chinese: 绝大部分人造关节是被黏结复位的。

detailed_translations.english: a grey powder made from  lime  and clay that becomes hard when it is mixed with water and allowed to dry, and that is used in building
to join two things together using cement , glue, etc.

name: pivot
trans: n. 支点，枢轴；最重要的人（或事物），核心；转动，旋转；策应位置；<美>中锋 v. （使）在枢轴上旋转；（以脚为支点）转身；（为机械装置）提供枢轴

sentences.english: Forming the pivot of the exhibition is a large group of watercolours.
sentences.chinese: 构成这个展览核心的是一大批水彩画。

detailed_translations.english: a central point or pin on which something balances or turns

detailed_translations.chinese: 以…为中心旋转；把…置于枢轴上
detailed_translations.english: to turn or balance on a central point, or to make something do this

name: axis
trans: n. 轴，轴线；对称中心线，对称轴；（国家间的）联盟；斑鹿（=chital，复数axis）

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on an axis between the north and south poles.
sentences.chinese: 地球绕着南北两极之间的地轴自转。

detailed_translations.english: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns

name: release
trans: v. 释放，放走；使出院；把（动物）放生；解救；放开；拉开，松开（装置）；发射，投（弹）；公布，发布；发行，上映；表达，发泄；释放，排放（物质）； 解除（职务或工作），解雇；放弃，让予；使不紧张；开放，解禁 n. （人或动物的）释放，放出；排放，泄漏；（设备的）松开，拉开；释放装置（如按、拉的装置）；表达，宣泄；解脱，轻松感；放松的机会；新发行的东西；公开，发布；公映；（责任等的）免除，解除；免责书；<法律> 放弃，让予；放弃文书；<美> 传球

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: load
trans: n. 负载，重荷；一批待洗的衣物；工作量；发电量，电荷；承载量；大量，许多；负担，压力；胡说八道，废话 v. 装上，装进；承载，装载；大量给予；装上（底片），上（子弹）；满（垒）；载入（计算机程序）

sentences.english: Have you finished loading up?
sentences.chinese: 你装完货了吗？

sentences.english: It took an hour to load the van.
sentences.chinese: 给小型货车装货花了一小时。

sentences.english: Will you help me load the dishwasher?
sentences.chinese: 你帮我把碗碟放进洗碗机好吗？

sentences.english: The plane was carrying afull loadof fuel.
sentences.chinese: 飞机载满燃料。

detailed_translations.english: to put a large quantity of something into a vehicle or container
a large quantity of something that is carried by a vehicle, person etc

name: behave
trans: v. 行为，表现；起反应，起作用；守规矩，举止得体

sentences.english: She behaved in a very responsible way .
sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我无法相信这些人竟这样行事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现，举止；运转，做出反应
detailed_translations.english: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc
The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say

name: erect
