sentences.english: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
sentences.chinese: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅，建于1892年

sentences.english: Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
sentences.chinese: 警察在进城的主要道路上设立了路障。

sentences.english: It took a couple of hours to erect the tent.
sentences.chinese: 搭帐篷花了几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a building or wall

name: raise
trans: v. 提升，举起；（使）直立，站立；建造，树立（纪念碑等）；增加，提高（数量、水平等）；筹集，筹募；召集，征募（尤指士兵）；提及（某事）；引起，使出现；饲养，种植；抚养，养育； 使积方，使自乘……次；比（对手）多下赌注； 打捞（船只）；使（面包）发酵；使复活；（暂时）终止，解除；（通过无线电或电话）与……取得联系；开具（发货单或其他单据）；把（动物）从窝里赶出；（海上人员）驶近能看见（陆地或其他船只）的地方；（免疫）刺激（抗血清、抗体等的）生成 n. <美>加薪；（扑克牌或勃莱格牌用语）赌注加码；（举重）（持杠铃时的）提，举；上升

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: manipulate
trans: v. 操纵，摆布；操作，使用；正骨，推拿；篡改；巧妙地移动（某物），巧妙地处理（某事）；校正，转移（储存在计算机上的信息）

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

name: construct
trans: v. 建造，修建；组成，创立，构思；绘制，作图 n. 构想，观念；建筑物，创造物；结构体

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

name: convey
trans: v. 传送，运输；表达，传递；<法律>转让（土地、财产等）

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.english: Ads convey the message that thin is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.english: He was sent to convey a message to the UN Secretary General.
sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

name: fabricate
trans: v. 制造，生产；捏造，编造；组装，装配

sentences.english: The police were accused of fabricating evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方被控捏造证据。

sentences.english: The discs are expensive to fabricate.
sentences.chinese: 这些磁盘的生产成本很高。

detailed_translations.english: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone

name: manufacture
trans: v. （用机器大量）生产，制造；编造，捏造；生成，产生（一种物质） n. 大量制造，批量生产；工业品；制造业

sentences.english: the company that manufactured the drug
sentences.chinese: 生产这种药的公司

sentences.english: manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 工业品，制成品

sentences.english: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 成本将决定生产方法。

sentences.english: a major importer of cotton manufactures
sentences.chinese: 棉花产品的主要进口商

detailed_translations.english: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts

name: conserve
trans: v. 保护，保存；节省，节约；使（量，如能量、质量）守恒；将……制成蜜饯 n. 蜜饯，果脯

sentences.english: We must conserve our woodlands for future generations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须为子孙后代保护林地。

sentences.english: efforts to conserve fish stocks
sentences.chinese: 保护鱼类资源的努力

detailed_translations.english: to protect something and prevent it from changing or being damaged

name: hoist
trans: v. 吊起，提升；<非正式>投篮 n. 吊升机械，起重机；吊起，升起；旗宽（贴近旗杆的部分）；（一串）信号旗

sentences.english: The crew hurried to hoist the flag.
sentences.chinese: 船员们急忙把旗子升起来。

detailed_translations.english: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes

detailed_translations.chinese: 起重器械； 举起， 升起， 吊起
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for lifting heavy objects with ropes

name: concrete
trans: adj. 确实的，具体的；实在的，有形的；混凝土的；物质的 n. 混凝土 v. 用混凝土覆盖（或做成）；<旧>（使）凝固，（使）凝结；使真实（化），使具体（化）

sentences.english: What does that mean in concrete terms ?
sentences.chinese: 具体来说那到底是什么意思？

sentences.english: the lack of any concrete evidence
sentences.chinese: 缺少具体证据的

sentences.english: a dialogue about concrete issues and problems
sentences.chinese: 有关具体事情和问题的对话

detailed_translations.english: definite and specific

name: mill
trans: n. 磨坊，磨粉厂；工厂，制造厂；<非正式> 一百万；磨粉机，磨麪机；<美>密尔，厘；机器，铣床；<非正式>引擎；<非正式>一百万 v. （用磨粉机）碾碎，磨成粉；（一大群人）闲逛，转悠；碾（轧，铣）（金属）；轧出（硬币的）边纹；使（羊毛或其他动物纤维）缩绒（或缩呢）

sentences.english: All our flours are milled using traditional methods.
sentences.chinese: 我们所有的面粉全是用传统方法碾磨的。

sentences.english: Add some freshly milled black pepper.
sentences.chinese: 加一些现磨的黑胡椒粉。

detailed_translations.english: to crush grain, pepper etc in a mill

detailed_translations.chinese: 磨坊；碾磨机；制造厂，工厂
detailed_translations.english: a building containing a large machine for crushing grain into flour

name: domestic
trans: adj. 国内的，本国的；家用的，家庭的；喜爱家庭生活的，乐于操持家务的；非野生的，驯养的 n. 家庭纠纷，家庭矛盾；佣人，家仆；<美>国货，本地产品

sentences.english: ...over 100 domestic flights a day to 30 leading U.S. destinations.
sentences.chinese: …每天飞往美国30个主要目的地的100多个国内航班。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries

sentences.english: This idyllic pastoral scene is only part of the picture.
sentences.chinese: 但这种田园诗般的乡村风光仅仅是一个侧面。

sentences.english: Some believe that lemurians were much more like early humans living in a sort of idyllic paradise largely agrarian with lush forests and an abundance of flowers and fruit trees.
sentences.chinese: 一些就相信利莫里亚更加像早期的人类，生活在一种田园诗般的天堂里，主要地与繁荣的森林，盛开的花朵和结果的树在一起。

sentences.english: I don't mind a bit of idiosyncrasy, but that strange ideology you believe in , coupled with your idyllic ideas on life, suggest to me that all you're doing is looking for some idol to follow.
sentences.chinese: 你有一点特殊的癖性我不在乎，但你相信的那种奇怪的意识形态，加上你向往田园诗般生活的想法，给我的印象是你在做的就是要找到一个偶像来效仿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 田园诗般的， 田园风光的， 牧歌的

name: scale
trans: n. 天平，磅秤；天平盘；天秤（星）座（the Scales）；等级，级别；刻度，标度；标尺，刻度尺；规模，范围；比例，比例尺；鳞，鳞片；鱼鳞状物；水垢；牙垢；音阶；（加热后金属上形成的）氧化皮；进位制；（摄影）影调范围 v. 改变（文字、图片）的尺寸大小；刮去（鱼鳞）；攀登，翻越；剔除（牙垢）；（尤指皮肤）生成鳞屑；（成片状）脱落，剥落；（数量，财产） 按一定比例调节；称得重量为；<美>估算（树木的）产木材量 adj. （模型或复制品）按比例缩小的

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

name: furniture
trans: n. 家具；装置；惯常的见解；贮藏物，内容；步枪底托；（排版用的）大空铅，填空材料

sentences.english: I helped him choose the furniture for his house.
sentences.chinese: 我帮他挑选房子里用的家具。

sentences.english: I can’t think of a single piece of furniture in my house that I bought new.
sentences.chinese: 我想不出家里有哪件家具是新买的。

sentences.english: office furniture
sentences.chinese: 办公室家具

detailed_translations.english: large objects such as chairs, tables, beds, and cupboards

name: rubbish
trans: n. 垃圾，废弃物；毫无价值的东西，劣质产品；废话，瞎说 v. <英，非正式>严厉批评，把……说得一无是处 adj. <英，非正式>很差劲的，无用的

sentences.english: a rubbish bin
sentences.chinese: 垃圾桶

detailed_translations.english: food, paper etc that is no longer needed and has been thrown away

name: trash
trans: n. 垃圾，废物；<美>垃圾桶；劣质的东西，（尤指）拙劣的作品；<美>废物，窝囊废；（西印度）（作燃料的）甘蔗叶（梢），甘蔗渣 v. <非正式>损坏，毁坏；<非正式>抨击，谴责；<非正式>丢弃，去除；（计算机）把（文件，程序）送进回收站删除，清空（磁盘）；剥（甘蔗）皮以使其更快成熟

sentences.english: Will someone take out the trash (= take it outside the house ) ?
sentences.chinese: 谁把垃圾拿出去好吗？

sentences.english: Just put it in the trash .
sentences.chinese: 就把它扔到垃圾桶里吧。

detailed_translations.english: things that you throw away, such as empty bottles, used papers, food that has gone bad etc

name: hurdle
trans: n. 障碍，难关；（供人或马在赛跑中跨越的）栏架，跨栏；跨栏赛跑，障碍赛跑；（把背叛者送往刑场的）囚笼 v. （奔跑中）跳越（某物）；参加跨栏赛跑；克服（障碍或困难），渡过难关；用临时围栏隔开（或围住）

sentences.english: Finding enough money for the project was the first hurdle.
sentences.chinese: 第一道难关是为该项目筹措足够的资金。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or difficulty that you must deal with before you can achieve something

name: sustenance
trans: n. 食物；生计；支持

sentences.english: Without sustenance, the animals will soon die.
sentences.chinese: 没有食物，动物很快就会死亡。

sentences.english: Potatoes were their only means of sustenance.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是他们唯一的食物。

detailed_translations.english: food that people or animals need in order to live

name: nostalgia
trans: n. 怀旧，念旧

sentences.english: He might be influenced by nostalgia for the surroundings of his happy youth.
sentences.chinese: 他也许被他对快乐青年时代的环境的怀念影响了。

detailed_translations.english: Nostalgia is an affectionate feeling you have for the past, especially for a particularly happy time

name: singe
trans: vt. 烧焦；烤焦 vi. 烧焦；烤焦 n. 烧焦；烤焦

sentences.english: The flames had singed her hair.
sentences.chinese: 火焰燎了她的头发。

detailed_translations.english: to burn the surface of something slightly, or to be burned slightly
a mark on the surface of something where it has been burnt slightly

name: baggage
trans: n. 行李；思想包袱，成见

sentences.english: Check your baggage in at the desk.
sentences.chinese: 在服务台托运行李。

detailed_translations.english: the cases, bags, boxes etc carried by someone who is travelling

name: outing
trans: n. 短途旅游，远足；出门，外出；<非正式>（尤指在体育项目或电影中的）出场；对同性恋者（尤指名人）的曝光 v. 击倒，击昏；<非正式>公开（知名人士）的同性恋身份；熄灭（out 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: One evening, she made a rare outing to the local night club.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，她难得地去了一趟当地的夜总会。

detailed_translations.chinese: 远足；短途旅游；体育比赛
detailed_translations.english: a short trip that a group of people take for pleasure

name: regimen
trans: n. <正式>生活规则，养生之道，疗程；<古>政治制度，政体

sentences.english: Patients maintain a strict dietary regimen.
sentences.chinese: 病人严格遵守饮食规律。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医] 养生法；生活规则；政体；支配
detailed_translations.english: a special plan of food, exercise etc that is intended to improve your health

name: slag
trans: n. 炉渣；矿渣；熔渣 vt. 使成渣；使变成熔渣 vi. 变熔渣

detailed_translations.english: a waste material similar to glass, which remains after metal has been obtained from rock

name: sojourn
trans: n. 逗留；旅居 vi. 逗留；旅居

name: dwell
trans: v. 居住，栖身；总是想着，唠叨（dwell on）

sentences.english: They dwelt in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在森林里。

sentences.english: So you made a mistake, but there's no need to dwell on it.
sentences.chinese: 你是错了，不过不必老是想着这事儿。

detailed_translations.english: to live in a particular place

name: baby-sit
trans: vi. 当临时保姆；代人承担照料责任 vt. 为人临时照看；照顾婴儿

name: tease
trans: v. 取笑，嘲笑；逗弄（动物）；（尤指性方面）挑逗，撩拨；哄，逗；拨，分离；梳理（羊毛、头发等）；<美>（为了使头发显厚）回梳 n. 爱开玩笑的人，爱戏弄别人的人；玩笑，戏弄；卖弄风骚的人；<非正式>激起兴趣的广告

sentences.english: Don’t get upset. I was only teasing .
sentences.chinese: 别生气，我只是在逗你玩。

sentences.english: He used to tease her mercilessly .
sentences.chinese: 他过去总是无情地取笑她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取笑；戏弄；梳理；欺负；强求；使起毛
detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩
detailed_translations.english: someone who enjoys making jokes at people, and embarrassing them, especially in a friendly way

name: inhabit
trans: v. 居住于，栖居在；存在于，占据

sentences.english: The woods are inhabited by many wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 很多野生动物栖居在这片森林里。

sentences.english: inhabited islands
sentences.chinese: 有人居住的岛屿

detailed_translations.english: if animals or people inhabit an area or place, they live there

name: scorch
trans: vt. 烧焦；使枯萎；挖苦 vi. 烧焦；枯萎 n. 烧焦；焦痕

sentences.english: The walls had been blackened and scorched by fire.
sentences.chinese: 这些墙被大火熏黑了。

detailed_translations.english: if you scorch something, or if it scorches, its surface burns slightly and changes colour
a mark made on something where its surface has been burnt

name: nurture
trans: v. 培养，促进；养育，培育；抱有，怀有；扶持，帮助；滋养，滋生 n. 养育，培育；教养；（总称）环境因素

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

name: reside
trans: v. <正式>居住，定居；<正式>存在于；<正式>（权利、权力等）属于；位（于）

sentences.english: He spent most of his time in Rutherglen, where his family resided.
sentences.chinese: 他大部分时间都在拉瑟格伦度过，他的家人就在那里居住。

detailed_translations.english: to live in a particular place

name: resident
trans: n. 居民，住户；（旅馆的）住宿者；<美>住院医生；<美> 寄宿制学校学生；<史>（英国政府派驻半独立国家的） 特派代表；驻外特工；留鸟，无迁徙习性的蝴蝶（或其他动物） adj. （在某地）居住的，居留的；常驻的；属于（某个群体）的；（鸟、蝴蝶等）非迁徙性的；（计算机程序、文件等在存储器中）驻留的

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: deserted
trans: adj. 空无一人的，空旷的；被遗弃的，被抛弃的； 废弃的 v. 离弃，舍弃（某地）；抛弃，遗弃（某人）；背弃，放弃（desert 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: At the edge of the desert, he came across a deserted church.
sentences.chinese: 在沙漠的边缘地带，他碰巧发现了一个被遗弃的教堂。

sentences.english: Poor farmers are deserting their parched farm fields and coming here looking for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 贫穷的农民丢下干旱的农田，来这里寻找工作。

detailed_translations.english: a wife etc who has been left by her husband etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗弃（desert的过去式和过去分词）
detailed_translations.english: If people or animals desert a place, they leave it and it becomes empty

name: desolate
trans: adj. 荒无人烟的，荒凉的；凄凉的，孤独忧伤的 v. 使悲痛欲绝，使孤独凄凉；使荒凉，使成废墟

sentences.english: a desolate landscape
sentences.chinese: 荒凉的景色

detailed_translations.english: a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
someone who is desolate feels very sad and lonely

name: bleak
trans: adj. 不乐观的，无望的；无遮掩的，荒凉的；阴冷的，寒冷的；沮丧的，阴郁的；（人或其表情）冷漠的，冷峻的 n. 欧鲌

sentences.english: a bleak January afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一月里一个阴冷的下午

sentences.english: The landscape was bleak.
sentences.chinese: 景色一片凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

name: sterile
trans: adj. 无生殖能力的，不育的；无菌的，消过毒的；（争论或讨论）毫无新意的，无结果的；（建筑、房间等）呆板的，乏味的；（土地）贫瘠的，不长作物的

sentences.english: The classrooms are sterile, with no artwork on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 这些教室毫无生气，墙上一张画都没有。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不育的；无菌的；贫瘠的；不毛的；枯燥乏味的
detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that is sterile cannot produce babies

name: barren
trans: adj. 贫瘠的，不毛的；不结果实的；<旧>不育的；不出成绩的，无效果的；沉闷无趣的，没有吸引力的 n. 瘠地

sentences.english: Thousands of years ago the surface was barren desert.
sentences.chinese: 很久很久以前，地面还是一片荒漠。

sentences.english: He prayed that his barren wife would one day have a child.
sentences.chinese: 他祈祷自己不孕的妻子有朝一日能怀上宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: (of land or soil) not good enough for plants to grow on it

name: agrarian
trans: adj. 土地的；耕地的；有关土地的

sentences.english: This was a feature of agrarian development in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这是大不列颠土地发展的一个特征。

sentences.english: The patriarchal clan becomes the resistance revolution in the agrarian revolution the strength, therefore encounters suppresses and attacks.
sentences.chinese: 在土地革命中宗族成为对抗革命的力量，所以遭到抑制和打击。

detailed_translations.english: Agrarian means relating to the ownership and use of land, especially farmland, or relating to the part of a society or economy that is concerned with agriculture

name: clay
trans: n. 黏土，陶土；（网球场的）硬固泥地，红土网球场；<文>肉体；似黏土的东西；黄棕翼欧洲蛾 v. 用黏土处理

sentences.english: Bricks are made from clay.
sentences.chinese: 砖是用黏土制成的。

detailed_translations.chinese: [土壤] 粘土；泥土；肉体；似黏土的东西
detailed_translations.english: a type of heavy sticky earth that can be used for making pots, bricks etc

name: clod
trans: n. 土块；笨蛋；牛颈肉 vt. 对……掷土块

name: stodgy
trans: adj. （食物）难消化的，易饱的；高糖分的；古板的，枯燥的；（外表）庞大的，笨重的

sentences.english: The company hasn't been able to shake off its image as stodgy and old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 该公司一直未能摆脱其古板守旧的形象。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something is stodgy, they are dull, unimaginative, and commonplace

name: stout
trans: adj. （人）肥胖的，壮实的；厚而结实的；不屈不挠的，顽强的 n. 烈性黑啤酒；特大号衣服；胖子

sentences.english: a stout pair of shoes
sentences.chinese: 一双厚实耐穿的鞋子

detailed_translations.chinese: 结实的；矮胖的；勇敢的；激烈的
detailed_translations.english: strong and thick
strong dark beer

name: obese
trans: adj. 肥胖的，臃肿的

sentences.english: Obese people tend to have higher blood pressure than lean people.
sentences.chinese: 肥胖的人往往比瘦人血压高。

detailed_translations.english: very fat in a way that is unhealthy

name: corpulent
trans: adj. 肥胖的

sentences.english: ...a rather corpulent farmer.
sentences.chinese: ...一位颇为肥胖的农人。

detailed_translations.english: fat

name: shabby
trans: adj. 破旧的，破烂的；（人）衣着破旧的，衣衫褴褛的；（行为）卑鄙的，不公正的；（质量）低劣的

sentences.english: Hugh’s jacket was old and shabby.
sentences.chinese: 休的夹克衫又旧又破。

sentences.english: a shabby little restaurant
sentences.chinese: 一家肮脏的小餐馆

sentences.english: a shabby tramp
sentences.chinese: 一个衣衫褴褛的流浪汉

detailed_translations.english: shabby clothes, places, or objects are untidy and in bad condition because they have been used for a long time

name: ragged
trans: adj. （衣服）破旧的；（人）衣衫褴褛的；高低不平的，参差不齐的；不流畅的，不规则的；精疲力竭的；不熟练的，蹩脚的；（尤指右边距）未对齐的

sentences.english: Crowds of ragged children played among the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 一群群破衣烂衫的孩子在岩石间玩耍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 褴褛的，外形参差不齐的
detailed_translations.english: wearing clothes that are old and torn

name: bald
trans: adj. 秃头的；光秃的，磨光的，掉光的；不加修饰的，直截了当的

sentences.english: a bald man
sentences.chinese: 一名秃顶男子

sentences.english: his shiny bald head
sentences.chinese: 他那亮闪闪的光头

sentences.english: Dad started going bald when he was in his thirties.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸在三十多岁的时候开始谢顶。

sentences.english: He combed his hair and tried to hide his bald patch (=  part of someone’s head where there is no hair  ).
sentences.chinese: 他梳了梳头，试图把头顶的秃块遮掩起来。

detailed_translations.english: having little or no hair on your head

name: aspect
trans: n. 方面，特色；朝向，方位；外表，外观；（动词的）体 v. （行星与另一天体）形成角度关系

sentences.english: a south-facing aspect
sentences.chinese: 朝南方向

detailed_translations.english: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

name: costume
trans: n. 服装，装束；戏服，表演服装；泳衣，泳装 v. 给（某人）穿上特定服装 adj. （戏剧）古装的

sentences.english: the film’s lavish costumes and spectacular sets
sentences.chinese: 影片中奢华的戏装和壮观的场景

sentences.english: Hallowe’en costumes
sentences.chinese: 万圣节前夕化装服

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn by an actor or by someone to make them look like something such as an animal, famous person etc

name: attire
trans: n. <正式>服装，衣服 v. 着装

sentences.english: business attire
sentences.chinese: 商务着装，正装

detailed_translations.english: clothes

name: outfit
trans: n. （尤指在某一场合穿的）全套服装；全套工具，全套设备；<非正式>（协同工作的）一组人，一队人（尤指乐队、运动队、公司） v. 配备，向……提供装备（或服装）；得到装备

sentences.english: She bought a new outfit for the party.
sentences.chinese: 她为了这次派对买了套新衣服。

sentences.english: a cowboy outfit
sentences.chinese: 一套牛仔服装

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn together, especially for a special occasion
to provide someone or something with a set of clothes or equipment, especially ones that are needed for a particular purpose

name: garb
trans: n. 服装；装束；打扮 vt. 装扮；穿衣

sentences.english: priestly garb
sentences.chinese: 牧师装束

detailed_translations.english: a particular style of clothing, especially clothes that show your type of work or look unusual

name: strap
trans: n. 带子，皮带；铁皮条，金属带，铰链片；鞭打（the strap）；拉手吊带，拉手吊环 v. （用带子）束住，捆绑；用绷带包扎（伤口）；用皮鞭抽打，鞭打

sentences.english: The strap of my bag is broken.
sentences.chinese: 我包上的带子断了。

sentences.english: soldiers with grenades strapped to their belts
sentences.chinese: 腰带上绑着手榴弹的士兵

detailed_translations.english: a narrow band of strong material that is used to fasten, hang, or hold onto something
to fasten something or someone in place with one or more straps

name: guise
trans: n. 伪装；装束；外观 vt. 使化装 vi. 伪装 n. （Guise）人名；（葡）吉塞；（英、法）吉斯

sentences.english: It’s the same idea in a different guise.
sentences.chinese: 还是一样的观点，只是形式不同。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone or something appears to be, which hides the truth or is only temporary

name: clothing
trans: n. 衣服，（尤指某种）服装 v. 给……穿衣，为……提供衣服，赋予（某人某品质）（clothe 的现在分词）

sentences.english: basic necessities such as food and clothing
sentences.chinese: 食物和衣服这类基本的生活必需品

sentences.english: She took only a few items of clothing.
sentences.chinese: 她只带了几件衣服。

detailed_translations.english: the clothes that people wear

name: array
trans: n. 一系列，大量；数组，阵列；盛装 v. 布置，排列；配置（兵力）；穿戴，打扮

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

name: cosmetics
trans: n. [化工]化妆品（cosmetic 的复数）；装饰品 v. 用化妆品打扮（cosmetic 的三单形式）

name: suit
trans: n. 套装，西装；（从事特定活动时穿的）成套服装；诉讼；同花色的一组纸牌；<非正式>（企业或机构中的）高级管理人员；一套蓬帆；追求（常指求婚）；<文>（向当权者提出的）请愿，请求 v. （服装、风格、颜色）使显得漂亮，与……相配；对（某人）方便，满足（某人）需要，合（某人）心意；适合，适宜；随自己的意愿，随性子；<美>（尤指为特定的活动）穿衣

sentences.english: Johnson has filed suit against her.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊对她提起了诉讼。

sentences.english: a civil suit
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼

sentences.english: There are countryside walks to suit everyone.
sentences.chinese: 有适合每个人的乡村步行路径。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

name: sole
trans: adj. 唯一的，仅有的；专用的，独享的；<古>（尤指女性）未婚的；<古>单独的，没人陪伴的 n. 脚底；鞋底（不包括后跟）；脚趾和脚弓之间的部分；（刨子等工具的）底部，（高尔夫球棒头的）底端；（船舱或驾驶室的）地面，地板；鳎（鱼）； 脚底 v. 给（鞋）换底

sentences.english: the sole American in the room
sentences.chinese: 房间里唯一的美国人

sentences.english: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

sentences.english: the soles of her shoes
sentences.chinese: 她鞋子的鞋底

detailed_translations.english: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on

name: drowsy
trans: adj. 昏昏欲睡的，困倦的；令人松弛的，令人困倦欲睡的；（尤指地方）静谧的，平静的，安静的

sentences.english: The drug can make you drowsy.
sentences.chinese: 这种药会让人昏昏欲睡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏昏欲睡的；沉寂的；催眠的
detailed_translations.english: tired and almost asleep

name: nap
trans: n. （尤指在白天）小睡，打盹；（织物、地毯等表面的）绒毛；<英>赛马情报；<澳，非正式>睡袋（野外用）；纳普牌戏（类似惠斯特牌戏，玩家自报可赢之墩数，全胜五墩）；<英>孤注一掷 v. （尤指在白天）小睡，打盹；不留神，无准备；（马）（尤指习惯性地）不听从指令，徘徊不前；<英>预测（赛马，赛狗）获胜；使起绒，使拉毛

sentences.english: an afternoon nap
sentences.chinese: 午睡

detailed_translations.chinese: 小睡，打盹儿；细毛；孤注一掷
detailed_translations.english: a short sleep, especially during the day

name: recreation
trans: n. 娱乐（活动），消遣（活动）；重现，重建

sentences.english: His only recreations are drinking beer and watching football.
sentences.chinese: 他唯一的消遣就是喝啤酒和看足球比赛。

sentences.english: the provision of recreation facilities
sentences.chinese: 提供娱乐设施

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you do for pleasure or amusement

name: lull
trans: v. 使安静，使昏昏欲睡；使（人）放松警惕，哄骗；（使）减弱，平息，停止 n. 间歇，暂时平静；低谷期

sentences.english: The hum of the tyres on the road lulled her to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 一路上滚滚的车轮声使她昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: There was a lull in political violence after the election of the current president.
sentences.chinese: 现任总统选举结束以后，政治暴力曾暂时平息。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calm or as if they want to sleep
A lull is a period of quiet or calm in a longer period of activity or excitement

name: beguile
trans: vt. 欺骗；使着迷；轻松地消磨

sentences.english: I was beguiled by the romance and exotic atmosphere of the souks in Marrakech.
sentences.chinese: 我被马拉喀什剧场浪漫的异国情调迷住了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗；使着迷；轻松地消磨
detailed_translations.english: to persuade or trick someone into doing something

name: doze
trans: v. 小睡，打盹；打瞌睡度过 n. 瞌睡，小睡

sentences.english: Grandad was dozing in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 爷爷在椅子上打瞌睡。

detailed_translations.english: to sleep lightly for a short time

name: bask
trans: vi. 晒太阳；取暖；愉快或舒适 vt. 使……晒太阳；使暖和而舒适 n. （Bask）人名；（芬）巴斯克

sentences.english: All through the hot, still days of their holiday Amy basked in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 在整个炎热、寂静的假期里埃米都在晒太阳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 晒太阳；取暖；愉快或舒适
detailed_translations.english: to enjoy sitting or lying in the heat of the sun or a fire

name: fateful
trans: adj. 重大的；决定性的；宿命的

sentences.english: It was a fateful decision, one which was to break the Government.
sentences.chinese: 那是一项重大的决定，一个将使政府垮台的决定。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重大的；决定性的；宿命的
detailed_translations.english: having an important, especially bad, effect on future events

name: imminent
trans: adj. 即将发生的，临近的；<古>垂悬的

sentences.english: A new trade agreement is imminent.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的贸易协定即将签署。

detailed_translations.english: an event that is imminent, especially an unpleasant one, will happen very soon

name: estimable
trans: adj. 可估计的；可尊敬的；有价值的

sentences.english: ...the estimable Miss Cartwright.
sentences.chinese: ...令人仰慕的卡特赖特小姐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可估计的；可尊敬的；有价值的
detailed_translations.english: deserving respect and admiration

name: apt
trans: adj. 易于……的，有……倾向的；恰当的，适宜的；善学的，聪明的

sentences.english: ‘Love at first sight’ is a very apt description of how he felt when he saw her.
sentences.chinese: 用“一见钟情”来形容他见到她时的感觉再恰当不过。

sentences.english: She had taught him French and he had been an apt student.
sentences.chinese: 她教过他法语，他一直是个聪慧的学生。

detailed_translations.english: exactly right for a particular situation or purpose

name: promising
trans: adj. 有希望的，有前途的 v. 承诺，答应；使很可能，预示（promise 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: a promising career in law
sentences.chinese: 很有前途的法律职业

sentences.english: a promising young actor
sentences.chinese: 大有前途的年轻演员

sentences.english: a promising start
sentences.chinese: 良好的开端

detailed_translations.chinese: 有希望的， 有前途的
detailed_translations.english: showing signs of being successful or good in the future

name: provident
trans: adj. 节俭的；有先见之明的；顾及未来的

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭的；有先见之明的；顾及未来的
detailed_translations.english: careful and sensible in the way you plan things, especially by saving money for the future

name: prospect
trans: n. 可能性，希望；预期，展望；（尤指事业的）成功机会，前景；有望成功的人，有前途的人；可能的顾客，潜在的主顾；<正式>（尤指从高处看到的）景象，景色；潜在矿藏或矿床 v. 勘探，勘察；寻找（商业机会）

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: prospective
trans: adj. 有希望的，潜在的； 可能发生的，预期的

sentences.english: The story should act as a warning to other prospective buyers.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报道应该可以对其他可能的购买者起到警告作用。

detailed_translations.english: You use prospective to describe someone who wants to be the thing mentioned or who is likely to be the thing mentioned

name: perspective
trans: n. （观察问题的）视角，观点；透视（画）法；（几何）透视关系，投影比例；洞察力，判断力；景观，远景；角度；（声音）立体效果 adj. 透视的

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: auspice
trans: n. 赞助，主办；吉兆

detailed_translations.english: a sign or omen, esp one that is favourable

name: tendency
trans: n. 经常性行为，偏好；趋势，趋向；（性格中不良的）倾向；（政党内的）极端派别

sentences.english: children with aggressive or anti-social tendencies
sentences.chinese: 具有攻击性倾向或反社会倾向的儿童

detailed_translations.chinese: 趋向， 趋势， 倾向
detailed_translations.english: if someone or something has a tendency to do or become a particular thing, they are likely to do or become it

name: precursor
trans: n. （事物）先驱，先兆；（尤指经新陈代谢形成另一种物质的）前体，前质

sentences.english: Error is often the precursor of what is correct.
sentences.chinese: 错误常常是正确的先导。

sentences.english: Viewed as a precursor to a wider open data movement, it could be as important as any we have seen in the web era.
sentences.chinese: 它被视为更宽泛的数据开放运动的先导，它将像我们在互联网时代看到的所有重要的事物一样重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that happened or existed before something else and influenced its development

name: prediction
trans: n. 预言之事，预报之事；预测（行为）

sentences.english: The data can be used to make useful economic predictions .
sentences.chinese: 这些数据可用于进行有用的经济预测。

detailed_translations.english: a statement about what you think is going to happen, or the act of making this statement

name: surmise
trans: vt. 猜测；推测 vi. 猜测；认为 n. 推测；猜度

sentences.english: There's so little to go on, we can only surmise what happened.
sentences.chinese: 几乎没有什么可继续进行的，我们只能猜测发生过的事。

sentences.english: It is mere surmise that Bosch had Brant's poem in mind when doing this painting.
sentences.chinese: 博斯画这幅画时头脑里想着勃朗特的诗，这只是猜测而已。

detailed_translations.english: to guess that something is true, using the information you know already
If you say that a particular conclusion is surmise, you mean that it is a guess based on the available evidence and you do not know for certain that it is true

name: foretell
trans: v. 预言，预测

sentences.english: the birth of Christ, foretold by prophets
sentences.chinese: 先知们所预言的基督的诞生

detailed_translations.english: to say what will happen in the future, especially by using special magical powers

name: foresee
trans: v. 预见，预知

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

name: foresight
trans: n. 先见之明；（枪的）前准星；前视

sentences.english: It was an example of the authorities’ lack of foresight .
sentences.chinese: 这是当权者缺乏远见的一个例证。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先见，远见；预见；深谋远虑
detailed_translations.english: the ability to imagine what is likely to happen and to consider this when planning for the future

name: current
trans: adj. 现行的，当前的；通用的，流行的；最近的 n. 水流，气流；电流；思潮，趋势

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: forecast
trans: v. 预测，预报 n. 预测，预报

sentences.english: The weather forecast is good for tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报说明天是晴天。

sentences.english: Rain was forecast for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 预报周末有雨。

detailed_translations.english: a description of what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now
to make a statement saying what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now

name: disaster
trans: n. 灾难，灾害；祸患，灾难性事物；彻底的失败

sentences.english: One hundred and twenty people died in China’s worst air disaster .
sentences.chinese: 有120人在中国这起最惨烈的空难事故中丧生。

sentences.english: the economic consequences of the Chernobyl nuclear disaster
sentences.chinese: 切尔诺贝利核灾难给经济带来的后果

sentences.english: The 1987 hurricane was the worst natural disaster to hit England for decades.
sentences.chinese: 1987年的飓风是英格兰数十年来遭遇的最为严重的自然灾害。

sentences.english: Their expedition nearly ended in disaster , when one of the climbers slid off the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 一名登山者从山上滑落，他们的探险活动险些以灾难告终。

sentences.english: The drought could spell disaster for wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 干旱可能会对野生生物造成灾难。

sentences.english: Disaster struckwhen two men were killed during their parachute jumps.
sentences.chinese: 灾难突然降临，两名男子在跳伞过程中丧生。

sentences.english: The peace process was on the brink of disaster .
sentences.chinese: 和平进程到了灾难的边缘。

sentences.english: Luckily the pilot saw the other plane just in time, and a disaster was narrowly averted .
sentences.chinese: 幸好驾驶员及时看到了另一架飞机，侥幸避免了一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden event such as a flood, storm, or accident which causes great damage or suffering

name: helpless
trans: adj. 无助的，无奈的；情不自禁的

sentences.english: He began to feel depressed and helpless.
sentences.chinese: 他开始觉得沮丧、无助。

sentences.english: a vicious attack on a helpless victim
sentences.chinese: 对无助受害者的残暴攻击

sentences.english: Newman threw out a hand in a helpless gesture.
sentences.chinese: 纽曼伸出手做了个无助的手势。

detailed_translations.english: unable to look after yourself or to do anything to help yourself

name: disastrous
trans: adj. 灾难性的，使损失惨重的；极失败的，很糟的

sentences.english: a disastrous first marriage
sentences.chinese: 以失败告终的第一次婚姻

sentences.english: The move proved disastrous (= was disastrous ) for the company.
sentences.chinese: 这一行动对公司来说是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: very bad, or ending in failure

name: unfortunately
trans: adv. 不幸地，遗憾地；<正式>不恰当地，不合适地

sentences.english: Unfortunately, you were out when we called.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我们来的时候你出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are mentioning a fact that you wish was not true

name: calamity
trans: n. 灾难，灾祸

sentences.english: It will be a calamity for farmers if the crops fail again.
sentences.chinese: 如果再次歉收，将会给农民带来灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible and unexpected event that causes a lot of damage or suffering

name: holocaust
trans: n. 大屠杀；毁灭

sentences.english: ...an Israeli-based fund for survivors of the Holocaust and their families.
sentences.chinese: …设在以色列的为纳粹大屠杀的幸存者及其家属建立的基金。

detailed_translations.english: the killing of millions of Jews and other people by the Nazis during the Second World War

name: carnage
trans: n. （尤指战争中的）大屠杀，残杀；艰难的局势

sentences.english: a scene of terrible carnage
sentences.chinese: 可怕的大屠杀场面

detailed_translations.english: when a lot of people are killed and injured, especially in a war

name: cataclysm
trans: n. 灾难；大洪水，地震；（社会政治的）大变动

sentences.english: In The Possessed the earth quakes: it is not the catastrophe that befalls the imaginative individual, but a cataclysm in which a large portion of humanity is buried, wiped out forever.
sentences.chinese: 在《魔鬼》中发生了地震，这不仅是降临在富于想象力的人头上的大灾难，而是一大半人类被埋葬于其中、永远被消灭的大地震。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灾难； 大洪水；  大变动
detailed_translations.english: a violent or sudden event or change, such as a serious flood or  earthquake

name: avalanche
trans: n. 雪崩，山崩；突然出现的大量事物；大量崩塌物；（物理）（电子或离子）雪崩 v. 雪崩，山崩；涌入；被雪崩吞没或冲走；（物理）（由于电子雪崩而）电导率突增

sentences.english: Just after the avalanche.
sentences.chinese: 就在这雪崩后不久。

sentences.english: But what if the avalanche happened?
sentences.chinese: 不过，要是发生雪崩怎么办呢？

sentences.english: If the value was much lower than one, on the other hand, the avalanche would soon die out.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，如果结果是一个比一小很多的数字，那么雪崩很快就会停止。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of snow, ice, and rocks that falls down the side of a mountain

name: catastrophe
trans: n. 灾难，灾祸；麻烦，困境；惨败

sentences.english: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 从各个方面来看，战争都会是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible event in which there is a lot of destruction, suffering, or death

name: plague
trans: n. 瘟疫，传染病；鼠疫（尤指腺鼠疫）；（老鼠或昆虫等肆虐造成的）灾害，祸患； 普遍的祸害；烦恼事；<古>愿上天降灾难于……（a plague on） v. 困扰，折磨；烦扰，纠缠；使得灾祸

sentences.english: Financial problems continued to plague the company.
sentences.chinese: 资金问题持续困扰着该公司。

detailed_translations.english: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

name: casualty
trans: n. 伤亡人员；受害者，毁坏物；急诊室，急救室；事故，灾难（主要用于保险中）

sentences.english: We have had our first casualty. One runner has dropped out with cramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有了第一位伤员，有一位队员因腿部痉挛退出了。

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

name: mishap
trans: n. 灾祸；不幸事故；晦气

sentences.english: I had a slight mishap with one of the glasses.
sentences.chinese: 我犯了一个小小的错误，把其中的一个玻璃杯打破了。

name: adversity
trans: n. 逆境，厄运

sentences.english: his courage in the face of adversity
sentences.chinese: 他面对逆境的勇气

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you have a lot of problems that seem to be caused by bad luck

name: afflict
trans: v. 折磨，使痛苦；（天体）相对于（另一天体或黄道上某点）处于应力星位

detailed_translations.english: to affect someone or something in an unpleasant way, and make them suffer

name: defunct
trans: adj. 非现存的，失灵的，不再使用的；死的

sentences.english: the now-defunct nuclear reactor
sentences.chinese: 现已废弃的核反应堆

detailed_translations.english: not existing any more, or not useful any more

name: lethal
trans: adj. 致命的，致死的；危害极大的，破坏性的；极成功的，极有效的

sentences.english: a lethal dose of heroin
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的海洛因

sentences.english: a lethal weapon
sentences.chinese: 致命的武器

sentences.english: death by lethal injection
sentences.chinese: 注入致命剂量造成的死亡

sentences.english: a lethal cocktail of drink and pills
sentences.chinese: 一种酒和药的致命混合物

detailed_translations.english: causing death, or able to cause death

name: deadly
trans: adj. 致命的；极度的；乏味枯燥的；死一般的；阴险毒辣的，冷酷无情的；极有害的，破坏性的；（运动员或其动作）极富技巧性的，极难防御的；极好的，卓越的 adv. 极其；死一般

sentences.english: a deadly poison
sentences.chinese: 致命的毒药

sentences.english: a deadly weapon
sentences.chinese: 致命武器

sentences.english: His face had a deadly paleness.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸死一般的苍白。

detailed_translations.english: likely to cause death

name: demise
trans: n. 倒闭，败落；死亡，逝世；（律）（财产或所有权的）转让，遗赠 v. （律）遗赠，转让（产业）；正式放弃，禅让（最高统治者的头衔）

sentences.english: the mystery surrounding Elena’s untimely demise
sentences.chinese: 埃琳娜猝然早逝之谜

detailed_translations.english: the end of something that used to exist

name: choke
trans: v. 窒息，噎住，卡住；说不出话，哽咽；掐死，扼死；堵塞，塞满；（管子、渠道等）被阻塞，被塞满；失败；阻止，抑制；闷住，扑灭（火等）；窒息，噎住 n. 窒息，噎住的声音；阻气门

sentences.english: I felt as if there was a weight on my chest, choking me.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉好像有重物压在胸口，让我喘不过气来。

sentences.english: The smoke was choking me.
sentences.chinese: 烟呛得我呼吸困难。

sentences.english: Weeds were choking the stream.
sentences.chinese: 野草将溪流堵塞了。

detailed_translations.english: if something chokes you, it makes you unable to breathe properly

name: smother
trans: vt. 使窒息；抑制；（用灰等）闷熄；忍住 vi. 窒息；被抑制；闷死 n. 窒息状态；令人窒息的浓烟

sentences.english: A teenage mother was accused of smothering her 3-month-old daughter.
sentences.chinese: 一个少女妈妈被指控闷死自己三个月大的女儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使窒息；抑制；（用灰等）闷熄；忍住
detailed_translations.english: to kill someone by putting something over their face to stop them breathing

detailed_translations.chinese: 窒息状态；令人窒息的浓烟

name: expire
trans: v. 到期，失效；死亡；呼气，吐气；（任期）届满

sentences.english: My passport expires next week.
sentences.chinese: 我的护照下周就到期了。

sentences.english: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

detailed_translations.english: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

name: mortal
trans: adj. 终有一死的，不能永生的；极其严重的，致命的；至死方休的，不共戴天的；极度的，极其强烈的；死的，临死的；（因罪孽深重而）灵魂无法得救的，不能蒙神恩得宽恕的；<非正式>想像得出的，可能；世间的，凡人的 n. 凡人，普通人；地位（或能力）不如他人者

sentences.english: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的
detailed_translations.english: not able to live for ever
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

name: sedate
trans: adj. 安静的；沉着的 vt. 给……服镇静剂

sentences.english: a sedate seaside town
sentences.chinese: 宁静的海边小镇

sentences.english: The wedding was rather a sedate occasion.
sentences.chinese: 婚礼上气氛庄重。

detailed_translations.english: calm, serious, and formal
to give someone drugs to make them calm or to make them sleep

name: tranquil
trans: adj. 平静的，宁静的

sentences.english: a small tranquil village
sentences.chinese: 宁静的小村庄

detailed_translations.english: pleasantly calm, quiet, and peaceful

name: placid
trans: adj. 平静的；温和的；沉着的

sentences.english: a large, placid baby
sentences.chinese: 一个胖胖的、安静的婴儿

sentences.english: She sat still, placid and waiting.
sentences.chinese: 她安安静静坐着等候。

detailed_translations.english: a placid person does not often get angry or upset and does not usually mind doing what other people want them to

name: static
trans: adj. 静止的，停滞的；静电的；静力的；（计算机）（储存器，储存）静态的；（计算机）（程序，变量）静态的；（物理）（物体）静止的，不动的 n. 静电；（广播、电视里的）静电噪声，静电干扰；<美，非正式>不停的抱怨，指责；静力学

sentences.english: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased.
sentences.chinese: 获得各种资格证书的年轻人的数量一直保持不变或者已经减少。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is static does not move or change
noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

name: serene
trans: adj. 平静的，安详的；清澈的，晴朗的 n. <古>晴空，平静的大海；平静

sentences.english: The child’s face was serene and beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子的神情宁静可爱。

sentences.english: a serene mountain lake
sentences.chinese: 静谧的山间湖泊

detailed_translations.chinese: 平静的；安详的；清澈的；晴朗的
detailed_translations.english: very calm or peaceful

name: serenity
trans: n. 平静，宁静

sentences.english: It was their serenity which galled her most.
sentences.chinese: 最让她恼怒的是他们的平静。

sentences.english: He thought of her serenity as a foil for his intemperance.
sentences.chinese: 在他看来，她的平静反衬出了他的放纵。

sentences.english: He attacks your purity with lust, and he attacks your serenity with worry.
sentences.chinese: 他攻击欲望你的纯度，他用焦虑攻击你的宁平静。

name: still
trans: adv. 还，依旧；仍然，还是（会或可能）；尽管那样，尽管如此；更加，还要（用于表示强调）；还有（更多）；静止地，不动地 adj. 静止的，不动的；宁静的，寂静的；无风的；不含碳酸气的，不起泡的；（照片）静态的，（画面）定格的 n. （电影或录像的）定格画面，剧照；（制酒的）蒸馏器；静止，安静，平静 v. （使）静止，平静，安静；使（感情）减轻，使（感情）平息；蒸馏

sentences.english: I still haven’t finished painting the spare room.
sentences.chinese: 我还没粉刷完那间空房间。

sentences.english: Do you still have Julie’s phone number?
sentences.chinese: 你还留着朱莉的电话号码吗？

detailed_translations.english: up to a particular point in time and continuing at that moment

detailed_translations.chinese: 静止的，不动的；寂静的，平静的；不起泡的
detailed_translations.english: not moving
a photograph of a scene from a film

detailed_translations.chinese: 蒸馏；使…静止；使…平静下来

name: lull
trans: v. 使安静，使昏昏欲睡；使（人）放松警惕，哄骗；（使）减弱，平息，停止 n. 间歇，暂时平静；低谷期

sentences.english: The hum of the tyres on the road lulled her to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 一路上滚滚的车轮声使她昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: There was a lull in political violence after the election of the current president.
sentences.chinese: 现任总统选举结束以后，政治暴力曾暂时平息。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calm or as if they want to sleep
A lull is a period of quiet or calm in a longer period of activity or excitement

name: disgraced
trans: adj. 失宠的；遭贬谪的 v. 耻辱；贬谪（disgrace 的过去式和过去分词）

name: dingy
trans: adj. 昏暗的；肮脏的

sentences.english: a dingy room
sentences.chinese: 阴暗邋遢的房间

sentences.english: a dingy side-street
sentences.chinese: 昏暗肮脏的小街

detailed_translations.english: dark, dirty, and in bad condition

name: messy
trans: adj. 脏的，凌乱的；使脏乱的，使不整洁的；棘手的，令人厌烦的；马虎的，不精确的

sentences.english: a messy room
sentences.chinese: 凌乱的房间

sentences.english: Sorry the place is so messy, I haven’t had time to clear up.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，这地方又脏又乱，我一直没时间打扫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌乱的，散乱的；肮脏的，污秽的；麻烦的
detailed_translations.english: dirty or untidy

name: slovenly
trans: adj. 懒散的；不整洁的；马虎的 adv. 邋遢地；马虎地；不整洁地

sentences.english: slovenly habits
sentences.chinese: 邋里邋遢的习惯

sentences.english: a large slovenly woman
sentences.chinese: 一个身材高大、不修边幅的女人

sentences.english: a slovenly way of speaking
sentences.chinese: 随便的说话方式

detailed_translations.chinese: 懒散的；不整洁的；马虎的
detailed_translations.english: lazy, untidy, and careless

detailed_translations.chinese: 邋遢地；马虎地；不整洁地

name: frowzy
trans: adj. 不整洁的（等于 frowsy）；有臭味的；霉臭的

sentences.english: There were frowzy fields, and cow-houses, and dunghills, and dustheaps, and ditches, and gardens, and summer-houses, and carpet-beating grounds, at the very door of the Railway.
sentences.chinese: 在铁路线开始的地方有霉臭难闻的田野、牛棚、粪堆、垃圾堆、水沟、菜园、凉亭和敲打地毯的场地。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不整洁的（等于frowsy）；有臭味的；霉臭的

name: obscene
trans: adj. 淫秽的，暴力的；道德败坏的，令人厌恶的；（数量等）大得惊人的，骇人听闻的

sentences.english: Bradford made an obscene gesture.
sentences.chinese: 布拉德福德做了个下流手势。

name: considerable
trans: adj. 相当大的，相当重要的；（人）显要的，值得尊敬的

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

name: substantial
trans: adj. 大量的，价值巨大的；牢固的，结实的；基本的，实质性的；（饭菜）丰盛的；重要的，真实的；有地位的，富有的 n. 重要材料

sentences.english: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.english: The document requires substantial changes.
sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可观的， 大量的； 物质的， 坚固的； 实质的， 真实的
detailed_translations.english: large in amount or number

name: grossly
trans: adv. 很；非常

name: extremely
trans: adv. 极度，非常

sentences.english: Earthquakes are extremely difficult to predict.
sentences.chinese: 地震非常难以预测。

sentences.english: I’m extremely sorry to have troubled you.
sentences.chinese: 给你添了麻烦，我十分抱歉。

detailed_translations.english: to a very great degree

name: nearly
trans: adv. 几乎，差不多；密切地，亲密地；即将，就要

sentences.english: It took nearly two hours to get here.
sentences.chinese: 到这里花了将近两小时。

sentences.english: Michelle’s nearly twenty.
sentences.chinese: 米歇尔年近二十。

sentences.english: Is the job nearly finished?
sentences.chinese: 这工作快干完了吗？

sentences.english: Louise is nearly as tall as her mother.
sentences.chinese: 路易丝差不多和她母亲一样高。

sentences.english: I nearly always go home for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我几乎总是回家吃午饭。

sentences.english: He very nearly died.
sentences.chinese: 他差点送命。

detailed_translations.english: almost, but not quite or not completely

name: virtually
trans: adv. 事实上，几乎；虚拟地，模拟地

sentences.english: Virtually all the children come to school by bus.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的孩子都乘公交车上学。

sentences.english: He was virtually unknown before running for office.
sentences.chinese: 他在参加竞选之前几乎不为人知。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: hardly
trans: adv. 几乎不，几乎没有；刚刚，才；几乎无法；差不多，大约；<古>严厉的，苛刻的

sentences.english: My parents divorced when I was six, and I hardly knew my father.
sentences.chinese: 我六岁时父母离婚，我对父亲几乎一无所知。

sentences.english: The children were so excited they could hardly speak.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们兴奋得几乎连话都说不出来了。

sentences.english: I can hardly believe it.
sentences.chinese: 这简直让我难以置信。

sentences.english: (= almost no one ) writes to me these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今几乎没有人给我写信了。

sentences.english: Dad ate hardly anything (= almost nothing ).
sentences.chinese: 爸爸几乎没吃什么东西。

sentences.english: There was hardly any (= very little ) traffic.
sentences.chinese: 路上车少人稀。

sentences.english: She lives in Spain, so we hardly ever (= almost never ) see her.
sentences.chinese: 她住在西班牙，所以我们几乎见不到她。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: barely
trans: adv. 勉强才能；几乎不，几乎没有；刚刚；仅仅，只有；贫乏地，光秃秃；<古>公开地，不加掩饰地

sentences.english: She was barely aware of his presence.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎没有注意到他的存在。

sentences.english: Joe and his brother are barely on speaking terms.
sentences.chinese: 乔和他哥哥几乎不说话。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: profoundly
trans: adv. 极大地，深刻地；严重地，完全地

sentences.english: As he cuddles with her, it feels like he’s doing the same with me — that’s how profoundly I feel we are all intertwined.
sentences.chinese: 当他搂住她的时候，感觉就像是他也在搂着我——这就是为什么我感到我们被深深地羁绊住了。

name: clean
trans: adj. 洁净的，干净的；（人或动物）讲卫生的，爱干净的；无污染的，不引起污染的；（气味、味道、颜色）清新的；（名声、履历）无污点的，清白的；公正的，遵守规则的；<非正式>未私带武器（或毒品等违禁品）的；没吸毒的，没喝酒的；健康的， 正派的；文明的，无色情的；（形状）规则的，简洁的，边缘平滑的；迅速彻底的；（行动）干净利落的；空白的，未写过的；（文件）无错误的；（木材）无树节的；（摩西律法等类似宗教法典规定的）不亵渎宗教仪式的；未感染的 v. （使）清洁，清理；变干净；做清洁工；干洗；（烹饪前）清除（动物）内脏 n. 清洁，清扫，打扫 adv. 干净地，纯洁地；彻底地，完全地

sentences.english: Are your hands clean?
sentences.chinese: 你的手干净吗？

sentences.english: clean towels
sentences.chinese: 干净的毛巾

sentences.english: Make sure you keep the wound clean .
sentences.chinese: 一定要保持伤口清洁。

sentences.english: Wipe that sink clean when you’re done.
sentences.chinese: 洗完后将水槽擦干净。

sentences.english: As usual, she left her room clean and tidy before going to school.
sentences.chinese: 和往常一样，她去上学之前把房间收拾得干干净净。

sentences.english: a spotlessly clean kitchen
sentences.chinese: 一尘不染的厨房

sentences.english: Oh, don’t get mad - it’s just good clean fun !
sentences.chinese: 噢，不要生气——这不过是个正经的玩笑嘛！

detailed_translations.english: without any dirt, marks etc

name: entirely
trans: adv. 完全地，完整地；仅仅，只

sentences.english: Our situation is entirely different.
sentences.chinese: 我们的处境完全不同。

sentences.english: The ridge consists entirely of volcanic rock.
sentences.chinese: 这处山脊完全由火山岩构成。

sentences.english: Her reasons were not entirely clear.
sentences.chinese: 她的理由不是很明确。

detailed_translations.english: completely and in every possible way

name: utterly
trans: adv. 完全地，彻底地

sentences.english: You look utterly miserable.
sentences.chinese: 你看起来很痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: completely – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong

name: somewhat
trans: adv. 稍微，有点 pron. 几分；某物

sentences.english: Things have changed somewhat since then.
sentences.chinese: 从那时候起，情况就有些不一样了。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little but not very

name: fairly
trans: adv. 相当地，颇；公平地，公正地；<旧>（用以强调）完全，简直；令人愉快地，让人喜欢地

sentences.english: The house had a fairly large garden.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子有个不小的花园。

sentences.english: She speaks English fairly well.
sentences.chinese: 她英语讲得还不错。

sentences.english: I felt I hadn’t been treated fairly.
sentences.chinese: 我感到自己没有受到公正对待。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little, but much less than very

name: absolute
trans: adj. 完全的，纯粹的；绝对的，无疑的；十足的；不受任何限制的，专制独裁的；（结构）独立的 n. 绝对真理，绝对原则

sentences.english: I have absolute confidence in her.
sentences.chinese: 我对她充满信心。

sentences.english: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。

sentences.english: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。

sentences.english: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: complete or total

name: radical
trans: adj. 根本的，彻底的；激进的，极端的；全新的，不同凡响的；（增减）急剧的，大幅度的；（人，物）原本的，与生俱来的；<美，非正式>顶呱呱的；（外科，医疗）根治的；<英，史>（19世纪）自由党激进派的；（数）根式的，根号的；词根的；（植）根生的 n. 激进分子； 游离基，自由基；词根；（汉字）偏旁，部首；（数）根式；根号

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根本的，基本的；激进的，激进派的
detailed_translations.english: a radical change or difference is very big and important
someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

name: sheer
trans: adj. （用于强调）纯粹的，完全的；程度深的，数量大的；陡峭的，垂直的；（织物等）极薄的，透明的 adv. 垂直地，陡峭地；<古>彻底地，完全地 v. 急转弯，突然转向；避开（不愉快的话题） n. 精纺（或透明）织物（或物品）；（尤指船）突然偏航，突然转向；（船首及船尾处的）舷弧

sentences.english: cliffs which rose sheer from the sea
sentences.chinese: 从海面垂直拔起的悬崖

detailed_translations.english: straight up or down in an almost vertical line
to change direction suddenly, especially in order to avoid something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全的，十足的；陡峭的，垂直的；极薄的，透明的
detailed_translations.english: a sheer drop, cliff, slope etc is very steep and almost vertical

name: pure
trans: adj. 纯的，不掺杂质的；血统纯的，纯种的；纯真的，贞洁的；干净的，不含有害物质的；无杂色的，清晰而优美的；完全的，纯粹的；（科学或研究）纯理论的，抽象的；（元音）单音的，纯音的

sentences.english: rings made of pure gold
sentences.chinese: 纯金制成的戒指

sentences.english: Our beef patties are 100% pure.
sentences.chinese: 我们的牛肉饼是100%的纯牛肉。

sentences.english: His motives were pure.
sentences.chinese: 他动机纯正。

detailed_translations.english: not mixed with anything else; with nothing added

name: unblemished
trans: adj. 无缺点的；清白的

sentences.english: a law firm with an unblemished reputation
sentences.chinese: 声誉良好的律师事务所

detailed_translations.english: not spoiled by any mistake or bad behaviour

name: innocent
trans: adj. 天真的，幼稚的；清白的，无罪的；无辜受害的；没有恶意的，无冒犯之意的 n. 天真无邪的人，幼稚的人；无辜的受害者（尤指犯罪或战争的受害者）

sentences.english: Nobody would believe that I was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 没人肯相信我是清白的。

sentences.english: The court found him innocent and he was released.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判他无罪，他被释放了。

sentences.english: She had always regarded Greg as a hopeless innocent where women were concerned.
sentences.chinese: 她过去一直认为格雷格在关于女人方面是一个不可救药的无知者。

detailed_translations.english: not guilty of a crime
An innocent is someone who is innocent

name: impeccable
trans: adj. 无瑕疵的，没有缺点的；<罕>（神学）不会犯罪过的

sentences.english: She has taught her children impeccable manners.
sentences.chinese: 她把她的孩子教育得举止十分得体。

sentences.english: a bar with impeccable service
sentences.chinese: 服务无可挑剔的酒吧

detailed_translations.english: without any faults and impossible to criticize

name: perfect
trans: adj. 无瑕的，完好的；完全正确的，极其准确的；完美的，理想的；最佳的，绝配的；十足的，完全的；通常的，大体的；（语法）完成时的，完成式的；（数字）完全的；（花）有雌雄蕊的；（昆虫）性成熟的；（真菌）有性孢子形成阶段的，有性的；完成时的，完成式的 v. 完善，使完美；双面印完（一页纸）；<法律>使（礼物、头衔等）合法转移 n. （语法）完成时，完成体

sentences.chinese: 他的英语很地道。

sentences.english: The car was in perfect condition.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车的车况极佳。

sentences.english: You’re very lucky to have perfect teeth.
sentences.chinese: 你能拥有一口完美的牙齿太幸运了。

sentences.english: a perfect performance
sentences.chinese: 完美的演出

sentences.english: In a perfect world, we wouldn’t need an army.
sentences.chinese: 在理想世界中，我们不需要军队。

detailed_translations.english: not having any mistakes, faults, or damage

name: virtuous
trans: adj. 道德高尚的，品行端正的；自命清高的，自鸣得意的；<旧>（尤指妇女）贞洁的；有效力的

sentences.english: a virtuous man
sentences.chinese: 品行端正的男子

sentences.english: Sue considered herself very virtuous because she neither drank nor smoked.
sentences.chinese: 休认为自己品行非常端正，因为她既不喝酒也不抽烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 善良的；有道德的；贞洁的；正直的；有效力的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a very honest and moral way

name: chaste
trans: adj. 纯洁的；贞洁的；有道德的；朴素的 n. （Chaste）人名；（法）沙斯特

sentences.english: She led a chaste decent life.
sentences.chinese: 她过着贞洁正派的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纯洁的；贞洁的；有道德的；朴素的
detailed_translations.english: not having sex with anyone, or not with anyone except your husband or wife

name: colossal
trans: adj. 巨大的，庞大的；异常的，非常的；（建筑）（柱型）不止一层柱的，多层柱的；（雕像）至少有真人两倍大的

sentences.english: a colossal statue of the King
sentences.chinese: 国王的巨大雕像

sentences.english: This whole holiday was a colossal waste of money.
sentences.chinese: 这次度假浪费了大量的钱财。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is extremely large

name: spacious
trans: adj. （房间或建筑物）宽敞的；无边无际的

sentences.english: a spacious living area
sentences.chinese: 宽敞的居住空间

detailed_translations.english: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in

name: expansive
trans: adj. 广阔的；广泛的；扩张的，发展的；开朗的，健谈的

sentences.english: expansive beaches
sentences.chinese: 广阔的海滩

sentences.english: She flung her arms out in an expansive gesture.
sentences.chinese: 她尽情地张开双臂。

detailed_translations.english: very large in area, or using a lot of space

name: prodigious
trans: adj. （范围，规模，程度）巨大的，庞大的

sentences.english: the artist’s prodigious output
sentences.chinese: 那位艺术家惊人的高产

detailed_translations.chinese: 惊人的，异常的，奇妙的；巨大的
detailed_translations.english: very large or great in a surprising or impressive way

name: massive
trans: adj. 大而重的，结实的；非常严重的；大量的，大规模的；<非正式>特别成功的，非常有影响的；（岩石或地层）均匀构造的，大块的；（矿物）外观非晶质的；<英，非正式>极好的，非常妙的 n. <英，非正式>（某一地区的年轻人群体）嬉蹦音乐迷（或丛林爵士音乐迷）

sentences.english: The bell is massive, weighing over 40 tons.
sentences.chinese: 那口钟非常大，有40多吨重。

sentences.english: the castle’s massive walls
sentences.chinese: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

detailed_translations.chinese: (尺寸、数量、规模) 非常大的
detailed_translations.english: very large in size, quantity, or extent

name: enormous
trans: adj. 巨大的，极大的；<古>凶暴的，极恶的

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

name: mighty
trans: adj. 强大的，巨大的；（动作）用力的，需用力的 adv. 很，非常，十分

sentences.english: the mighty Mississippi river
sentences.chinese: 浩荡的密西西比河

sentences.english: a mighty army
sentences.chinese: 强大的军队

detailed_translations.chinese: 有力的；强有力的；有势力的
detailed_translations.english: very strong and powerful, or very big and impressive
very

name: vast
trans: adj. 巨大的，广大的 n. <古>广阔空间

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: tremendous
trans: adj. 巨大的，极大的；极好的，精彩的；令人望而生畏的，可怕的

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

name: immense
trans: adj. 极大的，巨大的；非常好，极好；无边无际的

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: titanic
trans: adj. 极强大的；极重要的；巨大的；四价钛的 n. （Titanic）泰坦尼克号

sentences.english: a titanic struggle
sentences.chinese: 大搏斗

detailed_translations.english: very big, strong, impressive etc

name: commodious
trans: adj. 宽敞的；方便的

sentences.english: The students' cupboards are very commodious.
sentences.chinese: 学生们的橱柜非常宽敞。

sentences.english: Accidentally, I came across a cicada slough. I was really content with its commodious and safe place.
sentences.chinese: 无意中找到了一只蝉蜕，它壳内宽敞又安全的空间让我十分满意。

sentences.english: Open whereas commodious yard outside can serve as privately owned outdoors ground, also can become privately owned temporary parking lot for banquet guests.
sentences.chinese: 空旷而宽敞的庭院外，可作为私家户外休闲活动的场地，亦可成为私家宴会的客宾临时停车场。

detailed_translations.english: a house or room that is commodious is very big

name: broad
trans: adj. 宽广的，宽阔的；……宽；咧开嘴的；广泛的，普遍的；大致的，概括的；明确的，明显的；粗俗滑稽的；口音重的 n. <美>女人，娘儿们；宽阔部分 adv. 宽阔地

sentences.english: We went along a broad passage.
sentences.chinese: 我们走在一条宽阔的走廊上。

sentences.english: He was six feet tall, with broad shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 他身高六英尺，肩膀宽阔。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: becoming
trans: adj. 相配的；合适的；得体的 n. （变化过程的）形成，发生 v. 开始变得；成长为；取得资格；适合（某人）；使（人）显得漂亮（become 的现在分词）

name: reliable
trans: adj. 可靠的，可信赖的；真实可信的，确凿的；（汽车、设备、系统等）耐用的，性能稳定的 n. 可靠的人（或物）

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: preferable
trans: adj. 更好的，更合适的

sentences.english: Anything was preferable to the tense atmosphere at home.
sentences.chinese: 什么都比家里的紧张气氛好。

sentences.english: In warm weather, clothes made of natural fabrics are infinitely preferable (= much better ) .
sentences.chinese: 天气暖和的时候，穿天然织物的衣服要舒适得多。

detailed_translations.english: better or more suitable

name: available
trans: adj. 可用的，可获得的；有空的，有闲暇的；未婚的，单身的

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

name: competent
trans: adj. 能干的，能胜任的；合格的，过得去的；精神正常的，智力无缺陷的；有决定权的；有法定资格的；活性的，（处于）感受态的

sentences.english: A competent mechanic should be able to fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 一名合格的机修工应该能够解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

name: fit
trans: v. 适合，合身；适应，合得来；可容纳，装进；试穿（衣服）；和……相称，符合；为放置（于……）而设计；安置，安装（在某处）；安排时间会面，安排时间做（某事）；（疾病）发作 adj. 健康的，健壮的；合适的，适当的；合格的，胜任的；<俚>性感的；<非正式>快要，就要 n. 适合，合身；匹配，相配；痉挛，昏厥；一阵，突发

sentences.english: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child.
sentences.chinese: 这些腰带、和服和其他衣服都做得适合孩子穿。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it

name: fitting
trans: n. 配件，附件；试穿，试衣；可移动的定位安装家具；安装，装配 adj. 合适的，恰当的 v. 可容纳，装进；和……相称，符合；（疾病）发作（fit 的现在分词）

sentences.english: I thought the memorial was a fitting tribute to the President.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这座纪念碑恰如其分地表达了对总统的敬意。

sentences.english: new light fittings
sentences.chinese: 新款灯具配件

detailed_translations.english: right for a particular situation or occasion
an outside part of a piece of equipment that makes it possible to use or handle it

name: feasible
trans: adj. 可行的，办得到的；很可能会发生的

sentences.english: a feasible solution
sentences.chinese: 可行的解决方法

detailed_translations.english: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work

name: expedient
trans: adj. 权宜的；方便的；有利的 n. 权宜之计；应急手段

sentences.english: This solution is politically expedient but may well cause long-term problems.
sentences.chinese: 这种解决方法是政治上的权宜之计，但会引起长远的问题。

detailed_translations.english: helping you to deal with a problem quickly and effectively although sometimes in a way that is not morally right
a quick and effective way of dealing with a problem

name: pertinent
trans: adj. 切题的，相关的

sentences.english: He asked me a lot of very pertinent questions .
sentences.chinese: 他问了我许多直接相关的问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相关的，相干的；中肯的；切题的
detailed_translations.english: directly relating to something that is being considered

name: temperate
trans: adj. 温带的，（气候）温和的；（行为）温和的，有节制的

sentences.english: The Nile Valley keeps a temperate climate throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 尼罗河流域全年气候温和。

detailed_translations.chinese: 温和的；适度的；有节制的
detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is temperate is calm and sensible

name: suitable
trans: adj. 适宜的，合适的

sentences.english: We are hoping to find a suitable school.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望能找到一所合适的学校。

detailed_translations.english: having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation

name: plausible
trans: adj. 似乎是真的，貌似有理的；（人）花言巧语的，貌似可信的；可靠的，可重用的

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

name: methodical
trans: adj. 有条理的，做事有条不紊的

sentences.english: She’s a very methodical person.
sentences.chinese: 她是个办事很有条理的人。

sentences.english: He had a neat, methodical mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的思路清晰有条理。

detailed_translations.english: a methodical person always does things carefully, using an ordered system

name: entitled
trans: adj. 有资格的 v. 使享有权利；给……命名（或题名）（entitle 的过去式和过去分词）

name: correspondence
trans: n. 信件，信函；通信；相似，关联

sentences.english: The magazine is unable to enter into any correspondence on medical matters.
sentences.chinese: 本杂志无法答复有关医学方面的来信。

sentences.english: All correspondence between us must cease.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间的所有通信必须停止。

detailed_translations.english: the process of sending and receiving letters

name: propriety
trans: n. <正式>（行为，道德）正当，得体；<正式>行为规范，礼节（proprieties）

sentences.english: strict in observing the proprieties
sentences.chinese: 严格遵守礼节的

detailed_translations.english: correctness of social or moral behaviour

name: tally
trans: n. 记录，得分；账单；<史>符木；（对树或植物进行说明的）标志牌，标签 v. 相符，吻合；计算，合计；（在游戏或体育运动中）得分，进球

sentences.english: They do not keep a tally of visitors to the palace, but it is very popular.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有对来宫殿的游客作一个记录，不过这个地方非常受欢迎的。

detailed_translations.english: A tally is a record of amounts or numbers which you keep changing and adding to as the activity which affects it progresses
if numbers or statements tally, they match exactly

name: coincide
trans: v. 巧合，同时发生；一致，相符；相交，重叠

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: suit
trans: n. 套装，西装；（从事特定活动时穿的）成套服装；诉讼；同花色的一组纸牌；<非正式>（企业或机构中的）高级管理人员；一套蓬帆；追求（常指求婚）；<文>（向当权者提出的）请愿，请求 v. （服装、风格、颜色）使显得漂亮，与……相配；对（某人）方便，满足（某人）需要，合（某人）心意；适合，适宜；随自己的意愿，随性子；<美>（尤指为特定的活动）穿衣

sentences.english: Johnson has filed suit against her.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊对她提起了诉讼。

sentences.english: a civil suit
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼

sentences.english: There are countryside walks to suit everyone.
sentences.chinese: 有适合每个人的乡村步行路径。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

name: advisable
trans: adj. 明智的，可取的

sentences.english: I deem it advisable to buy property now.
sentences.chinese: 我认为现在购置房地产是明智的。

sentences.english: It would't be advisable for us to kiss off their objections.
sentences.chinese: 对人家的意见不予理睬是不明智的。

name: adapt
trans: v. 适应；调整，使适合；改编；改造，改装

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: adaptable
trans: adj. 能适应的，适应性强的；可改变（以适应新用途）的

sentences.english: The American Constitution has proved adaptable in changing political conditions.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明美国宪法能适应政治形势的变化。

detailed_translations.english: able to change in order to be successful in new and different situations

name: adaptation
trans: n. 改编本，改写本；适应，改变；适应（性），适应力；适应性变化

sentences.english: Branagh won two awards for his screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.
sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适应；改编；改编本，改写本
detailed_translations.english: a film or television programme that is based on a book or play

name: conformity
trans: n. 遵守，依照；随大流，循规蹈矩；符合，一致；信奉英国国教

sentences.english: We must act in conformity with local regulations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须按当地的法规行事。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that obeys rules, customs etc

name: incisive
trans: adj. 深刻的；敏锐的；锋利的

sentences.english: He is a very shrewd operator with an incisive mind.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位非常精明的经营者，有着敏锐的头脑。

detailed_translations.english: You use incisive to describe a person, their thoughts, or their speech when you approve of their ability to think and express their ideas clearly, briefly, and forcefully

name: caustic
trans: adj. [化学] 腐蚀性的；[化学] 苛性的；刻薄的；焦散的 n. [助剂] 腐蚀剂；苛性钠；焦散曲线

sentences.english: caustic soda (= a chemical used for cleaning things )
sentences.chinese: 苛性钠，烧碱

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 腐蚀性的；[化学] 苛性的；刻薄的；焦散的
detailed_translations.english: a caustic substance can burn through things by chemical action

detailed_translations.chinese: [助剂] 腐蚀剂；苛性钠；焦散曲线

name: acid
trans: n. 酸；<非正式>迷幻药；尖刻（或尖酸）的言语（或语调）；质子供体，电子对受体 adj. 酸的；酸性的；尖酸的，刻薄的；（颜色）刺目的，鲜亮的；（岩石，尤指熔岩）含相当量硅石的

sentences.english: sulphuric acid
sentences.chinese: 硫酸

sentences.english: a juicy apple with a slightly acid flavour
sentences.chinese: 一个多汁、略带酸味的苹果

sentences.english: I was expecting another of his acid remarks, but he remained silent.
sentences.chinese: 我等着他再说一句刻薄的话，但他不吭声了。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that has a  pH  of less than 7. Strong acids can burn holes in material or damage your skin
having a sharp sour taste

name: acrimonious
trans: adj. 讥讽的；（言辞、辩论）激烈的，尖刻的

sentences.english: The meeting ended in an acrimonious dispute.
sentences.chinese: 会议在激烈的辩论中结束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖酸刻薄的， 激烈的
detailed_translations.english: an acrimonious meeting or discussion is one in which people argue a lot and get very angry

name: acrid
trans: adj. （气味）辛辣的，苦的；刻薄的

sentences.english: a cloud of acrid smoke
sentences.chinese: 一团刺鼻的烟雾

detailed_translations.english: an acrid smell or taste is strong and unpleasant and stings your nose or throat

name: acrimony
trans: n. 辛辣；尖刻；严厉

sentences.english: Now, with an agreement put on the table, talks have broken down in acrimony .
sentences.chinese: 现在，当一份协议摆到了桌面上，对话却在尖酸刻薄中停止。

sentences.english: The Jesuits in a phase of ascendancy, persecuted and insulted the Buddhists with great acrimony .
sentences.chinese: 处于地位上升阶段的耶稣会修士迫害佛教徒，用尖刻的语言辱骂他们。

name: cunning
trans: adj. 狡猾的，诡诈的；灵巧的，巧妙的；<美>可爱的，好看的 n. 狡猾，诡诈；灵巧，巧妙

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: elegant
trans: adj. （人）高雅的，举止优雅的；精美的，雅致的；简练的，巧妙的

sentences.english: a tall, elegant young woman
sentences.chinese: 身材高挑、举止优雅的年轻女子

sentences.english: You can dine in elegant surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在雅致的环境中进餐。

detailed_translations.english: beautiful, attractive, or graceful

name: handy
trans: adj. 有用的，方便的，便于使用的；手巧的，有手艺的；手边的，附近的

sentences.english: It’s quite a handy little tool.
sentences.chinese: 这件小工具非常有用。

sentences.english: It’s very handy having a light above your desk.
sentences.chinese: 书桌上方有盏灯很有用。

sentences.english: Take your swimming trunks with you – they might come in handy (= be useful ).
sentences.chinese: 带上你的游泳裤，可能会派上用场的。

detailed_translations.english: useful

name: ingenious
trans: adj. 灵巧的，有独创性的；精巧的，巧妙的

sentences.english: an ingenious device
sentences.chinese: 精巧的装置

sentences.english: an ingenious cook
sentences.chinese: 心灵手巧的厨师

detailed_translations.english: (of an object, a plan, an idea, etc.) very suitable for a particular purpose and resulting from clever new ideas

name: exquisite
trans: adj. 精致的，精美的；剧烈的；细致的，有鉴赏力的 n. 花花公子

sentences.english: the most exquisite craftsmanship
sentences.chinese: 最精美的工艺

detailed_translations.chinese: 精致的；细腻的；优美的，高雅的；异常的；剧烈的
detailed_translations.english: extremely beautiful and very delicately made

name: delicate
trans: adj. 柔和的，清淡的；虚弱的，纤弱的；脆弱的，易碎的；小巧玲珑的，纤细的；微妙的，棘手的；精致的，精巧的；灵巧的，熟练的；（仪器）灵敏的 n. 精美的衣物

sentences.english: his delicate hands
sentences.chinese: 他纤细的手

sentences.english: delicate hand-cut glass
sentences.chinese: 易碎的手工刻花玻璃

sentences.english: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin .
sentences.chinese: 阳光很容易晒伤小孩娇嫩的皮肤。

detailed_translations.english: small and having a beautiful shape or appearance

name: refined
trans: adj. 精炼的；有教养的，文雅的；精确的，灵活巧妙的 v. 精炼，提纯；改进，改善；使……文雅（refine 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: a refined way of speaking
sentences.chinese: 优雅的谈吐

detailed_translations.chinese: [油气][化工][冶] 精炼的；精确的；微妙的；有教养的
detailed_translations.english: a substance that is refined has been made pure by an industrial process

name: dexterous
trans: adj. 灵巧的；敏捷的；惯用右手的

sentences.english: dextrous use of the needle
sentences.chinese: 灵巧的针法

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵巧的；敏捷的；惯用右手的
detailed_translations.english: skilful and quick when using your hands

name: crafty
trans: adj. 狡猾的；灵巧的

sentences.english: He’s a crafty old devil.
sentences.chinese: 他是个狡猾的老家伙。

detailed_translations.english: good at getting what you want by clever planning and by secretly deceiving people

name: elaborate
trans: adj. 复杂的，详尽的；精心制作的 v. 详细说明，详尽阐述；精心制作

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: remote
trans: adj. 边远的，偏僻的；（距离或空间上）遥远的；（时间上）久远的；（机会或可能性）渺茫的；差别很大的，很不相同的；不友好的，冷漠的；远亲关系的；（电子设备）遥控的；（计算机）远程的，远程连接的 n. 遥控装置，遥控器

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: distant
trans: adj. 遥远的，久远的；冷淡的；心不在焉的；远亲的；不相似的，不同的

sentences.english: the sound of distant gunfire
sentences.chinese: 远处的炮火声

sentences.english: Her honeymoon seemed a distant memory.
sentences.chinese: 她的蜜月似乎成了遥远的记忆。

sentences.english: That affair was in the dim and distant past (= a long time ago ) .
sentences.chinese: 那件事已成为遥远的过去了。

sentences.english: The President hopes to visit Ireland in the not too distant future (= quite soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统希望在不久的将来访问爱尔兰。

sentences.english: After the quarrel Sue remained cold and distant.
sentences.chinese: 那次争吵之后，休一直冷淡疏远。

detailed_translations.english: far away in space or time

name: gap
trans: n. 缝隙，缺口；（时间上的）间隔；空白，缺漏；隔阂，差距

sentences.english: ...the gap between rich and poor.
sentences.chinese: …贫富差距。

detailed_translations.english: a big difference between two situations, amounts, groups of people etc

name: proximity
trans: n. （时间、空间、关系的）靠近，亲近

sentences.english: Here the rich and the poor live in close proximity (= very near to each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 在这里，富人和穷人比邻而居。

detailed_translations.english: nearness in distance or time

name: distribute
trans: v. 分发，分配；配送，分销；散布，使分布；（印刷）拆（版）还字；周延

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: adjacent
trans: adj. 邻近的，毗连的；（几何）（两个角）相邻的

sentences.english: We stayed in adjacent rooms.

trans: n. 入口，通道；获得的机会，使用权；（对计算机存储器的）访问，存取；（情感）爆发，发作；探视权 v. 接近，进入；获取，访问（计算机信息） adj. <美>（电视节目或时间等）对外公开的

trans: adj. 邻接的；毗连的 v. 邻接（adjoin 的 ing 形式）

trans: adv. 无疑，肯定

sentences.chinese: 这种旅行方式当然有它们的长处所在，但毫无疑问也有一些缺憾。

trans: v. 查明，确定

sentences.english: an empty bottle

sentences.chinese: 书桌后面的空位

detailed_translations.english: having nothing inside

trans: adj. （地方）空着的，无人用的；（职位，工作）空缺的；茫然的，失神的

trans: n. 空间，空白，空虚；空虚感，失落感；（墙、建筑物上的）孔隙；（桥牌和惠斯特用语）缺门 adj. 不合法的，无效的；（话语，行动）无效的，无用的；毫无……的，缺乏……的；空的，空空如也的；<正式>（职位）空缺；（桥牌和惠斯特用语）缺门的 v. 使无效，使作废；排泄，排放（大小便）；排放（水、气体等）；倒空（容器），疏空（空间）

detailed_translations.chinese: 空虚感，寂寞感；真空，空白

to make a contract or agreement void so that it has no legal effect

trans: n. 真空，真空容器；真空吸尘器；空白，空虚；（用真空吸尘器所做的）清洁，清扫 v. 用真空吸尘器打扫 adj. 利用真空的；真空的；产生真空的

sentences.chinese: 我今天用吸尘器清洁地毯了。

trans: adj. 陈腐的；平庸的 v. 出租（马匹、马车等）；役使（hackney 的过去式）

sentences.english: Power corrupts and absolute power corrupts absolutely. That's the old hackneyed phrase, but it's true.

detailed_translations.chinese: 出租（马匹、马车等）；役使（hackney的过去式）

name: universal
trans: adj. 普遍的，全体的，全世界的；通用的，万能的；（逻）全称的，总称的 n. 普遍原则，通用原理；普遍看法，普遍特征；（逻）全称命题；（哲）普遍，一般概念；（哲）共相；（语言学）普遍现象，通用规则

sentences.chinese: 这些故事人人都喜欢。

sentences.english: a topic of universal interest
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍感兴趣的一个话题

sentences.english: a universal truth
sentences.chinese: 普遍的真理

detailed_translations.chinese: 宇宙的，全世界的；普遍的
detailed_translations.english: involving everyone in the world or in a particular group

name: catholic
trans: adj. 广泛的，包罗万象的；天主教的（Catholic） n. 天主教教徒

sentences.english: She has catholic tastes (= likes a lot of different things ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的兴趣非常广泛。

sentences.english: a catholic collection of records
sentences.chinese: 包罗万象的唱片收藏

sentences.english: At least nine out of ten Mexicans are baptized Catholics.
sentences.chinese: 至少十分之九的墨西哥人是受过洗礼的天主教徒。

detailed_translations.english: including a very wide variety of things
