name: general
trans: adj. 总体的，普遍的；一般的，常规的；大致的，大概的；综合的，广泛的；首席的，总管的 n. 上将，将军；半军事化管理的宗教组织（如耶稣会修士、多明我会修士或救世军）的领袖；<古>大众，公众

sentences.english: There has been a general decline in standards.
sentences.chinese: 道德水准普遍下降。

sentences.english: ways to improve your general health
sentences.chinese: 全面提高身体素质的方法

sentences.english: There is one exception to this general principle.
sentences.chinese: 这个一般性原则有一例外

sentences.english: a four-star general
sentences.chinese: 四星上将

detailed_translations.english: affecting all or most people, places or things
an officer of very high rank in the army or air force

name: generally
trans: adv. 笼统地，大概；通常，普遍地

sentences.english: Generally speaking, the more expensive the stereo, the better it is.
sentences.chinese: 一般说来，立体声音响越贵的越好。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that is true in most cases but not always

name: exhaustive
trans: adj. 详尽的，彻底的；消耗的

sentences.english: an exhaustive investigation
sentences.chinese: 彻底的调查

sentences.english: The list is by no means exhaustive.

detailed_translations.english: extremely thorough and complete

name: average
trans: n. 平均水平，一般标准；平均数，平均值；（海损的）平均分担；（按保单规定应付赔偿额的）降减，均减 adj. 普通的，平常的；不好不坏的；平均（数）的；中等的，适中的 v. 平均为，平均达到；计算平均值；将……平均分配；（行情下跌时）买进更多的证券（或商品）以降低平均进价

trans: adv. 多半，主要地；几乎全部，几乎所有

trans: adv. 通常地，经常地

sentences.chinese: 女人通常比男人长寿。

sentences.english: Usually I wear black, grey, or brown.

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about what happens on most occasions or in most situations

name: commonplace
trans: adj. 平凡的，不足为奇的；平庸的，陈腐的 n. 司空见惯的事，常见的东西；老生常谈，陈词滥调

sentences.english: Car thefts are commonplace in this part of town.
sentences.chinese: 镇上的这个地段盗车案屡见不鲜。

sentences.english: It is a commonplace to say that Northern Ireland is a backwater in the modern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 说北爱尔兰是现代欧洲死气沉沉的落后地区已是陈词滥调了。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in many places, and therefore not special or unusual
something that has been said so often that it is no longer interesting or original

name: tender
trans: adj. 温柔的，亲切的；（食物）嫩的，软的；年幼的，未成熟的；（身体部位）易痛的，一触即痛的；（植物）纤弱的，娇嫩的；微妙的，棘手的；（航海）易倾斜的，不稳的 v. <正式>提出，提供；投标；付钱，偿还；出价购买（股票等）；使变脆弱；<古>温柔地对待 n. 投标，投标书；<英>（期货交易中的）交割意向通知书；（尤指挂在火车头后的）煤水车；（在大船和口岸之间载运人或货物的）供应船，补给船；（装有特别设备的）辅助救火车；服务车，辅助车辆；照料人，照管人；<美，非正式>（通常裹有面包屑的）炸鸡块

sentences.english: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
sentences.chinese: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嫩的；脆弱的；疼痛的，一触即痛的；温柔的
detailed_translations.english: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
to formally offer or show something to someone
a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

name: concrete
trans: adj. 确实的，具体的；实在的，有形的；混凝土的；物质的 n. 混凝土 v. 用混凝土覆盖（或做成）；<旧>（使）凝固，（使）凝结；使真实（化），使具体（化）

sentences.english: What does that mean in concrete terms ?
sentences.chinese: 具体来说那到底是什么意思？

sentences.english: the lack of any concrete evidence
sentences.chinese: 缺少具体证据的

sentences.english: a dialogue about concrete issues and problems
sentences.chinese: 有关具体事情和问题的对话

detailed_translations.english: definite and specific

name: portable
trans: adj. 便携式的，轻便的；可移植的，可在不同计算机上使用的；（变更工作或情景时）可转移的，可随带的 n. 手提式电器；<美>活动教室

sentences.english: a portable radio
sentences.chinese: 便携式收音机

detailed_translations.english: able to be carried or moved easily

name: sloppy
trans: adj. 马虎的，草率的；（衣服）宽松的，肥大的；太稀的，不够稠的；庸俗伤感的，过分动情的

sentences.english: Ann was dressed in a sloppy brown sweater.
sentences.chinese: 安穿了一件邋遢的棕色羊毛衫。

detailed_translations.english: sloppy clothes are loose-fitting, untidy, or dirty

name: congested
trans: adj. 堵塞的，拥挤的 v. 挤满；超负荷（congest 的过去分词）

sentences.english: congested airspace
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的空域

sentences.english: London’s roads are heavily congested (= very congested ) .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦的马路非常拥挤。

detailed_translations.english: full of traffic

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤满；超负荷（congest的过去分词）

name: fraught
trans: adj. 充满（糟糕或令人讨厌的事物）；造成忧虑（或紧张）的，受忧虑（或压力）影响的；<旧>充满的 n. 货物 v. 装载

sentences.english: The earliest operations employing this technique were fraught with dangers.
sentences.chinese: 最早采用这一技术的手术充满了危险。

detailed_translations.english: If a situation or action is fraught with problems or risks, it is filled with them

name: sole
trans: adj. 唯一的，仅有的；专用的，独享的；<古>（尤指女性）未婚的；<古>单独的，没人陪伴的 n. 脚底；鞋底（不包括后跟）；脚趾和脚弓之间的部分；（刨子等工具的）底部，（高尔夫球棒头的）底端；（船舱或驾驶室的）地面，地板；鳎（鱼）； 脚底 v. 给（鞋）换底

sentences.english: the sole American in the room
sentences.chinese: 房间里唯一的美国人

sentences.english: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

sentences.english: the soles of her shoes
sentences.chinese: 她鞋子的鞋底

detailed_translations.english: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on

name: solitary
trans: adj. 独自的，单独的；偏僻的，孤立的；独自完成的；（人或动物）独处的，独居的；（花或其他部分）单生的；唯一的，仅有的 n. 单独监禁；独居者，隐士

sentences.english: a long, solitary walk
sentences.chinese: 独自一人的长距离散步

detailed_translations.english: doing something without anyone else with you
someone who lives completely alone

name: quantity
trans: n. 量，数目；大量，大批；（尤指和质量相对的）数量；（语音）音量；值，参量；代表数量（或参量）的数（或符号）

sentences.english: Your work has improved in quantity and quality this term.
sentences.chinese: 这学期你的作业在完成数量和质量上都有提高。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that can be counted or measured

name: quantitative
trans: adj. 数量的，量化的，定量的；（诗）由长短步组成的

sentences.english: We need to do a proper quantitative analysis of this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要对这个问题作一个正确的定量分析。

detailed_translations.english: relating to amounts rather than to the quality or standard of something

name: excess
trans: n. 超过，过量；越轨行为，暴行；无节制，无度；（保险中的）免赔额 adj. 过多的，超额的；额外的，附加的

sentences.english: The government was unable to curb the excesses of the secret police.
sentences.chinese: 政府无法约束秘密警察的过分行为。

sentences.english: the worst excesses of journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作中那些最糟糕的越轨行为

detailed_translations.english: harmful actions that are socially or morally unacceptable

name: excessive
trans: adj. 过度的，过多的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

name: redundant
trans: adj. <英> 被解雇的，被裁员的；多余的，累赘的；（为预防机器或系统中主要组件故障而设的）复置装置的，备用的

sentences.chinese: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过剩的；失业的，被解雇的
detailed_translations.english: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you

name: sporadic
trans: adj. 偶尔发生的，零星的；（疾病）偶发的，非流行性的

detailed_translations.english: happening fairly often, but not regularly

name: numerous
trans: adj. 众多的，许多的

sentences.chinese: 为掩盖事实作了很多尝试。

sentences.english: The two leaders have worked together on numerous occasions.
sentences.chinese: 那两位领导人已经多次合作。

trans: adj. 无数的，数不清的

sentences.chinese: 她在多个委员会担任委员。

detailed_translations.english: very many, or too many to be counted

name: countless
trans: adj. 无数的，数不尽的

sentences.chinese: 播放了无数次的一段著名电影选段

detailed_translations.english: too many to be counted

trans: adj. 足够的，充足的；（理由、条件）充足的，充分的

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

name: skimpy
trans: adj. 不足的；吝啬的

trans: adv. 稀疏地；贫乏地

sentences.chinese: 如果一个条目只填充了稀疏的内容，那么结果看上去就像图 8 那样。

sentences.chinese: 相反地，用户邮件文件稀疏地分布在集群内的部分服务器中。

sentences.chinese: 一片深绿色的地毯覆盖了大部分崎岖的地表，而片片裸地或植被稀疏的地块散布于图片边缘。

trans: n. 主体，大部分；庞大的身躯，肥硕的体形；（巨大的）容积，体积 adj. 大批的，大宗的 v. 使（产品）数量显得很大；结合（待售的股票或商品）

sentences.english: The dough will rise until it is double in bulk.

detailed_translations.english: the main or largest part of something

trans: n. 大多数；<英>多数票；成年的法定年龄；多数党；少校军衔，少校职位 adj. 多数人的

sentences.chinese: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

detailed_translations.english: most of the people or things in a group

name: block
trans: n. 大块，一块（木料、石头等）；（四面临街的）街段，街区；大楼，大厦；栋，座，幢；障碍物，阻碍；（短时间的）思维停滞，思维中断；一组，一批，一叠；（连续的）一段时间；阻挡，拦截；积木；（古代斩首用的）垫头木；<美>一大片土地；（物体的）平面，纯色色块；滑轮，滑轮组；区块 v. 阻塞，堵塞（道路、管道等）；遮住（视线）；封锁，挡住（去路）；阻挠，阻止；阻截，拦截（对方的球）；对……进行块操作；用模具使（帽等）成形

sentences.english: a wall made of concrete blocks
sentences.chinese: 由混凝土块砌成的墙

detailed_translations.english: a piece of hard material such as wood or stone with straight sides
to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it

detailed_translations.chinese: 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的

trans: n. 众多，大量；民众，群众，大批百姓；一大群人

detailed_translations.english: a very large number of people or things

trans: n. 金额，款项；算术，简单计算；总数，总和；全部，一切（尤指数量不大）；<英>计算失误；<英>计算费用 v. 概括，总结；求……的和，计算……的总数

sentences.english: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.

sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

trans: vt. 充满；弥漫

trans: adj. 大量的，丰富的，充足的

sentences.chinese: 充足的淡水供应

sentences.chinese: 提供给高素质的员工的大量机会

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的， 富裕的； 大量的， 充足的

trans: adv. 更远地，再往前地；进一步；此外，而且 adj. 更多的，进一步的；（距离上）更远的，较远的 v. 促进，推进

sentences.english: They walked a little further.
sentences.chinese: 他们又往前走了一点。

sentences.english: His hands moved further down her back.
sentences.chinese: 他的手在她背上继续往下滑。

sentences.english: They’ve never been further south than San Diego.
sentences.chinese: 他们从没有到过比圣迭戈更往南的地方。

detailed_translations.english: a greater distance, or beyond a particular place

trans: adj. 足够的，适当的，合乎需要的；（品质）足够好的，令人满意的；（质量）达到要求的，勉强过关的

sentences.chinese: 农民们迟迟没有为退休做好适当安排。

sentences.english: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测的有些防晒霜不能提供足够的防紫外线保护。

sentences.chinese: 他的工作水准勉强合格。

sentences.english: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司对其行动仍未作出充分解释。

sentences.english: Sorry, I can’t spare the time.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我抽不出时间。

sentences.english: Have you got any spare boxes?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有多余的盒子？

sentences.english: You could sleep in the spare bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 你可以睡那间空着的客房。

sentences.english: Do you have any spare cash?
sentences.chinese: 你手头有闲钱吗？

sentences.chinese: 我去看看是否还有空余的座位。

sentences.english: A decline in beer sales had left the industry with spare capacity (= the ability to produce more than can be sold ) .
sentences.chinese: 啤酒销售量的下降使该行业出现产能闲置。

name: times
trans: prep. 乘以 v. 乘，乘以 adv. 倍；乘，乘以 n. （用于比较）倍

sentences.english: two times two equals four (2×2=4)
sentences.chinese: 二二得四

sentences.english: ...a two-week period of time.
sentences.chinese: …一段为期两周的时间。

sentences.english: Time passed, and still Ma did not appear.
sentences.chinese: 时间一点点过去，可是玛还没有出现。

detailed_translations.english: multiplied by

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…相乘（time的第三人称单数）
时代（time的复数）；[数] 次数
detailed_translations.english: Time is what we measure in minutes, hours, days, and years

name: total
trans: adj. 总的，全部的；完全的，绝对的 v. 总数达，总计；把……加起来；<美，非正式>彻底毁坏（汽车）；杀死，严重伤害（某人） n. 总数，合计

sentences.english: a total ban on cigarette advertising
sentences.chinese: 香烟广告的全面禁止

sentences.english: He looked at her with a total lack of comprehension.
sentences.chinese: 他一头雾水地望着她。

sentences.english: a sport that demands total commitment
sentences.chinese: 需要全身心投入的体育运动

detailed_translations.english: complete, or as great as is possible
to reach a particular total

name: volume
trans: n. 体积，容积；总数，总量；音量，响度；（控制音量的）旋钮，控制杆；（成套图书中的）卷，册；（期刊）合订本；书籍；<史>（写在羊皮纸或纸草纸上的）书卷；（尤指头发的）厚，多 adj. 大量的 v. 以卷的形式发出；成团卷起

sentences.english: Can you turn the volume up?
sentences.chinese: 请你把音量调大好吗？

sentences.english: The volume of the container measures 10,000 cubic metres.
sentences.chinese: 这个容器的容量是1万立方米。

sentences.english: The period from 1940 – 1945 is in volume 9.
sentences.chinese: 1940年至1945年这段时间在第9卷。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

name: original
trans: adj. 起初的，原先的；原作的，真迹的；新创作的，未发表的；独创的，新颖的；有独到见解的，有独创性的 n. （艺术作品或文件的）原件，原稿；（文学作品中人物或地点的）原型；原版书，原版唱片；（根据服装展特制图样定做的）真品原板服装；<非正式>（举止、服装等）怪异滑稽的人，独特有趣的人

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

name: unique
trans: adj. 独一无二的，独特的；非常特别的，极不寻常的；（某人、地或事物）独具的，特有的 n. <古>独一无二的人（或事）

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

name: extraordinary

trans: adj. 奇异的，古怪的

detailed_translations.english: an offensive word for a homosexual person, especially a man. Do not use this word.

sentences.chinese: …一座古朴的小镇，有着狭窄的街道和传统的半木制房屋。

trans: adj. 规定的，指定的；倾向于；<古>（文件）（已在某日期由某人）签署的；赠送的；假定的，假设的 prep. 考虑到；如果，倘若 n. 假定事实 v. 给予（give 的过去分词形式）

sentences.english: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.chinese: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幻想， 错误的观念； 错觉， 幻觉， 假象
detailed_translations.english: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

name: fantasy
trans: n. 幻想，想象；想象产物，幻想作品；虚拟比赛（游戏）；幻想曲，集成曲；期望 v. 想象，幻想

sentences.english: I used to have fantasies about living in Paris with an artist.
sentences.chinese: 我过去常幻想着在巴黎与一位艺术家同住。

sentences.english: sexual fantasies
sentences.chinese: 性幻想

sentences.english: Young children sometimes can’t distinguish between fantasy and reality.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子有时不能区分幻想与现实。

sentences.english: He lived in a fantasy world of his own, even as a small boy.
sentences.chinese: 甚至还是个小孩子的时候，他就生活在一个幻想世界里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想象， 幻想； 想象的产物
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen

name: superstition
trans: n. 迷信

sentences.english: the old superstition that walking under a ladder is unlucky
sentences.chinese: 认为从梯子下面穿过不吉利的古老迷信

detailed_translations.english: a belief that some objects or actions are lucky or unlucky, or that they cause events to happen, based on old ideas of magic

name: panacea
trans: n. 灵丹妙药；万能药

sentences.english: Trade is not a panacea for the world's economic or social ills.
sentences.chinese: 贸易不是世界经济或社会弊端的万灵丹。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that something is a panacea for a set of problems, you mean that it will solve all those problems

name: figment
trans: n. 虚构的事；臆造的事物

sentences.english: Being one myself, I know that they are not just some figment, but the truth of the matter is, gaming is male dominated, the same way knitting is dominated by females.
sentences.chinese: 因为我本人就是一个游戏迷，所以知道这样的女孩绝非虚构。 然而事情的真相是，视频游戏是男人的地盘，就好像编织衣物大多由女人从事一样。

detailed_translations.english: something that you imagine is real, but does not exist

name: conceive
trans: v. 构思，设想；使受孕，怀孕

sentences.english: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.chinese: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.english: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.chinese: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.english: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.chinese: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.english: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

detailed_translations.english: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

name: occult
trans: n. 神秘学；神秘的事物，玄机；奥秘的习俗，奥秘的信仰；超自然现象；魔法 adj. 神秘的，不可思议的；超自然的；秘传的，深奥的；（疾病，过程）不伴随可见迹现象（或症状）的；（血液）（潜）隐的 v. 隔开（使看不见）；（天体）遮蔽

sentences.english: occult practices
sentences.chinese: 神秘习俗

sentences.english: the occult powers
sentences.chinese: 超自然力量

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的；超自然的；难以理解的
detailed_translations.english: magical and mysterious
mysterious practices and powers involving magic and spirits

name: gratuitous
trans: adj. 无理由的，无端的；免费的

sentences.english: children’s books which include gratuitous violence
sentences.chinese: 包含无谓暴力内容的儿童书籍

detailed_translations.chinese: 无理由的，无端的；免费的
detailed_translations.english: said or done without a good reason, in a way that offends someone

name: indispensable
trans: adj. 不可或缺的，必需的；不能撇开的，责无旁贷的 n. 不可缺少之物，必不可少的人

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

name: imperative
trans: adj. 极重要的，必要的；命令的，强制的；祈使的 n. 重要紧急的事，必要的事；祈使语气，祈使语气动词；命令

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的
detailed_translations.english: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

name: tangible
trans: adj. 明确的，真实的；可触摸的，可感知的 n. 可触知的东西

sentences.english: The silence of the countryside was almost tangible .
sentences.chinese: 乡村的寂静几乎能感觉得到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有形的；切实的；可触摸的
detailed_translations.english: if something is tangible, you can touch or feel it

name: authentic
trans: adj. 原作的，真迹的；传统的，正宗的；逼真的，仿真的；真实的，可靠的

sentences.english: an authentic account
sentences.chinese: 真实可信的说法

detailed_translations.chinese: 真的， 真正的； 可靠的， 可信的
detailed_translations.english: based on facts

name: genuine
trans: adj. 真正的，非伪造的；真诚的，真心的

sentences.english: ‘Did he really?’ Her surprise seemed genuine.
sentences.chinese: “他真的这样？”她好像是真的惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel

name: truly
trans: adv. 真实地，如实地；真正地，完全地；诚挚地，真诚地；准确地；非常，很

sentences.english: His work is truly original.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品确实十分独特。

sentences.english: Fawcett was a truly remarkable man.
sentences.chinese: 福西特是一位真正不同凡响的人。

sentences.english: a truly great work of medieval literature
sentences.chinese: 一部真正伟大的中世纪文学作品

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that the way you are describing something is really true

name: actual
trans: adj. 真实的，实际的，现实的；（用于对比主次方面）真正的；现存的，当前的

sentences.english: I’m not joking. Those were his actual words.
sentences.chinese: 我没开玩笑，那都是他的原话。

sentences.english: I know Germany won, but I can’t tell you the actual score.
sentences.chinese: 我知道德国队胜了，但我不知道确切的比分。

sentences.english: Interest is only charged on the actual amount borrowed.
sentences.chinese: 利息只按实际借款额收取。

sentences.english: In actual fact (= really  ) , there is little evidence to support the allegations.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这些指控几乎没有证据支持。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is real or exact

name: superb
trans: adj. 极佳的，质量极高的；（信心、控制力、技巧）非同一般的，超凡的；壮丽的，辉煌的；羽毛鲜艳夺目的

sentences.english: The food was superb.
sentences.chinese: 食物好吃极了。

sentences.english: superb weather
sentences.chinese: 极好的天气

detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: pivot
trans: n. 支点，枢轴；最重要的人（或事物），核心；转动，旋转；策应位置；<美>中锋 v. （使）在枢轴上旋转；（以脚为支点）转身；（为机械装置）提供枢轴

sentences.english: Forming the pivot of the exhibition is a large group of watercolours.
sentences.chinese: 构成这个展览核心的是一大批水彩画。

detailed_translations.english: a central point or pin on which something balances or turns

detailed_translations.chinese: 以…为中心旋转；把…置于枢轴上
detailed_translations.english: to turn or balance on a central point, or to make something do this

name: pivotal
trans: adj. 中枢的，关键的；有枢轴的，像枢轴的

sentences.english: The Bank of England has a pivotal role in the London money market.
sentences.chinese: 英格兰银行在伦敦货币市场中起着关键性的作用。

detailed_translations.english: more important than anything else in a situation, system etc

name: foremost
trans: adj. 最前的，最重要的 adv. 首先，第一；最基础地，最重要地

sentences.english: Economic concerns are foremost on many voters’ minds.
sentences.chinese: 经济是许多选民关心的首要问题。

sentences.english: Rostropovich was long considered the world’s foremost cellist.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，罗斯特罗波维奇一直被视为世界上首屈一指的大提琴家。

detailed_translations.english: in a leading position among a group of people or things

name: elementary
trans: adj. 简单的，基本的；基础的，初级的；小学的；单一元素的，非化合物的

sentences.english: the elementary principles of justice and democracy
sentences.chinese: 正义和民主的基本信条

sentences.english: You’ve made a very elementary mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个非常基本的错误。

sentences.english: I’m only familiar with the subject at an elementary level.
sentences.chinese: 我对这门学科的了解只是初级水平。

detailed_translations.english: simple or basic

name: fundamental
trans: adj. 根本的，基本的；必需的，必不可少的；不能再分的 n. 基本原理；基音，基频

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: momentous
trans: adj. 重大的，重要的

sentences.english: a momentous decision
sentences.chinese: 重大决定

sentences.english: Momentous events are taking place in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国正在发生重大事件。

sentences.english: His colleagues all recognized that this was a momentous occasion .
sentences.chinese: 他的同事都认识到这是一个重要时刻。

sentences.english: one of the most momentous days in British sport
sentences.chinese: 英国体育事业最重要的日子之一

detailed_translations.english: a momentous event, change, or decision is very important because it will have a great influence on the future

name: vital
trans: adj. 至关重要的，必不可少的；生机勃勃的，充满活力的；生命的，维持生命所必需的 n. 身体的重要内脏，维持生命的重要器官（vitals）

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: cardinal
trans: n. 红衣主教；基数，纯数；红衣凤头鸟；猩红，鲜红 adj. 最主要的，基本的

sentences.english: Having clean hands is one of the cardinal rules when preparing food.
sentences.chinese: 双手洁净是准备食物时的一项最基本要求。

sentences.english: an issue of cardinal importance
sentences.chinese: 至关重要的问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 红衣主教；枢机主教；鲜红色；【鸟类】(北美)主红雀
detailed_translations.english: a priest of high rank in the Roman Catholic Church

detailed_translations.chinese: 主要的，基本的；深红色的
detailed_translations.english: very important or basic

name: crucial
trans: adj. 至关重要的，决定性的；<非正式>极好的

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

name: significant
trans: adj. 显著的，相当数量的；重要的，意义重大的； 别有含义的，意味深长的 n. <古>象征，有意义的事物

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

name: dominant
trans: adj. 占支配地位的，占优势的；（基因）显性的 n. 显性（性状），显性基因

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

name: predominate
trans: v. （数量上）占优势，占大多数；占主导地位，占支配地位； <罕>支配，主宰 adj. 主要的，占支配地位的

sentences.english: In this type of case, the rights of the parent predominate.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的案例，要首先考虑父母的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to have the most importance or influence, or to be most easily noticed

name: predominantly
trans: adv. 绝大多数，主要地

sentences.english: The landscape has remained predominantly rural in appearance.
sentences.chinese: 该风景看上去主要保留了乡村风貌。

detailed_translations.english: You use predominantly to indicate which feature or quality is most noticeable in a situation

name: fateful
trans: adj. 重大的；决定性的；宿命的

sentences.english: It was a fateful decision, one which was to break the Government.
sentences.chinese: 那是一项重大的决定，一个将使政府垮台的决定。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重大的；决定性的；宿命的
detailed_translations.english: having an important, especially bad, effect on future events

name: primary
trans: adj. 主要的，首要的；<英>小学教育的，初级教育的；初级的，原发性的；最基本的，最根本的；第一手的，直接的；（有机化合物）连上一个碳原子的；（多指胺）（氨基酸顺序）一级的 n. （选举过程中的党内）初选（=primary election）；原色；初级飞羽；主星；初级线圈，原线圈

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: primarily
trans: adv. 主要地，首要地，根本地

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

name: essential
trans: adj. 必不可少的，非常重要的；基本的，精髓的；（氨基酸、脂肪酸）必需的；（疾病）自发的，原发的 n. 必不可少的东西，必需品；要素，本质；（某学科的）基础，基本知识

sentences.english: Window locks are fairly cheap and absolutely essential.
sentences.chinese: 窗锁相当便宜，绝对有必要安装。

sentences.english: Even in small companies, computers are an essential tool.
sentences.chinese: 即使在小公司里，计算机也是不可或缺的工具。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary
something that is necessary to do something or in a particular situation

name: key
trans: n. 钥匙；（电脑、打字机或乐器的）键；关键，要诀；答案；音调，声调；图例，符号说明；低岛，礁；扳手；销子，楔；（文章、形势等）主调，基调；（梣树、枫树或无花果树的）翼果；板条间首层灰泥；（有助于石膏等黏附的）粗糙表面；罚球区 v. 键入；成为（获胜）的关键；<非正式>用钥匙划坏（汽车）；用别针（或楔子、栓）固定；将……的表面处理好；给（广告）加识别编码 adj. 关键的，主要的

sentences.english: A bunch of keys hung from his belt.
sentences.chinese: 他的皮带上挂着一串钥匙。

sentences.english: Press the ‘Escape’ key to exit.
sentences.chinese: 按退出键退出。

sentences.english: Check your answers in the key at the back of the book.
sentences.chinese: 用书后的解答核对答案。

detailed_translations.english: a small specially shaped piece of metal that you put into a lock and turn in order to lock or unlock a door, start a car etc

name: optimum
trans: adj. 最优的，最适宜的 n. 最佳条件，最佳水平

sentences.english: optimum conditions for growth
sentences.chinese: 最适宜生长的条件

sentences.english: This design makes the optimum use of the available space.
sentences.chinese: 这一设计最大限度地利用了现有的空间。

detailed_translations.english: the best or most suitable for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

name: leading
trans: adj. 主要的，最重要的；在（比赛或行列中）首位的，居前的 n. 行距；领导；（用于屋顶的）铅皮，铅板 v. 领导（lead 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: The army played a leading role in organizing the attempted coup.
sentences.chinese: 军队在策划这场未遂政变的过程中起了最主要的作用。

sentences.english: the leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 主要的工业国

sentences.english: a leading heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 最好的心脏病专家

sentences.english: leading members of the government
sentences.chinese: 政府要员

detailed_translations.english: best, most important, or most successful

name: chiefly
trans: adv. 主要地；首先

sentences.english: The work consists chiefly of interviewing the public.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作主要是采访公众。

sentences.english: I lived abroad for years, chiefly in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 我在国外生活了很多年，主要在意大利。

detailed_translations.english: mostly but not completely

name: largely
trans: adv. 很大程度上，主要地

sentences.english: The state of Nevada is largely desert.
sentences.chinese: 内华达州大部分是沙漠。

sentences.english: It had been a tiring day, largely because of all the tedious waiting.
sentences.chinese: 那一天真累人，主要是因为等得无聊。

detailed_translations.english: mostly or mainly

name: sum
trans: n. 金额，款项；算术，简单计算；总数，总和；全部，一切（尤指数量不大）；<英>计算失误；<英>计算费用 v. 概括，总结；求……的和，计算……的总数

sentences.english: He owes me a large sum of money .
sentences.chinese: 他欠我一大笔钱。

sentences.english: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.
sentences.chinese: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

sentences.english: I was good at sums at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money

name: preference
trans: n. 偏爱，偏好；更喜欢的人（或物）；优待，优先（权）；<法律>（尤指债务偿付）优先偿还权

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: forte
trans: n. 长处；特长 adj. 强音的；响的 adv. 响亮地 n. （Forte）人名；（英、意、葡、法、德、西）福特

sentences.english: Moscow-based Kaspersky Lab has long been a magnet for Russia's young computer geniuses, luring them away from their usual forte, hacking, to viral analysis.
sentences.chinese: 总部位于莫斯科的卡巴斯基实验室许久以来就是吸引俄罗斯年轻计算机英才的一块磁石，诱使他们远离自己平常的黑客特长，转而从事病毒分析。

sentences.english: His forte is on the operations”, says Ashok Kumar, an analyst at Rodman &Renshaw LLC, in a Bloomberg Television interview
sentences.chinese: “他的长处是运营”，在彭博电视采访中一名Rodman &Renshaw 公司的分析员Ashok Kumar曾说过。

detailed_translations.english: played or sung loudly

name: elite
trans: n. 权力集团，上层人士；尖子，精英 adj. 出类拔萃的，精锐的

sentences.english: a struggle for power within the ruling elite
sentences.chinese: 统治阶层内部的争权夺利

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

name: gist
trans: n. 要点，主旨，大意；<法律>诉讼要点

sentences.english: Don’t worry about all the details as long as you get the gist (= understand the main meaning ) of it.
sentences.chinese: 不要去管各个细节，只要理解主要意思就行了。

detailed_translations.english: the main idea and meaning of what someone has said or written

name: merit
trans: n. 优秀品质，价值；优点，长处；<英>（成绩等级）良好；事实真相，是非曲直；善行，善事 v. 值得，应受；应受赏（或罚）

sentences.english: The merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的优点就是它对所要求的变动进行了实事求是的评估。

sentences.english: The great merit of the project is its flexibility and low cost.
sentences.chinese: 该项目最大的优点是它的灵活性和低成本。

sentences.english: Each of these approaches to teaching has its merits .
sentences.chinese: 这些教学方法每一种都有其优点。

sentences.english: Tonight’s meeting will weigh up the relative merits of the two candidates.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的会议将对两位候选人的相对优点进行考量。

sentences.english: It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
sentences.chinese: 这是本引人入胜的书，值得关注。

detailed_translations.english: an advantage or good feature of something
to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

name: motif
trans: n. 主题；主旨；图形；意念；基序，模体

sentences.english: The theme of creation is a recurrent motif in Celtic mythology.
sentences.chinese: 天地万物的创造是凯尔特神话中反复出现的主题。

detailed_translations.english: an idea, subject, or image that is regularly repeated and developed in a book, film, work of art etc

name: tenor
trans: n. 男高音（歌手）；男高音声部；主旨，大意；一般趋向，稳定的进程；<法律>（文件的）抄本，誊本；（财政）（支票、汇票或期票的）期限；（组钟中的）最低音钟（tenor bell） adj. 次中音的

sentences.english: Arthur Davies sings the tenor solo.
sentences.chinese: 阿瑟•戴维斯表演男高音独唱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 男高音；要旨，大意；票据的限期；稳定的进程
detailed_translations.english: a male singing voice that can reach the range of notes below the lowest woman’s voice, or a man with a voice like this
a tenor voice or instrument has a range of notes that is lower than an  alto  voice or instrument

name: principal
trans: adj. 最重要的，首要的；本金的，母金的 n. <美>（美国公立中小学的）校长；<英>（英国的）大学校长，学院院长；（企业或机构的）负责人；（音乐会、戏剧、芭蕾舞剧、歌剧中的）主角演员；（管弦乐队每一乐器组的）首席演奏者；（有利息的）本金，资金；（法律和商业事务中的）当事人，委托人；关键人物；（某些行业）完全合格的开业者；<英>（负责某一部门的）高级公务员；主犯，首犯；<史>决斗者；（支撑檩的）主椽；（管风琴的）主音栓

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

name: major
trans: adj. 重大的，主要的；严重的；大调的，大音阶的； <旧>（公立学校中置于学生姓氏后，表示两兄弟中）大的，年长的；主修的；大（项）的 n. 主修科目，专业；陆军少校，（美国）空军少校；（某专业的）主修学生；<美，非正式>职业棒球大联盟；大型公司，重要企业；成年人，已达到法定年龄者；（军乐队中主管某一乐器部的）乐器长；大调，大音程； 大项，大前提；主要世界性组织（或公司、比赛） v. （在美国大学）主修，专攻

sentences.english: There are two major political parties in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国有两大政党。

sentences.english: The government’s major concern is with preventing road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 政府关注的大事是预防道路交通事故。

sentences.english: Smoking is one of the major causes of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是引发癌症的元凶之一。

sentences.english: the major developments in computer technology
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术的重大进步

sentences.english: He’s majoring in Political Science.
sentences.chinese: 他主修政治学。

detailed_translations.english: very large or important, when compared to other things or people of a similar kind
to study something as your main subject at college or university

name: sole
trans: adj. 唯一的，仅有的；专用的，独享的；<古>（尤指女性）未婚的；<古>单独的，没人陪伴的 n. 脚底；鞋底（不包括后跟）；脚趾和脚弓之间的部分；（刨子等工具的）底部，（高尔夫球棒头的）底端；（船舱或驾驶室的）地面，地板；鳎（鱼）； 脚底 v. 给（鞋）换底

sentences.english: the sole American in the room
sentences.chinese: 房间里唯一的美国人

sentences.english: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

sentences.english: the soles of her shoes
sentences.chinese: 她鞋子的鞋底

detailed_translations.english: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on

name: glorious
trans: adj. 光荣的，值得称道的；辉煌的，绚丽的；极其愉快的；（天气）阳光灿烂的

sentences.english: a truly glorious future
sentences.chinese: 无比美好的将来

sentences.english: a glorious victory
sentences.chinese: 光荣的胜利

sentences.english: glorious views of the coast
sentences.chinese: 沿海的迷人景色

detailed_translations.english: having or deserving great fame, praise, and honour

name: splendid
trans: adj. 极佳的，非常好的；壮丽的，灿烂的，辉煌的；（一段时光）令人愉快的 int. （表示赞许或满意）好极了，痛快

sentences.english: a splendid idea
sentences.chinese: 很妙的主意

sentences.english: a splendid opportunity
sentences.chinese: 绝佳的机会

sentences.english: The staff are doing a splendid job.
sentences.chinese: 员工们干得非常棒。

detailed_translations.english: very good

name: splendor
trans: n. 壮丽，壮观；美景，让人印象深刻的事物（splendors）

name: grand
trans: adj. 壮丽的，堂皇的；宏伟的，宏大的；傲慢的，高高在上的；令人愉快的；<非正式>出色的，极好的；总括的；（常用于大型建筑物的名称前）大的；（对上层社会的人的称呼）大；（罪行）严重的；壮丽的，富丽堂皇的 n. <非正式>一千美元，一千英镑；大钢琴，三角钢琴

sentences.english: a grand country house
sentences.chinese: 豪华的乡间大宅

sentences.english: The party was a grand affair.
sentences.chinese: 这个聚会场面隆重。

sentences.english: New Yorkers build on a grand scale.
sentences.chinese: 纽约人喜欢建高楼大厦。

detailed_translations.english: big and very impressive

name: gorgeous
trans: adj. 美丽动人的；令人愉快的；绚丽的，华丽的

sentences.english: ‘What do you think of my new flatmate?’ ‘He’s absolutely gorgeous !’
sentences.chinese: “你觉得我的新室友怎么样？”“他帅极了！”

sentences.english: exotic birds with feathers of gorgeous colours
sentences.chinese: 长着绚丽羽毛的异国的鸟

detailed_translations.chinese: 极其漂亮的，极其吸引人的；绚丽的，华丽的
detailed_translations.english: extremely beautiful or attractive

name: radiant
trans: adj. 容光焕发的，喜悦的；明亮的，灿烂的；（热、能量）辐射的；（情感、品质）强烈的，显著的 n. 辐射源（尤指电热器或气热器的产热部分）；（天文）辐射点

sentences.english: She looked radiant in a white silk dress.
sentences.chinese: 她身穿白色真丝礼服，看上去光彩照人。

sentences.english: a radiant smile
sentences.chinese: 灿烂的笑容

detailed_translations.chinese: 辐射的；容光焕发的；光芒四射的
detailed_translations.english: full of happiness and love, in a way that shows in your face and makes you look attractive

name: spectacular
trans: adj. 壮观的，令人惊叹的；惊人的，突如其来的 n. 壮观场面，盛大演出

sentences.english: a mountainous area with spectacular scenery
sentences.chinese: 景色壮丽的山区

sentences.english: a spectacular success
sentences.chinese: 辉煌的成就

sentences.english: a television spectacular
sentences.chinese: 场面盛大的电视节目

detailed_translations.english: very impressive
an event or performance that is very large and impressive

name: solemn
trans: adj. 表情严肃的，庄严的；（承诺、协定等）庄严的，郑重的；（仪式）庄严的，隆重的

sentences.english: a solemn expression
sentences.chinese: 严肃的表情

sentences.english: Their faces suddenly grew solemn.
sentences.chinese: 他们的脸突然变得严肃起来。

sentences.english: a solemn procession of mourners
sentences.chinese: 庄重的送葬队伍

sentences.english: solemn ritual/ceremony
sentences.chinese: 隆重的仪式/典礼

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，庄重的；庄严的,隆重的
detailed_translations.english: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion

name: superb
trans: adj. 极佳的，质量极高的；（信心、控制力、技巧）非同一般的，超凡的；壮丽的，辉煌的；羽毛鲜艳夺目的

sentences.english: The food was superb.
sentences.chinese: 食物好吃极了。

sentences.english: superb weather
sentences.chinese: 极好的天气

detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: magnificent
trans: adj. 宏伟的，壮丽的；令人印象深刻的，出色的；高尚的，高贵的

sentences.english: The magnificent beau is dancing to the light of chandeliers.
sentences.chinese: 这个衣着华丽的花花公子在枝形吊灯灯光下翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: These magnificent ancient buildings demonstrate the great intelligence of the labouring people.
sentences.chinese: 这些壮丽的古代建筑显示了劳动人民的高度智慧。

name: injurious
trans: adj. 有害的，致伤的；中伤的，诽谤的

sentences.english: ...substances that are injurious to health.
sentences.chinese: ...有害健康的物质。

detailed_translations.english: causing injury, harm, or damage

name: asperse
trans: v. 诽谤，中伤；（教会）洒圣水于

name: aspersion
trans: n. 中伤，诽谤；洒水

sentences.english: Should you hear my name blackened and maligned, will you credit the aspersion ?
sentences.chinese: 要是你听见我的名誉受到诽谤， 你会相信那谗言吗?。

sentences.english: Rather than casting aspersion on leaks about Mr. Flynn, these commentators praised their contributions to accountability journalism.
sentences.chinese: 这些评论者不但没有对弗林一事的消息泄露做出诽谤，还赞扬这是对问责新闻的贡献。

sentences.english: We cast no aspersion on the man or his program. Mr. Obama, in his short career, has not strongly associated himself with any policy idea.
sentences.chinese: 我们无意诽谤这个人或他的计划，然而奥巴马先生在他短暂的职业生涯里，从未对任何政策主张表现过强烈支持的态度。

name: indignity
trans: n. 侮辱；轻蔑；有伤尊严；无礼举动

sentences.english: The prisoners were subjected to all sorts of indignities.
sentences.chinese: 犯人遭受各种侮辱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侮辱；轻蔑；有伤尊严；无礼举动
detailed_translations.english: a situation that makes you feel very ashamed and not respected

name: malign
trans: v. （公开地）诽谤 adj. 有害的；邪恶的；（疾病）恶性的

sentences.english: She had seen herself repeatedly maligned in the newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 她看到自己在报纸上一再受到诽谤。

sentences.english: a much maligned politician
sentences.chinese: 一个备受中伤的政治家

detailed_translations.english: to say unpleasant things about someone that are untrue
harmful

name: defame
trans: v. 诽谤；中伤

sentences.english: Sgt. Norwood complained that the article defamed him.
sentences.chinese: 诺维德中士抱怨这篇文章诽谤他。

detailed_translations.english: to write or say bad or untrue things about someone or something, so that people will have a bad opinion of them

name: disparage
trans: v. <正式>贬低，诋毁

sentences.english: ...Larkin's tendency to disparage literature.
sentences.chinese: …拉金诋毁文学的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: If you disparage someone or something, you speak about them in a way which shows that you do not have a good opinion of them

name: humiliate
trans: v. 羞辱，使蒙羞

sentences.english: Her boss humiliated her in front of all her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她的老板在所有同事面前羞辱了她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed or stupid, especially when other people are present

name: slander
trans: n. 诽谤，诋毁；诽谤罪 v. （口头）诽谤，诋毁

sentences.english: He accused me of slandering him and trying to undermine his position.
sentences.chinese: 他指控我诽谤他并想削弱他的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to say false things about someone in order to damage other people’s good opinion of them
a false spoken statement about someone, intended to damage the good opinion that people have of that person

name: insult
trans: v. 侮辱，冒犯；损害，危害 n. 侮辱，冒犯；（医）（对组织、器官的）损伤

sentences.english: Nobody insults my family and gets away with it!
sentences.chinese: 谁也别想侮辱了我的家人之后就这么算了！

sentences.english: I hope Andy won’t be insulted if I don’t come.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不来，希望安迪不要介意。

sentences.english: 200 for all that work? It’s an insult.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：干那么多工作才给200美元？这简直是侮辱。

detailed_translations.english: to offend someone by saying or doing something they think is rude
a remark or action that is offensive or deliberately rude

name: satirical
trans: adj. 讽刺的，讥讽的；爱挖苦人的

sentences.english: ...a satirical novel about New York life in the late 80s.
sentences.chinese: …一部关于80年代末纽约生活的讽刺小说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 讽刺性的；讥讽的；爱挖苦人的
detailed_translations.english: A satirical drawing, piece of writing, or comedy show is one in which humour or exaggeration is used to criticize something

name: sardonic
trans: adj. 讽刺的；嘲笑的，冷笑的

sentences.english: He looked at her with sardonic amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他带着嘲讽的愉悦神情看着她。

detailed_translations.english: showing that you do not have a good opinion of someone or something, and feel that you are better than them

name: sarcastic
trans: adj. 讽刺的，嘲笑的，挖苦的

sentences.english: Was she being sarcastic?
sentences.chinese: 她是在嘲讽吗？

detailed_translations.english: saying things that are the opposite of what you mean, in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed

name: sarcasm
trans: n. 讽刺，挖苦

sentences.english: ‘Good of you to arrive on time,’ George said, with heavy sarcasm (= very clear sarcasm ) .
sentences.chinese: “你到得真准时啊。”乔治不加掩饰地挖苦道。

detailed_translations.english: a way of speaking or writing that involves saying the opposite of what you really mean in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed

name: cynical
trans: adj. 认为人皆自私的，愤世嫉俗的；悲观的，怀疑的；损人利己的；轻蔑的，嘲笑的

sentences.english: a cynical view of human nature
sentences.chinese: 认为人性本恶的一种观点

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤世嫉俗的， 怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: unwilling to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something

name: mock
trans: v. 嘲笑，（模仿）嘲弄；使显得徒劳，使显得可笑；（照原尺寸）模仿，仿制 （mock sth. up） adj. 假装的，假的；仿真的；（考试、作战等）模拟的，演习的 n. <英>模拟考试（mocks）；<旧>嘲笑对象，笑柄；嘲笑；模仿，仿造（品） adv. 虚假地，不诚实地

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

name: taunt
trans: v. 奚落，逗弄 n. 嘲弄（话），讥讽（话） adj. 很高的

sentences.english: racist taunts
sentences.chinese: 种族主义嘲讽言论

detailed_translations.english: a remark or joke intended to make someone angry or upset
to try to make someone angry or upset by saying unkind things to them

name: jeer
trans: v. 嘲笑；戏弄；奚落 n. 嘲笑；戏弄；揶揄的言语；奚落人的话

sentences.english: ‘You know I’m right!’ she jeered.
sentences.chinese: “你知道我是对的！”她嘲笑道。

sentences.english: The President was booed and jeered by a crowd of protesters.
sentences.chinese: 总统被一群抗议者报以嘘声和嘲笑。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or shout unkind things at them in a way that shows you do not respect them

name: flout
trans: v. 藐视，无视（规则、法律等）；嘲笑，愚弄 n. 嘲笑，愚弄

sentences.english: ...illegal campers who persist in flouting the law.
sentences.chinese: …一向无视法律的非法露营者。

detailed_translations.english: If you flout something such as a law, an order, or an accepted way of behaving, you deliberately do not obey it or follow it

name: sneer
trans: v. 嘲笑，讥讽；鄙视 n. 嘲笑，讥讽

sentences.english: ‘Is that your best outfit?’ he sneered.
sentences.chinese: “那就是你最好的衣服了？”他讥笑道。

sentences.english: ‘You probably wouldn’t understand,’ he said with a sneer.
sentences.chinese: “你可能明白不了。”他冷笑了一声说道。

detailed_translations.english: to smile or speak in a very unkind way that shows you have no respect for someone or something
an unkind smile or remark that shows you have no respect for something or someone

name: deride
trans: v. 嘲笑，愚弄，揶揄

sentences.english: You shouldn’t deride their efforts.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该嘲笑他们的努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make remarks or jokes that show you think someone or something is silly or useless

name: gibe
trans: v. 嘲笑，愚弄；（非正式）相一符，一致（等于jibe） n. 讥讽，嘲讽话（等于jibe） n. （Gibe）（美、法、丹、瑞典、拉脱维亚）吉巴（人名）

sentences.english: It's impolite to gibe at a foreign student's English.
sentences.chinese: 嘲笑外国学生的英语是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: It's unkind to gibe at a foreign student's english even though it may sound amusing.
sentences.chinese: 嘲笑一个外国学生的英语是不应该的，就算他的英语令人捧腹。

sentences.english: "Please don't gibe me, " Lydia said. "I feel as repulsive and small as one of those deadly germs often portrayed in the horror movie genre. "
sentences.chinese: “请不要嘲笑我，”利迪娅说。“我觉得自己令人讨厌，渺小，像恐怖类电影描述的那些致命的细菌那样。”

name: clamor
trans: n. 喧闹，叫嚷；大声的要求 vi. 喧嚷，发喧嚣声；持续地喊声 vt. 喧嚷着说出

sentences.english: On weekdays, the marmosets steered clear of the roar of traffic, and on Sundays they shunned the clamor of visiting crowds.
sentences.chinese: 工作日的时候，这些狨猴避开嘈杂的交通，星期天的时候它们就会避开喧闹的游客。

name: exclaim
trans: v. 呼喊，惊叫，大声说

sentences.english: ‘No!’ she exclaimed in shock.
sentences.chinese: “不！”她惊呼道。

detailed_translations.english: to say something suddenly and loudly because you are surprised, angry, or excited

name: exhale
trans: v. 呼（气），呼出；散发出（蒸气，烟雾）

sentences.english: Take a deep breath, then exhale slowly.
sentences.chinese: 深吸一口气，然后慢慢呼出。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe air, smoke etc out of your mouth

name: howl
trans: v. （狗、狼等）嗥叫，长嚎；（因疼痛、愤怒、开心等）大声叫喊；（风）怒号，呼啸；怒吼，怒声要求；嚎哭 n. （狗、狼等）嗥叫，长嚎；（痛苦、愤怒、快乐的）嚎叫，咆哮；（狂风的）怒号，呼啸；颤噪效应

sentences.english: wind howling in the trees
sentences.chinese: 在林间呼啸的风

sentences.english: Somewhere a dog suddenly howled, baying at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 某个地方的一只狗突然嗥叫起来，对着月亮狂吠。

detailed_translations.english: if the wind howls, it makes a loud high sound as it blows
If an animal such as a wolf or a dog howls, it makes a long, loud, crying sound

detailed_translations.chinese: 嗥叫； 呼啸；吼叫； 哀号
detailed_translations.english: a loud high sound made by the wind blowing

name: acclaim
trans: v. 赞扬，称赞，为……喝彩 n. 赞扬，称誉，高度评价

sentences.english: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

sentences.english: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 安杰拉·巴西特因她出色的表演而赢得了评论界的赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something publicly
Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

name: counsel
trans: n. 忠告，建议；辩护律师；<古>咨询，磋商 v. 建议，劝告（做……）；为……提供咨询，给……提供建议；商讨，提出忠告

sentences.english: He assisted me with good counsel and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 他以良好的忠告和鼓励帮助我。

sentences.english: Those who counsel US privately, point out that we are wrong, are true friends.
sentences.chinese: 那些私下忠告我们，指出我们错误的人，才是真正的朋友。

sentences.english: Their free guidance and counsel will be the most priceless gift you can receive.
sentences.chinese: 他们的免费指导和忠告，将是你能够收到的最无价的礼物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劝告， 忠告；法律顾问； 辩护人
detailed_translations.english: a type of lawyer who represents you in court

name: propose
trans: v. 提议，建议；提出（理论或解释）；提名，推荐；计划，打算；求婚；（向立法机构或委员会）提交（动议）；提议祝（酒）

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

name: proposal
trans: n. 提议，建议；提案；（计划、建议等的）提出；求婚

sentences.english: The president is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional crisis.
sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group, or the act of making it

name: offer
trans: v. 提供，给予；提议，表示愿意（做某事）；出（价），开（价）；提出，作出；表示（爱、友谊等）；（向上帝或神）奉献（祈祷、赞美），祭献（牺牲）； 试图（使用暴力，进行抵抗）；<古>发动，挑起（战争）；把……摆好（或放到位）（以便检测或评估其外观或状况）；<旧>（机会）出现；求婚 n. 主动提议，提供； 出价，报价； （商品的）特价，特惠；求婚

sentences.english: Can I offer you something to drink?
sentences.chinese: 我给你拿点喝的好吗？

sentences.english: I can’t turn down the offer of a free trip to Milan!
sentences.chinese: 我怎能拒绝免费去米兰旅行的机会！

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone if they would like to have something, or to hold something out to them so that they can take it
a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

name: recommend
trans: v. 建议，劝告 ；推荐，介绍；使显得吸引人，使受欢迎；<古> 把……交托给，把……托付给

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: remind
trans: v. 提醒，使想起；（因相像）使联想起（remind sb. of）

sentences.english: Yes, I’ll be there. Thanks for reminding me.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我会去那里的。 谢谢提醒。

sentences.english: He made a few notes to remind himself of what he wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 他记了几条，提醒自己要说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone remember something that they must do

name: suggest
trans: v. 提议，建议；推荐，举荐；显示，表明；暗示，暗指；使人想到，使人联想到

sentences.english: The zoo asked its visitors to suggest a name for the new baby panda.
sentences.chinese: 动物园请游客提建议，给刚出生的大熊猫起一个名字。

sentences.english: It has been suggested that the manager will resign if any more players are sold.
sentences.chinese: 有人提议，如果再有球员被出售，球队主教练就辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提议，建议；启发；使人想起；显示；暗示
detailed_translations.english: to tell someone your ideas about what they should do, where they should go etc

name: mention
trans: v. 提到，谈到；提名，推荐；传令嘉奖，提名表扬 n. 提及，说起，写上一笔；提名表扬

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

name: advice
trans: n. 忠告，劝告，建议；（金融交易）正式通知；消息

sentences.english: You should have followed my advice.
sentences.chinese: 你真该听我的建议。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion you give someone about what they should do

name: advise
trans: v. 通知，告知；劝告，建议

sentences.english: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.english: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.english: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.chinese: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

name: advance
trans: v. （使）前进，（使）向前移动；发展，进步；预付；提前，提早；促进，推动；提出（想法或理论）；上涨，增加；提拔，晋升 n. 前进；进步，进展；改善；预付款；勾引，追求；（价格、价值的）上涨；贷款 adj. 预先的，事先的；先行的，先遣的

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: submit
trans: v. 呈递，提交；屈服，不得已接受；建议，主张；使经受，使受到

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: reciprocal
trans: adj. 相互的，互惠的，报答的；（路线，方向）反向的；（代词，动词）互相的；（量，函数）倒数的 n. 反身代词，相互动词； 倒数，乘法逆元素；互相起作用的事物

sentences.english: He spoke of the necessity for a reciprocal relationship that would be useful for all sides.
sentences.chinese: 他谈及需要建立对各方都有益的互惠关系。

sentences.english: Such treaties provide reciprocal rights and obligations.
sentences.chinese: 此类协议规定了相互之间的权利与义务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 互惠的；相互的；倒数的，彼此相反的
detailed_translations.english: a reciprocal arrangement or relationship is one in which two people or groups do or give the same things to each other

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 倒数；互相起作用的事物

name: correspondence
trans: n. 信件，信函；通信；相似，关联

sentences.english: The magazine is unable to enter into any correspondence on medical matters.
sentences.chinese: 本杂志无法答复有关医学方面的来信。

sentences.english: All correspondence between us must cease.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间的所有通信必须停止。

detailed_translations.english: the process of sending and receiving letters

name: liaison
trans: n. 联络，沟通；联络人；私通，婚外情；加浓调料，蛋黄勾芡；（法语和其他语言中的）连音，连诵

sentences.english: Liaison between police forces and the art world is vital to combat art crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方和艺术界之间的联络对于打击艺术犯罪是至关重要的。

detailed_translations.english: the regular exchange of information between groups of people, especially at work, so that each group knows what the other is doing

name: propagate
trans: v. 散播，宣传（观点、信仰等）；传播（运动、光线、声音等）；（动植物等）繁殖，使繁殖

sentences.english: The group launched a website to propagate its ideas.
sentences.chinese: 这个团体建了一个网站来宣扬他们的主张。

sentences.english: The plant can be propagated from seed.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物可由种子繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: to spread an idea, belief etc to many people

name: communicate
trans: v. 传递信息，通讯；传达，传递（想法或感情）；传染（疾病）；（房间或建筑）相通，相连；传输（热，力），传递（运动）；领受圣餐

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: impart
trans: v. 传授，告知；赋予，给予

sentences.english: Use a piece of fresh ginger to impart a East Asian flavour to simple ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 用一片鲜姜给简单的原料添上东亚的风味。

sentences.english: She had information that she couldn’t wait to impart.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了消息，迫不及待地想告诉别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give a particular quality to something

name: remit
trans: v. <正式>汇款；<法律>将（案件）发回原审判法庭（重审）；免除（债务、处罚等）；将……提交（权力部门处理）；<法律>将（某人）转到另一法院审判（或听证）；<罕>推迟；<古>使恢复原状；<古>减少 n. <英，非正式> 职权范围；提交审议的事项

detailed_translations.chinese: 宽恕；免除；减轻；传送；使恢复原状
detailed_translations.english: to free someone from a debt or punishment

name: consort
trans: n. （统治者的）配偶；一组（古乐器或乐师）；随航船只；伙伴 v. 厮混，（别人反对的）结交；陪伴；符合 n. （Consort）（美、英、法）孔索尔特（人名）

sentences.english: The public has accepted Camilla, Prince Charles’s former mistress, as his consort.
sentences.chinese: 公众接受了作为前任情妇的卡米拉成为查尔斯王子的新配偶。

sentences.english: Dressed as the Hindu deity Shiva and his consort, Parvati, children beg for money from tourists in Pushkar.
sentences.chinese: 打扮成印度教湿婆神和他的配偶帕尔瓦蒂，儿童从普什卡游客那里乞讨钱财。

detailed_translations.english: the wife or husband of a ruler

name: disseminate
trans: v. <正式>散布，传播（信息、知识等）

sentences.english: Her findings have been widely disseminated .
sentences.chinese: 她的发现已广为传播。

detailed_translations.english: to spread information or ideas to as many people as possible

name: tip
trans: v. （使）倾斜，（使）斜侧；给小费；<英>扔掉，倒掉（垃圾）；倾倒，倒出；打翻；（用液体、颜色等）覆盖……的尖端；预言……获胜；轻触，轻碰；密报，透露消息，告诫 n. 指点，诀窍，建议；小费；末梢，尖端；<英>垃圾场；<英，非正式>脏乱的地方；（对赛马、比赛结果的）预测，内幕消息；顶端附加物；（尤指给警方的）密报；（对运动的球或冰球的）轻碰，轻击；手触帽檐，脱帽（致敬、问好或道别的动作）；擦棒球

sentences.english: He kissed the tip of her nose.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的鼻尖。

sentences.english: gardening tips
sentences.chinese: 园艺小窍门

sentences.english: Did you leave a tip ?
sentences.chinese: 你留小费了吗？

sentences.english: His helmet had tipped forward and the boy pushed it back.
sentences.chinese: 头盔向前耷拉下来，男孩把它往后推了推。

detailed_translations.english: the end of something, especially something pointed
to move into a sloping position, so that one end or side is higher than the other, or to make something do this

name: bombastic
trans: adj. 辞藻华丽空洞的，浮夸的

sentences.english: He was vain and bombastic.
sentences.chinese: 他既虚荣又浮夸。

sentences.english: ...the bombastic style adopted by his predecessor.
sentences.chinese: …他的前任采取的浮夸方式。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as bombastic, you are criticizing them for trying to impress other people by saying things that sound impressive but have little meaning

name: pretentious
trans: adj. 自命不凡的，做作的；（书、电影等）捏造的，矫饰的

sentences.english: a pretentious film
sentences.chinese: 矫饰的电影

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is pretentious, they try to seem more important, intelligent, or high class than they really are in order to be impressive

name: boast
trans: v. 有（值得自豪的东西）；吹嘘，夸耀 n. 夸耀，自吹自擂，感到自豪的事

sentences.english: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.english: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.english: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.chinese: 该慈善机构自吹自擂，声称从来没有拒绝过任何人。

detailed_translations.english: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good

detailed_translations.chinese: 自夸，吹嘘；以拥有…而自豪
detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

detailed_translations.chinese: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话
detailed_translations.english: Boast is also a noun

name: boastful
trans: adj. 自吹自擂的，自夸的

name: vanity
trans: n. 虚荣（心），自负；（相对于非常严肃的事而言）无意义，微不足道；梳妆台，盥洗柜；自负的行为，虚荣的态度；自费出版

sentences.english: Sabrina had none of the vanity so often associated with beautiful women.
sentences.chinese: 萨布里娜没有一点漂亮女人经常会有的那种虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: too much pride in yourself, so that you are always thinking about yourself and your appearance

name: conceit
trans: n. 自负，骄傲自大；艺术效果，幻想，奇想 v. <英> 幻想

sentences.english: The conceit of the woman!
sentences.chinese: 这个自负的女人！

detailed_translations.english: an attitude that shows you have too high an opinion of your own abilities or importance

name: exaggerate
trans: v. 夸大，言过其实；使扩大

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

name: brag
trans: v. 吹牛，自夸 n. 大话，夸耀之词；勃莱格牌戏（简化的扑克牌戏） adj. <美，非正式>卓越的，一流的

sentences.english: Do not brag or bluff.
sentences.chinese: 不要自夸和虚张声势。

sentences.english: It is not in good form to brag of your learning.
sentences.chinese: 吹嘘自己的学识是欠妥的。

sentences.english: These are the people that have every right to brag and maybe be a bit arrogant, yet they remain humble.
sentences.chinese: 这些人有理由吹嘘自己的成功，甚至理应有点自傲，但是他们仍然保持着低调的作风。

detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about what you have done, what you own etc – used to show disapproval

name: imperative
trans: adj. 极重要的，必要的；命令的，强制的；祈使的 n. 重要紧急的事，必要的事；祈使语气，祈使语气动词；命令

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的
detailed_translations.english: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

name: bidding
trans: n. （尤指拍卖中的）出价；（拍卖时买方）报出的价钱；投标；吩咐，要求；叫牌 v. 出价；投标，竞标；努力争取（bid 的现在分词）

name: prescription
trans: n. 处方，药方；处方药；开处方，开药方；<正式>解决方法，诀窍；<法律>取得的时效（根据长期或不确定时期持续使用或以长期习惯为基础确立的要求权）（=positive prescription)） adj. 凭处方方可购买的

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

name: rally
trans: v. 召集，集合；公开支持（或反对）；重新集合，重整（军队）；恢复，重新振作；动员（全体人员）发愤图强；（价格）回升，升值；参加汽车拉力赛；<古>对……善意打趣，嘲笑 n. 集会，大会；赛车，汽车拉力赛；（网球等比赛中的）相持，拉锯；（球队技艺的）改进，提高；恢复健康，康复；（尤指股价）止跌回升

sentences.english: After a shaky start, he rallied and won the title in style.
sentences.chinese: 虽然开局不顺，但他振作精神，最后漂亮地赢得了冠军。

sentences.english: The Tokyo stock market rallied later in the day.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚些时候东京股市止跌回升。

detailed_translations.chinese: 团结；重整；恢复；（网球等）连续对打
detailed_translations.english: to become stronger again after a period of weakness or defeat
a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc

name: disband
trans: vi. 解散 vt. 解散；遣散

sentences.english: All the armed groups will be disbanded.
sentences.chinese: 所有武装团体将被解散。

detailed_translations.english: to stop existing as an organization, or to make something do this

name: distribute
trans: v. 分发，分配；配送，分销；散布，使分布；（印刷）拆（版）还字；周延

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: assign
trans: v. 分派，布置（工作、任务）；分配（某物）；指派，派遣；确定（价值、功能、时间、地点）；转让（财产、权利）

sentences.english: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你给这个会议定了多长时间？

detailed_translations.chinese: 指派， 分配； 布置； 指定
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

name: instruct
trans: v. 指示，吩咐；教授，指导；聘请（律师），托办；通知；（法官向陪审团）建议，作说明

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

name: expedite
trans: v. 加速，促进（行为，过程）

sentences.english: strategies to expedite the decision-making process
sentences.chinese: 加快决策进程的策略

detailed_translations.english: to make a process or action happen more quickly

name: dispatch
trans: v. 派遣；发送；迅速处理，迅速办妥；杀死，处决 n. 派遣，发送；公文，急件；报道，电讯；杀死，除掉

sentences.english: Goods are normally dispatched within 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 货物一般在24小时内派送。

sentences.english: I was carrying dispatches from the ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 我正拿着大使的急件。

detailed_translations.english: to send someone or something somewhere for a particular purpose
a message or report sent quickly from one military officer to another or between government officials

name: nominate
trans: v. 提名，推荐；任命，指派；挑选，指定（事件的日期或地点） adj. （动植物）以种名命名的

sentences.english: Ferraro was the first woman to be nominated for the job of vice president.
sentences.chinese: 费拉罗是第一位获得副总统职位提名的女性。

sentences.english: Next year Mr Jenks will retire and Mr Broadbent will be nominated as his replacement.
sentences.chinese: 明年詹克斯先生退休，布罗德本特先生将获任命接替他的职位。

detailed_translations.english: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize

name: evacuate
trans: v. （把人从危险的地方）疏散，撤离；（从危险的地方）搬出，撤空；（用泵等）抽出，抽空；排泄（粪便等）

sentences.english: Police evacuated the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方将该地区人员全部疏散。

detailed_translations.english: to send people away from a dangerous place to a safe place

name: summon
trans: v. 召唤；召集（会议）；传唤，传讯（出庭）；迫切地要求（帮助）；鼓起（勇气），振作（精神）

sentences.english: Robert summoned the waiter for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特召唤服务员结账。

sentences.english: It took her a full month to summon the courage to tell her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她用了整整一个月的时间才鼓起勇气告诉了母亲。

detailed_translations.english: to order someone to come to a place

name: destine
trans: v. （为某种用途、目的而）指定，预定，选定；区分；意欲；筹划

sentences.english: Over these three years, miss her, read her person, what is he an eldest brother?But his love, destine and leave sorry!
sentences.chinese: 这三年以来，想她，念她的人，何止他大哥一个？可是他的爱，注定是要留下遗憾的！

sentences.english: Authorize the others is a half the battle, an all matters whether important or trivial, can't authorize work the other people's person, destine will meet tremendous obstacle.
sentences.chinese: 授权他人是成功的一半，一个事无巨细，不能将工作授权别人的人，注定会遇到极大的障碍。

sentences.english: Some people destine to wait for other people.
sentences.chinese: 有些人是注定等待别人的。

name: designate
trans: v. 把……定名为，把……描述为；任命，指定；标明，标示 adj. 已当选而尚未上任的

sentences.english: This floor has been designated a no-smoking area.
sentences.chinese: 这楼层已定为无烟区。

sentences.english: Buildings are designated by red squares on the map.
sentences.chinese: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that sth has a particular character or name; to describe sth in a particular way

name: monitor
trans: n. 显示器，监控器；监视仪，监护仪；监督员，监察员；（学校里的）班长，级长；（电台的）监听员；扬声器；巨蜥；浅水重炮舰 v. 监视；监听（外国广播或电话）；监控（无线电或电视传输信号）

sentences.english: a heart monitor
sentences.chinese: 心脏监测仪

detailed_translations.chinese: 班长；监视器，检测器；显示器
detailed_translations.english: a television or part of a computer with a screen, on which you can see pictures or information
to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time

name: accredit
trans: v. 把……归于，归因于；委派；信任，正式认可；授权

sentences.english: That should see you think his accredit what.
sentences.chinese: 那要看你想给他授权什么。

sentences.english: To this, use accredit statement is a very good processing means.
sentences.chinese: 对此，使用授权声明是一个很好的处理方式。

name: culpable
trans: adj. 有罪的；该责备的；不周到的；应受处罚的

sentences.english: Both parties were held to be to some extent culpable.
sentences.chinese: 双方都被追究了一定的责任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有罪的；该责备的；不周到的；应受处罚的
detailed_translations.english: deserving blame

name: critical
trans: adj. 批判的，爱挑剔的；极其重要的，关键的；严重的，危急的；病重的，重伤的；评论性的，评论家的；临界的

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

name: censure
trans: n. <正式>严厉批评，谴责 v. <正式>严厉批评，正式谴责

sentences.english: The ethics committee may take a decision to admonish him or to censure him.
sentences.chinese: 道德规范委员会可能决定对他进行警告或批评。

detailed_translations.english: If you censure someone for something that they have done, you tell them that you strongly disapprove of it
the act of expressing strong disapproval and criticism

name: reproach
trans: n. 责备，批评；责备的话语，批评的言辞；丢脸，耻辱；（给……）带来羞辱的人（或事）；使缺陷或弱点更显突出的事物（a reproach to）；谴责曲（Reproaches） v. 谴责，批评

sentences.english: ‘You don’t need me,’ she said quietly, without reproach.
sentences.chinese: “你不需要我。”她语气平静，没有丝毫责备。

detailed_translations.english: criticism, blame, or disapproval

name: chide
trans: vt. 责骂；斥责 vi. 斥责；责骂

sentences.english: ‘Edward, you are naughty,’ Dorothy chided.
sentences.chinese: “爱德华，你真顽皮。”多萝西斥责道。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that you do not approve of something that they have done or said

name: decry
trans: vt. 责难，谴责；诽谤

sentences.english: It may be tempting for some to decry incentives as nothing but a poisonous fruit of Con-Lib responsibility thinking.
sentences.chinese: 对一些人谴责激励机制只是作为“新政治”责任思考的毒果这样的结论本身是很冒险的。

sentences.english: I know ‘tis the season to decry all things materialistic, but just as we’re inspired by people we are also inspired by things.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是谴责所有事情物质化的时候了，然而正如我们被人所激励一样，我们也受事物的激励。

sentences.english: All of that is grist for the mill for the Russian media, which is popular in the east of the country and uses every opportunity to decry "fascism" in Ukraine.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都像谷物被放进研磨机中一样，被俄国媒体粉碎，后者在这个国家的东部地区广受欢迎，并利用一切机会谴责乌克兰国内的“法西斯主义”。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that you do not approve of something

name: deprecate
trans: vt. 反对；抨击；轻视；声明不赞成

sentences.english: As a lawyer, I would deprecate any sort of legal control on gene therapy at this stage.
sentences.chinese: 作为律师，我会反对在现阶段对基因疗法进行任何形式的法律管制。

sentences.english: Though the environment doesn't have a mouth to deprecate what humans have done to her, she retaliates through action.
sentences.chinese: 尽管环境没有嘴巴来反对人类对她所做的一切，她通过行动来报复。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly disapprove of or criticize something

name: castigate
trans: v. <正式>严厉批评，申斥；苛评

sentences.english: Marx never lost an opportunity to castigate colonialism.
sentences.chinese: 马克思从不放过任何谴责殖民主义的机会。

detailed_translations.english: to criticize or punish someone severely

name: denounce
trans: v. 谴责，痛斥；检举，告发

sentences.english: The group denounced the failure by the authorities to take action.
sentences.chinese: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

sentences.english: She denounced him to the police.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方告发了他。

detailed_translations.english: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

name: condemn
trans: v. 谴责，严厉指责；宣判，判决；使陷入（不愉快的境地）；宣布……不安全；证明（或表明）有罪

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: berate
trans: vt. 严责；申斥

sentences.english: Marion berated Joe for the noise he made.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽恩指责乔制造的噪声。

detailed_translations.english: to speak angrily to someone because they have done something wrong

name: rap
trans: n. 说唱音乐；说唱歌曲；扣击，快速的敲击；<美，非正式> 指控，罪名；<美，非正式>（尤指人或事的不良）名声，声誉；<美，非正式> 指责，苛评；<美，非正式>（尤指冗长或即兴的）谈论，闲聊；一丁点儿，极少 v. 急拍，快敲；表演说唱音乐，说唱；批评，指责；厉声地说（rap out）；<美，非正式> 闲聊，交谈

sentences.english: ‘Come on,’ he rapped impatiently.
sentences.chinese: “得了吧。”他不耐烦地厉声说道。

detailed_translations.english: to say the words of a rap song

detailed_translations.chinese: 敲击，急敲；突然厉声说出；责备，训斥
detailed_translations.english: to say something loudly, suddenly, and in a way that sounds angry
a series of quick sharp hits or knocks

name: rebuke
trans: v. <正式>斥责，指责 n. 指责，叱责，训斥

sentences.english: The president rebuked the House and Senate for not passing those bills within 100 days.
sentences.chinese: 总统谴责参众两院未在100天内通过那些法案。

sentences.english: His statements drew a stinging rebuke from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 他的申明受到了主席严厉的谴责。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指责，非难；制止；使相形见绌
detailed_translations.english: to speak to someone severely about something they have done wrong
Rebuke is also a noun

name: blame
trans: v. 责怪，归咎于；怨，怪 n. 责备，过错，罪责

sentences.english: Don’t blame me – it’s not my fault.
sentences.chinese: 别来怪我——又不是我的错。

sentences.english: I blame his mother. She does everything for him.
sentences.chinese: 怪他母亲不好，她什么事都要为他做。

detailed_translations.english: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad

name: repudiate
trans: vt. 拒绝；否定；批判；与……断绝关系；拒付

sentences.english: He repudiated all offers of friendship.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝任何人给他的友谊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝；否定；批判；与…断绝关系；拒付
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept or continue with something

name: hoarse
trans: adj. 嘶哑的

sentences.english: He was hoarse from laughing.
sentences.chinese: 他笑得嗓子都沙哑了。

detailed_translations.english: if you are hoarse, or if your voice is hoarse, you speak in a low rough voice, for example because your throat is sore

name: colloquial
trans: adj. 口语的，非正式的

sentences.english: ...a colloquial expression.
sentences.chinese: …一个口语表达法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 白话的；通俗的；口语体的
detailed_translations.english: language or words that are colloquial are used mainly in informal conversations rather than in writing or formal speech

name: dumb
trans: adj. 哑的，不能说话的；一时说不出话的，不肯开口的；<非正式>愚蠢的；（计算机终端）简易的 v. 使通俗化；<文>使变哑，使沉默

sentences.english: What a dumb question.
sentences.chinese: 多么愚蠢的问题。

sentences.english: a bunch of dumb kids
sentences.chinese: 一帮笨孩子

sentences.english: ‘What is it?’ I asked, playing dumb (= pretending to be stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: “那是什么？” 我装傻问道。

sentences.english: She’s no dumb blonde (= a pretty woman with blonde hair who seems stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: 她可不是那种没有头脑的金发女郎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 哑的；暂不说话的；愚笨的
detailed_translations.english: stupid

name: hubbub
trans: n. 喧哗；骚动

sentences.english: the hubbub from the market
sentences.chinese: 市场的嘈杂声

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of loud noises, especially the noise of a lot of people talking at the same time

name: dialogue
trans: n. 对白；对话，交换意见 v. <美>（为解决问题而）参加对话，进行讨论；<美>为（电影、戏剧）配上对白

sentences.english: a boring movie full of bad dialog
sentences.chinese: 充满差劲对白的乏味电影

sentences.english: Students were asked to read simple dialogues out loud.
sentences.chinese: 学生被要求大声朗读简单的对话。

detailed_translations.english: a conversation in a book, play, or film

name: nonsense
trans: n. 荒谬的想法（看法），胡说；愚蠢的行为，胡闹；无意义的话（字句） adj. 无意义的，荒谬的 int. 胡说，废话

sentences.english: ‘I’m a prisoner in my own home.’ ‘Nonsense!’
sentences.chinese: “我在自己家里就像个囚犯。”“胡说！”

sentences.english: If you ask me, these modern teaching methods are a load of nonsense (= a lot of nonsense ).
sentences.chinese: 要我说，这些现代教学方法全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: He was talking utter nonsense as usual.
sentences.chinese: 他像平常一样又在胡说八道了。

sentences.english: By 1832 the idea had become an economic nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 到了1832年，那种观点已经成为经济学的谬论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 胡说， 废话； 冒失的行动
detailed_translations.english: ideas, opinions, statements etc that are not true or that seem very stupid

name: excuse
trans: n. 借口，托词；正当理由；宽恕，赦免；拙劣样品，蹩脚货；<美>（医生或父母为学生写的）病假条，请假条 v. 原谅，宽恕；辩解，开脱；准许……离开；同意免除

sentences.english: I’ll excuse you this time, but don’t be late again.
sentences.chinese: 这次我原谅你，但别再迟到了。

sentences.english: Please excuse my bad handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 请原谅，我的字写得不好。

sentences.english: Can I be excused from swimming today? I have a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我今天能不游泳吗？我感冒了。

detailed_translations.english: to forgive someone for doing something that is not seriously wrong, such as being rude or careless
a reason that you invent to explain an action and to hide your real intentions

name: compliment
trans: n. 赞扬，称赞；问候，祝贺 v. 赞美，恭维

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

name: gossip
trans: n. 流言蜚语，小道消息；爱说三道四的人；闲聊 v. 闲聊，说三道四

sentences.english: Who knows how much of the gossip was true.
sentences.chinese: 有谁知道这些流言蜚语有多少是真的呢？

sentences.english: You must avoid gossip and focus on what you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 务必避免流言蜚语，关注你必须做的事务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 流言蜚语；爱说长道短的人
detailed_translations.english: information that is passed from one person to another about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including unkind or untrue remarks

name: oration
trans: n. 演说；致辞；叙述法

sentences.english: ...a brief funeral oration.
sentences.chinese: ...一篇简短的葬礼悼词。

detailed_translations.english: a formal public speech

name: hearsay
trans: n. 传闻，谣言 adj. 传闻的，风闻的

sentences.english: I wouldn’t take any notice of it – it’s just hearsay.
sentences.chinese: 我不会在意，这只不过是传闻而已。

detailed_translations.english: something that you have heard about from other people but do not know to be definitely true or correct

name: interrupt
trans: v. 打断，打扰；使暂停，使中断；阻断，遮挡

sentences.english: Will you stop interrupting me!
sentences.chinese: 别打断我的话！

sentences.english: Sorry to interrupt, but I need to ask you to come downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉打扰了，我得请你下楼来。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise etc

name: rumble
trans: v. 发出隆隆声；轰鸣着缓慢行进；（肚子因饥饿而）咕噜作响；低沉地说；（争论）有节制地持续，低调地持续（rumble on）；<英，非正式>看穿（违法活动或进行违法活动者）；<美，非正式>打群架 n. 持续而低沉的声音，隆隆声；<美，非正式>打群架

sentences.english: The sky, swollen like a black bladder, rumbled and crackled.
sentences.chinese: 天空胀得像个黑色的气囊，发出隆隆声和劈啪声。

detailed_translations.english: If something rumbles, it makes a low, continuous noise
a series of long low sounds

name: gabble
trans: v. 急促而含混不清地说 n. 急促不清的话

sentences.english: Just calm down, stop gabbling, and tell me what has happened.
sentences.chinese: 冷静一下，说话别太急，告诉我发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to say something so quickly that people cannot hear you clearly or understand you properly

name: solicit
trans: v. 请求，索求，征求（意见）；<美>兜售，推销；拉（客），卖淫

sentences.english: Morgan is accused of illegally soliciting campaign contributions.
sentences.chinese: 摩根被指控非法征募竞选捐款。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone for money, help, or information

name: declaim
trans: vi. 慷慨陈词；演讲；朗读 vt. 演讲；慷慨激昂地发表

sentences.english: He raised his right fist and declaimed: "Liar and cheat!"
