sentences.chinese: 他举起右拳慷慨陈词:"骗子！"

detailed_translations.english: to speak loudly, sometimes with actions, so that people notice you

name: confide
trans: v. 托付，委托；吐露，倾诉

sentences.english: I knew she had some fundamental problems in her marriage because she had confided in me a year earlier.
sentences.chinese: 我知道她的婚姻存在一些根本问题，因为她一年前曾向我吐露过。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone you trust about personal things that you do not want other people to know

name: refer
trans: v. 提到，谈及（refer to）；描述，涉及（refer to）；查阅，参考（refer to）；将……送交给（以求获得帮助等）；让（某人）注意；<古>把……归因于；（考试中）淘汰（应试者）

sentences.english: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲话中，他提到了最近的加拿大之行。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

name: chat
trans: v. 闲聊，聊天 n. 闲聊，聊天；鸣禽

sentences.english: John and I sat up until the early hours chatting.
sentences.chinese: 我和约翰聊到凌晨才睡。

detailed_translations.english: to talk in a friendly informal way, especially about things that are not important

name: grumble
trans: v. 抱怨，嘟囔；咕隆，发轰隆声；（内脏）间歇性地闹病 n. 抱怨，牢骚；咕隆声

sentences.english: ‘This is boring,’ Kathleen grumbled.
sentences.chinese: “这真无聊。”凯瑟琳抱怨道。

sentences.english: My only grumble is that there isn't a non-smoking section.
sentences.chinese: 我惟一的抱怨是这儿没有无烟区。

sentences.english: They grumble about how hard they have to work.
sentences.chinese: 他们抱怨自己工作得很辛苦。

sentences.english: Taft grumbled that the law so favoured the criminal that trials seemed like a game of chance.
sentences.chinese: 塔夫脱抱怨法律如此有利于罪犯，使得审判看来像是一场运气的游戏。

detailed_translations.english: to keep complaining in an unhappy way
Grumble is also a noun
If someone grumbles, they complain about something in a bad-tempered way

name: equivocate
trans: vi. 说模棱两可的话；支吾， 躲闪；推诿；含糊其词

sentences.english: He is equivocating a lot about what is going to happen if and when there are elections.
sentences.chinese: 他含含糊糊地说着很多如果进行选举会发生的状况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说模棱两可的话；支吾， 躲闪；推诿；含糊其词
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a clear or direct answer to a question

name: coax
trans: v. 哄，劝诱；连哄带劝地得到；小心地摆弄（机器或装置） n. 同轴电缆 adj. 同轴的，共轴的

sentences.english: ‘Please, Vic, come with us,’ Nancy coaxed.
sentences.chinese: “求你了，维克，跟我们一起去吧。”南希哄劝道。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way

name: outwit
trans: vt. 瞒骗；以智取胜

sentences.english: a wolf that had outwitted hunters for years
sentences.chinese: 一头多年来智胜猎人的狼

detailed_translations.english: to gain an advantage over someone using tricks or clever plans

name: effuse
trans: vt. 流出；涌出；泻出 vi. 流出；涌出；泻出 adj. [植] 疏展的

detailed_translations.english: to pour or flow out

name: accost
trans: vt. 勾引；引诱；对……说话；搭讪

sentences.english: He was accosted by four youths and forced to give them all his money.
sentences.chinese: 四个少年走上前来和他搭讪，逼迫他交出身上所有的钱。

name: account
trans: n. 账户，户头；客户，老主顾；网络账号；描述，报道；账目；账单；赊购账，赊购；理由，解释；重要性；（定期结付的）交易合同；演奏（音乐）；<英>账期交易期 v. 把……视作，认为；解释，说明（account for）；占（一定数量或比例）（account for）；<古>报账

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: exposition
trans: n. 解释，阐述；展览会，博览会；（奏鸣曲等的）呈示部；暴露，揭露

sentences.english: a lucid exposition of educational theories
sentences.chinese: 对教育理论的清晰阐述

sentences.english: an art exposition
sentences.chinese: 一个艺术展览

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明，解释；展览会，博览会
detailed_translations.english: a clear and detailed explanation

name: enunciate
trans: vt. 发音；阐明；宣布 vi. 阐明；清晰地发音

sentences.english: His voice was harsh as he enunciated each word carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他用刺耳的声音小心地一字一句地念着。

sentences.english: She enunciates very slowly and carefully.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢地、仔细地读着。

detailed_translations.english: When you enunciate a word or part of a word, you pronounce it clearly

name: narrate
trans: v. 讲（故事），叙述；给（电影、广播或音乐等）配解说词

sentences.english: The main character narrates the story.
sentences.chinese: 主人公讲述故事。

detailed_translations.english: to tell a story by describing all the events in order, for example in a book

name: insinuate
trans: vt. 暗示；使逐渐而巧妙地取得；使迂回地潜入 vi. 暗讽；说含沙射影的话

sentences.english: What are you trying to insinuate?
sentences.chinese: 你想暗示什么？

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗示；使逐渐而巧妙地取得；使迂回地潜入
detailed_translations.english: to say something which seems to mean something unpleasant without saying it openly, especially suggesting that someone is being dishonest

name: cover
trans: v. 覆盖，遮盖；包括，涉及；报道；占（一片面积）；行走（一段路程）；掩护；翻唱；给……保险；足够支付；守住，封锁；顶替，代替（cover for）；找借口，包庇（cover for）；采取行动（保护自己）（cover oneself）；防守，（棒球）守（垒）；（以更大点数的牌）盖打 n. 覆盖物，盖子，罩子；封面，封底；保险；掩护；掩饰；掩蔽处；转录，翻唱；被子，床单；遮盖，覆盖；代替，替代；掩护活动，掩护身份；板球；（生态）盖度；借口

sentences.english: I’d just returned from covering the Cambodian war.
sentences.chinese: 我刚报道完柬埔寨战争回来。

detailed_translations.english: to report the details of an event for a newspaper or a television or radio programme

name: convey
trans: v. 传送，运输；表达，传递；<法律>转让（土地、财产等）

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.english: Ads convey the message that thin is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.english: He was sent to convey a message to the UN Secretary General.
sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

name: illuminate
trans: v. 照射，照亮；阐明，解释；使容光焕发；用彩灯装饰；用金、银等彩色图案装饰（书稿的书页或首词第一个字母）

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

name: render
trans: v. 使成为，使处于某种状态；给予，提供；（以某种方式）表达，表现；粉刷，往（墙上）抹灰；将（脂肪）熬成油，使熔化；正式宣布（判决或决定）；（供审查，考虑）提交，呈报；<文>放弃，献出；演奏，演唱；翻译；绘制（指用色彩和明暗使轮廓图像具立体感）；秘密引渡（外国罪犯、恐怖嫌疑犯）；从（动物身体）提取（蛋白质、脂肪及其他可用部分） n. 底灰，底泥；<史>交纳

sentences.english: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
sentences.chinese: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

sentences.english: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered
sentences.chinese: 一张3,200美元服务费的账单

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

name: elucidate
trans: v. <正式>阐明，解释

sentences.english: The full picture has not yet been elucidated.
sentences.chinese: 详细情况还没有解释清楚。

detailed_translations.english: to explain something that is difficult to understand by providing more information

name: clarify
trans: v. 澄清，阐明；（通过加热）使净化，使纯净

sentences.english: Reporters asked him to clarify his position (= say exactly what his beliefs are ) on welfare reform.
sentences.chinese: 记者们要求他阐明他在福利改革问题上的立场。

detailed_translations.english: to make something clearer or easier to understand

name: expound
trans: v. 详解，阐述；解释（文学作品，教义作品）的意思

sentences.english: Schmidt continued to expound his views on economics and politics.
sentences.chinese: 施密特继续阐释他关于经济与政治的观点。

detailed_translations.english: to explain or talk about something in detail

name: construe
trans: vt. 分析；解释；翻译 vi. 作文法性的分析

sentences.english: What may seem helpful behaviour to you can be construed as interference by others.
sentences.chinese: 在你看来似乎有助益的行为会被他人看作干涉。

sentences.english: He may construe the approach as a hostile act.
sentences.chinese: 他可能把这种方法理解为一种不友善的行为。

detailed_translations.english: If something is construed in a particular way, its nature or meaning is interpreted in that way

name: delineate
trans: v. （详细地）描述，解释；标明，标示（边界）

sentences.english: Biography must to some extent delineate characters.
sentences.chinese: 在某种程度上，传记一定要描述人物。

detailed_translations.english: If you delineate something such as an idea or situation, you describe it or define it, often in a lot of detail

name: exemplify
trans: v. 是……的典范；举例说明

sentences.english: Problems are exemplified in the report.
sentences.chinese: 问题都在报告中作了举例说明。

detailed_translations.english: to give an example of something

name: depict
trans: v. 描述，描绘

sentences.english: a book depicting life in pre-revolutionary Russia
sentences.chinese: 描写革命前俄国人生活的一本书

detailed_translations.english: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

name: emphasize
trans: v. 强调，着重；重读（单词或短语）；使突出（或明显）

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

name: illustrate
trans: v. 加插图于；说明，阐明；证明，证实

sentences.english: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
sentences.chinese: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。

sentences.english: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
sentences.chinese: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

detailed_translations.english: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

name: highlight
trans: v. 突出，强调；用亮色突出；挑染 n. 最好（或最精彩、最激动人心）的部分；挑染的头发；强光部分

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: specify
trans: v. 明确指出；具体说明；把……列入说明书

sentences.english: Payments will be made for a specified number of months.
sentences.chinese: 款项将在规定的几个月内支付。

sentences.english: They specified a spacious entrance hall.
sentences.chinese: 他们明确要求门厅要宽敞。

detailed_translations.english: to state something in an exact and detailed way

name: elaborate
trans: adj. 复杂的，详尽的；精心制作的 v. 详细说明，详尽阐述；精心制作

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: divulge
trans: vt. 泄露；暴露

sentences.english: Officials refuse to divulge details of the negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 官员们拒绝透露谈判的细节。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone information that should be secret

name: proclaim
trans: v. （正式）宣告，（公开）声明；强调，声称；（标志或通知）宣传，告知；清楚表明，显示

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

name: cite
trans: v. 引用，援引；引证，引以为例；传唤，传讯；嘉奖，表彰 n. <美>引用，引文

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

name: reiterate
trans: v. <正式>重申，反复说

sentences.english: Let me reiterate the most important points.
sentences.chinese: 我来把最重要的几点重申一遍。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat a statement or opinion in order to make your meaning as clear as possible

name: accentuate
trans: vt. 强调；重读

sentences.english: The photograph seemed to accentuate his large nose.
sentences.chinese: 照片似乎突出了他的大鼻子。

detailed_translations.english: to make something more noticeable

name: uniform
trans: n. 制服，校服；<非正式>穿制服的警官；（某一群体的人穿的）典型服装，特有服装；（无线电通讯）字母 U 的代码 adj. 全部相同的，始终如一的；制服式的 v. 使一致；使穿制服

sentences.english: Grade A eggs must be of uniform size.
sentences.chinese: A 级鸡蛋必须大小相同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 统一的；一致的；相同的；均衡的；始终如一的
detailed_translations.english: being the same in all its parts or among all its members
a particular type of clothing worn by all the members of a group or organization such as the police, the army etc

name: unanimity
trans: n. 同意，全体一致

sentences.english: All decisions would require unanimity.
sentences.chinese: 所有决定都需要全体一致同意。

detailed_translations.english: a state or situation of complete agreement among a group of people

name: unanimous
trans: adj. （投票、决定、协议等）全体同意的，无异议的；（所有人）一致同意的，意见一致的

sentences.english: It was decided by a unanimous vote that the school should close.
sentences.chinese: 关闭学校是大家一致通过的决定。

sentences.english: The decision to appoint Matt was almost unanimous.
sentences.chinese: 任命马特的决定几乎是一致通过的。

detailed_translations.english: a unanimous decision, vote, agreement etc is one in which all the people involved agree

name: reconcile
trans: v. 调和，使协调一致；（使）和解，（使）恢复友好关系；调停，调解（争吵）；使顺从于，使接受；核对，查核（账目）

sentences.english: The possibility remains that the two theories may be reconciled.
sentences.chinese: 这两种理论仍是有可能协调的。

sentences.english: The pair were reconciled after Jackson made a public apology.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊公开道歉之后，这两个人又言归于好了。

detailed_translations.english: if you reconcile two ideas, situations, or facts, you find a way in which they can both be true or acceptable

name: reconciliation
trans: n. 和解，复交；协调，和谐一致；对账

sentences.english: Her ex-husband had always hoped for a reconciliation.
sentences.chinese: 她的前夫一直想和她重归于好。

sentences.english: The treaty has brought a new spirit of reconciliation on both sides.
sentences.chinese: 条约使双方产生了新的和解精神。

sentences.english: The leadership announced a programme of national reconciliation (= an attempt by all sides to end a war or trouble in a country ) .
sentences.chinese: 领导层宣布了一个国内各方和解方案。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two people, countries etc become friendly with each other again after quarrelling

name: convention
trans: n. 习俗，惯例；大会，集会；公约，协定；（文学、艺术上的）传统手法，传统风格

sentences.english: a teachers’ convention
sentences.chinese: 教师大会

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans
sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests

name: pact
trans: n. 条约，协议，公约

sentences.english: the Warsaw pact
sentences.chinese: 华沙条约

detailed_translations.english: a formal agreement between two groups, countries, or people, especially to help each other or to stop fighting

name: consult
trans: v. 咨询，请教；商量，商讨；查询，查阅；当顾问

sentences.english: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor without delay.
sentences.chinese: 如果症状持续的话，马上咨询医生。

sentences.english: Have you consulted a dictionary?
sentences.chinese: 你查过词典了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something

name: negotiate
trans: v. （尤指在商业或政治上）谈判，磋商，洽谈；商定，达成协议；顺利通过，成功越过；解决（难题）；议付，洽兑；转让（支票、汇票或票据）

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: confer
trans: v. 授予，赋予；商讨，交换意见

sentences.english: He conferred with Hill and the others in his office.
sentences.chinese: 他和希尔以及他办公室里的其他人进行了商议。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something with other people, so that everyone can express their opinions and decide on something
to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved

name: placate
trans: v. 平息，安抚；怀柔

sentences.english: These changes did little to placate the unions.
sentences.chinese: 这些变革对于工会没有起到多少安抚作用。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone stop feeling angry

name: eloquent
trans: adj. 雄辩的，口才流利的；传神的，明确表示的

sentences.english: an eloquent appeal for support
sentences.chinese: 极具说服力的求助呼吁

detailed_translations.english: able to express your ideas and opinions well, especially in a way that influences people

name: eloquence
trans: n. 流利的口才，流畅的文笔；雄辩术，修辞

sentences.english: He is gifted with rare eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 他天生具有罕见的口才。

sentences.english: On the one hand to expand my insight, on the other hand exercise my eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 一方面扩大我的洞察力，另一方面锻炼我的口才。

sentences.english: I exercise in the race his eloquence and ability to cope, to learn some basic manners.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛中我锻炼了自己口才和应变能力， 学习到了一些基本的礼仪。

name: debate
trans: n. 讨论，辩论 v. 反复思考，斟酌；讨论，辩论

sentences.english: the gun-control debate in the US
sentences.chinese: 美国有关控制枪支的争论

sentences.english: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

name: debatable
trans: adj. 有争议的，有待商榷的

sentences.english: a debatable point
sentences.chinese: 有争议的地方

sentences.english: Whether the object was used for rituals is highly debatable .
sentences.chinese: 这一物件是否曾用作礼器有很大的争议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 未决定的， 有争执的
detailed_translations.english: things that are debatable are not certain because people have different opinions about them

name: squabble
trans: v. （为琐事）发生口角，大声争吵 n. 争吵，口角

sentences.english: Mother is devoted to Dad although they squabble all the time.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈深爱着爸爸，虽然他们总是为琐事争吵。

sentences.english: There have been minor squabbles about phone bills.
sentences.chinese: 为电话账单已闹过口角。

detailed_translations.english: to argue about something unimportant
Squabble is also a noun

name: dispute
trans: n. 争论，辩论，纠纷 v. 对……提出质疑，否认；争论，辩论；争夺，竞争；<旧>阻止（着陆），抵抗（进攻）

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: retort
trans: v. （愤怒或风趣地）反驳，回嘴；<古>对（侮辱，伤害）进行报复；利用（对方的论据）反驳对方；蒸馏，干馏 n. 反驳，回嘴；曲颈瓶，蒸馏器

sentences.english: He was about to make a sharp retort .
sentences.chinese: 他正要尖刻地反驳。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry or humorous reply
to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way

name: brawl
trans: n. 喧闹，斗殴，闹事；布劳尔舞 v. 打斗，闹事，大声争吵；（诗、文）小溪哗哗地流

sentences.english: Fans brawled outside the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 球迷们在体育馆外面闹事。

detailed_translations.english: to quarrel or fight in a noisy way, especially in a public place

name: bicker
trans: v. （为小事）斗嘴；（诗、文）潺潺而流；（火、光）闪耀，闪动 n. 吵嘴，口角 n. （Bicker）（美、英、德）比克尔（人名）

sentences.english: I went into medicine to care for patients, not to waste time bickering over budgets.
sentences.chinese: 我从医是为了治病救人，不是为了预算争吵而浪费时间。

sentences.english: ...as states bicker over territory.
sentences.chinese: …当国与国之间为领土而争执不断时。

sentences.english: The election will end months of political bickering.
sentences.chinese: 这场选举将结束几个月以来的政治争论。

detailed_translations.english: When people bicker, they argue or quarrel about unimportant things

name: haggle
trans: v. 讨价还价，争论；乱劈，乱砍 n. 讨价还价，争论

sentences.english: In many countries you have to haggle before you buy anything.
sentences.chinese: 在许多国家里买东西之前都得讨价还价。

sentences.english: Israel cannot "haggle its way out of" commitments, Erekat added in a statement. A settlement freeze was an Israeli obligation, he said, not a Palestinian precondition.
sentences.chinese: 艾拉卡特在声明中说，以色列不能“讨价还价，逃避承诺”；冻结定居点扩建是以色列的义务，而非巴勒斯坦提出的前提条件。

name: gainsay
trans: vt. 反驳；否定 n. 否认；反对

sentences.english: No one dared to gainsay him.
sentences.chinese: 没有人敢反驳他。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or to disagree with someone

name: refute
trans: v. <正式> 驳斥，批驳；<正式> 否认，辩驳

sentences.english: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种不可能推翻的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

name: disprove
trans: vt. 反驳，证明……是虚假的

sentences.english: These figures disproved Smith’s argument.
sentences.chinese: 这些数据证明史密斯的论点是错误的。

detailed_translations.english: to show that something is wrong or not true

name: controvert
trans: v. 否认，驳斥；就……展开争论

sentences.english: The statement of the last witness controvert the evidence of the first two.
sentences.chinese: 最后一个证人的陈述反驳了前两人的证词。

detailed_translations.english: to deny, refute, or oppose (some argument or opinion)

name: controversy
trans: n. 争论，争议

sentences.english: a political controversy
sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.english: the controversy surrounding Skinner’s theories
sentences.chinese: 围绕斯金纳的理论的争议

sentences.english: (= began ) over the use of the chemicals on crops.
sentences.chinese: 对庄稼施用化学品的做法引起了争论。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

name: controversial
trans: adj. 有争议的，引发争论的

sentences.english: the controversial issue of welfare reform
sentences.chinese: 福利改革这一有争议的话题

sentences.english: a highly controversial (= very controversial ) plan to flood the valley in order to build a dam
sentences.chinese: 一个把山谷淹掉来建造水坝的极具争议的计划

sentences.english: He is a controversial figure (= person who does controversial things ) in the art world.
sentences.chinese: 他是艺术界极具争议的人物。

detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

name: contradict
trans: v. 反驳，否认；相抵触，相矛盾；发生矛盾

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: contradictory
trans: adj. 相互矛盾的，对立的；好反驳的，爱争辩的 n. 矛盾命题

sentences.english: Customs officials have made a series of contradictory statements about the equipment.
sentences.chinese: 海关官员们对于这种设备做出了一系列相互矛盾的陈述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾的；反对的；反驳的；抗辩的
detailed_translations.english: two statements, beliefs etc that are contradictory are different and therefore cannot both be true or correct

name: contravene
trans: vt. 抵触；违反；反驳；否认

sentences.english: Some portions of the bill may contravene state law.
sentences.chinese: 这项议案中的一些部分可能与州法律相抵触。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that is not allowed according to a law or rule

name: contention
trans: n. 看法，观点；争论，争吵；争夺，竞争

sentences.english: His case has become a source of contention between civil liberties activists and the government.
sentences.chinese: 他的案子已变成了公民自由活动家们和政府之间的争论缘由。

detailed_translations.english: a strong opinion that someone expresses

name: cabbage
trans: n. 卷心菜，洋白菜；（作蔬菜食用的）卷心菜叶子，洋白菜叶子；<英，非正式>（冒犯）（因受伤或疾病而）身心残损的人；<英，非正式>生活极乏味的人

sentences.english: I like peas more than cabbage .
sentences.chinese: 比起卷心菜我更喜欢豌豆。

sentences.english: We have cabbage and mutton.
sentences.chinese: 我们有卷心菜和羊肉。

sentences.english: We have fresh cabbage, celery, lettuce and spinach.
sentences.chinese: 有新鲜的卷心菜、芹菜、生菜和菠菜。

detailed_translations.english: a large round vegetable with thick green or purple leaves

name: carrot
trans: n. 胡萝卜；（为鼓励某人做某事而作出的）诱人的承诺；<非正式，贬>红发人（carrots）

sentences.english: grated carrots
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的胡萝卜

sentences.english: carrot juice
sentences.chinese: 胡萝卜汁

detailed_translations.english: a long pointed orange vegetable that grows under the ground

name: celery
trans: n. 芹菜

sentences.english: a stick of celery
sentences.chinese: 一根芹菜

detailed_translations.english: a vegetable with long pale green stems that you can eat cooked or uncooked

name: cereal
trans: n. 谷类食物；谷类植物，谷物 adj. 谷类的；谷类制成的

sentences.english: a bowl of breakfast cereal
sentences.chinese: 一碗早餐麦片

detailed_translations.chinese: 谷类，谷物；谷类食品；谷类植物
detailed_translations.english: a breakfast food made from grain and usually eaten with milk

name: corn
trans: n. 谷物，谷粒；玉米；鸡眼；老一套，煽情的东西 v. 腌（肉类等）；使成粒状

sentences.english: fields of corn
sentences.chinese: 一片片麦田

sentences.english: an ear of corn
sentences.chinese: 谷穗

detailed_translations.english: plants such as wheat,  barley  , and  oats  or their seeds

name: cucumber
trans: n. 黄瓜；胡瓜

sentences.english: I like to eat cucumber sandwiches.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢吃有黄瓜的三明治。

sentences.english: Have some cucumber.
sentences.chinese: 吃点黄瓜吧。

sentences.english: The "gurkophone" is one of their classics, made from a hollowed cucumber , a pepper and a carrot.
sentences.chinese: 黄瓜管“是他们的经典乐器之一，那是用掏空的黄瓜、辣椒和胡萝卜做的。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin round vegetable with a dark green skin and a light green inside, usually eaten raw

name: grain
trans: n. 谷物，谷粒；颗粒，细粒；少量；纹理；（表面的）质地，触感；格令（旧的重量单位，一格令相当于0.065克）；（照片、底片的）显影颗粒；（用于火箭发动机的）固体推进剂；（皮革或其他类似人工材料的）粗糙面，皱面；（石头和煤等原料的）解理面，劈理面；<古>（人的）性格，天性；<史>胭脂虫，胭脂虫红 v. 使表面（或纹理）粗糙；成粒状；（尤指将家具或内表面）漆成木纹（或大理石纹）；将（生皮）去毛；<美>用谷物喂（马）

sentences.english: There were crumbs and grains of sugar on the table.
sentences.chinese: 桌子上有面包屑和糖粒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谷物， 谷粒， 颗粒； 少量， 微量
detailed_translations.english: a single very small piece of a substance such as sand or salt

name: leek
trans: n. 韭；[园艺] 韭葱 n. (Leek)人名；(英)利克；(瑞典)莱克

sentences.english: The Celts used these bowls of unleavened bread to hold a variety of fillings, including – as I discover when Wood hands me a sample – a tasty mixture of smoked fish, leek, hazelnuts and cream.
sentences.chinese: 凯尔特人用这种未发酵的面包“碗”来放各种各样的食物，我发现伍德今天放的食物就有很多，包括一种烟熏鱼、韭葱、榛子和奶油的混合物。

sentences.english: In the summer of 1917, he was inspired by the memory of the potato-and-leek soup of his childhood, which his mother and grandmother used to make.
sentences.chinese: 1917年夏天，他受到童年时期妈妈和奶奶做过的土豆韭葱汤的启发。

detailed_translations.english: a vegetable with a long white stem and long flat green leaves, which tastes like an onion

name: lettuce
trans: n. [园艺] 生菜；莴苣；（美）纸币

sentences.english: Do you like lettuce in sandwiches?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢在三明治里放生菜吗？

sentences.english: Do you like lettuce in sandwiches?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢吃莴苣三明治吗?。

sentences.english: We have fresh cabbage, celery, lettuce and spinach.
sentences.chinese: 有新鲜的卷心菜、芹菜、生菜和菠菜。

detailed_translations.english: a round vegetable with thin green leaves eaten raw in salads

name: millet
trans: n. 小米，粟；稷，黍的子实；黍类 n. （Millet）（美、法）米列特（人名）

sentences.english: The maize and millet were just putting forth ears.
sentences.chinese: 玉米粟子刚刚吐穗。

detailed_translations.english: the small seeds of a plant similar to grass, used as food

name: mustard
trans: n. 芥末酱；芥末黄，深黄色；芥菜；强烈的兴趣

sentences.english: I'm not especially fond of mustard.
sentences.chinese: 芥末我吃不来。

sentences.english: This meat should be seasoned with salt and mustard.
sentences.chinese: 这肉里应该加点盐和芥末调味。

sentences.english: I gave them ketchup and mustard, and they gave me everything.
sentences.chinese: 我递给他们番茄酱和芥末酱，他们给了我一切！

detailed_translations.english: a yellow sauce with a strong taste, eaten especially with meat

name: oats
trans: n. 燕麦；燕麦片（oat 的复数）；燕麦粥 n. （Oats）人名；（英）奥茨

sentences.english: Oats provide good, nutritious food for horses.
sentences.chinese: 燕麦为马提供营养丰富的好饲料。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燕麦；燕麦片（oat的复数）；燕麦粥
detailed_translations.english: the grain from which flour or oatmeal is made and that is used in cooking, or in food for animals

name: onion
trans: n. 洋葱，洋葱头

sentences.english: Chop the onions finely.
sentences.chinese: 把洋葱切碎。

sentences.english: red onions
sentences.chinese: 红皮洋葱

sentences.english: home-made onion soup
sentences.chinese: 自制的洋葱汤

detailed_translations.english: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or white skin and many layers. Onions have a strong taste and smell.

name: pea
trans: n. 豌豆（粒）；豆角；<西印度>豆荚

sentences.english: roast chicken with peas and carrots
sentences.chinese: 烤鸡配豌豆胡萝卜

detailed_translations.english: a round green seed that is cooked and eaten as a vegetable, or the plant on which these seeds grow

name: peanut
trans: n. 花生，花生米；<非正式>很少的钱（peanuts）；小片聚苯乙烯泡沫塑料（peanuts）

sentences.english: a packet of roasted peanuts
sentences.chinese: 一袋烤花生

detailed_translations.english: a pale brown nut in a thin shell which grows under the ground

name: pepper
trans: n. 胡椒粉；辣椒，甜椒，灯笼椒；胡椒；辣椒粉；（棒球）热身投击球练习 v. （在食物上）撒胡椒粉；连续射击；在……上撒，使布满； （演讲、文章等）充满……

sentences.english: salt and pepper
sentences.chinese: 盐和胡椒粉

detailed_translations.english: a powder that is used to add a hot taste to food
to add pepper to food

name: potato
trans: n. 马铃薯，土豆，洋芋；马铃薯植株；<英，非正式>（尤指脚后跟部的）袜子破洞

sentences.english: Marie stood at the sink, peeling potatoes (= cutting off the skin ) .
sentences.chinese: 玛丽站在洗涤槽边削土豆皮。

detailed_translations.chinese: [作物] 土豆，[作物] 马铃薯
detailed_translations.english: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or pale yellow skin, that grows under the ground

name: pumpkin
trans: n. 南瓜，倭瓜；南瓜藤；<美>小南瓜（一种称呼所爱的人的方式）

sentences.english: pumpkin pie
sentences.chinese: 南瓜饼

detailed_translations.english: a very large orange fruit that grows on the ground, or the inside of this fruit

name: radish
trans: n. 小萝卜（可在色拉中生食）；萝卜植物

sentences.english: She carved a flower out of a radish.
sentences.chinese: 她把萝卜刻成一朵花。

sentences.english: There are many different kinds of kimchi - some made with cabbage, others made with cucumber or radish.
sentences.chinese: 泡菜有非常多不同的种类，一些是由白菜做成的，一些是由黄瓜或者萝卜做成的。

sentences.english: After a lifetime of poverty, his last few years were spent in comparable comfort.
sentences.chinese: 他穷了一辈子，最后几年还算过得比较舒适。

detailed_translations.english: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

name: comparable
trans: adj. 可比的，可比较的；类似的，同类的

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

name: similar
trans: adj. 相像的，类似的；（几何图形）相似的 n. <古>相似之人（或物）；顺势药物（指疗效与某些疾病症状相似的药物，为顺势疗法的基础）

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

name: dissimilar
trans: adj. 不同的

sentences.english: His methods were not dissimilar to those used by Freud.
sentences.chinese: 他用的方法和弗洛伊德用的没有什么不同。

detailed_translations.english: not the same

name: subordinate
trans: n. 部属，下级；从属，次要 v. 使从属于，使处于次要地位；使隶属，使服从 adj. 从属的，下级的；次要的

sentences.english: a subordinate officer
sentences.chinese: 下级官员

detailed_translations.chinese: 下级的，级别低的；次要的，从属的
detailed_translations.english: in a less important position than someone else
someone who has a lower position and less authority than someone else in an organization

detailed_translations.chinese: 使处于次要地位， 使从属于
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in a less important position

name: monotonous
trans: adj. 单调乏味的，毫无变化的；无抑扬顿挫的

sentences.english: a monotonous diet
sentences.chinese: 单调的饮食

sentences.english: a little boy who wet his bed with monotonous regularity
sentences.chinese: 一个老是尿床的小男孩

detailed_translations.english: boring because of always being the same

name: typical
trans: adj. 典型的，有代表性的；一贯的，平常的；不出所料，特有的；象征性的

sentences.english: typical British weather
sentences.chinese: 典型的英国天气

sentences.english: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

detailed_translations.english: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

name: invert
trans: v. 使倒置，使反转；使（位置、顺序或关系）颠倒，使互换；（通过改变音高变化方向）修改（乐句），转回；转位；求逆，求反 n. 仰拱，倒拱；管道内底；颠倒图案的错印邮票；倒置物，倒悬者 adj. 转化的

sentences.english: Invert the cake onto a serving plate.
sentences.chinese: 把蛋糕倒扣过来放到一个盘子上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…转化；使…颠倒；使…反转；使…前后倒置
detailed_translations.english: to put something in the opposite position to the one it was in before, especially by turning it upside down (= the bottom is on the top and the top is on the bottom )

detailed_translations.chinese: 颠倒的事物；倒置物；倒悬者

name: inverse
trans: adj. 相反的，倒转的；颠倒的，逆的 n. 相反（的事物），颠倒（的事物）（the inverse）；（数）反数，倒数；（数）逆元素

sentences.english: Clearly, the amount of money people save increases in inverse proportion to the amount they spend.
sentences.chinese: 显然，人们储蓄的增加与消费成反比。

sentences.english: the inverse relationship between prices and interest rates
sentences.chinese: 价格和利率之间的反比关系

detailed_translations.english: if there is an inverse relationship between two amounts, one gets bigger at the same rate as the other gets smaller
the complete opposite of something

name: preferable
trans: adj. 更好的，更合适的

sentences.english: Anything was preferable to the tense atmosphere at home.
sentences.chinese: 什么都比家里的紧张气氛好。

sentences.english: In warm weather, clothes made of natural fabrics are infinitely preferable (= much better ) .
sentences.chinese: 天气暖和的时候，穿天然织物的衣服要舒适得多。

detailed_translations.english: better or more suitable

name: approximate
trans: adj. 大概的，近似的 v. 类似，接近；模仿，模拟；粗略估计

sentences.english: For each approximate solution of a parameterized problem, the app also displays the margin of error.
sentences.chinese: 对于每一个参数化问题的近似结果，这个程序也会显示误差的边界。

sentences.chinese: 直到1995年发布的半本，块在箱子里还是未排序的，所以最佳适合策略还只是近似的。

sentences.chinese: 这个模型会被下载到智能手机上，通过引用预先计算好的结果来找到一个对应新的参数组的近似结果。

detailed_translations.english: to be close to a particular number
an approximate number, amount, or time is close to the exact number, amount etc, but could be a little bit more or less than it

name: coordinate
trans: v. 协调，配合；使身体协调；（使颜色、款式、风格等）搭配，配套；给 （原子或分子）配位，与……形成共价键 n. 坐标；配套服装；同等级（或类别）的人（或事物） adj. 地位相当的，同等重要的；（语法）并列的；（化学）配位的

sentences.english: Matching bag and accessories provide a complete ensemble of colour coordinates.
sentences.chinese: 颜色协调的包和饰品使全套服装的颜色搭配齐全了。

detailed_translations.english: one of a set of numbers which give the exact position of a point on a map, computer screen etc
equal in importance or rank in a sentence
to organize an activity so that the people involved in it work well together and achieve a good result

name: homogeneous
trans: adj. 同种类的，同性质的；齐性的，齐次的；同形态（固态、液态或气态）的

sentences.chinese: 同种族人组成的社会

detailed_translations.english: consisting of people or things that are all of the same type

name: identical
trans: adj. 完全相同的；同一的；（双胞胎）同卵的；恒等的

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

name: peerless
trans: adj. 无与伦比的；出类拔萃的；无比的

sentences.chinese: 举世无双的蓝调音乐家比比金

detailed_translations.chinese: 无与伦比的；出类拔萃的；无比的
detailed_translations.english: better than any other

name: equal
trans: adj. （在数量、大小、程度、价值方面）相等的，相同的；平等的，同等的；胜任的，合适的；势均力敌的 v. （在大小、数字、数量上）等于；比得上，达到；导致，结果为 n. 同等的人，相等物

sentences.english: Both candidates received an equal number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 两位候选人的得票数相等。

sentences.english: I’m not sure he’s equal to the task.
sentences.chinese: 我不确定他是否能胜任这项任务。

sentences.english: He treats all his staff as equals.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有员工都一视同仁。

sentences.english: Two plus two equals four.
sentences.chinese: 二加二等于四。

detailed_translations.english: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else
someone who is as important, intelligent etc as you are, or who has the same rights and opportunities as you do
to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else

name: equate
trans: v. （使）等同；使（两个或两个以上事物）相等，使平衡

sentences.chinese: 我总是提防着穿制服的人，因为我将其等同于权力及权威。

trans: adj. 等同的，等效的 n. 对等的人（或事物），对应的人（或事物）；当量（equivalent weight）

sentences.chinese: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

detailed_translations.english: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else

name: intermediate
trans: adj. 居中的，中间的；中等程度的，中级的 n. 中级水平者，中级学生；中间事物；（化合物）中间体 v. 充当调解人，斡旋

sentences.english: an intermediate coursebook
sentences.chinese: 中级课本

sentences.english: an intermediate stage/step in a process
sentences.chinese: 中间阶段 / 步骤

detailed_translations.english: having more than a basic knowledge of sth but not yet advanced

name: neutral
trans: adj. 中立的，不偏不倚的；中性的，不带感情色彩的；暗淡的，素净的；（化学中）中性的，非酸非碱的；不带电的 n. （车辆排挡的）空挡；中立者，中立国；素净色，中和色；不活动，停滞；不带电的接触点

sentences.english: I always tried to remain neutral when they started arguing.
sentences.chinese: 他们争论起来的时候我总是努力保持中立。

sentences.chinese: 克莱夫决定采取中立立场。

sentences.english: The British government acted as a neutral observer during the talks.
sentences.chinese: 英国政府在会谈中扮演了中立观察员的角色。

sentences.chinese: 官方新闻报道采用的中性语言

name: backward
trans: adj. 向后的，朝后的；倒退的；落后的；迟钝的 adv. 向后，朝后（=backwards）；反向地，逆向地（=backwards）；向过去（=backwards）；倒退地，退步地（=backwards） n. 后面（或过去）的部分

sentences.chinese: 她头也不回地走了。

sentences.chinese: 他倒着干活，从上往下盖房子。

detailed_translations.english: looking or facing in the direction that is behind you
If you do something backward, you do it in the opposite way to the usual way

name: relatively
trans: adv. 相当地，相对地

sentences.chinese: 这个系统使用起来相对容易。

sentences.english: E-commerce is a relatively recent phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 电子商务相对而言是新兴事物。

detailed_translations.english: something that is relatively small, easy etc is fairly small, easy etc compared to other things

name: shade
trans: n. 背阴处，阴凉处；（图画中的）暗处；遮光物，灯罩；<美>（能上下卷叠的）窗帘，百叶窗；<非正式>太阳镜，墨镜（shades）；（色彩的）浓淡深浅，色度；差别，不同；略微，少量（a shade）；让人想起……的事物（shades of）；次要地位，不显眼；<文>鬼，幽灵；地狱，冥府（the Shades）；<史>剪影 v. 为……遮阳（挡光），遮蔽（光线）；（用铅笔或加色）描黑，描影；使阴暗，使阴郁；（色彩）渐变；<非正式>（比赛）稍胜一筹，略占优势；（数量、速度或价格）略降；<美>细微改动以掩盖事实

sentences.chinese: 淡 / 浅 / 艳 / 柔和的红色

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of red, green, blue etc

trans: n. 生殖，繁殖；复印，再版；（声音的）复制，录制；复制品，仿制品

sentences.chinese: 科学家研究了海豚的繁殖情况、进食规律和健康状况。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["sexual reproduction"]}
sentences.chinese: 有性繁殖

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of producing babies, young animals, or plants

name: inferior

sentences.english: I felt very inferior among all those academics.
sentences.chinese: 与那些大学教师在一起，我自惭形秽。

sentences.english: inferior goods
sentences.chinese: 质量低劣的商品

detailed_translations.english: not good, or not as good as someone or something else

name: sample
trans: n. 样本，样品；试用产品，试样；（供科学或医学检测用的）抽样样本；（抽查的）样本，抽选人员；（用于新乐曲中的）选录的歌曲片段 v. 品尝，尝试（食品、饮料）；体验（活动）；对……作抽样调查；节录，选录（歌曲等，用于其他录音）；确定（模拟信号）瞬时值 adj. 样品的，实例的

sentences.english: They took a blood sample to test for hepatitis.
sentences.chinese: 他们取了血样做肝炎化验。

detailed_translations.english: a small part or amount of something that is examined in order to find out something about the whole

name: medium
trans: n. 媒介，媒体；方法，手段；（艺术创作）材料，素材；灵媒，巫师；培养基；环境；中等，中号；存储（或打印）介质；（颜料）溶剂（如油或水）；（品质、状态）中等，中庸 adj. 中等的，中间的，适中的；五分熟的，半熟的；（程度、强度或数量）平均的；（颜色）不深不浅的，适中的；（投球，投球手）中速的

sentences.english: Advertising is a powerful medium.
sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.english: hair of medium length
sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

detailed_translations.english: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc

name: counterpart
trans: n. 对应的人（或事物）；（法律文件的）副本

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: midst
trans: n. 中部，中间 prep. 在……中间，在……之中（=amidst）

sentences.chinese: 我担心我们中间有内奸。

detailed_translations.english: in a particular group
surrounded by people or things

trans: n. 差异，对比；对照物，明显不同的事物；（摄影或绘画中的）颜色反差，明暗对比；（电视屏幕的）图像明暗对比度，反差 v. 对比，对照；显出明显的差异，形成对比

sentences.english: an essay comparing and contrasting (= showing how two things are similar and different ) Verdi and Wagner and their operas
sentences.chinese: 把威尔第和瓦格纳以及他们的歌剧进行比较和对照的一篇文章

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成对比， 对比之下显出区别
detailed_translations.english: if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising
something that is very different from something else
if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising

name: compare
trans: v. 比较，对比；把……比作；（与……）相比；构成（形容词或副词）的比较级和最高级 n. 比较

sentences.english: The report compares the different types of home computer available.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告比较了市场上不同类型的家用计算机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 把…比作

name: copy
trans: v. 抄写，誊写；模仿，效法；作弊，抄袭；听见（或明白）无线电收发报机中讲话人的话；复制，拷贝 n. 一本，一册，一份；复印件，副本；原稿，素材；广告文字

sentences.english: back-up copies of your files
sentences.chinese: 你的文档的备份

sentences.english: Could you copy this letter and send it out, please?
sentences.chinese: 你能把这封信复印一份发出去吗？

detailed_translations.english: something that is made to be exactly like another thing

name: imitate
trans: v. 模仿，仿效；作滑稽模仿；仿造，伪造

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

name: resemble
trans: v. 像，与……相似

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: affinity
trans: n. 喜好，喜爱；类同，密切关系；亲近感，亲和；适应性，匹配度；（与血缘关系相对的）姻亲关系；亲和力，亲和性

sentences.english: He has a close affinity with the landscape and people he knew when he was growing up.
sentences.chinese: 他对他成长过程中所熟悉的景色和人们有一种很强的亲切感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 密切关系；吸引力；姻亲关系；类同
detailed_translations.english: a close relationship between two things because of qualities or features that they share

name: exception
trans: n. 例外，除外

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: exceptional
trans: adj. 卓越的，杰出的；不寻常的，罕见的；（心理或身体上）有缺陷的 n. （公司账目上的）异常项目

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: A review panel concluded that there were no exceptional circumstances that would warrant a lesser penalty for him.
sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: unusually good

name: relieved
trans: adj. 放心的，宽慰的 v. 缓和（不快或痛苦）；减轻（问题的严重性）；调剂，使有趣（relieve 的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: A relieved smile spread over his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸上绽开了宽慰的笑容。

name: extra
