sentences.english: Could you get an extra loaf of bread?
sentences.chinese: 你能多拿一条面包吗？

sentences.english: Allow extra time for your journey.
sentences.chinese: 要给你的旅程多留出点时间。

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to take extra care.
sentences.chinese: 建议司机开车要格外小心。

sentences.english: You’re going to have to work extra hard to pass the exam.
sentences.chinese: 你要格外用功才能通过考试。

detailed_translations.english: more of something, in addition to the usual or standard amount or number
used to emphasize an adjective or adverb

name: extraneous
trans: adj. 外来的；没有关联的；来自体外的

sentences.english: extraneous noises
sentences.chinese: 外面传来的噪声

detailed_translations.chinese: 外来的；没有关联的；来自体外的
detailed_translations.english: coming from outside

name: irrelevant
trans: adj. 不相关的，不相干的

sentences.english: We’re focussing too much on irrelevant details.
sentences.chinese: 我们过于关注不相干的细节。

sentences.english: Students viewed Latin as boring and irrelevant.
sentences.chinese: 学生认为拉丁语无聊且无关紧要。

detailed_translations.english: not useful or not relating to a particular situation, and therefore not important

name: exclude
trans: vt. （故意）不包括，把……排除在外；认为……不可能，排除……的可能；阻挡；开除（学生）；防止……的发生

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

name: exclusive
trans: adj. 独有的，专用的；高档的，昂贵的；不含……的；排外的；排斥的；全部的；唯一关心的；（新闻或报道）独家的；（条款）除外责任的；高级的，昂贵的 n. 独家新闻，独家报道

sentences.english: Bel Air is an exclusive suburb of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 贝莱尔是洛杉矶郊外一处高级住宅区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢华的，高级的；独有的，独享的；排斥的，排他的；不包括…的，不把…计算在内的
detailed_translations.english: available or belonging only to particular people, and not shared
an important or exciting story that is printed in only one newspaper, because that newspaper was the first to find out about it

name: exclusion
trans: n. 排斥，排除在外；被排除在外的人（或事物）；认为不可能；（合约中的）除外事项；<英>开除学籍

sentences.english: Your essays tend to concentrate on one theme to the exclusion of everything else.
sentences.chinese: 你的文章往往会集中于一个主题而不顾及其他各个方面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 排除；排斥；驱逐；被排除在外的事物
detailed_translations.english: when someone is not allowed to take part in something or enter a place

name: unconventional
trans: adj. 非常规的，不依惯例的；（人、态度、行为）不遵循传统的，标新立异的

sentences.english: Linus Pauling is an unconventional genius.
sentences.chinese: 莱纳斯·鲍林是个奇才。

sentences.english: He was known for his unconventional behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他曾因另类行为而出名。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非传统的, 不合惯例的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their attitude or behaviour as unconventional, you mean that they do not behave in the same way as most other people in their society

name: external
trans: adj. 外部的，外面的；对外的，与外国有关的；外来的，外聘的；（药品等类似物质）外用的 n. 外表，外部特征

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: impertinent
trans: adj. 不恰当的；无礼的；粗鲁的；不相干的

sentences.english: He was always asking impertinent questions.
sentences.chinese: 他老是问一些唐突的问题。

sentences.english: You are an impertinent young woman.
sentences.chinese: 你这姑娘真没礼貌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不恰当的；无礼的；粗鲁的；不相干的
detailed_translations.english: rude and not respectful, especially to someone who is older or more important

name: besides
trans: prep. 除……之外（还） adv. 而且，再说；此外，也

sentences.english: I need the money. And besides, when I agree to do something, I do it.
sentences.chinese: 我需要这笔钱，而且，我一旦答应做什么事情就会做到。

sentences.english: The area has stunning scenery, beautiful beaches, and much more besides.
sentences.chinese: 那个地方有迷人的景色、美丽的沙滩，除此之外还有很多很多。

detailed_translations.english: used when adding another reason

name: scope
trans: n. 范围，领域；（发挥能力的）机会，施展余地；视野，眼界；观测仪器（如望远镜、显微镜等）；（船抛锚时的）缆绳长度；特定论点的数量 v. 评估，调查（scope sth. out）；确定（规划项目）的范围；<非正式>仔细看，彻底检查

sentences.english: measures to limit the scope of criminals’ activities
sentences.chinese: 限制罪犯活动范围的措施

detailed_translations.english: the range of things that a subject, activity, book etc deals with

name: span
trans: n. 时间跨度，一段时间；（桥或拱的）墩距，跨距；宽度，翼展；范围，包括的种类；（航海）跨绳；一队人（或动物）；数值范围；一掌的长度 v. 持续，贯穿；包括（广大地区），涵盖（多项内容）；横跨，跨越；张开手覆盖（或环绕）；<南非>给（动物）套上轭 adj. 整洁干净的，照管得很好的（spick and span）

sentences.english: I worked with him over a span of six years.
sentences.chinese: 我和他共事达六年之久。

sentences.english: The bridge crosses the river in a single span.
sentences.chinese: 河上的桥为单跨桥。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that sth lasts or is able to continue

name: content
trans: adj. 满足的，满意的，甘愿的 n. 目录；所含物，容纳的东西；（书、文章、演讲、电影等的）内容；含量；满足，满意；投赞成票的贵族院议员；网上信息，电子信息 v. 使满意，使满足

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

name: save
trans: v. 救助，搭救；避免，减少；积攒，储蓄；节省（钱、时间或其他资源）；保存，保留；收集；（为某人）保留；（计算机）保存（数据）；使健康长寿，护佑；（足球等）救球，防止对方进球；（棒球）（替补投手） 保持（其他投手取得的领先地位）；（基督教）拯救（某人），使摆脱罪孽 n. （足球等守门员的）救球；（棒球）（替补投手） 保持（其他投手取得的领先地位）；（计算机）存储数据 prep. <正式> 除……之外

sentences.english: We’ll save a lot of time if we go by car.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是开车去，可以节省很多时间。

sentences.english: Everyone is being encouraged to save energy.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都被鼓励节约能源。

sentences.english: ways to save money on heating bills
sentences.chinese: 节省取暖费的种种办法

detailed_translations.english: to use less money, time, energy etc so that you do not waste any

name: deviate
trans: v. 偏离，脱离；违背 adj. 离经叛道的 n. 异类，偏离规范的人；偏离

sentences.english: They stopped you as soon as you deviated from the script.
sentences.chinese: 你一偏离剧本，他们就会叫停。

detailed_translations.english: to change what you are doing so that you are not following an expected plan, idea, or type of behaviour

name: digress
trans: vi. 离题；走向岔道

sentences.english: I've digressed a little to explain the situation so far, so let me now recap.
sentences.chinese: 我刚才稍微离题说明了迄今的情况，现在让我重述一下要点。

sentences.english: She digressed from her prepared speech to pay tribute to the president.
sentences.chinese: 她偏离了预先准备的讲稿，对总统表示了敬意。

detailed_translations.english: If you digress, you move away from the subject you are talking or writing about and talk or write about something different for a while

name: embrace
trans: v. 拥抱；欣然接受，乐意采纳；包括，涉及；围绕，环绕 n. 拥抱；接受，信奉

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

name: cover
trans: v. 覆盖，遮盖；包括，涉及；报道；占（一片面积）；行走（一段路程）；掩护；翻唱；给……保险；足够支付；守住，封锁；顶替，代替（cover for）；找借口，包庇（cover for）；采取行动（保护自己）（cover oneself）；防守，（棒球）守（垒）；（以更大点数的牌）盖打 n. 覆盖物，盖子，罩子；封面，封底；保险；掩护；掩饰；掩蔽处；转录，翻唱；被子，床单；遮盖，覆盖；代替，替代；掩护活动，掩护身份；板球；（生态）盖度；借口

sentences.english: I’d just returned from covering the Cambodian war.
sentences.chinese: 我刚报道完柬埔寨战争回来。

detailed_translations.english: to report the details of an event for a newspaper or a television or radio programme

name: comprise
trans: v. 包括，包含；构成，组成

sentences.english: The house comprises two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子有两间卧室、一间厨房和一间起居室。

sentences.english: Women comprise a high proportion of part-time workers.
sentences.chinese: 兼职人员中妇女占了很大一部分。

detailed_translations.english: to consist of particular parts, groups etc

name: bias
trans: n. 偏见，成见；偏好，天赋；倾向，趋势；斜纹；（统计）偏差，偏倚；偏重心球形；偏压，偏统 v. 使有偏见，使偏心；加偏压（或偏流）于 adj. 偏斜的 adv. 偏斜地

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

name: deflect
trans: vt. 使转向；使偏斜；使弯曲 vi. 转向；偏斜

sentences.english: He deflected the blow with his forearm.
sentences.chinese: 他用前臂挡开了打来的一拳。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something deflects something that is moving, or if it deflects, it turns in a different direction

name: embody
trans: v. 具体表现，体现；收录，包括；<古>（尤指为军事目的）组织

sentences.english: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现，使具体化；具体表达
detailed_translations.english: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

name: accommodate
trans: v. 为……提供住宿；容纳，提供空间；考虑到，顾及；顺应，适应；帮助（某人），向……施以援手；迎合，迁就；调解

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: preclude
trans: v. <正式>阻止，妨碍（preclude sb. from）

sentences.english: rules that preclude experimentation in teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 禁止进行教学方法试验的规定

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something or make something impossible

name: forthright
trans: adj. 直率的；直截了当的 adv. 直率地；马上；立即 n. 直路

sentences.english: She answered in her usual forthright manner .
sentences.chinese: 她以一贯的直率作了回答。

detailed_translations.english: direct and honest - used in order to show approval

name: shortcut
trans: n. 近路；捷径，快捷方法；（电脑操作中的）快捷方式；（计算机）快捷键 v. 通过使用捷径缩短（路线、程序等）；抄近道

sentences.english: I tried to take a shortcut and got lost.
sentences.chinese: 我试着走近路，结果迷路了。

sentences.english: Fame can be a shortcut to love and money.
sentences.chinese: 名望可以是得到爱情和金钱的捷径。

detailed_translations.english: a quicker way of getting somewhere than the usual route

name: tip
trans: v. （使）倾斜，（使）斜侧；给小费；<英>扔掉，倒掉（垃圾）；倾倒，倒出；打翻；（用液体、颜色等）覆盖……的尖端；预言……获胜；轻触，轻碰；密报，透露消息，告诫 n. 指点，诀窍，建议；小费；末梢，尖端；<英>垃圾场；<英，非正式>脏乱的地方；（对赛马、比赛结果的）预测，内幕消息；顶端附加物；（尤指给警方的）密报；（对运动的球或冰球的）轻碰，轻击；手触帽檐，脱帽（致敬、问好或道别的动作）；擦棒球

sentences.english: He kissed the tip of her nose.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的鼻尖。

sentences.english: gardening tips
sentences.chinese: 园艺小窍门

sentences.english: Did you leave a tip ?
sentences.chinese: 你留小费了吗？

sentences.english: His helmet had tipped forward and the boy pushed it back.
sentences.chinese: 头盔向前耷拉下来，男孩把它往后推了推。

detailed_translations.english: the end of something, especially something pointed
to move into a sloping position, so that one end or side is higher than the other, or to make something do this

name: means
trans: n. 方法，手段；财富，金钱 v. 表示……的意思，作……的解释；意味着；打算，意欲（mean 的第三人称单数形式）

sentences.english: The only means of communication was sign language.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的交流方法是手语。

sentences.english: The window was our only means of escape .
sentences.chinese: 跳窗是我们唯一的逃生方法。

sentences.english: Do you have any means of identification ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.english: art as a means of expression
sentences.chinese: 作为一种表达方式的艺术

sentences.english: Homework should not be used as a means of controlling children.
sentences.chinese: 家庭作业不应该作为约束儿童的手段。

sentences.english: I had no means of telling him I would be late.
sentences.chinese: 我没有办法告诉他我会迟到。

sentences.english: Brian was prepared to use any means to get what he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩准备不择手段地得到他想要的。

sentences.english: They had entered the country by unlawful means .
sentences.chinese: 他们通过非法途径进入了这个国家。

sentences.english: the means by which performance is assessed
sentences.chinese: 评估表现的手段

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing or achieving something

name: via
trans: prep. 经由，经过（某一地方）；通过，借助于（某种手段或人）

sentences.english: We flew to Athens via Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我们经由巴黎飞往雅典。

detailed_translations.english: travelling through a place on the way to another place

name: direct
trans: adj. 径直的，笔直的；坦率的；直射的；直接的，亲身的；正好的；直系的 v. 把……对准；管理，指导；给……指路；指引，引导；导演；指示，命令；交予，寄至 adv. 径直地，直达地；亲自，直接

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: access
trans: n. 入口，通道；获得的机会，使用权；（对计算机存储器的）访问，存取；（情感）爆发，发作；探视权 v. 接近，进入；获取，访问（计算机信息） adj. <美>（电视节目或时间等）对外公开的

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
sentences.chinese: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

name: faint
trans: adj. 模糊的，微弱的；微小的，可能性不大的；虚弱的，头晕目眩的；不热情的 n. 晕倒，昏厥 v. 昏厥；<古>变得微弱，衰落；变得没有气力

sentences.english: She gave a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 她淡淡一笑。

sentences.english: a very faint noise
sentences.chinese: 很微弱的声响

sentences.english: the faint light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 微弱的晨光

detailed_translations.chinese: 模糊的；头晕的；虚弱的；[医] 衰弱的
detailed_translations.english: difficult to see, hear, smell etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏倒；变得微弱；变得没气力
detailed_translations.english: to suddenly become unconscious for a short time
an act of becoming unconscious

name: gloom
trans: n. 忧郁，绝望；昏暗，幽暗 v. 外观昏暗；显得萧条（或消沉）

sentences.english: He peered into the gathering (= increasing ) gloom.
sentences.chinese: 他在渐深的暮色中眺望远方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏暗， 阴暗； 忧郁， 沮丧
detailed_translations.english: almost complete darkness

name: gloomy
trans: adj. 阴暗的，幽暗的；沮丧的，悲伤的；前景黯淡的，悲观的

sentences.english: The report paints a gloomy picture of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧郁的， 沮丧的； 令人沮丧的； 昏暗的， 阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that things will not improve

name: luminous
trans: adj. 夜光的，发亮的；鲜亮的，鲜艳的；照亮的，明亮的；睿智的，美丽的；光亮的

sentences.english: luminous paint
sentences.chinese: 发光涂料

sentences.english: Her large dark eyes were almost luminous.
sentences.chinese: 她那双黑色的大眼睛几乎是亮闪闪的。

detailed_translations.english: shining in the dark

name: illuminate
trans: v. 照射，照亮；阐明，解释；使容光焕发；用彩灯装饰；用金、银等彩色图案装饰（书稿的书页或首词第一个字母）

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

name: dingy
trans: adj. 昏暗的；肮脏的

sentences.english: a dingy room
sentences.chinese: 阴暗邋遢的房间

sentences.english: a dingy side-street
sentences.chinese: 昏暗肮脏的小街

detailed_translations.english: dark, dirty, and in bad condition

name: dim
trans: adj. 暗淡的，昏暗的；模糊的，看不清的；<非正式>愚笨的，迟钝的；前景暗淡的，不乐观的 v. （使）变暗；变淡漠，失去光泽；（使）变模糊

sentences.english: in the dim light of the early dawn
sentences.chinese: 在微弱的晨曦里

sentences.english: a dim glow
sentences.chinese: 昏暗的微光

sentences.english: I could see a dim shape in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 我模模糊糊看见门口有个人影。

detailed_translations.english: fairly dark or not giving much light, so that you cannot see well

name: obscure
trans: adj. 难以说清楚的，模糊的；鲜为人知的，默默无闻的；未被查实的，不确定的；费解的，晦涩的 v. 遮掩，遮蔽；使费解 n. 某种模糊的或不清楚的东西

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

name: vague
trans: adj. 不明确的，不清楚的；（形状）模糊的；（感情、记忆等）不完整的，不清晰的；含糊其词的，闪烁其词的；茫然的，心不在焉的

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

name: dusky
trans: adj. （光线）昏暗的，暗淡的，朦胧的；（颜色）暗的，柔和的；（皮肤）黝黑的

sentences.english: The room was filled with dusky shadows.
sentences.chinese: 房间里到处都是朦胧的影子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗淡的；微暗的；忧郁的；朦胧的
detailed_translations.english: dark or not very bright in colour

name: extinct
trans: adj. 灭绝的；消亡的；（火山）死的；（贵族称号）无合法继承人的；熄灭了的

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: glaring
trans: adj. 耀眼的；瞪视的；炯炯的

sentences.english: the glaring light of high noon
sentences.chinese: 正午的耀眼阳光

detailed_translations.english: too bright and difficult to look at

name: dazzling
trans: adj. 令人赞叹的，给人深刻印象的；耀眼的，眩目的 v. 使目眩，使眼花；使赞叹不已，使惊奇（dazzle的现在分词）

sentences.english: a dazzling display of football skills
sentences.chinese: 让人眼花缭乱的足球技巧表演

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人眼花缭乱的， 耀眼的
detailed_translations.english: a light that is dazzling is very bright and makes you unable to see properly for a short time

name: dismal
trans: adj. 忧郁的，阴沉的；<非正式>差劲的，糟糕的

sentences.english: The future looks pretty dismal right now.
sentences.chinese: 目前前景似乎相当暗淡。

sentences.english: a dismal, grey afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一个阴沉灰暗的下午

detailed_translations.chinese: 凄凉的，忧郁的；阴沉的，沉闷的
detailed_translations.english: if a situation or a place is dismal, it is so bad that it makes you feel very unhappy and hopeless

name: glossy
trans: adj. 光滑的；有光泽的

sentences.english: her glossy black hair
sentences.chinese: 她那亮泽的黑发

sentences.english: the glossy surface of the leaves
sentences.chinese: 叶子光亮的表面

detailed_translations.english: shiny and smooth

name: luster
trans: n. [光]光泽；光彩 vi. 有光泽；发亮 vt. 使有光泽 n. （Luster）人名；（德）卢斯特尔

sentences.english: Then it’s really no more than a means of transportation, it too loses its luster.
sentences.chinese: 然后它就仅仅是一个名符其实的交通工具，失去了它的光彩。

sentences.english: College graduates may be losing some of their luster for reasons beyond technology and trade.
sentences.chinese: 大学毕业生也许会因为技术和贸易之外的原因失去一些光彩。

sentences.english: No one knows for sure when the tide started to turn, or the exact moment when American gold started its slow but seemingly irreversible loss of luster.
sentences.chinese: 无人确切知晓这波潮汐的消退始于何时，也没有人精确的得知美金的光泽从何时起开始缓慢，但不可逆转的褪色。

name: glaze
trans: vt. 装以玻璃；上釉于 vi. 变呆滞；变得光滑 n. 釉；光滑面 n. （Glaze）人名；（英）格莱兹

sentences.english: Sometimes his eyes would glaze over for a second or two.
sentences.chinese: 有时候他会两眼发直地愣一两秒钟。

detailed_translations.english: if your eyes glaze over, they show no expression, usually because you are very bored or tired
to cover plates, cups etc made of clay with a thin liquid that gives them a shiny surface
a liquid that is used to cover plates, cups etc made of clay to give them a shiny surface

name: flare
trans: v. 突然烧旺，闪耀；突发，加剧；突然发怒，突然爆发；张开，展开 n. 闪耀的光；闪光装置，信号弹；突然发怒，发脾气；喇叭裤；（发炎等症状的）突然复发；（太阳等恒星的）耀斑；（底片上的）翳雾斑；船舷的翻边

sentences.english: One possibility is that the blast was like an ultra-powerful solar flare.
sentences.chinese: 一种可能的原因是这种爆炸很像有超级能量的太阳耀斑。

sentences.english: Indeed, last month, we looked at evidence that the last flare up occurred only a few hundred years ago.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，上个月，我们在看最近一次，也就是几百年前的耀斑发生的有关证据。

sentences.english: Their diaphanous flare symbolizes at once grace and tragedy, innocence and despair, sadness and voluptuousness.
sentences.chinese: 它们半透明的闪光象征着优雅与悲剧，天真与绝望，悲伤与奢华。

name: burnish
trans: vt. 擦亮；使……光亮；将……打磨光亮 n. 光泽；抛光；闪闪发光 vi. 磨光发亮

sentences.english: The agency hired a New York public-relations firm to burnish Washington's image.
sentences.chinese: 该机构雇用了一家纽约公关公司来提升华盛顿的形象。

detailed_translations.chinese: 擦亮；使…光亮；将…打磨光亮
detailed_translations.english: to polish metal or another substance until it shines

name: flicker
trans: v. 闪烁，摇曳；闪现，一闪而过；（表情）掠过；（眼睛）瞟过；颤动，快速抖动；扑动翅膀；使……突然动一下 n. （火焰，光的）闪烁，摇曳；（感觉或情绪的）闪现，一闪而过；（身体部位的）小而快的动作；（电影或电视每秒帧数过少时的）图像闪烁；（鸟）扑翅䴕属

sentences.english: The overhead lights flickered momentarily.
sentences.chinese: 头顶灯闪了一会儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 闪烁；摇曳；颤动；扑动翅膀；假装昏倒
detailed_translations.english: to burn or shine with an unsteady light that goes on and off quickly
an unsteady light that goes on and off quickly

name: brighten
trans: v. 使明亮，使鲜艳；开颜，高兴；（使）好转，（使）变得乐观；使生色，为……增辉添彩；放晴

sentences.english: Use blonde highlights to brighten your hair.
sentences.chinese: 用点金色的挑染，让你的发色明亮起来。

sentences.english: The morning sunshine brightened up the room.
sentences.chinese: 清晨的阳光照亮了房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 明亮；变亮；活跃；快乐高兴
detailed_translations.english: to make something lighter or brighter

name: gleam
trans: v. 发微光，闪烁；显得光洁明亮；（眼睛）表露出，流露出；（因兴奋而眼睛）发光，发亮 n. 反光，闪光；微光，一丝光线；少量，一线；（情感等的）闪现；（指暂时还不能实现的）想法，愿望

sentences.english: They saw a sudden gleam of light.
sentences.chinese: 他们看到一道微光一闪而过。

sentences.english: The wooden panelling was gleaming with wax polish.
sentences.chinese: 木嵌板上过蜡显得很光亮。

detailed_translations.english: a small pale light, especially one that shines for a short time
to shine softly

name: extinguish
trans: v. 熄灭；消灭，使破灭；<法律>取消（权利，义务），使无效；偿清；压制

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

name: ablaze
trans: adj. 着火的，猛火燃烧；闪耀的，光亮的；激昂的，愤怒的 adv. 着火；闪耀

sentences.english: Within minutes the whole house was ablaze.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟内，整座房子就成了一片火海。

sentences.english: The factory had been set ablaze (=  made to burn  ) .
sentences.chinese: 那家工厂被纵火焚烧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 着火的， 燃烧的； 闪耀的； 情绪激动的
detailed_translations.english: burning strongly with a lot of flames

name: twinkle
trans: v. 闪烁，闪耀；（眼睛因高兴而）发亮，发光；（脚）轻快移动 n. 闪烁，闪耀；（眼睛的）闪亮，欣喜的神情

sentences.english: stars twinkling in the sky
sentences.chinese: 天空中闪烁的星星

sentences.english: I saw lights twinkling in the little town below us.
sentences.chinese: 我看到我们下面的小镇灯火闪烁。

detailed_translations.english: if a star or light twinkles, it shines in the dark with an unsteady light
an expression in your eyes that shows you are happy or amused

name: tentative
trans: adj. 试探性的，暂定的；踌躇的，犹豫不定的 n. 不确定的事物

sentences.english: I passed on my tentative conclusions to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的初步结论递交给了警方。

sentences.english: The government is taking tentative steps towards tackling the country’s economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在采取临时性措施来解决国家的经济问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试验性的，暂定的；踌躇的
detailed_translations.english: not definite or certain, and may be changed later

name: mechanical
trans: adj. 机械（方面）的；机械般的，呆板的；精通机械的；机械学的，力学的；独家灌录权的 n. 技工，机修工；劳工，工匠

sentences.english: The flight has been cancelled due to mechanical failure.
sentences.chinese: 因机械故障航班被取消了。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing because of mechanical problems.
sentences.chinese: 飞机因机械故障不得不紧急降落。

sentences.english: the mechanical properties of solids
sentences.chinese: 固体的力学性能

detailed_translations.english: affecting or involving a machine

name: exact
trans: adj. 确切的，精确的；严谨的，一丝不苟的；精密的，严密的 v. 强取，勒索；实施（报复）；造成重大苦难（或损失等）

sentences.english: Police are still investigating the exact cause of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 警方还在调查这起事故的确切原因。

sentences.english: What were his exact words?
sentences.chinese: 他的原话是什么？

sentences.english: The timing had to be exact.
sentences.chinese: 对时机的把握必须精确。

sentences.english: Some concepts in Chinese medicine have no exact equivalent in Western medicine.
sentences.chinese: 中医的一些概念在西医中没有完全一样的对应观念。

detailed_translations.english: completely correct in every detail
to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

name: theoretical
trans: adj. 理论的；理论上存在的，假设的

sentences.english: These findings have both theoretical and practical applications.
sentences.chinese: 这些发现具有理论和实际的应用。

sentences.english: In this process, an interaction of theoretical study with practical work . should be strengthened.
sentences.chinese: 在这个过程中，要加强理论的探讨和工作推进的互动作用。

sentences.english: Researchers have tossed around theoretical calculations of using just aluminum and water for rocket propellant in the past.
sentences.chinese: 研究者在过去辗转不安的进行理论计算，仅仅只用铝和水作为火箭燃料。

name: precise
trans: adj. 精确的，准确的；恰好的，确切的；（人）严格的，一丝不苟的

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

name: trial
trans: n. 审判，审理；试验，试用；（对人的忍耐、自制力的）考验，磨练；烦人的事，惹麻烦的人；预赛，选拔赛；（检验车手技能的）摩托车障碍检验赛；（动物的）比赛，表演 v. 测试，试验；（马、狗等动物）参加比赛 adj. 试验性的

sentences.english: The trial is due to start next week.
sentences.chinese: 审理定于下周开始。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试， 试验； 审判； 讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a legal process in which a judge and often a  jury  in a court of law examine information to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime

name: specimen
trans: n. 样品，标本；（尤指动植物的）实例；（化验的）抽样，血样，尿样；具有……特性的人（幽默用法）

sentences.english: a blood specimen
sentences.chinese: 血样

detailed_translations.english: a small amount or piece that is taken from something, so that it can be tested or examined

name: symbol
trans: n. 象征，标志；符号；代表性的人（物）

sentences.english: The symbol on the packet is a guarantee that the food has been produced organically.
sentences.chinese: 包装盒上的这个标识保证这种食物是有机生产的。

sentences.english: Fe is the chemical symbol for iron.
sentences.chinese: Fe是铁的化学符号。

detailed_translations.english: a picture or shape that has a particular meaning or represents a particular organization or idea

name: symbolic
trans: adj. 用作象征的，被认为是象征的；有象征意义的；（行为举动）象征性的，没有甚么实际影响的；符号的，使用象征的

sentences.english: Each element of the ceremony has a symbolic meaning .
sentences.chinese: 仪式的每一个元素都具有象征意义。

detailed_translations.english: a symbolic action is important because of what it represents but may not have any real effect

name: precision
trans: n. 精确（性），准确（性）；严谨，细致；（测量、计算或说明的）精确化（尤以数字表现） adj. （设计）精密的，精确的；要求技术精确的，（行动）精确的

sentences.english: precision engineering
sentences.chinese: 精密工程

sentences.english: precision bombing
sentences.chinese: 精确轰炸

detailed_translations.chinese: 精度，[数] 精密度；精确
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very exact or correct
made or done in a very exact way

name: doctrine
trans: n. 教义，主义，信条；（政府政策的）正式声明

sentences.english: traditional doctrines of divine power
sentences.chinese: 神力的传统教义

sentences.english: Marxist doctrine
sentences.chinese: 马克思主义学说

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs that form an important part of a religion or system of ideas

name: threshold
trans: n. 门槛，门口；阈，界，起始点；开端，起点，入门；机场跑道入口，跑道头

sentences.english: She opened the door and stepped across the threshold.
sentences.chinese: 她打开门，跨过门槛。

sentences.english: The creature is on the threshold of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 这种生物已濒临灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: the entrance to a room or building, or the area of floor or ground at the entrance

name: expertise
trans: n. 专长，专门技能（知识）；专家的意见

sentences.english: She was not an accountant and didn't have the expertise to verify all of the financial details.
sentences.chinese: 她不是会计，不具有核查所有这些财政细目的专业知识。

detailed_translations.english: Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice

name: institute
trans: n. 研究所，学院，协会；（尤指与法律相关的）注释，论述 v. 制定（制度、规则等）；提出（诉讼）；任命，授予……职位（尤指圣职）

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: invent
trans: v. 发明，创造；编造，虚构

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

detailed_translations.english: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

name: dissect
trans: v. 解剖（人或动物的尸体）；剖析，详细评论（某事物）；把（田地）分成小块

sentences.english: books in which the lives of famous people are dissected
sentences.chinese: 剖析名人生平的书籍

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to understand it

name: contrive
trans: v. 谋划，策划；设计，发明；设法做到

sentences.english: In 1862, a technique was contrived to take a series of photographs showing stages of movement.
sentences.chinese: 1862年时发明了一种技术，可以拍出一连串展示连续动作的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明; 设计; 设法；造成
detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something in spite of difficulties

name: launch
trans: v. 发动，发起；上市，发行；使（船或舰）下水；发射（武器或宇宙飞船）；启动（计算机程序）；投出，用力扔出；使投身于（事业等）；起飞，出海 n. （航天器的）发射；（产品的）上市；（事件的）发起；汽艇，游艇；（新产品，出版物）发布会，推介会

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

name: devise
trans: v. 设计，发明；<法律>（通过遗嘱）遗赠（不动产）；<古>图谋 n. <法律>（遗嘱中）遗赠不动产的条款

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

detailed_translations.english: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

name: gauge
trans: n. 测量仪器；宽度，厚度；（测量或判断的）尺度，标准；（铁道的）轨距；（枪管的）口径；（汽车）胎压计 v. 估计，判断；测量

sentences.english: Retail sales are a gauge of consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 零售额是衡量消费支出的一个标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计量器；标准尺寸；容量规格
detailed_translations.english: an instrument for measuring the size or amount of something
to measure or calculate something by using a particular instrument or method

name: accurate
trans: adj. 准确的，精确的；（工具，方法）精密的；正确无误的；（武器、投掷）精准的

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

name: scale
trans: n. 天平，磅秤；天平盘；天秤（星）座（the Scales）；等级，级别；刻度，标度；标尺，刻度尺；规模，范围；比例，比例尺；鳞，鳞片；鱼鳞状物；水垢；牙垢；音阶；（加热后金属上形成的）氧化皮；进位制；（摄影）影调范围 v. 改变（文字、图片）的尺寸大小；刮去（鱼鳞）；攀登，翻越；剔除（牙垢）；（尤指皮肤）生成鳞屑；（成片状）脱落，剥落；（数量，财产） 按一定比例调节；称得重量为；<美>估算（树木的）产木材量 adj. （模型或复制品）按比例缩小的

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

name: logical
trans: adj. 合情合理的；合乎逻辑的；逻辑（上）的

sentences.english: It’s a logical site for a new supermarket, with the housing development nearby.
sentences.chinese: 附近有住宅区，新的超级市场选址在此是合情合理的。

sentences.english: a logical conclusion
sentences.chinese: 合理的结论

detailed_translations.chinese: 逻辑的， 合乎常理的
detailed_translations.english: seeming reasonable and sensible

name: therefore
trans: adv. 因此，所以

sentences.english: Their car was bigger and therefore more comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他们的车大些，所以更舒适些。

sentences.english: Progress so far has been very good. We are, therefore, confident that the work will be completed on time.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止进展十分顺利，所以我们有把握按时完成工作。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that has just been mentioned

name: hence
trans: adv. 因此；之后

sentences.english: The cost of transport is a major expense for an industry. Hence factory location is an important consideration.
sentences.chinese: 运输成本是企业的一大支出，因此工厂选址是重要的考虑因素。

detailed_translations.english: for this reason

name: framework
trans: n. (建筑物或物体的）构架，结构；参照标准，准则；(社会、法律、政治等）框架

sentences.english: We have to act within the existing legal framework.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

detailed_translations.english: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

name: hypothesis
trans: n. 假说，假设；（凭空的）猜想，猜测；前提

sentences.english: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
sentences.chinese: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true

name: assumption
trans: n. 假定，假设；取得，承担

sentences.english: You would be making an assumption that's not based on any fact that you could report.
sentences.chinese: 你会做出不以你能报道的任何事实为依据的一种假设。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

name: presume
trans: v. 料想，（不肯定地）认为；假设，设想；（法律上或官方）假定，推定；擅自，冒昧；意味着；<正式>擅作主张，冒昧

sentences.english: They're resentful that outsiders presume to meddle in their affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务怨恨不已。

sentences.english: I presume you're here on business.
sentences.chinese: 我想你是来这儿出差的吧。

sentences.english: "Had he been home all week?"—"I presume so."
sentences.chinese: “他整个星期都在家吗？”—“我想是。”

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone presumes to do something, you mean that they do it even though they have no right to do it

detailed_translations.chinese: 推测，假定，相信；冒昧，擅自；认定，推定
detailed_translations.english: If you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain

name: presumption
trans: n. 推测，设想；（法律上的）假定，推定；放肆，冒昧

sentences.english: She was enraged by his presumption.
sentences.chinese: 她被他的放肆激怒了。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true because it is very likely

name: clue
trans: n. 线索，提示；理解，想法 v. 给（某人）提供线索，使（某人）了解

sentences.english: Police have found a vital clue .
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了至关重要的线索。

sentences.english: Archaeological evidence will provide clues about what the building was used for.
sentences.chinese: 考古证据将为这幢建筑的用途提供线索。

sentences.english: a desperate search for clues
sentences.chinese: 拼命寻找线索

detailed_translations.english: an object or piece of information that helps someone solve a crime or mystery

name: generalize
trans: v. 概括，归纳；推广，普及；笼统地表达

sentences.english: She has a tendency to generalize from her husband to all men.
sentences.chinese: 她总爱把自己对丈夫的看法推及所有的男人。

detailed_translations.english: to form a general principle or opinion after considering only a small number of facts or examples

name: incur
trans: v. 带来（成本、花费等）；招致，遭受

sentences.english: And operational downtime caused by reliability or performance problems can incur opportunity costs if customers are unable to access your system or the business is unable to do its work.
sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

detailed_translations.english: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

name: suppose
trans: v. 推断，料想，猜想；假设，假定，设想；预期，需要，以……为条件；相信，认为（某事物是可能的）；（婉转表达）我看，要我说，要不；（因处于某种境地或因约定）必须做（be supposed to do sth.）；我看（用于生气地表示预料某事属实）

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

name: premise
trans: n. 前提，假设；（企业或机构使用的）房屋及土地（premises）；上述各项 v. 以……为基础，以……为前提；预先提出，事先提到；<古>声明，说明

sentences.english: Schools may earn extra money by renting out their premises.
sentences.chinese: 学校通过出租房屋场地可以获取额外收入。

sentences.english: business premises
sentences.chinese: 企业经营场所

detailed_translations.chinese: 房屋和地基， 经营场址； 前提， 假设
detailed_translations.english: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

name: infer
trans: v. 推断，推论；暗示，暗指

sentences.english: A lot can be inferred from these statistics.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些统计资料可以推断出很多事情。

sentences.english: From the evidence, we can infer that the victim knew her killer.
sentences.chinese: 根据证据我们可以推断出受害者认识凶手。

detailed_translations.english: to form an opinion that something is probably true because of information that you have

name: demonstrate
trans: v. 证明；示范，演示；表露；游行，示威

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

name: due
trans: adj. 到期的，预期的；应有的，应得的；应付的，应给的；适当的 adv. 正对着 n. 应得，所得；会费

sentences.english: The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
sentences.chinese: 该球队预定下个月飞往意大利。

sentences.english: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
sentences.chinese: 应该支付给你的款项将会以支票邮寄给你。

detailed_translations.english: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

name: cursory
trans: adj. 粗略的，草率的，匆忙的

sentences.english: Burke cast a cursory glance at the menu, then flapped it shut.
sentences.chinese: 伯克粗略瞥了眼菜单，然后啪地合上了。

detailed_translations.english: done very quickly without much attention to details

name: perennial
trans: adj. 多年生的；常年的；四季不断的；常在的；反复的 n. 多年生植物

sentences.english: Lack of resources has been a perennial problem since the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 财力不足从最初起就一直是个问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 多年生的；常年的；四季不断的；常在的；反复的
detailed_translations.english: a plant that is perennial lives for more than two years
a plant that lives for more than two years

name: chronic
trans: adj. （疾病）慢性的，长期的；（问题）一直有的，反复出现的；难以根除的，积习难改的；<英，非正式>糟透的，拙劣的

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

detailed_translations.english: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

name: lasting
trans: adj. 持久的，耐久的 n. （纺）厚实斜纹织物 v. 持续；继续任职；存活（last 的现在分词）

sentences.english: The reforms will bring lasting benefits.
sentences.chinese: 改革将带来长久的利益。

sentences.english: Their generosity made a lasting impression on me.
sentences.chinese: 他们的慷慨给我留下了难忘的印象。

sentences.english: a solution that would bring lasting peace
sentences.chinese: 将带来持久和平的解决方案

detailed_translations.english: strong enough, well enough planned etc to continue for a very long time

name: everlasting
trans: adj. 永恒的；接连不断的

sentences.english: everlasting fame
sentences.chinese: 永久的名声

sentences.english: a symbol of God’s everlasting love
sentences.chinese: 上帝永恒之爱的象征

sentences.english: a belief in life everlasting
sentences.chinese: 对永生的信念

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever, even after someone has died

name: hasty
trans: adj. 匆忙的，仓促的；草率的，轻率的；<古>易怒的

sentences.english: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。

sentences.english: a hasty breakfast
sentences.chinese: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；懈怠的
detailed_translations.english: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

name: transitory
trans: adj. 短暂的，暂时的；瞬息的
