sentences.chinese: 大多数少年时代的罗曼史都转瞬即逝。

detailed_translations.english: continuing or existing for only a short time

name: transient
trans: adj. 转瞬即逝的，短暂的；暂住的，（工作）临时的 n. 暂住者，流动人口；（电流、电压、频率的）瞬变

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: obsolete
trans: adj. 淘汰的，废弃的；（生物特征的一部分）退化的 vt. <美>淘汰（产品），废弃（想法）

sentences.english: obsolete weapons
sentences.chinese: 已被淘汰的武器

sentences.english: computer hardware that quickly became obsolete
sentences.chinese: 很快就变得过时的电脑硬件

sentences.english: Will computers render (= make ) books obsolete?
sentences.chinese: 计算机会把书籍淘汰掉吗？

detailed_translations.english: no longer useful, because something newer and better has been invented

name: extemporaneous
trans: adj. 即席的，临时的；无准备的；不用讲稿的；善于即席讲话的

sentences.english: an extemporaneous speech
sentences.chinese: 即席演讲

detailed_translations.chinese: 即席的，临时的；无准备的；不用讲稿的；善于即席讲话的
detailed_translations.english: spoken or done without any preparation or practice

name: urgent
trans: adj. 紧急的，急迫的；急切的，催促的；<正式>（尤指某人的行动）执着的，坚定的

sentences.english: He was in urgent need of medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 他急需治疗。

sentences.english: The report called for urgent action to reduce lead in petrol.
sentences.chinese: 报告呼吁迅速采取行动，减少汽油中的铅含量。

sentences.english: an urgent message
sentences.chinese: 一封急报

detailed_translations.english: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

name: pressing
trans: adj. （问题，需求，情况）紧迫的，迫切的；难以推却的，不容忽视的 n. 压制品，一批压制品（尤指唱片）；按，压，挤，推 v. 按，压；熨平（衣服）；挤着走（pressing 的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: The CD, released in October, sold out a first pressing of 1,500 in just four months.
sentences.chinese: 这张光盘发行于10月份，第一批压制的1,500张仅仅四个月就销售一空。

detailed_translations.english: a thing or group of things, especially records or CDs, that have been made by pressing plastic or metal into shape
needing to be discussed or dealt with very soon

name: immediate
trans: adj. 立刻的，即时的；目前的，紧迫的；附近的，紧接的；（关系或级别）最接近的，直系的；（两者间）直接的；（感知，反应）直觉的

sentences.english: Our immediate response to the attack was sheer horror.
sentences.chinese: 我们对攻击的第一反应就是非常惊恐。

sentences.english: They promise immediate action to help the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 他们承诺立即采取行动帮助失业者。

sentences.english: If the eyes are affected, seek immediate medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 如果眼睛感染了要立即就医。

sentences.english: The funeral was attended by her immediate family (= her parents, children, brothers and sisters) only.
sentences.chinese: 只有她的直系亲属参加了葬礼。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done at once and without delay

name: forthright
trans: adj. 直率的；直截了当的 adv. 直率地；马上；立即 n. 直路

sentences.english: She answered in her usual forthright manner .
sentences.chinese: 她以一贯的直率作了回答。

detailed_translations.english: direct and honest - used in order to show approval

name: offhand
trans: adj. 随便的；即时的；无准备的；即席的 adv. 随便地；即席地；即时地

sentences.english: She said you were a bit offhand with her this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 她说你今天下午对她有点敷衍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 随便的；即时的；无准备的；即席的

name: temporal
trans: adj. 世俗的，现世的；时间的，与时间有关的；太阳穴的，颞部的；（语法）表示时间的，时态的；暂时的 n. 世间万物，暂存的事物；颞部

sentences.english: the temporal character of human existence
sentences.chinese: 人生的短促

detailed_translations.english: related to or limited by time

name: temporary
trans: adj. 暂时的，临时的；短期的，短暂的 n. 临时雇员，临时工

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
sentences.chinese: 在你定下来想做什么之前，也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

name: contemporary
trans: adj. 当代的，现代的；同时期的，同时代的 n. 同时代的人；同龄人，同辈

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

name: impromptu
trans: adj. 即兴的，即席的 adv. 即兴地，即席地 n. 即兴曲（尤指独奏）；即席演出

sentences.english: When do we make impromptu speeches?
sentences.chinese: 我们什么时候要做即席演讲？

sentences.english: When Marco was asked to give an impromptu speech on“Addictions,”he divided the topic /into/ several parts. Notice how he used the pattern of related subtopics in the outline that follows.
sentences.chinese: 举个例子，马可要做一个关于“嗜好”的即席演讲，他将这个主题分成了几部分，注意下面他在大纲中是如何运用有关联副主题模式的。

detailed_translations.english: done or said without any preparation or planning

name: occasional
trans: adj. 偶尔的，不经常的；（家具）特定场合才使用的； （文章、演讲或宗教仪式等）在特殊场合所作的，为特殊场合所准备的；非定时的，临时的

sentences.english: He made occasional visits to London.
sentences.chinese: 他有时候会去伦敦。

sentences.english: They had an occasional coffee together after shopping.
sentences.chinese: 他们偶尔会在购物后一起喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: He only has occasional use of a car.
sentences.chinese: 他只是偶尔用一下汽车。

sentences.english: We should have enough money for the occasional trip.
sentences.chinese: 我们的钱应该足够偶尔出去旅行一次的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶尔的， 间或发生的
detailed_translations.english: happening sometimes but not often or regularly

name: punctual
trans: adj. 准时的，守时的；<旧>精确的；（语法）（动作）瞬息性的

sentences.english: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
sentences.chinese: 她一向准时赴约。

sentences.english: the punctual payment of invoices
sentences.chinese: 准时结清费用清单

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged

name: instantaneous
trans: adj. 瞬间发生的，瞬间完成的

sentences.english: modern methods of instantaneous communication
sentences.chinese: 现代的即时通信方法

detailed_translations.english: happening immediately

name: subsequent
trans: adj. 随后的，接着的；（河，谷）后成的

sentences.english: These skills were passed on to subsequent generations.
sentences.chinese: 这些技能代代相传。

sentences.english: subsequent pages of the book
sentences.chinese: 接下去的书页

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming after something else

name: current
trans: adj. 现行的，当前的；通用的，流行的；最近的 n. 水流，气流；电流；思潮，趋势

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: concurrent
trans: adj. 并存的，同时发生的；同意的，一致的；（两个或两个以上徒刑判决）同时执行的；（三条或三条以上线）共点的，会合的 n. 共点；同时发生的事件

sentences.english: The exhibition reflected concurrent developments abroad.
sentences.chinese: 该展览反映了国外的同期发展情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并发的；一致的；同时发生的
detailed_translations.english: existing or happening at the same time

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 共点；同时发生的事件

name: extant
trans: adj. 现存的；显著的

sentences.english: Few of the manuscripts are still extant.
sentences.chinese: 手稿大都散佚无存。

detailed_translations.english: still existing in spite of being very old

name: nocturnal
trans: adj. （动物）夜间活动的；夜间发生的

sentences.english: Hamsters are nocturnal creatures.
sentences.chinese: 仓鼠是夜行动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夜的；夜曲的；夜间发生的
detailed_translations.english: an animal that is nocturnal is active at night

name: former
trans: adj. 旧时的；以前的，前……；（两者中）前者的 n. 模子，模型；形成某事的人（或事）；线圈架，绕线模；（机翼、机身的）翼肋 pron. （两者中的）前者

sentences.english: the former Soviet Union
sentences.chinese: 前苏联

sentences.english: Their farm has been reduced to half its former size.
sentences.chinese: 他们的农场已缩小到以前的一半。

sentences.english: Of the two possibilities, the former seems more likely.
sentences.chinese: 在这两种可能性中，前者似乎更有可能。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing before, but not now
the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned

name: formerly
trans: adv. 以前，原来

sentences.english: Kiribati, formerly known as the Gilbert Islands
sentences.chinese: 基里巴斯，旧称吉尔伯特群岛

sentences.english: This elegant hotel was formerly a castle.
sentences.chinese: 这家雅致的酒店以前是座城堡。

detailed_translations.english: in earlier times

name: previous
trans: adj. 以前的，先前的；（时间或顺序上）稍前的；<非正式>过早的，过急的 n. <英，非正式>前科，犯罪记录

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: previously
trans: adv. 以前地，先前地

sentences.english: Guyana's railways were previously owned by private companies.
sentences.chinese: 圭亚那的铁路先前为私营公司所拥有。

sentences.english: The contract was awarded to a previously unknown company.
sentences.chinese: 该合同给了一家先前不知名的公司。

detailed_translations.english: Previously means at some time before the period that you are talking about

name: eternal
trans: adj. 永恒的，永存的；似乎无休无止的，没完没了的

sentences.english: the Christian promise of eternal life
sentences.chinese: 基督教承诺的永生

sentences.english: She’s an eternal optimist (= she always expects that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 她永远是个乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever and having no end

name: permanent
trans: adj. 永久的，永恒的；（尤指问题或困难）不断出现的，一直存在的；（员工）终生的，长期的；（家庭住址）固定的 n. <美>烫发

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: abiding
trans: v. 容忍；居住；接受（规则、劝告等）；（感情）始终不渝（abide 的现在分词） adj. 持久的；始终不渝的

sentences.english: Phil has a deep and abiding love for his family.
sentences.chinese: 菲尔对家人怀有深厚不渝的爱。

detailed_translations.english: an abiding feeling or belief continues for a long time and is not likely to change

detailed_translations.chinese: 遵守；容忍；继续存在（abide的现在分词）

name: dated
trans: adj. 陈旧的；过时的；有日期的 v. 注有日期（date 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: That dress looks a bit dated now.
sentences.chinese: 那件连衣裙现在看起来有点过时了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈旧的；过时的；有日期的
detailed_translations.english: old-fashioned

detailed_translations.chinese: 注有日期（date的过去式和过去分词）

name: overdue
trans: adj. （到期）未付的，未还的；未能准时的，延误的； 早该发生的，早应完成的

sentences.english: an overdue gas bill
sentences.chinese: 逾期未付的煤气账单

sentences.english: The library books are overdue.
sentences.chinese: 图书馆的书过期未还。

sentences.english: The baby was a week overdue (= it was expected to be born a week ago ).
sentences.chinese: 宝宝超过预产期有一周了。

detailed_translations.english: not done, paid, returned etc by the time expected

name: tentative
trans: adj. 试探性的，暂定的；踌躇的，犹豫不定的 n. 不确定的事物

sentences.english: I passed on my tentative conclusions to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的初步结论递交给了警方。

sentences.english: The government is taking tentative steps towards tackling the country’s economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在采取临时性措施来解决国家的经济问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试验性的，暂定的；踌躇的
detailed_translations.english: not definite or certain, and may be changed later

name: beforehand
trans: adv. 事先，预先，提前 adj. 早做准备的；提前的

sentences.english: The police need to be briefed beforehand on how to deal with this sort of situation.
sentences.chinese: 需要事先告诉警察这种情况怎样处理。

sentences.english: When you give a speech, it’s natural to feel nervous beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 你在演讲之前感到紧张是很自然的。

detailed_translations.english: before something else happens or is done

name: simultaneously
trans: adv. 同时地

sentences.english: If they have multiple test cases that will be run on the same platforms, they can select multiple configurations simultaneously and apply the configurations to several of them in batch mode.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们拥有多个将要运行在同一个平台上的测试用例的话，那么他们能够同时选择多个配置，并且将这些配置批量应用到平台上。

name: recently
trans: adv. 最近，不久前

sentences.english: He has recently been promoted to Assistant Manager.
sentences.chinese: 他最近晋升为经理助理。

sentences.english: a recently published biography
sentences.chinese: 一部最近出版的传记

sentences.english: Jerry lived in Cairo until quite recently .
sentences.chinese: 直至不久之前杰里一直住在开罗。

sentences.english: More recently, he’s appeared in a number of British films.
sentences.chinese: 最近，他出演了多部英国电影。

detailed_translations.english: not long ago

name: lately
trans: adv. 近来，最近；新近卸任，最近离任

sentences.english: What have you been doing lately?
sentences.chinese: 你最近在干什么？

sentences.english: Lately, I’ve had trouble sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 最近我睡眠有问题。

detailed_translations.english: recently

name: duration
trans: n. 持续，持续时间

sentences.english: The course is of three years’ duration.
sentences.chinese: 该课程为期三年。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that something continues

name: epoch
trans: n. 时代，纪元；值得纪念的事件（或日期）；世（地质年代，纪下分世）；历元

sentences.english: the Victorian epoch
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

sentences.english: The king’s death marked the end of an epoch.
sentences.chinese: 这位国王的去世标志着一个时代的结束。

sentences.english: the beginning of a new epoch
sentences.chinese: 新纪元的开始

detailed_translations.english: a period of history

name: interlude
trans: n. （两件事情、两种形势之间的）间歇；（戏剧、电影等的）幕间休息；幕间乐曲（或节目、表演），插曲；短暂的幽会，风流韵事

sentences.english: a brief interlude of peace before a return to the battlefield
sentences.chinese: 重返战场之前的短暂平静

detailed_translations.chinese: 插曲；穿插；幕间节目；[数] 插算
detailed_translations.english: a period of time between two events or situations, during which something different happens

name: era
trans: n. 时代，年代，纪元

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: schedule
trans: n. 计划（表），进度表；<美>（公共汽车、火车等的）时间表；（价目、费用等的）清单，一览表；（电视或电台的）节目表；<美>（学校的）课程表；<法律> 附件（尤指表格、单据等）；（英国所得税制的）报税单 v. 安排，预定；列入，收进（正式目录、清单等中）；<英> 把（建筑物）列为文物保护单位

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: juncture
trans: n. 接缝；连接；接合；特定时刻，关头；交接处，接合点；音渡

sentences.english: Atthis juncture, I suggest we take a short break.
sentences.chinese: 此时此刻，我建议大家稍事休息。

sentences.english: The talks are at a critical juncture(= very important point ).
sentences.chinese: 会谈正处于紧急关头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关键时刻， 危急关头； 结合处， 接合点
detailed_translations.english: a particular point in an activity or period of time

name: session
trans: n. （某项活动的）一段时间，一场；（议会等的）会议，（法庭的）开庭；学年，上课时间；（酒吧中）演奏会（尤指演奏爱尔兰音乐）；（尤指录音师的）灌录音乐时间；<非正式>酗酒期；基督教长老会的管理机构 adj. （音乐家）伴奏的

sentences.english: Board members met in closed session (= with nobody else present ) .
sentences.chinese: 委员会成员举行了闭门会议。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament

name: elapse
trans: v. 消逝 n. 时间的流逝

sentences.english: Several months elapsed before his case was brought to trial.
sentences.chinese: 过了几个月他的案子才开审。

sentences.english: The assignment must be completed within an overall elapsed time of one week.
sentences.chinese: 这项任务总的时限为一周，必须按时完成。

detailed_translations.english: if a particular period of time elapses, it passes

name: concur
trans: v. 同意，赞同；（事件）同时发生

sentences.english: And so, a lot of people see this as a sort of … or create a scenario, an Orwellian scenario, a Big Brother type scenario but I don't concur.
sentences.chinese: 所以，大多数人会把这个现象视为一种……或者说创作一幕剧情，一幕奥威尔式或是“老大哥”式的剧情，但是我并不同意这样的看法。

detailed_translations.english: to agree with someone or have the same opinion as them

name: improvise
trans: v. 即兴表演，即兴创作；临时做，临时凑成

sentences.english: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

detailed_translations.english: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events

name: synchronize
trans: vt. （使）同步；对准（钟，表）；相符；（电脑）同步化

sentences.english: It was virtually impossible to synchronize our lives so as to take vacations and weekends together.
sentences.chinese: 为了一起度假和过周末而要让我们的生活同步几乎是不可能的。

sentences.english: Synchronize the score with the film action.
sentences.chinese: 让配乐和电影动作同步。

detailed_translations.english: If you synchronize two activities, processes, or movements, or if you synchronize one activity, process, or movement with another, you cause them to happen at the same time and speed as each other

name: abruptly
trans: adv. 突然地；唐突地；陡然

sentences.english: The path ends off abruptly.
sentences.chinese: 这条路突然到头了。

sentences.english: The ground rises abruptly.
sentences.chinese: 地势突然隆起。

name: itinerant
trans: adj. 巡回的；流动的 n. 巡回者；行商

sentences.english: itinerant labourers
sentences.chinese: 流动劳工

detailed_translations.english: travelling from place to place, especially to work

name: flow
trans: v. 流动，流淌；（人，物）涌向，涌进；顺畅地移动；持续抵达，持续供应（或生产）；（信息）传播，（资金）流通；飘垂，飘拂；强烈感到；（说话或思想）流畅；引发，来自；充满，满是；大量喝，畅饮；涨潮；永久性变形；<非正式>来月经 n. 流，流动；车流，人流；持续生产，不断供应；（语言、思路等的）连贯；传播，流通；流速，流率；流动物；流量；大量；涨潮；<苏格兰>湿地，沼泽；形变；<非正式>月经

sentences.english: a new road system to improve traffic flow through the city centre
sentences.chinese: 疏导市中心车流的新道路系统

sentences.english: These gates regulate the amount of water flowing into the canal.
sentences.chinese: 这些闸门调节流入运河的水量。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth steady movement of liquid, gas, or electricity
when a liquid, gas, or electricity flows, it moves in a steady continuous stream

name: influx
trans: n. （人或物的）大量涌入，大量流入；（水）流入，注入（河，湖，海）

sentences.english: ...problems caused by the influx of refugees.
sentences.chinese: …难民大量涌入所造成的问题。

detailed_translations.english: the arrival of large numbers of people or large amounts of money, goods etc, especially suddenly

name: spray
trans: n. 喷雾液体，喷剂；喷雾器；喷，喷涂；喷雾状物；浪花，飞沫；（用作装饰的）小树枝，小花枝；（戴在身上的）一簇花，枝状饰物 v. 喷，喷洒（液体）；（使）飞溅，（使）飞散；喷农药；在……上喷涂料（或油漆）；向……扫射（子弹）；用于体育运动中踢（或击、扔）（方向不定或不准的球）；撒尿（以示领地占有）；（臭鼬）用臭液弄湿

sentences.english: spray from the waves
sentences.chinese: 海浪溅起的水雾

sentences.english: a new hair styling spray
sentences.chinese: 一种新的定型喷发剂

sentences.english: Most farmers use pesticide sprays.
sentences.chinese: 大多数农民都使用喷雾杀虫剂。

sentences.english: She sprayed herself with perfume.
sentences.chinese: 她往身上喷了香水。

detailed_translations.english: water in very small drops that is blown from the sea etc or sent up by vehicles on a wet road
to force liquid out of a container so that it comes out in a stream of very small drops and covers an area

name: drift
trans: v. 飘移，漂流；任其自然地（或不知不觉地）进入（某种状态）；流浪，漂泊；缓慢移动；传出；吹积 n. 流动，趋势；吹积物，雪堆；主旨，大意；偏航；不作为，优柔寡断；丛生的植物；冰碛；水平巷道

sentences.english: Smoke drifted up from the jungle ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 我们前方的丛林里有烟升起。

sentences.english: Jenni spent the year drifting around Europe.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮这一年来一直在欧洲各地漂泊。

sentences.english: a drift towards longer working hours
sentences.chinese: 工作时间不知不觉的变长

sentences.english: the drift from the countryside to the cities
sentences.chinese: 大量人口从乡村往城市的流动

detailed_translations.english: to move slowly on water or in the air
a slow change or development from one situation, opinion etc to another

name: fluctuate
trans: v. 波动，起伏不定；使波动，使动摇

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

name: splash
trans: v. （液体）稀里哗啦地溅落，飞溅；朝……泼洒，使……溅湿；泼溅着水行进，拍打着水游；以显著版面刊载，以大篇幅报道；使有色块，使有光斑；<英，非正式> 在（某物）上花很多钱 n. 落水声，溅泼声；溅上的液体，溅洒后留下的污渍；掺入饮料的少量液体；色块，光斑；（报章等旨在招徕读者的）重点文章；拍水，戏水；引人注目的效果

sentences.english: Water splashed onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 水哗的一声泼洒在地板上。

sentences.english: He splashed cold water on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把冷水往脸上泼。

sentences.english: We heard the splash when she fell into the pool.
sentences.chinese: 她掉进游泳池时我们听见扑通的一声。

detailed_translations.english: (of liquid) to fall noisily onto a surface
the sound of sth hitting liquid or of liquid hitting sth

name: dip
trans: v. 浸，蘸；下降，下沉；把（手）伸入；将（汽车前灯）调为近光；给（动物）洗药浴；减少，降低；（路面）下沉，向下倾斜；浏览，翻看；动用（款项等）；<非正式>扒窃；（将蜡烛芯反复浸入热蜡中）制作（蜡烛）；给（某人）施洗礼 n. （在液体中的）浸，蘸；游泳；减少，下降；调味酱汁，蘸料；向下倾斜处；药浴液；傻瓜，笨蛋；低洼处，凹陷处；翻阅，浏览；涉猎，了解；一勺（的量）；（降而复升的）一动；（上坡前面）短距离的下坡；（与水平方向相比的向下的）倾角；视倾斜；<俚>扒手；<古>（将蜡烛芯反复浸入热蜡中）制作（蜡烛）

sentences.english: Dip each apple in the syrup until thickly coated.
sentences.chinese: 把每个苹果在糖浆里蘸一下，直到被厚厚地裹上糖浆。

detailed_translations.english: to put something into a liquid and lift it out again
to put something into a liquid and lift it out again

name: spurt
trans: v. 喷射，喷出；冲刺，迸发 n. 涌出的液体，喷出的火舌；短时激增，迸发

sentences.english: A spurt of diesel came from one valve and none from the other.
sentences.chinese: 一股股柴油从一个阀门喷涌而出，但另一个没有。

detailed_translations.english: when an amount of liquid or flame suddenly comes quickly out of something

name: spout
trans: n. 管口，容器嘴；（急速喷出的）水流，水柱；（鲸喷出的）水气柱；出水管，排水沟；（由高向低的）运货斜槽，滑道；<史>（当铺中将抵押品传送到存放处的）升降车 v. 喷涌；滔滔不绝地说，喋喋不休地说；（鲸鱼，海豚）从呼吸孔中喷出水柱

sentences.english: She lifted the kettle a little and tilted its spout over the tea-pot.
sentences.chinese: 她稍稍提起烧水壶，将壶嘴向茶壶倾斜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷口；水龙卷；水落管；水柱
detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong stream of liquid which comes out of somewhere very fast

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷出；喷射；滔滔不绝地讲；把…典当掉
detailed_translations.english: if liquid or fire spouts from somewhere, it comes out very quickly in a powerful stream

name: meander
trans: v. （河流、道路等）蜿蜒，曲折前行；漫步，闲逛，徘徊；漫谈，闲聊；（文章）行文散漫 n. 河流（或道路）弯道，河曲；漫游

sentences.english: We took a gravel road that meandered through farmland.
sentences.chinese: 我们走上了一条蜿蜒穿越农田的石子路。

detailed_translations.english: to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way rather than take the most direct way possible

name: gush
trans: v. 涌出；迸出 n. 涌出；迸发

sentences.english: All that pent-up frustration gushed out in a torrent of abuse.
sentences.chinese: 所有压抑着的失望与不快通过一阵痛骂全都发泄了出来。

detailed_translations.english: if words or emotions gush out, you suddenly express them very strongly
a large quantity of something, usually a liquid, that suddenly pours out of something

name: immerse
trans: v. 使沉浸（于），使深陷（于）；使浸没（于液体中）

sentences.english: She immersed herself in her work.
sentences.chinese: 她埋头工作。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make sb completely involved in sth

name: overflow
trans: v. 漫出，泛滥 ；充满，挤满；装满，完全盖住；扩展出界，过度延伸；洋溢着（情感） n. 溢出，溢出的液体；容纳不下的人（或物）；溢流管（=overflow pipe）；（计算机）数据过载

sentences.english: The drains flooded and water overflowed down the main street.
sentences.chinese: 下水道被淹，水溢到了大街上。

sentences.english: The river had overflowed its banks.
sentences.chinese: 河水漫堤了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 满得外溢，外流，泛滥；充满，洋溢
detailed_translations.english: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges

detailed_translations.chinese: 淹没， 从…中溢出， 多得无法容纳
detailed_translations.english: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges

detailed_translations.chinese: 容纳不下的物； 溢出， 满出； 溢流口， 溢流管
detailed_translations.english: the amount of something or the number of people that cannot be contained in a place because it is already full

name: infuse
trans: v. 使充满（某种感觉），向……灌输（某品质）；冲泡（茶、药草等），浸渍；输注（药物等）

sentences.english: All those lives maintained in the rarefied air of the absurd could not persevere without some profound and constant thought to infuse its strength into them.
sentences.chinese: 没有某种深邃的思想一成不变地为之输入力量，所有这些在荒谬的稀薄空气中维持的生命都无法继续。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling or quality

name: submerge
trans: v. （使）潜入水中，（使）没入水中，浸没；湮没，掩盖（思想、感情等）；使（自己）集中精力于，使（自己）沉浸于

sentences.english: Alice submerged herself in work to try and forget about Tom.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯埋头工作，试图忘记汤姆。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself very busy doing something, especially in order to forget about something else
to go under the surface of the water and be completely covered by it

name: imbue
trans: vt. 灌输；使感染；使渗透

sentences.english: The film is imbued with the star's rebellious spirit.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影充满了那位明星的反叛精神。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something is imbued with an idea, feeling, or quality, they become filled with it

name: saturate
trans: v. 使湿透，浸透；使充满，使饱和；充斥（市场），使（市场）供大于求；使（化学溶液）饱和；饱和磁化；饱和充电；饱和轰炸 adj. <文>湿透的；饱和的 n. 饱和脂肪

sentences.english: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 水从洞里流进来，浸湿了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满
detailed_translations.english: to make something very wet

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的

name: exude
trans: vt. 散发；流出；使渗出 vi. 流出；渗出；发散

sentences.english: The plant exudes a sticky liquid.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物会分泌一种黏液。

detailed_translations.english: to flow out slowly and steadily, or to make something do this

name: permeate
trans: v. 渗透，弥漫；（观点、信念、感情等）充满，充斥

sentences.english: The smell of diesel oil permeated the air.
sentences.chinese: 空气里充斥着柴油的气味。

detailed_translations.english: if liquid, gas etc permeates something, it enters it and spreads through every part of it

name: dampen
trans: v. 使潮湿，弄湿；减弱，抑制

sentences.english: The light rain dampened the crowd’s enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 小雨使观众的热情减退了。

sentences.english: Raising interest rates might dampen the economy.
sentences.chinese: 提高利率可能会抑制经济发展。

detailed_translations.english: to make something such as a feeling or activity less strong

name: moisten
trans: vt. 弄湿；使……湿润 vi. 潮湿；变潮湿

sentences.english: Moisten the clay if it seems too dry.
sentences.chinese: 如果黏土太干，就把它润润湿。

sentences.english: She moistened her lips (= made her lips wet with her tongue ) .
sentences.chinese: 她润了润嘴唇。

detailed_translations.english: to make something slightly wet

name: article
trans: n. 文章，论文；物品；条款，条文；冠词；见习契约，见习期 v. 见习，签约做实习生；进行控告；使……受协议条款的约束

sentences.english: The paper’s leading article (=  the main article  ) described the government as weak.
sentences.chinese: 该报社论称政府软弱。

sentences.english: newspaper articles
sentences.chinese: 报纸上的文章

sentences.english: household articles
sentences.chinese: 家居用品

sentences.english: Article 1 of the constitution guarantees freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 宪法的第一条保障宗教信仰自由。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine

name: craft
trans: n. 工艺，手艺；船，艇，飞行器；诡计，骗术；行业，职业；手工艺品 v. 精心制作

sentences.english: traditional rural crafts
sentences.chinese: 传统的乡村手工艺

sentences.english: arts and crafts
sentences.chinese: 手工艺

detailed_translations.english: a job or activity in which you make things with your hands, and that you usually need skill to do
to make something using a special skill, especially with your hands

name: vessel
trans: n. 船，舰；（人或动物的）血管，（植物的）导管；（盛液体用的）容器，器皿；（有某种特质或用途的）人

sentences.english: a fishing vessel
sentences.chinese: 渔船

sentences.english: a burst blood vessel
sentences.chinese: 破裂的血管

sentences.english: a Bronze Age drinking vessel
sentences.chinese: 青铜器时代的饮具

detailed_translations.english: a ship or large boat

name: girdle
trans: n. 腰带；围绕物；妇女紧身褡 vt. 围绕；绕……而行；用带子捆扎

sentences.english: the formal garden that girdled the house
sentences.chinese: 环绕屋子布置井然的花园

detailed_translations.chinese: 腰带；围绕物；妇女紧身褡
detailed_translations.english: a piece of women’s underwear which fits tightly around her stomach, bottom, and  hips  and makes her look thinner

detailed_translations.chinese: 围绕；绕…而行；用带子捆扎
detailed_translations.english: to surround something

name: canvas
trans: n. 帆布；画布，油画 v. 用帆布覆盖

sentences.english: a canvas bag
sentences.chinese: 帆布包

detailed_translations.english: strong cloth used to make bags, tents, shoes etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 用帆布覆盖，用帆布装备

name: stick
trans: v. 粘，贴；铭记在心，经久不忘；刺，扎，戳；（随便）摆放，放置；伸出，突出；卡住，钉住；容忍，忍受；（名字）流传下去，被众人采用；被接受，被证明成立；（牌戏中）不再要牌；停顿下来，没有进展；<非正式>（生气地）放弃（和打发）；<非正式>使支付，导致损失；刺伤，刺死 n. 枯枝，枝条；条状物，棍状物；（用于某特定用途的）棍，条，签；球棍，球棒；指挥棒；变速杆，操纵杆；惩戒，惩罚；<英，非正式>批评，责罚；<非正式>偏远乡村，边远地区（the sticks）；四分之一磅装的黄油（或人造黄油）；<非正式>（家具的）件；非常瘦的人（或四肢）；画着短细直线的；一批迅速投下的炸弹（或伞兵）；一队特务兵；<非正式>球门柱，（板球三柱门的）柱（the sticks）；（曲棍球犯规动作）举棍过肩（sticks）；（股票）大宗死股

sentences.english: a pair of drum sticks
sentences.chinese: 一对鼓槌

sentences.english: a measuring stick
sentences.chinese: 量尺

sentences.english: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (= uses a stick to help her walk ) .
sentences.chinese: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

name: souvenir
trans: n. 纪念品，纪念物 v. <非正式>把……作为纪念品

sentences.english: a souvenir shop
sentences.chinese: 纪念品商店

detailed_translations.english: an object that you buy or keep to remind yourself of a special occasion or a place you have visited

name: board
trans: n. 板，木板；黑板，告示牌；董事会，理事会；膳食，伙食，膳食费用；局；<非正式>舞台；<美>（冰球场周围的）界墙；<旧>（美国大学的）入学考试 v. 登上（火车、轮船或飞机）；让乘客登机（或上船等）；寄宿；（在学校）住校；将（宠物）暂时寄养在他处；用木板覆盖

sentences.english: a board meeting
sentences.chinese: 董事会会议

sentences.english: a board member
sentences.chinese: 董事会成员

detailed_translations.english: a group of people in a company or other organization who make the rules and important decisions

name: screen
trans: n. 屏幕，荧光屏；计算机屏幕显示的数据（或图像）；（电影院）银幕；电影（总称）；（摄）聚焦屏；屏风，隔板；掩蔽物，屏障；掩饰，幌子；（医疗）化验，检查；（拦在圣坛或唱诗班四周的木质或石砌）围屏；（隔离用的）植物丛；纱窗，纱门；（纱门或纱窗的）金属丝，塑料线；（机动车的）挡风玻璃；（篮球、冰球等运动的）掩护；（印刷）网屏，网版；屏蔽器；（电子）帘栅极，屏栅极（=screen grid）；掩护部队，护航舰队；大筛子，滤网 v. 检查，筛查（以确定是否患病）；检测（体内违禁药物）；隐藏，遮蔽；庇护，包庇；（似乎）用屏障把事物隔开（screen sth. off）；防止（或免受）电磁干扰；放映（影片），播放（电视节目）；审查，甄别（看是否可以信任）；分析，评估；对（人、行李）进行安全检查；转接，甄别（来电以决定是否接听）；筛，筛选（谷物，煤等）；检查排除（screen someone/thing out）；加网印刷

sentences.english: a computer with an 18-inch colour screen
sentences.chinese: 带18英寸彩色屏幕的电脑

sentences.english: He went on staring at the TV screen .
sentences.chinese: 他继续盯着电视屏幕看。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a television or computer where the picture or information appears

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩蔽， 遮蔽； 放映， 播放； 审查， 甄别
detailed_translations.english: if something screens something else, it is in front of it and hides it

name: container
trans: n. 容器；集装箱，货柜

sentences.english: ice cream in plastic containers
sentences.chinese: 塑料容器里的冰激凌

sentences.english: a container ship
sentences.chinese: 集装箱船

detailed_translations.english: something such as a box or bowl that you use to keep things in

name: entity
trans: n. 实体，独立存在体

sentences.english: The mind exists as a separate entity.
sentences.chinese: 思想作为一个独立的实体存在。

sentences.english: Good design brings a house and garden together as a single entity.
sentences.chinese: 优秀的设计能把一所房子和花园合为一体。

detailed_translations.english: something that exists as a single and complete unit

name: spur
trans: n. 一时冲动之下，心血来潮；刺激，激励；山嘴，尖坡；（公路或铁路的）支线，岔线；马刺，靴刺 v. 激励，鼓励；促进，加速，刺激（某事发生）；用马刺策（马）前进；紧贴主干剪短（副梢）

sentences.english: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.chinese: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.english: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.chinese: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.english: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
sentences.chinese: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

detailed_translations.english: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something
to encourage someone or make them want to do something

name: leash
trans: n. 拴狗链，皮带；猎鹰腿带；（喻）约束，限制；<罕>（狩猎）三只一组 v. 拴住，牵住（狗）；（喻）约束

name: strip
trans: v. 除去，撕掉（外皮或表层）；夺去，剥夺（地位，权力，财产）；脱衣服，脱光……的衣服；表演脱衣舞；为（奶牛）收奶；拆卸，拆开（机器、车辆或引擎 ）；<美>拆散（汽车等）卖零件；使空无一物，搬光（家具、设备等）；（使）（螺丝或齿轮）受损；（为利润）出售（公司资产）；分离（债券的）息票使二者分开出售；（子弹出膛时因膛面磨损而）不旋转 n. （纸、金属、织物等）条，带；带状地带；<英>（比赛时穿的）队服，球衣；商业街；脱衣舞；连环漫画；<英>（定时播出的）广播节目；飞机跑道

sentences.english: Strip the beds and wash the sheets.
sentences.chinese: 把床单撤下来清洗。

sentences.english: a strip of paper
sentences.chinese: 一张纸条

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is covering the surface of something else
a long narrow piece of paper, cloth etc

name: band
trans: n. 乐队；一伙，一群；范围，段；带，箍；带状物，条纹；波段，频带；戒指 v. 给……分级，把……分段；用带绑扎；加彩条

sentences.english: The band was playing old Beatles songs.
sentences.chinese: 乐队正在演奏披头士的老歌。

sentences.english: I grew up playing in rock bands.
sentences.chinese: 我是在摇滚乐队里玩音乐长大的。

sentences.english: Smith joined the band in 1989.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯在1989年加入这个乐队。

sentences.english: They formed a band when they were still at school.
sentences.chinese: 他们还在读书的时候就组建了一个乐队。

sentences.english: The entertainment includes a disco and live band .
sentences.chinese: 娱乐活动有跳迪斯科和乐队现场演奏。

sentences.english: interviews with band members
sentences.chinese: 对乐队成员的采访

detailed_translations.english: a group of musicians, especially a group that plays popular music

name: hinge
trans: n. 铰链，合叶；枢纽，关键；铰合部 v. 给（某物）装铰链

sentences.english: Your arm should hinge from the shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 你的手臂应该像从肩膀铰链住一般。

sentences.english: Each compartment should have a hinged seal door with a concealed or piano-type hinge .
sentences.chinese: 每个隔室应具有一个带暗装或钢琴型铰链的铰接密封门。

sentences.english: GATE: external direct (opposite side of the hinge). Flow direction should climb over the gasket side.
sentences.chinese: 浇口：外部方向（铰链对面）。流向须爬过衬垫侧。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of metal fastened to a door, lid etc that allows it to swing open and shut
to attach something, using a hinge

name: ledge
trans: n. 岩架；壁架；窗台；暗礁；矿层

sentences.english: We crept carefully along the narrow ledge.
sentences.chinese: 我们小心翼翼地沿着狭窄的岩架爬行。

sentences.english: He leapt onto a ledge of rock.
sentences.chinese: 他跳到一个岩架上。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow flat piece of rock that sticks out on the side of a mountain or cliff

name: bulk
trans: n. 主体，大部分；庞大的身躯，肥硕的体形；（巨大的）容积，体积 adj. 大批的，大宗的 v. 使（产品）数量显得很大；结合（待售的股票或商品）

sentences.english: The bulk of consumers are based in towns.
sentences.chinese: 大多数消费者都是城镇居民。

sentences.english: The dough will rise until it is double in bulk.
sentences.chinese: 面团会发酵到原来的两倍大。

detailed_translations.english: the main or largest part of something

name: varnish
trans: n. 亮光漆，清漆；虚饰；光泽面 vt. 装饰，粉饰；在……上涂清漆；使……有光泽

sentences.english: The varnish comes in six natural wood shades.
sentences.chinese: 这种清漆有6种天然木材的色泽可选。

detailed_translations.english: a clear liquid that is painted onto things, especially things made of wood, to protect them, or the hard shiny surface produced by this
to cover something with varnish

name: tug
trans: v. （用力地）拉，拖，拽；（迅速地）穿（衣服）；用拖船拖（船）；努力做 n. 拖船；猛拉，拽；一股强烈的感情；强大的吸引力；（滑翔机的）拖航飞机；（系在马鞍上支承车杠或挽绳的）圆环；苦干；竞争，较量

sentences.english: The woman gently tugged his arm.
sentences.chinese: 那女人轻轻拽了拽他的胳膊。

sentences.english: She removed the bandage with a sharp tug.
sentences.chinese: 她猛地一拉，扯下绷带。

detailed_translations.english: to pull with one or more short, quick pulls
a sudden strong pull

name: null
trans: adj. 无约束力的，无效的；零值的，等于零的；（数）（集合，矩阵）空的，元素只有零的；无特征的，无内涵的 n. <文>零；（密码中的）无意义暗码；（电子）无信号；无电磁辐射的方向 v. 使（信号）与另一信号结合产生无信号状态，抵消

sentences.english: The contract was declared null and void.
sentences.chinese: 该合同被宣布无效。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, contract etc that is null and void has no legal force

name: valid
trans: adj. （文件或票证）有效的；正当的，合理的；合法有效的；计算机系统接受的，被计算机系统认为有效的

sentences.english: a valid credit card
sentences.chinese: 有效信用卡

sentences.english: Your return ticket is valid for three months.
sentences.chinese: 你的往返票有效期为三个月。

sentences.english: Police officers must have a valid reason for stopping motorists.
sentences.chinese: 警察拦下驾车者必须有正当理由。

detailed_translations.english: that is legally or officially acceptable

name: invalid
trans: adj. （法律上）无效的，作废的；（论据、理由等）站不住脚的，错误的；（计算机）不能识别的；残疾的 n. 病弱者，伤残者 vt. 使（因伤或病）退役；使伤残，使病弱

sentences.english: Without the right date stamped on it, your ticket will be invalid.
sentences.chinese: 票上若没有加盖正确日期就是废票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效的，作废的；无可靠根据的，站不住脚的
detailed_translations.english: a contract, ticket, claim etc that is invalid is not legally or officially acceptable
someone who cannot look after themselves because of illness, old age, or injury

name: effect
trans: n. 作用，影响；（刻意制造的）效果，印象；所有物，财产；生效，实行 v. 实现，引起

sentences.english: the long-term effects of the drug
sentences.chinese: 这种毒品的长期影响

sentences.english: I could feel the effects of the thin mountain air.
sentences.chinese: 我能感觉到山上稀薄空气产生的影响。

sentences.english: This ingredient also has the effect of making your skin look younger.
sentences.chinese: 这种成分还有使皮肤看上去更年轻的效果。

sentences.english: A system failure has a knock-on effect throughout the whole hotel.
sentences.chinese: 系统故障会给整个酒店带来连锁反应。

sentences.english: the cumulative effect of human activities on the global environment
sentences.chinese: 人类活动对全球环境日积月累的影响

sentences.english: A much lower dose of the painkiller can still produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 大量减少该止痛药的服用剂量依然能产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: In mental illness, there is a complex relationship between cause and effect.
sentences.chinese: 精神疾病有复杂的因果关系。

detailed_translations.english: a change that is caused by an event, action etc

name: effective
trans: adj. 产生预期结果的，有效的；实际的，事实上的；（法律、规则等）生效的，起作用的；给人深刻印象的 n. 实际可作战的士兵

sentences.english: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating arthritis.
sentences.chinese: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。

sentences.english: the painting’s highly effective use of colour
sentences.chinese: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用

sentences.english: Training is often much less effective than expected.
sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
sentences.chinese: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

detailed_translations.english: successful, and working in the way that was intended

name: efficient
trans: adj. 生效的，效率高的；（人）有能力的，能胜任的

sentences.english: a very efficient secretary
sentences.chinese: 效率高的秘书

sentences.english: an efficient use of land
sentences.chinese: 土地的有效使用

sentences.english: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

name: outcome
trans: n. 结果，效果

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: impotence
trans: n. [泌尿][中医]阳萎；虚弱；无效（等于 impotency）

sentences.english: Impotence affects 10 million men in the U.S. alone.
sentences.chinese: 仅在美国，就有1千万男子患有阳痿。

detailed_translations.chinese: [泌尿][中医] 阳萎；虚弱；无效（等于impotency）
detailed_translations.english: Impotence is a man's sexual problem in which his penis fails to get hard or stay hard

name: gratuitous
trans: adj. 无理由的，无端的；免费的

sentences.english: children’s books which include gratuitous violence
sentences.chinese: 包含无谓暴力内容的儿童书籍

detailed_translations.chinese: 无理由的，无端的；免费的
detailed_translations.english: said or done without a good reason, in a way that offends someone

name: source
trans: n. 来源，出处；（问题的）原因，根源；消息人士，信息来源；河流源头，发源地；源（代）码；（电子）源极，电源；（技）源 v. （从某地）获得；找出……的来源

sentences.english: They get their money from various sources.
sentences.chinese: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

detailed_translations.english: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

name: account
trans: n. 账户，户头；客户，老主顾；网络账号；描述，报道；账目；账单；赊购账，赊购；理由，解释；重要性；（定期结付的）交易合同；演奏（音乐）；<英>账期交易期 v. 把……视作，认为；解释，说明（account for）；占（一定数量或比例）（account for）；<古>报账

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: reason
trans: n. 原因，理由；充分理由，正当理由；道理，情理；判断力，理智 v. 推理，逻辑思考；推论出，推断出（reason sth. out）；对（某人）以理相劝，劝告（reason with）

sentences.english: She has reason to feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她有理由感到内疚。

sentences.english: the human power of reason
sentences.chinese: 人类的理性

sentences.english: They reasoned that other businesses would soon copy the idea.
sentences.chinese: 他们推断其他企业也会很快仿效这个点子。

detailed_translations.english: why something happens, or why someone does something
to form a particular judgment about a situation after carefully considering the facts

name: sake
trans: n. 利益，好处；目的；为了便于讨论（for the sake of argument）；（强调重要或表示恼火）看在上帝分上，天哪（for God's/goodness'/Christ's/heaven's/Pete's etc. sake）；日本米酒，日本清酒

sentences.english: He moved to the seaside for the sake of his health.
sentences.chinese: 他为了健康而迁居海滨。

sentences.english: I only went for Kay’s sake.
sentences.chinese: 我是为了凯才去的。

sentences.english: I hope he’s told the truth for his own sake (= because it will be good for him ) .
sentences.chinese: 为了他自己好，我希望他已经说出了真相。

detailed_translations.english: in order to help, improve, or please someone or something

sentences.english: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.english: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.chinese: 不必惊慌。

sentences.english: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

detailed_translations.english: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

name: impute
trans: vt. 归罪于，归咎于；嫁祸于

sentences.english: It is grossly unfair to impute blame to the United Nations.
sentences.chinese: 把责任归咎于联合国是极不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: If you impute something such as blame or a crime to someone, you say that they are responsible for it or are the cause of it

name: attribute
trans: v. 把……归因于；认为是……所作；认为……具有某种特质 n. 属性，特质；标志，象征；定语

sentences.english: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation
a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful

name: superficial
trans: adj. 粗浅的，粗略的；（思想）浅薄的，缺乏深度的；表面的，乍看起来的（尤指实际并非如此）；（伤势或伤害）表皮的；（皮肤、土壤或岩石）表层的；不重要的，无关痛痒的；<英>（建筑）面积的，平方的

sentences.english: Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
sentences.chinese: 这两本小说尽管表面上有相似之处，但实际上大不一样。

sentences.english: They only have the most superficial understanding of prison life.
sentences.chinese: 他们对监狱生活只有最粗浅的了解。

detailed_translations.english: seeming to have a particular quality, although this is not true or real

name: partial
trans: adj. 部分的，不完全的；偏袒的，不公平的；偏爱的 n. （乐）分音，泛音

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

name: partially
trans: adv. 不完全地，部分地；<古>偏袒地

sentences.english: The operation was only partially successful.
sentences.chinese: 手术不尽如人意。

sentences.english: Remember that you are partially responsible for their unhappiness.
sentences.chinese: 记住，你对他们的不幸负有部分责任。

detailed_translations.english: not completely

name: overall
trans: adj. 总的，全面的；所有的，包括一切的 adv. 全部，总共； 总的说来，大体上 n. <英>（工作时穿的）罩衣；<英>（上下连身的）工作服，防护服（overalls）；<美>背带工装裤（overalls）；<英>骑马裤，紧身制服裤（overalls）

sentences.english: The overall cost of the exhibition was £400,000.
sentences.chinese: 展览会的全部费用是40万英镑。

sentences.english: The overall result is an increase in population.
sentences.chinese: 总的结果是人口增加。

sentences.english: An overall winner and a runner-up were chosen.
sentences.chinese: 总冠军和第二名被选了出来。

sentences.english: We don’t want all the details now, just the overall picture.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们不需要全部细节，只要知道大致的情况。

detailed_translations.english: heavy cotton trousers with a piece covering your chest, held up by pieces of cloth that go over your shoulders
considering or including everything

name: integral
trans: adj. 必需的，必要的；作为组成部分的；完整的；整的，积分的 n. 积分；完整

sentences.english: Rituals, celebrations, and festivals form an integral part of every human society.
sentences.chinese: 仪式、庆典和节日是每个人类社会不可缺少的组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is an integral part of something is an essential part of that thing

name: integrate
trans: v. （使）合并，成为一体；（使）加入，融入群体；（使）取消种族隔离；求……的积分；表示（面积、温度等）的总和，表示……的平均值 adj. 整合的

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

name: integrity
trans: n. 正直，诚实；完整，完全；职业操守；（电子数据的）集成度

sentences.english: I have always regarded him as a man of integrity.
sentences.chinese: 我一直把他当作一个正直诚实的人。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right

name: seemingly
trans: adv. 貌似，看似（但可能并非如此）；似乎，好像（是事实）

sentences.english: seemingly unrelated bits of information
sentences.chinese: 似乎互不相关的零星信息

detailed_translations.english: appearing to have a particular quality, when this may or may not be true

name: portion
trans: n. （某物的）一部分；（尤指餐馆中食物的）一份，一客；（责任、过失、职责等的）一份，一部分；<法律>（根据法律赠与或遗留给继承人的）一份财产；<古> 命运，天数 v. 分配；<古> 给（新娘）嫁妆

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: proportion
trans: n. 部分，份额；比例；正确的比例，均衡；大小，程度（proportions）；（事情的）重要性，严重性；等比关系 v. <正式> 使（某物）成比例，使相称；分摊

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

name: segment
trans: n. 部分，片段；（市场）细分的部分；（水果或花自然形成的）瓣，（昆虫的）节； 球缺，弓形；（直线或弧线上两点间的）段；（特定广播或电视节目的）时间段；某一时段单独播放的节目；音段 v. 分割，划分；（细胞）分裂

sentences.english: Decorate with orange segments.
sentences.chinese: 用几瓣橙子作点缀。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

name: facet
trans: n. 部分，方面；（宝石的）琢面，刻面；（构成昆虫或甲壳动物复眼的）小眼面 v. 在……上琢面

sentences.english: The issues are complex and multi-faceted.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题很复杂，涉及诸多方面。

detailed_translations.english: one of several parts of someone’s character, a situation etc

name: aspect
trans: n. 方面，特色；朝向，方位；外表，外观；（动词的）体 v. （行星与另一天体）形成角度关系

sentences.english: a south-facing aspect
sentences.chinese: 朝南方向

detailed_translations.english: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

name: juncture
trans: n. 接缝；连接；接合；特定时刻，关头；交接处，接合点；音渡

sentences.english: Atthis juncture, I suggest we take a short break.
sentences.chinese: 此时此刻，我建议大家稍事休息。

sentences.english: The talks are at a critical juncture(= very important point ).
sentences.chinese: 会谈正处于紧急关头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关键时刻， 危急关头； 结合处， 接合点
detailed_translations.english: a particular point in an activity or period of time

name: junction
trans: n. （公路或铁路的）交叉口，岔道口；汇合处，交叉点；（电子）接口；连接，结合；（高速公路的）出入口；（铁路的）枢纽站，联轨站

sentences.english: the junction of Abbot Road and Mill Street
sentences.chinese: 阿伯特路与米尔街的交叉口

sentences.english: Junction 5 on the M40
sentences.chinese: 40号高速公路上的第5交叉口

detailed_translations.english: a place where one road, track etc joins another

name: fraction
trans: n. 分数，小数；小部分，微量；持不同意见的小集团；分离；（基督教用语）分切圣餐面包

sentences.english: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
sentences.chinese: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of something

name: respect
trans: n. 尊敬，敬重；重视，尊重；方面，着眼点；问候，敬意（respects） v. 尊敬，敬佩；慎重对待，尊重；遵守；避免破坏（或干扰） int. <非正式> 真了不起（因敬重或赞同而发出的感叹）

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

name: component
trans: n. 组成部份，成分，部件 adj. 组成的，构成的

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

name: system
trans: n. （协同工作的）系统；（计算机、警报器等的）系统；体制，制度，方式，方法；现行体制，既成制度（the system）；身体，（器官）系统；人体的活动方式（尤指消化和排泄方式）；（度量，分类中的）方法（或规则）；条理，秩序；（交通、通信）网，网络；（地质）（年代地层学用语）系；（天文）系；下赌注法；（乐）用弧线连为一体的谱表；晶系（crystal system 的简称）

sentences.english: an alarm system
sentences.chinese: 警报系统

sentences.english: a well-designed heating system
sentences.chinese: 设计良好的供暖系统

sentences.english: the digestive system
sentences.chinese: 消化系统

sentences.english: the railway system
sentences.chinese: 铁路系统

detailed_translations.chinese: 系统； 制度， 体制； 方法， 做法； 身体
detailed_translations.english: a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose

name: fringe
trans: n. 穗，流苏；<英>刘海儿；（地区、组织或活动范围的）边缘，外围；偏激的人，极端的活动；干扰条纹，散乱边纹；（动物的）缘缨，（植物的）毛缘；（工资外的）补贴，附加福利 v. 在……上装以缘饰，加穗于；形成……的边缘 adj. 次要的，非主流的

sentences.english: a tall girl with straight brown hair and a fringe
sentences.chinese: 一头棕色直发、留着刘海的高个子女孩

sentences.english: The monarchists are a small fringe group who quarrel fiercely among themselves.
sentences.chinese: 君主制拥护者们是个边缘性小团体，内部争吵激烈。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a fringe, your hair is cut so that it hangs down over your forehead
Fringe groups or events are less important or popular than other related groups or events
